reference^sentence
40.1.1.1^the book of the genealogy of jesus christ, son of david, son of abraham:
40.1.2.1^abraham begat - isaac, isaac then begat - jacob, jacob then begat - judah and the brothers of him.
40.1.3.1^judah then begat - perez and - zerah out of - tamar, perez then begat - hezron, hezron then begat - ram.
40.1.4.1^ram then begat - amminadab, amminadab then begat - nahshon, nahshon then begat - salmon.
40.1.5.1^salmon then begat - boaz out of - rahab, boaz then begat - obed out of - ruth, obed then begat - jesse,
40.1.6.1^jesse then begat - david the king.
40.1.6.2^david then begat - solomon out of the wife - of uriah,
40.1.7.1^solomon then begat - rehoboam, rehoboam then begat - abijah, abijah then begat - asa.
40.1.8.1^asa then begat - jehoshaphat, jehoshaphat then begat - joram, joram then begat - uzziah.
40.1.9.1^uzziah then begat - jotham, jotham then begat - ahaz, ahaz then begat - hezekiah.
40.1.10.1^hezekiah then begat - manasseh, manasseh then begat - amos, amos then begat - josiah,
40.1.11.1^josiah then begat - jeconiah and the brothers of him at the time of the carrying away to babylon.
40.1.12.1^after then the carrying away to babylon:
40.1.12.2^jeconiah begat - shealtiel, shealtiel then begat - zerubbabel,
40.1.13.1^zerubbabel then begat - abiud, abiud then begat - eliakim, eliakim then begat - azor.
40.1.14.1^azor then begat - zadok, zadok then begat - achim, achim then begat - eliud.
40.1.15.1^eliud then begat - eleazar, eleazar then begat - matthan, matthan then begat - jacob,
40.1.16.1^jacob then begat - joseph, the husband of mary, out of whom was born jesus, the one being called christ.
40.1.17.1^all therefore the generations from abraham to david were generations fourteen;
40.1.17.2^and from david until the carrying away to babylon, generations fourteen;
40.1.17.3^and from the carrying away to babylon until the christ, generations fourteen.
40.1.18.1^- now of jesus christ the birth thus came about:
40.1.18.2^having been pledged the mother of him mary - to joseph, before rather coming together of them, she was found in womb having a child out of the spirit holy.
40.1.19.1^joseph now, the husband of her, righteous being, and not willing her to expose publicly, purposed secretly to send away her.
40.1.20.1^these things now of him having pondered, behold, an angel of the lord in a dream appeared to him, saying, joseph, son of david, not you should fear to receive mary as the wife of you;
40.1.20.2^that for in her having been conceived, from the spirit is, holy.
40.1.21.1^she will bear then a son, and you will call the name of him jesus;
40.1.21.2^he for will save the people of him from the sins of them.
40.1.22.1^this then all has come to pass, that may be fulfilled that having been spoken by the lord through the prophet, saying,
40.1.23.1^behold, the virgin in womb will hold, and will bear a son, and they will call the name of him immanuel,  which is being translated, with us - god.
40.1.24.1^having been awoken then - joseph from the sleep, he did as had commanded him the angel of the lord, and received the wife of him,
40.1.25.1^and not knew her until that she had brought forth a son;
40.1.25.2^and he called the name of him jesus.
40.2.1.1^- now jesus having been born in bethlehem - of judea, in the days of herod the king, behold, magi from the east arrived in jerusalem,
40.2.2.1^saying, where is the one having been born king of the jews?
40.2.2.2^we saw for of him the star in the east, and are come to worship him.
40.2.3.1^having heard then - king herod, he was troubled, and all jerusalem with him.
40.2.4.1^and having gathered together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he was inquiring of them where the christ was to be born.
40.2.5.1^- and they said to him, in bethlehem - of judea, thus for has it been written through the prophet:
40.2.6.1^and you, bethlehem, land of judah, by no means least are among the rulers of judah, out of you for will go forth one leading, who will shepherd the people of me - israel.
40.2.7.1^then herod, secretly having called the magi, inquired exactly of them the time of the appearing star.
40.2.8.1^and having sent them to bethlehem, he said, having gone, search carefully for the child;
40.2.8.2^when then you shall have found him, bring word back to me, so that i also having come, may worship him.
40.2.9.1^- and having heard the king, they went away;
40.2.9.2^and behold, the star which they saw in the east went before them until having arrived, it stood over where was the child.
40.2.10.1^having seen now the star, they rejoiced with joy great exceedingly.
40.2.11.1^and having come into the house, they found the child with mary the mother of him, and having fallen down, they worshiped him;
40.2.11.2^and having opened the treasures of them, they offered to him gifts, gold and frankincense and myrrh.
40.2.12.1^and having been divinely warned in a dream not to return to herod, by another route they withdrew into the country of them.
40.2.13.1^having withdrawn then of them, behold, an angel of the lord appears in a dream - to joseph, saying, having arisen, take the child and the mother of him, and flee into egypt, and remain there until - i should tell you;
40.2.13.2^is about for herod to seek the child, - to destroy him.
40.2.14.1^- and having arisen, he took the child and the mother of him by night and withdrew into egypt,
40.2.15.1^and he remained there until the death of herod;
40.2.15.2^so that it might be fulfilled that having been spoken by the lord through the prophet, saying, out of egypt have i called the son of me.
40.2.16.1^then herod, having seen that he had been outwitted by the magi, was enraged intensely, and having sent forth, he put to death all the boys that were in bethlehem and in all the vicinity of it, from two years old and under, according to the time which he had ascertained from the magi.
40.2.17.1^then was fulfilled that having been spoken by jeremiah the prophet, saying,
40.2.18.1^a voice in ramah was heard, weeping and mourning great, rachel weeping for the children of her, and not would be comforted, because no more are they.
40.2.19.1^having died now - of herod, behold, an angel of the lord appears in a dream to joseph in egypt,
40.2.20.1^saying, having arisen, take the child and the mother of him, and go into the land of israel;
40.2.20.2^they have died for those seeking the life of the child.
40.2.21.1^- and having arisen, he took the child and the mother of him and came into the land of israel.
40.2.22.1^having heard now that archelaus reigns over - judea in place of the father of him herod, he was afraid there to go;
40.2.22.2^having been divinely warned now in a dream, he withdrew into the district - of galilee,
40.2.23.1^and having come, he dwelt in a city being called nazareth;
40.2.23.2^so that it should be fulfilled that having been spoken through the prophets, that a nazarene he will be called.
40.3.1.1^in then the days those, comes john the baptist, preaching in the wilderness - of judea,
40.3.2.1^and saying, repent;
40.3.2.2^has drawn near for the kingdom of the heavens.
40.3.3.1^this for is the one having been spoken of through isaiah the prophet, saying, the voice of one crying in the wilderness, prepare the way of the lord;
40.3.3.2^straight make the paths of him.
40.3.4.1^himself now - john had the garment of him of hair of a camel, and a belt of leather around the waist of him, - and the food was of him locusts and honey wild.
40.3.5.1^at that time were going out to him jerusalem, and all - judea, and all the region around the jordan,
40.3.6.1^and were being baptized in the jordan river by him, confessing the sins of them.
40.3.7.1^having seen now many of the pharisees and sadducees coming to the baptism of him, he said to them, brood of vipers, who forewarned you to flee from the coming wrath?
40.3.8.1^produce therefore fruit worthy - of repentance.
40.3.9.1^and not presume to say within yourselves, as father we have - abraham.
40.3.9.2^i say for to you that able is - god out of the stones these to raise up children unto abraham.
40.3.10.1^already now the ax to the root of the trees is applied;
40.3.10.2^every therefore tree not producing fruit good is cut down and into the fire is thrown.
40.3.11.1^i indeed you baptize with water to repentance, - but after me is coming mightier than i, he of whom not i am fit the sandals to carry.
40.3.11.2^he you will baptize with the spirit holy and with fire,
40.3.12.1^whose - winnowing fork is in the hand of him;
40.3.12.2^and he will clear the threshing floor of him and will gather the wheat of him into the barn;
40.3.12.3^the but chaff he will burn up with fire unquenchable.
40.3.13.1^then comes - jesus from - galilee to the jordan, unto - john, - to be baptized by him.
40.3.14.1^- but john was hindering him, saying, i need have by you to be baptized, and you come to me?
40.3.15.1^answering, however, - jesus said unto him, permit it presently;
40.3.15.2^thus for fitting it is to us to fulfill all righteousness.
40.3.15.3^then he permits him.
40.3.16.1^having been baptized now, - jesus immediately went up from the water;
40.3.16.2^and behold, were opened to him the heavens, and he saw the spirit of god descending as a dove, and alighting upon him.
40.3.17.1^and behold, a voice out of the heavens, saying, this is the son of me, the beloved, in whom i was well pleased.
40.4.1.1^then - jesus was led up into the wilderness by the spirit to be tempted by the devil.
40.4.2.1^and having fasted days forty and nights, forty afterward he was hungry.
40.4.3.1^and having come the one tempting, he said to him, if son you are - of god, speak, that the stones these, loaves of bread might become.
40.4.4.1^- but answering, he said, it has been written:
40.4.4.2^not by bread alone shall live the man, but by every word coming out of the mouth of god.
40.4.5.1^then takes him the devil to the holy city and sets him upon the pinnacle of the temple,
40.4.6.1^and says to him, if son you are - of god, throw yourself down;
40.4.6.2^it has been written for -:
40.4.6.3^to the angels of him he will give orders concerning you, and in their hands will they bear up you, lest ever you strike against a stone the foot of you.
40.4.7.1^said to him - jesus, again it has been written:
40.4.7.2^not you shall test the lord the god of you.
40.4.8.1^again takes him the devil to a mountain high exceedingly, and shows to him all the kingdoms of the world and the glory of them,
40.4.9.1^and he says to him, these things to you all will i give, if falling down, you will worship me.
40.4.10.1^then says to him - jesus, get you away, satan;
40.4.10.2^it has been written for:
40.4.10.3^the lord the god of you, you shall worship, and him alone shall you serve.
40.4.11.1^then leaves him the devil, and behold, angels came and were ministering to him.
40.4.12.1^having heard now that john had been delivered up , he withdrew into - galilee.
40.4.13.1^and having left - nazareth, having come, he dwelt at capernaum, which is on the sea-side in the region of zebulun and naphtali,
40.4.14.1^that it might be fulfilled that having been spoken by isaiah the prophet, saying:
40.4.15.1^land of zebulun and land of naphtali, way of the sea, beyond the jordan, galilee of the gentiles
40.4.16.1^the people - sitting in darkness, a light have seen great, and to those sitting in the land and shadow of death, a light has dawned on them.
40.4.17.1^from that time began - jesus to proclaim and to say, repent, has drawn near for the kingdom of the heavens.
40.4.18.1^walking now beside the sea - of galilee, he saw two brothers, simon - called peter, and andrew the brother of him, casting a net into the sea;
40.4.18.2^they were for fishermen.
40.4.19.1^and he says to them, come follow after me, and i will make you fishers of men.
40.4.20.1^- and immediately having left the nets, they followed him.
40.4.21.1^and having gone on from there, he saw others, two brothers, james the son - of zebedee, and john the brother of him, in the boat with zebedee the father of them, mending the nets of them;
40.4.21.2^and he called them.
40.4.22.1^- and immediately, having left the boat and the father of them, they followed him.
40.4.23.1^and he was going throughout all - galilee, teaching in the synagogues of them, and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.
40.4.24.1^and went out the news of him into all - syria.
40.4.24.2^and they brought to him all the sick having various diseases and pains oppressing, and being possessed by demons, and being epileptics, and paralytics;
40.4.24.3^and he healed them.
40.4.25.1^and followed him crowds great from - galilee, and the decapolis, and jerusalem, and judea, and beyond the jordan.
40.5.1.1^having seen then the crowds, he went up on the mountain;
40.5.1.2^and having sat down of him, came to him the disciples of him.
40.5.2.1^and opening the mouth of him, he was teaching them, saying:
40.5.3.1^blessed are the poor in the spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.
40.5.4.1^blessed are those mourning, for they will be comforted.
40.5.5.1^blessed the meek, for they will inherit the earth.
40.5.6.1^blessed are those hungering and thirsting for - righteousness;
40.5.6.2^for they will be filled.
40.5.7.1^blessed are the merciful, for they will receive mercy.
40.5.8.1^blessed the pure - in heart, for they - god will see.
40.5.9.1^blessed the peacemakers, for they sons of god will be called.
40.5.10.1^blessed are those having been persecuted on account of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of the heavens.
40.5.11.1^blessed are you when they shall insult you, and shall persecute you, and shall say all kinds of evil against you, lying on account of me.
40.5.12.1^rejoice and exult, for the reward of you is great in the heavens;
40.5.12.2^thus for they persecuted the prophets - before you.
40.5.13.1^you are the salt of the earth;
40.5.13.2^if, however, the salt becomes tasteless, with what will it be salted.
40.5.13.3^for nothing it is potent any longer, if not having been cast out, to be trampled upon by - men.
40.5.14.1^you are the light of the world.
40.5.14.2^not is able a city to be hidden on a hill lying.
40.5.15.1^nor do they light a lamp and put it under - a basket, but upon the lampstand, and it shines for all those in the house.
40.5.16.1^thus let shine the light of you before - men, so that they may see your - good works, and they should glorify the father of you - in the heavens.
40.5.17.1^not think that i have come to abolish the law or the prophets;
40.5.17.2^not i have come to abolish, but to fulfill.
40.5.18.1^truly for i say to you, until - shall pass away the heaven and the earth, iota one, or one stroke of a letter, no not shall pass away from the law, until - everything should happen.
40.5.19.1^whoever if then shall break one of the commandments of these the least and shall teach so the others, least he will be called in the kingdom of the heavens;
40.5.19.2^whoever now - shall keep and shall teach them, this one great will be called in the kingdom of the heavens.
40.5.20.1^i say for to you, that if not shall abound your - righteousness above that of the scribes and pharisees, no not shall you enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
40.5.21.1^you have heard that it was said to the ancients, not you shall murder;
40.5.21.2^whoever now - shall murder, liable will be to the judgment.
40.5.22.1^i however say to you that everyone - being angry with the brother of him liable will be to the judgment;
40.5.22.2^whoever now - shall say to brother of him, raca,  liable will be to the sanhedrin;
40.5.22.3^whoever now - shall say, fool, liable will be to the hell - of fire.
40.5.23.1^if therefore you shall offer the gift of you at the altar, and there shall remember that the brother of you has something against you,
40.5.24.1^leave there the gift of you before the altar, and go away;
40.5.24.2^first be reconciled to brother of you;
40.5.24.3^and then having come, offer the gift of you.
40.5.25.1^be agreeing with accuser of you quickly, while which you are with him, on the way, lest ever you deliver the accuser to the judge, and the judge to the officer, and into prison you will be cast.
40.5.26.1^truly i say to you, no not shall you come out from there, until - you should pay the last kodranten!
40.5.27.1^you have heard that it was said, not shall you commit adultery.
40.5.28.1^i however say to you that everyone - looking upon a woman in order - to lust after her already has committed adultery with her in the heart of him.
40.5.29.1^if now the eye of you - right causes to stumble you, pluck out it and cast it from you;
40.5.29.2^it is better indeed for you that should perish one of the members of you, and not all the body of you should be cast into hell.
40.5.30.1^and if the right of you hand causes to stumble you, cut off it and cast it from you;
40.5.30.2^it is better indeed for you that should perish one of the members of you, and not all the body of you into hell should depart.
40.5.31.1^it was said also, whoever - shall divorce the wife of him, let him give to her a letter of divorce.
40.5.32.1^i however say to you that everyone - divorcing the wife of him, except on account of sexual immorality, causes her to commit adultery.
40.5.32.2^and whoever if her having been divorced shall marry, commits adultery.
40.5.33.1^again, you have heard that it was said to the ancients, not shall you swear falsely;
40.5.33.2^you shall keep now to the lord the oaths of you.
40.5.34.1^i however say to you not to swear at all:
40.5.34.2^neither by - heaven, because the throne it is - of god;
40.5.35.1^nor by the earth, because the footstool it is of the feet of him;
40.5.35.2^nor by jerusalem, because the city it is of the great king.
40.5.36.1^neither by the head of you shall you swear, because not you are able one hair white to make, or black.
40.5.37.1^let it be however the statement of you, yes,  yes, and  no, no.
40.5.37.2^the however more than these, from - evil comes.
40.5.38.1^you have heard that it was said, eye for eye, and tooth for tooth.
40.5.39.1^i however say to you, not to resist the evil person.
40.5.39.2^instead, whoever you shall strike on the right cheek of you, turn to him also the other;
40.5.40.1^and to the one willing you to sue and the tunic of you to take, yield to him also the cloak;
40.5.41.1^and whoever you shall compel to go mile one, go with him two.
40.5.42.1^to the one asking of you, give;
40.5.42.2^and the one desiring from you to borrow, not you shall turn away from.
40.5.43.1^you have heard that it was said, you shall love - neighbor of you and shall hate - enemy of you.
40.5.44.1^i however say to you, love the enemies of you, and pray for those persecuting you,
40.5.45.1^so that you may be sons of the father of you who is in the heavens.
40.5.45.2^for the sun of him he makes rise on evil and good, and he sends rain on righteous and unrighteous.
40.5.46.1^if for you love those loving you, what reward have you?
40.5.46.2^do not also the tax collectors the same do?
40.5.47.1^and if you greet the brothers of you only, what extraordinary do you?
40.5.47.2^do not also the gentiles the same do?
40.5.48.1^shall be therefore you perfect, as the father of you who is heavenly, perfect is.
40.6.1.1^beware now the righteousness of you not to do before - men in order - to be seen by them;
40.6.1.2^if now - otherwise, reward not have you with the father of you who is in the heavens.
40.6.2.1^when therefore you do acts of charity, not do sound a trumpet before you, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, so that they may have glory from - men.
40.6.2.2^truly i say to you, they have the reward of them.
40.6.3.1^you however doing charity, not let know the left hand of you what is doing the right hand of you,
40.6.4.1^so that may be your - giving in - secret.
40.6.4.2^and the father of you, the one seeing in - secret, will reward you.
40.6.5.1^and when you pray, not you shall be like the hypocrites, for they love in the synagogues and on the corners of the streets standing to pray, so that they might be seen - by men.
40.6.5.2^truly i say to you, they have the reward of them.
40.6.6.1^you however, when you pray, enter into the room of you, and having shut the door of you, pray to father of you, the one in - secret.
40.6.6.2^and the father of you, the one seeing in - secret, will reward you.
40.6.7.1^praying now not do use vain repetitions, like the pagans, they think for that in the many words of them they will be heard.
40.6.8.1^not therefore be like to them, knows for the father of you of what things need you have, before - your asking him.
40.6.9.1^thus therefore pray you:
40.6.9.2^father of us, who is in the heavens, hallowed be the name of you.
40.6.10.1^come the kingdom of you;
40.6.10.2^be done the will of you, as in heaven, so also upon earth.
40.6.11.1^the bread of us - daily grant us today.
40.6.12.1^and forgive us the debts of us, as also we forgive the debtors of us;
40.6.13.1^and not lead us into temptation, but deliver us from - evil.
40.6.14.1^if for you forgive - men the trespasses of them, will forgive also you the father of you - heavenly.
40.6.15.1^if however not you forgive - men, neither the father of you will forgive the trespasses of you.
40.6.16.1^whenever now you fast, not be like the hypocrites, gloomy;
40.6.16.2^they disfigure for the appearance of them, so that they might appear - to men as fasting.
40.6.16.3^truly i say to you, they have the reward of them.
40.6.17.1^you however, fasting, anoint your - head and the face of you wash,
40.6.18.1^so that not you might appear - to men as fasting, but - to father your the one in - secret;
40.6.18.2^and the father of you, the one seeing in - secret, will reward you.
40.6.19.1^not store up for yourselves treasures upon the earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal;
40.6.20.1^store up however for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust destroy, and where thieves not do break in nor steal.
40.6.21.1^where for is the treasure of you, there will be also the heart of you.
40.6.22.1^the lamp of the body is the eye.
40.6.22.2^if therefore is the eye of you clear, the whole - body of you full of light will be.
40.6.23.1^if however the eye of you evil is, all the body of you full of darkness will be.
40.6.23.2^if then the light that is within you darkness is, that darkness how great!
40.6.24.1^no one is able two masters to serve;
40.6.24.2^either for the one he will hate, and the other he will love;
40.6.24.3^or the one he will be devoted to, and the other he will despise.
40.6.24.4^not you are able god to serve, and money.
40.6.25.1^because of this i say to you, not be anxious about the life of you, what you should eat or what you should drink;
40.6.25.2^nor the body of you, what you should put on.
40.6.25.3^not the life more is than the food, and the body than clothing?
40.6.26.1^look at the birds of the air, that not they sow, nor do they reap, nor do they gather into barns   and the father of you - heavenly feeds them.
40.6.26.2^not you much are more valuable than they?
40.6.27.1^who now from you being anxious is able to add to the lifespan of him hour one?
40.6.28.1^and about clothing why are you anxious?
40.6.28.2^observe the lilies of the field, how they grow:
40.6.28.3^they do not labor nor do they spin.
40.6.29.1^i say however to you that not even solomon in all the glory of him was adorned like one of these.
40.6.30.1^if however the grass of the field, today being here, and tomorrow into the furnace being thrown, - god thus clothes, will he not much more you, o you of little faith?
40.6.31.1^not therefore be anxious, saying, what shall we eat?
40.6.31.2^or what shall we drink?
40.6.31.3^or what shall we wear?
40.6.32.1^all for these things the gentiles seek after;
40.6.32.2^knows for the father of you - heavenly that you have need of them all.
40.6.33.1^seek however first the kingdom of god and the righteousness of him, and these things all will be added to you.
40.6.34.1^not therefore be anxious about things tomorrow, - for tomorrow will be anxious about itself.
40.6.34.2^sufficient to the day is the trouble of it.
40.7.1.1^not do judge, that not you should be judged.
40.7.2.1^with whatever for verdict you judge, you will be judged;
40.7.2.2^and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured again to you.
40.7.3.1^why now do you look at the splinter that is in the eye the brother of you, - and the in - your own eye beam not notice?
40.7.4.1^or how shall you say to the brother of you, permit that i might cast out the splinter from the eye of you;
40.7.4.2^and behold, the beam is in the eye of you?
40.7.5.1^hypocrite!
40.7.5.2^cast out first from the eye of you the beam, and then you will see clearly to cast out the splinter from the eye of the brother of you.
40.7.6.1^not give that which is holy to the dogs, nor cast the pearls of you before the pigs, not lest they shall trample upon them with the feet of them, and having turned, they tear to pieces you.
40.7.7.1^ask and it will be given to you;
40.7.7.2^seek and you will find;
40.7.7.3^knock and it will be opened to you.
40.7.8.1^everyone for - asking receives;
40.7.8.2^and the one seeking, finds;
40.7.8.3^and to the one knocking, it will be opened.
40.7.9.1^or which is of you a man whom will ask for the son of him bread, not a stone will he give him?
40.7.10.1^or also a fish he will ask for, not a serpent will he give him?
40.7.11.1^if therefore you, evil being, know gifts good to give to the children of you, how much more the father of you who is in the heavens will give good things to those asking him!
40.7.12.1^all things therefore, as many as if you might desire that should do to you the men, so also you do to them.
40.7.12.2^this for is the law and the prophets.
40.7.13.1^enter through the narrow gate.
40.7.13.2^for wide is the gate and broad the way - leading to - destruction, and many are those entering through it.
40.7.14.1^for small is the gate and compressed the way - leading to - life, and few are those finding it.
40.7.15.1^but beware of the false prophets, who come to you in clothing of sheep;
40.7.15.2^inwardly however they are wolves ravenous.
40.7.16.1^by the fruits of them you will know them.
40.7.16.2^not do they gather from thorns grapes, or from thistles figs?
40.7.17.1^so every tree good, fruits good produces;
40.7.17.2^- but the bad tree, fruits bad produces.
40.7.18.1^not is able a tree good, fruits bad to produce;
40.7.18.2^nor a tree bad, fruits good to produce.
40.7.19.1^every tree not producing fruit good is cut down and into fire is thrown.
40.7.20.1^- then surely by the fruits of them you will know them.
40.7.21.1^not everyone - saying to me, lord, lord, will enter into the kingdom of the heavens, but the one doing the will the father of me, who is in the heavens.
40.7.22.1^many will say to me in that the day, lord, lord, not in your name did we prophesy, and in your name demons cast out, and in your name miracles many perform?
40.7.23.1^and then i will declare to them -, never knew i you;
40.7.23.2^depart you from me, those working - lawlessness.
40.7.24.1^everyone therefore, whoever hears my - words these, and does them, will be like a man wise, who built his - house upon the rock.
40.7.25.1^and came down the rain, and came the torrents, and blew the winds, and beat that house upon;
40.7.25.2^and not it fell, it had been founded for upon the rock.
40.7.26.1^and everyone - hearing my - words these, and not doing them, he will be likened to a man foolish, who built of him the house upon the sand.
40.7.27.1^and came down the rain, and came the torrents, and blew the winds, and beat that house upon, and it fell   and was the fall of it great.
40.7.28.1^and it came to pass, when had finished - jesus the words these, were astonished the crowds at the teaching of him.
40.7.29.1^he was for teaching them as authority having, and not as the scribes of them.
40.8.1.1^having come down now he from the mountain, followed him crowds great.
40.8.2.1^and behold, a leper having come, was worshipping him, saying, lord, if you are willing, you are able me to cleanse.
40.8.3.1^and having stretched out the hand, he touched him, saying, i am willing;
40.8.3.2^be you cleansed!
40.8.3.3^and immediately was cleansed his - leprosy.
40.8.4.1^and says to him - jesus, see that no one you tell.
40.8.4.2^but go, yourself show to the priest, and offer the gift that commanded moses, for a testimony to them.
40.8.5.1^having entered now he into capernaum, came to him a centurion, imploring him,
40.8.6.1^and saying, lord, the servant of me is lying in the house, paralyzed, grievously tormented.
40.8.7.1^and he says to him, i having come, will heal him.
40.8.8.1^and answering the centurion said, lord, not i am worthy that of me under the roof you should come;
40.8.8.2^but only speak the word, and will be healed the servant of me.
40.8.9.1^also for i a man am under authority, having under me soldiers;
40.8.9.2^and i say to this one, go, and he goes;
40.8.9.3^and to another, come, and he comes;
40.8.9.4^and to the servant of me, do this, and he does it.
40.8.10.1^having heard now, - jesus marveled, and said to those following, truly i say to you, except no one so great faith in - israel have i found.
40.8.11.1^i say now to you that many from east and west will come, and will recline with abraham and isaac and jacob in the kingdom of the heavens;
40.8.12.1^the however sons of the kingdom will be cast out, into the darkness the outer, there will be the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth.
40.8.13.1^and said - jesus to the centurion, go, as you have believed, be it to you.
40.8.13.2^and was healed the servant of him in the hour that.
40.8.14.1^and having come - jesus to the house of peter, he saw the mother-in-law of him lying sick and fevering.
40.8.15.1^and he touched the hand of her, and left her the fever;
40.8.15.2^and she arose and was ministering to them.
40.8.16.1^evening now having come, they brought to him being possessed with demons many, and he cast out the spirits by a word, and all those sick being, he healed,
40.8.17.1^so that it might be fulfilled that having been spoken by isaiah the prophet, saying, himself the infirmities of us he took, and our diseases bore.
40.8.18.1^having seen now - jesus a crowd around him, he commanded to depart to the other side.
40.8.19.1^and having come to him, one scribe said to him, teacher, i will follow you wherever if you might go.
40.8.20.1^and says to him - jesus, - foxes holes have, and the birds of the air nests;
40.8.20.2^- but the son - of man, no has place where the head he might lay.
40.8.21.1^another now of the disciples of him said to him, lord, allow me first to go and to bury the father of me.
40.8.22.1^- but jesus said to him, follow me, and leave the dead to bury - their own dead.
40.8.23.1^and having entered he into the boat, followed him the disciples of him.
40.8.24.1^and behold, a storm great arose in the sea, so that the boat was being swamped by the waves;
40.8.24.2^he himself however was sleeping.
40.8.25.1^and having come to him, they awoke him, saying, lord, save us, we are perishing!
40.8.26.1^and he says to them, why fearful are you, o you of little faith?
40.8.26.2^then, having arisen, he rebuked the winds and the sea, and there was a calm great.
40.8.27.1^- and the men marveled, saying, what kind of man is this, that even the winds and the sea him obey?
40.8.28.1^and having come he to the other side, to the region of the gadarenes, met him two being possessed by demons, out of the tombs coming forth, violent extremely, so that not was able anyone to pass by the way that.
40.8.29.1^and behold, they cried out, saying, what to us and to you, son - of god?
40.8.29.2^are you come here before the time to torment us?
40.8.30.1^there was now far off from them a herd of pigs many, feeding.
40.8.31.1^- and the demons were begging him, saying, if you cast out us, send away us into the herd - of pigs.
40.8.32.1^and he said to them, go.
40.8.32.2^- and having gone out they went away into the pigs;
40.8.32.3^and behold, rushed all the herd down the steep bank into the sea, and perished in the waters.
40.8.33.1^those now feeding them fled, and having gone away into the city, they related everything, including the matter of those being possessed by demons.
40.8.34.1^and behold, all the city went out to meet - jesus.
40.8.34.2^and having seen him, they begged him that he would depart from the region of them.
40.9.1.1^and having entered into a boat, he passed over and came to the own city.
40.9.2.1^and behold, they were bringing to him a paralytic on a bed lying.
40.9.2.2^and having seen - jesus the faith of them, he said to the paralytic, take courage, son;
40.9.2.3^have been forgiven of you the sins.
40.9.3.1^and behold, some of the scribes said to themselves, this man blasphemes!
40.9.4.1^and having known - jesus the thoughts of them, he said, so that why think you evil in the hearts of you?
40.9.5.1^which for is easier, to say, are forgiven of you the sins, or to say.
40.9.5.2^arise and walk?
40.9.6.1^so that however you may know that authority has the son - of man on the earth to forgive sins.
40.9.6.2^.
40.9.6.3^.
40.9.6.4^then he says to the paralytic, having arisen, take up your - mat, and go to the house of you.
40.9.7.1^and having arisen, he went away to the house of him.
40.9.8.1^having seen now, the crowds marveled and glorified - god, the one having given authority such - to men.
40.9.9.1^and passing on - jesus from there, he saw a man sitting at the tax booth, matthew named.
40.9.9.2^and he says to him, follow me.
40.9.9.3^and having arisen, he followed him.
40.9.10.1^and it came to pass of him reclining in the house, that behold, many tax collectors and sinners, having come, were reclining with - jesus and the disciples of him.
40.9.11.1^and having seen it, the pharisees said to disciples of him, because of why with the tax collectors and sinners eats the teacher of you?
40.9.12.1^- and having heard, he said, not need have those being strong of a physician, but those sick being.
40.9.13.1^having gone however, learn what is, mercy i desire, and not sacrifice.
40.9.13.2^not for i came to call the righteous, but sinners.
40.9.14.1^then come to him the disciples of john, saying, because of why we and the pharisees do fast many times;
40.9.14.2^the however disciples of you not fast?
40.9.15.1^and said to them - jesus, not can the sons of the bridechamber mourn as long as with them is the bridegroom?
40.9.15.2^will come however days when shall have been taken away from them the bridegroom, and then they will fast.
40.9.16.1^no one however puts a patch of cloth unshrunk on clothing old;
40.9.16.2^tears away for the patch of it from the garment, and a worse tear emerges.
40.9.17.1^nor pour they wine new into wineskins old;
40.9.17.2^if now - lest are burst the wineskins, and the wine is poured out, and the wineskins are destroyed.
40.9.17.3^but they pour wine new into wineskins new, and both are preserved.
40.9.18.1^these things of him speaking to them, behold, a ruler certain having come, was kneeling down to him, saying -, the daughter of me presently has died;
40.9.18.2^but having come, lay the hand of you upon her, and she will live.
40.9.19.1^and having arisen, - jesus followed him, also the disciples of him.
40.9.20.1^and behold, a woman having had a flux of blood twelve years, having come up behind him, touched the fringe of the garment of him.
40.9.21.1^she was saying for within herself, if only i shall touch the garment of him, i will be healed.
40.9.22.1^- and jesus, having turned and having seen her, said, take courage, daughter;
40.9.22.2^the faith of you has cured you.
40.9.22.3^and was cured the woman from the hour very.
40.9.23.1^and having come - jesus into the house of the ruler, and having seen the flute players and the crowd making a commotion,
40.9.24.1^he says, go away.
40.9.24.2^not for is dead the girl, but sleeps.
40.9.24.3^and they began to laugh at him.
40.9.25.1^when now had been put outside the crowd, having entered, he took hold of the hand of her, and arose the girl.
40.9.26.1^and went out the report this into all the land that.
40.9.27.1^and passing on from there - jesus, followed him two blind men, crying out and saying, have mercy on us, son of david.
40.9.28.1^having come now into the house, came to him the blind men, and says to them - jesus, believe you that i am able this to do?
40.9.28.2^they say to him, yes, lord.
40.9.29.1^then he touched the eyes of them, saying, according to the faith of you be it to you.
40.9.30.1^and were opened their - eyes.
40.9.30.2^and strictly instructed them - jesus, saying, see that no one knows.
40.9.31.1^- but having gone out, they make known him in all the land that.
40.9.32.1^as they now were going out, behold, they brought to him a man mute, possessed by a demon.
40.9.33.1^and having been cast out the demon, spoke the mute man.
40.9.33.2^and marveled the crowds, saying, never was it seen thus in - israel.
40.9.34.1^the now pharisees were saying, by the prince of the demons he casts out - demons.
40.9.35.1^and was going throughout - jesus the cities all and the villages, teaching in the synagogues of them, and proclaiming the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness.
40.9.36.1^having seen now the crowds, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were wearied and cast away, as sheep not having a shepherd.
40.9.37.1^then he says to the disciples of him, the indeed harvest is plentiful, the however workmen are few;
40.9.38.1^beseech therefore the lord of the harvest, that he might send out workmen into the harvest of him.
40.10.1.1^and having summoned the twelve disciples of him, he gave to them authority over spirits unclean, so as to cast out them and to heal every disease and every sickness.
40.10.2.1^- and of the twelve apostles the names are these:
40.10.2.2^first simon, - called peter, and andrew, the brother of him;
40.10.2.3^and james the son of zebedee, and john the brother of him;
40.10.3.1^philip, and bartholomew;
40.10.3.2^thomas, and matthew the tax collector;
40.10.3.3^james the son - of alphaeus, and thaddaeus;
40.10.4.1^simon the zealot, and judas - iscariot, the one also having betrayed him.
40.10.5.1^these - twelve sent forth - jesus, having instructed them, saying, into the way of the gentiles not go off, and into any city of the samaritans not enter;
40.10.6.1^go however rather to those sheep - being lost of the house of israel.
40.10.7.1^going on also proclaim, saying -, has drawn near the kingdom of the heavens.
40.10.8.1^those ailing heal, dead raise, lepers cleanse, demons cast out;
40.10.8.2^freely you received, freely give.
40.10.9.1^neither take along gold, nor silver, nor copper in the belts of you,
40.10.10.1^nor provision-bag for the way, nor two tunics, nor sandals, nor a staff;
40.10.10.2^worthy is for the workman of the provisions of him.
40.10.11.1^into whatever now - city or village you enter, inquire who in it worthy is, and there remain until - you go forth.
40.10.12.1^entering now into the house, greet it.
40.10.13.1^and if indeed be the house worthy, let come the peace of you upon it;
40.10.13.2^if however not it be worthy, the peace of you to you let return.
40.10.14.1^and whoever - not will receive you, nor will hear the words of you, going forth out of the house or of the city that, shake off the dust of the feet of you!
40.10.15.1^truly i say to you, more tolerable it will be for the land of sodom and of gomorrah on day of judgment, than the city for that.
40.10.16.1^behold, i send forth you as sheep in the midst of wolves;
40.10.16.2^be you therefore shrewd as the serpents, and innocent as the doves.
40.10.17.1^beware however of - men;
40.10.17.2^they will deliver for you into courts, and in the synagogues of them, they will flog you;
40.10.18.1^and before governors also, and kings you will be brought, on account of me, for a testimony to them and to the gentiles.
40.10.19.1^when then they deliver up you, not be anxious how or what you should speak;
40.10.19.2^it will be given for you in that - hour what you should say.
40.10.20.1^not for you are those speaking, but the spirit of the father of you - speaking through you.
40.10.21.1^will deliver up now brother, brother to death;
40.10.21.2^and father, child.
40.10.21.3^and will rise up children against parents, and will put to death them.
40.10.22.1^and you will be hated by all on account of the name of me;
40.10.22.2^the one however having endured to the end, he will be saved.
40.10.23.1^whenever then they persecute you in the city one, flee to the next.
40.10.23.2^truly for i say to you, no not shall you have completed the cities of israel until - be come the son of man.
40.10.24.1^not is a disciple above the teacher, nor a servant above the master of him.
40.10.25.1^it is sufficient for the disciple that he become as the teacher of him, and the servant as the master of him.
40.10.25.2^if the master of the house beelzebul they called, how much more those house members of him!
40.10.26.1^not therefore you should fear them;
40.10.26.2^nothing for is concealed which not will be revealed, or hidden which not will be known.
40.10.27.1^what i tell you in the darkness, speak in the light;
40.10.27.2^and what in the ear you hear, proclaim upon the housetops!
40.10.28.1^and not you should be afraid of those killing the body, the however soul not being able to kill;
40.10.28.2^you should fear however rather the one being able both soul and body to destroy in hell.
40.10.29.1^not two sparrows for an assarion are sold?
40.10.29.2^and one of them not will fall to the ground, apart from the father of you?
40.10.30.1^of you now even the hairs of the head all numbered are.
40.10.31.1^not therefore you should fear;
40.10.31.2^than many sparrows are worth more you.
40.10.32.1^everyone therefore who will confess in me before - men, will confess also i in him before the father of me who is in the heavens.
40.10.33.1^whoever now - shall deny me before - men, will deny i also him before the father of me who is in the heavens.
40.10.34.1^not think that i came to bring peace to the earth;
40.10.34.2^not i came to bring peace, but a sword.
40.10.35.1^i came for to set at variance a man against the father of him, and a daughter against the mother of her, and a daughter-in-law against the mother-in-law of her,
40.10.36.1^and enemies of the man the household of him.
40.10.37.1^the one loving father or mother above me, not is of me worthy;
40.10.37.2^and the one loving son or daughter above me, not is of me worthy.
40.10.38.1^and he who not takes the cross of him and follows after me, not is of me worthy.
40.10.39.1^the one having found the life of him will lose it;
40.10.39.2^and the one having lost the life of him on account of me will find it.
40.10.40.1^the one receiving you, me receives;
40.10.40.2^and the one me receiving, receives the one having sent me.
40.10.41.1^the one receiving a prophet in the name of a prophet, the reward of a prophet will receive;
40.10.41.2^and the one receiving a righteous man in the name of a righteous man, the reward of a righteous man will receive.
40.10.42.1^and whoever - shall give to drink one the little ones of these a cup of cold water, only in the name of a disciple, truly i say to you, no not shall he lose the reward of him.
40.11.1.1^and it came to pass when had finished - jesus commanding the twelve disciples of him, he departed from there - to teach and to preach in the cities of them.
40.11.2.1^- and john, having heard in the prison the works of the christ, having sent two of the disciples of him,
40.11.3.1^said to him, you are the coming one, or another are we to look for?
40.11.4.1^and answering, - jesus said to them, having gone, relate to john what you hear and see:
40.11.5.1^blind receive sight, and lame walk, lepers are cleansed, and deaf hear, and dead are raised, and poor are gospelized.
40.11.6.1^and blessed is he who if not shall fall away in me.
40.11.7.1^as these now were going away, began - jesus to speak to the crowds concerning john:
40.11.7.2^what went you out into the wilderness to see?
40.11.7.3^a reed by the wind shaken?
40.11.8.1^but what did you go out to see?
40.11.8.2^a man in delicate clothing having been dressed?
40.11.8.3^behold, those - delicate clothing wearing, in the houses - of kings are.
40.11.9.1^but what did you go out, to see?
40.11.9.2^a prophet yes, i say to you, and one more excellent than a prophet.
40.11.10.1^for this is he concerning whom it has been written:
40.11.10.2^behold, i send the messenger of me before the face of you, who will prepare the way of you before you.
40.11.11.1^truly i say to you, not there has risen among those born of women one greater than john the baptist.
40.11.11.2^- yet the least in the kingdom of the heavens, greater than he is.
40.11.12.1^from then the days of john the baptist until now, the kingdom of the heavens is taken by violence, and the violent claim it.
40.11.13.1^all for the prophets and the law until john prophesied.
40.11.14.1^and if you are willing to receive it, he is elijah, the one being about to come.
40.11.15.1^the one having ears, let him hear!
40.11.16.1^to what however will i compare the generation this?
40.11.16.2^like it is little children sitting in the markets, and calling out - to others,
40.11.17.1^saying:
40.11.17.2^we piped for you, and not you did dance;
40.11.17.3^we sang a dirge and not you did wail.
40.11.18.1^came for john neither eating nor drinking, and they say, a demon he has!
40.11.19.1^came the son - of man eating and drinking, and they say, behold, a man, a glutton and a drunkard, of tax collectors a friend and of sinners!
40.11.19.2^but is justified - wisdom by the deeds of her.
40.11.20.1^then he began to denounce the cities in which had taken place the most miracles of him, because not they repented.
40.11.21.1^woe to you, chorazin!
40.11.21.2^woe to you, bethsaida!
40.11.21.3^for if in tyre and sidon had taken place the miracles - having come to pass in you, long ago then in sackcloth and ashes they would have repented.
40.11.22.1^but i say to you, for tyre and sidon more tolerable will it be in the day of judgment than for you.
40.11.23.1^and you, capernaum, not to heaven will be exalted, to hades will be brought down!
40.11.23.2^for if in sodom had taken place the miracles - having taken place in you, it would have remained - until the day.
40.11.24.1^but i say to you, that for the land of sodom more tolerable will it be in day of judgment than for you.
40.11.25.1^at that - time answering, - jesus said, i fully consent to you, father, lord of the heaven and the earth, that you did hide these things from wise and learned, and did reveal them to little children.
40.11.26.1^yes, - father, for thus well-pleasing it was before you.
40.11.27.1^all things to me have been delivered by the father of me.
40.11.27.2^and no one knows the son, if not the father;
40.11.27.3^nor the father anyone does know, if not the son, and to whom if might choose the son to reveal him.
40.11.28.1^come to me, all those toiling and being burdened, and i will give rest to you.
40.11.29.1^take the yoke of me upon you and learn from me, for gentle i am and humble in the heart, and you will find rest for the souls of you.
40.11.30.1^the for yoke of me is easy, and the burden of me light is.
40.12.1.1^at that - time went - jesus on the sabbaths through the grainfields, - and the disciples of him were hungry, and they began to pluck the heads of grain and to eat.
40.12.2.1^- and the pharisees, having seen, said to him, behold, the disciples of you are doing what not it is lawful to do on sabbath.
40.12.3.1^- and he said to them, not you have read what did david when he was hungry, and those with him
40.12.4.1^how he entered into the house - of god, and the loaves of the presentation they ate, which not lawful it was for him to eat, nor for those with him, if not for the priests only?
40.12.5.1^or not have you read in the law, that on the sabbath the priests in the temple the sabbath profane, and guiltless are?
40.12.6.1^i say however to you that the temple a greater than is here.
40.12.7.1^if however you had known what is, mercy i desire and not sacrifice,  not - you would have condemned the guiltless.
40.12.8.1^lord for is of the sabbath the son of man.
40.12.9.1^and having departed from there, he went into the synagogue of them.
40.12.10.1^and behold, a man a hand having withered.
40.12.10.2^and they asked him, saying, is it lawful on the sabbaths to heal?
40.12.10.3^so that they might accuse him.
40.12.11.1^- and he said to them, what will there be among you man, who will have sheep one, and if falls it on the sabbaths into a pit, not will he take hold of it and will raise it up?
40.12.12.1^how much therefore is more valuable a man than a sheep!
40.12.12.2^therefore it is lawful on the sabbaths good to do.
40.12.13.1^then he says to the man, stretch out your - hand.
40.12.13.2^and he stretched it out, and it was restored, sound as the other.
40.12.14.1^having gone out now, the pharisees a counsel held against him, how him they might destroy.
40.12.15.1^- and jesus, having known, withdrew from there.
40.12.15.2^and followed him multitudes great, and he healed them all,
40.12.16.1^and he warned them that not known him they should make
40.12.17.1^so that might be fulfilled that having been spoken by isaiah the prophet, saying,
40.12.18.1^behold the servant of me, whom i have chosen, the beloved of me, in whom has found delight the soul of me.
40.12.18.2^i will put the spirit of me upon him, and justice to the gentiles he will proclaim.
40.12.19.1^not will he quarrel nor will he cry out, nor will hear anyone in the streets the voice of him.
40.12.20.1^a reed bruised not he will break, and a wick smoldering not he will quench, until - he leads to victory - justice.
40.12.21.1^and in the name of him the gentiles will hope.
40.12.22.1^then was brought to him one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, and he healed him, in order for the mute man to speak and to see.
40.12.23.1^and were amazed all the crowds, and were saying, whether this is the son of david?
40.12.24.1^- and the pharisees, having heard, said, this man not casts out the demons, if not by - beelzebul prince of the demons.
40.12.25.1^having known now the thoughts of them, he said to them, every kingdom having been divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house having been divided against itself not will stand.
40.12.26.1^and if - satan, - satan casts out, against himself he is divided.
40.12.26.2^how then will stand the kingdom of him?
40.12.27.1^and if i by beelzebul cast out - demons, the sons of you by whom do they cast out?
40.12.27.2^on account of this, they judges will be of you.
40.12.28.1^if however by the spirit of god i cast out - demons, then has come upon you the kingdom - of god.
40.12.29.1^or how is able anyone to enter into the house of the strong man and the goods of him to plunder, if not first he bind the strong man?
40.12.29.2^and then the house of him he will plunder.
40.12.30.1^the one not being with me against me is, and the one not gathering with me scatters.
40.12.31.1^because of this i say to you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven - men;
40.12.31.2^- however against the spirit blasphemy not will be forgiven.
40.12.32.1^and whoever if speaks a word against the son - of man, it will be forgiven him;
40.12.32.2^whoever now - speaks against - spirit the holy, not it will be forgiven him, neither in this - age nor in the coming one.
40.12.33.1^either make the tree good and the fruit of it good, or make the tree bad and the fruit of it bad;
40.12.33.2^by for the fruit, the tree is known.
40.12.34.1^offspring of vipers, how are you able good things to speak, evil being?
40.12.34.2^out of for the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.
40.12.35.1^the good man out of his good treasure puts forth good things;
40.12.35.2^and the evil man out of his evil treasure puts forth evil things.
40.12.36.1^i say now to you that every word careless that will speak - men, they will give of it an account in day of judgment.
40.12.37.1^by for the words of you, you will be justified, and by the words of you, you will be condemned.
40.12.38.1^then answered him some of the scribes and pharisees, saying, teacher, we wish from you a sign to see.
40.12.39.1^- and answering he said to them, a generation evil and adulterous a sign seeks for, and a sign not will be given to it, if not the sign of jonah the prophet.
40.12.40.1^just as for was jonah in the belly of the great fish three days and three nights, so will be the son - of man in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.
40.12.41.1^the men of nineveh will stand up in the judgment with the generation this, and will condemn it;
40.12.41.2^for they repented at the preaching of jonah;
40.12.41.3^and behold, greater than jonah here.
40.12.42.1^the queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with the generation this, and will condemn it;
40.12.42.2^for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon, and behold, greater than solomon here.
40.12.43.1^when now the unclean spirit is gone out from the man, it passes through waterless places seeking rest, and none finds it.
40.12.44.1^then it says, to the house of me i will return, from where i came out.
40.12.44.2^and having come, it finds it being unoccupied, swept, and put in order.
40.12.45.1^then it goes and takes with itself seven other spirits more evil than itself, and having entered in they dwell there;
40.12.45.2^and becomes the last of the man that worse than the first.
40.12.45.3^so it will be also unto generation this the evil.
40.12.46.1^while he was speaking to the crowds, behold, the mother and the brothers of him were standing outside, seeking to him to speak.
40.12.47.1^said now someone to him, behold, the mother of you and the brothers of you outside are standing, seeking to you to speak.
40.12.48.1^- and answering, he said to the one telling him, who is the mother of me, and who are the brothers of me?
40.12.49.1^and having stretched out the hand of him to the disciples of him, he said, behold, the mother of me and the brothers of me.
40.12.50.1^whoever for - shall do the will the father of me who is in the heavens, he my brother and sister and mother is.
40.13.1.1^in the day that, having gone forth - jesus from the house, was sitting by the sea.
40.13.2.1^and were gathered together to him crowds great, so that he into a boat having entered sat down, and all the crowd on the shore stood.
40.13.3.1^and he spoke to them many things in parables, saying, behold, went out the one sowing - to sow.
40.13.4.1^and in - sowing of him, some indeed fell along the road, and having come, the birds devoured them.
40.13.5.1^other now fell upon the rocky places, where not it had soil much, and immediately it sprang up, through - not having depth of soil;
40.13.6.1^the sun now having risen, they were scorched, and through the not having root, were dried up.
40.13.7.1^other now fell upon the thorns, and grew up the thorns, and choked them.
40.13.8.1^other now fell upon the soil - good, and were yielding fruit, some indeed a hundredfold, some now sixty, some now thirty.
40.13.9.1^the one having ears, let him hear!
40.13.10.1^and having come to him, the disciples said to him, because of why in parables speak you to them?
40.13.11.1^- and answering, he said to them, because to you it has been granted to know the mysteries of the kingdom of the heavens;
40.13.11.2^to them however not it has been granted.
40.13.12.1^whoever for has, will be given to him, and he will be in abundance;
40.13.12.2^whoever now not has, even what he has will be taken away from him.
40.13.13.1^because of this, in parables to them i speak:
40.13.13.2^because seeing, not do they see;
40.13.13.3^and hearing, not do they hear, nor do they understand.
40.13.14.1^and is fulfilled in them the prophecy of isaiah, - saying:
40.13.14.2^in hearing you will hear, and no not understand;
40.13.14.3^and seeing you will see and no not perceive.
40.13.15.1^has grown dull for the heart of the people this, and with the ears barely they have heard, and the eyes of them they have closed;
40.13.15.2^not lest they should see with the eyes, and with the ears they should hear, and with the heart they should understand, and should return, and i will heal them.
40.13.16.1^of you however blessed are the eyes, because they see;
40.13.16.2^and the ears of you, because they hear.
40.13.17.1^truly for i say to you, that many prophets and righteous men longed to see what you see, and not saw;
40.13.17.2^and to hear what you hear, and not heard.
40.13.18.1^you therefore hear the parable of the one having sown:
40.13.19.1^everyone hearing the word of the kingdom and not understanding, comes the evil one and snatches away that having been sown in the heart of him.
40.13.19.2^this is the one on the path having been sown.
40.13.20.1^that which now upon the rocky places having been sown, this is the one the word hearing, and immediately with joy receiving it;
40.13.21.1^no he has now root in himself, but temporary is;
40.13.21.2^having come however tribulation or persecution on account of the word, immediately he falls away.
40.13.22.1^that which now among the thorns having been sown, this is the one the word hearing, and the care - the present age and the deceit - of riches choke the word, and unfruitful it becomes.
40.13.23.1^that however on the good soil having been sown, this is the one the word hearing and understanding, who indeed brings forth fruit and produces   some indeed a hundredfold, some now sixty, some now thirty.
40.13.24.1^another parable put he before them, saying, has become like the kingdom of the heavens, a man having sown good seed in the field of him.
40.13.25.1^in now the time are sleeping the men, came his - enemy and sowed weeds in the midst of the wheat, and went away.
40.13.26.1^when now sprouted the plants and fruit produced, then appeared also the weeds.
40.13.27.1^having come to him now, the servants the master of the house said to him, sir, not good seed did you sow in - your field?
40.13.27.2^how then has it the weeds?
40.13.28.1^- and he said to them, an enemy, a man this did.
40.13.28.2^- and the servants said, to him do you desire then that having gone forth, we should gather them?
40.13.29.1^- and he said, no;
40.13.29.2^not lest gathering the weeds, you would uproot with them the wheat.
40.13.30.1^allow to grow together both until the harvest;
40.13.30.2^and in the time of the harvest i will say to the harvesters, gather first the weeds, and bind them into bundles in order - to burn them;
40.13.30.3^- and the wheat, gather together into the barn of me.
40.13.31.1^another parable put he before them, saying, like is the kingdom of the heavens to a grain of mustard, which having taken, a man sowed in the field of him;
40.13.32.1^which smallest indeed is of all the seeds;
40.13.32.2^when however it is grown, greater than the garden plants it is, and becomes a tree, so that come the birds of the air and perch in the branches of it.
40.13.33.1^another parable spoke he to them:
40.13.33.2^like is the kingdom of the heavens to leaven, which having taken, a woman hid in of flour measures three, until of it was leavened all.
40.13.34.1^these things all spoke - jesus in parables to the crowds, and without a parable not he was speaking to them,
40.13.35.1^so that might be fulfilled that having been spoken by the prophet, saying, i will open in parables the mouth of me;
40.13.35.2^i will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.
40.13.36.1^then having dismissed the crowds, he went into the house.
40.13.36.2^and came to him the disciples of him, saying, explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.
40.13.37.1^- and answering he said, the one sowing the good seed is the son - of man;
40.13.38.1^- and the field is the world;
40.13.38.2^- and the good seed, these are the sons of the kingdom;
40.13.38.3^- and the weeds are the sons of the evil one;
40.13.39.1^- and the enemy - having sown them is the devil;
40.13.39.2^- and the harvest the consummation of the age is, - and the harvesters angels are.
40.13.40.1^as therefore is gathered the weeds, and in fire is consumed, thus it will be in the consummation of the age.
40.13.41.1^will send forth the son - of man the angels of him, and they will gather out of the kingdom of him all the causes of sin and those practicing - lawlessness,
40.13.42.1^and they will cast them into the furnace of the fire;
40.13.42.2^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
40.13.43.1^then the righteous will shine forth as the sun in the kingdom of the father of them.
40.13.43.2^the one having ears, let him hear!
40.13.44.1^like is the kingdom of the heavens treasure having been hidden in the field, which, having found, a man hid, and for the joy of it goes and he sells all that he has and buys the field that.
40.13.45.1^again like is the kingdom of the heavens a man, a merchant seeking fine pearls;
40.13.46.1^having found now one very precious pearl, having gone away, he has sold all things as many as he had, and bought it.
40.13.47.1^again like is the kingdom of the heavens a dragnet having been cast into the sea, and of every kind having gathered together,
40.13.48.1^which, when it was filled, having drawn up on the shore and having sat down, they collected the good into vessels, the and bad out they cast.
40.13.49.1^thus will it be in the consummation of the age;
40.13.49.2^will go out the angels, and will separate the evil from the midst of the righteous,
40.13.50.1^and will cast them into the furnace of the fire.
40.13.50.2^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth.
40.13.51.1^have you understood these things all?
40.13.51.2^they say to him, yes.
40.13.52.1^- and he said to them, because of this, every scribe having been discipled into the kingdom of the heavens like is a man, a master of a house, who puts forth out of the treasure of him things new and old.
40.13.53.1^and it came to pass, when had finished - jesus the parables these, he withdrew from there.
40.13.54.1^and having come into the region his own, he was teaching them in the synagogue of them, so that are astonished they and are saying, from where to this man the wisdom this and the miraculous powers?
40.13.55.1^not this is the of the carpenter son?
40.13.55.2^is not the mother of him called mary?
40.13.55.3^and the brothers of him james and joseph and simon and judas?
40.13.56.1^and the sisters of him not all with us are?
40.13.56.2^from where then to this man these things all?
40.13.57.1^and they were offended at him.
40.13.57.2^- but jesus said to them, not is a prophet without honor, if not in the hometown, and in the household of him.
40.13.58.1^and not he did there miracles many, because of the unbelief of them.
40.14.1.1^at that - time heard herod the tetrarch the news of jesus,
40.14.2.1^and he said to the servants of him, this is john the baptist;
40.14.2.2^he is risen from the dead, and because of this, the miraculous powers are working in him.
40.14.3.1^- for herod having seized - john, he bound him and in prison put him, on account of herodias, the wife of philip, the brother of him.
40.14.4.1^had been saying for - john to him, not it is lawful for you to have her.
40.14.5.1^although wishing him to kill, he feared the multitude, because as a prophet him they were holding.
40.14.6.1^the birthday now having been celebrated - of herod, danced the daughter - of herodias in the midst, and pleased - herod,
40.14.7.1^whereupon with oath he promised to her to give whatever if she should ask.
40.14.8.1^- and having been urged on by the mother of her, give me, she says, here upon a platter the head of john the baptist.
40.14.9.1^and having been grieved the king, on account of the oaths and those reclining with him, he commanded it to be given.
40.14.10.1^and he having sent, beheaded - john in the prison.
40.14.11.1^and was brought the head of him on a platter, and was given to the girl, and she brought it to the mother of her.
40.14.12.1^and having come, the disciples of him took the body, and buried it;
40.14.12.2^and having come, they told - jesus.
40.14.13.1^having heard now, - jesus withdrew from there by boat to a secluded place apart himself.
40.14.13.2^and having heard of it, the crowds followed him on foot from the towns.
40.14.14.1^and having gone out, he saw great a crowd, and was moved with compassion toward them, and healed the sick of them.
40.14.15.1^evening now having come, came to him the disciples, saying, desolate is this place, and the time already is gone by.
40.14.15.2^dismiss the crowds, that having gone into the villages, they might buy for themselves food.
40.14.16.1^- and jesus said to them, no need they have to go away.
40.14.16.2^give to them you to eat.
40.14.17.1^- and they say to him, not we have here, if not five loaves and two fish.
40.14.18.1^- and he said, bring to me here them.
40.14.19.1^and having commanded the crowds to sit down on the grass, having taken the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to - heaven, he spoke a blessing;
40.14.19.2^and having broken, he gave to the disciples the loaves, - and the disciples to the crowds.
40.14.20.1^and ate all and were satisfied;
40.14.20.2^and they took up that being over and above of the fragments, twelve hand-baskets full.
40.14.21.1^those then eating were men about five thousand, besides women and children.
40.14.22.1^and immediately he compelled the disciples to enter into the boat and to go before him to the other side, until that he would have dismissed the crowds.
40.14.23.1^and having dismissed the crowds, he went up on the mountain by himself to pray.
40.14.23.2^evening now having arrived, alone he was there.
40.14.24.1^- and the boat, now stadia many from the land, being tossed by the waves was, for contrary was the wind.
40.14.25.1^in the fourth now watch of the night, he went to them, walking on the sea.
40.14.26.1^- and the disciples, having seen him on the sea walking, were troubled, saying -, a ghost it is!
40.14.26.2^and in - fear they cried out.
40.14.27.1^immediately now spoke - jesus to them, saying, take courage!
40.14.27.2^i it is, not fear.
40.14.28.1^answering now to him, - peter said, lord, if you it is, command me to come to you upon the waters.
40.14.29.1^- and he said, come.
40.14.29.2^and having descended from the boat, - peter walked upon the water and came to - jesus.
40.14.30.1^seeing now the wind charging, he was afraid, and having begun to sink, he cried out, saying, lord, save me!
40.14.31.1^immediately now - jesus, having stretched out the hand, took hold of him and says to him, you of little faith, of why did you doubt?
40.14.32.1^and having entered they into the boat, ceased the wind.
40.14.33.1^those then in the boat worshiped him, saying, truly, of god son you are!
40.14.34.1^and having crossed over, they came to the land of gennesaret.
40.14.35.1^and having recognized him, the men the place of that sent to all the surrounding region that and brought to him all those sick being,
40.14.36.1^and they were begging him that only they might touch the fringe of the garment of him;
40.14.36.2^and as many as touched were cured.
40.15.1.1^then come - to jesus from jerusalem pharisees and scribes, saying,
40.15.2.1^because of why the disciples of you break the tradition of the elders?
40.15.2.2^not for they wash the hands of them when bread they shall eat.
40.15.3.1^- and answering he said to them, because of why also you break the commandment - of god on account of the tradition of you?
40.15.4.1^- for god commanded, honor the father and the mother  and, the one speaking evil of father or mother, in death must end.
40.15.5.1^you however say, whoever - shall say to the father or the mother, it is a gift, whatever if by me you might be profited,
40.15.6.1^no not he shall honor the father of himself.
40.15.6.2^and you made void the commandment - of god on account of the tradition of you!
40.15.7.1^hypocrites!
40.15.7.2^rightly prophesied concerning you isaiah, saying,
40.15.8.1^the people this, with the lips me it honors;
40.15.8.2^the however heart of them, far away is kept from me;
40.15.9.1^in vain then they worship me, teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.
40.15.10.1^and having called to him the crowd, he said to them, hear and understand!
40.15.11.1^not what is entering into the mouth defiles the man;
40.15.11.2^but that going forth out of the mouth, this defiles the man.
40.15.12.1^then having come near, the disciples said to him, know you that the pharisees, having heard the saying, were offended?
40.15.13.1^- and answering he said, every plant that not has planted the father of me - heavenly, it will be rooted up.
40.15.14.1^leave them!
40.15.14.2^blind they are guides of the blind.
40.15.14.3^blind now blind if they lead, both into a pit will fall.
40.15.15.1^answering then, - peter said to him, explain to us the parable this.
40.15.16.1^- and he said, still also you without understanding are?
40.15.17.1^not yet understand you that everything - entering into the mouth, into the stomach goes, and into the sewer is cast out?
40.15.18.1^the things however going forth out of the mouth, out of the heart come forth, and these defile the man.
40.15.19.1^out of for the heart come forth thoughts evil, murders, adulteries, sexual immorality, thefts, false testimonies, slanders.
40.15.20.1^these are the things defiling the man;
40.15.20.2^- but with unwashed hands to eat, not defiles the man.
40.15.21.1^and having gone forth from there, - jesus withdrew to the district of tyre and sidon.
40.15.22.1^and behold, a woman canaanite from the region same, having approached, was crying out, saying, have mercy on me, lord, son of david;
40.15.22.2^the daughter of me miserably is possessed by a demon.
40.15.23.1^- and not he answered her a word.
40.15.23.2^and having come to him, the disciples of him were imploring him, saying, dismiss her, for she cries out after us!
40.15.24.1^- and answering he said, not i was sent, if not to the sheep - being lost of the house of israel.
40.15.25.1^- and having come, she was worshiping him, saying, lord, help me!
40.15.26.1^- and answering, he said, not it is right to take the bread of the children, and to cast it to the dogs.
40.15.27.1^- and she said, yes, lord;
40.15.27.2^even however the dogs eat of the crumbs - falling from the table of the masters of them.
40.15.28.1^then answering, - jesus said to her, o woman, great is of you the faith!
40.15.28.2^be it to you as you desire.
40.15.28.3^and was healed the daughter of her from the hour that.
40.15.29.1^and having departed from there, - jesus went along the sea - of galilee;
40.15.29.2^and having gone up on the mountain, he was sitting there.
40.15.30.1^and came to him crowds great, having with them lame, blind, crippled, mute, and others many, and they placed them at the feet of him, and he healed them;
40.15.31.1^so that the crowd marveled, seeing mute speaking, crippled restored, and lame walking, and blind seeing;
40.15.31.2^and they glorified the god of israel.
40.15.32.1^- and jesus, having called to him the disciples of him, said, i am moved with compassion toward the crowd, because already days three they continue with me, and nothing have that they might eat;
40.15.32.2^and to send away them hungry, not i am willing, not lest they faint on the way.
40.15.33.1^and say to him the disciples, from where to us in a secluded place, loaves so many as to satisfy a crowd so great.
40.15.34.1^and says to them - jesus, how many loaves have you?
40.15.34.2^- and they said, seven, and a few small fish.
40.15.35.1^and he having commanded the crowds to sit down on the ground,
40.15.36.1^having taken the seven loaves and the fish, and having given thanks, he broke them and was giving to disciples, - and the disciples to the crowd.
40.15.37.1^and ate all and were satisfied;
40.15.37.2^and that being over and above of the fragments, they took up seven baskets full.
40.15.38.1^those then eating were four thousand men, besides women and children.
40.15.39.1^and having dismissed the crowds, he entered into the boat and came to the region of magadan.
40.16.1.1^and having approached, the pharisees and sadducees, testing , asked him a sign out of - heaven to show them.
40.16.2.1^- and answering he said to them, evening having come, you say, fair weather;
40.16.2.2^is red for the sky.
40.16.3.1^and in the morning, today a storm;
40.16.3.2^is red for being overcast the sky.
40.16.3.3^the indeed appearance of the sky you know how to discern, - but the signs of the times, not you are able!
40.16.4.1^a generation evil and adulterous, a sign seeks, and a sign not will be given to it, if not the sign of jonah.
40.16.4.2^and having left them, he went away.
40.16.5.1^and having come the disciples to the other side, they forgot bread to take.
40.16.6.1^- and jesus said to them, watch and beware of the leaven of the pharisees and sadducees.
40.16.7.1^- and they were reasoning among themselves, saying, because bread not we took.
40.16.8.1^having known this however, - jesus said, why reason you among yourselves, o you of little faith, because bread not you took?
40.16.9.1^not yet do you understand, nor remember the five loaves for the five thousand, and how many hand-baskets you gathered?
40.16.10.1^nor the seven loaves for the four thousand, and how many baskets you gathered?
40.16.11.1^how not understand you that, not concerning bread i spoke to you, to beware also of the leaven of the pharisees and sadducees?
40.16.12.1^then they understood that not he said to beware of the leaven of bread, but of the teaching of the pharisees and sadducees.
40.16.13.1^having come then - jesus into the district of caesarea - philippi, he was questioning the disciples of him, saying, whom do pronounce - men to be the son of man?
40.16.14.1^- and they said, some indeed john the baptist;
40.16.14.2^others now elijah;
40.16.14.3^others now jeremiah, or one of the prophets.
40.16.15.1^he says to them, you but whom me do you pronounce to be?
40.16.16.1^answering now, simon peter said, you are the christ, the son of god the living.
40.16.17.1^answering now, - jesus said to him, blessed are you, simon barjona!
40.16.17.2^for flesh and blood not revealed it to you, but the father of me, who is in the heavens.
40.16.18.1^i also now to you say that you are peter, and on this the rock i will build my - church, and the gates of hades not will prevail against it.
40.16.19.1^i will give to you the keys of the kingdom of the heavens;
40.16.19.2^and whatever if you might bind on the earth, will be bound in the heavens;
40.16.19.3^and whatever if you might loose on the earth, will be loosed in the heavens.
40.16.20.1^then instructed he the disciples that to no one they should say that he is the christ.
40.16.21.1^from that time began - jesus to show to the disciples of him that it is necessary for him to jerusalem to go away, and many things to suffer from the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be killed, and on the third day to be raised.
40.16.22.1^and having taken aside him, - peter began to rebuke him, saying, far be it from you, lord;
40.16.22.2^never, not will be to you this.
40.16.23.1^- and having turned he said - to peter, get behind me, satan!
40.16.23.2^a stumbling block you are to me.
40.16.23.3^for not your thoughts are of the things - of god, but the things of men.
40.16.24.1^then - jesus said to disciples of him, if anyone desires after me to come, let him deny himself, and take up the cross of him, and follow me.
40.16.25.1^whoever for if might desire the life of him to save, will lose it;
40.16.25.2^whoever however - might lose the life of him on account of me, will find it.
40.16.26.1^what for will it profit a man, if the world whole he gains, - but the soul of him loses?
40.16.26.2^or what will give a man as an exchange for the soul of him?
40.16.27.1^is about for the son of the man to come in the glory the father of him, with the angels of him;
40.16.27.2^and then he will give to each according to the deeds of him.
40.16.28.1^truly i say to you -, there are some of those here standing who no not shall taste of death until - they have seen the son - of man coming in the kingdom of him.
40.17.1.1^and after days six, takes with him - jesus, - peter and james and john, the brother of him, and brings up them into a mountain high by themselves.
40.17.2.1^and he was transfigured before them, and shone the face of him like the sun, - and the clothes of him became white as the light.
40.17.3.1^and behold, appeared to them moses and elijah, talking with him.
40.17.4.1^answering now, - peter said - to jesus, lord, good it is for us here to be.
40.17.4.2^if you wish, i will make here three tabernacles, for you one, and for moses one, and for elijah one.
40.17.5.1^while yet he was speaking, behold, a cloud bright overshadowed them;
40.17.5.2^and behold, a voice out of the cloud, saying, this is the son of me, the beloved, in whom i am well pleased.
40.17.5.3^listen to him!
40.17.6.1^and having heard it, the disciples fell upon face of them and were terrified greatly.
40.17.7.1^and having come to them - jesus, and having touched them, he said, rise up, and not be afraid.
40.17.8.1^having lifted up and the eyes of them, no one they saw if not himself jesus alone.
40.17.9.1^and as were descending they from the mountain, instructed them - jesus, saying, to no one tell the vision, until that the son - of man out from the dead is risen.
40.17.10.1^and asked him the disciples, saying, why then the scribes say that elijah it behooves to come first?
40.17.11.1^- and answering, he said, elijah indeed comes, and will restore all things.
40.17.12.1^i say however to you that elijah already is come, and not they knew him, but did to him whatever they desired.
40.17.12.2^thus also, the son - of man is about to suffer from them.
40.17.13.1^then understood the disciples that concerning john the baptist he spoke to them.
40.17.14.1^and they having come to the crowd, came to him a man kneeling down to him
40.17.15.1^and saying, lord, have mercy on my - son, for he is epileptic and miserably suffers;
40.17.15.2^often for he falls into the fire, and often into the water.
40.17.16.1^and i brought him to the disciples of you, and not they were able him to heal.
40.17.17.1^answering now, - jesus said, o generation unbelieving and perverted, how long when with you will i be?
40.17.17.2^how long when will i bear with you?
40.17.17.3^bring to me him here.
