40.17.18.1^and rebuked him - jesus, and went out from him the demon, and was healed the boy from the hour that.
40.17.19.1^then having come the disciples - to jesus in private, they said, because of why we not were able to cast out it?
40.17.20.1^- and he said to them, because of the little faith of you.
40.17.20.2^truly for i say to you, if you have faith as a seed of mustard, you will say to the mountain to this, move from here to there, and it will move.
40.17.20.3^and nothing will be impossible for you.
40.17.22.1^were abiding now they in - galilee, said to them - jesus, is about the son - of man to be betrayed into the hands of men,
40.17.23.1^and they will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised up.
40.17.23.2^and they were grieved deeply.
40.17.24.1^having come now they to capernaum, came those the didrachmas collecting - to peter and said, the teacher of you not does he pay the didrachmas?
40.17.25.1^he says, yes.
40.17.25.2^and he having entered into the house, anticipated him - jesus, saying, what you do think, simon?
40.17.25.3^the kings of the earth, from whom do they receive custom or tribute?
40.17.25.4^from the sons of them, or from - strangers?
40.17.26.1^he having said now, from the strangers, said to him - jesus, - then free are the sons.
40.17.27.1^that however not we might offend them, having gone to sea, cast a hook, and the having come up first fish take, and having opened the mouth of it, you will find a four-drachma coin.
40.17.27.2^that having taken, give to them for me and yourself.
40.18.1.1^in that - hour came the disciples - to jesus, saying, who then the greatest is in the kingdom of the heavens?
40.18.2.1^and having called to him a child, he set it in midst of them,
40.18.3.1^and said, truly i say to you, if not you turn and become as the little children, no not shall you enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
40.18.4.1^whoever therefore will humble himself as the little child this, he is the greatest in the kingdom of the heavens.
40.18.5.1^and whoever if shall receive one little child such in the name of me, me receives.
40.18.6.1^whoever then - shall cause to stumble one of the little ones of these - believing in me, it is better for him that should be hung a millstone heavy around the neck of him, and he be sunk in the depth of the sea.
40.18.7.1^woe to the world because of the causes of sin.
40.18.7.2^necessary are for to come the stumbling blocks, but woe to the man by whom the offense comes!
40.18.8.1^if now the hand of you or the foot of you causes to sin you, cut off it and cast it from you;
40.18.8.2^better for you it is to enter into - life crippled or lame, than two hands or two feet having, to be cast into the fire - eternal.
40.18.9.1^and if the eye of you causes to sin you, gouge out it and cast it from you;
40.18.9.2^better for you it is one-eyed into - life to enter, than two eyes having to be cast into the hell of the fire.
40.18.10.1^see that not you despise one of the little ones of these.
40.18.10.2^i say for to you that the angels of them in the heavens continually always behold the face of the father of me, who is in the heavens.
40.18.12.1^what you do think?
40.18.12.2^if there should be to any man a hundred sheep, and has gone astray one of them, not will he leave the ninety nine on the mountains, and having gone, seek the one going astray?
40.18.13.1^and if he should find it, truly i say to you that he rejoices over it more than over the ninety nine - not having gone astray.
40.18.14.1^thus not it is the will of the father of you who is in the heavens, that should perish one of the little ones of these.
40.18.15.1^if now sins against you the brother of you, go reprove him, between you and him alone.
40.18.15.2^if you he will hear, you have gained the brother of you.
40.18.16.1^if however not he will hear, take with you more, one or two, that upon the testimony of two witnesses or of three, may be strengthened every word.
40.18.17.1^if now he fails to listen to them, tell it to the church.
40.18.17.2^if now also to the church he fails to listen, let him be to you as the pagan and the tax collector.
40.18.18.1^truly i say to you, how many if you shall bind on the earth, shall have been bound in heaven;
40.18.18.2^and how many if you shall loose on the earth, shall have been loosed in heaven.
40.18.19.1^again truly i say to you that if two might agree of you on the earth concerning any matter, that if they shall ask, it will be done for them by the father of me who is in the heavens.
40.18.20.1^where for are two or three gathered together unto - my name, there am i in the midst of them.
40.18.21.1^then having come, - peter said to him, lord, how often will sin against me the brother of me, and i will forgive him?
40.18.21.2^up to seven times?
40.18.22.1^says to him - jesus, not i say to you up to seven times, but up to seventy times seven!
40.18.23.1^because of this, has become like the kingdom of the heavens to a man, a king, who desired to settle accounts with the servants of him.
40.18.24.1^having begun then he to settle, was brought to him, one a debtor of ten thousand talents.
40.18.25.1^nothing having now he to pay, commanded him the master to be sold, and the wife and the children, and all as many as he had, and payment to be made.
40.18.26.1^having fallen down therefore the servant was bowing on his knees to him, saying, have patience with me, and all i will pay to you.
40.18.27.1^having been moved with compassion now, the master of the servant that released him, and the debt forgave him.
40.18.28.1^having gone out however, the servant same found one the fellow servants of him who was owing him a hundred denarii, and having seized him he was throttling him, saying, pay if any you owe.
40.18.29.1^having fallen down therefore, the fellow servant of him was begging him, saying, have patience with me, and i will pay you.
40.18.30.1^- but not he was willing, rather having gone, he cast him into prison, until he should pay that which was owing.
40.18.31.1^having seen therefore the fellow servants of him the things having taken place, they were grieved deeply, and having gone, narrated to master of themselves all that having taken place.
40.18.32.1^then having called to him, the master of him says to him, servant evil, all the debt that i forgave you, because you begged me.
40.18.33.1^not did it behoove also you to have pitied the fellow servant of you, as also i you had pitied?
40.18.34.1^and having been angry, the master of him delivered him to the jailers, until that he should pay all - being owed.
40.18.35.1^thus also the father of me - heavenly will do to you, if not you forgive each the brother of him, from the heart of you.
40.19.1.1^and it came to pass, when had finished - jesus the words these, he withdrew from - galilee and came to the region - of judea beyond the jordan.
40.19.2.1^and followed him crowds great, and he healed them there.
40.19.3.1^and came to him pharisees, testing him and saying, if is it lawful for a man to divorce the a wife to him for every cause?
40.19.4.1^which now answering, he said, not have you read that the one having created, from the beginning male and female made them
40.19.5.1^and said, on account of this will leave a man the father and the mother and be joined with the wife of him, and will become the two into flesh one
40.19.6.1^so that no longer are they two, but flesh one.
40.19.6.2^what therefore - god united together, man not let separate.
40.19.7.1^they say to him, why then moses did command to give a roll of divorce, and to send away her?
40.19.8.1^he says to them -, moses in view of the hardness of heart of you allowed you to divorce the wives of you;
40.19.8.2^from the beginning however not was it this way.
40.19.9.1^i say now to you that whoever - shall divorce - wife of him except for sexual immorality, and shall marry another, commits adultery.
40.19.10.1^say to him the disciples of him if this is the case of the man with the wife, not it is better to marry.
40.19.11.1^- and he said to them, not all receive the word this, but only those to whom it has been given.
40.19.12.1^there are for eunuchs who from the womb of their mother were born thus, and there are eunuchs who were made eunuchs by - men, and there are eunuchs who made eunuchs of themselves for the sake of the kingdom of the heavens.
40.19.12.2^the one being able to receive it, let him receive it.
40.19.13.1^then were brought to him little children, that the hands he might lay on them, and he might pray.
40.19.13.2^- however the disciples rebuked them.
40.19.14.1^- and jesus said, permit the little children, and not do forbid them to come to me;
40.19.14.2^of the for such kind is the kingdom of the heavens.
40.19.15.1^and having laid the hands upon them, he departed from there.
40.19.16.1^and behold, one having come to him, said, teacher, what good thing shall i do, that i might have life eternal?
40.19.17.1^- and he said to him, why me ask you about what is good?
40.19.17.2^only one is - good.
40.19.17.3^if however you desire into - life to enter, keep the commandments.
40.19.18.1^he says to him, which?
40.19.18.2^- and jesus said, - not shall you murder, not shall you commit adultery, not shall you steal, not shall you bear false witness,
40.19.19.1^you shall honor the father and the mother, and you shall love - neighbor of you as yourself.
40.19.20.1^says to him the young man, all these things i have kept.
40.19.20.2^what yet lack i?
40.19.21.1^was saying to him - jesus, if you desire perfect to be, go, sell of you the possessing, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in the heavens;
40.19.21.2^and come, follow me.
40.19.22.1^having heard now the young man the statement, he went away grieving;
40.19.22.2^he was one for having possessions many.
40.19.23.1^- and jesus said to the disciples of him, truly i say to you that a rich man with difficulty will enter into the kingdom of the heavens.
40.19.24.1^again now i say to you, easier for it is a camel through the eye of a needle to go, than a rich man to enter into the kingdom of god.
40.19.25.1^having heard now, the disciples were astonished exceedingly, saying, who then is able to be saved?
40.19.26.1^having looked on them now, - jesus said to them, with men this impossible is, with however god all things are possible.
40.19.27.1^then answering - peter said to him, behold, we left all things and followed you;
40.19.27.2^what then will be to us?
40.19.28.1^- and jesus said to them, truly i say to you that you - having followed me, in the regeneration, when shall sit down the son - of man upon the throne of glory of him, will sit also you on twelve thrones, judging the twelve tribes - of israel.
40.19.29.1^and everyone who has left houses, or brothers, or sisters, or father, or mother, or children, or lands, for the sake of - name, my a hundredfold will receive, and life eternal will inherit.
40.19.30.1^many however will be first last, and last first.
40.20.1.1^like for is the kingdom of the heavens to a man, a master of a house, who went out in the morning to hire workmen for the vineyard of him.
40.20.2.1^having agreed then with the workmen for a denarius for the day, he sent them into the vineyard of him.
40.20.3.1^and having gone out about the third hour, he saw others standing in the marketplace idle,
40.20.4.1^and to them he said, go also you into the vineyard, and whatever if might be right, i will give you.
40.20.5.1^- and they went.
40.20.5.2^again then having gone out about the sixth and ninth hour, he did likewise.
40.20.6.1^about then the eleventh, having gone out, he found others standing, and he says to them, why here stand you all the day idle?
40.20.7.1^they say to him, because no one us has hired.
40.20.7.2^he says to them, go also you into the vineyard.
40.20.8.1^evening then having arrived, says the master of the vineyard to foreman of him, call the workmen and pay them the wages, having begun from the last unto the first.
40.20.9.1^and having come those hired about the eleventh hour, they received each a denarius.
40.20.10.1^and having come the first, they thought that more they will receive, but they received those each a denarius also themselves.
40.20.11.1^having received, now they were grumbling against the master of the house,
40.20.12.1^saying, these the last, one hour have worked, and equal to us them you have made, those having borne the burden of the day and the scorching heat.
40.20.13.1^- and answering to one of them, he said, friend, not i do wrong you.
40.20.13.2^not for a denarius did you agree with me?
40.20.14.1^take what is yours and go.
40.20.14.2^i desire now to this - last to give, as also to you.
40.20.15.1^or not is it lawful for me what i will to do with that which is mine?
40.20.15.2^or the eye of you envious is, because i generous am?
40.20.16.1^thus will be the last first, and the first, last.
40.20.17.1^and going up - jesus to jerusalem, he took the twelve disciples aside themselves, and on the way he said to them,
40.20.18.1^behold, we go up to jerusalem, and the son - of man will be betrayed to the chief priests and scribes, and they will condemn him to death,
40.20.19.1^and they will betray him the gentiles unto, - to mock and to flog and to crucify;
40.20.19.2^and the third day he will rise again.
40.20.20.1^then came to him the mother of the sons of zebedee with the sons of her, kneeling down, and asking something from him.
40.20.21.1^- and he said to her, what do you desire?
40.20.21.2^she says to him, say that might sit these - two sons of mine, one on the right hand of you and one on the left hand of you, in the kingdom of you.
40.20.22.1^answering now, - jesus said, not you know what you ask for.
40.20.22.2^are you able to drink the cup which i am about to drink?
40.20.22.3^they say to him, we are able.
40.20.23.1^he says to them, - indeed the cup of me you will drink, - but to sit on the right hand of me and on the left, not is mine this to give, but to those for whom it has been prepared by the father of me.
40.20.24.1^and having heard this, the ten were indignant about the two brothers.
40.20.25.1^- and jesus, having called to him them, said, you know that the rulers of the gentiles exercise lordship over them, and the great ones exercise authority over them.
40.20.26.1^not thus will it be among you;
40.20.26.2^but whoever if wishes among you great to become, he will be your servant;
40.20.27.1^and whoever - wishes among you to be first, he will be your slave;
40.20.28.1^even as the son - of man not came to be served, but to serve, and to give the life of him as a ransom for many.
40.20.29.1^and as were going out they from jericho, followed him a crowd great.
40.20.30.1^and behold, two blind men sitting beside the road, having heard that jesus is passing by, cried out, saying, have mercy on us, lord, son of david.
40.20.31.1^- and the crowd rebuked them, that they should be silent.
40.20.31.2^- but all the more they cried out, saying, have mercy on us, lord, son of david.
40.20.32.1^and having stopped, - jesus called them and said, what do you desire i should do unto you?
40.20.33.1^they say to him, lord, that might be opened the eyes of us.
40.20.34.1^having been moved with compassion then, - jesus touched the eyes of them;
40.20.34.2^and immediately they received sight, and they followed him.
40.21.1.1^and when they drew near to jerusalem and came to bethphage on the mount - of olives, then jesus sent two disciples,
40.21.2.1^saying to them, go into the village - in front of you, and immediately you will find a donkey having been tied, and a colt with her;
40.21.2.2^having untied them, bring them to me.
40.21.3.1^and if anyone to you says anything, you will say that the lord of them need has.
40.21.3.2^immediately then he will send them.
40.21.4.1^this then came to pass that it might be fulfilled that having been spoken by the prophet, saying,
40.21.5.1^say to the daughter of zion, behold, the king of you comes to you, gentle and mounted on a donkey, even upon a colt, the foal of a beast of burden.
40.21.6.1^having gone then the disciples and having done as commanded them - jesus,
40.21.7.1^they brought the donkey and the colt, and put upon them their cloaks, and he sat on them.
40.21.8.1^the now very great crowd spread their the cloaks on the road;
40.21.8.2^others now were cutting down branches from the trees and were spreading them on the road.
40.21.9.1^the now crowds - going before him and those following were crying out, saying:
40.21.9.2^hosanna to the son of david!
40.21.9.3^blessed is the one coming in the name of the lord!
40.21.9.4^hosanna in the highest!
40.21.10.1^and having entered of him into jerusalem, was stirred all the city, saying, who is this?
40.21.11.1^- and the crowds were saying, this is the prophet, jesus, the one from nazareth - of galilee.
40.21.12.1^and entered jesus into the temple and cast out all those selling and buying in the temple, and the tables of the money changers he overturned, and the seats of those selling the doves.
40.21.13.1^and he says to them, it has been written:
40.21.13.2^the house of me a house of prayer will be called.
40.21.13.3^you however it have made a den of robbers.
40.21.14.1^and came to him blind and lame in the temple, and he healed them.
40.21.15.1^having seen now the chief priests and the scribes the wonders that he did and the children the crying out in the temple and saying, hosanna to the son of david, they were indignant
40.21.16.1^and said to him, hear you what these say?
40.21.16.2^- and jesus says to them, yes, never did you read -:
40.21.16.3^out of the mouth of babes and sucklings, you have prepared for yourself praise
40.21.17.1^and having left them, he went out of the city to bethany, and he passed the night there.
40.21.18.1^in the morning then, having come back into the city, he became hungry.
40.21.19.1^and having seen fig tree one along the road, he came to it and nothing found on it, if not leaves only.
40.21.19.2^and he says to it, no more from you fruit let there be, to the age.
40.21.19.3^and withered immediately the fig tree.
40.21.20.1^and having seen it, the disciples marveled, saying, how so quickly withered the fig tree?
40.21.21.1^answering now, - jesus said to them, truly i say to you, if you have faith and not do doubt, not only the miracle of the fig tree will you do, but even if to the mountain this you should say, be you taken away and be you cast into the sea, it will come to pass.
40.21.22.1^and all things as many as - you might ask in - prayer, believing, you will receive.
40.21.23.1^and having come of him into the temple, came to him teaching, the chief priests and the elders of the people, saying, by what authority these things are you doing?
40.21.23.2^and who to you gave the authority this?
40.21.24.1^answering now, - jesus said to them, will ask you i also thing one, which if you tell me, i also to you will say by what authority these things i do.
40.21.25.1^the baptism of john, from where was it?
40.21.25.2^from heaven, or from men?
40.21.25.3^- and they were reasoning with themselves, saying, if we should say, from heaven, he will say to us, because of why then not did you believe him?
40.21.26.1^if however we should say, from men, we fear the multitude;
40.21.26.2^all for as a prophet hold - john.
40.21.27.1^and answering - jesus, they said, not do we know.
40.21.27.2^said to them also he, neither i tell you by what authority these things i do.
40.21.28.1^what however you think?
40.21.28.2^a man had sons two, and having come to the first he said, son, go today, work in the vineyard.
40.21.29.1^- and answering he said, not will i.
40.21.29.2^afterward however, having repented, he went.
40.21.30.1^having come then to the other, he said likewise.
40.21.30.2^- and answering he said, i will sir, and not did he go.
40.21.31.1^which of the two did the will of the father?
40.21.31.2^they say, the first.
40.21.31.3^says to them - jesus, truly i say to you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes go before you into the kingdom - of god.
40.21.32.1^came for john to you in the way of righteousness, and not you did believe him, - however the tax collectors and the prostitutes believed him;
40.21.32.2^you then, having seen, not even did repent afterward - to believe him.
40.21.33.1^another parable hear:
40.21.33.2^a man there was, a master of a house, who planted a vineyard, and a fence it placed around, and dug in it a winepress, and built a tower, and rented out it to farmers, and traveled abroad.
40.21.34.1^when then drew near the season of the fruits, he sent the servants of him to the farmers to receive the fruits of him.
40.21.35.1^and having taken the farmers the servants of him, one - they beat, one then they killed, one then they stoned.
40.21.36.1^again he sent other servants, more than the first, and they did to them likewise.
40.21.37.1^afterward then, he sent to them the son of him, saying, they will respect the son of me.
40.21.38.1^- but the farmers having seen the son, said among themselves, this is the heir;
40.21.38.2^come, let us kill him and gain possession of the inheritance of him.
40.21.39.1^and having taking him, they cast him out of the vineyard and killed him.
40.21.40.1^when therefore shall come the master of the vineyard, what will he do the farmers to those?
40.21.41.1^they say to him, the wretches, grievously he will destroy them, and the vineyard he will rent out to other farmers, who will give to him the fruits in the seasons of them.
40.21.42.1^says to them - jesus, never did you read in the scriptures:
40.21.42.2^the stone which rejected those building, this has become the chief corner.
40.21.42.3^from the lord was this, and it is marvelous in the eyes of us?
40.21.43.1^because of this i say to you that will be taken away from you the kingdom - of god, and it will be given to a people producing the fruits of it.
40.21.44.1^and the one having fallen on the stone this will be broken;
40.21.44.2^on whomever but - it shall fall, it will grind to powder him.
40.21.45.1^and having heard the chief priests and the pharisees the parables of him, they knew that about them he speaks.
40.21.46.1^and seeking him to lay hold of, they feared the crowds, because as a prophet him they were holding.
40.22.1.1^and answering, - jesus again spoke in parables to them, saying,
40.22.2.1^has become like the kingdom of the heavens to a man, a king, who made a wedding feast for the son of him.
40.22.3.1^and he sent the servants of him to call those having been invited to the wedding feast, and not they were willing to come.
40.22.4.1^again he sent other servants, saying, say to those having been invited, behold, the dinner of me i have prepared, the oxen of me and the fatlings have been killed, and all things are ready;
40.22.4.2^come to the wedding feast.
40.22.5.1^- and having paid no attention they went away, one - to the own field, one then to the business of him.
40.22.6.1^- and the rest, having laid hold of the servants of him, mistreated and killed them.
40.22.7.1^- and the king was angry, and having sent the armies of him, he destroyed the murderers those, and the city of them he burned.
40.22.8.1^then he says to servants of him, the indeed wedding feast ready is;
40.22.8.2^those however having been invited not were worthy.
40.22.9.1^go therefore into the thoroughfares of the highways, and as many as if you shall find, invite to the wedding feast.
40.22.10.1^and having gone out the servants those into the highways, they brought together all as many as they found, evil both and good;
40.22.10.2^and became full the wedding hall of those reclining.
40.22.11.1^having entered in then the king to see those reclining, he beheld there a man not being dressed in clothes of wedding;
40.22.12.1^and he says to him, friend, how did you enter here not having garment of wedding?
40.22.12.2^- and he was speechless.
40.22.13.1^then the king said to the servants, having bound his feet and hands, cast out him into the darkness - outer;
40.22.13.2^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth.
40.22.14.1^many for are called, few however chosen.
40.22.15.1^then having gone out, the pharisees counsel took how him they might trap in his words.
40.22.16.1^and they send to him the disciples of them, with the herodians, saying, teacher, we know that true you are, and the way - of god in the truth you teach, and not there is care to you about no one, not for you look on the appearance of men.
40.22.17.1^tell therefore us what you think?
40.22.17.2^is it lawful to give tribute to caesar, or not?
40.22.18.1^having known however - jesus the malice of them, he said, why me do you test, hypocrites?
40.22.19.1^show me the coin of the tribute.
40.22.19.2^- and they presented to him a denarius.
40.22.20.1^and he says to them, whose is the likeness this?
40.22.20.2^and whose inscription?
40.22.21.1^they say to him caesar s.
40.22.21.2^then he says to them, give back therefore the things of caesar to caesar, and the things - of god - to god.
40.22.22.1^and having heard, they marveled;
40.22.22.2^and having left him, they went away.
40.22.23.1^on that - day came to him sadducees, those saying not there is a resurrection, and they questioned him,
40.22.24.1^saying, teacher, moses said, if anyone should die not having children, will marry the brother of him the wife of him, and he will raise up offspring for the brother of him.
40.22.25.1^there were now among us seven brothers;
40.22.25.2^and the first, having married, died, and not having seed, he left the wife of him to the brother of him.
40.22.26.1^likewise also the second, and the third, unto the seventh.
40.22.27.1^last then of all, died the woman.
40.22.28.1^in the resurrection, therefore, of which of the seven will she be wife?
40.22.28.2^all for had her.
40.22.29.1^answering now, - jesus said to them, you err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power - of god.
40.22.30.1^in for the resurrection, neither do they marry, nor are given in marriage, but like angels in - heaven they are.
40.22.31.1^concerning now the resurrection of the dead, not have you read that which has been spoken to you by - god, saying,
40.22.32.1^i am the god of abraham and the god of isaac and the god of jacob?
40.22.32.2^not he is the god of the dead, but of the living.
40.22.33.1^and having heard, the crowds were astonished at the teaching of him.
40.22.34.1^- and the pharisees, having heard that he had silenced the sadducees, were gathered together the same.
40.22.35.1^and questioned him one of them, a lawyer, testing him,
40.22.36.1^teacher, which commandment is the greatest in the law?
40.22.37.1^- and he said to him, you shall love the lord the god of you with all the heart of you, and with all the soul of you, and with all the mind of you.
40.22.38.1^this is the great and first commandment.
40.22.39.1^the second also is like it:
40.22.39.2^you shall love the neighbor of you as yourself.
40.22.40.1^on these - two commandments, all the law hangs and the prophets.
40.22.41.1^having been assembled together now the pharisees, questioned them - jesus,
40.22.42.1^saying, what you think concerning the christ?
40.22.42.2^of whom son is he?
40.22.42.3^they say to him, - of david.
40.22.43.1^he says to them, how then, david in spirit does call him lord, saying:
40.22.44.1^said the lord to the lord of me, sit on the right hand of me, until - i place the enemies of you as a footstool for the feet of you.
40.22.45.1^if therefore david calls him lord, how son of him is he?
40.22.46.1^and no one was able to answer him a word, nor dared anyone from that - day to question him no longer.
40.23.1.1^then - jesus spoke to the crowds and to disciples of him,
40.23.2.1^saying, on - moses  seat have sat down the scribes and the pharisees.
40.23.3.1^all things therefore, how many if they might tell you, keep and observe.
40.23.3.2^after however the works of them, not do.
40.23.3.3^they speak for, and not act.
40.23.4.1^they tie up - burdens heavy and hard to bear and lay them on the shoulders - of men;
40.23.4.2^themselves however, with finger of them, not are they willing to move them.
40.23.5.1^all now the deeds of them, they do in order - to be seen - by men.
40.23.5.2^they broaden for the phylacteries of them, and enlarge their tassels.
40.23.6.1^they love now the chief place at the banquets, and the first seats in the synagogues,
40.23.7.1^and the greetings in the marketplaces, and to be called by - men, rabbi.
40.23.8.1^you however not shall be called rabbi;
40.23.8.2^one for is of you the teacher, all now you brothers are.
40.23.9.1^and father no one call of you on the earth;
40.23.9.2^one for is of you the father, who is in heaven.
40.23.10.1^neither be called instructors, since the instructor of you is one, the christ.
40.23.11.1^- and the greatest among you will be your servant.
40.23.12.1^he who then shall exalt himself will be humbled, and whoever shall humble himself will be exalted.
40.23.13.1^woe however to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.13.2^for you shut up the kingdom of the heavens before - men;
40.23.13.3^you for neither enter, nor even those who are entering do you allow to go in.
40.23.15.1^woe to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.15.2^for you traverse the sea and the dry land to make one convert, and when he has become so, you make him a son of hell twofold more than yourselves.
40.23.16.1^woe to you, guides blind, those saying, whoever - shall swear by the temple, nothing it is;
40.23.16.2^whoever however - shall swear by the gold of the temple is bound by his oath.
40.23.17.1^foolish and blind!
40.23.17.2^which for greater is, the gold, or the temple - having sanctified the gold?
40.23.18.1^and you say, whoever - shall swear by the altar, nothing it is;
40.23.18.2^whoever however - shall swear by the gift that is upon it, he is bound by his oath.
40.23.19.1^you blind men!
40.23.19.2^which for is greater, the gift, or the altar - sanctifying the gift?
40.23.20.1^the one therefore having sworn by the altar swears by it and by all things that are upon it.
40.23.21.1^and the one having sworn by the temple swears by it and by the one dwelling in it.
40.23.22.1^and the one having sworn by - heaven swears by the throne - of god and by the one sitting upon it.
40.23.23.1^woe to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.23.2^for you pay tithes of - mint, and - dill, and - cumin;
40.23.23.3^and you have neglected the weightier matters of the law:
40.23.23.4^- justice and - mercy and - faithfulness.
40.23.23.5^these now it behooved you to do, those not to be leaving aside.
40.23.24.1^guides blind!
40.23.24.2^those straining out the gnat, the however camel swallowing!
40.23.25.1^woe to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.25.2^for you cleanse the outside of the cup and of the dish;
40.23.25.3^inside, however, they are full of greed and self-indulgence.
40.23.26.1^pharisee blind!
40.23.26.2^cleanse first the inside of the cup that might become also the outside of them clean.
40.23.27.1^woe to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.27.2^for you are like tombs having been whitewashed, which outwardly indeed appear beautiful.
40.23.27.3^inside however they are full of bones of the dead, and of all impurity.
40.23.28.1^thus also, you outwardly indeed appear - to men righteous, inwardly however you are full of hypocrisy and lawlessness.
40.23.29.1^woe to you, scribes and pharisees, hypocrites!
40.23.29.2^for you build the tombs of the prophets and adorn the monuments of the righteous;
40.23.30.1^and you say, if we had lived in the days of the fathers of us, not - we would have been with them partakers in the blood of the prophets.
40.23.31.1^thus you bear witness to yourselves that sons you are of those having murdered the prophets.
40.23.32.1^and you, fill up the measure of the fathers of you.
40.23.33.1^serpents!
40.23.33.2^offspring of vipers!
40.23.33.3^how shall you escape from the sentence - of hell?
40.23.34.1^because of this, behold, i send to you prophets and wise men and scribes.
40.23.34.2^some of them you will kill and will crucify, and some of them you will flog in the synagogues of you, and will persecute from town to town;
40.23.35.1^so that shall come upon you all the blood righteous being poured out upon the earth, from the blood of abel the righteous, to the blood of zechariah son of berekiah, whom you murdered between the temple and the altar.
40.23.36.1^truly i say to you, will come these things all upon the generation this.
40.23.37.1^jerusalem, jerusalem, - killing the prophets and stoning those having been sent to her!
40.23.37.2^how often would i have gathered together the children of you, in which way a hen gathers together the chicks of her under the wings, and not you were willing!
40.23.38.1^behold, is left to you the house of you desolate!
40.23.39.1^i say for to you, no not me shall you see from now until - you say, blessed is the one coming in the name of the lord.
40.24.1.1^and having gone forth - jesus from the temple, he was going away, and came to him the disciples of him to point out to him the buildings of the temple.
40.24.2.1^- and answering, he said to them, not do you see these things all?
40.24.2.2^truly i say to you, none not even shall be left here stone upon stone, which not will be thrown down.
40.24.3.1^as was sitting now he upon the mount - of olives, came to him the disciples in private, saying, tell us, when these things will be?
40.24.3.2^and what is the sign - of your coming and of the consummation of the age?
40.24.4.1^and answering, - jesus said to them, take heed, lest anyone you mislead.
40.24.5.1^many for will come in the name of me, saying, i am the christ, and many they will mislead.
40.24.6.1^you will begin then to hear of wars and rumors of wars.
40.24.6.2^behold, not be alarmed;
40.24.6.3^it is necessary for to take place, but not yet is the end.
40.24.7.1^will rise up for nation against nation, and kingdom against kingdom;
40.24.7.2^and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places.
40.24.8.1^all then these are the beginning of birth pains.
40.24.9.1^then will they deliver you to tribulation, and will kill you, and you will be hated by all the nations on account of the name of me.
40.24.10.1^and then will fall away many, and one another they will betray, and will hate one another;
40.24.11.1^and many false prophets will arise and will mislead many.
40.24.12.1^and because - is to be multiplied - lawlessness, will grow cold the love of the many.
40.24.13.1^the one however having endured to the end, he will be saved.
40.24.14.1^and there will be proclaimed this - gospel of the kingdom in all the earth, for a testimony to all the nations;
40.24.14.2^and then will come the end.
40.24.15.1^when therefore you shall see the abomination - of desolation,  - having been spoken of by daniel the prophet, standing in the place holy   the one reading let him understand
40.24.16.1^then those in - judea, let them flee to the mountains;
40.24.17.1^the one on the housetop, not let him come down to take anything out of the house of him;
40.24.18.1^and the one in the field, neither let him return back to take the cloak of him.
40.24.19.1^woe then to those in womb having, and to the ones nursing infants in those the days.
40.24.20.1^pray however that not might be the flight of you in winter, nor on a sabbath.
40.24.21.1^there will be for then tribulation great, such as not has been from the beginning of the world until - now, no never not shall be.
40.24.22.1^and if not had been shortened the days those, not - there would have been saved any flesh;
40.24.22.2^because of however the elect, will be shortened the days those.
40.24.23.1^then if anyone to you says, behold, here is the christ, or here, not believe it.
40.24.24.1^there will arise for false christs and false prophets, and they will give signs great, and wonders, so as to mislead, if possible, even the elect.
40.24.25.1^behold, i have foretold it to you.
40.24.26.1^if therefore they say to you, behold, in the wilderness he is, not go forth;
40.24.26.2^or  behold, in the inner rooms, not believe it.
40.24.27.1^just as for the lightning comes forth from the east and shines as far as the west, so will be the coming of the son - of man.
40.24.28.1^for wherever if may be the carcass, there will be gathered the vultures.
40.24.29.1^immediately then after the tribulation the days of those:
40.24.29.2^the sun will be darkened, and the moon not will give the light of it, and the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
40.24.30.1^and then will appear the sign of the son - of man in heaven, and then will mourn all the tribes of the earth, and they will see the son - of man coming on the clouds - of heaven with power and glory great.
40.24.31.1^and he will send the angels of him with a trumpet call great, and they will gather together the elect of him, from the four winds, from the ends of the heavens to the ends of them.
40.24.32.1^of now the fig tree learn the parable:
40.24.32.2^when already the branch of it may have become tender and the leaves it puts forth, you know that near is the summer.
40.24.33.1^thus also you, when you see all these things, know that near he is, at the doors.
40.24.34.1^truly i say to you that no not will have passed away the generation this until - all these things shall have taken place.
40.24.35.1^the heaven and the earth will pass away, - but the words of me no not shall pass away.
40.24.36.1^concerning however the day that and hour, no one knows, not even the angels of the heavens, nor the son, if not the father only.
40.24.37.1^as were for the days - of noah, so will be the coming of the son - of man.
40.24.38.1^as for they were in the days those - before the flood, eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until that day entered noah into the ark.
40.24.39.1^and not they knew, until came the flood and took away all;
40.24.39.2^thus will be also the coming of the son - of man.
40.24.40.1^then two will be in the field:
40.24.40.2^one is taken, and one is left.
40.24.41.1^two women will be grinding at the mill:
40.24.41.2^one is taken, and one is left.
40.24.42.1^keep watch therefore, for not you know on what day the lord of you comes.
40.24.43.1^this then know, that if had known the master of the house in what time of night the thief comes, he would have watched - and not - have allowed to be broken into the house of him.
40.24.44.1^because of this also, you be ready, for in that not you expect hour, the son - of man comes.
40.24.45.1^who then is the faithful servant, and wise, whom has set the master over the household of him, - to give to them the food in season?
40.24.46.1^blessed is the servant that, whom having come, the master of him will find thus doing.
40.24.47.1^truly i say to you that over all the possessing of him he will set him.
40.24.48.1^if however should say the evil servant that in the heart of him, delays of me the master,
40.24.49.1^and should begin to beat the fellow servants of him, to eat then and to drink with those being drunkards,
40.24.50.1^will come the master the servant of that in a day in which not he does expect, and in an hour which not he is aware,
40.24.51.1^and will cut in pieces him, and the place of him with the hypocrites will appoint;
40.24.51.2^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
40.25.1.1^then will be likened the kingdom of the heavens to ten virgins, who having taken the lamps of them, went forth to meet the bridegroom.
40.25.2.1^five now of them were foolish, and five wise.
40.25.3.1^the for foolish, having taken the lamps of them, not did take with them oil;
40.25.4.1^- but the wise took oil in the vessels, with the lamps of them.
40.25.5.1^tarrying then the bridegroom, they became drowsy all and were sleeping.
40.25.6.1^at middle then of the night, a cry there was:
40.25.6.2^behold, the bridegroom!
40.25.6.3^go forth to meet him!
40.25.7.1^then arose all the virgins those and trimmed the lamps of them.
40.25.8.1^- and the foolish to the wise said, give us of the oil of you, for the lamps of us are going out.
40.25.9.1^answered then the wise, saying, lest no not even it might suffice for us and you.
40.25.9.2^go rather to those selling, and buy for yourselves.
40.25.10.1^while are going away then they to buy, came the bridegroom, and those ready went in with him to the wedding feast;
40.25.10.2^and was shut the door.
40.25.11.1^afterward then come also the other virgins, saying, lord, lord, open to us!
40.25.12.1^- and answering he said, truly i say to you, not i do know you.
40.25.13.1^watch therefore, for neither do you know the day, nor the hour.
40.25.14.1^it is like for a man going on a journey who called the own servants, and delivered to them the possessing of him.
40.25.15.1^and to one indeed he gave five talents, to one then two, to one then one, to each according to the own ability;
40.25.15.2^and he left the region immediately.
40.25.16.1^having gone, the one the five talents having received traded with them and made more five.
40.25.17.1^likewise, the one with the two gained more two.
40.25.18.1^the one however - one having received, having gone away, dug in the ground and hid the money of the master of him.
40.25.19.1^after then much time, comes the master of the servants those and takes account with them.
40.25.20.1^and having come, the one the five talents having received brought to him other five talents, saying, master, five talents to me you did deliver.
40.25.20.2^behold, more five talents have i gained.
40.25.21.1^said to him the master of him, well done, servant good and faithful!
40.25.21.2^over a few things you were faithful;
40.25.21.3^over many things you will i set.
40.25.21.4^enter into the joy of the master of you!
40.25.22.1^having come then also the one with the two talents, he said, master, two talents to me you did deliver.
40.25.22.2^behold, more two talents have i gained.
40.25.23.1^said to him the master of him, well done, servant good and faithful!
40.25.23.2^over a few things you were faithful;
40.25.23.3^over many things you will i set.
40.25.23.4^enter into the joy of the master of you!
40.25.24.1^having come then also the one the one talent having received, he said, master, i knew you, that hard you are a man, reaping where not you did sow, and gathering from where not you did scatter.
40.25.25.1^and having been afraid, having gone away, i hid the talent of you in the ground.
40.25.25.2^behold, you have what is yours.
40.25.26.1^answering now, the master of him said to him, wicked servant and lazy!
40.25.26.2^you knew that i reap where not i sowed, and gather from where not i scattered.
40.25.27.1^it behooved you therefore to put the money of me to the bankers, and having come, i would have received - - my own with interest.
40.25.28.1^take therefore from him the talent, and give it to the one having the ten talents.
40.25.29.1^- for having, to everyone will be given, and he will have in abundance;
40.25.29.2^the one however not having, even that which he has will be taken away from him.
40.25.30.1^and the worthless servant, cast out into the darkness - outer;
40.25.30.2^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth.
40.25.31.1^when then comes the son - of man in the glory of him, and all the angels with him, then he will sit upon the throne of glory of him.
40.25.32.1^and will be gathered before him all the nations, and he will separate them from one another, as the shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
40.25.33.1^and he will set - indeed the sheep on the right hand of him, - and the goats on the left.
40.25.34.1^then will say the king to those on the right hand of him, come, those being blessed of the father of me, inherit the having been prepared for you kingdom from the foundation of the world.
40.25.35.1^i hungered for, and you gave me to eat;
40.25.35.2^i thirsted, and you gave to drink me;
40.25.35.3^a stranger i was, and you took in me;
40.25.36.1^naked, and you clothed me;
40.25.36.2^i was sick, and you visited me;
40.25.36.3^in prison i was, and you came to me.
40.25.37.1^then will answer him the righteous, saying, lord, when you saw we hungering, and fed you?
40.25.37.2^or thirsting, and gave you to drink?
40.25.38.1^when now you saw we a stranger, and took you in?
40.25.38.2^or naked, and clothed you?
40.25.39.1^when now you saw we ailing or in prison, and came to you?
40.25.40.1^and answering, the king will say to them, truly i say to you, to the extent as much as you did it to one of these the brothers of me the least, to me you did it.
40.25.41.1^then will he say also to those on the left, depart from me, those being cursed, into the fire - eternal, - having been prepared for the devil and the angels of him.
40.25.42.1^i hungered for, and nothing you gave to me to eat;
40.25.42.2^i thirsted, and nothing you gave to drink me;
40.25.43.1^a stranger i was, and not you took in me;
40.25.43.2^naked, and not you did clothe me;
40.25.43.3^sick and in prison, and not did you visit me.
40.25.44.1^then will answer also themselves, saying, lord, when you saw we hungering, or thirsting, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and not did minister to you?
40.25.45.1^then will he answer them, saying, truly i say to you, to the extent that not you did it to one of these the least, neither to me did you.
40.25.46.1^and will go away these into punishment eternal;
40.25.46.2^- but the righteous into life eternal.
40.26.1.1^and it came to pass, when had finished - jesus all the words these, he said to the disciples of him,
40.26.2.1^you know that after two days the passover takes place, and the son - of man is delivered over - to be crucified.
40.26.3.1^then were gathered together the chief priests and the elders of the people in the courtyard of the high priest, who is called caiaphas,
40.26.4.1^and they plotted together, in order that - jesus by guile they might seize and kill.
40.26.5.1^they were saying however, not during the feast, that not a riot there be among the people.
40.26.6.1^- and of jesus having been in bethany in the house of simon the leper,
40.26.7.1^came to him a woman, having an alabaster flask fragrant oil very costly, and poured it on the head of him as he is reclining.
40.26.8.1^having seen then, the disciples became indignant, saying, for what purpose is the waste this?
40.26.9.1^could for this have been sold for much, and have been given to the poor.
40.26.10.1^having known this now, - jesus said to them, why trouble do you cause to the woman?
40.26.10.2^a work for beautiful she did to me.
40.26.11.1^always for the poor you have with you;
40.26.11.2^me however not always you have.
40.26.12.1^in pouring for this woman the fragrant oil this on the body of me, for the burial of me she did it.
40.26.13.1^truly i say to you, wherever if shall be proclaimed the gospel this in all the world, will be spoken of also that which did this woman, for a memorial of her.
40.26.14.1^then having gone one of the twelve, the one being called judas iscariot, to the chief priests,
40.26.15.1^he said, what are you willing me to give, and i to you will betray him?
40.26.15.2^- and they appointed to him thirty pieces of silver.
40.26.16.1^and from that time, he was seeking an opportunity that him he might betray.
40.26.17.1^on the now first day of the unleavened bread, came the disciples - to jesus, saying, where wish you that we should prepare for you to eat the passover?
40.26.18.1^- and he said, go into the city unto a certain man and tell him the teacher says, the time of me near is;
40.26.18.2^with you i will keep the passover, with the disciples of me.
40.26.19.1^and did the disciples as directed them - jesus, and prepared the passover.
40.26.20.1^evening now having arrived, he was reclining with the twelve.
40.26.21.1^and as they were eating, to them he said, truly i say to you that one of you will betray me.
40.26.22.1^and being grieved exceedingly, they began to say to him, one each, not i is it, lord?
40.26.23.1^- and answering he said, the one having dipped with me the hand in the dish, he me will betray.
40.26.24.1^- indeed the son - of man goes as it has been written about him;
40.26.24.2^woe however - the man to that by whom the son - of man is betrayed.
40.26.24.3^better would it be for him if not had been born the man that.
40.26.25.1^answering now judas, who was betraying him, said, not i is it, rabbi?
40.26.25.2^he says to him, you have said.
40.26.26.1^as they were eating now of them, having taken - jesus bread, and having blessed, broke it, and having given to the disciples, he said, take, eat;
40.26.26.2^this is the body of me.
40.26.27.1^and having taken a cup and having given thanks, he gave it to them, saying, drink of it, all of you.
40.26.28.1^this for is the blood of me, of the covenant, - for many being poured out for forgiveness of sins.
40.26.29.1^i say now to you, no not will i drink, from now, of this the fruit of the vine, until the day that, when it i drink with you anew in the kingdom of the father of me.
40.26.30.1^and having sung a hymn, they went out to the mount - of olives.
40.26.31.1^then says to them - jesus, all you will fall away because of me during the night this.
40.26.31.2^it has been written for:
40.26.31.3^i will strike the shepherd, and will be scattered the sheep of the flock.
40.26.32.1^after however - being raised, i will go before you into - galilee.
40.26.33.1^answering now, - peter said to him, if all will fall away because of you, i never will fall away.
40.26.34.1^said to him - jesus, truly i say to you that during this - night, before the rooster crowing, three times you will deny me.
40.26.35.1^says to him - peter, even if it were necessary for me with you to die, no not you will i deny.
40.26.35.2^likewise also, all the disciples said.
40.26.36.1^then comes with them - jesus to a place called gethsemane, and he says to the disciples, sit here, until that having gone away over there, i shall pray.
40.26.37.1^and having taken with him - peter and the two sons of zebedee, he began to be sorrowful and deeply distressed.
40.26.38.1^then he says to them, very sorrowful is the soul of me, even to death;
40.26.38.2^remain here and watch with me.
40.26.39.1^and having gone forward a little, he fell upon face of him, praying, and saying, father of me, if possible it is, let pass from me the cup this.
40.26.39.2^nevertheless not as i will, but as you.
40.26.40.1^and he comes to the disciples and finds them sleeping.
40.26.40.2^and he says - to peter, thus not were you able one hour to watch with me?
40.26.41.1^watch and pray, that not you enter into temptation.
40.26.41.2^the indeed spirit is willing, - but the flesh weak.
40.26.42.1^again for a second time having gone away, he prayed, saying, father of me, if not is possible this to pass if not it i drink, be done the will of you.
40.26.43.1^and having come again, he finds them sleeping, were for of them the eyes heavy.
40.26.44.1^and having left them again, having gone away, he prayed for the third time, the same thing having said again.
40.26.45.1^then he comes to the disciples and says to them, sleep - later on and take your rest.
40.26.45.2^behold, has drawn near the hour, and the son - of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
40.26.46.1^rise up, let us go!
40.26.46.2^behold, has drawn near he who is betraying me!
40.26.47.1^and yet of him as he is speaking, behold, judas, one of the twelve, came, and with him a crowd great, with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and elders of the people.
40.26.48.1^the one then betraying him gave them a sign, saying, whomever - i shall kiss, he it is;
40.26.48.2^seize him.
40.26.49.1^and immediately having come up - to jesus, he said, greetings, rabbi, and kissed him.
40.26.50.1^- and jesus said to him, friend, for what are you come?
40.26.50.2^then having come to him, they laid - hands on - jesus and seized him.
40.26.51.1^and behold, one of those with jesus, having stretched out the hand, drew the sword of him, and having struck the servant of the high priest, cut off of him the ear.
40.26.52.1^then says to him - jesus, return the sword of you into the place of it;
40.26.52.2^all for those having taken the sword, by the sword will perish.
40.26.53.1^or think you that not i am able to call upon the father of me, and he will furnish to me presently more than twelve legions of angels?
40.26.54.1^how then should be fulfilled the scriptures, that so it must be?
40.26.55.1^in that - hour, said - jesus to the crowds, as against a robber did you come out with swords and clubs to capture me?
40.26.55.2^every day in the temple i was sitting teaching, and not you did seize me.
40.26.56.1^this then all is come to pass, that might be fulfilled the scriptures of the prophets.
40.26.56.2^then the disciples all, having forsaken him, fled.
40.26.57.1^those then having seized - jesus led him away to caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were assembled.
40.26.58.1^- and peter was following him from afar, even to the court of the high priest.
40.26.58.2^and having entered within, he was sitting with the guards to see the outcome.
40.26.59.1^- and the chief priests and the council whole were seeking false testimony against - jesus, so that him they might put to death;
40.26.60.1^but not any they found, of many having come forward as false witnesses.
40.26.60.2^at last then, having come forward two,
40.26.61.1^they said, this man has been saying, i am able to destroy the temple - of god, and in three days to rebuild it.
40.26.62.1^and having stood up, the high priest said to him, nothing answer you?
40.26.62.2^what these you do witness against?
40.26.63.1^- and jesus was silent.
40.26.63.2^and the high priest said to him, i adjure you by - god the living, that us you tell if you are the christ, the son - of god.
40.26.64.1^says to him - jesus, you have said.
40.26.64.2^but i say to you, from now you will see the son - of man sitting at the right hand - of power and coming upon the clouds - of heaven.
40.26.65.1^then the high priest tears the garments of him, saying, he has blasphemed;
40.26.65.2^why any more need have we of witnesses?
40.26.65.3^behold now, you have heard the blasphemy.
40.26.66.1^what you do think?
40.26.66.2^- and answering they said, deserving of death he is.
40.26.67.1^then they spat in the face of him, and struck him.
40.26.67.2^others then slapped him,
40.26.68.1^saying, prophesy to us, christ, who is the one having struck you?
40.26.69.1^- and peter was sitting outside in the court, and came to him one servant girl, saying, also you were with jesus the galilean.
40.26.70.1^- and he denied before all, saying, not i know what you say.
40.26.71.1^having gone out then to the porch, saw him another servant girl, and says to those there, this man was with jesus of nazareth.
40.26.72.1^and again he denied with an oath -, not i know the man.
40.26.73.1^after a little while, also having come to him those standing by, they said - to peter, surely also you of them are, even for the speech of you away you gives.
40.26.74.1^then he began to curse and to swear -, not i know the man!
40.26.74.2^and immediately a rooster crowed.
40.26.75.1^and remembered - peter the word of jesus, he having said -, before the rooster crowing, three times you will deny me.
40.26.75.2^and having gone out, he wept bitterly.
40.27.1.1^morning then having arrived, counsel took all the chief priests and the elders of the people against - jesus, so that they might put to death him.
40.27.2.1^and having bound him, they led away him and delivered him to pilate, the governor.
40.27.3.1^then having seen judas, the one having delivered up him, that he was condemned, having regretted it, he returned the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,
40.27.4.1^saying, i sinned, having betrayed blood innocent.
40.27.4.2^- then they said, what is that to us?
40.27.4.3^you will see.
40.27.5.1^and having cast down the pieces of silver into the temple, he withdrew, and having gone away, hanged himself.
40.27.6.1^- and the chief priests, having taken the pieces of silver, said, not it is lawful to put them into the treasury, since the price of blood it is.
40.27.7.1^counsel then having taken, they bought with them the field of the potter, for a burial place for the strangers.
40.27.8.1^therefore was called the field that, field of blood, to - this day.
40.27.9.1^then was fulfilled that having been spoken by jeremiah the prophet, saying, and they took the thirty pieces of silver, the price of the one having been priced, whom they set a price on by the sons of israel,
40.27.10.1^and they gave them for the field of the potter, as directed me the lord.
40.27.11.1^- and jesus stood before the governor;
40.27.11.2^and questioned him the governor, saying, you are the king of the jews?
40.27.11.3^- and jesus said, you say.
40.27.12.1^and in - being accused his by the chief priests and elders, nothing he answered.
40.27.13.1^then says to him - pilate, not do you hear how many things you they witness against?
40.27.14.1^and not he did answer him, to not even one word, so as to amaze the governor exceedingly.
40.27.15.1^at now the feast, was accustomed the governor to release one to the multitude prisoner, whom they were wishing.
40.27.16.1^they were holding now at that time a prisoner notable, called jesus barabbas.
40.27.17.1^being gathered together therefore of them, said to them - pilate, whom will you that i shall release to you?
40.27.17.2^jesus - barabbas, or jesus, who is called christ?
40.27.18.1^he knew for that through envy they delivered up him.
40.27.19.1^as was sitting now he on the judgment seat, sent to him the wife of him, saying, let there be nothing between you and the righteous man that;
40.27.19.2^many things for i suffered today in a dream because of him.
40.27.20.1^- and the chief priests and the elders persuaded the crowds that they should ask for - barabbas, - and jesus should destroy.
40.27.21.1^answering now, the governor said to them, which do you desire of the two, i release to you?
40.27.21.2^- and they said, - barabbas.
40.27.22.1^says to them - pilate, what then should i do with jesus, who is called christ?
40.27.22.2^they say all, let him be crucified.
40.27.23.1^- and he said, what for evil did he commit?
40.27.23.2^- and all the more they kept crying out, saying, let him be crucified.
40.27.24.1^having seen now - pilate that nothing it availed, but rather a riot is arising, having taken water, he washed the hands before the crowd, saying, guiltless i am of the blood of this.
40.27.24.2^for yourselves you will see.
40.27.25.1^and answering, all the people said, the blood of him be on us, and on the children of us.
40.27.26.1^then he released to them - barabbas;
40.27.26.2^- and jesus having flogged, he delivered up him, that he might be crucified.
40.27.27.1^then the soldiers of the governor, having taken with them - jesus to the praetorium, gathered before him all the cohort.
40.27.28.1^and having stripped him, a robe scarlet they put around him.
40.27.29.1^and having twisted together a crown of thorns, they put it on the head of him, and a reed in the right hand of him;
40.27.29.2^and having bowed the knees before him, they mocked him, saying, hail, king of the jews!
40.27.30.1^and having spit upon him, they took the reed and kept striking him on the head of him.
40.27.31.1^and when they had mocked him, they took off him the robe, and they put on him the garments of him and led away him to - crucify him.
40.27.32.1^going forth now, they found a man of cyrene, named simon.
40.27.32.2^him they compelled that he might carry the cross of him.
40.27.33.1^and having come to a place called golgotha, which is of a skull place called,
40.27.34.1^they gave him to drink wine with gall mingled;
40.27.34.2^and having tasted, not he was willing to drink it.
40.27.35.1^having crucified now him, they divided the garments of him, casting lots.
40.27.36.1^and sitting down, they were guarding him there.
40.27.37.1^and they put up over the head of him the accusation of him written:
40.27.37.2^this is jesus, the king of the jews.
40.27.38.1^at the same time are crucified with him two robbers, one at the right hand, and one at the left.
40.27.39.1^those now passing by kept railing at him, wagging the heads of them
40.27.40.1^and saying, the one destroying the temple and in three days building it, save yourself!
40.27.40.2^if the son you are - of god, also descend from the cross!
40.27.41.1^likewise also the chief priests, mocking, with the scribes and elders, were saying,
40.27.42.1^others he saved.
40.27.42.2^himself not is he able to save.
40.27.42.3^king of israel he is.
40.27.42.4^let him descend now from the cross, and we will believe in him.
40.27.43.1^he trusted on - god.
40.27.43.2^let him deliver now if he wants him.
40.27.43.3^he said for -, of god i am the son.
40.27.44.1^- and likewise even the robbers, those having been crucified with him, were upbraiding him.
40.27.45.1^from then the sixth hour, darkness was over all the land, until the hour ninth.
40.27.46.1^about then the ninth hour, cried out - jesus in a voice loud, saying, eli, eli, lema sabachthani?
40.27.46.2^that is, god of me, god of me, so that why me have you forsaken?
40.27.47.1^some then of those who there were standing, having heard, began saying -, elijah calls this man.
40.27.48.1^and immediately, having run one of them and having taken a sponge, having filled it and with vinegar and having put it on a reed, gave to drink him.
40.27.49.1^- and the rest were saying, let be.
40.27.49.2^let us see whether comes elijah to save him.
40.27.50.1^- and jesus again, having cried in a voice loud, yielded up his spirit.
40.27.51.1^and behold, the veil of the temple was torn from top to bottom, into two;
40.27.51.2^and the earth was shaken, and the rocks were split,
40.27.52.1^and the tombs were opened, and many bodies of the having fallen asleep saints arose,
40.27.53.1^and having gone forth out of the tombs after the resurrection of him, they entered into the holy city and appeared to many.
40.27.54.1^- and the centurion and those with him keeping guard over - jesus, having seen the earthquake and the things taking place, feared greatly, saying, truly god s son was this.
40.27.55.1^they were now there women many from afar off, looking on, who followed - jesus from - galilee, ministering to him,
40.27.56.1^among whom was mary - magdalene, and mary the - of james and joseph mother, and the mother of the sons of zebedee.
40.27.57.1^evening now having arrived, came a man rich from arimathea, named joseph, who also himself was discipled - to jesus.
40.27.58.1^he having gone - to pilate, asked for the body - of jesus.
40.27.58.2^then - pilate commanded it to be given up.
40.27.59.1^and having taken the body, - joseph wrapped it in a linen cloth clean
40.27.60.1^and placed it in the new of him tomb, which he had cut in the rock;
40.27.60.2^and having rolled a stone great to the door of the tomb, he went away.
40.27.61.1^was now there mary - magdalene, and the other mary, sitting opposite the tomb.
40.27.62.1^- and the next day, which is after the preparation, were gathered together the chief priests and the pharisees before pilate,
40.27.63.1^saying, sir, we have remembered how that - deceiver said while living, after three days i arise.
40.27.64.1^command therefore to be secured the tomb until the third day, lest ever having come, the disciples of him steal away him and say to the people, he is risen from the dead.
40.27.64.2^and will be the last deception worse than the first.
40.27.65.1^said to them - pilate, you have a guard.
40.27.65.2^go make it as secure as you know how.
40.27.66.1^- and having gone, they made secure the tomb, having sealed the stone, with the guard.
40.28.1.1^after then the sabbaths, it being dawn toward the first day of the week, came mary - magdalene and the other mary, to see the tomb.
40.28.2.1^and behold, an earthquake there was great;
40.28.2.2^an angel for of the lord, having descended out of heaven, and having come, rolled away the stone and was sitting upon it.
40.28.3.1^was now the appearance of him like lightning, and the clothing of him white as snow.
40.28.4.1^from now the fear of him trembled those keeping guard and became as dead men.
40.28.5.1^answering now, the angel said to the women, not fear you;
40.28.5.2^i know for that jesus, the one having been crucified, you seek.
40.28.6.1^not he is here;
40.28.6.2^he is risen for, as he said.
40.28.6.3^come, see the place where he was lying.
40.28.7.1^and quickly having gone, say to the disciples of him that he is risen from the dead and behold, he goes before you into - galilee;
40.28.7.2^there him you will see.
40.28.7.3^behold, i have told you.
40.28.8.1^and having gone out quickly from the tomb with fear and joy great, they ran to tell the disciples of him.
40.28.9.1^and behold, jesus met them, saying, greetings!
40.28.9.2^- and having come to him, they took hold of his - feet and worshiped him.
40.28.10.1^then says to them - jesus, not fear.
40.28.10.2^go, tell the brothers, of me so that they should go into - galilee, and there me will they see.
40.28.11.1^as were going now they, behold, some of the guard, having gone into the city, reported to the chief priests all the things having been done.
40.28.12.1^and having been gathered together with the elders, counsel then having taken, silver pieces many they gave to the soldiers,
40.28.13.1^saying, say that the disciples of him, by night having come, stole him, we being asleep.
40.28.14.1^and if is heard this by the governor, we will persuade him, and you out of trouble will keep.
40.28.15.1^- and having taken the money, they did as they were instructed.
40.28.15.2^and is spread abroad the report this among the jews, until the present day.
40.28.16.1^- and the eleven disciples went into - galilee, to the mountain where assigned them - jesus.
40.28.17.1^and having seen him they worshiped;
40.28.17.2^some however doubted.
40.28.18.1^and having come to them, - jesus spoke to them, saying, has been given to me all authority in heaven and on the earth.
40.28.19.1^having gone therefore, disciple all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the father, and of the son, and of the holy spirit,
40.28.20.1^teaching them to observe all things, whatever i commanded you.
40.28.20.2^and behold, i with you am all the days, until the completion of the age.
41.1.1.1^the beginning of the gospel of jesus christ, son of god.
41.1.2.1^as it has been written in - isaiah the prophet:
41.1.2.2^behold, i send the messenger of me before face of you, who will prepare the way of you.
41.1.3.1^the voice of one crying in the wilderness, prepare the way of the lord, straight make the paths of him.
41.1.4.1^came john, - baptizing in the wilderness and proclaiming a baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins.
41.1.5.1^and were going out to him all the of judea region, and - of jerusalem, all and were being baptized by him in the jordan river, confessing the sins of them.
41.1.6.1^and was - john clothed in hair of a camel, and a belt of leather around the waist of him;
41.1.6.2^and he is eating locusts and honey wild.
41.1.7.1^and he was preaching, saying, he comes who is mightier than i after me, of whom not i am sufficient, having stooped down, to untie the strap of the sandals of him.
41.1.8.1^i baptized you with water;
41.1.8.2^he however will baptize you with the spirit holy.
41.1.9.1^and it came to pass in those - days, that came jesus from nazareth - of galilee, and was baptized in the jordan by john.
41.1.10.1^and immediately going up from the water, he saw tearing open the heavens, and the spirit as a dove descending upon him.
41.1.11.1^and a voice came out of the heavens:
41.1.11.2^you are the son of me, the beloved, in you i am well pleased.
41.1.12.1^and immediately the spirit him drives out into the wilderness.
41.1.13.1^and he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by - satan.
41.1.13.2^and he was with the wild animals;
41.1.13.3^and the angels were ministering to him.
41.1.14.1^after and the delivering up - of john, came - jesus into - galilee, proclaiming the gospel - of god
41.1.15.1^and saying -, has been fulfilled the time, and has drawn near the kingdom - of god;
41.1.15.2^repent and believe in the gospel.
41.1.16.1^and passing by the sea - of galilee, he saw simon and andrew, the brother of simon, casting a net into the sea;
41.1.16.2^they were for fishermen.
41.1.17.1^and said to them - jesus, come after me, and i will make you to become fishers of men.
41.1.18.1^and immediately, having left the nets, they followed him.
41.1.19.1^and having gone on a little, he saw james the son - of zebedee, and john the brother of him, and they were in the boat adjusting the nets.
41.1.20.1^and immediately he called them;
41.1.20.2^and having left the father of them zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, they went away after him.
41.1.21.1^and they go into capernaum;
41.1.21.2^and immediately on the sabbaths, having entered into the synagogue, he was teaching.
41.1.22.1^and they were astonished at the teaching of him;
41.1.22.2^he was for teaching them as authority having, and not as the scribes.
41.1.23.1^and immediately there was in the synagogue of them a man with a spirit unclean, and he cried out,
41.1.24.1^saying, what to us and to you, jesus of nazareth?
41.1.24.2^did you come to destroy us?
41.1.24.3^i know you who are, the holy one - of god!
41.1.25.1^and rebuked him - jesus, saying be silent, and come forth out of him!
41.1.26.1^and having thrown into convulsions him the spirit - unclean, and having cried in a voice loud, it came forth out of him.
41.1.27.1^and were astonished all, so as to question among themselves, saying, what is this teaching new?
41.1.27.2^with authority, even the spirits - unclean he commands, and they obey him!
41.1.28.1^and went out the news of him immediately, everywhere into all the surrounding region - of galilee.
41.1.29.1^and immediately, out of the synagogue having gone forth, they came into the house of simon and andrew, with james and john.
41.1.30.1^- and the mother-in-law of simon was laying sick fevering.
41.1.30.2^and immediately they speak to him about her.
41.1.31.1^and having come to her, he raised up her, having taken hold of the hand.
41.1.31.2^and left her the fever, and she began to minister to them.
41.1.32.1^evening now having come, when went down the sun, they began bringing to him all those sick being, and those being possessed by demons.
41.1.33.1^and was all the city gathered together at the door.
41.1.34.1^and he healed many sick being of various diseases, and demons many he cast out.
41.1.34.2^and not he would allow to speak the demons, because they knew him.
41.1.35.1^and very early, in night still much, having risen up, he went out and departed into solitary a place, and there he was praying.
41.1.36.1^and went after him simon and those with him,
41.1.37.1^and having found him, also they say to him -, everyone seeks you!
41.1.38.1^and he says to them, let us go another way into the neighboring towns, so that also there i might preach;
41.1.38.2^for this therefore have i come forth.
41.1.39.1^and he was going, preaching in the synagogues of them, in all - galilee, and - demons casting out.
41.1.40.1^and comes to him a leper, imploring him and kneeling down to him, and saying to him -, if you are willing, you are able me to cleanse.
41.1.41.1^and having been moved with compassion, having stretched out the hand of him, he touched him and says to him, i am willing;
41.1.41.2^be you cleansed.
41.1.42.1^and immediately departed from him the leprosy, and he was cleansed.
41.1.43.1^and having sternly warned him, immediately he sent away him.
41.1.44.1^and he says to him, see that nothing to none you speak.
41.1.44.2^but go, yourself show to the priest, and offer for the cleansing of you what commanded moses, for a testimony to them.
41.1.45.1^- and having gone out, he began to proclaim much and to spread abroad the matter, so that no longer he was able openly into the city to enter;
41.1.45.2^but out in solitary places he was, and they were coming to him from every quarter.
41.2.1.1^and he having entered again into capernaum after some days, it was heard that in the house he is.
41.2.2.1^and were gathered together many, so that no more to have space, not even - at the door;
41.2.2.2^and he was speaking to them the word.
41.2.3.1^and they come, bringing to him a paralytic, being carried by four.
41.2.4.1^and not being able to come near to him on account of the crowd, they removed the roof where he was, and having broken up it, they let down the pallet on which the paralytic was lying.
41.2.5.1^and having seen - jesus the faith of them, he says to the paralytic, son, are forgiven of you the sins.
41.2.6.1^were now some of the scribes there sitting and reasoning in the hearts of them,
41.2.7.1^why this man thus does speak?
41.2.7.2^he blasphemes!
41.2.7.3^who is able to forgive sins, if not alone - god?
41.2.8.1^and immediately, having known - jesus in the spirit of him that thus they are reasoning within themselves, he says to them, why these things reason you in the hearts of you?
41.2.9.1^which is easier, to say to the paralytic, are forgiven of you the sins, or to say, arise, and take up the mat of you, and walk
41.2.10.1^that however you might know that authority has the son - of man to forgive sins on the earth.
41.2.10.2^.
41.2.10.3^.
41.2.10.4^he says to the paralytic,
41.2.11.1^to you i say, arise, take up the mat of you, and go to the home of you.
41.2.12.1^and he arose and immediately, having taken up the mat, he went forth before all, so as for to be amazed all, and to glorify - god, saying -, thus never did we see.
41.2.13.1^and he went forth again beside the sea, and all the crowd was coming to him, and he taught them.
41.2.14.1^and passing on, he saw levi the son - of alphaeus sitting at the tax booth, and he says to him, follow me.
41.2.14.2^and having arisen, he followed him.
41.2.15.1^and it came to pass, reclining of him in the house of him, that many tax collectors and sinners were reclining with - jesus and the disciples of him;
41.2.15.2^there were for many, and they were following him.
41.2.16.1^and the scribes of the pharisees, having seen him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, were saying to the disciples of him, why with the tax collectors and sinners does he eat?
41.2.17.1^and having heard, - jesus says to them -, no need have those being strong of a physician, but those sick being.
41.2.17.2^not i came to call the righteous , but sinners.
41.2.18.1^and were the disciples of john and the pharisees fasting.
41.2.18.2^and they come and say to him, because of why the disciples of john and the disciples of the pharisees fast, - but your disciples not fast?
41.2.19.1^and said to them - jesus, not are able the sons of the bridechamber, in which the bridegroom with them is, to fast?
41.2.19.2^as long as time they have the bridegroom with them, not they are able to fast.
41.2.20.1^will come however the days when will have been taken away from them the bridegroom, and then they will fast in those the days.
41.2.21.1^no one a patch of cloth unshrunk sews on clothing old;
41.2.21.2^if now not tears away the patch from it, - new from the old, and worse a tear takes place.
41.2.22.1^and no one puts wine new into wineskins old;
41.2.22.2^if now not, will burst the wine the wineskins, and the wine will be destroyed, and the wineskins.
41.2.22.3^instead, wine new into wineskins new.
41.2.23.1^and it came to pass, he on the sabbaths is passing through the grainfields, and the disciples of him began their way to make, plucking the heads of grain.
41.2.24.1^and the pharisees were saying to him, behold, why do they on the sabbaths that which not is lawful?
41.2.25.1^and he said to them, never did you read what did david, when need he had and hungered, he and those with him?
41.2.26.1^how he entered into the house - of god in the days of abiathar the high priest, and the loaves of the presentation ate, which not it is lawful to eat, if not for the priests.
41.2.26.2^and he gave even to those with him being?
41.2.27.1^and he said to them, the sabbath on account of the man was made, and not the man on account of the sabbath.
41.2.28.1^so then, lord is the son - of man also even of the sabbath.
41.3.1.1^and he entered again into the synagogue, and there was there a man, withered having the hand,
41.3.2.1^and they were watching him, whether on the sabbaths he will heal him, in order that they might accuse him.
41.3.3.1^and he says to the man - the withered, hand having arise into the midst.
41.3.4.1^and he says to them, is it lawful on the sabbaths - to do good, or to do evil?
41.3.4.2^life to save, or to kill?
41.3.4.3^- but they were silent.
41.3.5.1^and having looked around on them with anger, being grieved at the hardness of the heart of them, he says to the man, stretch out the hand and he stretched it out, and was restored the hand of him.
41.3.6.1^and having gone out, the pharisees immediately with the herodians counsel began to take against him, how him they might destroy.
41.3.7.1^and - jesus, with the disciples of him, withdrew to the sea, and great a multitude from - galilee followed, and from - judea,
41.3.8.1^and from jerusalem, and from - idumea, and beyond the jordan, and around tyre and sidon.
41.3.8.2^a multitude great, having heard how much he was doing, came to him.
41.3.9.1^and he spoke to the disciples of him that a boat might wait upon him on account of the crowd, that not they might press upon him.
41.3.10.1^many for he healed, so as for to press upon him, that him they might touch, as many as had diseases.
41.3.11.1^and the spirits - unclean, whenever him they beheld, were falling down before him and crying out, saying -, you are the son - of god.
41.3.12.1^and much he would rebuke them, so that not him known they should make.
41.3.13.1^and he goes up on the mountain and calls near those whom he wanted himself;
41.3.13.2^and they went to him.
41.3.14.1^and he appointed twelve ones also apostles.
41.3.14.2^he called them that they might be with him, and that he might send them to preach,
41.3.15.1^and to have authority to cast out - demons.
41.3.16.1^and he appointed the twelve.
41.3.16.2^and he added the name to simon, peter;
41.3.17.1^and james the son of zebedee, and john the brother - of james, and he added to them the name boanerges, which is, sons of thunder;
41.3.18.1^and andrew, and philip, and bartholomew, and matthew, and thomas, and james the son - of alphaeus, and thaddaeus, and simon the zealot,
41.3.19.1^and judas iscariot, who also betrayed him.
