41.3.20.1^and he comes to a house, and comes together again a crowd, so that not are they able them even bread to eat.
41.3.21.1^and having heard of it, those belonging to him went out to seize him;
41.3.21.2^they were saying for -, he is out of his mind.
41.3.22.1^and the scribes, those from jerusalem having come down, were saying -, beelzebul he has, and - by the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.
41.3.23.1^and having called to him them, in parables he began speaking to them:
41.3.23.2^how is able satan, satan to cast out?
41.3.24.1^and if a kingdom against itself is divided, not is able to stand the kingdom that.
41.3.25.1^and if a house against itself is divided, not will be able the house that to stand.
41.3.26.1^and if - satan has risen up against himself and has been divided, not he is able to stand, but an end is coming to.
41.3.27.1^but not is able no one, into the house of the strong man having entered, the goods of him to plunder, if not first the strong man he binds.
41.3.27.2^and then the house of him he will plunder.
41.3.28.1^truly i say to you that all will be forgiven the sons the of men, the sins and the blasphemies, as many as if they shall have blasphemed.
41.3.29.1^whoever however - shall blaspheme against the spirit - holy not has forgiveness to the age, but guilty is of eternal sin.
41.3.30.1^for they were saying, a spirit unclean he has.
41.3.31.1^and arrive the mother of him and the brothers of him, and outside standing, sent to him, calling him.
41.3.32.1^and was sitting around him a crowd.
41.3.32.2^and they said to him, behold, the mother of you and the brothers of you and the sisters of you outside are seeking you.
41.3.33.1^and he answering them, says, who are the mother of me and the brothers of me?
41.3.34.1^and having looked around on those who around him in a circle were sitting, he says, behold, the mother of me, and the brothers of me!
41.3.35.1^whoever for - shall do the will - of god, he brother of me, and sister, and mother is.
41.4.1.1^and again, he began to teach beside the sea.
41.4.1.2^and was gathered together to him a crowd great, so that he into a boat having entered, sat in the sea, and all the crowd close to the sea on the land was.
41.4.2.1^and he began teaching them in parables many things, and he was saying to them in the teaching of him,
41.4.3.1^listen!
41.4.3.2^behold, went out the one sowing to sow.
41.4.4.1^and it came to pass as - he sowed, some - fell along the road, and came the birds and devoured it.
41.4.5.1^and other fell upon the rocky place, where not it had soil much, and immediately it sprang up, because of the not having depth of soil.
41.4.6.1^and after rose the sun, it was scorched, and because of - not having root, it withered away.
41.4.7.1^and other fell among the thorns, and grew up the thorns, and choked it, and fruit no it yielded.
41.4.8.1^and other fell into the soil - good, and began yielding fruit, growing up and increasing, and bearing one thirtyfold, and one sixty, and one a hundred.
41.4.9.1^and he was saying, he who has ears to hear, let him hear.
41.4.10.1^and when he was with alone, began asking him those around him with the twelve about the parable.
41.4.11.1^and he was saying to them, to you the mystery has been given of the kingdom - of god.
41.4.11.2^to those however who are outside, in parables - everything is done,
41.4.12.1^so that, seeing, they might see and not perceive;
41.4.12.2^and hearing, they might hear and not understand;
41.4.12.3^lest ever they should turn, and should be forgiven them.
41.4.13.1^and he says to them, not understand you the parable this?
41.4.13.2^and how all the parables will you understand?
41.4.14.1^the one sowing, the word sows.
41.4.15.1^these now are they along the road, where is sown the word, and when they hear, immediately comes - satan and takes away the word - having been sown in them.
41.4.16.1^and these are those upon the rocky places sown, who, when they hear the word, immediately with joy receive it,
41.4.17.1^and not they have root in themselves, but temporary are;
41.4.17.2^then having arisen tribulation or persecution on account of the word, immediately they fall away.
41.4.18.1^and these are those among the thorns sown.
41.4.18.2^these are those, the word having heard,
41.4.19.1^and the cares - of this age, and the deceit of the riches, and - of the other things desires entering in, choke the word, and unfruitful it becomes.
41.4.20.1^and these are those upon the soil - good having been sown;
41.4.20.2^such as hear the word and receive it, and bring forth fruit, one thirtyfold, and one sixty, and one a hundred.
41.4.21.1^and he was saying to them not is brought in the lamp so that under the basket it might be put, or under the bed?
41.4.21.2^is it not that upon the lampstand it might be put?
41.4.22.1^nothing for there is hidden, if not that it should be made manifest, nor has taken place a secret thing, but that it should come to light.
41.4.23.1^if anyone has ears to hear, let him hear.
41.4.24.1^and he was saying to them, take heed what you hear.
41.4.24.2^with what measure you measure it will be measured to you, and more will be added to you.
41.4.25.1^whoever for may have, it will be given to him;
41.4.25.2^and he who not has, even that which he has will be taken away from him.
41.4.26.1^and he was saying, thus is the kingdom - of god, as a man should cast the seed upon the earth,
41.4.27.1^and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should sprout and grow;
41.4.27.2^how not knows he.
41.4.28.1^of itself, the earth brings forth fruit   first a plant, then an ear, then full grain in the ear.
41.4.29.1^when then offers itself the fruit, immediately he sends the sickle, for has come the harvest.
41.4.30.1^and he was saying, to what shall we liken the kingdom - of god?
41.4.30.2^or in what it parable shall we present?
41.4.31.1^as to a grain of mustard, which, when it has been sown upon the earth, smallest is of all the seeds which are upon the earth,
41.4.32.1^and when it has been sown, it grows up and becomes greater than all the garden plants, and it produces branches great, so that are able under the shadow of it the birds of the air to perch.
41.4.33.1^and with such parables many, he kept speaking to them the word, as they were able to hear.
41.4.34.1^without then parables, not would he speak to them;
41.4.34.2^in private however, to his own disciples he would explain all things.
41.4.35.1^and he says to them on that - day, evening having come, let us pass over to the other side.
41.4.36.1^and having dismissed the crowd, they take with them him since he was in the boat;
41.4.36.2^also other boats were with him.
41.4.37.1^and comes a storm violent of wind, and the waves were breaking over the boat, so that already is being filled up the boat.
41.4.38.1^and he was in the stern, on the cushion sleeping.
41.4.38.2^and they awaken him and say to him, teacher, not is it concern to you that we perish?
41.4.39.1^and having been awoken he rebuked the wind and said to the sea, silence, be still.
41.4.39.2^and abated the wind, and there was a calm great.
41.4.40.1^and he said to them, why fearful are you?
41.4.40.2^still not have you faith?
41.4.41.1^and they feared with fear great, and were saying to each other, who then this is, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
41.5.1.1^and they came to the other side of the sea, to the region of the gerasenes.
41.5.2.1^and having gone forth of him out of the boat, immediately met him out of the tombs a man with a spirit unclean,
41.5.3.1^who the dwelling had in the tombs.
41.5.3.2^and not even with chains no longer anyone was able him to bind,
41.5.4.1^because that he often with shackles and chains had been bound, and had been torn in two by him the chains, and the shackles had been shattered, and no one was able him to subdue.
41.5.5.1^and constantly all night and day in the tombs and in the mountains he was crying out and cutting himself with stones.
41.5.6.1^and having seen - jesus from afar, he ran and fell on his knees before him.
41.5.7.1^and having cried in a voice loud, he said, what to me and to you, jesus, son - of god the most high?
41.5.7.2^i adjure you - by god, not me torment.
41.5.8.1^he was saying for to him, you come forth, the spirit - unclean, out of the man!
41.5.9.1^and he was asking him, what is the name of you?
41.5.9.2^and saying, he answered, legion is name to me, because many we are.
41.5.10.1^and he begged him numerous times that not them he would send out of the country.
41.5.11.1^there was now there, near the mountain, a herd of pigs great feeding.
41.5.12.1^and they begged him, saying, send us into the pigs, so that into them we may enter.
41.5.13.1^and he allowed them.
41.5.13.2^and having gone out, the spirits - unclean entered into the pigs, and rushed the herd down the steep bank into the sea, about two thousand, and they were drowned in the sea.
41.5.14.1^and those feeding them fled and proclaimed it to the city and to the country.
41.5.14.2^and they went out to see what it is that has been done.
41.5.15.1^and they come to - jesus and see the man possessed by demons sitting, clothed and sound minded, the one having had the legion;
41.5.15.2^and they were afraid.
41.5.16.1^and related to them those having seen it how it happened to the one being possessed by demons, and concerning the pigs.
41.5.17.1^and they began to implore him to depart from the region of them.
41.5.18.1^and having entered he into the boat, was begging him the one having been possessed by demons, that with him he might be.
41.5.19.1^and not he did permit him, but he says to him, go to the home of you, to - your own, and report to them how much the lord for you did and had mercy on you.
41.5.20.1^and he departed and began to proclaim in the decapolis how much had done for him - jesus;
41.5.20.2^and all were marveling.
41.5.21.1^and having passed over - jesus in the boat again to the other side, was gathered a crowd great to him, and he was beside the sea.
41.5.22.1^and comes one of the synagogue rulers, named jairus, and having seen him, falls at the feet of him
41.5.23.1^and he begs him much, saying -, the little daughter of me at the end is holding, that, having come, you would lay the hands on her, so that she might be cured, and she shall live.
41.5.24.1^and he departed with him.
41.5.24.2^and was following him a crowd great, and pressing in on him.
41.5.25.1^and a woman, being with a flux of blood twelve years,
41.5.26.1^and much having suffered under many physicians, and having spent the of her all, and in no way having benefited, but rather to the worse having come,
41.5.27.1^having heard concerning - jesus, having come up in the crowd behind, she touched the clothing of him.
41.5.28.1^she was saying for -, if i shall touch even the garments of him, i will be healed.
41.5.29.1^and immediately was dried up the flow of the blood of her, and she knew in the body that she was healed from the affliction.
41.5.30.1^and immediately - jesus, having known in himself the out of him power having gone forth, having turned in the crowd, said, who of me touched the garments?
41.5.31.1^and were saying to him the disciples of him, you see the crowd pressing in on you, and say you, who me touched?
41.5.32.1^and he was looking around to see the one this having done.
41.5.33.1^- and the woman, having been frightened and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him and told him all the truth.
41.5.34.1^- and he said to her, daughter, the faith of you has healed you;
41.5.34.2^go in peace and be sound from the affliction of you.
41.5.35.1^while yet he is speaking, they come from the ruler of synagogue s house, saying -, the daughter of you is dead;
41.5.35.2^why still trouble you the teacher?
41.5.36.1^- and jesus, having heard the word spoken, says to the ruler of the synagogue, not fear;
41.5.36.2^only believe.
41.5.37.1^and not he allowed no one with him to follow, if not - peter and james and john the brother of james.
41.5.38.1^and they come to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and he beholds a commotion, and weeping and wailing much.
41.5.39.1^and having entered, he says to them, why make you commotion and weep?
41.5.39.2^the child not is dead, but sleeps.
41.5.40.1^and they were laughing at him.
41.5.40.2^he then, having put out all, takes with him the father of the child, and the mother, and those with him, and enters in where was the child.
41.5.41.1^and having taken the hand of the child, he says to her, talitha, koum!
41.5.41.2^which is, translated, - little girl, to you i say, arise!
41.5.42.1^and immediately arose the girl and began walking;
41.5.42.2^she was for of years twelve.
41.5.42.3^and they were overcome immediately with amazement great.
41.5.43.1^and he instructed them strictly that no one should know this;
41.5.43.2^and he commanded to be given to her to eat.
41.6.1.1^and he went out from there and came into the hometown of him;
41.6.1.2^and follow him the disciples of him.
41.6.2.1^and having come the sabbath, he began to teach in the synagogue;
41.6.2.2^and many hearing were astonished, saying, from where to this man these things, and what is the wisdom - having been given to him, even the miracles, such by the hands of him are done?
41.6.3.1^not this is the carpenter, the son - of mary, and brother of james and joseph and judas and simon?
41.6.3.2^and not are the sisters of him here with us?
41.6.3.3^and they took offense at him.
41.6.4.1^and said to them - jesus -, not is a prophet without honor, if not in the hometown of him, and among - relatives of him, and in the household of him.
41.6.5.1^and not he was able there to do not any work of power, if not on a few sick, having laid the hands, he healed.
41.6.6.1^and he was amazed because of the unbelief of them.
41.6.6.2^and he was going the villages around, teaching.
41.6.7.1^and he calls near the twelve, and he began them to send forth two by two, and he gave to them authority over the spirits - unclean.
41.6.8.1^and he instructed them that nothing they should take for the journey, if not a staff only;
41.6.8.2^no bread, nor bag, nor in the belt money;
41.6.9.1^but wearing sandals, and not put on two tunics.
41.6.10.1^and he would say to them, wherever if you enter into a house, there remain until - you go out from there.
41.6.11.1^and whatever - place not will receive you nor hear you, departing from there, shake off the dust which is under the feet of you, for a testimony against them.
41.6.12.1^and having gone out, they preached that they should repent.
41.6.13.1^and demons many they were casting out, and were anointing with oil many sick and healing them.
41.6.14.1^and heard - king herod;
41.6.14.2^well known for became the name of him.
41.6.14.3^and they were saying -, john, the one baptizing, is risen out from the dead, and because of this operate the miraculous powers in him.
41.6.15.1^others however were saying -, elijah he is.
41.6.15.2^others now were saying -, a prophet, like one of the prophets.
41.6.16.1^having heard now, - herod was saying, whom i beheaded, john   he is risen!
41.6.17.1^himself for - herod, having sent, seized - john and bound him in prison, on account of herodias, the wife of philip the brother of him, because her he had married.
41.6.18.1^had been saying for - john - to herod -, not it is lawful for you to have the wife of the brother of you.
41.6.19.1^- and herodias held it against him, and wished him to kill, and not was able;
41.6.20.1^- for herod was afraid of - john, knowing him to be a man righteous and holy;
41.6.20.2^and he kept safe him.
41.6.20.3^and having heard him, greatly he was perplexed and gladly him heard.
41.6.21.1^and having come a day opportune, when herod on the birthday of him a banquet made to the great men of him, and to the chief captains, and to the leading men - of galilee,
41.6.22.1^and having come in the daughter of him herodias, and having danced, pleased - herod and those reclining with him.
41.6.22.2^said the king to the girl, ask me whatever if you wish, and i will give to you.
41.6.23.1^and he swore to her, whatever - that if me you might ask, i will give you, up to half of the kingdom of me.
41.6.24.1^and having gone out, she said to the mother of her, what shall i ask?
41.6.24.2^- and she said, the head of john the one baptizing.
41.6.25.1^and having entered immediately with haste to the king, she asked, saying, i desire that at once you give to me upon a platter the head of john the baptist.
41.6.26.1^and encompassingly sorrowful having been made the king, on account of the oaths and those reclining with him, not was he willing to refuse her.
41.6.27.1^and immediately having sent the king an executioner, he commanded to be brought the head of him.
41.6.27.2^and having gone, he beheaded him in the prison,
41.6.28.1^and brought the head of him upon a platter, and gave it to the girl, and the girl gave it to the mother of her.
41.6.29.1^and having heard it, the disciples of him came, and took up the body of him, and laid it in a tomb.
41.6.30.1^and are gathered together the apostles to - jesus, and they related to him all things, what they had done and what they had taught.
41.6.31.1^and he said to them, come you yourselves apart own to a solitary place, and rest a little.
41.6.31.2^were for those coming and those going many, and not even to eat had they opportunity.
41.6.32.1^and they went away by the boat into a solitary place by themselves.
41.6.33.1^and they saw them going, and recognized many, and on foot from all the cities ran together there, and went before them.
41.6.34.1^and having gone out, he saw a great crowd and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were like sheep not having a shepherd.
41.6.34.2^and he began to teach them many things.
41.6.35.1^and already the hour late being, having come to him, the disciples of him were saying -, desolate is the place, and already it is an hour late.
41.6.36.1^dismiss them, that having gone to the surrounding region and villages, they might buy for themselves something to eat.
41.6.37.1^- but answering, he said to them, give to them you something to eat.
41.6.37.2^and they say to him, having gone, shall we buy denarii two hundred of bread, and give them to eat?
41.6.38.1^- and he says to them, how many loaves?
41.6.38.2^have you go, see.
41.6.38.3^and having known, they say, five, and two fish.
41.6.39.1^and he commanded them to make recline all, groups by groups on the green grass.
41.6.40.1^and they sat down groups by groups, by hundreds and by fifties.
41.6.41.1^and having taken the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to the heaven, he blessed and broke the loaves, and he kept giving them to the disciples of him that they might set before them.
41.6.41.2^and the two fish he divided among all.
41.6.42.1^and ate all and were satisfied.
41.6.43.1^and they took up of fragments twelve hand-baskets full, and of the fish.
41.6.44.1^and were those having eaten of the loaves five thousand men.
41.6.45.1^and immediately he compelled the disciples of him to enter into the boat and to go before to the other side, to bethsaida, until he should dismiss the crowd.
41.6.46.1^and having taken leave of them, he departed into the mountain to pray.
41.6.47.1^and evening having come, was the boat in the midst of the sea, and he alone upon the land.
41.6.48.1^and he having seen them straining in the rowing, was for the wind contrary to them.
41.6.48.2^about the fourth watch of the night he comes to them, walking on the sea, and he was wishing to pass by them.
41.6.49.1^- and having seen him on the sea walking, they thought that a ghost it is, and cried out.
41.6.50.1^all for him saw and were troubled.
41.6.50.2^- and immediately he spoke with them, and says to them, take courage;
41.6.50.3^i am he;
41.6.50.4^not fear.
41.6.51.1^and he went up to them into the boat, and ceased the wind.
41.6.51.2^and exceedingly in abundance in themselves they were amazed,
41.6.52.1^not for they understood by the loaves;
41.6.52.2^but had been of them the heart hardened.
41.6.53.1^and having passed over to the land, they came to gennesaret and drew to shore.
41.6.54.1^and on having come of them out of the boat, immediately having recognized him,
41.6.55.1^they ran around all the country that, and they began on the mats those sick being to carry about, to wherever they were hearing that he is.
41.6.56.1^and wherever - he entered into villages or into cities or into fields, in the marketplaces they were laying the ailing, and were begging him that only the fringe the clothing of him they might touch;
41.6.56.2^and as many as - touched him were being healed.
41.7.1.1^and are gathered together to him the pharisees and some of the scribes, having come from jerusalem.
41.7.2.1^and they had seen some of the disciples of him that with defiled hands, that is unwashed, are eating the bread.
41.7.3.1^- for the pharisees and all the jews, if not carefully they wash the hands, not eat, holding the tradition of the elders;
41.7.4.1^and on coming from the market, if not they wash not they eat;
41.7.4.2^and other things many there are which they received for them to hold to   washings of cups and vessels and utensils and couches for dining.
41.7.5.1^and questioned him the pharisees and the scribes, because of why not walk the disciples of you according to the tradition of the elders, but with unwashed hands eat the bread?
41.7.6.1^- and he said to them, rightly prophesied isaiah concerning you - hypocrites, as it has been written -:
41.7.6.2^this - people with the lips me honors, - but the heart of them far away is kept from me.
41.7.7.1^in vain now they worship me, teaching as doctrines the precepts of men.
41.7.8.1^having neglected the commandment - of god, you hold to the tradition - of men.
41.7.9.1^and he was saying to them, neatly do you set aside the commandment - of god, that the tradition of you, you might keep.
41.7.10.1^moses for said, honor the father of you and the mother of you,  and, the one speaking evil of father or mother, in death must end.
41.7.11.1^you however say that if says a man to the father or the mother, it is corban, that is, a gift, whatever if from me you might be profited,
41.7.12.1^no longer do you allow him anything to do for the father or the mother,
41.7.13.1^making void the word - of god for the tradition of you which you have handed down.
41.7.13.2^and like things such many you do.
41.7.14.1^and having called to him again the crowd, he was saying to them, listen to me, all, and understand:
41.7.15.1^nothing there is from outside the man entering into him, which is able to defile him;
41.7.15.2^but the things out of the man proceeding are the things defiling the man.
41.7.17.1^and when he went into the house from the crowd, were asking him the disciples of him the parable.
41.7.18.1^and he says to them, thus also you without understanding are?
41.7.18.2^not understand you that everything - from outside entering into the man, not is able him to defile,
41.7.19.1^because not it enters of him into the heart, but into the belly, and into the sewer goes out?
41.7.19.2^purifying all the food.
41.7.20.1^he was saying now -, that out of the man going forth, that defiles the man.
41.7.21.1^within for from the heart - of men - thoughts - evil go forth, sexual immorality, thefts, murders,
41.7.22.1^adulteries, covetous desires, wickednesses, deceit, sensuality, an eye evil, slander, pride, foolishness.
41.7.23.1^all these - evils from within go forth, and they defile the man.
41.7.24.1^from there also having risen up, he went away into the region of tyre.
41.7.24.2^and having entered into a house, no one he was wishing to know it, and not he was able to be hidden.
41.7.25.1^but immediately having heard a woman about him, of whom had the little daughter of her spirit unclean, having come, fell at the feet of him.
41.7.26.1^- now the woman was gentile, syrophoenician by race, and kept asking him that the demon he should cast forth out of the daughter of her.
41.7.27.1^and he was saying to her, permit first to be satisfied the children;
41.7.27.2^not for it is good to take the bread of the children, and to the dogs to cast it.
41.7.28.1^- but she answered and says to him, lord;
41.7.28.2^even the dogs under the table eat of the crumbs of the children.
41.7.29.1^and he said to her, because of this - word, go;
41.7.29.2^has gone forth out of the daughter of you the demon.
41.7.30.1^and having gone away to the home of her, she found the child lying on the bed, and the demon having gone out.
41.7.31.1^and again having departed from the region of tyre, he came through sidon, to the sea - of galilee through the midst of the region of the decapolis.
41.7.32.1^and they bring to him a deaf man and who spoke with difficulty, and they implore him that he might lay on him the hand.
41.7.33.1^and having taken away him from the crowd aside privately, he put the fingers of him to the ears of him, and having spit, he touched the tongue of him,
41.7.34.1^and having looked up to - heaven he sighed deeply, and he says to him, ephphatha!
41.7.34.2^that is, be opened!
41.7.35.1^and immediately were opened his - ears, and was loosed the band of the tongue of him, and he began speaking plainly.
41.7.36.1^and he instructed them that no one they should tell.
41.7.36.2^as much as however he kept instructing them, more abundantly they were proclaiming it.
41.7.37.1^and above measure they were astonished, saying, well all things he has done;
41.7.37.2^both the deaf he makes to hear, and the mute to speak.
41.8.1.1^in those - days, again great the crowd being and not having what they might eat, having called to him the disciples, he says to them,
41.8.2.1^i am moved with compassion upon the crowd, because already days three they continue with me, and nothing have that they might eat.
41.8.3.1^and if i shall send away them hungry to the homes of them, they will faint on the way.
41.8.3.2^for some of them from afar are come.
41.8.4.1^and answered him the disciples of him -, from where these will be able anyone here to satisfy with bread in this desolate place?
41.8.5.1^and he was asking them, how many have you loaves?
41.8.5.2^- and they said, seven.
41.8.6.1^and he directs the crowd to recline on the ground.
41.8.6.2^and having taken the seven loaves, having given thanks, he broke them and kept giving them to disciples of him, that they might set before them.
41.8.6.3^and they set it before the crowd.
41.8.7.1^and they had small fish a few.
41.8.7.2^and having blessed them, he ordered also these to be set before them.
41.8.8.1^and they ate and were satisfied.
41.8.8.2^and they took up over and above of fragments seven baskets.
41.8.9.1^there were now about four thousand.
41.8.9.2^and he sent away them.
41.8.10.1^and immediately having entered into the boat with the disciples of him, he came into the district of dalmanutha.
41.8.11.1^and went out the pharisees and began to dispute with him, seeking from him a sign from - heaven, testing him.
41.8.12.1^and having sighed deeply in the spirit of him, he says, why the generation this seeks a sign?
41.8.12.2^truly i say to you, if there will be given to the generation this a sign.
41.8.13.1^and having left them, again having embarked, he went away to the other side.
41.8.14.1^and they forgot to take loaves, and if not one loaf not they had with them in the boat.
41.8.15.1^and he was instructing them, saying, watch out;
41.8.15.2^take heed of the leaven of the pharisees, and of the leaven of herod.
41.8.16.1^and they were reasoning with one another because loaves not they have.
41.8.17.1^and having known it, he says to them, why reason you because loaves not you have?
41.8.17.2^not yet do you perceive nor understand?
41.8.17.3^hardened do you have the heart of you?
41.8.18.1^eyes having, not do you see?
41.8.18.2^and ears having, not do you hear?
41.8.18.3^and not do you remember?
41.8.19.1^when the five loaves i broke for the five thousand, how many hand-baskets of fragments full took you up?
41.8.19.2^they say to him, twelve.
41.8.20.1^when the seven to the four thousand, of how many baskets the fillings of fragments took you up?
41.8.20.2^and said they, seven.
41.8.21.1^and he was saying to them, not yet do you understand?
41.8.22.1^and they come to bethsaida.
41.8.22.2^and they bring to him a blind man, and implore him that him he might touch.
41.8.23.1^and having taken hold of the hand of the blind man, he led forth him out of the village, and having spit upon the eyes of him, having laid the hands upon him, he was asking him if anything you see.
41.8.24.1^and having looked up he was saying, i see the men, for as trees i see them walking.
41.8.25.1^then again he laid the hands upon the eyes of him, and he opened his eyes and he was restored, and he began to see clearly everything.
41.8.26.1^and he sent him to the home of him, saying, not into the village may you enter.
41.8.27.1^and went forth - jesus and the disciples of him into the villages of caesarea - philippi.
41.8.27.2^and on the way, he was questioning the disciples of him, saying to them, whom me do pronounce - men to be?
41.8.28.1^- and they answered him, saying -, john the baptist;
41.8.28.2^and others, elijah;
41.8.28.3^others now -, one of the prophets.
41.8.29.1^and he was questioning them, you however, whom me do pronounce to be?
41.8.29.2^answering, - peter says to him, you are the christ.
41.8.30.1^and he warned them that no one they should tell concerning him.
41.8.31.1^and he began to teach them that it is necessary for the son - of man many things to suffer, and to be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and to be killed, and after three days to rise again.
41.8.32.1^and openly the word he was speaking.
41.8.32.2^and having taken him - peter to him, he began to rebuke him.
41.8.33.1^- and having turned and having looked upon the disciples of him, he rebuked peter and said, get behind me, satan, for not you have in mind the things of god, but the things of men.
41.8.34.1^and having called to him the crowd with the disciples of him, he said to them, if anyone desires after me to follow, let him deny himself, and let him take up the cross of him, and let him follow me.
41.8.35.1^whoever for if might desire - life his to save, will lose it;
41.8.35.2^whoever now - will lose the life of him on account of me and of the gospel, he will save it.
41.8.36.1^what for does it profit a man to gain the world whole and to lose the soul of him?
41.8.37.1^what for shall give a man as an exchange for the soul of him?
41.8.38.1^whoever for if may be ashamed of me and - my words in the generation this - adulterous and sinful, also the son - of man will be ashamed of him when he shall come in the glory of the father of him, with the angels - holy.
41.9.1.1^and he was saying to them, truly i say to you that there are some here of those standing, who no not shall taste of death, until - they see the kingdom - of god having come with power.
41.9.2.1^and after days six takes along - jesus, - peter and - james and - john, and brings up them into a mountain high apart themselves alone.
41.9.2.2^and he was transfigured before them,
41.9.3.1^and the garments of him became shining white exceedingly, such as a launderer on the earth not is able thus to whiten.
41.9.4.1^and appeared to them elijah with moses, and they were talking with - jesus.
41.9.5.1^and answering, - peter says - to jesus, rabbi, good it is for us here to be.
41.9.5.2^and let us make three tabernacles:
41.9.5.3^for you one, and for moses one, and for elijah one.
41.9.6.1^not for he knew what he should say;
41.9.6.2^terrified for they were.
41.9.7.1^and there came a cloud overshadowing them, and there came a voice out of the cloud:
41.9.7.2^this is the son of me, the beloved;
41.9.7.3^listen you to him.
41.9.8.1^and suddenly, having looked around, no longer no one they saw except - jesus alone with them.
41.9.9.1^and descending of them from the mountain, he instructed them that to no one what they had seen they should tell, if not until the son - of man out from the dead had risen.
41.9.10.1^and that saying they kept among themselves, questioning what it is - out from the dead to rise.
41.9.11.1^and they were asking him, saying -, say the scribes that elijah it behooves to come first?
41.9.12.1^- and he was saying to them, elijah indeed having come first, restores all things;
41.9.12.2^and how has it been written of the son - of man, that many things he should suffer and be set at naught?
41.9.13.1^but i say to you, that also elijah has come, and they did to him whatever they desired, as it has been written of him.
41.9.14.1^and having come to the disciples, they saw a crowd great around them, and scribes arguing with them.
41.9.15.1^and immediately all the crowd, having seen him, were greatly amazed, and running to him, were greeting him.
41.9.16.1^and he asked them, what are you disputing with them?
41.9.17.1^and answered him one out of the crowd, teacher, i brought the son of me to you, having a spirit mute;
41.9.18.1^and whenever if him it seizes, it throws down him;
41.9.18.2^and he foams, and gnashes - his teeth, and is withering away.
41.9.18.3^and i spoke to the disciples of you, that it they might cast out, and not they had power.
41.9.19.1^- and answering him, he says, o generation unbelieving!
41.9.19.2^until when with you will i be?
41.9.19.3^until when will i bear with you?
41.9.19.4^bring him to me.
41.9.20.1^and they brought him to him.
41.9.20.2^and having seen him, the spirit immediately threw into convulsions him, and having fallen upon the ground, he began rolling around, foaming.
41.9.21.1^and he asked the father of him, how long a time is it that this has been with him?
41.9.21.2^- and he said, from childhood.
41.9.22.1^and often both into fire him it casts, and into waters, that it might destroy him.
41.9.22.2^but if anything you are able to do, help us, having compassion on us.
41.9.23.1^- and jesus said to him, - if you are able?
41.9.23.2^all things are possible to the one believing.
41.9.24.1^immediately having cried out, the father of the child was saying, i believe;
41.9.24.2^help of me the unbelief!
41.9.25.1^having seen now - jesus that was running together a crowd, he rebuked the spirit - unclean, saying to it, - mute and deaf spirit, i command you, come out of him, and no more may you enter into him.
41.9.26.1^and having cried out, and much having thrown him into convulsions, it came out;
41.9.26.2^and he became as if dead, in order for - many to say that he was dead.
41.9.27.1^- and jesus, having taken by the hand him, raised up him, and he arose.
41.9.28.1^and having entered he into a house, the disciples of him in private were asking him, why we not were able to cast out it?
41.9.29.1^and he said to them, this - kind by nothing is able to go out, if not by prayer.
41.9.30.1^from there having gone forth, they were passing through - galilee;
41.9.30.2^and not did he want that anyone should know it;
41.9.31.1^he was teaching for the disciples of him, and he was saying to them -, the son - of man is delivered into the hands of men, and they will kill him;
41.9.31.2^and having been killed, on the third day he will arise.
41.9.32.1^- and they did not understand the saying, and they were afraid him to ask.
41.9.33.1^and they came to capernaum.
41.9.33.2^and in the house having been, he was asking them, what on the way were you discussing?
41.9.34.1^- and they were silent, with one another for they had been discussing along the road which was greatest.
41.9.35.1^and having sat down, he called the twelve, and he says to them, if anyone desires first to be, he will be of all last and of all servant.
41.9.36.1^and having taken a child, he set it in midst of them;
41.9.36.2^and having taken in his arms it, he said to them,
41.9.37.1^whoever - one - of such little children shall receive in the name of me, me receives;
41.9.37.2^and whoever - me shall receive, not me receives, but the one having sent me.
41.9.38.1^answered him - john, teacher, we saw someone in the name of you casting out demons, and we were forbidding him, because not he was following us.
41.9.39.1^- and jesus said, not forbid him.
41.9.39.2^no one for there is who will do a work of power in the name of me, and will be able readily to speak evil of me.
41.9.40.1^whoever for not is against us, for us is.
41.9.41.1^whoever for - might give to drink you a cup of water, in name because christ s you are, truly i say to you, that no not shall he lose the reward of him.
41.9.42.1^and whoever - might cause to stumble one of the little ones these - believing in me, better it is for him rather if is put a millstone heavy around the neck of him and he has been cast into the sea.
41.9.43.1^and if should cause to stumble you the hand of you, cut off it;
41.9.43.2^better it is for you crippled to enter into - life, than - two hands having, to go away into - hell, into the fire - unquenchable.
41.9.45.1^and if the foot of you should cause to stumble you, cut off it;
41.9.45.2^better it is for you to enter into - life lame, than the two feet having, to be cast into - hell.
41.9.47.1^and if the eye of you should cause to stumble you, cast out it;
41.9.47.2^better for you it is with one eye to enter into the kingdom - of god, than two eyes having to be cast into - hell,
41.9.48.1^where the worm of them not dies, and the fire not is quenched.
41.9.49.1^everyone for with fire will be salted.
41.9.50.1^good is the salt;
41.9.50.2^if however the salt unsalty becomes, with what it will you season?
41.9.50.3^have in yourselves salt, and be at peace with one another.
41.10.1.1^and from there having risen up, he comes into the region - of judea, and beyond the jordan.
41.10.1.2^and come together again crowds to him, and as he had been accustomed, again he was teaching them.
41.10.2.1^and having come to him, the pharisees were demanding of him if it is lawful for a husband a wife to divorce, testing him.
41.10.3.1^- and he answering, said to them, what you did command moses?
41.10.4.1^- and they said, permitted moses a roll of divorce to write, and to send her away.
41.10.5.1^- but jesus said to them, because of the hardness of heart of you, he wrote for you the commandment this.
41.10.6.1^from, however, the beginning of creation, male and female he made them.
41.10.7.1^on account of this, will leave a man the father of him and - mother and be joined to - wife his,
41.10.8.1^and will be the two for flesh one.
41.10.8.2^therefore no longer they are two, but one flesh.
41.10.9.1^what therefore - god has joined together, man not let separate.
41.10.10.1^and in the house again, the disciples concerning this were asking him.
41.10.11.1^and he says to them, whoever - shall divorce the wife of him, and shall marry another, commits adultery against her.
41.10.12.1^and if a woman, having divorced the husband of her, should marry another, she commits adultery.
41.10.13.1^and they were bringing to him little children, that them he might touch.
41.10.13.2^- but the disciples rebuked them.
41.10.14.1^having seen now, - jesus was indignant and said to them, permit the little children to come to me;
41.10.14.2^not do hinder them!
41.10.14.3^to the for such, belongs the kingdom - of god.
41.10.15.1^truly i say to you, whoever - not shall receive the kingdom - of god as a child, no not shall enter into it.
41.10.16.1^and having taken them in arms, them he was blessing, having laid the hands on them.
41.10.17.1^and going forth of him on the journey, having run up one and having knelt down to him, was asking him, teacher good, what shall i do, that life eternal i might inherit?
41.10.18.1^- and jesus said to him, why me call you good?
41.10.18.2^no one is good, if not alone - god.
41.10.19.1^the commandments you know:
41.10.19.2^not shall you murder, not shall you commit adultery, not shall you steal, not shall you bear false witness, not shall you defraud, you shall honor the father of you and the mother.
41.10.20.1^- and he was saying to him, teacher, these all i have kept from the youth of me.
41.10.21.1^- and jesus, having looked upon him, loved him and said to him, one thing to you is lacking.
41.10.21.2^go, as much as you have sell, and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven;
41.10.21.3^and come, follow me.
41.10.22.1^- and having been sad at the word, he went away grieving;
41.10.22.2^he was one for having possessions many.
41.10.23.1^and having looked around, - jesus says the disciples of him, how difficultly those - riches having, into the kingdom - of god will enter!
41.10.24.1^- and the disciples were astonished at the words of him.
41.10.24.2^- but jesus, again answering, says to them, children, how difficult it is into the kingdom - of god to enter!
41.10.25.1^easier it is for a camel through the eye of the needle to pass, than for a rich man into the kingdom - of god to enter.
41.10.26.1^- and exceedingly they were astonished, saying among themselves, then who is able to be saved?
41.10.27.1^having looked on them, - jesus says, with men it is impossible, but not with god;
41.10.27.2^all things for are possible with - god.
41.10.28.1^began to say - peter to him, behold, we have left all and followed you.
41.10.29.1^was saying - jesus, truly i say to you, no one there is who has left house, or brothers, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or lands, for the sake of me and because of the gospel,
41.10.30.1^if not shall take a hundredfold now in the time this   houses and brothers and sisters and mothers and children and lands, with persecutions   and in the age which is coming, life eternal.
41.10.31.1^many however will be first, last;
41.10.31.2^and the last, first.
41.10.32.1^they were then on the way, going up to jerusalem, and was going on before them - jesus, and they were astonished;
41.10.32.2^those then following were afraid.
41.10.32.3^and having taken to him again the twelve, he began them to tell the things being about to him to happen:
41.10.33.1^- behold, we go up to jerusalem, and the son - of man will be betrayed to the chief priests and to the scribes, and they will condemn him to death, and will betray him to the gentiles.
41.10.34.1^and they will mock him, and will spit upon him, and will flog him, and will kill, and on the third day he will rise again.
41.10.35.1^and come up to him james and john, the sons of zebedee, saying to him, teacher, we desire that whatever if we might ask you, you would do for us.
41.10.36.1^- and he said to them, what do you desire me to do for you?
41.10.37.1^- and they said to him, grant to us that one of us at your right hand, and one at your left hand, we might sit in the glory of you.
41.10.38.1^- and jesus said to them, not you know what you ask.
41.10.38.2^are you able to drink the cup which i drink, and the baptism which i am baptized , to be baptized with?
41.10.39.1^- and they said to him, we are able.
41.10.39.2^- and jesus said to them, the cup which i drink, you will drink;
41.10.39.3^and the baptism which i am baptized , you will be baptized with;
41.10.40.1^- but to sit at the right hand of me or at the left hand, not is mine to give, but to those for whom it has been prepared.
41.10.41.1^and having heard this, the ten began to be indignant about james and john.
41.10.42.1^and having called near them, - jesus says to them, you know that those being accounted to rule over the gentiles exercise lordship over them;
41.10.42.2^and those great ones of them exercise authority over them.
41.10.43.1^not thus however shall it be among you.
41.10.43.2^instead, whoever - desires great to become among you, will be your servant;
41.10.44.1^and whoever - desires among you to become first, will be of all slave.
41.10.45.1^even for the son - of man not came to be served, but to serve, and to give the life of him as a ransom for many.
41.10.46.1^and they come to jericho.
41.10.46.2^and as was going out he from jericho   and the disciples of him, and a crowd large   the son of timaeus, bartimaeus, blind beggar, was sitting beside the road.
41.10.47.1^and having heard that jesus of nazareth it is, he began to cry out and to say, son of david, jesus, have mercy on me.
41.10.48.1^and were rebuking him many that he should be silent;
41.10.48.2^- but much more he kept crying out, son of david, have mercy on me.
41.10.49.1^and having stopped, - jesus commanded to be called him.
41.10.49.2^and they call the blind man, saying to him, take courage!
41.10.49.3^rise up!
41.10.49.4^he calls you.
41.10.50.1^- and having cast away the cloak of him, having risen up, he came to - jesus.
41.10.51.1^and answering him, - jesus says, what to you do you desire i should do?
41.10.51.2^- and the blind man said to him, rabboni, that i may receive sight.
41.10.52.1^and - jesus said to him, go, the faith of you has healed you.
41.10.52.2^and immediately he received sight, and he began following him on the way.
41.11.1.1^and when they drew near to jerusalem, to bethphage and bethany, near the mount - of olives, he sends two of the disciples of him
41.11.2.1^and says to them, go into the village, - before you, and immediately, entering into it, you will find a colt having been tied, upon which no one not yet of men has sat;
41.11.2.2^having untied it, also bring it.
41.11.3.1^and if anyone to you says, why are you doing this?
41.11.3.2^say, the lord of it need has, and soon it he will send back here.
41.11.4.1^and they departed and found the colt having been tied at the door outside, by the street, and they untied it.
41.11.5.1^and some of those there standing were saying to them, what are you doing untying the colt?
41.11.6.1^- and they spoke to them as had commanded - jesus, and they allowed them.
41.11.7.1^and they led the colt to - jesus, and they cast upon it the cloaks of them, and he sat on it.
41.11.8.1^and many the cloaks of them spread on the road;
41.11.8.2^others then, branches having been cut down from the fields.
41.11.9.1^and those going before and those following were crying out:
41.11.9.2^hosanna!
41.11.9.3^blessed is the one coming in the name of the lord!
41.11.10.1^blessed is the coming kingdom of the father of us, david!
41.11.10.2^hosanna in the highest!
41.11.11.1^and he entered into jerusalem, into the temple, and having looked around on all things, late already being the hour, he went out to bethany with the twelve.
41.11.12.1^and on the next day, having gone out they from bethany, he was hungry.
41.11.13.1^and having seen a fig tree from afar, having leaves, he went if perhaps anything he will find on it.
41.11.13.2^and having come to it, nothing he found, if not leaves;
41.11.13.3^the for season not it was of figs.
41.11.14.1^and answering, he said to it, no more to the age, of you no one fruit may eat.
41.11.14.2^and were listening the disciples of him.
41.11.15.1^and they come to jerusalem.
41.11.15.2^and having entered into the temple, he began to cast out those selling and those buying in the temple;
41.11.15.3^and the tables of the money changers and the seats of those selling the doves he overturned.
41.11.16.1^and not he would permit that anyone should carry a vessel through the temple.
41.11.17.1^and he began teaching, and was saying to them, not has it been written -:
41.11.17.2^the house of me a house of prayer will be called for all the nations  you however have made it a den of robbers.
41.11.18.1^and heard it the chief priests and the scribes, and they were seeking how him they might destroy;
41.11.18.2^they were afraid of for him;
41.11.18.3^all for the crowd was astonished at the teaching of him.
41.11.19.1^and when evening came, they were going forth out of the city.
41.11.20.1^and passing by in the morning, they saw the fig tree having been dried up from the roots.
41.11.21.1^and having remembered, - peter says to him, rabbi, look, the fig tree that you cursed is dried up.
41.11.22.1^and answering, - jesus says to them, have faith from god.
41.11.23.1^truly i say to you that whoever - shall say to the mountain this, be you taken away and be you cast into the sea,  and not shall doubt in the heart of him, but shall believe that what he says takes place, it will be done for him.
41.11.24.1^because of this i say to you, all things whatever praying, also you ask, believe that you receive, and it will be to you.
41.11.25.1^and when you may stand praying, forgive if anything you have against anyone, so that also the father of you, who is in the heavens, might forgive you the trespasses of you.
41.11.27.1^and they come again to jerusalem.
41.11.27.2^and in the temple is walking as he, come to him the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
41.11.28.1^and they were saying to him, by what authority these things are you doing?
41.11.28.2^or, who you gave the authority this, that these things you should do?
41.11.29.1^- and jesus said to them, i will ask you one question, and you answer me, and i will tell you by what authority these things i do.
41.11.30.1^the baptism - of john, from heaven was it, or from men?
41.11.30.2^answer me.
41.11.31.1^and they began reasoning with themselves, saying, if we should say, from heaven, he will say, because of why then not did you believe him?
41.11.32.1^but should we say, from men.
41.11.32.2^.
41.11.32.3^.
41.11.32.4^they were afraid of the people;
41.11.32.5^all for were holding - john truly that a prophet he was.
41.11.33.1^and answering - to jesus, they say, not do we know.
41.11.33.2^and - jesus says to them, neither i tell you by what authority these things i do.
41.12.1.1^and he began to them in parables to speak:
41.12.1.2^a vineyard a man planted, and he placed around it a fence, and dug a wine vat, and built a tower, and rented out it to farmers, and traveled abroad.
41.12.2.1^and he sent to the farmers at the due time a servant, that from the farmers he might receive from the fruit of the vineyard.
41.12.3.1^but having taken him, they beat him and sent him away empty-handed.
41.12.4.1^and again he sent to them another servant, and him they struck on the head and treated shamefully.
41.12.5.1^and another he sent, and him they killed;
41.12.5.2^also many others, some indeed beating, some then killing.
41.12.6.1^yet one having son beloved, he sent him last to them, saying -, they will have respect for the son of me.
41.12.7.1^those however - farmers to themselves said -, this is the heir;
41.12.7.2^come, let us kill him, and ours will be the inheritance.
41.12.8.1^and having taken, they killed him and cast forth him outside the vineyard.
41.12.9.1^what therefore will do the master of the vineyard?
41.12.9.2^he will come and will destroy the farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.
41.12.10.1^not even the scripture this have you read:
41.12.10.2^the stone which rejected those building, this has become the chief corner;
41.12.11.1^from the lord was this, and it is marvelous in the eyes of us.
41.12.12.1^and they were seeking him to lay hold of, and they feared the crowd;
41.12.12.2^they knew for that against them the parable he had spoken.
41.12.12.3^and having left him, they went away.
41.12.13.1^and they send to him some of the pharisees, and of the herodians, that him they might catch in discourse.
41.12.14.1^and having come, they say to him, teacher, we know that true you are, and not there is care to you about no one;
41.12.14.2^not for you look on the appearance of men, but on the basis of the truth the way - of god teach.
41.12.14.3^is it lawful to give tribute to caesar or not?
41.12.14.4^should we pay or not pay?
41.12.15.1^- and knowing of them the hypocrisy, he said to them, why me do you test?
41.12.15.2^bring me a denarius, that i might see it.
41.12.16.1^- and they brought it.
41.12.16.2^and he says to them, whose is the likeness this, and the inscription?
41.12.16.3^- and they said to him, caesar s.
41.12.17.1^- and jesus said to them, the things of caesar, give back to caesar, and the things - of god, - to god.
41.12.17.2^and they were amazed at him.
41.12.18.1^and come sadducees to him, who say a resurrection not there is, and they began questioning him, saying,
41.12.19.1^teacher, moses wrote for us that if of anyone a brother should die, and leave behind a wife, and not leave children, that should take the brother of him the wife, and raise up seed for the brother of him.
41.12.20.1^seven brothers there were;
41.12.20.2^and the first took a wife, and, dying, not left seed.
41.12.21.1^and the second took her, and died, not having left seed;
41.12.21.2^and the third likewise.
41.12.22.1^and the seven not left seed.
41.12.22.2^last of all also, the woman died.
41.12.23.1^in the resurrection, when they rise, of which of them will she be wife?
41.12.23.2^- for the seven had her as wife.
41.12.24.1^was saying to them - jesus, not because of this do you err, not knowing the scriptures, nor the power - of god?
41.12.25.1^when for out from the dead they rise, neither do they marry, nor are given in marriage;
41.12.25.2^but are like angels in the heavens.
41.12.26.1^concerning now the dead, that they rise, not have you read in the book of moses, on the bush, how spoke to him - god, saying, i am the god of abraham, and the god of isaac, and the god of jacob
41.12.27.1^not he is god of the dead, but of the living.
41.12.27.2^greatly you err.
41.12.28.1^and having come up one of the scribes, having heard them reasoning together, having seen that well he answered them, he questioned him, which is commandment the first of all?
41.12.29.1^answered - jesus, the foremost is, hear this o israel:
41.12.29.2^the lord - god of us, the lord one is,
41.12.30.1^and you shall love the lord - god of you with all the heart of you, and with all the soul of you, and with all the mind of you, and with all the strength of you.
41.12.31.1^the second this:
41.12.31.2^you shall love the neighbor of you as yourself.
41.12.31.3^greater than these another commandment not there is.
41.12.32.1^and said to him the scribe, right, teacher, according to truth you have spoken that one he is, and not there is another besides him,
41.12.33.1^and - to love him with all the heart and with all the understanding and with all the strength, and - to love the neighbor as oneself more important is than all the burnt offerings and sacrifices.
41.12.34.1^and - jesus, having seen him that wisely he answered, said to him, not far are you from the kingdom - of god.
41.12.34.2^and no one no longer dared him to question.
41.12.35.1^and answering, - jesus was saying, teaching in the temple, how say the scribes that the christ, the son of david is?
41.12.36.1^himself david said by the spirit - holy:
41.12.36.2^said the lord to the lord of me, sit at the right hand of me, until - i place of the enemies of you as a footstool of the feet of you.
41.12.37.1^himself david calls him lord, then how of him is he son?
41.12.37.2^and the great crowd was listening to him gladly.
41.12.38.1^and in the teaching of him, he was saying, beware of the scribes, - desiring in robes to walk about, and greetings in the marketplaces,
41.12.39.1^and first seats in the synagogues, and first places at the feasts;
41.12.40.1^those devouring the houses of the widows, and as a pretext, at great length praying.
41.12.40.2^these will receive greater judgment.
41.12.41.1^and having sat down opposite the treasury, he was watching how the crowd cast money into the treasury;
41.12.41.2^and many rich were casting in much.
41.12.42.1^and having come, one widow poor cast in lepta two, which is a kodrantes.
41.12.43.1^and having called to him the disciples of him, he says to them, truly i say to you that the widow this - poor, more than all has cast in of those casting into the treasury.
41.12.44.1^all for out of that which was abounding to them cast in;
41.12.44.2^she however, out of the poverty of her, all as much as she had cast in, all the livelihood of her.
41.13.1.1^and going forth of him out of the temple, says to him one of the disciples of him, teacher, behold what stones and what buildings!
41.13.2.1^and - jesus said to him, see you these - great buildings?
41.13.2.2^no not shall be left here stone upon stone, which no not shall be thrown down.
41.13.3.1^and sitting of him upon the mount - of olives, opposite the temple, asked him in private peter and james and john and andrew,
41.13.4.1^tell us when these things will be?
41.13.4.2^and what will be the sign when are going these things to be accomplished all?
41.13.5.1^- and jesus began to say to them, take heed, lest anyone you mislead.
41.13.6.1^many will come in the name of me, saying -, i am he, and many they will mislead.
41.13.7.1^when then you shall hear of wars and rumors of wars, not be disturbed;
41.13.7.2^it must come to pass, but not yet is the end.
41.13.8.1^will rise up for nation against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
41.13.8.2^there will be earthquakes throughout places;
41.13.8.3^there will be famines.
41.13.8.4^the beginning of birth pains are these.
41.13.9.1^take heed however you to yourselves;
41.13.9.2^they will betray you to courts and in synagogues;
41.13.9.3^you will be beaten, and before governors and kings you will stand because of me, for a testimony to them.
41.13.10.1^and to all the nations first it behooves to proclaim the gospel.
41.13.11.1^and when they might lead away you, delivering you up, not be anxious beforehand what you should say, but whatever if might be given to you, in that - hour, that speak;
41.13.11.2^not for are you those speaking, but the spirit - holy.
41.13.12.1^and will deliver up brother, brother to death, and father, child;
41.13.12.2^and will rise up children against parents, and will put to death them.
41.13.13.1^and you will be hated by all on account of the name of me;
41.13.13.2^the one however having endured to the end, he will be saved.
41.13.14.1^when then you see the abomination of the desolation standing where not it should   the one reading, let him understand   then those in - judea, let them flee to the mountains,
41.13.15.1^the one and upon the housetop, not let him come down, nor go in to take anything out of the house of him;
41.13.16.1^and the one in the field, not let him return to the things behind, to take the clothing of him.
41.13.17.1^woe then to those in womb having, and to the ones nursing infants in those - days!
41.13.18.1^pray then that it not might be in winter;
41.13.19.1^will be in for the days those tribulation, such as never has been the like, from the beginning of creation, which created - god, until - now   and never not shall be.
41.13.20.1^and if not had shortened the lord the days, no - there would have been saved any flesh;
41.13.20.2^but on account of the elect whom he chose, he has shortened the days.
41.13.21.1^and then if anyone to you says, behold, here is the christ!
41.13.21.2^behold, there!
41.13.21.3^not you shall believe it.
41.13.22.1^there will arise for false christs and false prophets, and will give signs and wonders, so as - to deceive if possible, the elect.
41.13.23.1^you however take heed;
41.13.23.2^i have foretold to you all things.
41.13.24.1^but in those - days, after the tribulation those, the sun will be darkened, and the moon not will give the light of it;
41.13.25.1^and the stars will be out of the heaven falling, and the powers that are in the heavens will be shaken.
41.13.26.1^and then will they see the son - of man coming in the clouds, with power great and glory.
41.13.27.1^and then he will send the angels, and will gather together the elect of him, from the four winds, from the end of earth to the end of heaven.
41.13.28.1^of now the fig tree, learn the parable:
41.13.28.2^when already the branch of it tender has become, and it puts forth the leaves, you know that near the summer is.
41.13.29.1^so also you, when you see these things coming to pass, know that near he is, at the doors.
41.13.30.1^truly i say to you that no not will have passed away the generation this until that these things all shall have taken place.
41.13.31.1^the heaven and the earth will pass away, - but the words of me in no way not will pass away.
41.13.32.1^concerning now the day that, or the hour, no one knows;
41.13.32.2^not even the angels in heaven, nor the son, if not the father.
41.13.33.1^take heed;
41.13.33.2^watch;
41.13.33.3^not you know for when the time is.
41.13.34.1^it is like a man going on a journey, having left the house of him, and having given the servants of him - authority, to each one the work of him.
41.13.34.2^and the doorkeeper he commanded that he should keep watch.
41.13.35.1^watch therefore   not you know for when the master of the house comes, or at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or morning
41.13.36.1^lest having come suddenly, he should find you sleeping.
41.13.37.1^what now to you i say, to all i say:
41.13.37.2^watch!
41.14.1.1^it would be now the passover and the feast of unleavened bread, after two days.
41.14.1.2^and were seeking the chief priests and the scribes how, him by stealth having taken, they might kill him.
41.14.2.1^they were saying for, not during the feast, lest ever there will be an uproar of the people.
41.14.3.1^and being of him in bethany in the house of simon the leper, having reclined of him, came a woman having an alabaster flask of fragrant oil of nard pure of great price;
41.14.3.2^having broken the alabaster flask, she poured it on his - head.
41.14.4.1^were now some indignant within themselves:
41.14.4.2^to what the waste this of the fragrant oil has been made?
41.14.5.1^could for this - fragrant oil to have been sold for above denarii three hundred, and to have been given to the poor.
41.14.5.2^and they were grumbling at her.
41.14.6.1^- and jesus said, leave alone her;
41.14.6.2^why to her trouble do you cause?
41.14.6.3^a good work she did toward me.
41.14.7.1^always for the poor you have with you, and whenever you desire you are able them good to do;
41.14.7.2^me however not always do you have.
41.14.8.1^what she could, she did.
41.14.8.2^she came beforehand to anoint the body of me for the burial.
41.14.9.1^truly now i say to you, wherever if shall be proclaimed the gospel in whole the world, also what has done this woman will be spoken of for a memorial of her.
41.14.10.1^and judas iscariot, - one of the twelve, went away to the chief priests, that him he might betray to them.
41.14.11.1^- and having heard, they rejoiced, and promised him money to give.
41.14.11.2^and he was seeking how him conveniently he might deliver up.
41.14.12.1^and on the first day - of unleavened bread, when the passover lamb they were to sacrifice, say to him the disciples of him, where do you desire that, having gone, we should prepare that you may eat the passover?
41.14.13.1^and he sends forth two of the disciples of him and says to them, go into the city, and will meet you a man, a pitcher of water carrying.
41.14.13.2^follow him.
41.14.14.1^and wherever if he might enter, say to the master of the house that the teacher says, where is the guest room of me, where the passover with the disciples of me i may eat?
41.14.15.1^and he you will show an upper room large, having been furnished and ready.
41.14.15.2^and there prepare for us.
41.14.16.1^and went away - his disciples, and came into the city, and found as he had said to them, and they prepared the passover.
41.14.17.1^and evening having arrived, he comes with the twelve.
41.14.18.1^and as were reclining they, and were eating, - jesus said, truly i say to you that one of you will betray me, who is eating with me.
41.14.19.1^they began to be grieved and to say to him one by one, surely not i?
41.14.20.1^- and he said to them, it is one of the twelve, who is dipping with me in the bowl.
41.14.21.1^for - indeed the son - of man goes as it has been written concerning him;
41.14.21.2^woe however to the man that by whom the son - of man is betrayed;
41.14.21.3^better for him it were if not had been born the man that.
41.14.22.1^and they were eating of them, having taken bread, having spoken a blessing, he broke, and gave to them, and said, take;
41.14.22.2^this is the body of me.
41.14.23.1^and having taken the cup, having given thanks, he gave it to them, and they drank of it all.
41.14.24.1^and he said to them, this is the blood of me of the covenant, which is being poured out for many.
41.14.25.1^truly i say to you that no more never not will i drink of the fruit of the vine, until the day that when it i drink anew in the kingdom - of god.
41.14.26.1^and having sung a hymn, they went out to the mount - of olives.
41.14.27.1^and says to them - jesus -, all you will fall away, for it has been written:
41.14.27.2^i will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.
41.14.28.1^but after - having arisen, i will go before you into - galilee.
41.14.29.1^- and peter was saying to him, if even all will fall away, yet not i.
41.14.30.1^and says to him - jesus, truly i say to you that yourself now this - night, before that twice the rooster crows, three times me you will deny.
41.14.31.1^- and emphatically he kept saying, if it is needful of me to die with you, no not you will i deny.
41.14.31.2^likewise now also all of them were saying.
41.14.32.1^and they come to a place, of which the name is gethsemane;
41.14.32.2^and he says to the disciples of him, sit here, while i shall pray.
41.14.33.1^and he takes - peter and - james and - john with him;
41.14.33.2^and he began to be greatly awe-struck and deeply distressed.
41.14.34.1^and he says to them, very sorrowful is the soul of me, even to death;
41.14.34.2^remain here and watch.
41.14.35.1^and having gone forward a little, he fell upon the ground and was praying that, if possible it is, might pass from him the hour.
41.14.36.1^and he was saying, abba, - father, all things are possible to you;
41.14.36.2^take away the cup this from me;
41.14.36.3^but not what i will, but what you.
41.14.37.1^and he comes and finds them sleeping.
41.14.37.2^and he says - to peter, simon, are you asleep?
41.14.37.3^not were you able one hour to watch?
41.14.38.1^watch and pray, so that not you may enter into temptation.
41.14.38.2^the indeed spirit is willing, - but the flesh weak.
41.14.39.1^and again having gone away, he prayed, the same thing having said.
41.14.40.1^and again having returned, he found them sleeping.
41.14.40.2^were for of them the eyes heavy;
41.14.40.3^and not they knew what they should answer him.
41.14.41.1^and he comes the third time, and says to them, are you sleeping - still and taking your rest.
41.14.41.2^it is enough;
41.14.41.3^has come the hour;
41.14.41.4^behold, is delivered up the son - of man into the hands of the sinful.
41.14.42.1^rise, let us go;
41.14.42.2^behold, the one betraying me has drawn near!
41.14.43.1^and immediately while yet of him speaking, comes up judas, one of the twelve, and with him a crowd with swords and clubs, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
41.14.44.1^had given then the one delivering up him a sign to them, saying:
41.14.44.2^whomever - i shall kiss, he is;
41.14.44.3^seize him and lead him away securely.
41.14.45.1^and having arrived, immediately having come up to him, he says, rabbi!
41.14.45.2^and he kissed him.
41.14.46.1^- and they laid the hands on him and seized him.
41.14.47.1^one then, a certain of those standing by, having drawn the sword, struck the servant of the high priest and cut off of him the ear.
41.14.48.1^and answering, - jesus said to them, as against a robber are you come out with swords and clubs to capture me?
41.14.49.1^every day i was with you in the temple teaching, and not you did seize me.
41.14.49.2^but it is that may be fulfilled the scriptures.
41.14.50.1^and having left him, fled all.
41.14.51.1^and a young man certain was following him, having cast a linen cloth about his naked body;
41.14.51.2^and they seize him,
41.14.52.1^- and having left behind the linen cloth, naked he fled.
41.14.53.1^and they led away - jesus to the high priest.
41.14.53.2^and come together all the chief priests, and the elders, and the scribes.
41.14.54.1^and - peter from afar off followed him, as far as within to the court of the high priest;
41.14.54.2^and he was sitting with the officers and warming himself at the fire.
41.14.55.1^- and the chief priests and all the council were seeking against - jesus testimony, to - put to death him, but not they were finding any.
41.14.56.1^many for were bearing false testimony against him, but alike their testimonies not were.
41.14.57.1^and some having risen up, were bearing false testimony against him, saying,
41.14.58.1^- we heard him saying -, i will destroy the temple this, the one made with hands, and in three days another, not made with hands, i will build.
41.14.59.1^and neither thus alike was the testimony of them.
41.14.60.1^and having stood up the high priest in the midst, he questioned - jesus, saying, not answer you nothing?
41.14.60.2^what is it these you testify against?
41.14.61.1^- but he was silent, and not did he answer nothing.
41.14.61.2^again the high priest was questioning him, and says to him, you are the christ, the son of the blessed one?
41.14.62.1^- and jesus said, i am.
41.14.62.2^and you will see the son - of man at the right hand sitting of power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.
41.14.63.1^- and the high priest, having torn the garments of him, says, what any more need have we of witnesses?
41.14.64.1^you heard the blasphemy.
41.14.64.2^what to you does it appear?
41.14.64.3^- and all condemned him deserving to be of death.
41.14.65.1^and began some to spit upon him, and to cover up of him the face, and to strike him, and to say to him, prophesy!
41.14.65.2^and the officers with the palms him received.
41.14.66.1^and being - peter below in the courtyard, comes one of the servant girls of the high priest,
41.14.67.1^and having seen - peter warming himself, having looked at him, she says, also you with the nazarene were, - jesus.
41.14.68.1^- but he denied it, saying, neither i know, nor even understand you what say.
41.14.68.2^and he went forth out into the porch;
41.14.68.3^and the rooster crowed.
41.14.69.1^and the servant girl, having seen him, began again to say to those standing by -, this one of them is.
41.14.70.1^- but again he denied.
41.14.70.2^and after a little, again those standing by were saying - to peter, truly of them you are, also for a galilean you are.
41.14.71.1^- but he began to curse and to swear -, not i know the man this, whom you speak of!
41.14.72.1^and immediately for the second time a rooster crowed.
41.14.72.2^and remembered - peter the word that had said to him - jesus -, before the rooster crows, twice three times me you will deny.
41.14.72.3^and having broken down, he began to weep.
41.15.1.1^and early in the morning, a counsel having formed the chief priests, with the elders, and scribes, and all the council, having bound - jesus, they led him away and delivered him to pilate.
41.15.2.1^and questioned him - pilate, you are the king of the jews?
41.15.2.2^- and answering to him, he says, you have said.
41.15.3.1^and were accusing him the chief priests of many things.
41.15.4.1^- and pilate again began to question him, saying, not answer you nothing?
41.15.4.2^see how many things you they testify against!
41.15.5.1^- but jesus no longer nothing answered, so as to amaze - pilate.
41.15.6.1^at then the feast, he used to release to them one prisoner, whom they requested.
41.15.7.1^there was then the one called barabbas, with the rebels having been bound, who in the insurrection murder had committed.
41.15.8.1^and having cried out, the crowd began to beg him to do as usually he did for them.
41.15.9.1^- but pilate answered them, saying, wish you that i should release to you the king of the jews?
41.15.10.1^he was aware for that because of envy had delivered up him the chief priests.
41.15.11.1^- but the chief priests stirred up the crowd so that instead - barabbas he might release to them.
41.15.12.1^- and pilate again answering, was saying to them, what then do you wish that i should do to him you call the king of the jews?
41.15.13.1^- and again they cried out, crucify him!
41.15.14.1^- and pilate was saying to them, what indeed did he commit evil?
41.15.14.2^- but much more they shouted, crucify him!
41.15.15.1^- and pilate, desiring to the crowd that which was satisfactory to do, released to them - barabbas, and he delivered - jesus, having flogged him, that he might be crucified.
41.15.16.1^- and the soldiers led away him into the palace, that is the praetorium, and they call together all the cohort.
41.15.17.1^and they put on him purple, and placed on him, having twisted together of thorns a crown,
41.15.18.1^and they began to salute him, hail, king of the jews!
41.15.19.1^and they kept striking his - head with a reed, and spitting on him;
41.15.19.2^and, bending the knees, they were kneeling down to him.
41.15.20.1^and when they had mocked him, they took off him the purple and put on him the garments his and they are leading out him, that they might crucify him.
41.15.21.1^and they compel, passing by one, simon of cyrene, coming from the country, the father of alexander and rufus, that he might carry the cross of him.
41.15.22.1^and they bring him to - golgotha, a place which is translated, of a skull place.
41.15.23.1^and they were offering him, having been mixed with myrrh, wine;
41.15.23.2^he however not did take it.
41.15.24.1^and having crucified him, also they divided the garments of him, casting lots for them, who what should take.
41.15.25.1^it was then the hour third, and they crucified him.
41.15.26.1^and there was the inscription of the accusation against him having been written:
41.15.26.2^the king of the jews.
41.15.27.1^and with him they crucify two robbers, one at the right hand, and one at the left of him.
41.15.29.1^and those passing by were railing at him, shaking the heads of them and saying, aha!
41.15.29.2^the one destroying the temple and building it in three days,
41.15.30.1^save yourself, having descended from the cross!
41.15.31.1^likewise also the chief priests, mocking among one another, with the scribes, were saying, others he saved;
41.15.31.2^himself not he is able to save.
41.15.32.1^the christ, the king of israel, let him descend now from the cross, that we might see and believe!
41.15.32.2^and those being crucified with him were upbraiding him.
41.15.33.1^and having arrived the hour sixth, darkness came over all the land, until the hour ninth.
41.15.34.1^and at the ninth hour, cried out - jesus in a voice loud, eloi, eloi, lema sabachthani?
41.15.34.2^which is translated, - god of me, - god of me, to why have you forsaken me?
41.15.35.1^and some of those standing by, having heard, were saying, behold, elijah he calls.
41.15.36.1^having run then one and having filled a sponge with vinegar, having put it on a reed, gave to drink him, saying, let be;
41.15.36.2^let us see if comes elijah to take down him.
41.15.37.1^- but jesus, having uttered a cry loud, breathed his last.
41.15.38.1^and the veil of the temple was torn into two from top to bottom.
41.15.39.1^having seen then the centurion - standing from opposite of him that thus he breathed his last, he said, truly this - man the son of god was!
41.15.40.1^there were then also women from afar off looking on, among whom also mary - magdalene, and mary the of james the least and of joseph mother, and salome,
41.15.41.1^who, when he was in - galilee, had been following him and had been ministering to him, and other many, those having come up with him to jerusalem.
41.15.42.1^and already evening having arrived, since it was the preparation, that is, the day before sabbath,
41.15.43.1^having come, joseph - from arimathea, a prominent council member, who also himself was waiting for the kingdom - of god, having boldness, went in to - pilate and asked for the body - of jesus.
41.15.44.1^- and pilate wondered if already he were dead.
41.15.44.2^and having called to him the centurion, he questioned him whether already he had died.
41.15.45.1^and having known it from the centurion, he granted the body - to joseph.
41.15.46.1^and having bought a linen cloth, having taken down him, he wrapped him in the linen cloth and laid him in a tomb which was cut out of a rock.
41.15.46.2^and he rolled a stone to the door of the tomb.
41.15.47.1^- and mary - magdalene and mary the mother of joseph were watching where he was laid.
41.16.1.1^and having passed the sabbath, mary - magdalene, and mary the mother - of james, and salome, bought spices, that having come, they might anoint him.
41.16.2.1^and very early on the first day of the week, they come to the tomb, having arisen the sun.
41.16.3.1^and they were saying among themselves, who will roll away for us the stone from the door of the tomb?
41.16.4.1^and having looked up they see that has been rolled away the stone;
41.16.4.2^it was for large extremely.
41.16.5.1^and having entered into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right, clothed in a robe white, and they were greatly amazed.
41.16.6.1^- and he says to them, not be amazed.
41.16.6.2^jesus you seek, the nazarene, the one having been crucified.
41.16.6.3^he is risen!
41.16.6.4^not he is here!
41.16.6.5^behold the place where they laid him.
41.16.7.1^but go, say the disciples of him and - to peter that he goes before you into - galilee;
41.16.7.2^there him will you see, as he said to you.
41.16.8.1^and having gone out, they fled from the tomb.
41.16.8.2^had seized for them trembling and amazement, and to none nothing they spoke;
41.16.8.3^they were afraid for.
41.16.9.1^having risen now early the first day of the week, he appeared first to mary - magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
41.16.10.1^she having gone, told it to those with him, having been mourning and weeping.
41.16.11.1^and they, having heard that he is alive and has been seen by her, disbelieved.
41.16.12.1^after now these things, to two of them as they are walking, he appeared in another form, going into the country.
41.16.13.1^and they, having gone, told it to the rest;
41.16.13.2^neither them did they believe.
41.16.14.1^afterward now were reclining they;
41.16.14.2^to the eleven he appeared and rebuked the unbelief of them and hardness of heart, because those having seen him arisen not they believed.
41.16.15.1^and he said to them, having gone into the world all, proclaim the gospel to all the creation.
41.16.16.1^the one having believed and having been baptized will be saved;
41.16.16.2^the one however having disbelieved will be condemned.
41.16.17.1^signs now those having believed these will accompany:
41.16.17.2^in the name of me demons they will cast out;
41.16.17.3^with tongues they will speak new;
