41.16.18.1^and with their hands serpents they will take up;
41.16.18.2^and if deadly anything they drink, no not them shall it hurt;
41.16.18.3^upon the sick, hands they will lay, and well they will be.
41.16.19.1^- indeed therefore the lord jesus, after - speaking to them, was taken up into the heaven and sat at the right hand - of god.
41.16.20.1^they now having gone forth, preached everywhere, the lord working with them and the word confirming by the accompanying signs.
41.16.20.2^all moreover the things being instructed to those around - peter.
41.16.20.3^promptly they reported after moreover, these, also himself - jesus from the east and to the west, sent out through them, the sacred and imperishable preaching of eternal salvation.
41.16.20.4^amen.
42.1.1.1^inasmuch as many have undertaken to draw up a narration concerning the having been accomplished among us things,
42.1.2.1^as delivered them to us those from the beginning eyewitnesses and servants having been of the word,
42.1.3.1^it seemed good also to me, having been acquainted from the first with all things, carefully with method to you to write, most excellent theophilus,
42.1.4.1^so that you may know concerning which you were instructed, of the things, the certainty.
42.1.5.1^there was in the days of herod king - of judea a priest certain, named zechariah, of the division of abijah, and wife of him of the daughters of aaron, and the name of her elizabeth.
42.1.6.1^they were now righteous both before - god, walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the lord blameless.
42.1.7.1^and no there was to them child, inasmuch as was - elizabeth barren, and both advanced in the years of them were.
42.1.8.1^it came to pass now in the fulfilling the priestly service of him, in the order of the division of him before - god,
42.1.9.1^according to the custom of the priesthood, it fell to him by lot - to burn incense, having entered into the temple of the lord.
42.1.10.1^and all the multitude were of the people praying outside at the hour of the incense.
42.1.11.1^appeared then to him an angel of the lord, standing at the right of the altar of the incense.
42.1.12.1^and was troubled zechariah having seen him, and fear fell upon him.
42.1.13.1^said then to him the angel, not fear, zechariah, because has been heard the prayer of you, and the wife of you elizabeth will bear a son to you, and you shall call the name of him john.
42.1.14.1^and he will be joy to you and gladness, and many at the birth of him will rejoice.
42.1.15.1^he will be for great before the lord;
42.1.15.2^and wine and strong drink no not shall he drink, and of the spirit holy he will be filled even from the womb of the mother of him.
42.1.16.1^and many of the sons of israel he will turn to the lord, the god of them.
42.1.17.1^and he will go forth before him in the spirit and power of elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, to make ready for the lord a people prepared.
42.1.18.1^and said zechariah to the angel, by what will i know this?
42.1.18.2^i for am an old man, and the wife of me is advanced in the years of her.
42.1.19.1^and answering, the angel said to him, i am gabriel, the one standing before - god, and i was sent to speak to you, and to bring glad tidings to you these.
42.1.20.1^and behold, you will be silent, and not able to speak until that day shall take place these things, in return for that not you did believe the words of me, which will be fulfilled in the season of them.
42.1.21.1^and were the people expecting - zechariah, and they were wondering at the delaying in the temple of him.
42.1.22.1^having come out then, not he was able to speak to them, and they recognized that a vision he had seen in the temple.
42.1.22.2^and he was making signs to them, and remained mute.
42.1.23.1^and it came to pass, when were fulfilled the days of the service of him, he departed to the home of him.
42.1.24.1^after then these - days conceived elizabeth the wife of him, and hid herself months five, saying,
42.1.25.1^- thus to me has done the lord, in the days in which he looked upon me, to take away the disgrace of me among men.
42.1.26.1^in now the month - sixth, was sent the angel gabriel by - god to a city - of galilee, whose name was nazareth,
42.1.27.1^to a virgin betrothed to a man, whose name was joseph, of the house of david;
42.1.27.2^and the name of the virgin was mary.
42.1.28.1^and having come to her, he said, greetings, you favored with grace!
42.1.28.2^the lord is with you.
42.1.29.1^- and at the statement she was troubled, and was pondering what kind might be the salutation this.
42.1.30.1^and said the angel to her, not fear, mary;
42.1.30.2^you have found for favor with - god;
42.1.31.1^and behold, you will conceive in womb, and will bring forth a son, and you shall call the name of him jesus.
42.1.32.1^he will be great, and son of the most high he will be called;
42.1.32.2^and will give him the lord - god the throne of david, of the father of him;
42.1.33.1^and he will reign over the house of jacob to the ages;
42.1.33.2^and of the kingdom of him not there will be an end!
42.1.34.1^said then mary to the angel, how will be this, since a man not i know?
42.1.35.1^and answering, the angel said to her, the spirit holy will come upon you, and power of the most high will overshadow you;
42.1.35.2^therefore also the being born holy one will be called the son of god.
42.1.36.1^and behold, elizabeth, the relative of you, also she has conceived a son in old age her, and this month the sixth is to her who was called barren.
42.1.37.1^for not will be impossible with - god every thing.
42.1.38.1^said then mary, behold, the handmaid of the lord.
42.1.38.2^may it happen to me according to the word of you.
42.1.38.3^and departed from her the angel.
42.1.39.1^having risen up then mary in the days this, she went into the hill country with haste, to a town of judah,
42.1.40.1^and she entered into the house of zechariah and greeted - elizabeth.
42.1.41.1^and it came to pass, as heard the greeting - of mary - elizabeth, leaped the baby in the womb of her;
42.1.41.2^and was filled with the spirit holy - elizabeth,
42.1.42.1^and she cried out in a voice loud and said, blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of the womb of you.
42.1.43.1^and from where to me this, that should come the mother of the lord of me to me?
42.1.44.1^behold for, as came the voice of the greeting of you into the ears of me, leaped in exultation the baby in the womb of me.
42.1.45.1^and blessed is the one having believed that there will be a fulfillment to the things spoken to her from the lord.
42.1.46.1^and said mary:
42.1.46.2^magnifies the soul of me the lord,
42.1.47.1^and rejoices the spirit of me in - god, the savior of me.
42.1.48.1^for he has looked upon the humiliation of the handmaiden of him.
42.1.48.2^behold for from - henceforth will count blessed me all the generations.
42.1.49.1^for has done to me great things the mighty one.
42.1.49.2^and holy is the name of him.
42.1.50.1^and the mercy of him is to generations and generations, to those fearing him.
42.1.51.1^he has shown strength with the arm of him, he has scattered the proud in the thought of heart of them.
42.1.52.1^he has brought down rulers from thrones, and exalted the humble.
42.1.53.1^those hungering he has filled with good things, and those being rich he has sent away empty.
42.1.54.1^he has helped israel the servant of him, remembering mercy,
42.1.55.1^as he spoke to the fathers of us, - to abraham and to the descendants of him to the age.
42.1.56.1^dwelt then mary with her about months three, and returned to the home of her.
42.1.57.1^to now elizabeth was fulfilled the time - to give birth for her, and she bore a son.
42.1.58.1^and heard the neighbors and - relatives of her that was magnifying the lord the mercy of him with her, and they were rejoicing with her.
42.1.59.1^and it came to pass on - day the eighth, they came to circumcise the child, and were calling it after the name of the father of him, zechariah.
42.1.60.1^and answering, the mother of him said, no, but he will be called john.
42.1.61.1^and they said to her -, no one is among the relatives of you, who is called the name by this.
42.1.62.1^they were making signs then to the father of him, the what - he might wish to be called him.
42.1.63.1^and having asked for a writing tablet, he wrote, saying, john is the name of him.
42.1.63.2^and they marveled all.
42.1.64.1^was opened then the mouth of him immediately, and the tongue of him, and he was speaking, blessing - god.
42.1.65.1^and came upon all fear, those dwelling around them;
42.1.65.2^and in all the hill country - of judea were being talked about all the things, words these.
42.1.66.1^and laid them up all those having heard, in the heart of them, saying, what then the child this will be?
42.1.66.2^and for the hand of the lord was with him.
42.1.67.1^and zechariah, the father of him, was filled with the spirit holy, and prophesied, saying,
42.1.68.1^blessed be the lord the god - of israel, because he has visited and has performed redemption on the people of him,
42.1.69.1^and has raised up a horn of salvation for us, in the house of david of the servant of him;
42.1.70.1^as he spoke by the mouth of the holy of old prophets of him,
42.1.71.1^salvation from the enemies of us, and from the hand of all those hating us;
42.1.72.1^to fulfill mercy toward the fathers of us, and to remember the covenant holy of him,
42.1.73.1^the oath that he swore to abraham, the father of us, - to grant us,
42.1.74.1^without fear, from the hand of our enemies having been saved, to serve him,
42.1.75.1^in holiness and righteousness before him, all the days of our life.
42.1.76.1^and you now, child, prophet of the most high will be called;
42.1.76.2^you will go for before the lord, to prepare ways of him;
42.1.77.1^- to give knowledge of salvation to people of him, in forgiveness of the sins of them,
42.1.78.1^through the affections of compassion of god of us, in which will visit us the sunrise from on high,
42.1.79.1^to shine upon those in darkness and in the shadow of death sitting;
42.1.79.2^- to direct the feet of us into the way of peace.
42.1.80.1^- and the child continued to grow and was strengthened in spirit;
42.1.80.2^and he was in the deserted places until the day of appearance of him to - israel.
42.2.1.1^it came to pass then in the days those, went out a decree from caesar augustus to register all the world.
42.2.2.1^this registration first took place when was governing - syria quirinius.
42.2.3.1^and were going all to be registered, each to the of themselves city.
42.2.4.1^went up then also joseph, from - galilee out of the town of nazareth, to - judea, to the city of david, which is called bethlehem, because of - being his of the house and family of david,
42.2.5.1^to register with mary, the one being betrothed to him, she being with child.
42.2.6.1^it came to pass then in their being - there, were fulfilled the days of the giving birth of her.
42.2.7.1^and she brought forth the son of her, the firstborn, and wrapped in swaddling cloths him, and laid him in a manger, because not there was for them a place in the inn.
42.2.8.1^and shepherds were in the region - same, lodging in the fields and keeping watch - by night over the flock of them.
42.2.9.1^and an angel of the lord stood by them, and the glory of the lord shone around them, and they feared with fear great.
42.2.10.1^and said to them the angel, not fear;
42.2.10.2^behold, for i bring good news to you of joy great, which will be to all the people.
42.2.11.1^for has been born to you today a savior, who is christ the lord, in the city of david.
42.2.12.1^and this is to you the sign:
42.2.12.2^you will find a baby wrapped in swaddling cloths, and lying in a manger.
42.2.13.1^and suddenly there came with the angel a multitude of the host heavenly, praising - god and saying:
42.2.14.1^glory in the highest to god, and on earth peace among men with whom he is pleased!
42.2.15.1^and it came to pass, as were departing from them into the heaven the angels, the shepherds were saying to one another, let us go through indeed as far as bethlehem, and let us see the word this that has come to pass, which the lord has made known to us.
42.2.16.1^and they came having hurried, and found - both mary and - joseph, and the baby, lying in the manger.
42.2.17.1^having seen now, they proclaimed abroad concerning the saying - having been told them concerning the child this.
42.2.18.1^and all those having heard marveled concerning the things having been spoken by the shepherds to them.
42.2.19.1^- but mary all was treasuring up - matters these, pondering them in the heart of her.
42.2.20.1^and returned the shepherds, glorifying and praising - god for all things which they had heard and seen, as it was said to them.
42.2.21.1^and when were fulfilled days eight - to circumcise him, then was called the name of him jesus, which he had been called by the angel before - was conceived he in the womb.
42.2.22.1^and when were fulfilled the days of the purification of them according to the law of moses, they brought him to jerusalem, to present to the lord
42.2.23.1^as it has been written in the law of the lord -:
42.2.23.2^every male opening a womb holy to the lord shall be called,
42.2.24.1^and - to offer a sacrifice, according to that having been said in the law of the lord, a pair of turtle doves or two young pigeons.
42.2.25.1^and behold, a man there was in jerusalem, whose name was simeon;
42.2.25.2^and the man this was righteous and devout, waiting for the consolation - of israel, and the spirit was holy upon him.
42.2.26.1^and it was to him divinely revealed by the spirit - holy not to see death before that - he should see the christ of the lord.
42.2.27.1^and he came in the spirit into the temple;
42.2.27.2^and in the time when were bringing in the parents the child jesus, the thing were doing they according to that having become customary by the law for him,
42.2.28.1^then he received him into the arms, and blessed - god, and said:
42.2.29.1^now you dismiss the servant of you, lord, according to the word of you, in peace;
42.2.30.1^for have seen the eyes of me the salvation of you,
42.2.31.1^which you have prepared before the face of all the peoples,
42.2.32.1^a light for revelation of the gentiles, and glory of the people of you, israel.
42.2.33.1^and were the father of him, and the mother, marveling at the things having been spoken concerning him.
42.2.34.1^and blessed them simeon, and said to mary the mother of him:
42.2.34.2^behold, this child is appointed for the falling and rising up of many in - israel, and for a sign spoken against
42.2.35.1^and of you also of her the soul will go through a sword   so that - may be revealed of many hearts the thoughts.
42.2.36.1^and there was anna, a prophetess, daughter of phanuel, of the tribe of asher, she being advanced in years great, having lived with a husband years seven from the marriage of herself,
42.2.37.1^and she was a widow of about years eighty and four, who not departed the temple, with fastings and prayers serving night and day.
42.2.38.1^and she at that hour having come up, was giving praise - to god, and was speaking concerning him to all those waiting for the redemption of jerusalem.
42.2.39.1^and when they had performed everything - according to the law of the lord, they returned to - galilee, to the town of them, nazareth.
42.2.40.1^- and the child continued to grow and become strong, being filled with wisdom, and the grace of god was upon him.
42.2.41.1^and were going the parents of him every year to jerusalem at the feast of the passover.
42.2.42.1^and when he was years old twelve, having gone up they according to the custom of the feast,
42.2.43.1^and having completed the days, in the returning of them, remained behind jesus the boy in jerusalem.
42.2.43.2^but not knew the parents of him.
42.2.44.1^having supposed now him to be in their company, they went a day s journey, and began seeking him among the relatives and the acquaintances;
42.2.45.1^and not having found him, they returned to jerusalem, seeking him.
42.2.46.1^and it came to pass after days three, they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, both hearing them and questioning them.
42.2.47.1^were amazed then all those hearing him at the understanding and the answers of him.
42.2.48.1^and having seen him, they were astonished, and said to him the mother of him, child why have you done to us thus?
42.2.48.2^behold, the father of you, and i, distressing were seeking you.
42.2.49.1^and he said to them, why is it that you were seeking me?
42.2.49.2^not knew you that in the house of the father of me it behooves to be me?
42.2.50.1^and they not understood the word that he spoke to them.
42.2.51.1^and he went down with them and came to nazareth, and he was subject to them.
42.2.51.2^and the mother of him was treasuring up all the these matters in the heart of her.
42.2.52.1^and jesus continued to advance in - wisdom and stature, and in favor with god and men.
42.3.1.1^in year then fifteenth of the reign of tiberius caesar, being governor pontius pilate - of judea, and being tetrarch - of galilee herod, philip now the brother of him being tetrarch - of ituraea and of trachonitis the region, and lysanias - of abilene being tetrarch,
42.3.2.1^during the high priesthood of annas and caiaphas, came the word of god upon john, - of zechariah son, in the wilderness.
42.3.3.1^and he went into all the surrounding region of the jordan, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for forgiveness of sins,
42.3.4.1^as it has been written in the book of the words of isaiah the prophet:
42.3.4.2^the voice of one crying in the wilderness, prepare the way of the lord;
42.3.4.3^straight make the paths of him.
42.3.5.1^every valley will be filled, and every mountain and hill will be made low;
42.3.5.2^and will become the crooked into straight, and the rough into ways smooth;
42.3.6.1^and will see all flesh the salvation - of god.
42.3.7.1^he was saying therefore to the coming out crowds to be baptized by him, offspring of vipers, who forewarned you to flee from the coming wrath?
42.3.8.1^produce therefore fruits worthy - of repentance;
42.3.8.2^and not begin to say in yourselves, as father we have - abraham.
42.3.8.3^i say for to you, that is able - god from - stones these to raise up children - to abraham.
42.3.9.1^already now also the ax to the root of the trees is applied;
42.3.9.2^every therefore tree not producing fruit good is cut down and into the fire is thrown.
42.3.10.1^and were asking him the crowds, saying, what then shall we do?
42.3.11.1^answering now, he was saying to them, the one having two tunics, let him impart to the one none having;
42.3.11.2^and the one having food, likewise let him do.
42.3.12.1^came then also tax collectors to be baptized, and they said to him, teacher, what shall we do?
42.3.13.1^- and he said to them, nothing more beyond that having been appointed to you collect.
42.3.14.1^were asking then him also those being soldiers, saying, what shall do also we?
42.3.14.2^and he said to them, no one extort nor accuse falsely, and be content with the wages of you.
42.3.15.1^are expecting then the people and wondering all in the hearts of them concerning - john, whether ever he might be the christ.
42.3.16.1^answered saying to all - john, i indeed with water baptize you;
42.3.16.2^comes however the one mightier than i, of whom not i am worthy to untie the strap of the sandals of him;
42.3.16.3^he you will baptize with the spirit holy, and with fire,
42.3.17.1^of whom the winnowing fork is in the hand of him, to clear the threshing floor of him and to gather the wheat into the barn of him.
42.3.17.2^- but the chaff he will burn up with fire unquenchable.
42.3.18.1^many indeed therefore other things exhorting, he was preaching the good news to the people.
42.3.19.1^- and herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him concerning herodias, the wife of the brother of him, and concerning all that had done the evils - herod,
42.3.20.1^added yet this to all:
42.3.20.2^also he locked up - john in prison.
42.3.21.1^it came to pass now in - having been baptized all the people, and jesus having been baptized, and having prayed, was opened the heaven,
42.3.22.1^and descended the spirit - holy in a bodily form as a dove upon him, and a voice out of heaven came:
42.3.22.2^you are the son of me, the beloved;
42.3.22.3^in you i am well pleased.
42.3.23.1^and himself was jesus beginning about years old thirty, being son, as was supposed, of joseph, - of heli,
42.3.24.1^- of matthat, - of levi, - of melchi, - of jannai, - of joseph,
42.3.25.1^- of mattathias, - of amos, - of nahum, - of esli, - of naggai,
42.3.26.1^- of maath, - of mattathias, - of semein, - of josech, - of joda,
42.3.27.1^- of joannen, - of rhesa, - of zerubbabel, - of shealtiel, - of neri,
42.3.28.1^- of melchi, - of addi, - of cosam, - of elmadam, - of er,
42.3.29.1^- of joshua, - of eliezer, - of jorim, - of matthat, - of levi,
42.3.30.1^- of simeon, - of judah, - of joseph, - of jonam, - of eliakim,
42.3.31.1^- of melea, - of menna, - of mattatha, - of nathan, - of david,
42.3.32.1^- of jesse, - of obed, - of boaz, - of sala, - of nahshon,
42.3.33.1^- of amminadab, - of admin, - of arni, - of hezron, - of perez, - of judah,
42.3.34.1^- of jacob, - of isaac, - of abraham, - of terah, - of nahor,
42.3.35.1^- of serug, - of reu, - of peleg, - of heber, - of shelah,
42.3.36.1^- of cainan, - of arphaxad, - of shem, - of noah, - of lamech,
42.3.37.1^- of methuselah, - of enoch, - of jared, - of mahalalel, - of cainan,
42.3.38.1^- of enosh, - of seth, - of adam, - of god.
42.4.1.1^jesus then, full of the spirit holy, returned from the jordan and was led by the spirit into the wilderness,
42.4.2.1^days forty being tempted by the devil.
42.4.2.2^and not he ate nothing in the days those, and having ended they, he was hungry.
42.4.3.1^said then to him the devil, if the son you are - of god, speak to the stone this, that it should become bread.
42.4.4.1^and answered to him - jesus, it has been written -:
42.4.4.2^not on bread alone shall live the man.
42.4.5.1^and having led up him, he showed him all the kingdoms of the world in a moment of time.
42.4.6.1^and said to him the devil, to you will i give the authority this all, and the glory of it;
42.4.6.2^for to me it has been delivered, and to whom if i wish, i give it.
42.4.7.1^you therefore, if you will worship before me, will be yours all.
42.4.8.1^and answering, - jesus said to him, it has been written:
42.4.8.2^the lord - god of you, you shall worship and him only you shall serve.
42.4.9.1^he led also him to jerusalem and set upon the pinnacle of the temple, and said to him, if the son you are - of god, cast yourself from here down.
42.4.10.1^it has been written for -:
42.4.10.2^to the angels of him he will give orders concerning you, - to guard you;
42.4.11.1^and - in their hands will they bear you, lest ever you strike against a stone the foot of you.
42.4.12.1^and answering, said to him - jesus -, it has been said, not you shall test the lord the god of you.
42.4.13.1^and having finished every temptation, the devil departed from him until an opportune time.
42.4.14.1^and returned - jesus in the power of the spirit to - galilee;
42.4.14.2^and a report went out into all the surrounding region concerning him.
42.4.15.1^and he was teaching in the synagogues of them, being glorified by all.
42.4.16.1^and he came to nazareth, where he had been brought up;
42.4.16.2^and he entered according to the custom to him, on the day of the sabbaths, into the synagogue, and stood up to read.
42.4.17.1^and there was given to him the scroll of the prophet isaiah, and having unrolled the scroll, he found the place where it was written:
42.4.18.1^the spirit of the lord is upon me, of which because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor.
42.4.18.2^he has sent me to proclaim to the captives deliverance, and to the blind recovery of sight, to send forth the oppressed in deliverance,
42.4.19.1^to proclaim the year of the lord s favor.
42.4.20.1^and having rolled up the scroll, having delivered it to the attendant, he sat down, and of all the eyes in the synagogue were fixed upon him.
42.4.21.1^he began then to say to them -, today is fulfilled the scripture this, in the hearing of you.
42.4.22.1^and all were bearing witness to him and marveling at the words of the grace that are proceeding out of the mouth of him;
42.4.22.2^and they were saying, not the son is of joseph this?
42.4.23.1^and he said to them, surely you will say to me the proverb this, physician heal yourself!
42.4.23.2^whatsoever we have heard has been done in - capernaum, do also here in the hometown of you.
42.4.24.1^he said then, truly i say to you that no prophet acceptable is in the hometown of him.
42.4.25.1^in truth now i say to you, many widows there were in the days of elijah in - israel, when was shut up the heaven for years three and months six, when there was a famine great upon all the land;
42.4.26.1^and to none of them was sent elijah, if not to zarephath - of sidon, to a woman, a widow.
42.4.27.1^and many lepers were in - israel in the time of elisha the prophet, and none of them was cleansed, if not naaman the syrian.
42.4.28.1^and were filled all with anger in the synagogue, hearing these things;
42.4.29.1^and having risen up, they cast him out of the city and led him unto brow of the hill upon which the town had been built of them, in order to throw over him;
42.4.30.1^he however, having passed through the midst of them, went away.
42.4.31.1^and he went down to capernaum, a city - of galilee.
42.4.31.2^and he was teaching them on the sabbaths;
42.4.32.1^and they were astonished at the teaching of him, for with authority was the message of him.
42.4.33.1^and in the synagogue was a man having a spirit of a demon unclean;
42.4.33.2^and he cried out in a voice loud,
42.4.34.1^ha!
42.4.34.2^what to us and to you, jesus, of nazareth?
42.4.34.3^are you come to destroy us?
42.4.34.4^i know you who are, the holy one - of god.
42.4.35.1^and rebuked him - jesus, saying, be silent and come forth out of him!
42.4.35.2^and having thrown him the demon into the midst, it came out from him, in nothing having hurt him.
42.4.36.1^and came astonishment upon all, and they were speaking to one another, saying, what - word is this, that with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits, and they come out?
42.4.37.1^and was spreading the report concerning him into every place of the surrounding region.
42.4.38.1^having risen up then out of the synagogue, he entered into the house of simon.
42.4.38.2^the mother-in-law then - of simon was oppressed with a fever great;
42.4.38.3^and they appealed to him for her.
42.4.39.1^and having stood over her, he rebuked the fever, and it left her;
42.4.39.2^immediately then having arisen, she began to serve them.
42.4.40.1^at the setting now of the sun, all as many as had any ailing with diseases various, brought them to him, - and on one each of them, the hands having laid, he would heal them.
42.4.41.1^were going out now also demons from many, crying out and saying -, you are the son - of god.
42.4.41.2^and rebuking them, not did he allow them to speak, because they knew the christ him to be.
42.4.42.1^having arrived now daybreak, having gone out, he went into a solitary place, and the crowds were seeking him, and they came up to him and were detaining him, of the not to go from them.
42.4.43.1^- but he said to them -, also to the other towns to preach the good news me it behooves, of the kingdom - of god;
42.4.43.2^because for this have i been sent forth.
42.4.44.1^and he was preaching in the synagogues - of judea.
42.5.1.1^it came to pass then in - the crowd pressing on him also to hear the word of god, and he was standing by the lake of gennesaret,
42.5.2.1^and he saw two boats lying by the lake;
42.5.2.2^- but the fishermen from them having gone out, were washing the nets.
42.5.3.1^having entered then into one of the boats, which was simon s, he asked him from the land to put off a little.
42.5.3.2^having sat down then, from the boat he was teaching the crowds.
42.5.4.1^when then he left off speaking, he said to - simon, put off into the deep and let down the nets of you for a catch.
42.5.5.1^and answering, simon said, master, through whole night having toiled, nothing have we taken;
42.5.5.2^at however the word of you, i will let down the nets.
42.5.6.1^and this having done, they enclosed a multitude of fishes great;
42.5.6.2^were breaking now the nets of them.
42.5.7.1^and they beckoned to the partners in the other boat, - having come, to help them, and they came and filled both the boats so that were sinking they.
42.5.8.1^having seen now, simon peter fell at the knees of jesus, saying, depart from me, for a man sinful am i, lord.
42.5.9.1^amazement for laid hold on him, and on all those with him, at the catch of the fish which they had taken,
42.5.10.1^likewise now also james and john, the sons of zebedee, who were partners - with simon.
42.5.10.2^and said to - simon, - jesus, not fear;
42.5.10.3^from - now on men you will be catching.
42.5.11.1^and having brought the boats to the land, having left all, they followed him.
42.5.12.1^and it came to pass in - being his in one of the cities, that behold, a man full of leprosy, having seen then - jesus, having fallen upon his face, begged him, saying, lord, if you would be willing, you are able me to cleanse.
42.5.13.1^and having stretched out the hand, he touched him, saying, i am willing;
42.5.13.2^be you cleansed!
42.5.13.3^and immediately the leprosy departed from him.
42.5.14.1^and he ordered him no one to tell:
42.5.14.2^but having gone, show yourself to the priest, and offer for the cleansing of you, as commanded moses, for a testimony to them.
42.5.15.1^was spread abroad now still more the report concerning him;
42.5.15.2^and were coming crowds great to hear and to be healed from the sicknesses of them.
42.5.16.1^he himself now was withdrawing into the wilderness and praying.
42.5.17.1^and it came to pass on one of the days that he was teaching, and there were sitting by pharisees and teachers of the law, who were come out of every village - of galilee, and of judea, and of jerusalem.
42.5.17.2^and the power of the lord was there for - to heal him.
42.5.18.1^and behold, men carrying upon a mat a man who was paralyzed, and they were seeking him to bring in and to place him before him.
42.5.19.1^and not having found what way they should bring in him on account of the crowd, having gone up on the housetop, through the tiles they let down him, with the mat into the midst before - jesus.
42.5.20.1^and having seen the faith of them, he said, man, have been forgiven you the sins of you.
42.5.21.1^and began to reason the scribes and the pharisees, saying, who is this who speaks blasphemies?
42.5.21.2^who is able sins to forgive, if not alone - god?
42.5.22.1^having known now - jesus the reasonings of them, answering, he said to them, why reason you in the hearts of you?
42.5.23.1^which is easier, to say, have been forgiven you the sins of you, or to say, arise and walk?
42.5.24.1^that however you may know that the son - of man authority has on the earth to forgive sins.
42.5.24.2^.
42.5.24.3^.
42.5.24.4^he said to the one having been paralyzed, to you i say, arise, and having taken up the mat of you, go to the house of you.
42.5.25.1^and immediately having stood up before them, having taken up that on which he was lying, he departed to the home of him, glorifying - god.
42.5.26.1^and amazement seized all, and they were glorifying - god, and were filled with fear, saying -, we have seen remarkable things today.
42.5.27.1^and after these things he went forth and he saw a tax collector named levi sitting at the tax booth;
42.5.27.2^and he said to him, follow me.
42.5.28.1^and having left all, having arisen, he began to follow him.
42.5.29.1^and made a banquet great levi for him in the house of him, and there was a multitude great of tax collectors and others, who were with them reclining.
42.5.30.1^and were grumbling the pharisees and the scribes of them at the disciples of him, saying, because of why with the tax collectors and sinners do you eat and drink?
42.5.31.1^and answering, - jesus said to them, no need have those being well of a physician, but those sick being.
42.5.32.1^not i have come to call righteous ones, but sinners, to repentance.
42.5.33.1^- and they said to him, the disciples of john fast often, and prayers make, likewise also those of the pharisees;
42.5.33.2^those however of you eat and drink.
42.5.34.1^- and jesus said to them, not are you able the sons of the bridechamber in which time the bridegroom with them is, to make to fast?
42.5.35.1^will come however days also when shall be taken away from them the bridegroom;
42.5.35.2^then they will fast in those - days.
42.5.36.1^he was speaking now also a parable to them -:
42.5.36.2^no one a piece of a garment new having torn, puts it on a garment old;
42.5.36.3^if however - otherwise also the new he will tear, and the old not will match, which is the piece - of the new.
42.5.37.1^and no one puts wine new into wineskins old;
42.5.37.2^if now - otherwise, will burst the wine - new the wineskins, and it will be spilled out, and the wineskins will be destroyed.
42.5.38.1^but wine new into wineskins fresh must be put.
42.5.39.1^and no one having drunk old wine desires new;
42.5.39.2^he says for, the old better is.
42.6.1.1^it came to pass then on a sabbath is passing along he through grainfields, and were plucking the disciples of him, and were eating the heads of grain, rubbing them in the hands.
42.6.2.1^some however of the pharisees said, why do you that which not it is lawful on the sabbaths?
42.6.3.1^and answering to them, said - jesus, not even this have you read, that which did david, when was hungry he himself, and those who with him were:
42.6.4.1^how he entered into the house - of god, and the loaves of the presentation having taken, ate, and gave to those with him, which not it is lawful to eat, if not only to the priests?
42.6.5.1^and he was saying to them, lord is of the sabbath the son - of man.
42.6.6.1^it came to pass then on another sabbath, entered he into the synagogue and taught;
42.6.6.2^and there was a man there, and the hand of him the right was withered.
42.6.7.1^were closely watching now him the scribes and the pharisees, whether on the sabbath he will heal, that they might find reason to accuse him.
42.6.8.1^he now knew the thoughts of them;
42.6.8.2^he said now to the man the withered having the hand, arise and stand in the midst.
42.6.8.3^and having risen up, he stood.
42.6.9.1^said then - jesus to them, i ask you, whether it is lawful on the sabbath to do good or to do evil?
42.6.9.2^life to save or to destroy?
42.6.10.1^and having looked around all on them, he said to him, stretch out the hand of you.
42.6.10.2^- and he did, and was restored the hand of him.
42.6.11.1^they themselves then were filled with rage, and were discussing with one another what - they might do - to jesus.
42.6.12.1^it came to pass then in the days those, went out he to the mountain to pray, and he was spending the night in - prayer - to god.
42.6.13.1^and when it became day, he called to him the disciples of him, also having chosen out from them twelve, whom also apostles he named:
42.6.14.1^simon whom also he named peter, and andrew the brother of him;
42.6.14.2^and james and john;
42.6.14.3^and philip and bartholomew;
42.6.15.1^and matthew and thomas;
42.6.15.2^and james son of alphaeus;
42.6.15.3^and simon the one called zealot;
42.6.16.1^and judas son of james;
42.6.16.2^and judas iscariot, who became the betrayer.
42.6.17.1^and having descended with them, he stood on a place level, and a crowd large of disciples of him, and a multitude great of the people from all - judea, and jerusalem, and the sea coast of tyre, and sidon,
42.6.18.1^who came to hear him and to be healed of the diseases of them.
42.6.18.2^and those troubled with spirits unclean were healed.
42.6.19.1^and all the multitude were seeking to touch him, because power from him was going out and healing all.
42.6.20.1^and he, having lifted up the gaze of him upon the disciples of him, was saying:
42.6.20.2^blessed are the poor, for yours is the kingdom - of god.
42.6.21.1^blessed are those hungering now, for you will be filled.
42.6.21.2^blessed are those weeping now, for you will laugh.
42.6.22.1^blessed are you when shall hate you - men, and when they shall exclude you, and shall insult you, and shall cast out the name of you as evil, on account of the son - of man.
42.6.23.1^rejoice in that - day, and leap for joy;
42.6.23.2^behold for, the reward of you is great in - heaven.
42.6.23.3^according to these things of them for used to treat the prophets the fathers likewise.
42.6.24.1^but woe to you who are rich, for you are receiving the comfort of you.
42.6.25.1^woe to you who having been filled now, for you will hunger.
42.6.25.2^woe to those laughing now, for you will mourn and will weep.
42.6.26.1^woe to you when of you well speak all - men, according to these things of them for used to treat the false prophets the fathers likewise.
42.6.27.1^but to you i say, to those hearing:
42.6.27.2^love the enemies of you, good do to those hating you,
42.6.28.1^bless those cursing you, pray for those mistreating you.
42.6.29.1^to the one striking you on the cheek, offer also the other;
42.6.29.2^and from the one taking away your - cloak, also the tunic not do withhold.
42.6.30.1^to everyone asking you, give, and from the one taking away what is yours, not ask it back.
42.6.31.1^and as you desire that should do to you - men, do to them likewise.
42.6.32.1^and if you love those loving you, what to you credit is it?
42.6.32.2^even for - sinners those loving them, love.
42.6.33.1^and for if you do good to those doing good to you, what to you credit is it?
42.6.33.2^for even - sinners the same do.
42.6.34.1^and if you lend to those from whom you expect to receive back, what to you credit is it?
42.6.34.2^even sinners to sinners lend, that they might receive the same amount.
42.6.35.1^but love the enemies of you, and do good, and lend, nothing expecting in return, and will be the reward of you great, and you will be sons of the most high;
42.6.35.2^for he kind is to the ungrateful and evil.
42.6.36.1^be you merciful, as also the father of you merciful is.
42.6.37.1^and not judge, that no not you should be judged;
42.6.37.2^and not condemn, that no not you should be condemned.
42.6.37.3^forgive, and you will be forgiven.
42.6.38.1^give, and it will be given to you.
42.6.38.2^measure good, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will they put into the lap of you, with that for measure you measure, it will be measured again to you.
42.6.39.1^he spoke then also a parable to them, not is able a blind man, a blind man to lead?
42.6.39.2^not both into a pit will fall?
42.6.40.1^not is a disciple above the teacher;
42.6.40.2^fully trained however, everyone will be like the teacher of him.
42.6.41.1^why now look you at the splinter that is in the eye of the brother of you, - and the beam that is in the own eye not notice?
42.6.42.1^how are you able to say to brother of you, brother, let that i might cast out the splinter that is in the eye of you, yourself the in the eye of you beam not seeing?
42.6.42.2^hypocrite, cast out first the beam from the eye of you, and then you will see clearly the splinter - in the eye of the brother of you to cast out.
42.6.43.1^no for there is tree good, producing fruit bad;
42.6.43.2^nor again a tree bad, producing fruit good.
42.6.44.1^each for tree by the own fruit is known.
42.6.44.2^not for from thorns do they gather figs, nor from a bramble bush grapes gather they.
42.6.45.1^the good man, out of the good treasure of the his heart brings forth that which is good;
42.6.45.2^and the evil, out of the evil, brings forth that which is evil.
42.6.45.3^out of for the abundance of his heart, speaks the mouth of him.
42.6.46.1^why now me do you call lord, lord, and not do what i say?
42.6.47.1^everyone who is coming to me, and hearing of me the words, and doing them, i will show you whom he is like.
42.6.48.1^like he is to a man building a house, who dug and deepened, and laid a foundation on the rock;
42.6.48.2^a flood then having come, burst upon the stream the house that, and not was able to shake it, because - well had been built it.
42.6.49.1^the one however having heard, and not having done, like is to a man having built a house on the ground without a foundation, on which burst the stream, and immediately it fell, and was the ruin of the house that great.
42.7.1.1^and when he had completed all the words of him in the hearing of the people, he entered into capernaum.
42.7.2.1^of a centurion then a certain servant, sick being, was about to die, who was to him valued highly.
42.7.3.1^having heard then about - jesus, he sent to him elders of the jews, begging him that having come, he might save the servant of him.
42.7.4.1^- and having come to - jesus, they were begging him earnestly, saying that, worthy he is, to whom you will grant this;
42.7.5.1^he loves for the nation of us, and the synagogue he built for us.
42.7.6.1^- and jesus was going with them.
42.7.6.2^already then, he not far being distant from the house, sent friends the centurion, saying to him, lord, not trouble yourself, not for worthy i am that under the roof of me you should come;
42.7.7.1^therefore neither myself counted i worthy to you to come;
42.7.7.2^but say in a word, and shall be healed the servant of me.
42.7.8.1^also for i a man am under authority appointed, having under me soldiers;
42.7.8.2^and i say to this one, go, and he goes;
42.7.8.3^and to another, come, and he comes;
42.7.8.4^and to the servant of me, do this, and he does it.
42.7.9.1^having heard then these things, - jesus marveled at him;
42.7.9.2^and having turned to the following him crowd, he said, i say to you, not even in - israel such great faith did i find.
42.7.10.1^and having returned to the house, those having been sent found the servant in good health.
42.7.11.1^and it came to pass on the next day, he went into a town called nain, and were going with him the disciples of him, and a crowd great.
42.7.12.1^as then he drew near to the gate of the town, also behold, was being carried out one having died, only begotten son of the mother of him;
42.7.12.2^and she was a widow.
42.7.12.3^and a crowd of the town, considerable, was with her.
42.7.13.1^and having seen her, the lord was moved with compassion on her, and said to her, not weep.
42.7.14.1^and having come up, he touched the bier;
42.7.14.2^those then bearing it stopped.
42.7.14.3^and he said, young man, to you i say, arise!
42.7.15.1^and sat up the dead man, and began to speak, and he gave him to the mother of him.
42.7.16.1^seized then fear all, and they began glorifying - god, saying -, a prophet great has risen up among us!
42.7.16.2^and -, has visited - god the people of him!
42.7.17.1^and went out the report this in all - judea concerning him, and in all the surrounding region.
42.7.18.1^and brought word to john the disciples of him concerning all these things.
42.7.18.2^and having called near two certain - disciples of him, - john
42.7.19.1^sent them to the lord, saying, you are the coming one, or another are we to look for?
42.7.20.1^having come then to him, the men said, john the baptist has sent us to you, saying, you are the coming one, or another are we to look for?
42.7.21.1^at that very - hour, he healed many of diseases, and afflictions, and spirits evil, and to blind many he granted to see.
42.7.22.1^and answering, he said to them, having gone, relate to john what you have seen and heard:
42.7.22.2^blind receive sight, lame walk, lepers are cleansed, and deaf hear, dead are raised, poor are gospelized.
42.7.23.1^and blessed is who if not shall be offended in me.
42.7.24.1^having departed then the messengers of john, he began to speak to the crowds concerning john:
42.7.24.2^what have you gone out into the wilderness to see?
42.7.24.3^a reed by the wind shaken?
42.7.25.1^but what have you gone out to see?
42.7.25.2^a man in fine clothing arrayed?
42.7.25.3^behold, those in clothing splendid and in luxury living, in the palaces are.
42.7.26.1^but what have you gone out to see?
42.7.26.2^a prophet?
42.7.26.3^yes, i say to you, and one more excellent than a prophet.
42.7.27.1^this is he concerning whom it has been written:
42.7.27.2^behold, i send the messenger of me before the face of you, who will prepare the way of you before you.
42.7.28.1^i say to you, a greater among those born of women than john no one is;
42.7.28.2^- yet the least in the kingdom of god, greater than he is.
42.7.29.1^and all the people having heard, even the tax collectors, declared as righteous - god, having been baptized with the baptism of john;
42.7.30.1^- but the pharisees and the lawyers, the counsel - of god rejected as to themselves, not having been baptized by him.
42.7.31.1^to what therefore will i liken the men of the generation this?
42.7.31.2^and to what are they like?
42.7.32.1^like are they to little children - in the marketplace sitting, and calling to each other one, saying:
42.7.32.2^we piped to you, and not you did dance;
42.7.32.3^we sang a dirge, and not you did weep.
42.7.33.1^has come for john the baptist, neither eating bread, nor drinking wine, and you say, a demon he has.
42.7.34.1^has come the son - of man, eating and drinking, and you say, behold, a man, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and of sinners.
42.7.35.1^and was justified - wisdom by all the children of her.
42.7.36.1^was asking now one him of the pharisees, that he should eat with him;
42.7.36.2^and having entered into the house of the pharisee, he reclined.
42.7.37.1^and behold, a woman who was in the city, a sinner.
42.7.37.2^and she having known that he had reclined in the house of the pharisee, having taken an alabaster flask of fragrant oil,
42.7.38.1^and having stood behind him at the feet of him weeping, the tears she began to wet with the feet of him, and with the hairs of the head of her, she was wiping them, and was kissing the feet of him, and was anointing them with the fragrant oil.
42.7.39.1^having seen now the pharisee, the one having invited him, he spoke within himself, saying, this, if he were a prophet, would have known - who and what the woman is who touches him, for a sinner she is.
42.7.40.1^and answering, - jesus said to him, simon, i have to you something to say.
42.7.40.2^- and, teacher, say it, he says.
42.7.41.1^two debtors there were to a creditor certain;
42.7.41.2^the one owed denarii five hundred;
42.7.41.3^- and the other, fifty.
42.7.42.1^nothing having they to pay, both he forgave.
42.7.42.2^which therefore of them, more will love him?
42.7.43.1^answering, simon said, i take it that he to whom the most he forgave.
42.7.43.2^- and he said to him, rightly you have judged.
42.7.44.1^and having turned to the woman, - to simon he was saying, see you this the woman?
42.7.44.2^i entered of you into the house, water of me for feet not you gave;
42.7.44.3^with her however - tears she wet my - feet, and with the hair of her wiped them.
42.7.45.1^a kiss to me not you gave;
42.7.45.2^she herself however, from which time i came in, not has ceased kissing my - feet.
42.7.46.1^with oil the head of me not you did anoint;
42.7.46.2^she herself however, with fragrant oil anointed the feet of me.
42.7.47.1^this therefore i say to you, have been forgiven the sins of her - many, for she loved much;
42.7.47.2^to whom however little is forgiven, little he loves.
42.7.48.1^he said then to her, have been forgiven your - sins.
42.7.49.1^and began those reclining to say within themselves, who this is who even sins forgives?
42.7.50.1^he said then to the woman, the faith of you has saved you;
42.7.50.2^go in peace.
42.8.1.1^and it came to pass afterward - soon, that he was traveling throughout city and village, preaching and proclaiming the good news of the kingdom - of god.
42.8.1.2^and the twelve were with him,
42.8.2.1^and women certain who had been cured from spirits evil and infirmities:
42.8.2.2^mary who is called magdalene, from whom demons seven had gone out;
42.8.3.1^and joanna wife of chuza, a steward of herod, and susanna, and others many, who were ministering to them out of the means their own.
42.8.4.1^as is assembling now a crowd great, and those from each town are coming to him, he spoke by a parable:
42.8.5.1^went out the one sowing - to sow the seed of him.
42.8.5.2^and in the sowing of him, some indeed fell along the road, and it was trampled upon, and the birds of the air devoured it.
42.8.6.1^and other fell upon the rock, and having sprung up it withered through - no having moisture.
42.8.7.1^and other fell in the midst of the thorns, and having sprung up with it, the thorns choked it.
42.8.8.1^and other fell upon the soil - good, and having sprung up, it produced fruit a hundredfold.
42.8.8.2^these things saying, he was calling out, the one having ears to hear, let him hear.
42.8.9.1^were asking then him the disciples of him, what this means, the parable?
42.8.10.1^- and he said, to you it has been given to know the mysteries of the kingdom - of god;
42.8.10.2^to however the rest, it is in parables, so that, seeing, not may they see;
42.8.10.3^and hearing, not may they understand.
42.8.11.1^is now this the parable:
42.8.11.2^the seed is the word - of god.
42.8.12.1^those now along the road are those having heard;
42.8.12.2^then comes the devil and takes away the word from the heart of them, that not having believed they should be saved.
42.8.13.1^those now upon the rock, those who when they hear, with joy receive the word, and these a root not have, who for a time believe, and in time of testing fall away.
42.8.14.1^that now into the thorns having fallen, these are those having heard, and under cares, and riches, and pleasures - of life, moving along are choked, and not do mature.
42.8.15.1^that now in the good soil, these are those in a heart worthy and good, having heard the word keep it, and bring forth fruit by perseverance.
42.8.16.1^no one now a lamp having lighted, covers it with a vessel, or under a bed puts it, but on a lampstand puts it, so that those entering in may see the light.
42.8.17.1^nothing for is hidden which not manifest will become, nor secret which nothing not shall be known, and to light come.
42.8.18.1^take heed therefore how you hear;
42.8.18.2^whoever - for might have, will be given to him;
42.8.18.3^and whoever - not might have, even what he seems to have will be taken away from him.
42.8.19.1^came then to him the mother and the brothers of him, and not they were able to get to him, because of the crowd.
42.8.20.1^it was told also him, the mother of you and the brothers of you are standing outside, to see wanting you.
42.8.21.1^- but answering, he said to them, mother of me and brothers of me, those are who the word - of god are hearing and doing.
42.8.22.1^it came to pass then, on one of the days also he entered into a boat with the disciples of him, and he said to them, let us pass over to the other side of the lake.
42.8.22.2^and they launched out.
42.8.23.1^sailing then of them, he fell asleep.
42.8.23.2^and came down a storm of wind on the lake, and they were being swamped and were in danger.
42.8.24.1^having come to him then, they awoke him, saying, master, master, we are perishing!
42.8.24.2^- and having arisen, he rebuked the wind and the raging of the water, and they ceased, and there was a calm.
42.8.25.1^he said then to them, where is the faith of you?
42.8.25.2^having been afraid then, they marveled, saying to one another, who then this is, that even the winds he commands and the water, and they obey him?
42.8.26.1^and they sailed down to the region of the gerasenes, which is opposite - galilee.
42.8.27.1^having gone forth then he upon the land, met him a man certain out of the city, having demons, and time a long not was wearing clothing, and in a house not did abide, but in the tombs.
42.8.28.1^having seen then - jesus, having cried out, he fell down before him, and in a voice loud said, what to me and to you, jesus, son - of god, the most high?
42.8.28.2^i implore of you not me you might torment!
42.8.29.1^he was commanding for the spirit - unclean to come out from the man.
42.8.29.2^many for times it had seized him, and he was bound, with chains and shackles being kept;
42.8.29.3^and breaking the chains, he was driven by the demon into the deserts.
42.8.30.1^asked now him - jesus, what your name is?
42.8.30.2^- and he said, legion, because were entered demons many into him.
42.8.31.1^and they were begging him, that not he would command them into the abyss to go away.
42.8.32.1^there was now there a herd of pigs many feeding, in the mountain, and they begged him that he would allow them into them to enter;
42.8.32.2^and he allowed them.
42.8.33.1^having gone out then the demons from the man, they entered into the pigs, and rushed the herd down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
42.8.34.1^having seen then those feeding them that having taken place, they fled and reported it to the city and to the country.
42.8.35.1^they went out then to see that having taken place, and they came to - jesus and found sitting the man from whom the demons had gone out, clothed and being of sound mind, at the feet - of jesus.
42.8.35.2^and they were afraid.
42.8.36.1^related then to them those having seen it, how was healed the one having been possessed by demons.
42.8.37.1^and asked him all the multitude of the surrounding region of the gerasenes to depart from them, because with fear great they were seized.
42.8.37.2^he now, having entered into the boat, turned back.
42.8.38.1^was begging however him the man from whom had gone the demons to be taken with him.
42.8.38.2^he sent away however him saying,
42.8.39.1^return to the house of you, and relate all that for you has done - god.
42.8.39.2^and he departed, through all the city proclaiming all that had done for him - jesus.
42.8.40.1^when then - returned - jesus, received him the crowd;
42.8.40.2^they were for all looking for him.
42.8.41.1^and behold, came a man whose name was jairus, and he a ruler of the synagogue was, and having fallen at the feet - of jesus, he began begging him to come to the house of him,
42.8.42.1^because daughter an only was to him, about years old twelve, and she was dying.
42.8.42.2^as then - went he, the crowds were pressing around him.
42.8.43.1^and a woman being with a flux of blood for years twelve, who on physicians having spent all her living, neither was able by no one to be healed,
42.8.44.1^having come behind, touched the fringe the of cloak of him, and immediately stopped the flux of the blood of her.
42.8.45.1^and said - jesus, who is the one having touched me?
42.8.45.2^were denying it however all;
42.8.45.3^said - peter, master, the people surround you and press in.
42.8.46.1^- but jesus said, touched me someone;
42.8.46.2^i for know power has gone out from me.
42.8.47.1^having seen then the woman that not she was hid, trembling she came, and having fallen down before him, for what cause she touched him she declared before all the people, and how she was healed immediately.
42.8.48.1^- and he said to her, daughter, the faith of you has healed you;
42.8.48.2^go in peace.
42.8.49.1^still of him speaking, comes one from the synagogue ruler, saying -, has died the daughter of you;
42.8.49.2^no longer trouble the teacher.
42.8.50.1^- but jesus having heard, answered him, not fear;
42.8.50.2^only believe, and she will be saved.
42.8.51.1^having entered then into the house, not he did allow to go in anyone with him, if not peter, and john, and james, and the father of the child, and the mother.
42.8.52.1^they were weeping now all and mourning for her.
42.8.52.2^- but he said, not weep;
42.8.52.3^not for she is dead, but sleeps.
42.8.53.1^and they were laughing at him, knowing that she was dead.
42.8.54.1^he now, having taken hold of the hand of her, called out, saying -, child, arise!
42.8.55.1^and returned the spirit of her, and she arose immediately;
42.8.55.2^and he directed to her to be given to eat.
42.8.56.1^and were amazed the parents of her;
42.8.56.2^- and he instructed them no one to tell what had happened.
42.9.1.1^having called together then the twelve, he gave to them power and authority over all the demons, and diseases to heal,
42.9.2.1^and he sent them to proclaim the kingdom - of god and to heal the sick,
42.9.3.1^and he said to them, nothing take for the journey;
42.9.3.2^neither staff, nor bag, nor bread, nor money, nor apiece two tunics to have.
42.9.4.1^and into whatever - house you might enter, there remain, and from there go forth.
42.9.5.1^and as many as - not might receive you, going forth from the city that, the dust from the feet of you shake off, as a testimony against them.
42.9.6.1^going forth then, they were passing through the villages, proclaiming the gospel and healing everywhere.
42.9.7.1^heard of now herod the tetrarch the things being done all, and was perplexed, because - it was said by some - john has been raised out from the dead,
42.9.8.1^by some also that elijah had appeared, by others also that a prophet one of the ancients had arisen.
42.9.9.1^said then herod, john i beheaded;
42.9.9.2^who however is this concerning whom i hear such things?
42.9.9.3^and he was seeking to see him.
42.9.10.1^and having returned, the apostles related to him whatever they had done.
42.9.10.2^and having taken them, he withdrew by himself into a town called bethsaida.
42.9.11.1^the now crowds having known it, followed him;
42.9.11.2^and having received them, he was speaking to them concerning the kingdom - of god, and those need having of healing, he was healing.
42.9.12.1^- and the day began to decline;
42.9.12.2^having come then the twelve said to him, dismiss the crowd, that having gone into the surrounding villages and countryside they might lodge, and might find provisions;
42.9.12.3^for here in a desolate place we are.
42.9.13.1^he said now to them, give to them you.
42.9.13.2^to eat - but they said, not there are to us more than loaves five, and fish two, if not having gone, we should buy for all the people this food.
42.9.14.1^they were for about men five thousand.
42.9.14.2^he said then to the disciples of him, make sit down them, groups of about in fifty.
42.9.15.1^and they did so and made sit down all.
42.9.16.1^having taken then the five loaves and the two fish, having looked up to the heaven, he blessed them and broke them, and he kept giving them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
42.9.17.1^and they ate and were satisfied all;
42.9.17.2^and was taken up that having been a surplus to them of fragments, hand-baskets twelve.
42.9.18.1^and it came to pass as - was he praying in solitary, were with him the disciples, and he questioned them, saying, whom me do pronounce the crowds to be?
42.9.19.1^- and answering, they said, john the baptist;
42.9.19.2^others also, elijah;
42.9.19.3^others now, that a prophet, one of the ancients, has arisen.
42.9.20.1^he said then to them, you however, whom me do pronounce to be?
42.9.20.2^peter then answering said, the christ - of god.
42.9.21.1^- and having strictly warned them, he instructed them to no one to tell this,
42.9.22.1^having said -, it is necessary for the son - of man many things to suffer, and to be rejected by the elders and chief priests and scribes, and to be killed, and on the third day to be raised.
42.9.23.1^he was saying then to all, if anyone desires after me to come, let him deny himself, and let him take up the cross of him every day, and let him follow me.
42.9.24.1^whoever for - might desire the life of him to save, will lose it;
42.9.24.2^whoever however - might lose the life of him on account of me, he will save it.
42.9.25.1^what for is profited a man, having gained the world whole, himself now having destroyed, or having suffered the loss of?
42.9.26.1^whoever for - may have been ashamed of me and - my words, him the son - of man will be ashamed of when he shall come in the glory of himself, and of the father, and of the holy angels.
42.9.27.1^i say now to you truthfully, there are some of those here standing, who no not shall taste of death until - they shall have seen the kingdom - of god.
42.9.28.1^it came to pass now after the sayings these, about days eight, and having taken peter and john and james, he went up on the mountain to pray.
42.9.29.1^and it came to pass in the praying of him, the appearance of the face of him was altered, and the clothing of him white became dazzling.
42.9.30.1^and behold, men two began talking with him, who were moses and elijah.
42.9.31.1^those having appeared in glory were speaking of the going out of him, which he was about to accomplish in jerusalem.
42.9.32.1^- and peter and those with him were heavy with sleep;
42.9.32.2^having awoken fully then they saw the glory of him, and the two men - standing with him.
42.9.33.1^and it came to pass in the departing of them from him, said - peter to - jesus, master, good it is for us here to be;
42.9.33.2^also let us make tabernacles three:
42.9.33.3^one for you, and one for moses, and one for elijah, not knowing what he is saying.
42.9.34.1^these things then as he is saying, came a cloud and was overshadowing them;
42.9.34.2^they feared then in the entering of them into the cloud.
42.9.35.1^and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, this is the son of me, - whom i have chosen;
42.9.35.2^him listen to!
42.9.36.1^and as - occurred the voice, was found jesus alone.
42.9.36.2^and they were silent, and to no one they told in those the days anything of what they had seen.
42.9.37.1^it came to pass then the next day, on having come down of them from the mountain, met him a crowd great.
42.9.38.1^and behold, a man from the crowd cried out, saying, teacher, i implore you to look upon the son of me, for an only child to me he is.
42.9.39.1^and behold, a spirit takes him, and suddenly he cries out, and it throws into convulsions him with foaming, and with difficulty it departs from him, bruising him.
42.9.40.1^and i begged the disciples of you that they might cast out it, and not they were able.
42.9.41.1^answering now, - jesus said, o generation unbelieving and perverted, until when will i be with you and bear with you?
42.9.41.2^bring here the son of you.
42.9.42.1^while then he was coming near of him, threw down him the demon and threw him into convulsions.
42.9.42.2^rebuked then - jesus the spirit - unclean, and healed the boy, and gave back him to father of him.
42.9.43.1^were astonished then all at the majesty - of god.
42.9.43.2^of all however wondering at all which he did, he said to the disciples of him,
42.9.44.1^let sink you into the ears of you the words these;
42.9.44.2^- for the son - of man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men.
42.9.45.1^- but they understand not the saying this, and it was veiled from them, that not they should understand it.
42.9.45.2^and they were afraid to ask him concerning the saying this.
42.9.46.1^came up then an argument among them, this, who - might be greatest of them.
42.9.47.1^- but jesus, having known the reasoning of the heart of them, having taken hold of a child, set it by him,
42.9.48.1^and he said to them, whoever if shall receive this - child in the name of me, me receives;
42.9.48.2^and whoever - me shall receive, receives the one having sent me.
42.9.48.3^the one for least among all you being, he shall be great.
42.9.49.1^answering now, john said, master, we saw someone in the name of you casting out demons, and we were forbidding him, because not he follows with us.
42.9.50.1^said then to him - jesus, not forbid;
42.9.50.2^whoever for not is against you, for you is.
42.9.51.1^it came to pass then in the completing the days of the ascension of him, that he the face steadfastly set - to go to jerusalem.
42.9.52.1^and he sent messengers before the face of him.
42.9.52.2^and having gone, they entered into a village of the samaritans, so as to make ready for him.
42.9.53.1^and not they did receive him, because the face of him was as going toward jerusalem.
42.9.54.1^having seen it now, the disciples james and john said, lord, will you that we should call fire to come down from - heaven and to consume them?
42.9.55.1^having turned then, he rebuked them.
42.9.56.1^and they went to another village.
42.9.57.1^and going of them along the road, said someone to him, i will follow you wherever if you may go.
42.9.58.1^and said to him - jesus, the foxes holes have, and the birds of the air nests;
42.9.58.2^- but the son - of man not has where the head he might lay.
42.9.59.1^he said then to another, follow me.
42.9.59.2^- but he said, lord allow me having gone away, first, to bury the father of me.
42.9.60.1^he said then to him, leave the dead to bury - their own dead;
42.9.60.2^you however, having gone forth, declare the kingdom - of god.
42.9.61.1^said then also another, i will follow you, lord;
42.9.61.2^first however allow me to bid farewell to those at the home of me.
42.9.62.1^said then to him - jesus, no one having laid the hand upon the plow, and looking on the things behind, fit is for the kingdom - of god.
42.10.1.1^after now these things, appointed the lord others seventy two and sent them in two by two before the face of himself into every city and place where was about he himself to go.
42.10.2.1^he was saying then to them, the indeed harvest is plentiful, - but the workmen are few.
42.10.2.2^pray earnestly to therefore the lord of the harvest, that workmen he may send out into the harvest of him.
42.10.3.1^go;
42.10.3.2^behold, i send forth you as lambs in the midst of wolves.
42.10.4.1^neither carry purse, nor bag, nor sandals;
42.10.4.2^and no one on the road greet.
42.10.5.1^into whatever now - you might enter house, first say peace to the house this.
42.10.6.1^and if there is a son of peace, will rest upon him the peace of you;
42.10.6.2^if however - not so, to you it will return.
42.10.7.1^in the same now - house remain, eating and drinking the things supplied by them;
42.10.7.2^worthy is for the workman of the wages of him.
42.10.7.3^not move from house to house.
42.10.8.1^and into whatever - city you might enter, and they receive you, eat the things set before you.
42.10.9.1^and heal - in it the sick, and say to them, has drawn near to you the kingdom - of god.
42.10.10.1^into whatever now - city you might enter, and not they receive you, having gone out into the streets of it, say,
42.10.11.1^even the dust - having clung to us out of the city of you to the feet, we wipe off against you;
42.10.11.2^yet this know, that has drawn near the kingdom - of god.
42.10.12.1^i say to you that for sodom in the day that, more tolerable it will be than the city for that.
42.10.13.1^woe to you, chorazin!
42.10.13.2^woe to you, bethsaida!
42.10.13.3^for if in tyre and sidon had taken place the miracles - having taken place in you, long ago - in sackcloth and ashes sitting, they would have repented.
42.10.14.1^but for tyre and sidon, more tolerable will it be in the judgment than for you.
42.10.15.1^and you, capernaum, not to heaven will you be lifted up;
42.10.15.2^to - hades you will be brought down.
42.10.16.1^the one hearing you, me hears;
42.10.16.2^and the one rejecting you, me rejects;
42.10.16.3^the one now me rejecting, rejects the one having sent me.
42.10.17.1^returned then the seventy two with joy, saying, lord, even the demons are subject to us through the name of you.
42.10.18.1^he said then to them, i beheld - satan as lightning out of the heaven having fallen.
42.10.19.1^behold, i give you the authority - to tread upon serpents and scorpions, and upon all the power of the enemy, and nothing you no not will injure.
42.10.20.1^yet in this not rejoice, that the spirits to you are subjected;
42.10.20.2^rejoice however that the names of you are written in the heavens.
42.10.21.1^in the same - hour, he rejoiced in the spirit - holy and said, i fully consent to you, father, lord of the heaven and of the earth, that you have hidden these things from wise and intelligent, and have revealed them to little children;
42.10.21.2^yes, - father, for thus well-pleasing was it before you.
42.10.22.1^all things to me have been delivered by the father of me.
42.10.22.2^and no one knows who is the son, if not the father;
42.10.22.3^and who is the father, if not the son, and to whom if might resolve the son to reveal him.
42.10.23.1^and having turned to the disciples in private, he said, blessed are the eyes - seeing what you see!
42.10.24.1^i say for to you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see, and not saw;
42.10.24.2^and to hear what you hear, and not heard.
42.10.25.1^and behold, a lawyer certain stood up, testing him, saying, teacher, what having done, life eternal will i inherit?
42.10.26.1^- and he said to him, in the law what has been written?
42.10.26.2^how read you?
42.10.27.1^- and answering, he said, you shall love the lord the god of you with all the heart of you, and with all the soul of you, and with all the strength of you, and with all the mind of you  and the neighbor of you as yourself.
42.10.28.1^he said then to him, correctly you have answered.
42.10.28.2^this do, and you will live.
42.10.29.1^- but desiring to justify himself, he said to - jesus, and who is my neighbor?
42.10.30.1^having taken it up, - jesus said, a man certain was going down from jerusalem to jericho, and robbers fell among, who both having stripped him, and wounds having inflicted, went away, having left him half dead.
42.10.31.1^by chance now a priest certain was going down on the road that, and having seen him he passed by on the opposite side.
42.10.32.1^likewise now also a levite having come to the spot, having come and having seen him, passed by on the opposite side.
42.10.33.1^a samaritan however, one journeying, came to him, and having seen was moved with compassion,
42.10.34.1^and having approached, he bound up the wounds of him, pouring on oil and wine;
42.10.34.2^having put then him on the own beast, he brought him to an inn and took care of him.
42.10.35.1^and on the next day, having taken out he gave them two denarii, to the innkeeper and said, take care of him, and whatever more - you might expend, of me on - returning, i will repay you.
42.10.36.1^which of these - three a neighbor seems to you to have been of the one having fallen among the robbers?
42.10.37.1^- and he said, the one having shown - compassion toward him.
42.10.37.2^said then to him - jesus, go and you do likewise.
42.10.38.1^in now the proceeding of them, he entered into a village certain;
42.10.38.2^a woman now certain named martha received him.
42.10.39.1^and she had a sister called mary, who also having sat down at the feet of the lord, was listening to the word of him.
42.10.40.1^- but martha was distracted about much service;
42.10.40.2^having come up now, she said, lord, not is it concerning to you that the sister of me alone me has left to serve?
42.10.40.3^speak therefore to her that me she might help!
42.10.41.1^answering now, said to her the lord, martha, martha, you are anxious and troubled about many things;
42.10.42.1^one thing however is necessary, mary for the good portion has chosen, which not will be taken away from her.
42.11.1.1^and it came to pass in - being his in a place certain praying, when he ceased, said one of the disciples of him to him, lord, teach us to pray, as also john taught the disciples of him.
42.11.2.1^he said then to them, when you pray, say:
42.11.2.2^father, hallowed be the name of you.
42.11.2.3^come the kingdom of you.
42.11.3.1^the bread of us - daily give us - each day.
42.11.4.1^and forgive us the sins of us, also for ourselves we forgive everyone indebted to us;
42.11.4.2^and not lead us into temptation.
42.11.5.1^and he said to them, who among you will have a friend, and will go to him at midnight and say to him, friend, lend me three loaves,
42.11.6.1^since a friend of my is come off a journey to me, and nothing i have what i will set before him.
42.11.7.1^and he from within answering will say, not me trouble cause;
42.11.7.2^already the door has been shut, and the children of me with me in the bed are;
42.11.7.3^not i am able having risen up, to give to you.
42.11.8.1^i say to you, if even not he will give to him, having risen up, because of - being friend of him, because of yet the persistence of him, having risen he will give him as much as he needs.
42.11.9.1^and i to you say, ask and it will be given to you;
42.11.9.2^seek and you will find;
42.11.9.3^knock and it will be opened to you.
42.11.10.1^everyone for - asking receives;
42.11.10.2^and the one seeking finds;
42.11.10.3^and to the one knocking, it will be opened.
42.11.11.1^which now of you who is a father, will ask for the son a fish, and instead of a fish, a serpent to him will he give?
42.11.12.1^or also if he will ask for an egg, will he give to him a scorpion?
42.11.13.1^if therefore you, evil being, know gifts good to give to the children of you, how much more the father who is in heaven will give the spirit holy to those asking him!
42.11.14.1^and he was casting out a demon, and it was mute;
42.11.14.2^it came to pass then the demon having gone out, spoke the mute man.
42.11.14.3^and marveled the crowds.
42.11.15.1^some then of them said, by beelzebul the prince of the demons he casts out the demons.
42.11.16.1^others now, testing, a sign from heaven were seeking from him.
42.11.17.1^he now, knowing their - thoughts, said to them, every kingdom against itself having been divided is brought to desolation;
42.11.17.2^and a house against a house falls.
42.11.18.1^if now also - satan against himself is divided, how will stand the kingdom of him?
42.11.18.2^for you say, by beelzebul cast out i the demons.
42.11.19.1^if now i by beelzebul cast out the demons, the sons of you, by whom do they cast out?
42.11.19.2^on account of this, they of you judges will be.
42.11.20.1^if however by the finger of god i cast out the demons, then has come upon you the kingdom - of god.
42.11.21.1^when the strong man being armed might guard - his house, in peace are the possessions of him;
42.11.22.1^when however one stronger than he, having come upon him, shall overcome him, the complete armor of him he takes away in which he had trusted, and the plunder of him he divides.
42.11.23.1^the one not being with me against me is;
42.11.23.2^and the one not gathering with me scatters.
42.11.24.1^when the unclean spirit is gone out from the man, it passes through waterless places seeking rest;
42.11.24.2^and not finding any, then it says, i will return to the house of me, from where i came out.
42.11.25.1^and having come, it finds it swept and put in order.
42.11.26.1^then it goes and takes other spirits more evil than itself, seven, and having entered, they dwell there;
42.11.26.2^and becomes the last of the man that worse than the first.
42.11.27.1^it came to pass then, in - saying his these things, having lifted up one her voice, a woman from the crowd said to him, blessed is the womb - having borne you, and the breasts at which you nursed.
42.11.28.1^he then said, no rather, blessed are those hearing the word - of god and keeping it.
42.11.29.1^of the now crowds being pressed around together, he began to say, the generation this, generation an evil is;
42.11.29.2^a sign it seeks after, and a sign not will be given to it, if not the sign of jonah.
42.11.30.1^as for was jonah to the ninevites a sign, thus will be also the son - of man to the generation this.
42.11.31.1^the queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with the men of the generation this, and will condemn them.
42.11.31.2^for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon, and behold, greater than solomon here.
42.11.32.1^the men of nineveh will stand up in the judgment with the generation this, and will condemn it.
42.11.32.2^for they repented at the preaching of jonah, and behold, greater than jonah is here.
42.11.33.1^but no one a lamp having lit, in secret sets it, nor under the basket, but upon the lampstand, that those entering in the light may see.
42.11.34.1^the lamp of your body is the eye of you.
42.11.34.2^when the eye of you clear is, also all the body of you light is;
42.11.34.3^when however evil it be, also the body of you is dark.
42.11.35.1^take heed therefore, lest the light that is in you darkness be.
42.11.36.1^if therefore the body of you is full of light, not having part any dark, it will be light all, as when the lamp - shining might light you.
42.11.37.1^in then the speaking, asked him a pharisee that he would dine with him, having entered then, he reclined.
42.11.38.1^- and the pharisee, having seen it, marveled that not first he washed before the dinner.
42.11.39.1^said then the lord to him, now you - pharisees, the outside of the cup and of the dish you cleanse, - and the inside of you is full of plundering and wickedness.
42.11.40.1^fools!
42.11.40.2^did not the one having made the outside, also the inside make?
42.11.41.1^but of the things being within give alms, and behold, all things clean to you are.
42.11.42.1^but woe to you - pharisees, for you pay tithes of - mint and - rue and every herb;
42.11.42.2^and you pass by the justice and the love - of god.
42.11.42.3^these things also it behooved you to do, and those not to neglect.
42.11.43.1^woe to you - pharisees, for you love the first seat in the synagogues and the greetings in the marketplaces.
42.11.44.1^woe to you, for you are like - graves - unmarked, and the men - walking above not have known it.
42.11.45.1^answering now, one of the lawyers says to him, teacher, these things saying, also us you insult.
42.11.46.1^- and he said, also to you the lawyers, woe!
42.11.46.2^for you burden the men with burdens heavy to bear, and yourselves with one of the fingers of you, not do touch the burdens.
42.11.47.1^woe to you, for you build the tombs of the prophets, - yet the fathers of you killed them.
42.11.48.1^so witnesses you are, and consent to the works of the fathers of you.
42.11.48.2^for they indeed killed them;
42.11.48.3^you now build their tombs.
42.11.49.1^because of this also the wisdom - of god said, i will send to them prophets and apostles, and some of them they will kill and persecute,
