42.11.50.1^so that might be charged the blood of all the prophets - having been poured out from the foundation of the world against the generation this,
42.11.51.1^from the blood of abel to the blood of zechariah, the one having perished between the altar and the house.
42.11.51.2^yes, i say to you, it will be required of the generation this.
42.11.52.1^woe to you, the lawyers, for you have taken away the key of the knowledge.
42.11.52.2^you yourselves not did enter, and those who are entering you hindered.
42.11.53.1^from there having gone forth of him, began the scribes and the pharisees urgently to press upon him and to make speak him about many things,
42.11.54.1^watching him to catch in something out of the mouth of him.
42.12.1.1^in these times, having been gathered together the myriads of the crowd so as to trample upon one another, he began to say to the disciples of him first, take heed to yourselves of the leaven, which is hypocrisy, of the pharisees.
42.12.2.1^nothing now concealed up is, which not will be revealed, nor hidden which not will be known.
42.12.3.1^instead, that whatever in the darkness you have said, in the light will be heard;
42.12.3.2^and what into the ear you have spoken in the inner rooms will be proclaimed upon the housetops.
42.12.4.1^i say now to you, those friends of me, not you should fear because of those killing the body and after these things not being able more abundantly anything to do.
42.12.5.1^i will show however you whom you should fear:
42.12.5.2^fear the one who after the killing, has authority to cast into - hell.
42.12.5.3^yes, i say to you, him fear.
42.12.6.1^not five sparrows are sold for assarion two?
42.12.6.2^and one of them not is forgotten before - god.
42.12.7.1^but even the hairs of the head of you all have been numbered.
42.12.7.2^not fear, than many sparrows you are more valuable.
42.12.8.1^i say now to you, everyone who - will confess in me before the men, also the son - of man will confess in him before the angels - of god;
42.12.9.1^the one now having denied me before - men, will be denied before the angels - of god.
42.12.10.1^and everyone who will speak a word against the son - of man, it will be forgiven him;
42.12.10.2^the one however against the holy spirit having blasphemed, not will be forgiven.
42.12.11.1^when then they bring you before the synagogues, and the rulers, and the authorities, not be anxious how or what you shall reply in defense, or what you should say;
42.12.12.1^the for holy spirit will teach you in same the hour what it behooves you to say.
42.12.13.1^said then one from the crowd to him, teacher, say to the brother of me to divide with me the inheritance.
42.12.14.1^- and he said to him, man, who me appointed a judge or partitioner over you?
42.12.15.1^he said then to them, beware and keep yourselves from all covetousness;
42.12.15.2^for not in the abundance to anyone, the life to him is of that which possesses of him.
42.12.16.1^he spoke then a parable to them, saying, of a man certain rich brought forth abundantly the ground.
42.12.17.1^and he was reasoning within himself, saying, what shall i do, for not i have where i will store up the fruits of me?
42.12.18.1^and he said, this will i do:
42.12.18.2^i will tear down my - barns and greater will build, and will store up there all the grain and the goods of me.
42.12.19.1^and i will say to the soul of me, soul, you have many good things laid up for years many;
42.12.19.2^take your rest;
42.12.19.3^eat, drink, be merry.
42.12.20.1^said then to him - god, fool!
42.12.20.2^this - night, the soul of you is required of you;
42.12.20.3^what now you did prepare   to whom will it be?
42.12.21.1^so is the one treasuring up for himself, and not toward god being rich.
42.12.22.1^he said then to the disciples of him, because of this i say to you, not be anxious for the life, what you should eat, nor for the body what you should put on.
42.12.23.1^the for life more than is the food, and the body than the clothing.
42.12.24.1^consider the ravens, that not they sow nor reap;
42.12.24.2^to them not there is a storehouse nor barn   and - god feeds them.
42.12.24.3^how much more you are valuable than the birds!
42.12.25.1^which now of you, being anxious, is able to the lifespan of him to add one hour?
42.12.26.1^if then not even the least you are able to do, why about the rest are you anxious?
42.12.27.1^consider the lilies, how they grow:
42.12.27.2^not do they labor, nor do they spin.
42.12.27.3^i say however to you, not even solomon in all the glory of him was arrayed as one of these.
42.12.28.1^if however in the field the grass, being here today and tomorrow into the furnace being thrown, - god thus clothes, how much more you, o you of little faith!
42.12.29.1^and you not seek what you might eat, and what you might drink, and not be in suspense;
42.12.30.1^these things for all the nations of the world seek after;
42.12.30.2^of you now the father knows that you have need of these.
42.12.31.1^but seek you the kingdom of him, and these things will be added to you.
42.12.32.1^not fear, - little flock, for took delight the father of you to give you the kingdom.
42.12.33.1^sell the possessions of you and give alms;
42.12.33.2^make to yourselves purses not growing old, a treasure unfailing in the heavens, where thief not does draw near, nor moth destroy.
42.12.34.1^where for is the treasure of you, there also the heart of you will be.
42.12.35.1^let be your - waist girded about, and the lamps burning;
42.12.36.1^and you, like to men waiting for the master of themselves, whenever he shall return from the wedding feasts, that having come and having knocked, immediately they might open to him.
42.12.37.1^blessed are the servants those, whom having come, the master will find watching.
42.12.37.2^truly i say to you that he will gird himself and will make recline them, and having come up, will serve them.
42.12.38.1^and if in the second and if in the third watch he comes and finds them thus, blessed are those!
42.12.39.1^this however know, that if had known the master of the house in what hour the thief is coming, not - he would have allowed to be broken into the house of him.
42.12.40.1^also you be ready;
42.12.40.2^for in the hour not you expect, the son - of man comes.
42.12.41.1^said then - peter, lord, to us the parable this speak you, or also to all?
42.12.42.1^and said the lord, who then is the faithful manager and the wise, whom will set the master over the care of servants of him, - to give them in season the measure of food?
42.12.43.1^blessed is the servant that whom having come, the master of him will find doing thus.
42.12.44.1^of a truth i say to you that over all the possessions of him he will set him.
42.12.45.1^if however should say the servant that in the heart of him, delays the master of me to come, and should begin to beat the men-servants and the maid-servants, to eat also and to drink and to get drunk,
42.12.46.1^will come the master of the servant that in a day in which not he does expect, and in an hour that not he knows, and he will cut in two him and the place of him with the unbelievers will appoint.
42.12.47.1^that now - servant, the one having known the will of the master of him and not having prepared, nor having done according to the will of him, will be beaten with many blows;
42.12.48.1^the one however not having known, having done however things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few.
42.12.48.2^everyone now to whom has been given much, much will be required from him;
42.12.48.3^and to whom has been committed much, the more will they ask of him.
42.12.49.1^fire i came to cast upon the earth, and how i wish if already it be kindled!
42.12.50.1^baptism however i have to be baptized with, and how i am distressed until while it should be accomplished!
42.12.51.1^think you that peace i came to give on the earth?
42.12.51.2^no, i say to you, but rather division.
42.12.52.1^there will be for from - now five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.
42.12.53.1^they will be divided father against son and son against father, mother against - daughter and daughter against - mother, mother-in-law against the daughter-in-law of her and daughter-in-law against - mother-in-law.
42.12.54.1^he was saying now also to the crowds, when you see a cloud rising up from the west, immediately you say -, a shower is coming, and it happens so.
42.12.55.1^and when a south wind is blowing, you say -, heat there will be, and it happens.
42.12.56.1^hypocrites!
42.12.56.2^the appearance of the earth and of the sky you know how to discern;
42.12.56.3^the time however this, how not do you know to discern?
42.12.57.1^why now even for yourselves not judge you what is right?
42.12.58.1^as for you are going with the adversary of you before a magistrate, in the way give earnestness to be set free from him, lest ever he should drag away you to the judge, and the judge you will deliver to the officer, and the officer you will cast into prison.
42.12.59.1^i say to you, no not shall you come out from there until even the last lepton you shall have paid.
42.13.1.1^were present now some at the same - time, telling him about the galileans of whom the blood pilate had mingled with the sacrifices of them.
42.13.2.1^and answering, he said to them, think you that - galileans these, sinners beyond all the galileans were, because such things they have suffered?
42.13.3.1^no, i say to you;
42.13.3.2^but if not you repent, all likewise you will perish.
42.13.4.1^or those - ten and eight on whom fell the tower in - siloam and killed them, think you that these debtors were beyond all the men - dwelling in jerusalem?
42.13.5.1^no, i say to you;
42.13.5.2^but if not you repent, all likewise you will perish.
42.13.6.1^he was speaking then this - parable:
42.13.6.2^a fig tree had a certain man planted in the vineyard of him;
42.13.6.3^and he came seeking fruit on it, and not did find any.
42.13.7.1^he said then to the vinedresser, behold, three years throughout these i come seeking fruit on the fig tree this, and not do find any.
42.13.7.2^cut down therefore it, that why even the ground should it use up?
42.13.8.1^- and answering, he says to him, sir, let alone it also this the year, until when i shall dig around it, and put in manure,
42.13.9.1^and if indeed it should bear fruit in the time, so be it.
42.13.9.2^if however - not, you will cut down it.
42.13.10.1^he was now teaching in one of the synagogues on the sabbaths.
42.13.11.1^and behold, a woman a spirit having of infirmity, years ten and eight.
42.13.11.2^and she was bent over and not able to lift up herself to the full.
42.13.12.1^having seen then her, - jesus called her near and said to her, woman, you have been freed from the sickness of you.
42.13.13.1^and he laid upon her the hands, and immediately she was made straight and began to glorify - god.
42.13.14.1^answering now the ruler of the synagogue, indignant because on the sabbath had healed - jesus, he was saying to the crowd -, six days there are in which it behooves to work;
42.13.14.2^in these therefore coming be healed, and not on the day of the sabbath.
42.13.15.1^answered therefore him the lord and said, hypocrites!
42.13.15.2^each one of you on the sabbath, not does he untie the ox of him, or the donkey, from the stall, and having led it away, give it to drink?
42.13.16.1^this now, a daughter of abraham being, whom has bound - satan, behold, ten and eight years, not ought she to be loosed from the bond this on the day of the sabbath?
42.13.17.1^and these things on saying of him, were ashamed all those opposed to him;
42.13.17.2^and all the crowd was rejoicing at all the glorious things that were being done by him.
42.13.18.1^he was saying then, to what like is the kingdom - of god?
42.13.18.2^and to what shall i liken it?
42.13.19.1^like it is to a grain of mustard, which having taken, a man cast into garden his;
42.13.19.2^and it grew and came into a tree, and the birds of the air encamped in the branches of it.
42.13.20.1^and again he said, to what shall i liken the kingdom - of god?
42.13.21.1^like it is to leaven, which having taken, a woman hid in of meal measures three until it was leavened all.
42.13.22.1^and he was going through by towns and villages, teaching, and progress making toward jerusalem.
42.13.23.1^said then one to him, lord, if are few those being saved?
42.13.23.2^- and he said to them,
42.13.24.1^strive to enter in through the narrow door;
42.13.24.2^for many, i say to you, will seek to enter in, and not will be able.
42.13.25.1^from what - shall have risen up the master of the house, and shall have shut the door, then you should begin outside to stand and to knock at the door, saying, lord, open to us.
42.13.25.2^and he answering, will say to you, not i do know you, from where are.
42.13.26.1^then will you begin to say, we ate in presence of you and drank, and in the streets of us you taught.
42.13.27.1^and he will say, i tell you, not i do know you from where you are;
42.13.27.2^depart from me, all you workers of unrighteousness.
42.13.28.1^there will be the weeping and the gnashing of the teeth when you see abraham, and isaac, and jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom - of god;
42.13.28.2^you however are being cast out.
42.13.29.1^and they will come from east and west, and from north and south, and will recline in the kingdom - of god.
42.13.30.1^and behold, there are last who will be first, and there are first who will be last.
42.13.31.1^in same the hour came near certain pharisees, saying to him, go out and proceed from here, for herod desires you to kill.
42.13.32.1^and he said to them, having gone, say to the fox that, behold, i cast out demons, and cures i complete today and tomorrow, and the third day i am perfected.
42.13.33.1^but it behooves me today and tomorrow and the day following to proceed;
42.13.33.2^for not it is possible for a prophet to perish outside of jerusalem.
42.13.34.1^jerusalem, jerusalem, - killing the prophets, and stoning those having been sent to her, how often i have wanted to gather those children of you, that way a hen gathers - her brood under the wings, and not you were willing.
42.13.35.1^behold, is left to you the house of you.
42.13.35.2^i say now to you, no not shall you see me until the time comes when you say, blessed is the one coming in the name of the lord.
42.14.1.1^and it came to pass on the going of him into a house of one of the rulers of the pharisees on a sabbath to eat bread, and they were watching him.
42.14.2.1^and behold, a man certain there was with dropsy before him.
42.14.3.1^and answering, - jesus spoke to the lawyers and to the pharisees, saying, is it lawful on the sabbath to heal or not?
42.14.4.1^- but they were silent.
42.14.4.2^and having taken hold of him, he healed him and let him go.
42.14.5.1^and to them he said, which of you a son or an ox into a pit will fall, also not immediately he will pull up him on day the sabbath?
42.14.6.1^and not they were able to reply to these things.
42.14.7.1^he was speaking then to those having been invited a parable, remarking how the first places they were choosing out, saying to them,
42.14.8.1^when you are invited by anyone to wedding feasts, not do recline in the first place, lest ever one more honorable than you might have been invited by him,
42.14.9.1^and having come, the one you and him having invited will say to you, give to this one your place, and then you should begin with shame the last place to take.
42.14.10.1^but when you are invited, having gone, recline in the last place, so that when might come the one having invited you, he will say to you, friend, come up higher.
42.14.10.2^then will be to you glory before all those reclining with you.
42.14.11.1^for everyone - exalting himself will be humbled, and the one humbling himself will be exalted.
42.14.12.1^he was saying then also to the one having invited him, when you make a dinner or a supper, not call - friends of you, nor the brothers of you, nor the relatives of you, nor neighbors rich, lest ever also they should invite in return you, and be made recompense to you.
42.14.13.1^but when a feast you make, call the poor, the crippled, the lame, the blind;
42.14.14.1^and blessed you will be, because nothing they have to repay you.
42.14.14.2^it will be recompensed for to you in the resurrection of the righteous.
42.14.15.1^having heard then one of those reclining with him these things, he said to him, blessed is he who will eat bread in the kingdom - of god.
42.14.16.1^- but he said to him, a man certain was preparing a supper great, and invited many.
42.14.17.1^and he sent the servant of him at the hour of the supper to say to those having been invited, come, for now ready it is.
42.14.18.1^and began with one voice all to excuse themselves.
42.14.18.2^the first said to him, a field i have bought, and i have need going out to see it;
42.14.18.3^i beg of you, hold me excused.
42.14.19.1^and another said, yoke of oxen i have bought five, and i am going to prove them;
42.14.19.2^i beg of you hold me excused.
42.14.20.1^and another said, a wife i have married, and because of this not i am able to come.
42.14.21.1^and having come, the servant reported to the master of him these things.
42.14.21.2^then having become angry, the master of the house said to servant of him, go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and the poor and crippled and blind and lame bring in here.
42.14.22.1^and said the servant, sir, it has been done as you did command, and still room there is.
42.14.23.1^and said the master to the servant, go out into the highways and hedges and compel them to come in, so that may be filled of me the house.
42.14.24.1^i say for to you that not one the men of those - having been invited will taste of me the supper.
42.14.25.1^were going with then him crowds great;
42.14.25.2^and having turned, he said to them,
42.14.26.1^if anyone comes to me, and not hates the father of himself and the mother and the wife and the children and the brothers and the sisters, yes, and even the life of him, not he is able to be of me disciple.
42.14.27.1^whoever not carries the cross of himself and comes after me, not is able to be my disciple.
42.14.28.1^which for of you, desiring a tower to build, not first having sat down, counts the cost, whether he has for its completion?
42.14.29.1^thus not ever he having laid of it a foundation, and not being able to finish, all - seeing it may begin him to mock,
42.14.30.1^saying -, this - man began to build and not was able to finish.
42.14.31.1^or what king, proceeding with another king to engage in war, not, having sat down, first will take counsel whether able he is with ten thousand to meet the one with twenty thousand coming against him?
42.14.32.1^if now - not, still of him far off being, an embassy having sent, he asks - for peace.
42.14.33.1^so therefore every one of you who not does give up all that he himself possesses, not is able to be my disciple.
42.14.34.1^good is therefore the salt;
42.14.34.2^if however even the salt becomes tasteless, with what will it be seasoned?
42.14.35.1^neither for soil nor for manure fit is it;
42.14.35.2^out they cast it.
42.14.35.3^the one having ears to hear, let him hear.
42.15.1.1^were now to him drawing near all the tax collectors and the sinners to hear him.
42.15.2.1^and were grumbling the both pharisees and the scribes, saying -, this man sinners receives and eats with them.
42.15.3.1^he spoke then to them the parable this, saying,
42.15.4.1^what man of you, having a hundred sheep, and having lost of them one, not leaves the ninety nine in the open field, and goes after the one having been lost, until he finds it?
42.15.5.1^and having found it, he lays it on the shoulders of him, rejoicing.
42.15.6.1^and having come to the house, he calls together the friends and the neighbors, saying to them, rejoice with me, for i have found the sheep of me, the one having been lost!
42.15.7.1^i say to you that in the same way joy in - heaven there will be over one sinner repenting, rather than over ninety nine righteous ones, who no need have of repentance.
42.15.8.1^or what woman, drachmas having ten, if she should lose drachma one, not lights a lamp and sweeps the house, and seeks carefully until it she finds?
42.15.9.1^and having found it, she calls together the friends and neighbors, saying, rejoice with me, for i have found the drachma that i lost.
42.15.10.1^thus i say to you, there is joy before the angels - of god over one sinner repenting.
42.15.11.1^he said then, a man certain had two sons.
42.15.12.1^and said the younger of them to the father, father, give to me the falling to me portion of the property.
42.15.12.2^- and he divided between them the property.
42.15.13.1^and after not many days, having gathered together all, the younger son went away into a country distant, and there he wasted the estate of him, living prodigally.
42.15.14.1^having spent however of him all, there arose a famine severe throughout the country that, and he began to be in need.
42.15.15.1^and having gone, he joined himself to one of the citizens the country of that, and he sent him into the fields of him to feed pigs.
42.15.16.1^and he was longing to be filled from the pods that were eating the pigs;
42.15.16.2^and no one was giving to him.
42.15.17.1^to himself however having come, he was saying, how many hired servants of the father of me have abundance of bread, i however with hunger here am perishing?
42.15.18.1^having risen up, i will go to the father of me, and i will say to him, father, i have sinned against - heaven and before you;
42.15.19.1^no longer am i worthy to be called son of you.
42.15.19.2^make me like one of the servants of you.
42.15.20.1^and having risen up, he went to the father of himself.
42.15.20.2^still now he far being distant, saw him the father of him, and was moved with compassion, and having run, fell upon the neck of him and kissed him.
42.15.21.1^said then the son to him, father, i have sinned against - heaven and before you;
42.15.21.2^no longer am i worthy to be called son of you.
42.15.22.1^said then the father to the servants of him, quickly bring out robe the best and clothe him, and give a ring for the hand of him, and sandals for his feet;
42.15.23.1^and having brought the calf - fattened, kill it, and having eaten, let us be merry.
42.15.24.1^for this - son of mine dead was, and is alive again;
42.15.24.2^he was lost, and is found.
42.15.24.3^and they began to be merry.
42.15.25.1^was now the son of him, the elder, in the field;
42.15.25.2^and while coming up, he drew near to the house, he heard music and dancing.
42.15.26.1^and having called near one of the servants, he began inquiring what - might be these things.
42.15.27.1^- and he said to him -, the brother of you is come, and has killed the father of you the calf - fattened, because in good health him he has received.
42.15.28.1^he was angry however, and not was willing to go in.
42.15.28.2^- and the father of him, having gone, was begging him.
42.15.29.1^- and answering, he said to the father of him, behold, so many years i serve you, and never a commandment of you i disobeyed, and to me never did you give a young goat, that with the friends of me i might make merry.
42.15.30.1^when however the son of you this, the one having devoured your - living with prostitutes, came, you have killed for him the fattened calf!
42.15.31.1^- and he said to him, son, you always with me are, and all that is mine, yours is.
42.15.32.1^to make merry however and to rejoice it was fitting, because the brother of you this, dead was, and is alive again;
42.15.32.2^and he was lost, and is found.
42.16.1.1^he was saying now also to the disciples, a man certain there was rich, who had a manager, and he was accused unto him as is wasting the possessions of him.
42.16.2.1^and having called him, he said to him, what is this i hear concerning you?
42.16.2.2^give the account of the stewardship of you;
42.16.2.3^not for you are able any longer to manage.
42.16.3.1^said then within himself the manager, what shall i do, for the master of me is taking away the management from me?
42.16.3.2^to dig not i am able;
42.16.3.3^to beg i am ashamed.
42.16.4.1^i know what i will do so that when i shall have been removed from the management, they might receive me into the homes of them.
42.16.5.1^and having called to him one each of the debtors of the master of him, he was saying to the first, how much owe you to master of me?
42.16.6.1^- and he said, a hundred baths of oil.
42.16.6.2^- and he said to him, take your the bill and, having sat down quickly, write fifty.
42.16.7.1^then to another he said, you now how much owe?
42.16.7.2^- and he said, a hundred cors of wheat.
42.16.7.3^he says to him, take your - bill and write eighty.
42.16.8.1^and praised the master the manager - unrighteous, because shrewdly he had acted.
42.16.8.2^for the sons of the age this more shrewd than the sons of the light in the generation - of themselves are.
42.16.9.1^and i to you say, for yourselves make friends by the wealth - of unrighteousness, that when it fails they might receive you into the eternal dwellings.
42.16.10.1^the one faithful with very little, also with much faithful is;
42.16.10.2^and the one with very little unrighteous, also with much unrighteous is.
42.16.11.1^if therefore in the unrighteous wealth, faithful not you have been, the true riches who to you will entrust?
42.16.12.1^and if in that which is of another, faithful not you have been, that which is yours who to you?
42.16.12.2^will give
42.16.13.1^no servant is able two masters to serve;
42.16.13.2^either for the one he will hate, and the other he will love;
42.16.13.3^or one he will be devoted to, and the other he will despise.
42.16.13.4^not you are able god to serve and money.
42.16.14.1^were listening to now these things all the pharisees, lovers of money being, and they were ridiculing him.
42.16.15.1^and he said to them, you are those justifying themselves before - men, - but god knows the hearts of you;
42.16.15.2^for that which among men is exalted is an abomination before - god.
42.16.16.1^the law and the prophets were until john;
42.16.16.2^from that time the kingdom - of god is proclaimed, and everyone into it forces his way.
42.16.17.1^easier for however it is the heaven and the earth to pass away, than of the law one stroke of a pen to fail.
42.16.18.1^everyone - putting away the wife of him and marrying another commits adultery.
42.16.18.2^and the one her put away from a husband marrying commits adultery.
42.16.19.1^a man now certain there was rich, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, making good cheer every day in splendor.
42.16.20.1^a poor man now certain named lazarus was laid at the gate of him, being full of sores
42.16.21.1^and desiring to be fed from that falling from the table of the rich man;
42.16.21.2^but even the dogs, coming, were licking the sores of him.
42.16.22.1^it came to pass that then died the poor man, and was carried away he by the angels into the bosom of abraham.
42.16.22.2^died then also the rich man and was buried.
42.16.23.1^and in - hades, having lifted up the eyes of him, being in torment, he sees abraham from afar, and lazarus in the bosom of him.
42.16.24.1^and he having cried out said, father abraham, have mercy on me and send lazarus, that he might dip the tip of the finger of him in water and cool the tongue of me;
42.16.24.2^for i am suffering in the flame this.
42.16.25.1^said then abraham, child, remember that you did fully receive the things good of you in the lifetime of you, and lazarus likewise the things evil.
42.16.25.2^now however here he is comforted;
42.16.25.3^you now are suffering.
42.16.26.1^and besides all these things, between us and you a chasm great has been fixed, so that those desiring to pass from here to you not are able, nor from there to us can they pass.
42.16.27.1^he said then, i implore you then, father, that you would send him to the house of the father of me
42.16.28.1^i have for five brothers   so that he might warn them, that not also they might come to the place this - of torment.
42.16.29.1^says however abraham, they have moses and the prophets;
42.16.29.2^let them hear them.
42.16.30.1^- and he said, no, father abraham, but if one from the dead should go to them, they will repent.
42.16.31.1^he said however to him, if moses and the prophets not they hear, not even if one out from the dead should rise, will they be persuaded.
42.17.1.1^he said then to the disciples of him, impossible it is for the stumbling blocks not to come, but woe to him by whom they come!
42.17.2.1^it is better for him if a stone of a mill is hung around the neck of him and he is thrown into the sea, than that he should cause to stumble - little of these one.
42.17.3.1^take heed to yourselves.
42.17.3.2^if should sin the brother of you, rebuke him;
42.17.3.3^and if he should repent, forgive him.
42.17.4.1^and if seven times in the day he should sin against you, and seven times should return to you, saying i repent, you shall forgive him.
42.17.5.1^and said the apostles to the lord, add to us faith!
42.17.6.1^said then the lord, if you have faith like a grain of mustard, you would have said - to the mulberry tree this, be uprooted and be planted in the sea, and it would have obeyed - you.
42.17.7.1^which now of you a servant having, plowing or shepherding, the one having come in out of the field, will say to him, immediately having come, recline?
42.17.8.1^but not will he say to him, prepare what i may eat, and having girded yourself about, serve me while i eat and drink;
42.17.8.2^and after these things shall eat and drink you?
42.17.9.1^not is he thankful to the servant because he did the things having been commanded?
42.17.10.1^thus also you, when you may have done all the things having been commanded you, say -, servants unworthy are we;
42.17.10.2^that which we were bound to do, we have done.
42.17.11.1^and it came to pass in the going up to jerusalem that he was passing through the midst of samaria and galilee.
42.17.12.1^and on entering of him into a certain village, met him ten leprous men, who stood afar off.
42.17.13.1^and they lifted up their voice, saying, jesus, master, have compassion on us.
42.17.14.1^and having seen them, he said to them, having gone, show yourselves to the priests.
42.17.14.2^and it came to pass in the going them, they were cleansed.
42.17.15.1^one then of them, having seen that he was healed, turned back, with a voice loud glorifying - god,
42.17.16.1^and he fell on his face at the feet of him, giving thanks to him;
42.17.16.2^and he was a samaritan.
42.17.17.1^having answered then, - jesus said, not the ten were cleansed?
42.17.17.2^- but the nine are where?
42.17.18.1^none was there found having returned to give glory - to god, if not the foreigner this?
42.17.19.1^and he said to him, having risen up go forth;
42.17.19.2^the faith of you has cured you!
42.17.20.1^having been asked now by the pharisees when is coming the kingdom - of god, he answered them and said, not comes the kingdom - of god with careful observation,
42.17.21.1^nor will they say, behold here, or there.
42.17.21.2^behold for, the kingdom - of god in the midst of you is.
42.17.22.1^he said then to the disciples, will come days when you will desire one of the days of the son - of man to see, and not you will see it.
42.17.23.1^and they will say to you, behold there, or behold here.
42.17.23.2^not go forth nor follow.
42.17.24.1^as for the lightning flashing from the one end of the sky to the other end of the sky shines, thus will be the son - of man in the day of him.
42.17.25.1^first however it behooves him many things to suffer, and to be rejected by the generation this.
42.17.26.1^and as it came to pass in the days of noah, thus will it be also in the days of the son of man:
42.17.27.1^they were eating, they were drinking, they were marrying, they were being given in marriage, until that day entered noah into the ark, and came the flood and destroyed all.
42.17.28.1^likewise, as it came to pass in the days of lot, they were eating, they were drinking, they were buying, they were selling, they were planting, they were building;
42.17.29.1^in that then day went out lot from sodom, it rained fire and brimstone from heaven and destroyed all.
42.17.30.1^according - to these will it be in that day the son - of man is revealed.
42.17.31.1^in that - day, the one who will be on the housetop, and the goods of him in the house, not let him come down to take away them;
42.17.31.2^and the one in the field, likewise not let him return to the things behind.
42.17.32.1^remember the wife of lot!
42.17.33.1^whoever if may seek the life of him to save, will lose it;
42.17.33.2^whoever also - will lose it, will preserve it.
42.17.34.1^i say to you, in that - night there will be two upon bed one:
42.17.34.2^the one will be taken, and the other will be left.
42.17.35.1^there will be two women grinding at the same place:
42.17.35.2^the one will be taken, - and the other will be left.
42.17.37.1^and answering, they say to him, where, lord?
42.17.37.2^- and he said to them, where the body is, there also the vultures will be gathered together.
42.18.1.1^he was speaking then a parable to them about the way it behooves always to pray them and not to lose heart,
42.18.2.1^saying, a judge certain there was in a certain city, - god not fearing and man not respecting.
42.18.3.1^a widow then there was in the city that, and she was coming to him, saying, avenge me of the adversary of me.
42.18.4.1^and not he would for a time;
42.18.4.2^afterward however he said within himself, if even - god not i fear, nor man respect,
42.18.5.1^because yet - causes me trouble the widow this, i will avenge her, so that not to end coming, she exhaust me.
42.18.6.1^said then the lord, hear what the judge - unrighteous says.
42.18.7.1^- and god no not shall execute the avenging of the elect of him, the ones crying out to him day and night, and be deferring in regard to them?
42.18.8.1^i say to you that he will execute the avenging of them in quickness.
42.18.8.2^nevertheless, the son - of man having come, indeed will he find - faith on the earth?
42.18.9.1^he spoke now also to some - trusting in themselves that they are righteous, and despising the others, the parable this:
42.18.10.1^men two went up into the temple to pray, the one a pharisee, and the other a tax collector.
42.18.11.1^the pharisee, having stood, toward himself thus was praying, - god, i thank you that not i am like the rest of the men   swindlers, unrighteous, adulterers   or even like this - tax collector.
42.18.12.1^i fast twice in the week;
42.18.12.2^i tithe all things, as many as i gain.
42.18.13.1^- but the tax collector, afar off standing, not was willing not even the eyes to lift up to - heaven, but was striking the breast of himself, saying -, god, be merciful to me, the sinner!
42.18.14.1^i say to you, went down this one justified to the house of him, rather than that.
42.18.14.2^for everyone - exalting himself will be humbled;
42.18.14.3^the one however humbling himself will be exalted.
42.18.15.1^they were bringing then to him also the infants, that them he might touch;
42.18.15.2^having seen however, the disciples were rebuking them.
42.18.16.1^- but jesus, having called to him them, said, permit the little children to come to me, and not do forbid them;
42.18.16.2^of the for such is the kingdom - of god.
42.18.17.1^truly i say to you, whoever - not shall receive the kingdom - of god as a child, no not shall enter into it.
42.18.18.1^and asked a certain him ruler, saying, teacher good, what having done, life eternal will i inherit?
42.18.19.1^said then to him - jesus, why me call you good?
42.18.19.2^no one is good, if not alone - god.
42.18.20.1^the commandments you know:
42.18.20.2^not shall you commit adultery, not shall you murder, not shall you steal, not shall you bear false witness, you shall honor the father of you and the mother.
42.18.21.1^- and he said, these all have i kept from the youth
42.18.22.1^having heard then, - jesus said to him, yet one thing to you is lacking:
42.18.22.2^all, as much as you have, sell, and distribute to the poor, and you will have treasure in the heavens;
42.18.22.3^and come, follow me.
42.18.23.1^- and having heard these things, very sorrowful he became;
42.18.23.2^he was for rich extremely.
42.18.24.1^having seen then him, - jesus sorrowful became, saying, how difficultly those - riches having, into the kingdom - of god shall enter.
42.18.25.1^easier for it is a camel through an eye of a needle to go, than a rich man into the kingdom - of god to enter.
42.18.26.1^said then those having heard, then who is able to be saved?
42.18.27.1^- but he said, the things impossible with men, possible with - god are.
42.18.28.1^said then - peter, behold, we having left the own, followed you.
42.18.29.1^- and he said to them, truly i say to you that no one there is who has left house or wife or brothers or parents or children for the sake of the kingdom - of god,
42.18.30.1^who no nothing shall receive manifold more in the time this   and in the age that is coming, life eternal.
42.18.31.1^having taken aside then the twelve, he said to them, behold, we go up to jerusalem, and will be accomplished all things - having been written by the prophets about the son - of man.
42.18.32.1^he will be betrayed for to the gentiles, and will be mocked, and will be insulted, and will be spit upon.
42.18.33.1^and having flogged him, they will kill him;
42.18.33.2^and on the day - third he will rise again.
42.18.34.1^and they none of these things understood;
42.18.34.2^and was the word this hidden from them, and neither they knew the things being spoken.
42.18.35.1^it came to pass then in the drawing near of him to jericho, a blind man certain was sitting beside the road, begging.
42.18.36.1^having heard now a crowd passing along, he was asking what might be this.
42.18.37.1^they told then him -, jesus of nazareth is passing by.
42.18.38.1^and he called out saying, jesus, son of david, have mercy on me.
42.18.39.1^and those going before were rebuking him, that he should be silent.
42.18.39.2^he however much more kept crying out, son of david, have mercy on me.
42.18.40.1^having stopped then, - jesus commanded him to be brought to him.
42.18.40.2^having drawn near then him, he asked him,
42.18.41.1^what to you desire you i shall do?
42.18.41.2^- and he said, lord, that i might receive sight.
42.18.42.1^and - jesus said to him, receive sight!
42.18.42.2^the faith of you has healed you.
42.18.43.1^and immediately he received sight and began following him, glorifying - god.
42.18.43.2^and all the people, having seen it, gave praise - to god.
42.19.1.1^and having entered, he was passing through - jericho.
42.19.2.1^and behold, a man by name called zacchaeus, and he was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.
42.19.3.1^and he was seeking to see - jesus, who he is, and not he was able because of the crowd, because - in stature small he was.
42.19.4.1^and having run to the front he went up into a sycamore-fig tree, so that he might see him, for that way he was about to pass.
42.19.5.1^and as he came to the place, having looked up, - jesus said to him, zacchaeus, having hurried come down;
42.19.5.2^today for in the house of you it behooves me to stay.
42.19.6.1^and having hurried, he came down and received him, rejoicing.
42.19.7.1^and having seen it, all were grumbling, saying -, with a sinful man he has entered to stay.
42.19.8.1^having stood then, zacchaeus said to the lord, behold, the half of me of the possessions, lord, to the poor i give;
42.19.8.2^and if of anyone anything i have defrauded, i restore it fourfold.
42.19.9.1^said then to him - jesus -, today salvation to the house this has come, because also he a son of abraham is.
42.19.10.1^came for the son - of man to seek and to save that having been lost.
42.19.11.1^were hearing while they these things, having proceeded, he spoke a parable, because - near being jerusalem of his, and thinking their that immediately is about the kingdom - of god to appear.
42.19.12.1^he said therefore, a man certain of noble birth proceeded to a country distant, to receive for himself a kingdom and to return.
42.19.13.1^having called then ten servants of himself, he gave to them ten minas and said to them, do business until that i come back.
42.19.14.1^- but the citizens of him hated him and sent a delegation after him, saying, not we are willing for this man to reign over us.
42.19.15.1^and it came to pass on the returning of him, having received the kingdom, that he directed to be called to him the servants these to whom he had given the money, in order that he might know what they had gained by trading.
42.19.16.1^came up then the first, saying, lord, the mina of you, ten has produced more minas.
42.19.17.1^and he said to him, well done, good servant!
42.19.17.2^because in very little, faithful you were, to be having authority you are over ten cities.
42.19.18.1^and came the second, saying, the mina of you, lord, has made five minas.
42.19.19.1^he said then also to this one, and you over are to be five cities.
42.19.20.1^and - another came, saying, lord, behold the mina of you, which i kept lying away in a piece of cloth.
42.19.21.1^i was afraid for of you, because a man harsh you are.
42.19.21.2^you take up what not you did lay down, and you reap what not you did sow.
42.19.22.1^he says to him, out of the mouth of you i will judge you, evil servant.
42.19.22.2^you knew that i a man harsh am, taking up what not i did lay down and reaping what not i did sow?
42.19.23.1^then because of why not did you give of me the money to the bank, and i having come, with interest - it might have collected?
42.19.24.1^and to those standing by he said, take from him the mina, and give it to the one the ten minas having.
42.19.25.1^and they said to him, master, he has ten minas.
42.19.26.1^i say to you that to everyone - having will be given;
42.19.26.2^from however the one not having, even that which he has will be taken away.
42.19.27.1^furthermore, the enemies of mine these, those not having been willing for me to reign over them, bring here and slay them before me.
42.19.28.1^and having said these things he went on ahead, going up to jerusalem.
42.19.29.1^and it came to pass as he drew near to bethphage and bethany, toward the mount - called olivet, he sent two of the disciples,
42.19.30.1^saying, go into the ahead village, in which entering you will find a colt having been tied, on which no one ever yet of men has sat;
42.19.30.2^and having untied it, bring it.
42.19.31.1^and if anyone you asks, because of why do you untie it?
42.19.31.2^thus will you say, because the lord of it need has.
42.19.32.1^having departed then, those having been sent found it as he had said to them.
42.19.33.1^on untying then of them the colt, said the masters of it to them, why untie you the colt?
42.19.34.1^- and they said -, the lord of it need has.
42.19.35.1^and they led it to - jesus, and having cast their - garments on the colt, they put on it - jesus.
42.19.36.1^going then of him, they were spreading the garments of them on the road.
42.19.37.1^drawing near then of him already at the descent of the mount - of olives, began all the multitude of the disciples, rejoicing, to praise - god in a voice loud for all which they had seen the mighty works,
42.19.38.1^saying:
42.19.38.2^blessed is the coming - king in the name of the lord.
42.19.38.3^in heaven peace, and glory in the highest.
42.19.39.1^and some of the pharisees from the crowd said to him, teacher, rebuke the disciples of you.
42.19.40.1^and answering, he said, i say to you if these will be silent, the stones will cry out.
42.19.41.1^and as he drew near, having seen the city, he wept over it,
42.19.42.1^saying -, if you had known in the day this, even you, the things for peace!
42.19.42.2^now however they are hidden from eyes of you.
42.19.43.1^for will come days upon you that will cast around the enemies of you a barricade you;
42.19.43.2^and they will surround you and will hem in you on every side,
42.19.44.1^and will level to the ground you and the children of you within you, and not will leave a stone upon a stone within you, in place of which not you knew the season the of visitation of you.
42.19.45.1^and having entered into the temple, he began to cast out those selling,
42.19.46.1^saying to them, it has been written:
42.19.46.2^and will be the house of me a house of prayer.
42.19.46.3^you however it have made a den of robbers.
42.19.47.1^and he was teaching - every day in the temple;
42.19.47.2^the however chief priests and the scribes were seeking him to destroy, and the foremost of the people.
42.19.48.1^and not they found - what they might do;
42.19.48.2^the people for all were hanging on his words, listening.
42.20.1.1^and it came to pass on one of the days, as was teaching he the people in the temple and proclaiming the gospel, came up the chief priests and the scribes with the elders
42.20.2.1^and spoke, saying to him, tell us by what authority these things you do, or who is the one having given to you the authority this?
42.20.3.1^answering now, he said to them, will ask you i also one thing, and you tell me:
42.20.4.1^the baptism of john, from heaven was it, or from men?
42.20.5.1^- and they reasoned among themselves, saying -, if we should say from heaven, he will say, because of why not did you believe him?
42.20.6.1^if however we should say, from men, the people all will stone us;
42.20.6.2^having been persuaded for they are, john a prophet to be.
42.20.7.1^and they answered, not they knew from where.
42.20.8.1^and - jesus said to them, neither i tell you by what authority these things i am doing.
42.20.9.1^he began then to the people to speak the parable this:
42.20.9.2^a man certain planted a vineyard, and rented it to farmers, and went abroad a time long.
42.20.10.1^and in the season, he sent to the farmers a servant, that from the fruit of the vineyard they will give to him.
42.20.10.2^- but the farmers sent away him, having beaten him, empty-handed.
42.20.11.1^and he proceeded another to send a servant;
42.20.11.2^- but him having beaten and having dishonored, they sent away empty-handed.
42.20.12.1^and he proceeded a third to send;
42.20.12.2^- then also him having wounded, they cast out.
42.20.13.1^said then the master of the vineyard, what shall i do?
42.20.13.2^i will send the son of me, the beloved;
42.20.13.3^perhaps him they will respect.
42.20.14.1^having seen now him, the farmers began reasoning among themselves, saying, this is the heir;
42.20.14.2^let us kill him, so that ours might become the inheritance.
42.20.15.1^and having cast forth him outside the vineyard, they killed him.
42.20.15.2^what therefore will do to them the master of the vineyard?
42.20.16.1^he will come and will destroy the farmers these, and will give the vineyard to others.
42.20.16.2^having heard it, then they said, never may it be!
42.20.17.1^- but having looked at them, he said, what then is that has been written this:
42.20.17.2^the stone which rejected those building, this has become into the head of the corner
42.20.18.1^everyone - falling on that - stone will be broken;
42.20.18.2^on whomever but - it might fall, it will grind into powder him.
42.20.19.1^and sought the scribes and the chief priests to lay on him - hands in that - hour;
42.20.19.2^and they feared the people;
42.20.19.3^they perceived for that against them he was speaking the parable this.
42.20.20.1^and having watched him, they sent spies, feigning themselves righteous to be, that they might catch him in talk, in order to deliver him to the rule and to the authority of the governor.
42.20.21.1^and they questioned him, saying, teacher, we know that rightly you speak and teach, and not receive any person, but on the basis of truth the way - of god teach.
42.20.22.1^is it lawful for us to caesar tribute to give, or not?
42.20.23.1^having perceived however of them the craftiness, he said to them,
42.20.24.1^show me a denarius.
42.20.24.2^of whom has it the image and inscription?
42.20.24.3^- and they said, caesar s.
42.20.25.1^- and he said to them, therefore give back the things of caesar to caesar, and the things - of god - to god.
42.20.26.1^and not they were able to catch him in his word before the people;
42.20.26.2^and having marveled at the answer of him, they became silent.
42.20.27.1^having approached then some of the sadducees, the ones denying a resurrection not there is, they questioned him,
42.20.28.1^saying, teacher, moses wrote to us if anyone s brother should die having a wife, and he childless is, that should take the brother of him the wife and should raise up seed to the brother of him.
42.20.29.1^seven therefore brothers there were;
42.20.29.2^and the first, having taken a wife, died childless;
42.20.30.1^and the second,
42.20.31.1^and the third took her;
42.20.31.2^likewise then also the seven not did leave children, and died.
42.20.32.1^finally also the woman died.
42.20.33.1^the woman therefore, in the resurrection, of which of them does she become wife?
42.20.33.2^- for the seven had her as wife.
42.20.34.1^and said to them - jesus, the sons of the age this marry and are given in marriage;
42.20.35.1^those however having been considered worthy to the age that which is to obtain, and the resurrection which is out from the dead, neither marry nor are given in marriage;
42.20.36.1^neither for to die any more are they able, like the angels for they are;
42.20.36.2^and sons they are of god, of the resurrection sons being.
42.20.37.1^that however are raised the dead, even moses showed at the bush, when he calls the lord the god of abraham, and god of isaac, and god of jacob.
42.20.38.1^god now not he is of the dead, but of the living;
42.20.38.2^all for to him live.
42.20.39.1^answering now, some of the scribes said, teacher, well you have spoken.
42.20.40.1^no longer then did they dare to ask him anything.
42.20.41.1^he said then to them, how do they declare the christ to be of david son?
42.20.42.1^himself for david says in the book of psalms:
42.20.42.2^said the lord to the lord of me, sit at the right hand of me,
42.20.43.1^until - i place the enemies of you, as a footstool of the feet of you.
42.20.44.1^david therefore lord him calls, and how of him son is he?
42.20.45.1^were listening now all the people, he said to the disciples of him,
42.20.46.1^beware of the scribes, - desiring to walk in long robes, and loving greetings in the marketplaces, and first seats in the synagogues, and first places in the banquets;
42.20.47.1^who devour the houses of widows, and as a pretext at great length pray.
42.20.47.2^these will receive more abundant condemnation.
42.21.1.1^having looked up now, he saw the ones casting into the treasury the gifts of them rich.
42.21.2.1^he saw then a certain widow poor casting in lepta two.
42.21.3.1^and he said, truly i say to you that the widow this - poor, more than all has cast in;
42.21.4.1^all for these out of that which was abounding to them cast in the gifts;
42.21.4.2^she however, out of the poverty of her, all the livelihood that she had did cast.
42.21.5.1^and as some were speaking about the temple, that with stones goodly and consecrated gifts it was adorned, he said,
42.21.6.1^as to these things which you are beholding, will come the days in which not will be left stone upon stone which not will be thrown down.
42.21.7.1^they asked then him, saying, teacher, when then these things will be, and what will be the sign when are about these things to take place?
42.21.8.1^- and he said, take heed, lest you be led astray;
42.21.8.2^many for will come in the name of me, saying, i am he, and the time is drawn near.
42.21.8.3^not go after them.
42.21.9.1^when then you should hear of wars and commotions, not be terrified;
42.21.9.2^it behooves for these things to take place first, but not immediately is the end.
42.21.10.1^then he was saying to them, will rise up nation against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.
42.21.11.1^earthquakes both great, and in different places famines and pestilences there will be;
42.21.11.2^fearful sights also and from heaven signs great will there be.
42.21.12.1^before however these things all, they will lay upon you the hands of them, and will persecute you, delivering you to the synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors on account of the name of me.
42.21.13.1^it will result to you for a testimony.
42.21.14.1^settle therefore in the minds of you not to premeditate to make a defense;
42.21.15.1^i for will give you a mouth and wisdom, which not will be able to resist nor to reply to all those opposing you.
42.21.16.1^you will be betrayed then even by parents and brothers and relatives and friends, and they will put to death some from among you.
42.21.17.1^and you will be hated by all because of the name of me.
42.21.18.1^but a hair of the head of you no not should perish.
42.21.19.1^by the patient endurance of you, you will gain the souls of you.
42.21.20.1^when then you see being encircled by encampments jerusalem, then know that has drawn near the desolation of her.
42.21.21.1^then those in - judea, let them flee to the mountains;
42.21.21.2^and those in midst of her, let them depart out;
42.21.21.3^and those in the countries, not let them enter into her;
42.21.22.1^for the days of avenging these are, - to fulfill all things - having been written.
42.21.23.1^but woe to those in womb having, and to the ones nursing in those the days;
42.21.23.2^there will be for distress great upon the land and wrath to the people this.
42.21.24.1^and they will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into the nations;
42.21.24.2^all and jerusalem will be trodden down by the gentiles, until that are fulfilled the times of the gentiles.
42.21.25.1^and there will be signs in sun, and moon, and stars;
42.21.25.2^and upon the earth distress of nations with perplexity, the roaring of the sea and rolling surge,
42.21.26.1^fainting men from fear and expectation of that which is coming on the earth;
42.21.26.2^- for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.
42.21.27.1^and then will they see the son - of man coming in a cloud, with power and glory great.
42.21.28.1^beginning then of these things to come to pass, look up and lift up the heads of you, because draws near the redemption of you.
42.21.29.1^and he spoke a parable to them:
42.21.29.2^behold the fig tree and all the trees.
42.21.30.1^when they sprout already, looking on them for yourselves, you know that already near the summer is.
42.21.31.1^so also you, when you see these things coming to pass, know that near is the kingdom - of god.
42.21.32.1^truly i say to you, that no not will have passed away the generation this, until - all these things shall have taken place.
42.21.33.1^the heaven and the earth will pass away, - but the words of me no not will pass away.
42.21.34.1^take heed now to yourselves, lest ever be burdened of you the hearts with dissipation and drunkenness and cares of life   and would come upon you suddenly the day that
42.21.35.1^as a snare.
42.21.35.2^it will come for upon all those sitting upon the face of all the earth.
42.21.36.1^watch also at every season, praying that you may have strength to escape these things all that are about to come to pass and to stand before the son - of man.
42.21.37.1^he was now during the day in the temple teaching, - and the evening going out, he was lodging on the mount - called olivet.
42.21.38.1^and all the people would come early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.
42.22.1.1^was drawing near now the feast of unleavened bread, - called passover.
42.22.2.1^and were seeking the chief priests and the scribes - how they might put to death him;
42.22.2.2^they were afraid for of the people.
42.22.3.1^entered then satan into judas, the one being called iscariot, being of the number of the twelve.
42.22.4.1^and having gone away, he spoke with the chief priests and captains, the how to them he might betray him.
42.22.5.1^and they rejoiced and agreed him money to give.
42.22.6.1^and he promised, and began seeking opportunity - to betray him apart from a crowd to them.
42.22.7.1^came then the day of unleavened bread on which it was necessary for to be sacrificed the passover lamb.
42.22.8.1^and he sent peter and john, having said, having gone, prepare for us the passover, that we might eat it.
42.22.9.1^- and they said to him, where will you we should prepare?
42.22.10.1^- and he said to them, behold, having entered of you into the city, will meet you a man, a pitcher of water carrying;
42.22.10.2^follow him into the house into which he enters;
42.22.11.1^and you shall say to the master of the house, says to you the teacher, where is the guest room, where the passover with the disciples of me i may eat?
42.22.12.1^and he you will show an upper room large, furnished;
42.22.12.2^there prepare.
42.22.13.1^having gone then, they found it as he had said to them;
42.22.13.2^and they prepared the passover.
42.22.14.1^and when was come the hour, he reclined, and the apostles with him.
42.22.15.1^and he said to them, with desire i have desired this - passover to eat with you before - i suffer.
42.22.16.1^i say for to you that never not will i eat thereof, until when it is fulfilled in the kingdom - of god.
42.22.17.1^and having received the cup, having given thanks, he said, take this, and divide it among yourselves.
42.22.18.1^i say for to you, that no not will i drink from - now of the fruit of the vine, until that the kingdom - of god shall come.
42.22.19.1^and having taken the bread, having given thanks, he broke it and gave to them, saying, this is the body of me, which for you is given;
42.22.19.2^this do in the of me remembrance,
42.22.20.1^and the cup likewise after which having supped, saying, this - cup is the new covenant in the blood of me, which for you is being poured out.
42.22.21.1^but, behold, the hand of him betraying me is with me on the table.
42.22.22.1^for the son indeed of man, according to that having been determined goes, but woe to the man that by whom he is betrayed.
42.22.23.1^and they began to question among themselves - who then it might be of them who this is about to do.
42.22.24.1^there was then also a dispute among them, - which of them is thought to be the greatest.
42.22.25.1^- and he said to them, the kings of the gentiles rule over them, and those exercising authority over them, benefactors are called.
42.22.26.1^you however not thus shall be.
42.22.26.2^instead, the greatest among you, let him be as the younger;
42.22.26.3^and the one leading, as the one serving.
42.22.27.1^who for is greater, the one reclining or the one serving?
42.22.27.2^is not the one reclining?
42.22.27.3^i however in the midst of you am, as the one serving.
42.22.28.1^you now are those having remained with me in the trials of me.
42.22.29.1^and i appoint to you, as appointed to me the father of me, a kingdom,
42.22.30.1^so that you may eat and may drink at the table of me in the kingdom of me, and may sit on thrones, the twelve tribes judging of israel.
42.22.31.1^simon, simon, behold, - satan demanded to have all of you - to sift like - wheat;
42.22.32.1^i however begged for you, that not may fail the faith of you;
42.22.32.2^and you, when you have turned back, strengthen the brothers of you.
42.22.33.1^- and he said to him, lord, with you ready i am both to prison and to death to go.
42.22.34.1^- and he said, i tell you peter, not will crow today the rooster, until three times me you will deny knowing.
42.22.35.1^and he said to them, when i sent you without purse and bag and sandals, not anything did you lack?
42.22.35.2^- and they said, nothing.
42.22.36.1^he said then to them, but now the one having a purse, let him take it;
42.22.36.2^likewise also a bag;
42.22.36.3^and the one not having, let him sell the cloak of him and buy one a sword.
42.22.37.1^i say for to you that this which has been written, it behooves to be accomplished in me:
42.22.37.2^- and with the lawless he was reckoned.
42.22.37.3^and for the things concerning me an end have.
42.22.38.1^- and they said, lord, behold, swords here are two.
42.22.38.2^- and he said to them, enough it is.
42.22.39.1^and having gone forth, he went according to the custom to the mount - of olives;
42.22.39.2^followed then him also the disciples.
42.22.40.1^having come then to the place, he said to them, pray not to enter into temptation.
42.22.41.1^and he withdrew from them about a stone s throw, and having fallen on the knees, he was praying,
42.22.42.1^saying, father, if you are willing, take away this - cup from me.
42.22.42.2^yet not the will of me, but - of you be done.
42.22.43.1^appeared then to him an angel from heaven, strengthening him.
42.22.44.1^and having been in agony, more earnestly he was praying.
42.22.44.2^and became the sweat of him like great drops of blood, falling down upon the ground.
42.22.45.1^and having risen up from the prayer, having come to the disciples, he found sleeping them from the grief,
42.22.46.1^and he said to them, why are you sleeping?
42.22.46.2^having risen up pray, that not you might enter into temptation.
42.22.47.1^while still of him speaking, behold, a crowd, and he who is called judas, one of the twelve, was going before them, and he drew near - to jesus to kiss him.
42.22.48.1^jesus then said to him, judas, with a kiss the son - of man are you betraying?
42.22.49.1^having seen then those around him what would be, they said, lord, if will we strike with the sword?
42.22.50.1^and struck one a certain of them of the high priest the servant, and cut off the ear, his - right.
42.22.51.1^answering now, - jesus said, allow you as far as thus!
42.22.51.2^and having touched the ear, he healed him.
42.22.52.1^said then jesus to those having come out against him, chief priests, and captains of the temple, and elders, as against a robber have you come out with swords and clubs?
42.22.53.1^every day being of me with you in the temple, not did you stretch out the hands against me;
42.22.53.2^but this is of you the hour, and the power of the darkness.
42.22.54.1^having seized then him, they led him away, and led him into the house of the high priest.
42.22.54.2^- and peter was following afar off.
42.22.55.1^they having kindled then a fire in the midst of the courtyard, and having sat down together, was sitting - peter among them.
42.22.56.1^having seen then him a servant girl certain sitting by the light, and having looked intently on him, she said, also this one with him was.
42.22.57.1^- but he denied it, saying, not i do know him, woman.
42.22.58.1^and after a little, another having seen him, was saying, also you of them are.
42.22.58.2^- but peter was saying, man, not i am.
42.22.59.1^and having elapsed about hour one, other a certain strongly affirmed it, saying, of a truth, also this one with him was;
42.22.59.2^also for a galilean he is.
42.22.60.1^said however - peter, man, not i know what you say.
42.22.60.2^and immediately while he was speaking of him, crowed the rooster.
42.22.61.1^and having turned, the lord looked at - peter, and remembered - peter the word of the lord, how he had said to him -, before the rooster crows today, you will deny me three times.
42.22.62.1^and having gone forth outside, he wept bitterly.
42.22.63.1^and the men who are holding him began mocking him, beating him.
42.22.64.1^and having blindfolded him, they were questioning him, saying, prophesy, who is the one having struck you?
42.22.65.1^and other things many, blaspheming, they were saying to him.
42.22.66.1^and when it became day, were gathered together the elderhood of the people, chief priests both and scribes, and they led him into the council of them,
42.22.67.1^saying, if you are the christ, tell us.
42.22.67.2^he said then to them, if you i should tell, no not would you believe;
42.22.68.1^if then i should ask you, no not would you answer.
42.22.69.1^from - now on also will be the son - of man sitting at the right hand of the power - of god.
42.22.70.1^they said then all, you then are the son - of god?
42.22.70.2^- and to them he was saying, you say that i am.
42.22.71.1^- and they said, what any more have we of witness need?
42.22.71.2^we ourselves for have heard it from the mouth of him.
42.23.1.1^and having risen up, all the multitude of them led him to - pilate.
42.23.2.1^they began then to accuse him, saying, this man we found misleading the nation of us and forbidding tribute to caesar to be given, and declaring himself christ, a king, to be.
42.23.3.1^- and pilate questioned him, saying, you are the king of the jews?
42.23.3.2^- and answering him, he was saying, you say.
42.23.4.1^- and pilate said to the chief priests and the crowds, not find i guilt in the man this.
42.23.5.1^- but they kept insisting, saying -, he stirs up the people, teaching throughout all - of judea, and he has begun from - galilee even to here.
42.23.6.1^pilate now having heard, asked whether the man a galilean is,
42.23.7.1^and having learned that from the jurisdiction of herod he is, he sent up him to herod, being also he himself in jerusalem in those - days.
42.23.8.1^- and herod, having seen - jesus, was glad exceedingly;
42.23.8.2^he was for of a long time wishing to see him, because of - hearing concerning him;
42.23.8.3^and he was hoping some sign to see by him done.
42.23.9.1^he kept questioning then him in words many;
42.23.9.2^he however nothing answered him.
42.23.10.1^had been standing by now the chief priests and the scribes, vehemently accusing him.
42.23.11.1^having set at naught then him, also - herod with the troops of him, and having mocked him, having put on him apparel splendid, sent back him to pilate.
42.23.12.1^became then friends - both herod and - pilate on that - day with one another;
42.23.12.2^previously it had been that for at enmity they were between themselves.
42.23.13.1^pilate then, having called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
42.23.14.1^said to them, you brought to me the man this, as misleading the people;
42.23.14.2^and behold, i before you having examined him, nothing found in the man this guilty of that accusation you are bringing against him.
42.23.15.1^no, not even herod did;
42.23.15.2^he sent back for him to us.
42.23.15.3^and behold, nothing worthy of death is done by him.
42.23.16.1^having chastised therefore him, i will release him.
42.23.18.1^they cried out however all together, saying, away with this man, release now to us - barabbas,
42.23.19.1^who was on account of insurrection a certain having been made in the city, and murder, having been cast into the prison.
42.23.20.1^again therefore - pilate called to them, wishing to release - jesus.
42.23.21.1^- but they were crying out, saying, crucify, crucify him.
42.23.22.1^- and a third time he said to them, what for evil did commit this man?
42.23.22.2^no cause of death found i in him.
42.23.22.3^having chastised therefore him, i will release him.
42.23.23.1^- but they were urgent, with voices loud, asking for him to be crucified.
42.23.23.2^and were prevailing the voices of them.
42.23.24.1^and pilate sentenced to be done the demand of them.
42.23.25.1^he released then the one on account of insurrection and murder having been cast into prison, whom they had asked for;
42.23.25.2^- and jesus he delivered to the will of them.
42.23.26.1^and as they led away him, having laid hold on simon, a certain of cyrene, coming from the country, they put upon him the cross, to carry behind - jesus.
42.23.27.1^were following now him a great multitude of the people, and of women, who were mourning and lamenting for him.
42.23.28.1^having turned then to them, - jesus said, daughters of jerusalem, not weep for me, but for yourselves weep, and for the children of you.
42.23.29.1^for behold, are coming days in which they will say, blessed are the barren, and the wombs that never did bear, and breasts that never nursed.
42.23.30.1^then they will begin to say to the mountains, fall upon us, and to the hills, cover us.
42.23.31.1^for if in the green tree, these things they do;
42.23.31.2^in the dry, what might take place?
42.23.32.1^were being led away now also other criminals two, with him to be put to death.
42.23.33.1^and when they came to the place - called the skull, there they crucified him, and the criminals, one - on the right;
42.23.33.2^one now on the left.
42.23.34.1^- and jesus was saying, father, forgive them, not for they know what they do.
42.23.34.2^dividing then the garments of him, they cast lots.
42.23.35.1^and stood the people beholding.
42.23.35.2^were deriding him then also the rulers, saying, others he saved;
42.23.35.3^let him save himself if this is the christ - of god, the chosen one.
42.23.36.1^mocked then him also the soldiers, coming near, sour wine offering him,
42.23.37.1^and saying, if you are the king of the jews, save yourself!
42.23.38.1^there was now also an inscription over him, the king of the jews this.
42.23.39.1^one now of the having been hanged criminals was railing at him, saying not you are if the christ?
42.23.39.2^save yourself and us!
42.23.40.1^answering now, the other was rebuking him, saying, not even do fear you - god, that under the same judgment you are,
42.23.41.1^and we indeed justly?
42.23.41.2^worthy for of what we did we are receiving;
42.23.41.3^this man however nothing wrong did.
42.23.42.1^and he was saying, jesus, remember me when you come into the kingdom of you!
42.23.43.1^and he said to him, truly to you i say, today with me you will be in - paradise.
42.23.44.1^and it was now about the hour sixth, and darkness came over all the land until the hour ninth.
42.23.45.1^the sun was darkened;
42.23.45.2^was torn then the veil of the temple in the middle.
42.23.46.1^and having called out in a voice loud, - jesus said, father, into the hands of you i commit the spirit of me.
42.23.46.2^this now having said, he breathed his last.
42.23.47.1^having seen now the centurion that having taken place, he began glorifying - god, saying, certainly the man this righteous was.
42.23.48.1^and all the having come together crowds to the spectacle this, having seen the things having taken place, beating the breasts were returning home.
42.23.49.1^stood now all those who knew him from afar off, also women, those having followed him from - galilee, beholding these things.
42.23.50.1^and behold, a man named joseph, a council member, being also a man good and righteous,
42.23.51.1^he not was having consented to the counsel and the deed of them, from arimathea, a city of the jews, who was waiting for the kingdom - of god.
42.23.52.1^he having gone - to pilate, asked for the body - of jesus.
42.23.53.1^and having taken it down, he wrapped it in a linen cloth and placed it in a tomb cut in a rock, in which no had been no one not yet laid.
42.23.54.1^and the day it was of preparation, and sabbath was just beginning.
42.23.55.1^having followed then, the women who were come out of - galilee with him, saw the tomb and how was laid the body of him.
42.23.56.1^having returned then, they prepared spices and anointing oils.
42.23.56.2^and on the indeed sabbath they rested according to the commandment.
42.24.1.1^the however first day of the week, dawn very early, to the tomb they came, bringing that they had prepared spices.
42.24.2.1^they found then the stone having been rolled away from the tomb.
42.24.3.1^having entered however, not they found the body of the lord jesus.
42.24.4.1^and it came to pass while - are perplexed they about this, that behold, men two stood by them in garments dazzling.
42.24.5.1^terrified then having become of them and bowing the faces to the ground, they said to them, why seek you the living among the dead?
42.24.6.1^not he is here, but he is risen!
42.24.6.2^remember how he spoke to you, yet being in - galilee,
42.24.7.1^saying, the son - of man - it behooves to be delivered into hands of men sinful, and to be crucified, and the third day to arise.
42.24.8.1^and they remembered the words of him.
42.24.9.1^and having returned from the tomb, they related these things all to the eleven and to all the rest.
42.24.10.1^it was now - magdalene mary, and joanna, and mary the mother of james, and the other women with them, telling to the apostles these things.
42.24.11.1^and appeared before them like folly the words of them, and they did not believe them.
42.24.12.1^- but peter, having risen up, ran to the tomb, and having stooped down, he sees the linen strips only, and he went away, in himself wondering at that having come to pass.
42.24.13.1^and behold, two of them on same the day were going to a village being distant, stadia sixty from jerusalem, whose name is emmaus;
42.24.14.1^and they were talking with one another about all - having taken place these things.
42.24.15.1^and it came to pass in the talking of them and reasoning, that himself jesus, having drawn near, was walking along with them;
42.24.16.1^- but the eyes of them were held - not to know him.
42.24.17.1^he said then to them, what - words are these that you exchange with one another walking?
42.24.17.2^and they stood still, looking sad.
42.24.18.1^answering now, the one named cleopas said to him, you alone visit jerusalem and not have known the things having come to pass in it in the days these?
42.24.19.1^and he said to them, what things?
42.24.19.2^- and they said to him, the things concerning jesus of nazareth, who was a man, a prophet mighty in deed and word before - god and all the people;
42.24.20.1^that then delivered up him the chief priests and the rulers of us to the judgment of death, and crucified him.
42.24.21.1^we however were hoping - he it is who is about to redeem - israel.
42.24.21.2^but indeed also with all these things, the third this day brings, away from which these things came to pass.
42.24.22.1^however also women certain out from us astonished us.
42.24.22.2^having been early to the tomb
42.24.23.1^and not having found the body of him, they came declaring also a vision of angels to have seen, who say he is alive.
42.24.24.1^and went some of those with us to the tomb and found it so, as also the women said;
42.24.24.2^him however not they saw.
42.24.25.1^and he said to them, o foolish and slow - of heart - to believe in all that have spoken the prophets.
42.24.26.1^not these things was it necessary for to suffer the christ and to enter into the glory of him?
42.24.27.1^and having begun from moses and from all the prophets, he interpreted to them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
42.24.28.1^and they drew near to the village where they were going, and he appeared farther to be going.
42.24.29.1^and they constrained him, saying, abide with us, for toward evening it is, and has declined now the day.
42.24.29.2^and he entered in - to abide with them.
42.24.30.1^and it came to pass in the reclining of him with them, having taken the bread he blessed it, and having broken it, he began giving it to them.
42.24.31.1^of them then were opened the eyes, and they knew him.
42.24.31.2^and he vanished being seen from them.
42.24.32.1^and they said to one another, not the heart of us burning was within us as he was speaking with us on the road, as he was opening to us the scriptures?
42.24.33.1^and having risen up that same - hour, they returned to jerusalem, and they found gathered together the eleven and those with them,
42.24.34.1^saying -, indeed has risen the lord and he has appeared to simon.
42.24.35.1^and they began relating the things on the road, and how he was known to them in the breaking of the bread.
42.24.36.1^these things now of them as they were telling, he himself stood in midst of them and says to them, peace to you.
42.24.37.1^having been terrified however, and filled with fear having been, they were thinking themselves a spirit to see.
42.24.38.1^and he said to them, why troubled are you, and through why doubts do come up in the hearts of you?
42.24.39.1^see the hands of me and the feet of me, that i am he.
42.24.39.2^touch me and see, for a spirit flesh and bones not has, as me you see having.
42.24.40.1^and this having said, he showed to them the hands and the feet.
42.24.41.1^still now, while they were disbelieving of them for the joy and amazement, he said to them, have you anything to eat here?
42.24.42.1^- and they gave to him of a fish broiled part.
42.24.43.1^and having taken it, before them he ate it.
42.24.44.1^he said now unto to them, these are the words of me, which i spoke to you still being with you, that it behooves to be fulfilled all things - having been written in the law of moses, and the prophets and the psalms concerning me.
42.24.45.1^then he opened their - mind - to understand the scriptures.
42.24.46.1^and he said to them -, thus it has been written:
42.24.46.2^was to suffer the christ, and to rise out from the dead the third day;
42.24.47.1^and to be proclaimed in the name of him repentance and forgiveness of sins to all - nations, having begun from jerusalem.
42.24.48.1^you are witnesses of these things.
42.24.49.1^and behold, i am sending the promise of the father of me upon you;
42.24.49.2^you however remain in the city until that you should be clothed with from on high power.
42.24.50.1^he led now them out as far as to bethany, and having lifted up the hands of him, he blessed them.
42.24.51.1^and it came to pass in the blessing of him them, he was separated from them and was carried up into - heaven.
42.24.52.1^and they having worshiped him, returned to jerusalem with joy great,
42.24.53.1^and were continually all in the temple, blessing - god.
43.1.1.1^in the beginning was the word, and the word was with - god, and god was the word.
43.1.2.1^he was in the beginning with - god.
43.1.3.1^all things through him came into being, and without him came into being not even one thing that has come into being.
43.1.4.1^in him life was, and the life was the light - of men.
43.1.5.1^and the light in the darkness shines, and the darkness it not overcame.
43.1.6.1^there came a man having been sent from god;
43.1.6.2^the name to him was john.
43.1.7.1^he came as a witness, that he might testify concerning the light, that all might believe through him.
43.1.8.1^not was he the light, but that he might witness concerning the light.
43.1.9.1^was the light - true, who enlightens every man, coming into the world.
43.1.10.1^in the world he was, and the world through him came into being, and the world him not knew.
43.1.11.1^to the own he came, and the own him not received.
