43.1.12.1^as many as however received him, he gave to them authority children of god to be, to those believing in the name of him,
43.1.13.1^who not of blood, nor of will of flesh, nor of will of man, but of god were born.
43.1.14.1^and the word flesh became and dwelt among us, and we beheld the glory of him, a glory as of an only begotten from the father, full of grace and truth.
43.1.15.1^john witnesses concerning him, and he cried out, saying, this was he of whom i was saying, the one after me coming, precedence over me has, because before me he was.
43.1.16.1^for from the fullness of him, we all have received then grace for grace.
43.1.17.1^for the law through moses was given;
43.1.17.2^- grace and - truth through jesus christ came.
43.1.18.1^god no one has seen ever yet;
43.1.18.2^the only begotten god, the one being in the bosom of the father, he has made him known.
43.1.19.1^and this is the testimony - of john, when sent to him the jews from jerusalem, priests and levites, that they might ask him, you, who are?
43.1.20.1^and he confessed and not denied, but confessed -, i not am the christ.
43.1.21.1^and they asked him, what then?
43.1.21.2^you elijah are?
43.1.21.3^and he says, not i am.
43.1.21.4^the prophet are you?
43.1.21.5^and he answered, no.
43.1.22.1^they said therefore to him, who are you?
43.1.22.2^that an answer we might give to those having sent us;
43.1.22.3^what say you about yourself?
43.1.23.1^he was saying, i am a voice crying in the wilderness, make straight the way of the lord,   as said isaiah the prophet.
43.1.24.1^and those having been sent were out from the pharisees.
43.1.25.1^and they asked him and said to him, why then baptize you, if you not are the christ, nor elijah, nor the prophet?
43.1.26.1^answered them - john saying, i baptize with water;
43.1.26.2^but in the midst of you stands one whom you not know,
43.1.27.1^the one after me coming, of whom not am i worthy that i should untie of him the strap of the sandal.
43.1.28.1^these things in bethany took place, across the jordan, where was - john baptizing.
43.1.29.1^on the next day he sees - jesus coming to him and says, behold the lamb - of god, - taking away the sin of the world.
43.1.30.1^he it is concerning whom i said, after me comes a man, who precedence over me has, because before me he was.
43.1.31.1^and i not knew him;
43.1.31.2^but that he might be revealed - to israel, because of this, came i with water baptizing.
43.1.32.1^and bore witness john saying -, i have beheld the spirit, descending as a dove out of heaven, and it remained upon him.
43.1.33.1^and i not knew him;
43.1.33.2^but the one having sent me to baptize with water, he to me said, upon whom - you shall see the spirit descending and abiding on him, he is the one baptizing with the spirit holy.
43.1.34.1^and i have seen and have borne witness that this is the son - of god.
43.1.35.1^on the next day again was standing - john, and of the disciples of him two.
43.1.36.1^and having looked at - jesus walking, he says, behold the lamb - of god!
43.1.37.1^and heard the two disciples him speaking, and followed - jesus.
43.1.38.1^having turned then - jesus, and having beheld them following, he says to them, what seek you?
43.1.38.2^- and they said to him, rabbi which is to say, being translated, teacher   where are you staying?
43.1.39.1^he says to them, come and you will see.
43.1.39.2^they went therefore and saw where he abides;
43.1.39.3^and with him they stayed the day that.
43.1.39.4^the hour was about the tenth.
43.1.40.1^was andrew, the brother of simon peter, one of the two - having heard from john, and having followed him.
43.1.41.1^finds he first the brother - own simon, and he says to him, we have found the messiah, which is translated christ.
43.1.42.1^he led him to - jesus.
43.1.42.2^having looked at him, - jesus said, you are simon the son of john;
43.1.42.3^you will be called cephas which means peter.
43.1.43.1^on the next day he desired to go forth into - galilee.
43.1.43.2^and he finds philip.
43.1.43.3^and says to him - jesus, follow me.
43.1.44.1^was now - philip from bethsaida, from the city of andrew and peter.
43.1.45.1^finds philip - nathanael and says to him, him whom wrote of moses in the law, also the prophets, we have found, jesus son - of joseph, - of nazareth.
43.1.46.1^and said to him nathanael, out of nazareth is able any good thing to be?
43.1.46.2^says to him - philip, come and see.
43.1.47.1^saw - jesus - nathanael coming to him, and he says concerning him, behold truly an israelite, in whom deceit not there is.
43.1.48.1^says to him nathanael, from where me know you?
43.1.48.2^answered jesus and said to him, before - you philip calling, being under the fig tree, i saw you.
43.1.49.1^answered him nathanael, rabbi, you are the son - of god;
43.1.49.2^you king are - of israel.
43.1.50.1^answered jesus and said to him, because i said to you that i saw you under the fig tree, believe you?
43.1.50.2^greater things than these you will see.
43.1.51.1^and he says to him, truly, truly, i say to all of you, you will see the heaven opened and the angels - of god ascending and descending on the son - of man.
43.2.1.1^and on the day - third a wedding took place in cana - of galilee, and was the mother - of jesus there.
43.2.2.1^was invited then also - jesus and the disciples of him to the wedding.
43.2.3.1^and having been deficient of wine, says the mother - of jesus to him, wine not they have.
43.2.4.1^and says to her - jesus, what to me and to you, woman?
43.2.4.2^not yet is come the hour of me.
43.2.5.1^says the mother of him to the servants, whatever anyhow - he may say to you, do.
43.2.6.1^there were now there of stone, water jars six, according to the purification of the jews, standing, having space for metretae two or three.
43.2.7.1^says to them - jesus, fill the jars with water.
43.2.7.2^and they filled them up to the brim.
43.2.8.1^and he says to them, draw out now and carry to the master of the feast.
43.2.8.2^- and they carried it.
43.2.9.1^when then had tasted the master of the feast the water wine having become, and not he knew from where it is   the however servants knew - having drawn the water   calls the bridegroom the master of the feast
43.2.10.1^and says to him, every man first the good wine sets out, and when they might have drunk freely, the inferior;
43.2.10.2^you have kept the good wine until now.
43.2.11.1^this did, the beginning of the signs, - jesus in cana - of galilee, and he revealed the glory of him, and believed in him the disciples of him.
43.2.12.1^after this he went down to capernaum, he and the mother of him and the brothers of him and the disciples of him, and there they stayed not many days.
43.2.13.1^and near was the passover of the jews, and went up to jerusalem - jesus.
43.2.14.1^and he found in the temple those selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers sitting.
43.2.15.1^and having made a whip of cords, all he drove out from the temple, - both sheep and - oxen;
43.2.15.2^and of the money changers he poured out the coins, and the tables he overthrew.
43.2.16.1^and to those - doves selling he said, take these things from here;
43.2.16.2^not make the house of the father of me a house of trade.
43.2.17.1^remembered the disciples of him that written it is:
43.2.17.2^the zeal of the house of you will consume me.
43.2.18.1^answered therefore the jews and said to him, what sign show you to us, that these things you do?
43.2.19.1^answered jesus and said to them, destroy the temple this, and in three days i will raise up it.
43.2.20.1^said therefore the jews, forty and six years was built the temple this, and you in three days will raise up it?
43.2.21.1^he however was speaking concerning the temple of the body of him.
43.2.22.1^when therefore he was raised up out from the dead, remembered the disciples of him that this he had said, and they believed the scripture and the word that had spoken - jesus.
43.2.23.1^when then he was in - jerusalem in the passover, in the feast, many believed in the name of him, beholding of him the signs that he was doing.
43.2.24.1^on his part however jesus not did entrust himself to them, because of - his knowing all men,
43.2.25.1^and because no need he had that anyone should testify concerning the man;
43.2.25.2^he himself for knew what was in the man.
43.3.1.1^there was now a man of the pharisees, nicodemus name to him, a ruler of the jews;
43.3.2.1^he came to him by night and said to him, rabbi, we know that from god you have come, a teacher;
43.3.2.2^no one for is able these - signs to do that you do, if not should be - god with him.
43.3.3.1^answered jesus and said to him, truly, truly i say to you, if not anyone be born from above, not he is able to see the kingdom - of god.
43.3.4.1^says to him - nicodemus, how is able a man to be born, old being?
43.3.4.2^not is he able into the womb of the mother of him a second time to enter, and to be born?
43.3.5.1^answered jesus, truly, truly, i say to you, if not anyone be born of water and of the spirit, not he is able to enter into the kingdom - of god.
43.3.6.1^that having been born of the flesh, flesh is;
43.3.6.2^and that having been born of the spirit, spirit is.
43.3.7.1^not do wonder that i said to you, it is necessary for you all to be born from above.
43.3.8.1^the wind where it wishes blows, and the sound of it you hear, but not you know from where it comes, and where it goes;
43.3.8.2^thus is everyone - having been born of the spirit.
43.3.9.1^answered nicodemus and said to him, how are able these things to be?
43.3.10.1^answered jesus and said to him, you are the teacher - of israel, and these things not know?
43.3.11.1^truly, truly, i say to you that what we know we speak, and what we have seen we bear witness to;
43.3.11.2^and the witness of us not you people receive.
43.3.12.1^if things earthly i have told you, and not you believe, how if i tell to you the things heavenly, will you believe?
43.3.13.1^and no one has gone up into - heaven if not the one out of - heaven having come down, the son - of man.
43.3.14.1^and as moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, thus to be lifted up it behooves the son - of man,
43.3.15.1^so that everyone - believing in him may have life eternal.
43.3.16.1^thus for loved - god the world, that the son, the only begotten, he gave, so that everyone - believing in him not should perish, but should have life eternal.
43.3.17.1^not for sent - god - his son into the world that he might judge the world, but that might be saved the world through him.
43.3.18.1^the one believing on him not is judged;
43.3.18.2^the one but not believing already has been judged, because not he has believed in the name of the only begotten son - of god.
43.3.19.1^this now is the judgement, that the light has come into the world, and loved - men rather the darkness than the light;
43.3.19.2^were for of them evil the deeds.
43.3.20.1^everyone for - evil practicing hates the light and not comes to the light, so that not may be exposed the works of him;
43.3.21.1^the one however practicing the truth comes to the light, that may be manifest his - works that in god have been done.
43.3.22.1^after these things came - jesus and the disciples of him into the judean land, and there he was staying with them, and was baptizing.
43.3.23.1^was now also - john baptizing in aenon, near - salim, because waters many were there, and they were coming and being baptized.
43.3.24.1^not yet for had been cast into the prison - john.
43.3.25.1^arose then a debate among the disciples of john, with a certain jew, about purification.
43.3.26.1^and they came to - john and said to him, rabbi, he who was with you beyond the jordan, to whom you have borne witness, behold he baptizes, and all are coming to him.
43.3.27.1^answered john and said, nothing is able a man to receive, nothing one if not it is given to him from - heaven.
43.3.28.1^yourselves you to me bear witness, that i said, - not am i the christ, but - sent i am before him.
43.3.29.1^the one having the bride, the bridegroom is;
43.3.29.2^the now friend of the bridegroom, the one standing and listening for him, with joy rejoices because of the voice of the bridegroom.
43.3.29.3^this therefore, the joy - of mine, is fulfilled.
43.3.30.1^him it behooves to increase;
43.3.30.2^me however to decrease.
43.3.31.1^the one from above coming, above all is.
43.3.31.2^the one being from the earth, from the earth is, and from the earth speaks.
43.3.31.3^the one from - heaven coming, above all is.
43.3.32.1^what he has seen and heard, this he testifies;
43.3.32.2^and the testimony of him, no one receives.
43.3.33.1^the one having received his - testimony has set his seal that - god true is.
43.3.34.1^he whom for sent - god, the words - of god speaks, not for by measure he gives the spirit.
43.3.35.1^the father loves the son, and all things has given into the hand of him.
43.3.36.1^the one believing in the son has life eternal;
43.3.36.2^the one however not obeying the son, not will see life, but the wrath - of god abides on him.
43.4.1.1^when therefore knew - jesus that heard the pharisees that jesus more disciples makes and baptizes than john
43.4.2.1^although indeed jesus himself not was baptizing, but the disciples of him
43.4.3.1^he left - judea, and went away again into - galilee.
43.4.4.1^it was necessary for now him to pass through - samaria.
43.4.5.1^he comes therefore to a city - of samaria called sychar, near the plot of ground that had given jacob to joseph, the son of him.
43.4.6.1^was now there the well - of jacob.
43.4.6.2^- therefore jesus, being wearied from the journey, was sitting thus at the well.
43.4.6.3^the hour was about the sixth.
43.4.7.1^comes a woman out of - samaria to draw water.
43.4.7.2^says to her - jesus, give me to drink.
43.4.8.1^- for the disciples of him had gone away into the city, that food they might buy.
43.4.9.1^says therefore to him the woman - samaritan, how you a jew being, from me to drink do ask, a woman samaritan being?
43.4.9.2^not for have association jews with samaritans.
43.4.10.1^answered jesus and said to her, if you had known the gift - of god, and who it is - saying to you, give me to drink, you - would have asked him, and he would have given - to you water living.
43.4.11.1^says to him the woman sir, nothing to draw with you have, and the well is deep;
43.4.11.2^from where then have you the water - living?
43.4.12.1^not you greater than are the father of us jacob, who gave us the well, and himself of it drank, and the sons of him, and the livestock of him?
43.4.13.1^answered jesus and said to her, everyone - drinking of the water this will thirst again;
43.4.14.1^whoever however - may drink of the water that i will give him, never not will thirst, to the age.
43.4.14.2^instead, the water that i will give to him will become in him a spring of water, welling up into life eternal.
43.4.15.1^says to him the woman, sir, give me this - water, that not i might thirst, nor come here to draw.
43.4.16.1^he says to her, go, call the husband of you and come here.
43.4.17.1^answered the woman and said to him not i have a husband.
43.4.17.2^says to her - jesus, correctly you have spoken -, a husband not i have.
43.4.18.1^five for husbands you have had, and now he whom you have, not is your husband;
43.4.18.2^this truly you have spoken.
43.4.19.1^says to him the woman, sir, i understand that a prophet are you.
43.4.20.1^the fathers of us on the mountain this worshiped, and you say that in jerusalem is the place where to worship it is necessary.
43.4.21.1^says to her - jesus, believe me, woman, that is coming an hour when neither on the mountain this, nor in jerusalem, will you worship the father.
43.4.22.1^you worship what not you know;
43.4.22.2^we worship what we know, for - salvation of the jews is.
43.4.23.1^but is coming an hour and now is, when the true worshipers will worship the father in spirit and truth;
43.4.23.2^also for the father such seeks, who worship him.
43.4.24.1^spirit - god is, and those worshiping him in spirit and truth it behooves to worship.
43.4.25.1^says to him the woman, i know that messiah is coming, who is called christ;
43.4.25.2^when comes he, he will tell us all things.
43.4.26.1^says to her - jesus, i am he, the one speaking to you.
43.4.27.1^and upon this came the disciples of him, and were amazed that with a woman he was speaking;
43.4.27.2^no one however said, what seek you?
43.4.27.3^or why speak you with her?
43.4.28.1^left then the water pot of her the woman, and went away into the city, and says to the men,
43.4.29.1^come, see a man who told me all things whatever i did.
43.4.29.2^can it be that this is the christ?
43.4.30.1^they went forth out of the city and were coming unto him.
43.4.31.1^but in the meantime were asking him the disciples, saying, rabbi, eat.
43.4.32.1^- but he said to them, i food have to eat that you not know.
43.4.33.1^were saying therefore the disciples to one another, no one did bring him anything to eat?
43.4.34.1^says to them - jesus, my food is that i should do the will of the one having sent me, and should finish of him the work.
43.4.35.1^not you say that yet four months it is, and the harvest comes?
43.4.35.2^behold, i say to you, lift up the eyes of you and see the fields, because white they are toward harvest already!
43.4.36.1^the one reaping a reward receives and gathers fruit unto life eternal, so that the one sowing together may rejoice, and the one reaping.
43.4.37.1^in for this the saying is true -, one is - sowing, and another - reaping.
43.4.38.1^i sent you to reap what not you have toiled for;
43.4.38.2^others have toiled, and you into the labor of them have entered.
43.4.39.1^out of now the city that, many believed in him of the samaritans, because of the word of the woman testifying -, he told me all things whatever i did.
43.4.40.1^when therefore came to him the samaritans, they were asking him to abide with them, and he stayed there two days.
43.4.41.1^and many more believed, because of the word of him;
43.4.42.1^- and to the woman they were saying -, no longer because of - your speech we believe;
43.4.42.2^we ourselves for have heard, and we know that this is truly the savior of the world.
43.4.43.1^after then the two days, he went forth from there into - galilee.
43.4.44.1^himself for jesus testified that a prophet in the own hometown, honor not has.
43.4.45.1^when therefore he came into - galilee, received him the galileans, all things having seen how great he had done in jerusalem during the feast;
43.4.45.2^also themselves for they had gone to the feast.
43.4.46.1^he came therefore again to - cana - of galilee, where he had made the water wine.
43.4.46.2^and there was a certain royal official whose - son was sick in capernaum.
43.4.47.1^he, having heard that jesus had come out of - judea into - galilee, went to him and was asking that he would come down and heal his - son;
43.4.47.2^he was about for to die.
43.4.48.1^said therefore - jesus to him, if not signs and wonders you people see, no not will you believe.
43.4.49.1^says to him the royal official, sir, come down before dies the child of me.
43.4.50.1^says to him - jesus, go, the son of you lives.
43.4.50.2^believed the man the word that said to him - jesus, and he went on his way.
43.4.51.1^already then as he is going down, the servants of him met him, saying that the boy of him lives.
43.4.52.1^he inquired therefore the hour from them in which better he got.
43.4.52.2^they said therefore to him -, yesterday at the hour seventh, left him the fever.
43.4.53.1^knew therefore the father that it was in that the hour at which said to him - jesus, the son of you lives.
43.4.53.2^and he believed himself, and the household of him all.
43.4.54.1^this is now again the second sign did - jesus, having come out of - judea into - galilee.
43.5.1.1^after these things there was a feast of the jews, and went up jesus to jerusalem.
43.5.2.1^there is now in - jerusalem by the sheep gate a pool, - called in hebrew bethesda, five porches having.
43.5.3.1^in these were lying a multitude of those ailing, blind, lame, paralyzed.
43.5.5.1^was now a certain man there, thirty and eight years being in - infirmity himself.
43.5.6.1^him having seen - jesus lying, and having known that a long already time he has been, he says to him, desire you well to become?
43.5.7.1^answered him the one ailing, sir, a man not i have, that when has been stirred the water, he might put me into the pool, in which now am going i, another before me descends.
43.5.8.1^says to him - jesus, arise, take up the mat of you, and walk.
43.5.9.1^and immediately became well the man, and he took up the mat of him and began to walk.
43.5.9.2^it was now sabbath on that - day.
43.5.10.1^were saying therefore the jews to the one having been healed, sabbath it is, and not it is lawful for you to take up the mat of you,
43.5.11.1^who however answered them, the one having made me well, that one to me said, take up the mat of you and walk.
43.5.12.1^they asked him, who is the man - having said to you, take up and walk?
43.5.13.1^the one now having been healed not knew who it is, - for jesus had moved away, a crowd being in the place.
43.5.14.1^after these things finds him - jesus in the temple and said to him, behold, well you have become;
43.5.14.2^no more sin, that not worse to you something happens.
43.5.15.1^went away the man and told the jews that jesus it is the one having made him well.
43.5.16.1^and because of this, were persecuting the jews - jesus, because these things he was doing on the sabbath.
43.5.17.1^- but jesus answered them, the father of me until now is working, and i am working.
43.5.18.1^because of this therefore, the more were seeking him the jews to kill, because not only was he breaking the sabbath, but also father his own he was calling - god, equal himself making to god.
43.5.19.1^answered therefore - jesus and was saying to them, truly, truly, i say to you, not is able the son to do of himself nothing, if not anything he might see the father doing;
43.5.19.2^whatever for - he does, these things also the son likewise does.
43.5.20.1^- for the father loves the son, and all things shows to him that he does;
43.5.20.2^and greater than these he will show him works, so that you may marvel.
43.5.21.1^even as for the father raises up the dead and gives life, thus also the son to whom he will, gives life.
43.5.22.1^not even for the father judges no one, but - judgment all has given to the son,
43.5.23.1^so that all may honor the son, even as they honor the father.
43.5.23.2^he who not is honoring the son, not is honoring the father, the one having sent him.
43.5.24.1^truly, truly i say to you that the one the word of me hearing, and believing the one having sent me, he has life eternal and into judgment not comes, but has passed out of - death into - life.
43.5.25.1^truly, truly, i say to you that is coming an hour, and now is, when the dead will hear the voice of the son - of god, and those having heard will live.
43.5.26.1^as for the father has life in himself, so also to the son he gave life, to have in himself.
43.5.27.1^and authority he gave him judgment to execute, because son of man he is.
43.5.28.1^not marvel at this, for is coming an hour in which all those in the tombs will hear the voice of him,
43.5.29.1^and will come forth   those - good having done, to the resurrection of life;
43.5.29.2^- and those evil having done, to the resurrection of judgment.
43.5.30.1^not am able i to do of myself nothing;
43.5.30.2^as i hear, i judge;
43.5.30.3^and the judgment - of me just is, because not i seek the will - of me, but the will of the one having sent me.
43.5.31.1^if i bear witness concerning myself, the testimony of me not is true.
43.5.32.1^another it is - bearing witness concerning me, and i know that true is the testimony which he bears witness concerning me.
43.5.33.1^you have sent unto john and he has borne witness to the truth.
43.5.34.1^i now not from man the testimony receive, but these things i say that you may be saved.
43.5.35.1^he was the lamp - burning and shining;
43.5.35.2^you now were willing to rejoice for a season in the light of him.
43.5.36.1^i however have the testimony greater than that of john.
43.5.36.2^- for the works that has given me the father that i should complete them, same the works which i do, bear witness concerning me that the father me has sent.
43.5.37.1^and the one having sent me, the father himself, has borne witness concerning me.
43.5.37.2^neither voice of him at any time have you heard, nor form of him have you seen.
43.5.38.1^and the word of him not you have in you abiding;
43.5.38.2^for whom sent he, him you not believe.
43.5.39.1^you diligently search the scriptures, for you think in them life eternal to have;
43.5.39.2^and these are they - bearing witness concerning me;
43.5.40.1^and not you are willing to come to me that life you may have.
43.5.41.1^glory from men not i take;
43.5.42.1^but i have known you, that the love - of god not you have in yourselves.
43.5.43.1^i have come in the name of the father of me, and not you receive me;
43.5.43.2^if another should come in the name the own, him you will receive.
43.5.44.1^how are able you to believe, glory from one another receiving, and the glory that is from the only god, not you seek?
43.5.45.1^not think that i will accuse you to the father.
43.5.45.2^there is one accusing you, moses, in whom you have hoped.
43.5.46.1^if for you were believing moses, you would have believed - me;
43.5.46.2^concerning for me he wrote.
43.5.47.1^if now - his writings not you believe, how - my words will you believe?
43.6.1.1^after these things went away - jesus over the sea - of galilee   - of tiberias.
43.6.2.1^was following now him a crowd great, because they were seeing the signs which he was doing upon those being sick.
43.6.3.1^went up now on the mountain jesus, and there he was sitting with the disciples of him.
43.6.4.1^was now near the passover, the feast of the jews.
43.6.5.1^having lifted up then the eyes - jesus and having seen that a great crowd is coming to him, he says to philip, from where shall we buy bread that might eat these?
43.6.6.1^this now he was saying testing him;
43.6.6.2^he for knew what he was about to do.
43.6.7.1^answered him - philip, two hundred denarii worth of loaves not are sufficient for them that each little piece one might receive.
43.6.8.1^says to him one of the disciples of him, andrew, the brother of simon peter,
43.6.9.1^is a little boy here, who has five loaves barley and two small fish;
43.6.9.2^but these what are for so many?
43.6.10.1^said - jesus, make the men to recline.
43.6.10.2^there was now grass much in the place.
43.6.10.3^reclined therefore the men, the number about five thousand.
43.6.11.1^took then the loaves - jesus, and having given thanks, he distributed to those reclining;
43.6.11.2^likewise also of the fish, as much as they wished.
43.6.12.1^when now they were filled, he says to the disciples of him, gather together the having been over and above fragments, so that nothing anything may be lost.
43.6.13.1^they gathered together therefore, and filled twelve hand-baskets of fragments from the five loaves - barley which were over and above to those having eaten.
43.6.14.1^the therefore people, having seen what he had done, the sign, were saying -, this is truly the prophet who is coming into the world.
43.6.15.1^jesus therefore, having known that they are about to come and to seize him that they might make him king, withdrew again to the mountain himself alone.
43.6.16.1^when now evening it became, went down the disciples of him to the sea,
43.6.17.1^and having entered into a boat, they were going over the sea to capernaum.
43.6.17.2^and dark already it had become, and not had come to them - jesus.
43.6.18.1^- and the sea by a wind strong blowing was agitated.
43.6.19.1^having rowed therefore about stadia twenty five or thirty, they see - jesus walking on the sea, and near the boat coming, and they were frightened.
43.6.20.1^- and he says to them, i am he;
43.6.20.2^not fear.
43.6.21.1^they were willing then to receive him into the boat, and immediately was the boat at the land to which they were going.
43.6.22.1^on the next day the crowd - standing on the other side of the sea, having seen that boat other no was there if not one, and that not went with the disciples of him - jesus into the boat, but alone the disciples of him went away;
43.6.23.1^but other came boats from tiberias, near the place where they ate the bread, having given thanks the lord.
43.6.24.1^when therefore saw the crowd that jesus not is there, nor the disciples of him, they entered themselves into the boats and came to capernaum, seeking - jesus.
43.6.25.1^and having found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him, rabbi, when here have you come?
43.6.26.1^answered them - jesus and said, truly, truly, i say to you, you seek me, not because you saw signs, but because you ate of the loaves and were satisfied.
43.6.27.1^work not for the food that is perishing, but for the food - enduring unto life eternal, which the son - of man to you will give.
43.6.27.2^him for the father has sealed, - god.
43.6.28.1^they said therefore to him, what must we do, that we may be doing the works - of god?
43.6.29.1^answered - jesus and said to them, this is the work - of god, that you should believe in him whom has sent he.
43.6.30.1^they said therefore to him, what then do you as a sign, that we may see and may believe you?
43.6.30.2^what work do you perform?
43.6.31.1^the fathers of us the manna ate in the wilderness, as it is written:
43.6.31.2^bread from - heaven he gave them to eat.
43.6.32.1^said therefore to them - jesus, truly, truly, i say to you, not moses has given you the bread from - heaven, but the father of me gives you the bread from - heaven - true.
43.6.33.1^the for bread - of god is the one coming down out of - heaven and life giving to the world.
43.6.34.1^they said therefore to him, sir, always give to us the bread this.
43.6.35.1^said to them - jesus, i am the bread - of life;
43.6.35.2^the one coming to me never not shall hunger, and the one believing in me no not shall thirst at any time.
43.6.36.1^but i said to you that also you have seen me, and yet not believe.
43.6.37.1^all that gives me the father, to me will come, and the one coming to me, no not shall i cast out.
43.6.38.1^for i have come down from - heaven, not that i should do the will - of me, but the will of the one having sent me.
43.6.39.1^this now is the will of the one having sent me, that all that he has given me, none i should lose of it, but will raise up it in the last day.
43.6.40.1^this for is the will of the father of me, that everyone - beholding the son and believing in him should have life eternal, and will raise up him i in the last day.
43.6.41.1^were grumbling therefore the jews about him because he said, i am the bread - having come down from - heaven.
43.6.42.1^and they were saying, not this is jesus the son of joseph, of whom we know the father and the mother?
43.6.42.2^how then says he -, from - heaven i have come down?
43.6.43.1^answered jesus and said to them, not grumble with one another.
43.6.44.1^no one is able to come to me, if not the father, the one having sent me, draws him, and i will raise up him in the last day.
43.6.45.1^it is written in the prophets:
43.6.45.2^and they will be all taught of god.
43.6.45.3^everyone - having heard from the father and having learned, comes to me.
43.6.46.1^not that the father has seen anyone, if not the one being from - god;
43.6.46.2^he has seen the father.
43.6.47.1^truly, truly, i say to you, the one believing has life eternal.
43.6.48.1^i am the bread - of life.
43.6.49.1^the fathers of you ate in the wilderness the manna, and died.
43.6.50.1^this is the bread - from - heaven coming down, that anyone of it may eat, and not die.
43.6.51.1^i am the bread - living, - from - heaven having come down;
43.6.51.2^if anyone shall have eaten of this - bread, he will live to the age;
43.6.51.3^and the bread also that i will give, the flesh of me is for the of the world life.
43.6.52.1^were arguing therefore with one another the jews, saying, how is able this man us to give the flesh of him to eat?
43.6.53.1^said therefore to them - jesus, truly, truly, i say to you, if not you shall have eaten the flesh of the son - of man, and shall have drunk of him the blood, not you have life in yourselves.
43.6.54.1^the one eating of me the flesh, and drinking of me the blood, has life eternal, and i will raise up him in the last day.
43.6.55.1^the for flesh of me, true is food, and the blood of me, true is drink.
43.6.56.1^the one eating of me the flesh and drinking of me the blood, in me abides, and i in him.
43.6.57.1^as sent me the living father, and i live because of the father, also the one feeding on me, he also will live because of me.
43.6.58.1^this is the bread - from heaven having come down, not as ate the fathers and died.
43.6.58.2^the one eating this - bread will live to the age.
43.6.59.1^these things he said in the synagogue, teaching in capernaum.
43.6.60.1^many therefore, having heard, of the disciples of him, said, difficult is the word this;
43.6.60.2^who is able it to hear?
43.6.61.1^knowing however - jesus in himself that are grumbling about this the disciples of him, he said to them, this you does offend?
43.6.62.1^what if then you should see the son - of man ascending where he was - before?
43.6.63.1^the spirit it is - giving life;
43.6.63.2^the flesh not profits nothing.
43.6.63.3^the words that i speak to you spirit are, and life they are.
43.6.64.1^but they are of you some who not believe.
43.6.64.2^knew for from the beginning - jesus who are those not believing and who it is who will betray him.
43.6.65.1^and he was saying, because of this have i said to you that no one is able to come to me, if not it shall have been granted to him from the father.
43.6.66.1^from that time, many out of the disciples of him departed to the back and no longer with him walked.
43.6.67.1^said therefore - jesus to the twelve, not also you are wishing to go away?
43.6.68.1^answered him simon peter, lord, to whom will we go?
43.6.68.2^the words of life eternal you have;
43.6.69.1^and we have believed and have known that you are the holy one - of god.
43.6.70.1^answered them - jesus, not i you the twelve did choose, and of you one a devil is?
43.6.71.1^he was speaking now - of judas son of simon iscariot;
43.6.71.2^he for was about to betray him, one of the twelve.
43.7.1.1^and after these things, was walking - jesus in - galilee;
43.7.1.2^not for he did desire in - judea to walk, because were seeking him the jews to kill.
43.7.2.1^was now near the feast of the jews, of booths.
43.7.3.1^said therefore to him the brothers of him, depart from here and go into - judea, so that also the disciples of you will see of you the works that you are doing.
43.7.4.1^no one for anything in secret does and seeks himself in public to be.
43.7.4.2^if these things you do, show yourself to the world.
43.7.5.1^not even for the brothers of him were believing in him.
43.7.6.1^says therefore to them - jesus, the time - of me not yet is come, - but the time - of you always is ready.
43.7.7.1^not is able the world to hate you;
43.7.7.2^me however it hates, because i bear witness concerning it that the works of it evil are.
43.7.8.1^you go up to the feast.
43.7.8.2^i not am going up to the feast this, for - my time not yet has been fulfilled.
43.7.9.1^these things now having said to them, he remained in - galilee.
43.7.10.1^when however had gone up the brothers of him to the feast, then also he went up, not openly, but as in secret.
43.7.11.1^the therefore jews were seeking him at the feast and were saying, where is he?
43.7.12.1^and murmuring about him there was much among the crowds.
43.7.12.2^some indeed were saying -, good he is.
43.7.12.3^others however were saying, no, but he deceives the people.
43.7.13.1^no one however publicly was speaking about him, because of the fear of the jews.
43.7.14.1^now also of the feast being in the middle, went up jesus into the temple and was teaching.
43.7.15.1^were marveling then the jews, saying, how this one writings knows, not having studied?
43.7.16.1^answered therefore them - jesus and said -, my teaching not is of myself, but of the one having sent me.
43.7.17.1^if anyone desires the will of him to do, he will know concerning the teaching, whether from - god it is, or i from myself speak.
43.7.18.1^the one from himself speaking, the glory the own seeks;
43.7.18.2^the one however seeking the glory of the one having sent him, he true is, and unrighteousness in him not is.
43.7.19.1^not moses has given to you the law, and no one of you keeps the law?
43.7.19.2^why me do you seek to kill?
43.7.20.1^answered the crowd, a demon you have;
43.7.20.2^who you seeks to kill?
43.7.21.1^answered jesus and said to them, one work i did, and all you marvel.
43.7.22.1^because of the fact that moses has given you - circumcision   not that of - moses it is, but of the fathers   also on sabbath you circumcise a man.
43.7.23.1^if circumcision receives a man on sabbath so that not might be broken the law of moses, with me are you angry because entirely a man sound i made on the sabbath?
43.7.24.1^not judge according to appearance, but the righteous judgment judge.
43.7.25.1^were saying therefore some of those of jerusalem, not this is he whom they seek to kill?
43.7.26.1^and behold, publicly he speaks, and nothing to him they say not ever.
43.7.26.2^truly have recognized the rulers that this is the christ?
43.7.27.1^but this man, we know from where he is.
43.7.27.2^the however christ, whenever he may come, no one knows from where he is.
43.7.28.1^cried out therefore in the temple teaching - jesus, and saying, me you know, and you know from where i am;
43.7.28.2^and of myself not i have come, but is true the one having sent me, whom you not know.
43.7.29.1^but i know him, because from him i am, and he me sent.
43.7.30.1^they were seeking therefore him to take, but no one laid upon him the hand, because not yet had come the hour of him.
43.7.31.1^out of the crowd now many believed in him and were saying, the christ, when he comes, not more signs will he do than this man has done?
43.7.32.1^heard the pharisees the crowd murmuring about him these things, and sent the chief priests and the pharisees officers, that they might seize him.
43.7.33.1^said therefore - jesus, yet time a little with you i am, and i go to the one having sent me.
43.7.34.1^you will seek me and not will find me;
43.7.34.2^and where am i, you not are able to come.
43.7.35.1^said therefore the jews among themselves, where he is about to go that we not will find him?
43.7.35.2^not to the dispersion among the greeks is he about to go and to teach the greeks?
43.7.36.1^what is the word this that he said, you will seek me, and not will find me, and where am i you not are able to come
43.7.37.1^in now the last day, the great day of the feast, stood - jesus and cried out, saying, if anyone thirsts, let him come to me and drink.
43.7.38.1^the one believing in me, as has said the scripture:
43.7.38.2^rivers out of the belly of him will flow of water living.
43.7.39.1^this now he said concerning the spirit, whom were about to receive those having believed in him;
43.7.39.2^not yet given for was the spirit, because jesus not yet was glorified.
43.7.40.1^some of the crowd therefore, having heard the words these, were saying this is truly the prophet.
43.7.41.1^others were saying, this is the christ.
43.7.41.2^others however were saying, not indeed out of - galilee the christ comes?
43.7.42.1^not the scripture has said that out of the seed of david and from bethlehem, the village where was david, comes the christ?
43.7.43.1^a division therefore occurred in the crowd because of him.
43.7.44.1^some now desired of them to seize him, but no one laid on him the hands.
43.7.45.1^came therefore the officers to the chief priests and pharisees, and said to them that, because of why not did you bring him?
43.7.46.1^answered the officers, never spoke like this.
43.7.46.2^a man
43.7.47.1^answered therefore them the pharisees, not also you have been deceived?
43.7.48.1^not any of the rulers has believed on him, or of the pharisees?
43.7.49.1^but the crowd this, - not knowing the law, accursed are.
43.7.50.1^says nicodemus to them, the one having come to him, the former one being of them,
43.7.51.1^not the law of us does judge the man, if not it has heard first from him and known what he does?
43.7.52.1^they answered and said to him, not also you from - galilee are?
43.7.52.2^search and see that out of - galilee a prophet not is raised.
43.7.53.1^and went each to the home of him.
43.8.1.1^jesus however went to the mount - of olives.
43.8.2.1^early in the morning then again he came into the temple, and all the people were coming to him.
43.8.2.2^and having sat down, he was teaching them.
43.8.3.1^bring now the scribes and the pharisees a woman in adultery having been caught, and having set her in the midst,
43.8.4.1^they say to him, teacher, this - woman was caught in the very act, committing adultery.
43.8.5.1^in now the law, us moses commanded - such to be stoned.
43.8.5.2^you therefore, what say you?
43.8.6.1^this now they were saying, testing him so that they might have grounds to accuse him.
43.8.6.2^- but jesus, down having stooped, with his finger began writing on the ground.
43.8.7.1^as however they continued asking him, having lifted himself up also, he said to them, the one sinless among you, the first at her let him cast.
43.8.7.2^stone
43.8.8.1^and again having stooped down, he continued to write on the ground.
43.8.9.1^- and having heard, they began to go away one by one having begun from the elder ones, and he was left alone, and the woman in the midst being.
43.8.10.1^having lifted up then, - jesus said to her, woman, where are they?
43.8.10.2^no one you has condemned?
43.8.11.1^- and she said, no one, sir.
43.8.11.2^said then - jesus, neither i you do condemn;
43.8.11.3^go, and from - now on no more sin.
43.8.12.1^again therefore to them spoke - jesus, saying, i am the light of the world;
43.8.12.2^the one following me no not shall walk in the darkness, but will have the light - of life.
43.8.13.1^said therefore to him the pharisees, you concerning yourself are bearing witness;
43.8.13.2^the testimony of you not is true.
43.8.14.1^answered jesus and said to them, even if i am bearing witness concerning myself, true is the testimony of me, because i know from where i came and where i am going.
43.8.14.2^you however not know from where i come or where i am going.
43.8.15.1^you according to the flesh judge;
43.8.15.2^i not am judging no one.
43.8.16.1^and if judge however i, - judgment - my true is, because alone not i am, but i and the having sent me father.
43.8.17.1^and in the law also - of you it has been written that of two men the testimony true is.
43.8.18.1^i am the one bearing witness concerning myself, and bears witness concerning me the having sent me father.
43.8.19.1^they were saying therefore to him, where is the father of you?
43.8.19.2^answered jesus, neither me you know, nor the father of me.
43.8.19.3^if me you had known, also the father of me - you would have known.
43.8.20.1^these - words he spoke in the treasury, teaching in the temple;
43.8.20.2^and no one seized him, for not yet had come the hour of him.
43.8.21.1^he said then again to them, i am going away and you will seek me, and in the sin of you, you will die;
43.8.21.2^where i go, you not are able to come.
43.8.22.1^were saying therefore the jews, not will he kill himself, that he says, where i go, you not are able to come?
43.8.23.1^and he was saying to them, you from - below are;
43.8.23.2^i from - above am.
43.8.23.3^you of this the world are, i not am of the world this.
43.8.24.1^i said therefore to you that you will die in the sins of you;
43.8.24.2^if for not you believe that i am he, you will die in the sins of you.
43.8.25.1^they were saying therefore to him, you who are?
43.8.25.2^said to them - jesus, from the beginning - what also i am saying to you.
43.8.26.1^many things i have concerning you to say, and to judge;
43.8.26.2^but the one having sent me true is;
43.8.26.3^and i what i have heard from him, these things i say to the world.
43.8.27.1^not they understood that about the father to them he was speaking.
43.8.28.1^said therefore to them - jesus, when you shall have lifted up the son - of man, then you will know that i am he, and from myself i do nothing, but as taught me the father, these things i speak.
43.8.29.1^and the one having sent me, with me is;
43.8.29.2^not he has left me alone, because i the things pleasing to him do always.
43.8.30.1^these things of his speaking, many believed in him.
43.8.31.1^was saying therefore - jesus to the having believed in him jews, if you abide in the word - my, truly disciples of me you are.
43.8.32.1^and you will know the truth, and the truth will set free you.
43.8.33.1^they answered unto him, seed of abraham we are, and to no one have we been under bondage ever.
43.8.33.2^how you say -, free you will become?
43.8.34.1^answered them - jesus, truly, truly, i say to you that everyone - practicing the sin, a slave is of the sin.
43.8.35.1^- now the slave not abides in the house to the age;
43.8.35.2^the son abides to the age.
43.8.36.1^if therefore the son you shall set free, indeed free you will be.
43.8.37.1^i know that seed of abraham you are;
43.8.37.2^but you seek me to kill, because the word - of me not receives a place in you.
43.8.38.1^that which i have seen with the father, i speak;
43.8.38.2^also you therefore what you have heard from the father, you do.
43.8.39.1^they answered and said to him, the father of us abraham is.
43.8.39.2^says to them - jesus, if children - of abraham you were, the works - of abraham you would do;
43.8.40.1^now however you seek me to kill, a man who the truth to you has spoken, that i heard from - god.
43.8.40.2^this abraham not did.
43.8.41.1^you are doing the works of the father of you.
43.8.41.2^they said therefore to him, we of sexual immorality not have been born;
43.8.41.3^one father we have, - god.
43.8.42.1^said to them - jesus, if - god father of you were, you would have loved - me, i for from - god came forth and am here;
43.8.42.2^not even for of myself have i come, but he me sent.
43.8.43.1^because of why the speech - my not do you understand?
43.8.43.2^because not you are able to hear the word - my.
43.8.44.1^you of the father the devil are, and the desires of father of you, you desire to do.
43.8.44.2^he a murderer was from the beginning, and in the truth not has stood, because not there is truth in him.
43.8.44.3^whenever he might speak - falsehood, from the own he speaks;
43.8.44.4^for a liar he is, and the father of it.
43.8.45.1^i now because the truth speak, not you do believe me!
43.8.46.1^which of you convicts me concerning sin?
43.8.46.2^if the truth i speak, because of why you not do believe me?
43.8.47.1^he who is of - god, the words - of god hears;
43.8.47.2^because of this you not hear, because of - god, not you are.
43.8.48.1^answered the jews and said to him, not rightly say we that a samaritan are you, and a demon have?
43.8.49.1^answered jesus, i a demon not have;
43.8.49.2^but i honor the father of me, and you dishonor me.
43.8.50.1^i now not seek the glory of me;
43.8.50.2^there is one seeking it and judging.
43.8.51.1^truly, truly, i say to you, if anyone - my word keeps, death never not shall he see, to the age.
43.8.52.1^said therefore to him the jews, now we know that a demon you have.
43.8.52.2^abraham died, and the prophets, and you say, if anyone the word of me keeps, never not shall he taste of death, to the age.
43.8.53.1^not you greater than are the father of us abraham, who died?
43.8.53.2^and the prophets died!
43.8.53.3^whom yourself make you?
43.8.54.1^answered jesus, if i glorify myself, the glory of me nothing is;
43.8.54.2^it is the father of me - glorifying me, of whom you say -, god of us he is.
43.8.55.1^and not you have known him, i however know him.
43.8.55.2^and if i say that not i know him, i will be like you, a liar.
43.8.55.3^but i know him, and the word of him i keep.
43.8.56.1^abraham the father of you rejoiced in that he should see - day - my, and he saw and rejoiced.
43.8.57.1^said therefore the jews to him, fifty years old not yet are you, and abraham you have seen?
43.8.58.1^said to them jesus, truly, truly, i say to you, before abraham was, i am.
43.8.59.1^they took up therefore stones, that they might cast at him;
43.8.59.2^jesus however hid himself, and went forth out of the temple.
43.9.1.1^and passing by, he saw a man blind from birth.
43.9.2.1^and asked him the disciples of him saying, rabbi, who sinned, this man or the parents of him, that blind he should be born?
43.9.3.1^answered jesus, neither this man sinned, nor the parents of him;
43.9.3.2^but it was that should be displayed the works - of god in him.
43.9.4.1^us it behooves to work the works of the one having sent me, while day it is;
43.9.4.2^is coming night, when no one is able to work.
43.9.5.1^while in the world i shall be, the light i am of the world.
43.9.6.1^these things having said, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and applied to him the clay to the eyes.
43.9.7.1^and he said to him, go, wash in the pool - of siloam, which means sent.
43.9.7.2^he went therefore and washed, and came back seeing.
43.9.8.1^the therefore neighbors and those having seen him - before, that a beggar he was, were saying, not this is he who was sitting and begging?
43.9.9.1^some were saying -, he it is, but others were saying, no, but like him he is.
43.9.9.2^he kept saying -, i am he.
43.9.10.1^they were saying therefore to him, how then were opened of you the eyes?
43.9.11.1^answered he, the man - called jesus clay made, and anointed of me the eyes, and he said to me -, go to - siloam and wash.
43.9.11.2^having gone therefore and having washed, i received sight.
43.9.12.1^and they said to him, where is he?
43.9.12.2^he says, not i know.
43.9.13.1^they bring him to the pharisees who once was blind.
43.9.14.1^was now sabbath in which day the clay had made - jesus and opened of him the eyes.
43.9.15.1^again therefore were asking him also the pharisees how he had received sight.
43.9.15.2^- and he said to them, clay he put of me on the eyes, and i washed, and i see.
43.9.16.1^were saying therefore of the pharisees some, not is this from god the man, for the sabbath not he does keep.
43.9.16.2^others however were saying, how is able a man sinful such signs to do?
43.9.16.3^and division there was among them.
43.9.17.1^they say therefore to the blind man again, what you say concerning him, for he opened of you the eyes?
43.9.17.2^- and he said -, a prophet he is.
43.9.18.1^not did believe then the jews concerning him that he had been blind and had received sight, until when they called the parents of him - having received sight.
43.9.19.1^and they asked them saying, this is the son of you, of whom you say that blind he was born?
43.9.19.2^how then does he see presently?
43.9.20.1^answered therefore the parents of him and said, we know that this is the son of us, and that blind he was born.
43.9.21.1^how however presently he sees, not we know, or who opened of him the eyes, we not know;
43.9.21.2^him ask;
43.9.21.3^age has he.
43.9.21.4^concerning himself, he will speak.
43.9.22.1^these things said the parents of him because they were afraid of the jews;
43.9.22.2^already for had agreed together the jews that if anyone him should confess christ, expelled from the synagogue he would be.
43.9.23.1^because of this, the parents of him said -, age he has;
43.9.23.2^him ask.
43.9.24.1^they called therefore the man out a second time who had been blind, and said to him, give glory - to god!
43.9.24.2^we know that this - man a sinner is.
43.9.25.1^answered then he, whether a sinner he is, not i know.
43.9.25.2^one thing i do know, that blind being, now i see.
43.9.26.1^they said therefore to him, what did he to you?
43.9.26.2^how opened he of you the eyes?
43.9.27.1^he answered them, i told you already, and not you did listen.
43.9.27.2^why again do you wish to hear?
43.9.27.3^not also you do wish his disciples to become?
43.9.28.1^and they railed at him and said, you a disciple are of that one;
43.9.28.2^we however - of moses are disciples.
43.9.29.1^we know that to moses has spoken - god;
43.9.29.2^this man however not we know from where is.
43.9.30.1^answered the man and said to them, in this for - an amazing thing is, that you not know from where he is, and yet he opened my - eyes.
43.9.31.1^we know that sinners - god not does hear;
43.9.31.2^but if anyone god-fearing is, and the will of him does, him he hears.
43.9.32.1^out of the age never it has been heard, that opened anyone the eyes of one blind having been born.
43.9.33.1^if not were this man from god, not he could do nothing.
43.9.34.1^they answered and said to him, in sins you were born entirely, and you teach us?
43.9.34.2^and they cast him out.
43.9.35.1^heard jesus that they had cast him out, and having found him, he said, you believe in the son of man?
43.9.36.1^answered he and said, and who is he, lord, that i may believe in him?
43.9.37.1^said to him - jesus, both you have seen him, and the one speaking with you he is.
43.9.38.1^- and he was saying, i believe, lord.
43.9.38.2^and he worshiped him.
43.9.39.1^and said - jesus, for judgment i into the world this came, that those not seeing may see;
43.9.39.2^and those seeing, blind may become.
43.9.40.1^heard of the pharisees these things, who with him were, and they said to him, not also we blind are?
43.9.41.1^said to them - jesus, if blind you were, not - you would have sin;
43.9.41.2^since however you say -, we see, the sin of you remains.
43.10.1.1^truly, truly, i say to you, the one not entering in by the door to the fold of the sheep, but climbing up another way, he a thief is and a robber.
43.10.2.1^the one however entering in by the door, shepherd is of the sheep.
43.10.3.1^to him the doorkeeper opens, and the sheep the voice of him hear, and the own sheep he calls by name and leads out them.
43.10.4.1^when the own all he has brought out, before them he goes, and the sheep him follow, because they know the voice of him.
43.10.5.1^a stranger however in no way not they will follow, but will flee from him, because not they recognize - of strangers the voice.
43.10.6.1^this - allegory spoke to them - jesus;
43.10.6.2^they however not knew what it was that he was saying to them.
43.10.7.1^said therefore again - jesus, truly, truly, i say to you -, i am the door of the sheep.
43.10.8.1^all who ever came before me, thieves are and robbers;
43.10.8.2^but not did hear them the sheep.
43.10.9.1^i am the door;
43.10.9.2^by me if anyone enters in, he will be saved, and he will go in and will go out, and pasture will find.
43.10.10.1^the thief not comes if not that he might steal, and might kill, and might destroy.
43.10.10.2^i came that life they may have, and abundantly may have it.
43.10.11.1^i am the shepherd - good.
43.10.11.2^the shepherd - good, the life of him lays down for the sheep;
43.10.12.1^the hired servant however not being the shepherd, whose not are the sheep own, sees the wolf coming, and leaves the sheep, and flees   and the wolf snatches them and scatters
43.10.13.1^because a hired servant he is, and not is himself concerned to him about the sheep.
43.10.14.1^i am the shepherd - good;
43.10.14.2^and i know - my own, and am known i by mine.
43.10.15.1^as knows me the father, i also know the father;
43.10.15.2^and the life of me i lay down for the sheep.
43.10.16.1^and other sheep i have, which not are of the fold this;
43.10.16.2^those also it behooves me to bring, and the voice of me they will hear;
43.10.16.3^and there will be one flock, with one shepherd.
43.10.17.1^because of this, me the father loves, because i lay down the life of me, that again i might take it.
43.10.18.1^no one takes it from me, but i lay down it of myself.
43.10.18.2^authority i have to lay down it, and authority i have again to take it.
43.10.18.3^this - commandment i received from the father of me.
43.10.19.1^division again there was among the jews on account of the words these.
43.10.20.1^were saying now many of them, a demon he has, and is insane;
43.10.20.2^why him do you listen to?
43.10.21.1^others were saying, these - sayings not are those of one possessed by a demon.
43.10.21.2^not a demon is able of the blind the eyes to open?
43.10.22.1^took place at the time the feast of dedication, at - jerusalem.
43.10.22.2^winter it was,
43.10.23.1^and was walking - jesus in the temple in the porch - of solomon.
43.10.24.1^encircled therefore him the jews, and they were saying to him, until when the soul of us hold you in suspense?
43.10.24.2^if you are the christ, tell us plainly.
43.10.25.1^answered them - jesus, i told you, and not you believe.
43.10.25.2^the works that i do in the name of the father of me, these bear witness concerning me.
43.10.26.1^but you not believe, because not you are from among the sheep - of me.
43.10.27.1^the sheep - of me, the voice of me hear, and i know them, and they follow me;
43.10.28.1^and i give them life eternal;
43.10.28.2^and never not shall they perish, to the age, and never will seize anyone them out of the hand of me.
43.10.29.1^the father of me who has given them to me, than all greater is, and no one is able to seize them out of the hand the father.
43.10.30.1^i and the father one are.
43.10.31.1^took up again stones the jews, that they might stone him.
43.10.32.1^answered them - jesus, many works good i have shown you from the father;
43.10.32.2^because of which of these work, me do you stone?
43.10.33.1^answered him the jews, for a good work not we do stone you, but for blasphemy, and because you, a man being, make yourself god.
43.10.34.1^answered them - jesus, not is it written in the law of you -:
43.10.34.2^i said gods you are
43.10.35.1^if them he called gods, to whom the word - of god came, and not is able to be broken the scripture,
43.10.36.1^of him whom the father sanctified and sent into the world, you do say -, you blaspheme, because i said, son - of god i am?
43.10.37.1^if not i do the works of the father of me, not believe me.
43.10.38.1^if however i do, even if me not you believe, the works believe, so that you may know and may understand that in me is the father, and i in the father.
43.10.39.1^they were seeking therefore him again to seize, but he went forth out of the hand of them.
43.10.40.1^and he departed again beyond the jordan, to the place where was john - at first baptizing.
43.10.40.2^and he stayed there.
43.10.41.1^and many came to him and were saying -, john indeed sign did no;
43.10.41.2^everything however that said john about this man, true was.
43.10.42.1^and many believed in him there.
43.11.1.1^was now a certain man ailing, lazarus of bethany, of the village of mary and martha, the sister of her.
43.11.2.1^was now mary the one having anointed the lord with fragrant oil and having wiped the feet of him with the hair of her, whose - brother lazarus was sick.
43.11.3.1^sent therefore the sisters to him, saying, lord, behold, he whom you love is sick.
43.11.4.1^having heard then, - jesus said, this - sickness not is unto death, but for the glory - of god, that may be glorified the son - of god by it.
43.11.5.1^loved now - jesus - martha, and the sister of her, and - lazarus.
43.11.6.1^when therefore he heard that he is sick, then indeed he remained in which he was the place two days.
43.11.7.1^then after this he says to the disciples, let us go into - judea again.
43.11.8.1^say to him the disciples, rabbi, just now were seeking you to stone the jews, and again you are going there?
43.11.9.1^answered jesus, not twelve hours are there in the day?
43.11.9.2^if anyone walks in the day, not he stumbles, because the light the world of this he sees;
43.11.10.1^if however anyone walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light not is in him.
43.11.11.1^these things he said, and after this he says to them, lazarus the friend of us has fallen asleep, but i go that i may awaken him.
43.11.12.1^said therefore the disciples of him, lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will get well.
43.11.13.1^had spoken however - jesus of the death of him;
43.11.13.2^they however thought that of the rest - of sleep he speaks.
43.11.14.1^then therefore said to them - jesus plainly, lazarus has died.
43.11.15.1^and i rejoice for sake of you, in order that you might believe, that not i was there.
43.11.15.2^but let us go to him.
43.11.16.1^said therefore thomas, - called didymus, to the fellow disciples, let go also us, that we may die with him.
43.11.17.1^having come therefore, - jesus found him, four already days having been in the tomb.
43.11.18.1^was now - bethany near - jerusalem, about away stadia fifteen.
43.11.19.1^many now of the jews had come unto - martha and mary that they might console them concerning the brother.
43.11.20.1^- therefore martha, when she heard that jesus is coming, met him;
43.11.20.2^mary however in the house was sitting.
43.11.21.1^said then - martha to - jesus, lord, if you had been here, not - would have died the brother of me.
43.11.22.1^nevertheless even now i know that whatever - you might ask - god, will give you - god.
43.11.23.1^says to her - jesus, will rise again the brother of you.
43.11.24.1^says to him - martha, i know that he will rise again in the resurrection in the last day.
43.11.25.1^said to her - jesus, i am the resurrection and the life;
43.11.25.2^the one believing in me, even if he should die, he will live;
43.11.26.1^and everyone - living and believing in me, never not shall die, to the age.
43.11.26.2^believe you this?
43.11.27.1^she says to him, yes, lord;
43.11.27.2^i have believed that you are the christ, the son - of god, the one into the world coming.
43.11.28.1^and these things having said, she went away and called mary, the sister of her, secretly, having said, the teacher is come, and he calls you.
43.11.29.1^she then when she heard, rose up quickly and was coming to him.
43.11.30.1^not yet now had come - jesus into the village, but was still in the place where had met him - martha.
43.11.31.1^the then jews - being with her in the house and consoling her, having seen - mary that quickly she rose up and went out, followed her, having supposed - she is going to the tomb that she might weep there.
43.11.32.1^- therefore mary, when she came to where was jesus, having seen him, fell of him at the feet, saying to him, lord, if you had been here, not - of me would have died the brother.
43.11.33.1^jesus therefore when he saw her weeping, and the having come with her jews weeping, he was deeply moved - in spirit and troubled himself.
43.11.34.1^and he said, where have you laid him.
43.11.34.2^they say to him, lord, come and see.
43.11.35.1^wept - jesus.
43.11.36.1^were saying therefore the jews, behold how he loved him!
43.11.37.1^some however of them said, not was able this man - having opened the eyes of the blind, to have caused that also this one not should have died?
43.11.38.1^jesus therefore again, being deeply moved in himself, comes to the tomb.
43.11.38.2^it was now a cave, and a stone was lying against it.
43.11.39.1^says - jesus, take away the stone.
43.11.39.2^says to him the sister of the one having died, martha, lord, already he stinks, four days for it is.
43.11.40.1^says to her - jesus, not said i to you that if you should believe, you will see the glory - of god?
43.11.41.1^they took away therefore the stone.
43.11.41.2^- now jesus lifted his eyes upwards and said, father, i thank you that you have heard me.
43.11.42.1^i and knew that always me you hear;
43.11.42.2^but on account of the crowd - standing around i said it, that they may believe that you me sent.
43.11.43.1^and these things having said, in a voice loud he cried out, lazarus, come forth.
43.11.44.1^came forth the one having been dead, being bound the feet and the hands with linen strips, and the face of him in a headcloth bound about.
43.11.44.2^says to them - jesus, unbind him and allow him to go.
43.11.45.1^many therefore of the jews - having come to - mary and having seen what he did, believed in him;
43.11.46.1^some however of them went to the pharisees and told them what had done jesus.
43.11.47.1^gathered therefore the chief priests and the pharisees a council, and they were saying, what are we to do?
43.11.47.2^for this - man many does signs.
43.11.48.1^if we shall let him alone him like this, all will believe in him, and will come the romans and will take away of us both the place and the nation.
43.11.49.1^one however certain of them, caiaphas, high priest being the year same, said to them, you not know nothing,
43.11.50.1^nor consider you that it is profitable for you that one man should die for the people, and not all the nation should perish.
43.11.51.1^this now from himself not he said, but high priest being the year that, he prophesied that was about jesus to die for the nation,
43.11.52.1^and not for the nation only, but that also the children - of god, those having been scattered, he might gather together into one.
43.11.53.1^from that therefore - day they took counsel together that they might kill him.
43.11.54.1^- therefore jesus no longer publicly walked among the jews, but went away from there into the region near the wilderness, to ephraim called a city.
43.11.54.2^and there he stayed with the disciples.
43.11.55.1^was now near the passover of the jews, and went up many to jerusalem out of the region before the passover, so that they might purify themselves.
43.11.56.1^they were seeking therefore - jesus and were saying among one another in the temple standing, what does it seem to you, that no not he will come to the feast?
43.11.57.1^had given now the chief priests and the pharisees a command that if anyone should know where he is, he should show it, so that they might seize him.
43.12.1.1^- therefore jesus, before six days the passover, came to bethany, where was lazarus, whom had raised out from the dead jesus.
43.12.2.1^they made therefore him a supper there, and - martha was serving, - and lazarus one was of those reclining with him.
43.12.3.1^- therefore mary, having taken a litra of fragrant oil of nard pure of great price, anointed the feet - of jesus and wiped with the hair of her the feet of him;
43.12.3.2^the now house was filled with the fragrance of the oil.
43.12.4.1^says however judas - iscariot, one of the disciples of him, - being about him to betray,
43.12.5.1^because of why this - fragrant oil not was sold for three hundred denarii and given to the poor?
43.12.6.1^he said however this, not because for the poor he was caring to him, but because a thief he was, and the money bag having, that being put into it he used to pilfer.
43.12.7.1^said therefore - jesus, leave alone her, so that for the day of the burial of me she may keep it;
43.12.8.1^the poor for always you have with you;
43.12.8.2^me however not always you have.
43.12.9.1^knew therefore - a crowd great of the jews that there he is;
43.12.9.2^and they came, not because of - jesus only, but that also - lazarus they might see, whom he had raised out from the dead.
43.12.10.1^took counsel however the chief priests that also - lazarus they might kill,
43.12.11.1^because many on account of him were going away of the jews and were believing in - jesus.
43.12.12.1^on the next day the crowd great - having come to the feast, having heard that is coming - jesus into jerusalem,
43.12.13.1^took the branches of the palm trees and went out to meet him, and were shouting:
43.12.13.2^hosanna!
43.12.13.3^blessed is the one coming in the name of the lord!
43.12.13.4^and the king - of israel!
43.12.14.1^having found then - jesus a young donkey, he sat upon it, as it is written:
43.12.15.1^not fear, daughter of zion.
43.12.15.2^behold, the king of you comes, sitting on a colt of a donkey.
43.12.16.1^these things not knew of him the disciples from the first, but when was glorified jesus, then they remembered that these things were of him written, and these things they had done to him.
43.12.17.1^continued to bear witness therefore the crowd - being with him when - lazarus he called out of the tomb and raised him out from the dead.
43.12.18.1^on account of this also met him the crowd, because they heard this of his having done the sign.
43.12.19.1^- therefore the pharisees said among themselves, you see that not you gain nothing.
43.12.19.2^behold, the world after him has gone.
43.12.20.1^there were now greeks certain among those coming up that they might worship at the feast;
43.12.21.1^these therefore came to philip, who was from bethsaida - of galilee, and they were asking him saying, sir, we desire - jesus to see.
43.12.22.1^comes - philip and tells - andrew;
43.12.22.2^come andrew and philip and tell - jesus.
43.12.23.1^- and jesus answered them saying, has come the hour that should be glorified the son - of man.
43.12.24.1^truly, truly, i say to you, if not the grain - of wheat, having fallen into the ground, should die, it alone abides;
43.12.24.2^if however it should die, much fruit it bears.
43.12.25.1^the one loving the life of him, loses it, and the one hating the life of him in the world this, to life eternal will keep it.
43.12.26.1^if me anyone serves, me let him follow;
43.12.26.2^and where am i, there also the servant - of me will be.
43.12.26.3^if anyone me serves, will honor him the father.
43.12.27.1^now the soul of me has been troubled, and what shall i say?
43.12.27.2^father, save me from the hour this.
43.12.27.3^but on account of this i came to the hour this.
43.12.28.1^father, glorify of you the name.
43.12.28.2^came therefore a voice from - heaven:
43.12.28.3^both i have glorified it, and again i will glorify it.
43.12.29.1^- therefore the crowd - having stood and having heard was saying, thunder there has been.
43.12.29.2^others were saying, an angel to him has spoken.
43.12.30.1^answered jesus and said not because of me the voice this has come, but because of you.
43.12.31.1^now the judgment is the world of this;
43.12.31.2^now the prince of the world this will be cast out.
43.12.32.1^and i, if i am lifted up from the earth, all will draw to myself.
43.12.33.1^this now he was saying, signifying by what death he was about to die.
43.12.34.1^answered then him the crowd, we have heard from the law that the christ abides to the age, and how say you that it behooves to be lifted up the son - of man?
43.12.34.2^who is this - son - of man?
43.12.35.1^said therefore to them - jesus, yet a little while the light with you is.
43.12.35.2^walk while the light you have, so that not darkness you might overtake.
43.12.35.3^and the one walking in the darkness not knows where he is going.
43.12.36.1^while the light you have, believe in the light, so that sons of light you may become.
43.12.36.2^these things spoke jesus, and having gone away, he was hidden from them.
43.12.37.1^so many however of him signs having been done before them, not they believed in him,
43.12.38.1^so that the word of isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled that said:
43.12.38.2^lord, who has believed the report of us?
43.12.38.3^and the arm of the lord to whom has been revealed?
43.12.39.1^because of this, not they were able to believe, for again said isaiah:
43.12.40.1^he has blinded of them the eyes, and has hardened of them the heart, that not they should see with the eyes, and understand with the heart, and turn, and i will heal them.
43.12.41.1^these things said isaiah because he saw the glory of him and spoke concerning him.
43.12.42.1^nevertheless, indeed even of the rulers many believed in him;
43.12.42.2^but on account of the pharisees not they were confessing, so that not put out of the synagogue they might be;
43.12.43.1^they loved for the glory - of men more than the glory - of god.
43.12.44.1^jesus then cried out and said, the one believing in me, not believes in me, but in the one having sent me;
43.12.45.1^and the one beholding me, beholds the one having sent me.
43.12.46.1^i a light into the world have come, so that everyone - believing in me, in the darkness not should abide.
43.12.47.1^and if anyone of me hears the words and not keeps them, i not do judge him, not for i came that i might judge the world, but that i might save the world.
43.12.48.1^the one rejecting me and not receiving the words of me has one judging him:
43.12.48.2^the word which i spoke, that will judge him in the last day.
43.12.49.1^for i from myself not spoke, but the having sent me father himself, me a commandment gave what i should say and what i should speak.
43.12.50.1^and i know that the commandment of him life eternal is.
43.12.50.2^what therefore i speak, as has said to me the father, so i speak.
43.13.1.1^before now the feast of the passover, knowing - jesus that had come his - hour, that he would depart out of the world this to the father, having loved the own who were in the world, to the end he loved them.
43.13.2.1^and supper taking place, the devil already having put into the heart that he should betray him of judas, son of simon iscariot,
43.13.3.1^knowing that all things has given him the father into the hands, and that from god he came forth and to - god he is going,
43.13.4.1^he rises from the supper and lays aside the garments.
43.13.4.2^and having taken a towel, he girded himself.
43.13.5.1^after that, he pours water into the basin, and he began to wash the feet of the disciples, and to wipe them with the towel with which he was girded.
43.13.6.1^he comes then to simon peter, who says to him, lord, you of me do wash the feet?
43.13.7.1^answered jesus and said to him, what i do you not know presently;
43.13.7.2^you will know however after these things.
43.13.8.1^says to him peter, no not shall you wash of me the feet to the age.
43.13.8.2^answered jesus him, if not i wash you, not you have part with me.
43.13.9.1^says to him simon peter, lord, not the feet of me only, but also the hands and the head.
43.13.10.1^says to him - jesus, the one having been bathed not has need, if not the feet to wash, but is clean wholly;
43.13.10.2^and you all clean are, but not all.
43.13.11.1^he knew for the one who was betraying him;
43.13.11.2^on account of this he said -, not all clean you are.
43.13.12.1^when therefore he had washed the feet of them and taken the garments of him, and having reclined again, he said to them, do you know what i have done to you?
43.13.13.1^you call me - teacher and - lord, and rightly you say, i am for.
43.13.14.1^if therefore i have washed your - feet, the lord and the teacher, also you ought of one another to wash the feet.
43.13.15.1^a pattern for i gave you, that as i did to you, also you should do.
43.13.16.1^truly, truly, i say to you, not is a servant greater than the master of him, nor a messenger greater than the one having sent him.
43.13.17.1^if these things you know, blessed are you if you do them.
43.13.18.1^not about all of you i speak.
43.13.18.2^i know whom i chose, but that the scripture may be fulfilled:
43.13.18.3^the one eating of me the bread lifted up against me the heel of him.
43.13.19.1^from this time i am telling you before - it comes to pass, so that you should believe when it comes to pass, that i am he.
43.13.20.1^truly, truly, i say to you, the one receiving - any i shall send, me receives;
43.13.20.2^the one now me receiving, receives the one having sent me.
43.13.21.1^these things having said, - jesus was troubled - in spirit, and he testified and said, truly, truly, i say to you that one of you will betray me.
43.13.22.1^began to look upon one another the disciples, being uncertain of whom he is speaking.
43.13.23.1^there was reclining one of the disciples of him in the bosom - of jesus, whom loved - jesus.
43.13.24.1^motions therefore to him simon peter to ask who it is about whom he is speaking?
43.13.25.1^having leaned then he thus on the breast - of jesus, he says to him, lord, who is it?
43.13.26.1^answers - jesus, he it is to whom i will dip the morsel and will give him.
43.13.26.2^having dipped then the morsel, he takes it and gives it to judas, son of simon iscariot.
43.13.27.1^and after the morsel, then entered into him - satan.
43.13.27.2^says therefore to him - jesus, what you do, do quickly.
43.13.28.1^this now no one knew of those reclining to what he spoke to him.
43.13.29.1^some for were thinking, since the money bag had judas, that is saying to him - jesus, buy what things need of we have for the feast, or to the poor that something he should give.
43.13.30.1^having received therefore the morsel, he went out immediately;
43.13.30.2^it was now night.
43.13.31.1^when therefore he had gone out, says jesus, now has been glorified the son - of man, and - god has been glorified in him.
43.13.32.1^if - god is glorified in him, also - god will glorify him in himself, and immediately will glorify him.
43.13.33.1^little children, yet a little while with you i am.
43.13.33.2^you will seek me;
43.13.33.3^and, as i said to the jews -:
43.13.33.4^where i go, you not are able to come, also to you i say now.
43.13.34.1^a commandment new i give to you, that you should love one another;
43.13.34.2^as i have loved you, so also you should love one another.
43.13.35.1^by this will know all that to me disciples you are, if love you have among one another.
43.13.36.1^says to him simon peter, lord, where go you?
43.13.36.2^answered him jesus, where i go, not you are able me now to follow;
43.13.36.3^you will follow however afterward.
43.13.37.1^says to him - peter, lord, because of why not am i able you to follow presently?
43.13.37.2^the life of me for you i will lay down.
43.13.38.1^answered jesus, the life of you for me will you lay down?
43.13.38.2^truly, truly, i say to you, no not the rooster will crow, until that you will deny me three times.
43.14.1.1^not let be troubled of you the heart.
43.14.1.2^you believe in - god, also in me believe.
43.14.2.1^in the house of the father of me, mansions many there are;
43.14.2.2^if now not, would i have told - you that i go to prepare a place for you?
43.14.3.1^and if i go and prepare a place for you, again i am coming and will receive you to myself, that where am i, also you may be.
43.14.4.1^and to the place i am going, you know the way.
43.14.5.1^says to him thomas, lord, not we know where you are going;
43.14.5.2^how can we the way know?
