43.14.6.1^says to him - jesus, i am the way, and the truth, and the life.
43.14.6.2^no one comes to the father, if not by me.
43.14.7.1^if you had known me, also the father of me you would have known;
43.14.7.2^- from now you know him and have seen him.
43.14.8.1^says to him philip, lord, show us the father, and it is enough for us.
43.14.9.1^says to him - jesus, so long a time with you am i, and not you have known me, philip?
43.14.9.2^the one having seen me has seen the father;
43.14.9.3^how you say, show us the father?
43.14.10.1^not believe you that i am in the father, and the father in me is?
43.14.10.2^the words that i speak to you, from myself not i speak, - but the father in me dwelling does the works of him.
43.14.11.1^believe me that i am in the father, and the father in me;
43.14.11.2^if but not, because of the works themselves believe.
43.14.12.1^truly, truly, i say to you, the one believing in me, the works that i do, also he will do, and greater than these he will do, because i to the father am going.
43.14.13.1^and - whatever - you might ask in the name of me, this will i do, so that may be glorified the father in the son.
43.14.14.1^if anything you ask me in the name of me, i will do it.
43.14.15.1^if you love me, - commandments - my you will keep.
43.14.16.1^and i will ask the father, and another helper he will give you, that with you to the age, he may be
43.14.17.1^the spirit - of truth, whom the world not is able to receive, because not it does see him, nor know.
43.14.17.2^but you know him, for with you he abides, and in you he will be.
43.14.18.1^not i will leave you as orphans;
43.14.18.2^i am coming to you.
43.14.19.1^yet a little while and the world me no more sees, you however see me;
43.14.19.2^because i live, also you will live.
43.14.20.1^in that - day will know you that i am in the father of me, and you in me, and i in you.
43.14.21.1^the one having the commandments of me and keeping them, he is the one loving me;
43.14.21.2^the one now loving me, will be loved by the father of me;
43.14.21.3^and i will love him and will show to him myself.
43.14.22.1^says to him judas, not - iscariot, lord, then what has occurred that to us you are about to manifest yourself, and not to the world?
43.14.23.1^answered jesus and said to him, if anyone loves me, the word of me he will keep, and the father of me will love him, and to him we will come, and a home with him will make.
43.14.24.1^the one not loving me, the words of me not does keep;
43.14.24.2^and the word that you hear, not is mine, but of the having sent me father.
43.14.25.1^these things i have said to you, with you abiding.
43.14.26.1^the however helper, the spirit - holy, whom will send the father in the name of me, he you will teach all things and will bring to remembrance of you all things that have said to you i.
43.14.27.1^peace i leave with you;
43.14.27.2^peace - my i give to you;
43.14.27.3^not as the world gives, i give to you.
43.14.27.4^not let be troubled of you the heart, nor let it fear.
43.14.28.1^you heard that i said to you, i am going away and i am coming to you.
43.14.28.2^if you loved me, you would have rejoiced - that i am going to the father, because the father greater than i is.
43.14.29.1^and now i have told you before it comes to pass, that when it shall have come to pass, you might believe.
43.14.30.1^no longer much i will speak with you;
43.14.30.2^comes for the of this world ruler, and in me not he has nothing;
43.14.31.1^but that may know the world that i love the father, and as has commanded me the father, thus i do.
43.14.31.2^rise up, let us go from here.
43.15.1.1^i am the vine - true, and the father of me, the vinedresser is.
43.15.2.1^every branch in me not bearing fruit, he takes away it;
43.15.2.2^and every one - fruit bearing, he prunes it, that fruit more it may bear.
43.15.3.1^already you clean are by reason of the word that i have spoken to you.
43.15.4.1^abide in me, and i in you.
43.15.4.2^as the branch not is able fruit to bear of itself, if not it abide in the vine, so neither can you, if not in me you abide.
43.15.5.1^i am the vine;
43.15.5.2^you are the branches.
43.15.5.3^the one abiding in me, and i in him, he bears fruit much.
43.15.5.4^for apart from me not you are able to do nothing.
43.15.6.1^if not anyone abide in me, he is thrown out like the branch and is dried up, and they gather them and into the fire cast, and it is burned.
43.15.7.1^if you abide in me and the words of me in you abide, whatever if you wish, you shall ask, and it will come to pass to you.
43.15.8.1^in this is glorified the father of me, that fruit much you should bear, and you shall be to me disciples.
43.15.9.1^as has loved me the father, i also you have loved.
43.15.9.2^abide in the love - of me.
43.15.10.1^if the commandments of me you keep, you will abide in the love of me, as i, the commandments the father of me have kept, and i abide of him in the love.
43.15.11.1^these things i have spoken to you, that - joy - my in you may be, and the joy of you may be full.
43.15.12.1^this is - commandment - my, that you love one another as i loved you.
43.15.13.1^greater than this love no one has, that one the life of him should lay down for the friends of him.
43.15.14.1^you friends of me are if you do what i command you.
43.15.15.1^no longer i call you servants, for the servant not knows what is doing his - master.
43.15.15.2^you however i have called friends, because all things that i heard from the father of me, i have made known to you.
43.15.16.1^not you me chose, but i chose you, and appointed you that you should go and fruit you should bear, and the fruit of you should remain;
43.15.16.2^so that - whatever - you might ask the father in the name of me, he may give you.
43.15.17.1^these things i command you, that you love one another.
43.15.18.1^if the world you hates, you know that me before you it has hated.
43.15.19.1^if of the world you were, the world - as its own would love you;
43.15.19.2^because however of the world not you are, but i chose you out of the world, on account of this hates you the world.
43.15.20.1^remember the word that i said to you:
43.15.20.2^not is a servant greater than the master of him.
43.15.20.3^if me they persecuted, also you they will persecute;
43.15.20.4^if the word of me they kept, also - yours they will keep.
43.15.21.1^but these things all they will do against you on account of the name of me, because not they have known the one having sent me.
43.15.22.1^if not i had come and spoken to them, sin not they would have had;
43.15.22.2^now however excuse not they have for the sin of them.
43.15.23.1^the one me hating, also the father of me hates.
43.15.24.1^if the works not i had done among them that no other has done, sin not they would have had;
43.15.24.2^now however both they have seen and have hated both me and the father of me.
43.15.25.1^but this is that may be fulfilled the word - in the law of them having been written -:
43.15.25.2^they hated me without cause.
43.15.26.1^when comes the helper, whom i will send to you from the father, the spirit - of truth, who from the father goes forth, he will bear witness concerning me.
43.15.27.1^also you now bear witness, because from the beginning with me you are.
43.16.1.1^these things i have spoken to you that not you might fall away.
43.16.2.1^out of the synagogues they will put you;
43.16.2.2^but is coming an hour that everyone - having killed you will think it is a service to offer - to god.
43.16.3.1^and these things they will do, because not they know the father, nor me.
43.16.4.1^but these things i have said to you, so that when might have come the hour of them, you may remember them, that i said them to you.
43.16.4.2^these things now to you from the beginning not i said, because with you i was.
43.16.5.1^now however i go to the one having sent me, and none of you asks me, where are you going?
43.16.6.1^but because these things i have said to you, - sorrow has filled your - heart.
43.16.7.1^but i the truth say to you, it is profitable for you that i should go away.
43.16.7.2^if for not i go away, the helper no will come to you;
43.16.7.3^if however i go, i will send him to you.
43.16.8.1^and having come, he will convict the world concerning sin, and concerning righteousness, and concerning judgment:
43.16.9.1^concerning sin indeed, because not do they believe in me;
43.16.10.1^concerning righteousness now, because to the father i go away, and no more you behold me;
43.16.11.1^concerning now judgment, because the ruler of the world this has been judged.
43.16.12.1^yet many things i have to you to say, but not you are able to bear them now.
43.16.13.1^when however shall come he, the spirit - of truth, he will guide you into the truth all;
43.16.13.2^not for he will speak from himself, but whatever he may hear, he will speak;
43.16.13.3^and the things coming he will declare to you.
43.16.14.1^he me will glorify, for from that which is mine he will take, and will disclose to you.
43.16.15.1^all things whatever has the father, mine are;
43.16.15.2^because of this, i said that from that which is mine he will take and will disclose to you.
43.16.16.1^a little while and no longer you do behold me;
43.16.16.2^and again a little while and you will see me.
43.16.17.1^said therefore some of the disciples of him to one another, what is this that he says to us, a little while and not you do behold me;
43.16.17.2^and, again a little while and you will see me  and because i am going to the father?
43.16.18.1^they were saying therefore, what is this that he says, a little while?
43.16.18.2^not we do know what he is saying.
43.16.19.1^knew - jesus that they were desiring him to ask, and he said to them, concerning this do you inquire among one another that i said, a little while and not you do behold me, and again a little while and you will see me?
43.16.20.1^truly, truly, i say to you that will weep and will lament you, - but the world will rejoice.
43.16.20.2^you will be grieved, but the grief of you to joy will turn.
43.16.21.1^the woman when she is giving birth, pain has, because has come the hour of her;
43.16.21.2^when however she brings forth the child, no longer she remembers the tribulation, on account of the joy that has been born a man into the world.
43.16.22.1^also you therefore, now indeed grief have;
43.16.22.2^again however i will see you, and will rejoice your - heart, and the joy of you no one will take from you.
43.16.23.1^and in that - day, of me not you will ask nothing.
43.16.23.2^truly, truly, i say to you, - whatever you may ask, the father in the name of me.
43.16.23.3^he will give you,
43.16.24.1^until now not you have asked nothing in the name of me.
43.16.24.2^ask and you will receive, that the joy of you may be full.
43.16.25.1^these things in allegories i have spoken to you;
43.16.25.2^is coming an hour when no more in allegories i will speak to you, but plainly concerning the father i will report to you.
43.16.26.1^in that - day in the name of me you will ask, and not i say to you that i will implore the father for you.
43.16.27.1^himself for the father loves you, because you me have loved and have believed that i from - god came forth.
43.16.28.1^i came forth from the father and have come into the world;
43.16.28.2^again i leave the world and go to the father.
43.16.29.1^say the disciples of him, behold, now in openness you speak, and allegory not speak.
43.16.30.1^now we know that you know all things, and not need have that anyone you should ask.
43.16.30.2^in this we believe that from god you came forth.
43.16.31.1^answered them jesus, now do you believe?
43.16.32.1^behold, is coming an hour, and has come, when you will be scattered, each to the own, and i alone you shall leave;
43.16.32.2^yet not i am alone, for the father with me is.
43.16.33.1^these things i have spoken to you so that in me peace you may have.
43.16.33.2^in the world tribulation you have.
43.16.33.3^but take courage;
43.16.33.4^i have overcome the world.
43.17.1.1^these things spoke jesus, and having lifted up the eyes of him to - heaven, he said, father, has come the hour;
43.17.1.2^glorify your - son, that the son may glorify you.
43.17.2.1^as you gave him authority over all flesh, so that all whom you have given him, he may give to them life eternal.
43.17.3.1^this now is - eternal life, that they may know you, the only true god, and whom you have sent, jesus christ.
43.17.4.1^i you glorified on the earth, the work having completed that you have given me that i should do.
43.17.5.1^and now glorify me you, father, with yourself, with the glory that i had before - the world existed, with you.
43.17.6.1^i revealed your - name to the men whom you have given me out of the world.
43.17.6.2^yours they were, and to me them you gave, and the word of you they have kept.
43.17.7.1^now they have known that all things whatever you have given me, of you are;
43.17.8.1^for the words that you have given me, i have given them, and they received them and knew truly that from you i came forth;
43.17.8.2^and they believed that you me sent.
43.17.9.1^i concerning them am praying.
43.17.9.2^not concerning the world do i pray, but concerning those whom you have given me, for yours they are.
43.17.10.1^and things of mine all, yours are;
43.17.10.2^and - yours, mine;
43.17.10.3^and i have been glorified in them.
43.17.11.1^and no longer i am in the world, and yet themselves in the world they are, and i to you am coming.
43.17.11.2^father holy, keep them in the name of you, which you have given me, that they may be one as we are.
43.17.12.1^when i was with them, i was keeping them in the name of you, which you have given me.
43.17.12.2^and i guarded them, and none of them has perished, if not the son - of destruction, that the scripture might be fulfilled.
43.17.13.1^now however to you i am coming;
43.17.13.2^and these things i speak in the world, so that they may have - joy - my fulfilled within them.
43.17.14.1^i have given them the word of you, and the world hated them, because not they are of the world, even as i not am of the world.
43.17.15.1^not i do ask that you should take them out of the world, but that you should keep them from - evil.
43.17.16.1^of the world not they are, as i not am of the world.
43.17.17.1^sanctify them by the truth;
43.17.17.2^the word - of you truth is.
43.17.18.1^as me you sent into the world, i also sent them into the world;
43.17.19.1^and for them i sanctify myself, that may be also they sanctified in truth.
43.17.20.1^not for these however do i ask only, but also for those believing through the word of them in me,
43.17.21.1^that all one may be, as you, father, are in me, and i in you, that also they in us may be, that the world may believe that you me sent.
43.17.22.1^and i the glory which you have given me, have given them, so that they may be one, as we are one
43.17.23.1^i in them, and you in me   that they may be perfected in unity, so that may know the world that you me sent and loved them even as me you loved.
43.17.24.1^father, those whom you have given me, i desire that where am i, they also may be with me, that they may behold - glory - my, that you gave me because you loved me before the foundation of the world.
43.17.25.1^father righteous, although the world you not has known, i now you have known, and these have known that you me sent.
43.17.26.1^and i made known to them the name of you, and will make it known, so that the love with which you loved me in them may be, and i in them.
43.18.1.1^these things having said, jesus went out with the disciples of him beyond the winter stream - of kidron, where there was a garden, into which entered he and the disciples of him.
43.18.2.1^knew now also judas, who was delivering up him, the place, because often gathered together jesus there with the disciples of him.
43.18.3.1^- therefore judas, having procured the cohort and from the chief priests and from the pharisees officers, comes there with lanterns, and torches, and weapons.
43.18.4.1^jesus therefore, knowing all things that are coming upon him, having gone forth also said to them, whom seek you?
43.18.5.1^they answered him, jesus of nazareth.
43.18.5.2^he says to them, i am he.
43.18.5.3^had been standing now also judas, who is delivering up him, with them.
43.18.6.1^when therefore he said to them, i am he, they drew toward the back and fell to the ground.
43.18.7.1^again therefore he questioned them, whom seek you?
43.18.7.2^- and they said, jesus of nazareth.
43.18.8.1^answered jesus, i have told you that i am he.
43.18.8.2^if therefore me you seek, allow these to go away,
43.18.9.1^so that might be fulfilled the word that he had spoken -, those whom you have given me, not i lost of them not one.
43.18.10.1^simon then peter, having a sword, drew it and struck the of the high priest servant, and cut off of him the ear - right.
43.18.10.2^was now name of the servant malchus.
43.18.11.1^said therefore - jesus - to peter, put the sword into the sheath.
43.18.11.2^the cup which has given me the father, no not shall i drink it?
43.18.12.1^- then the cohort and the commander and the officers of the jews took hold of - jesus and bound him,
43.18.13.1^and they led him away to annas first;
43.18.13.2^he was for father-in-law - of caiaphas, who was high priest the year same.
43.18.14.1^was now caiaphas the one having given counsel to the jews that it is profitable for one man to perish for the people.
43.18.15.1^were following now - jesus simon peter and the other disciple.
43.18.15.2^since now disciple that was known to the high priest, also he entered with - jesus into the court of the high priest.
43.18.16.1^- but peter stood at the door outside.
43.18.16.2^went out therefore the disciple - other, who was known to the high priest, and spoke to the doorkeeper, and brought in - peter.
43.18.17.1^says therefore - to peter the servant girl, the doorkeeper, not also you of the disciples are of the man this?
43.18.17.2^says he, not i am.
43.18.18.1^were standing now the servants and the officers, a fire of coals having made, for cold it was and they were warming themselves.
43.18.18.2^was now also - peter with them standing and warming himself.
43.18.19.1^- then the high priest questioned - jesus concerning the disciples of him and concerning the teaching of him.
43.18.20.1^answered him jesus, i openly have spoken to the world;
43.18.20.2^i always taught in the synagogue and in the temple, where all the jews come together, and in secret i spoke nothing.
43.18.21.1^why me do you question?
43.18.21.2^question those having heard what i spoke to them;
43.18.21.3^behold, they know what said i.
43.18.22.1^these things now of him having said, one standing by of the officers gave a blow with the palm - to jesus, having said, thus answer you the high priest?
43.18.23.1^answered him jesus, if evil i spoke, bear witness concerning the evil;
43.18.23.2^if however rightly, why me strike you?
43.18.24.1^sent then him - annas, bound, to caiaphas the high priest.
43.18.25.1^was now simon peter standing and warming himself.
43.18.25.2^they said therefore to him, not also you of the disciples of him are?
43.18.25.3^denied he and said, not i am.
43.18.26.1^says one of the servants of the high priest, kinsman being of him of whom had cut off peter the ear, not i you saw in the garden with him?
43.18.27.1^again then denied peter, and immediately a rooster crowed.
43.18.28.1^they are leading then - jesus from - caiaphas into the praetorium.
43.18.28.2^it was now early, and they not entered into the praetorium so that not they should be defiled, but might eat the passover.
43.18.29.1^went therefore - pilate out to them and said, what accusation bring you against the man this?
43.18.30.1^they answered and said to him, if not were he evil doing, not - to you we would have delivered him.
43.18.31.1^said therefore to them - pilate, take him yourselves and according to the law of you judge him.
43.18.31.2^said to him the jews, to us not it is permitted to put to death no one
43.18.32.1^that the word - of jesus might be fulfilled, which he had spoken, signifying what death he was about to die.
43.18.33.1^entered therefore again into the praetorium - pilate, and he called - jesus and said to him, you are the king of the jews?
43.18.34.1^answered jesus, of yourself you this say, or others did say it to you concerning me?
43.18.35.1^answered - pilate, not i a jew am?
43.18.35.2^the nation - of you and the chief priests delivered you to me.
43.18.35.3^what have you done?
43.18.36.1^answered jesus, the kingdom - my not is of the world this;
43.18.36.2^if of the world this were - kingdom - my, - attendants - my would fight - that not i might be betrayed to the jews.
43.18.36.3^now however - kingdom - my not is from here.
43.18.37.1^said therefore to him - pilate, then a king are you?
43.18.37.2^answered - jesus, you say that a king i am.
43.18.37.3^i for this have been born, and for this i have come into the world, that i may bear witness to the truth.
43.18.37.4^everyone - being of the truth hears of me the voice.
43.18.38.1^says to him - pilate, what is truth?
43.18.38.2^and this having said, again he went out to the jews and says to them, i no find in him guilt.
43.18.39.1^it is however a custom with you that one i should release to you at the passover;
43.18.39.2^wish you therefore i should release to you the king of the jews?
43.18.40.1^they cried out then again saying, not this one, but - barabbas!
43.18.40.2^was now - barabbas an insurrectionist.
43.19.1.1^at that time therefore took - pilate - jesus and flogged him.
43.19.2.1^and the soldiers, having twisted together a crown of thorns, put it on of him the head, and a robe purple cast around him,
43.19.3.1^and they began coming up to him and saying, hail, - king of the jews!
43.19.3.2^and they kept giving him blows with the palm.
43.19.4.1^and went forth again outside - pilate, and he says to them, behold, i bring to you him out, so that you may know that no guilt i find in him.
43.19.5.1^went forth therefore - jesus outside, wearing the thorny crown and the purple robe.
43.19.5.2^and he says to them, behold the man!
43.19.6.1^when therefore saw him the chief priests and the officers, they cried out saying, crucify!
43.19.6.2^crucify!
43.19.6.3^says to them - pilate, take him yourselves and crucify him;
43.19.6.4^i for no find in him guilt.
43.19.7.1^answered him the jews, we a law have, and according to the law, he ought to die, because the son of god himself he made.
43.19.8.1^when therefore heard - pilate this - word, the more he was afraid.
43.19.9.1^and he went into the praetorium again, and he says - to jesus, from where are you?
43.19.9.2^- but jesus an answer not did give him.
43.19.10.1^says therefore to him - pilate, to me not speak you?
43.19.10.2^not know you that authority i have to release you, and authority i have to crucify you?
43.19.11.1^answered him jesus, not you would have authority also me against, if not it were given to you from above.
43.19.11.2^because of this, the one having delivered up me to you, greater sin has.
43.19.12.1^out of this - pilate was seeking to release him;
43.19.12.2^- but the jews cried out, saying, if this man you release, not you are a friend - of caesar.
43.19.12.3^everyone - a king himself making, speaks against - caesar.
43.19.13.1^- therefore pilate, having heard the words these, brought out - jesus, and sat down upon the judgment seat at a place called the stone pavement;
43.19.13.2^in hebrew now, gabbatha.
43.19.14.1^it was now the day of preparation of the passover;
43.19.14.2^the hour was about the sixth.
43.19.14.3^and he says to the jews, behold the king of you!
43.19.15.1^they cried out therefore, with him away, away!
43.19.15.2^crucify him!
43.19.15.3^says to them - pilate, the king of you shall i crucify?
43.19.15.4^answered the chief priests, not we have a king, if not caesar.
43.19.16.1^then therefore he delivered him to them, that he might be crucified.
43.19.16.2^they took therefore - jesus.
43.19.17.1^and bearing his own - cross, he went out to the called of the skull place, which is called in hebrew golgotha,
43.19.18.1^where him they crucified, and with him others two, on this side and on that side, in between now - jesus.
43.19.19.1^wrote then also a title - pilate and put it on the cross.
43.19.19.2^it was now written:
43.19.19.3^jesus of nazareth, the king of the jews.
43.19.20.1^this therefore the title many read of the jews, for near was the place, the city, where was crucified - jesus, and it was written in hebrew, in latin, in greek.
43.19.21.1^were saying therefore - to pilate the chief priests of the jews, not write, the king of the jews, but that he said, king i am of the jews.
43.19.22.1^answered - pilate, what i have written, i have written.
43.19.23.1^the then soldiers, when they crucified - jesus, took the garments of him and made four parts, to each soldier a part, and also the tunic.
43.19.23.2^was now the tunic seamless, from the top woven throughout all.
43.19.24.1^they said therefore to one another, not let us tear up it, but let us cast lots for it, whose it will be, that the scripture might be fulfilled that said:
43.19.24.2^they divided the garments of me among them, and for the clothing of me they cast a lot.
43.19.24.3^the indeed therefore soldiers these things did.
43.19.25.1^had been standing now by the cross - of jesus the mother of him, and the sister of the mother of him, mary the wife - of clopas, and mary - magdalene.
43.19.26.1^jesus therefore, having seen his mother and the disciple standing by whom he loved, says to his mother, woman, behold, the son of you.
43.19.27.1^then he says to the disciple, behold the mother of you.
43.19.27.2^and from that - hour took the disciple her to the own.
43.19.28.1^after this, knowing - jesus that now all things had been accomplished, so that might be fulfilled the scripture, he says, i thirst.
43.19.29.1^a vessel had been set there of sour wine full;
43.19.29.2^a sponge therefore filled with sour wine, a stalk of hyssop having put on, they brought it to the mouth.
43.19.30.1^when therefore took the sour wine - jesus, he said, it has been finished.
43.19.30.2^and having bowed the head, he yielded up the spirit.
43.19.31.1^- therefore the jews, because the preparation it was, so that not would remain on the cross the bodies on the sabbath   was for a high - day that - sabbath   asked - pilate that might be broken their - legs, and they might be taken away.
43.19.32.1^came therefore the soldiers, and of the indeed first broke the legs, and of the other - having been crucified with him;
43.19.33.1^to however - jesus having come, when they saw already him having been dead, not they did break his - legs.
43.19.34.1^but one of the soldiers with a spear his - side pierced, and came out immediately blood and water.
43.19.35.1^and the one having seen has borne witness, and true of him is the testimony.
43.19.35.2^and he knows that truth he is speaking, that also you might believe.
43.19.36.1^took place for these things so that the scripture might be fulfilled:
43.19.36.2^bone not one will be broken of him.
43.19.37.1^and again, another scripture says:
43.19.37.2^they will look on the one they have pierced.
43.19.38.1^after then these things, asked - pilate joseph - from arimathea, being a disciple - of jesus   concealed however through the fear of the jews   that he might take away the body - of jesus;
43.19.38.2^and gave permission - pilate.
43.19.38.3^he came therefore and took away the body of him.
43.19.39.1^came now also nicodemus, the one having come to him by night at the first, bearing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about litras a hundred.
43.19.40.1^they took therefore the body - of jesus and bound it in linen cloths, with the spices, as the custom is among the jews to prepare for burial.
43.19.41.1^there was now in the place where he was crucified a garden, and in the garden a tomb new, in which not yet no one was laid.
43.19.42.1^there therefore, on account of the preparation of the jews, because near was the tomb, they laid - jesus.
43.20.1.1^- now the first day of the week, mary - magdalene comes early, dark still it being, to the tomb, and she sees the stone having been removed from the tomb.
43.20.2.1^she runs therefore and comes to simon peter and to the other disciple, whom loved - jesus, and she says to them, they have taken away the lord out of the tomb, and not we know where they have laid him.
43.20.3.1^went forth therefore - peter and the other disciple, and were coming to the tomb.
43.20.4.1^were running now the two together, and the other disciple ran ahead faster - than peter and came first to the tomb.
43.20.5.1^and having stooped down, he sees lying there the linen cloths;
43.20.5.2^not however he entered.
43.20.6.1^comes then also simon peter following him, and he entered into the tomb and sees the linen cloths lying there,
43.20.7.1^and the soudarion, which was upon the head of him, not with the linen cloths lying, but by itself having been folded up in a place.
43.20.8.1^then therefore entered also the other disciple, - having come first to the tomb, and he saw and believed;
43.20.9.1^not yet for understood they the scripture that it behooves him out from the dead to rise.
43.20.10.1^went away therefore again to their homes the disciples.
43.20.11.1^mary however stood at the tomb outside weeping.
43.20.11.2^as therefore she was weeping, she stooped down into the tomb,
43.20.12.1^and she sees two angels in white sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where had lain the body - of jesus.
43.20.13.1^and say to her they, woman, why weep you?
43.20.13.2^she says to them, because they have taken away the lord of me, and not i know where they have laid him.
43.20.14.1^these things having said, she turned back - around, and she sees - jesus standing there, and not had known that jesus it is.
43.20.15.1^says to her jesus, woman, why do you weep?
43.20.15.2^whom do you seek?
43.20.15.3^she, thinking that the gardener he is, says to him, sir, if you have carried off him, tell me where you have laid him, and i him will take away.
43.20.16.1^says to her jesus, mary.
43.20.16.2^having turned around, she says to him in hebrew, rabboni, that is to say, teacher.
43.20.17.1^says to her jesus, not me touch, not yet for have i ascended to the father;
43.20.17.2^go however to the brothers of me and say to them, i am ascending to the father of me and father of you, and to god of me and god of you.
43.20.18.1^comes mary - magdalene bringing word to the disciples -, i have seen the lord, and that these things he had said to her.
43.20.19.1^it being therefore evening the day same, the first of the week, and the doors having been shut, where were the disciples through the fear of the jews, came - jesus and stood in the midst, and he says to them, peace to you.
43.20.20.1^and this having said, he showed his hands and his side to them.
43.20.20.2^rejoiced then the disciples, having seen the lord.
43.20.21.1^said therefore to them - jesus again, peace to you;
43.20.21.2^as has sent forth me the father, i also send you.
43.20.22.1^and this having said, he breathed on them, and he says to them, receive the spirit holy.
43.20.23.1^if of any, you might forgive the sins, they are forgiven them;
43.20.23.2^if any you might retain, they are retained.
43.20.24.1^thomas however, one of the twelve, the one called didymus, not was with them when came jesus.
43.20.25.1^were saying therefore to him the other disciples, we have seen the lord.
43.20.25.2^- but he said to them, if not i see in the hands of him the mark of the nails, and put the finger of me into the mark of the nails, and put of me the hand into the side of him, no not will i believe.
43.20.26.1^and after days eight again were inside the disciples of him, and thomas with them.
43.20.26.2^comes - jesus, the doors having been shut.
43.20.26.3^and he stood in the midst and said, peace to you.
43.20.27.1^then he says - to thomas, bring the finger of you here, and see the hands of me;
43.20.27.2^and bring the hand of you, and put it into the side of me;
43.20.27.3^and not be unbelieving, but believing.
43.20.28.1^answered thomas and said to him, the lord of me and the god of me!
43.20.29.1^says to him - jesus, because you have seen me, you have believed;
43.20.29.2^blessed are those not having seen, yet having believed.
43.20.30.1^many indeed therefore also other signs did - jesus in the presence of the disciples of him, which not are written in the book this;
43.20.31.1^these however have been written that you may believe that jesus is the christ, the son - of god, and that believing, life you may have in the name of him.
43.21.1.1^after these things, revealed himself again - jesus to the disciples at the sea - of tiberias.
43.21.1.2^he revealed himself now in this way:
43.21.2.1^they were together, simon peter, and thomas - called didymus, and nathanael - from cana - of galilee, and the sons - of zebedee, and others of the disciples his two.
43.21.3.1^says to them simon peter, i am going to fish.
43.21.3.2^they say to him, come also we with you.
43.21.3.3^they went forth and went up into the boat, and during that - night they caught nothing.
43.21.4.1^morning now already having come, stood jesus on the shore;
43.21.4.2^not however knew the disciples that jesus it is.
43.21.5.1^says therefore to them - jesus, children, not any fish have you?
43.21.5.2^they answered him, no.
43.21.6.1^- and he said to them, cast to the right side of the boat the net, and you will find some.
43.21.6.2^they cast therefore, and not it to haul in were they able, from the multitude of the fish.
43.21.7.1^says therefore the disciple that whom loved - jesus - to peter, the lord it is.
43.21.7.2^simon therefore peter, having heard that the lord it is, the outer garment put on he was for naked and he cast himself into the sea.
43.21.8.1^- and the other disciples in the boat came, not for were they far from the land, but about away cubits two hundred, dragging the net with the fish.
43.21.9.1^when therefore they got out onto the land, they see a fire of coals lying, and fish lying on it, and bread.
43.21.10.1^says to them - jesus, bring some of the fish that you have caught now.
43.21.11.1^went up therefore simon peter and drew the net to the land, full of fish large, a hundred fifty three;
43.21.11.2^although so many there are, not was torn the net.
43.21.12.1^says to them - jesus, come, have breakfast.
43.21.12.2^none however dared of the disciples to ask him, you who are?
43.21.12.3^knowing that the lord it is.
43.21.13.1^comes jesus and takes the bread and gives it to them, and the fish likewise.
43.21.14.1^this is now the third time was revealed jesus to the disciples, having been raised out from the dead.
43.21.15.1^when therefore they had dined, says - to simon peter - jesus, simon son of john, love you me more than these?
43.21.15.2^he says to him, yes, lord;
43.21.15.3^you know that i dearly love you.
43.21.15.4^he says to him, feed the lambs of me.
43.21.16.1^he says to him again a second time, simon son of john, love you me?
43.21.16.2^he says to him, yes, lord;
43.21.16.3^you know that i dearly love you.
43.21.16.4^he says to him, shepherd the sheep of me.
43.21.17.1^he says to him the third time, simon son of john, do you dearly love me?
43.21.17.2^was grieved - peter because he said to him the third time, do you dearly love me?
43.21.17.3^and he said to him, lord, all things you know;
43.21.17.4^you know that i dearly love you.
43.21.17.5^says to him - jesus, feed the sheep of me.
43.21.18.1^truly, truly, i say to you, when you were younger, you dressed yourself and walked where you desired;
43.21.18.2^when however you shall be old, you will stretch forth the hands of you, and another you will dress and will bring you where not you do desire.
43.21.19.1^this now he said signifying by what death he will glorify - god.
43.21.19.2^and this having said, he says to him, follow me.
43.21.20.1^having turned, - peter sees the disciple whom loved - jesus following, who also had reclined at the supper on the bosom of him, and said, lord, who is it who is betraying you?
43.21.21.1^him therefore having seen, - peter says - to jesus, lord, this man and what about?
43.21.22.1^says to him - jesus, if him i desire to remain until i come, what is it to you?
43.21.22.2^you me follow!
43.21.23.1^went out therefore this - saying among the brothers, that the disciple that, not dies.
43.21.23.2^not said however to him - jesus that not he dies, but, if him i desire to remain until i come, what is it to you?
43.21.24.1^this is the disciple - bearing witness concerning these things, and the one having written these things, and we know that true of him the testimony is.
43.21.25.1^there are now also other things many that did - jesus, which if they should be written every one, not even itself i suppose the world to have space for the to be written books.
44.1.1.1^the indeed first account i composed concerning all the things, o theophilus, which began - jesus to do both and to teach,
44.1.2.1^until the day, having given orders to the apostles by the spirit holy whom he had chosen, he was taken up,
44.1.3.1^to whom also he presented himself alive after the suffering of him with many proofs, during days forty being seen by them and speaking the things concerning the kingdom - of god.
44.1.4.1^and being assembled together, he instructed them from jerusalem not to depart, but to await the promise of the father:
44.1.4.2^that which you heard of me;
44.1.5.1^for john indeed baptized with water;
44.1.5.2^you however with the spirit will be baptized holy, not after many these days.
44.1.6.1^those indeed therefore having come together, were asking him, saying, lord, if at the time this, are you restoring the kingdom - to israel?
44.1.7.1^he said then to them, not yours it is to know times or seasons which the father put in place by - his own authority.
44.1.8.1^but you will receive power, having come the holy spirit upon you, and you will be for me witnesses, in both jerusalem, and in all - judea, and samaria, and to the uttermost part of the earth.
44.1.9.1^and these things having said, beholding they, he was taken up, and a cloud hid him from the eyes of them.
44.1.10.1^and as looking intently they were into the heaven as was going he, then behold men two stood by them in apparel white,
44.1.11.1^who also said, men, galileans, why do you stand looking into - heaven?
44.1.11.2^this - jesus, - having been taken up from you into - heaven, thus will come in that manner you beheld him going into - heaven.
44.1.12.1^then they returned to jerusalem from the mount - called olivet, which is near jerusalem, a sabbath day s holding journey.
44.1.13.1^and when they had entered into the upper room, they went up where they were staying, - both peter and john, and james and andrew, philip and thomas, bartholomew and matthew, james son of alphaeus, and simon the zealot, and judas son of james.
44.1.14.1^these all were steadfastly continuing with one accord - in prayer, with the women, and mary the mother - of jesus, and the brothers of him.
44.1.15.1^and in the days these, having stood up peter in the midst of the brothers, he said   was then the number of names together the same about a hundred twenty
44.1.16.1^men, brothers, it was necessary for to have been fulfilled the scripture which spoke beforehand the spirit - holy by the mouth of david concerning judas, the one having become guide to those having arrested jesus;
44.1.17.1^for numbered he was with us, and was allotted - a share of the ministry this.
44.1.18.1^this man indeed then acquired a field out of the reward - of unrighteousness, and headlong having fallen, he burst open in the middle, and gushed out all the intestines of him.
44.1.19.1^and known it became to all those dwelling in jerusalem, so that was called the field that in the own language of them akeldama, that is, field of blood.
44.1.20.1^it has been written for in the book of psalms:
44.1.20.2^let become the homestead of him desolate, and not let there be one person dwelling in it,  and, the position of him let take another.
44.1.21.1^it behooves therefore the having accompanied us men, during all the time that came in and went out among us the lord jesus,
44.1.22.1^having begun from the baptism of john until the day in which he was taken up from us, a witness of the resurrection of him with us to become one of these.
44.1.23.1^and they put forward two, joseph - called barsabbas, who was called justus, and matthias.
44.1.24.1^and having prayed, they said, you lord, knower of the hearts of all, show which you have chosen of these - two, one
44.1.25.1^to take the place of the ministry this and apostleship, from which turned aside judas to go to the place - own.
44.1.26.1^and they gave lots for them, and fell the lot on matthias, and he was numbered with the eleven apostles.
44.2.1.1^and during the arriving of the day - of pentecost, they were all together in the one place.
44.2.2.1^and came suddenly out of - heaven a sound, like the rushing of a wind violent, and it filled all the house where they were sitting.
44.2.3.1^and there appeared to them dividing tongues as of fire and sat upon one each of them.
44.2.4.1^and they were filled with all spirit holy, and began to speak in other tongues as the spirit was giving to utter forth to them.
44.2.5.1^were now in jerusalem dwelling jews, men devout from every nation of those under - heaven.
44.2.6.1^having come about now the sound of this, came together the multitude and was confounded, because was hearing one each the own language speaking them.
44.2.7.1^they were amazed then and were marveling, saying, not behold all these are who are speaking galileans?
44.2.8.1^and how we hear each the own language of us, in which we were born?
44.2.9.1^parthians, and medes, and elamites;
44.2.9.2^and those inhabiting - mesopotamia, judea also, and cappadocia, pontus and - asia;
44.2.10.1^phrygia both and pamphylia, egypt and the parts - of libya that are around cyrene, and those visiting here from rome;
44.2.11.1^jews both and converts, cretans and arabs   we hear speaking them - in our own tongues the great things - of god!
44.2.12.1^were amazed then all and were perplexed, other to other saying, what wishes this to be?
44.2.13.1^others however mocking were saying -, of new wine full they are.
44.2.14.1^having stood up however - peter with the eleven, he lifted up the voice of him and spoke forth to them:
44.2.14.2^men of judea and those inhabiting jerusalem all, this to you known let be, and give heed to the words of me.
44.2.15.1^not for as you suppose, these are drunkards;
44.2.15.2^it is for the hour third of the day;
44.2.16.1^but this is that having been spoken by the prophet joel:
44.2.17.1^and it will be in the last days, says - god, i will pour out of the spirit of me upon all flesh;
44.2.17.2^and will prophesy the sons of you, and the daughters of you;
44.2.17.3^and the young men of you visions will see, and the elders of you dreams will dream;
44.2.18.1^and even upon the servants of me, and upon the handmaidens of me, in the days those i will pour out of the spirit of me, and they will prophesy.
44.2.19.1^and i will show wonders in - heaven above, and signs on the earth below, blood and fire and vapor of smoke.
44.2.20.1^the sun will be turned into darkness, and the moon into blood, before coming day of the lord, - great and glorious.
44.2.21.1^and it shall be, everyone who if they shall call upon the name of the lord will be saved.
44.2.22.1^men, israelites, hear the words these:
44.2.22.2^jesus of nazareth, a man having been set forth by - god to you by miracles and wonders and signs, which did by him - god in the midst of you, as you yourselves know,
44.2.23.1^him by the determinate plan and foreknowledge - of god, delivered up by hands lawless, having crucified, you put to death,
44.2.24.1^whom - god raised up, having loosed the agony of death, inasmuch as not it was possible for to be held him by it.
44.2.25.1^david for says about him:
44.2.25.2^i foresaw the lord before me continually everything, because at the right hand of me he is, that not i should be shaken.
44.2.26.1^because of this was glad the heart, of me and rejoiced the tongue of me;
44.2.26.2^and now also the flesh of me will dwell in hope,
44.2.27.1^for not you will abandon the soul of me into hades, nor will you allow the holy one of you to see decay.
44.2.28.1^you have made known to me the paths of life;
44.2.28.2^you will fill me with joy in the presence of you.
44.2.29.1^men, brothers, it is permitted me to speak with freedom to you concerning the patriarch david, that both he died and was buried, and the tomb of him is among us unto the day this.
44.2.30.1^a prophet therefore being, and knowing that with an oath swore to him - god out of the fruit of the loins of him to set upon the throne of him.
44.2.31.1^having foreseen, he spoke concerning the resurrection of the christ, that neither was he abandoned into hades, nor the flesh of him saw decay.
44.2.32.1^this - jesus has raised up - god, whereof all we are witnesses.
44.2.33.1^to the right hand therefore - of god having been exalted, - and the promise of the spirit - holy having received from the father, he has poured out this which you both are seeing and hearing.
44.2.34.1^not for david ascended into the heavens;
44.2.34.2^he says however himself:
44.2.34.3^said the lord to the lord of me, sit at the right hand of me,
44.2.35.1^until - i place the enemies of you, a footstool of the feet of you.
44.2.36.1^assuredly therefore let know all the house of israel that both lord him and christ has made - god   this - jesus whom you crucified.
44.2.37.1^having heard then, they were pierced to the heart;
44.2.37.2^they said then to - peter and the other apostles, what shall we do, men, brothers?
44.2.38.1^peter then to them, repent, he declared, and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of jesus christ for the forgiveness of the sins of you, and you will receive the gift of the holy spirit.
44.2.39.1^to you for is the promise, and to the children of you, and to all those at a distance, as many as - shall call to himself the lord, the god of us.
44.2.40.1^other and words many he earnestly testified, and was exhorting them, saying, be saved from the generation - perverse this.
44.2.41.1^those indeed therefore having received the word of him were baptized;
44.2.41.2^and were added on the day that, souls about three thousand.
44.2.42.1^they were now steadfastly continuing in the teaching of the apostles, and - in fellowship, the breaking of the bread, and the prayers.
44.2.43.1^there was coming then upon every soul awe, many and both wonders and signs through the apostles were taking place.
44.2.44.1^all now - having believed were together the same and having all things in common;
44.2.45.1^and the possessions and the goods they were selling and were dividing them to all, as - anyone need had.
44.2.46.1^every day and steadfastly continuing with one accord in the temple, breaking then at each house bread, they were partaking of food with gladness and sincerity of heart,
44.2.47.1^praising - god and having favor with all the people.
44.2.47.2^- and the lord kept adding those who were being saved every day to their number.
44.3.1.1^peter now and john were going up into the temple at the hour - of prayer, the ninth.
44.3.2.1^and a certain man, lame from womb of mother of him being, was being carried, whom they placed every day at the gate of the temple - called beautiful - to ask for alms from those who were going into the temple,
44.3.3.1^who having seen peter and john being about to enter into the temple, was asking alms to receive.
44.3.4.1^having looked intently now peter upon him, with - john, he said, look unto us.
44.3.5.1^- and he began to give heed to them, expecting something from them to receive.
44.3.6.1^said however peter, silver and gold none there is to me;
44.3.6.2^what however i have, this to you i give:
44.3.6.3^in the name of jesus christ of nazareth, rise up and walk!
44.3.7.1^and having taken him by the right hand, he raised up him;
44.3.7.2^immediately then were strengthened the feet of him, and the ankles.
44.3.8.1^and leaping up, he stood and began walking, and he entered with them into the temple, walking and leaping and praising - god.
44.3.9.1^and saw all the people him walking and praising - god.
44.3.10.1^they recognized then him, that he was the one for the alms sitting at the beautiful gate of the temple;
44.3.10.2^and they were filled with wonder and amazement at that having happened to him.
44.3.11.1^is clinging now he to peter and - john;
44.3.11.2^ran together all the people to them in the porch - called solomon s, greatly amazed.
44.3.12.1^having seen it however, - peter answered to the people:
44.3.12.2^men, israelites, why wonder you at this?
44.3.12.3^or on us why you look intently, as if by our own power or godliness we have made - to walk him?
44.3.13.1^the god of abraham, and the god of isaac, and the god jacob, the god of the fathers of us, has glorified the servant of him, jesus, whom you indeed betrayed and disowned in the presence of pilate, having adjudged that one to release him.
44.3.14.1^you however the holy and righteous one denied, and requested a man, a murderer, to be granted to you;
44.3.15.1^- and the author - of life you killed, whom - god has raised up out from the dead, whereof we witnesses are.
44.3.16.1^and on the faith in the name of him, this man whom you see and know has strengthened the name of him;
44.3.16.2^and the faith which is through him has given to him the complete soundness this before all of you.
44.3.17.1^and now, brothers, i know that in ignorance you acted, as also the rulers of you.
44.3.18.1^- but god what he foretold by the mouth of all the prophets, that should suffer the christ of him, he has fulfilled thus.
44.3.19.1^repent, therefore, and turn again, for the blotting out of your - sins,
44.3.20.1^so that - may come times of refreshing from the presence of the lord, and that he may send the one having been appointed to you, christ jesus,
44.3.21.1^whom it behooves heaven indeed to receive, until the times of restoration of all things, of which spoke - god by the mouth of holy from the age his prophets.
44.3.22.1^moses indeed said -, a prophet to you will raise up the lord the god of you out from the brothers of you, like me;
44.3.22.2^him you will listen to in all things, as many as - he might say to you.
44.3.23.1^it will be that now every soul who, if not might heed the prophet that, will be utterly destroyed out from the people.
44.3.24.1^and all now the prophets from samuel, and those subsequently, as many as have spoken, also have announced the days these.
44.3.25.1^you are the sons of the prophets and of the covenant that made - god with the fathers of you, saying to abraham, and in the seed of you will be blessed all the families of the earth.
44.3.26.1^to you first, having raised up - god the servant of him, sent him, blessing you in - turning away each from the wickednesses of you.
44.4.1.1^speaking now of them to the people, came upon them the priests and the captain of the temple and the sadducees,
44.4.2.1^being distressed because of - teaching their the people and proclaiming in - jesus the resurrection - out from the dead;
44.4.3.1^and they laid on them the hands and put them in custody until the next day;
44.4.3.2^it was for evening already.
44.4.4.1^many however of those having heard the word believed, and became the number of the men about thousand five.
44.4.5.1^it came to pass then on the next day were gathered together their - rulers and - elders and - scribes in jerusalem,
44.4.6.1^and annas the high priest, and caiaphas, and john, and alexander, and as many as were of descent high-priestly.
44.4.7.1^and having placed them in the midst, they began to inquire, in what power or in what name did this you?
44.4.8.1^then peter, having been filled with the spirit holy, said to them, rulers of the people and elders,
44.4.9.1^if we this day are being examined as to a good work to the man ailing, by what means he has been healed,
44.4.10.1^known let it be to all you and to all the people of israel that in the name of jesus christ of nazareth, whom you crucified, whom - god raised out from the dead, in him this man stands before you sound.
44.4.11.1^this is the stone - having been rejected by you, the builders, which has become into head of the corner.
44.4.12.1^and not there is in other no one the salvation, not for name is there another under - heaven - having been given among men by which it behooves to be saved us.
44.4.13.1^seeing now the - of peter boldness, and of john, and having understood that men unschooled they are, and ordinary, they were astonished.
44.4.13.2^they recognized then them, that with - jesus they had been.
44.4.14.1^- and the man beholding with them standing - having been healed, nothing they had to contradict.
44.4.15.1^having commanded however them outside the council to go, they began to confer with one another,
44.4.16.1^saying, what shall we do to the men these?
44.4.16.2^that truly for a noteworthy sign has come to pass through them, to all those inhabiting jerusalem is evident, and not we are able to deny it.
44.4.17.1^but that not on further it might spread among the people, let us warn them no longer to speak in the name this to no man.
44.4.18.1^and having called them, they commanded them - at all not to speak nor to teach in the name - of jesus.
44.4.19.1^- but peter and john answering, said to them, whether right it is before - god to you to listen, rather than - god, you must judge;
44.4.20.1^not are able for we, what we have seen and heard, not to speak.
44.4.21.1^- and having further threatened them, they let go them, nothing finding the how they might punish them, on account of the people, because all were glorifying - god for that having happened;
44.4.22.1^years old for was more than forty, the man on whom had taken place the sign this of healing.
44.4.23.1^having been let go now, they came to the own and reported how much to them the chief priests and the elders had said.
44.4.24.1^- and having heard, with one accord they lifted up their voice to - god and said, sovereign lord, you - made the heaven, and the earth, and the sea, and all that is in them,
44.4.25.1^- of the father of us by the spirit holy through the mouth david servant of you having spoken -:
44.4.25.2^why did rage the gentiles, and peoples did devise vain things?
44.4.26.1^took their stand the kings of the earth, and the rulers were gathered together - themselves against the lord and against the christ of him.
44.4.27.1^were gathered together for in truth, in the city this, against the holy servant of you jesus whom you anointed, herod both and pontius pilate, with the gentiles and peoples of israel,
44.4.28.1^to do whatever the hand of you and the purpose of you had determined beforehand to happen.
44.4.29.1^and - now, lord, look upon the threats of them, and grant to the servants of you with boldness all to speak the word of you,
44.4.30.1^in that the hand of you stretch out you for healing, and signs and wonders to take place, through the name of the holy servant of you, jesus.
44.4.31.1^and having prayed they, was shaken the place in which they were assembled, and they were filled with all the holy spirit and were speaking the word - of god with boldness.
44.4.32.1^- and the multitude - having believed were in heart and soul one, and not one anything of that which possessed he, claimed his own to be, but were to them all things in common.
44.4.33.1^and with power great, were giving - testimony the apostles of the resurrection;
44.4.33.2^of the lord jesus grace then abundant was upon all them.
44.4.34.1^not even for in need anyone there was among them;
44.4.34.2^as many as for owners of lands or houses were selling them, were bringing the proceeds of what is sold,
44.4.35.1^and were laying them at the feet of the apostles;
44.4.35.2^distribution was made then to each just as - anyone need had.
44.4.36.1^joseph now - having been called barnabas by the apostles which is translated son of encouragement a levite, a cypriot at the birth,
44.4.37.1^owns by him a field, having sold it, brought the money and laid it at the feet of the apostles.
44.5.1.1^a man now certain, ananias named, with sapphira, the wife of him, sold a property,
44.5.2.1^and he kept back from the proceeds, being aware of it also the wife, and having brought a portion certain, at the feet of the apostles he laid it.
44.5.3.1^said however - peter, ananias, because of why has filled - satan the heart of you to lie to for you the spirit - holy and to keep back from the proceeds of the land?
44.5.4.1^not remaining to you did it remain?
44.5.4.2^and having been sold, in the own authority it was?
44.5.4.3^why - did you purpose in the heart of you the deed this?
44.5.4.4^not you have lied to men, but - to god!
44.5.5.1^hearing now - ananias the words these, having fallen down, he breathed his last.
44.5.5.2^and came fear great upon all those hearing.
44.5.6.1^having arisen then, the younger men covered him, and having carried him out, buried him.
44.5.7.1^it came to pass now about hours three afterward, also the wife of him, not knowing that having come to pass, came in.
44.5.8.1^replied then to her peter, tell me if for so much, the land you sold?
44.5.8.2^- and she said, yes, for so much.
44.5.9.1^- but peter said to her, why is it that have agreed together you to test the spirit of the lord?
44.5.9.2^behold, the feet of those having buried the husband of you are at the door, and they will carry out you.
44.5.10.1^she fell down then immediately at the feet of him and breathed her last.
44.5.10.2^having come in then, the young men found her dead;
44.5.10.3^and having carried out, they buried her by the husband of her.
44.5.11.1^and came fear great upon all the church and upon all those hearing these things.
44.5.12.1^by now the hands of the apostles were happening signs and wonders many among the people.
44.5.12.2^and they were with one accord, all in the colonnade of solomon;
44.5.13.1^of the now rest, no one dared to join them, but were magnifying them the people;
44.5.14.1^more now were added believing in the lord, multitudes of men both, and women,
44.5.15.1^so as even into the streets to bring out the sick, and to put them on cots and mats, that coming of peter, at least the shadow might envelop some of them.
44.5.16.1^were coming together now also the multitude from the surrounding cities jerusalem, bringing the sick and those being tormented by spirits unclean, who were healed all.
44.5.17.1^having risen up however the high priest and all those with him, - being the sect of the sadducees, were filled with jealousy,
44.5.18.1^and they laid the hands on the apostles and put them in the jail public.
44.5.19.1^an angel however of the lord, during the night having opened the doors of the prison, having brought out then them, said,
44.5.20.1^go, and having stood, speak in the temple to the people all the words of the life this.
44.5.21.1^having heard now, they entered at the dawn into the temple and were teaching.
44.5.21.2^having come now the high priest and those with him, they called together the council, even all the senate of the sons of israel, and sent to the prison house to bring them.
44.5.22.1^- and having come, the officers not did find them in the prison;
44.5.22.2^having returned then they reported back,
44.5.23.1^saying -, the prison house we found shut, with all security, and the guards standing before the doors;
44.5.23.2^having opened them however, inside no one we found.
44.5.24.1^when now they heard the words these, - both the captain of the temple and the chief priests were perplexed concerning them, what - might be this.
44.5.25.1^having come then, a certain one reported to them -, behold, the men whom you put in the prison are in the temple, standing and teaching the people!
44.5.26.1^then having gone, the captain with the officers was bringing them, not with force;
44.5.26.2^they were afraid of for the people lest they might be stoned.
44.5.27.1^having brought then them, they set them in the council.
44.5.27.2^and asked them the high priest,
44.5.28.1^saying, not by a charge we commanded you not to teach in the name this?
44.5.28.2^and behold, you have filled - jerusalem with the teaching of you, and you intend to bring upon us the blood of the man this.
44.5.29.1^answering however, peter and the apostles said, to obey it is necessary god, rather than men.
44.5.30.1^the god of the fathers of us raised up jesus, whom you killed, having hanged him on a tree.
44.5.31.1^him - god as prince and savior exalted by the right hand of him, - to give repentance - to israel and forgiveness of sins.
44.5.32.1^and we are witnesses of the things these, and also the spirit - holy, whom has given - god to those obeying him.
44.5.33.1^- and having heard, they were cut to the heart and were desiring to put to death them.
44.5.34.1^having risen up however a certain man in the council, a pharisee named gamaliel, a teacher of the law honored by all the people, he commanded them outside for a short while the men to put.
44.5.35.1^he said then to them, men, israelites, take heed to yourselves with the men these, what you are about to do.
44.5.36.1^before for these - days rose up theudas, affirming to be somebody himself, to whom were joined of men number about four hundred, who was put to death, and all, as many as were persuaded by him, were dispersed, and it came to nothing.
44.5.37.1^after this man rose up judas the galilean in the days of the registration and drew away people after him.
44.5.37.2^and he perished, and all as many as were persuaded by him, were scattered.
44.5.38.1^and - now i say to you, withdraw from the men these, and let alone them, for if be from men, the plan this or the work this, it will be overthrown;
44.5.39.1^if however from god it is, not you will be able to overthrow them, lest ever also fighting against god you would be found.
44.5.39.2^they were persuaded now by him;
44.5.40.1^and having called in the apostles, having beaten, they commanded them not to speak in the name - of jesus, and released them.
44.5.41.1^they indeed therefore departed, rejoicing, from the presence of the council, that they had been counted worthy for the name to suffer dishonor.
44.5.42.1^every then day, in the temple and in house, not they ceased teaching and proclaiming the good news that the christ is jesus.
44.6.1.1^in now the days these, as are multiplying the disciples, there arose a grumbling of the hellenists against the hebrews, because were being overlooked in the distribution - daily the widows of them.
44.6.2.1^having called near then the twelve the multitude of the disciples, they said, not desirable it is for us, having neglected the word - of god, to attend tables.
44.6.3.1^select therefore, brothers, men out from yourselves being well attested, seven full of the spirit and wisdom, whom we will appoint over the task this.
44.6.4.1^we now in the prayer and the ministry of the word will steadfastly continue.
44.6.5.1^and was pleasing the statement before all the multitude;
44.6.5.2^and they chose stephen, a man full of faith and of the spirit holy, and philip, and prochorus, and nicanor, and timon, and parmenas, and nicolas a convert of antioch,
44.6.6.1^whom they set before the apostles;
44.6.6.2^and having prayed, they laid on them the hands.
44.6.7.1^and the word - of god continued to increase, and was multiplied the number of the disciples in jerusalem exceedingly;
44.6.7.2^a great then multitude of the priests were becoming obedient to the faith.
44.6.8.1^stephen now, full grace and power, was performing wonders and signs great among the people.
44.6.9.1^arose however certain of those from the synagogue - called freedmen, including cyrenians and alexandrians and of those from cilicia and asia, disputing with stephen.
44.6.10.1^and not they were able to withstand the wisdom and the spirit by whom he was speaking.
44.6.11.1^then they suborned men, saying -, we have heard him speaking words blasphemous against moses and - god.
44.6.12.1^they stirred up then the people and the elders and the scribes, and having come upon him, they seized him and brought him to the council.
44.6.13.1^they set also witnesses false, saying, the man this, not does stop speaking words against the place - holy this and the law;
44.6.14.1^we have heard for him saying that jesus of nazareth this will destroy the place this and will change the customs that delivered to us moses.
44.6.15.1^and having looked intently on him, all - sitting in the council saw the face of him as the face of an angel.
44.7.1.1^said then the high priest, if these things so are?
44.7.2.1^- and he began to speak:
44.7.2.2^men, brothers, and fathers, listen!
44.7.2.3^the god - of glory appeared to the father of us abraham, being in - mesopotamia, before rather dwelling his in haran,
44.7.3.1^and he said to him, go out from the country of you and from the kindred of you, and come into the land which - to you i will show.
44.7.4.1^then having gone out from the land of chaldeans, he dwelt in haran.
44.7.4.2^and from there, after - died the father of him, he removed him into the land this, in which you now dwell.
44.7.5.1^and not he did give to him an inheritance in it, not even the length of a foot;
44.7.5.2^but he promised to give to him for a possession it, and to the descendants of him after him, not there being to him a child.
44.7.6.1^spoke however thus - god that will be the seed of him a sojourner in a land strange, and they will enslave it, and will mistreat it years four hundred.
44.7.7.1^and the nation to which if they will be in bondage, will judge i, - god said, and after these things they will come forth and will serve me in the place this.
44.7.8.1^and he gave to him the covenant of circumcision;
44.7.8.2^and thus he begat - isaac and circumcised him on the day - eighth;
44.7.8.3^and isaac - jacob, and jacob the twelve patriarchs.
44.7.9.1^and the patriarchs, having envied - joseph, sold him into egypt.
44.7.9.2^but was - god with him,
44.7.10.1^and rescued him out of all the tribulations of him, and gave him favor and wisdom before pharaoh, king of egypt;
44.7.10.2^and he appointed him ruler over egypt, and over all the house of him.
44.7.11.1^came then a famine upon all - of egypt and canaan, and affliction great, and not were finding sustenance the fathers of us.
44.7.12.1^having heard now jacob there is grain in egypt, he sent forth the fathers of us first;
44.7.13.1^and on the second time, was made known joseph to brothers of him, and known became - to pharaoh the family - of joseph.
44.7.14.1^having sent then joseph, he called for jacob, the father of him, and all the kindred, in all souls seventy five.
44.7.15.1^and went down jacob into egypt and died, he and the fathers of us,
44.7.16.1^and they were carried over into shechem and were placed in the tomb which had bought abraham for a sum of silver from the sons of hamor in shechem.
44.7.17.1^as now was drawing near the time of the promise that had made - god - to abraham, increased the people and multiplied in egypt,
44.7.18.1^until that there arose king another over egypt, who not knew - joseph.
44.7.19.1^he having dealt treacherously with the race of us, he mistreated the fathers of us, - making them the infants abandon of them unto the not they would live.
44.7.20.1^in that time was born moses, and he was beautiful - to god, who was brought up months three in the house of the father.
44.7.21.1^having been set outside then he, took up him the daughter of pharaoh, and brought up him for herself for a son.
44.7.22.1^and was instructed moses in all the wisdom of the egyptians;
44.7.22.2^he was now mighty in words and deeds of him.
44.7.23.1^when then was fulfilled to him of forty years a period, it came into the mind of him to visit the brothers of him, the sons of israel.
44.7.24.1^and having seen a certain one being wronged, he defended him and did vengeance for the one being oppressed, having struck down the egyptian.
44.7.25.1^he was supposing now to understand the brothers of him that - god by the hand of him is giving salvation them, - but not they understood.
44.7.26.1^on the and following day, he appeared to those who were quarreling and urged them to peace, having said, men, brothers you are.
44.7.26.2^so that why wrong you one another?
44.7.27.1^the one however mistreating the neighbor pushed away him, having said, who you appointed, ruler and judge over us?
44.7.28.1^not to kill me you desire, the same way you put to death yesterday the egyptian?
44.7.29.1^fled then moses at the remark this, and became exiled in the land of midian, where he begat sons two.
44.7.30.1^and having been passed years forty, appeared to him in the wilderness of the mount sinai an angel in a flame of fire of a bush.
44.7.31.1^- and moses having seen it, marveled at the vision;
44.7.31.2^coming near then of him to behold it, there was the voice of the lord:
44.7.32.1^i am the god of the fathers of you, the god of abraham, and of isaac, and of jacob.
44.7.32.2^terrified then having become moses, not he dared to look.
44.7.33.1^said then to him the lord, take off the sandal of the feet of you, - for the place on which you stand, ground holy is.
44.7.34.1^having seen, i saw the oppression of the people of me - in egypt, and the groans of them i have heard, and i have come down to deliver them;
44.7.34.2^and now come, i will send you to egypt.
44.7.35.1^this - moses, whom they rejected, having said, who you appointed ruler and judge?
44.7.35.2^him whom god as and ruler and redeemer sent by the hand of the angel - having appeared to him in the bush
44.7.36.1^this one led out them, having done wonders and signs in the land of egypt, and in the red sea, and in the wilderness years forty.
44.7.37.1^this is the moses - having said to the sons of israel, a prophet for you will raise up - god out from the brothers of you, like me.
44.7.38.1^this is the one having been in the congregation in the wilderness, with the angel - speaking to him in the mount sinai, and of the fathers of us, who received oracles living to give to us,
44.7.39.1^to whom not were willing obedient to be the fathers of us, but thrust away, and turned back in the hearts of them to egypt,
44.7.40.1^having said - to aaron, make us gods who will go before us.
44.7.40.2^- as for moses this, who brought out us from the land of egypt, not we know what has happened to him.
44.7.41.1^and they made a calf in the days those and offered a sacrifice to the idol, and they were rejoicing in the works of the hands of them.
44.7.42.1^turned away however - god and delivered them to worship the host of heaven, as it has been written in the book of the prophets:
44.7.42.2^not slain beasts and sacrifices did you offer to me, years forty in the wilderness, o house of israel?
44.7.43.1^and you took up the tabernacle - of moloch, and the star of the god of you rephan, the images that you made to worship them;
44.7.43.2^and i will remove you beyond babylon.
44.7.44.1^the tabernacle of the testimony was with fathers of us in the wilderness, just as had commanded the one speaking - to moses, to make it according to the pattern that he had seen,
44.7.45.1^which also brought it, having received by succession, the fathers of us, with joshua in the taking possession of the nations whom drove out - god from the face of the fathers of us, until the days of david,
44.7.46.1^who found favor before - god and asked to find a dwelling place for the house of jacob.
44.7.47.1^solomon however built him the house.
44.7.48.1^yet not the most high in hand-made houses dwells.
44.7.48.2^as the prophet says:
44.7.49.1^- heaven is to me a throne, - and the earth a footstool of the feet of me.
44.7.49.2^what kind of house will you build me, says the lord, or what is the place of the rest of me?
44.7.50.1^not the hand of me has made these things all?
44.7.51.1^stiff-necked and uncircumcised in heart and - ears, you always the spirit - holy resist;
44.7.51.2^as the fathers of you, also you.
44.7.52.1^which of the prophets not did persecute the fathers of you?
44.7.52.2^and they killed those having foretold about the coming of the righteous one, of whom now you betrayers and murderers have become,
44.7.53.1^who received the law by the ordination of angels, and not have kept it.
44.7.54.1^hearing now these things, they were cut in the hearts of them and began gnashing the teeth at him.
44.7.55.1^he being however full of the spirit holy, having looked intently into - heaven, saw the glory of god and jesus standing at the right hand - of god,
44.7.56.1^and he said, behold, i see the heavens having been opened, and the son - of man at the right hand standing - of god.
44.7.57.1^having cried out then in a voice loud, they held the ears of them and rushed with one accord upon him,
44.7.58.1^and having cast him out of the city, they began to stone him.
44.7.58.2^and the witnesses laid aside the garments of them at the feet of a young man named saul.
44.7.59.1^and as they were stoning - stephen, he was calling out and saying, lord jesus, receive the spirit of me.
44.7.60.1^having fallen then on his knees, he cried in a voice loud, lord, not place to them this - sin.
44.7.60.2^and this having said, he fell asleep.
44.8.1.1^saul now was there consenting to the killing of him.
44.8.1.2^arose then on that - day a persecution great against the church which was in jerusalem.
44.8.1.3^all then were scattered throughout the regions - of judea and samaria, except the apostles.
44.8.2.1^buried now - stephen men devout, and made lamentation great over him.
44.8.3.1^saul however was destroying the church;
44.8.3.2^houses after - houses entering, dragging off then men and women, he was delivering them to prison.
44.8.4.1^those indeed therefore having been scattered went about, preaching the word.
44.8.5.1^philip now, having gone down to - a city - of samaria, was proclaiming to them the christ.
44.8.6.1^were giving heed now the crowds to the things being spoken by - philip with one accord, in the time to hear them and to see the signs that he was performing.
44.8.7.1^many for of those having spirits unclean, crying voice in a loud, they were coming out of them;
44.8.7.2^many now, having been paralyzed and lame, were healed.
44.8.8.1^there was then great joy in the city that.
44.8.9.1^a man now certain, named simon, had been formerly in the city practicing sorcery and amazing the people - of samaria, declaring to be someone himself great,
44.8.10.1^to whom were giving heed all, from small to great, saying, this one is the power - of god that is called great.
44.8.11.1^they were giving heed now to him, because the long time with the magic arts he had amazed them.
44.8.12.1^when however they believed - philip, proclaiming the gospel concerning the kingdom - of god, and the name of jesus christ, they were baptized, men both and women.
44.8.13.1^- and simon also himself believed, and having been baptized, was steadfastly continuing - with philip.
44.8.13.2^beholding then the signs and miracles great being performed, he was amazed.
44.8.14.1^having heard now the in jerusalem apostles that had received - samaria the word - of god, they sent to them peter and john,
44.8.15.1^who having come down, prayed for them that they might receive the spirit holy.
44.8.16.1^not yet for he was upon any of them fallen;
44.8.16.2^only however baptized they had been into the name of the lord jesus.
44.8.17.1^then they began laying the hands upon them, and they received the spirit holy.
44.8.18.1^having seen now - of simon that through the laying on of the hands of the apostles was given the spirit, he offered to them money,
44.8.19.1^saying, give also to me the authority this, that on whom if i may lay the hands, he may receive the spirit holy.
44.8.20.1^peter however said to him, the silver of you, with you may it be to destruction, because the gift - of god you thought by money to be obtained!
44.8.21.1^no there is to you part, nor lot, in the matter this;
44.8.21.2^the for heart of you not is right before - god.
44.8.22.1^repent therefore of the wickedness of yours this, and pray earnestly to the lord, if indeed will be forgiven you the intent of the heart of you;
44.8.23.1^in for the gall of bitterness and the bond of iniquity, i see you being.
44.8.24.1^answering now, - simon said, pray earnestly you on behalf of me to the lord, so that nothing may come upon me of which you have spoken.
44.8.25.1^they indeed therefore having earnestly testified, and having spoken the word of the lord, traveled back to jerusalem, to many then villages of the samaritans they were preaching the gospel.
44.8.26.1^an angel now of the lord spoke to philip, saying, rise up and go toward the south, to the road - going down from jerusalem to gaza.
44.8.26.2^this is the desert road.
44.8.27.1^and having risen up, he went.
44.8.27.2^and behold, a man an ethiopian, a eunuch, a potentate of candace queen of the ethiopians, who was over all the treasure of her, who had come to worship to jerusalem,
44.8.28.1^he was then returning and sitting in the chariot of him, and he was reading the prophet isaiah.
44.8.29.1^said then the spirit - to philip, go near and join yourself to the chariot this.
44.8.30.1^having run up then, - philip heard him reading isaiah the prophet, and said, then also understand you what you are reading?
44.8.31.1^- and he said, how for - could i be able if not someone will guide me?
44.8.31.2^he invited then - philip, having come up, to sit with him.
44.8.32.1^- now the passage of the scripture which he was reading was this:
44.8.32.2^as a sheep to slaughter he was led, and as a lamb before the one shearing him is silent, so not he opens the mouth of him.
44.8.33.1^in the humiliation of him, - justice from him was taken away.
44.8.33.2^the generation of him, who will describe?
44.8.33.3^for is removed from the earth the life of him.
44.8.34.1^answering now, the eunuch - to philip said, i pray you, concerning whom the prophet says this?
44.8.34.2^concerning himself, or concerning other some?
44.8.35.1^having opened then - philip the mouth of him and having begun from the scripture this, he proclaimed the good news to him   - jesus.
44.8.36.1^as then they were going along the road, they came upon some water, and says the eunuch, behold water;
44.8.36.2^what prevents me to be baptized?
44.8.38.1^and he commanded to stop the chariot.
44.8.38.2^and they went down both to the water, - both philip and the eunuch, and he baptized him.
