44.8.39.1^when now they came up out of the water, the spirit of the lord carried away - philip, and not saw him no longer the eunuch;
44.8.39.2^he went for the way of him, rejoicing.
44.8.40.1^philip however was found at azotus, and passing through, he was proclaiming the gospel to the towns all, until - coming his to caesarea.
44.9.1.1^- but saul, still breathing out threats and murder toward the disciples of the lord, having gone to the high priest,
44.9.2.1^requested from him letters in damascus to the synagogues, so that if any he found of the way, being men both and women, having bound, he might bring them to jerusalem.
44.9.3.1^in now - proceeding, it came to pass as he draws near - to damascus, suddenly also him flashed around a light from - heaven.
44.9.4.1^and having fallen on the ground, he heard a voice saying to him, saul, saul, why me do you persecute?
44.9.5.1^he said then, who are you, lord?
44.9.5.2^- and he said, i am jesus, whom you are persecuting.
44.9.6.1^but rise up and enter into the city, and it will be told you that what you it behooves to do.
44.9.7.1^- and the men - traveling with him stood speechless, hearing indeed the voice, no one however seeing.
44.9.8.1^rose up then saul from the ground;
44.9.8.2^having been opened however the eyes of him, nothing he could see.
44.9.8.3^leading by the hand then him, they brought him to damascus.
44.9.9.1^and he was days three without seeing, and neither did he eat nor drink.
44.9.10.1^there was now a certain disciple in damascus named ananias.
44.9.10.2^and said to him in a vision the lord, ananias.
44.9.10.3^- and he said, behold me, lord.
44.9.11.1^- and the lord to him said, having risen up, go into the street - called straight, and seek in the house of judas saul named, of tarsus.
44.9.11.2^behold for he is praying,
44.9.12.1^and he saw a man in a vision ananias named, having come and having put on him the hands, so that he might see again.
44.9.13.1^answered but ananias, lord, i have heard from many concerning the man this, how many evils to saints of you he did in jerusalem;
44.9.14.1^and here he has authority from the chief priests to bind all those calling on the name of you.
44.9.15.1^said however to him the lord, go, for a vessel of choice is to me this man, - to carry the name of me before the gentiles, and also kings, the sons then of israel;
44.9.16.1^i for will show to him how much it behooves him for the name of me to suffer.
44.9.17.1^went away then ananias and entered into the house;
44.9.17.2^and having laid upon him the hands, he said, saul brother, the lord has sent me, jesus, the one having appeared to you on the road by which you were coming, that you may see again and be filled of the spirit holy.
44.9.18.1^and immediately fell of him from the eyes something like scales, he regained his sight also.
44.9.18.2^and having risen up, he was baptized;
44.9.19.1^and having taken food, he was strengthened.
44.9.19.2^he was now with the in damascus disciples days some.
44.9.20.1^and immediately in the synagogues he began proclaiming - jesus, that he is the son - of god.
44.9.21.1^were amazed then all - hearing, and were saying, not this is the one having ravaged in jerusalem those calling on the name this?
44.9.21.2^and here for this he had come, that having been bound, them he might bring to the chief priests.
44.9.22.1^saul however all the more was empowered, and kept confounding the jews - dwelling in damascus, proving that this is the christ.
44.9.23.1^when now had passed days many, plotted together the jews to kill him;
44.9.24.1^became known however - to saul the plot of them.
44.9.24.2^they were closely watching now also the gates day and also night, so that him they might kill;
44.9.25.1^having taken him however the disciples of him by night, through the wall they let down him, having lowered him in a basket.
44.9.26.1^having arrived then in jerusalem, he was attempting to join the disciples.
44.9.26.2^and all were afraid of him, not believing that he is a disciple.
44.9.27.1^barnabas however, having taken him, brought him to the apostles, and he related to them how on the road he had seen the lord, and that he had spoken to him, and how in damascus he had spoken boldly in the name - of jesus.
44.9.28.1^and he was with them, coming in and going out in jerusalem, speaking boldly in the name of the lord.
44.9.29.1^he was speaking also and was debating with the hellenists;
44.9.29.2^- but they were seeking to kill him.
44.9.30.1^having known it however, the brothers brought down him to caesarea and sent away him to tarsus.
44.9.31.1^the indeed then church throughout all - of judea, and galilee, and samaria, had peace, being edified and going on in the fear of the lord;
44.9.31.2^and in the comfort of the holy spirit they were multiplied.
44.9.32.1^it came to pass that now peter, passing through all quarters, went down also to the saints - inhabiting lydda.
44.9.33.1^he found then there a man certain, named aeneas, for years eight lying on a bed, who was paralyzed.
44.9.34.1^and said to him - peter, aeneas, heals you jesus christ;
44.9.34.2^rise up, and make the bed for yourself.
44.9.34.3^and immediately he rose up.
44.9.35.1^and saw him all those inhabiting lydda and - sharon, who turned to the lord.
44.9.36.1^in joppa now certain there was a disciple named tabitha, which translated is called dorcas.
44.9.36.2^she was full of works good, and of alms that she continually did.
44.9.37.1^it came to pass however, in the days those, that having become sick, she died.
44.9.37.2^having washed her then, put her they in an upper room.
44.9.38.1^near now being lydda - joppa, the disciples, having heard that peter is in it, sent two men to him, imploring , not to delay coming to us.
44.9.39.1^having risen up then, peter went with them, who having arrived, brought him into the upper room.
44.9.39.2^and stood by him all the widows, weeping and showing the tunics and garments that had made, with them being, - dorcas.
44.9.40.1^having put then outside all - peter, and having bowed the knees, he prayed.
44.9.40.2^and having turned to the body he said, tabitha, arise!
44.9.40.3^- and she opened the eyes of her, and having seen - peter, she sat up.
44.9.41.1^having given then her his hand, he raised up her.
44.9.41.2^having called then the saints and the widows, he presented her living.
44.9.42.1^known then it became throughout all - of joppa, and believed many on the lord.
44.9.43.1^it came to pass then, days many he stayed in joppa with a certain simon, a tanner.
44.10.1.1^a man now certain in caesarea, named cornelius, was a centurion of the cohort that is called italian,
44.10.2.1^devout and fearing - god with all the household of him, doing alms many to the people, and praying to god continually all.
44.10.3.1^he saw in a vision clearly, as if about hour the ninth of the day, an angel - of god having come to him and having said to him, cornelius!
44.10.4.1^- and having looked intently on him, and afraid having become, he said, what is it, lord?
44.10.4.2^he said then to him, the prayers of you and the alms of you have ascended as a memorial before - god.
44.10.5.1^and now send men to joppa and summon simon, a man who is called peter.
44.10.6.1^he lodges with a certain simon a tanner, whose is the house by the sea.
44.10.7.1^when then had departed the angel - speaking to him, having called two of the servants and a soldier devout of those who are attending him,
44.10.8.1^and having related all things to them, he sent them to - joppa.
44.10.9.1^on the now next day, as are journeying these and the city approaching, went up peter on the housetop to pray, about hour the sixth.
44.10.10.1^he became then hungry and desired to eat;
44.10.10.2^as were preparing however they, fell upon him a trance,
44.10.11.1^and he beholds - heaven opening, and descending a vessel certain, as a sheet great, by four corners being let down upon the earth,
44.10.12.1^in which were all the quadrupeds, and creeping things of the earth, and birds of heaven.
44.10.13.1^and came a voice to him:
44.10.13.2^having risen up, peter, kill and eat!
44.10.14.1^- and peter said, in no way, lord;
44.10.14.2^for never have i eaten anything common or unclean.
44.10.15.1^and a voice came again for the second time to him:
44.10.15.2^what - god has cleansed, you not call common.
44.10.16.1^this now took place for three times, and immediately was taken up the vessel into - heaven.
44.10.17.1^while then in himself was perplexed - peter what - might be the vision that he had seen, behold, the men - having been sent from - cornelius, having inquired for the house - of simon, stood at the gate.
44.10.18.1^and having called out, they were asking if simon who is called peter here is lodged.
44.10.19.1^- and of peter thinking over the vision, said to him the spirit, behold, men three are seeking you.
44.10.20.1^but having risen, go down and proceed with them, nothing doubting, because i have sent them.
44.10.21.1^having gone down then peter to the men, he said, behold, i am whom you seek;
44.10.21.2^what is the cause for which you are here?
44.10.22.1^- and they said, cornelius a centurion, a man righteous and fearing - god, being well testified to then by all the nation of the jews, was divinely instructed by an angel holy to send for you to the house of him, and to hear a message from you.
44.10.23.1^having called in therefore them he lodged them.
44.10.23.2^on the now next day having risen up, he went forth with them, and some of the brothers those from joppa went with him.
44.10.24.1^on the now next day, he entered into - caesarea, - and cornelius was expecting them, having called together the relatives of him and - close friends.
44.10.25.1^as then was - entering - peter, having met him - cornelius, having fallen at the feet, worshiped him.
44.10.26.1^- but peter lifted up him, saying, rise up, also i myself a man am.
44.10.27.1^and talking with him, he entered, and he finds having gathered together many.
44.10.28.1^he was saying then to them, you know how unlawful it is for a man a jew to unite himself or to come near to a foreigner.
44.10.28.2^to me however god has shown, not common or unclean to call man.
44.10.29.1^therefore also without objection i came, having been summoned.
44.10.29.2^i inquire therefore, for what reason did you summon me?
44.10.30.1^and - cornelius was saying, ago four days, until this the hour, i was at the ninth hour praying in the house of me;
44.10.30.2^and behold, a man stood before me in apparel bright,
44.10.31.1^and said, cornelius, has been heard your - prayer, and the alms of you have been remembered before - god.
44.10.32.1^send therefore to joppa and call for simon, who is called peter;
44.10.32.2^he lodges in the house of simon, a tanner by the sea.
44.10.33.1^at once therefore i sent to you;
44.10.33.2^you then well did, having come.
44.10.33.3^now therefore, all we before - god are present to hear all the things having been commanded you by the lord.
44.10.34.1^having opened then peter the mouth, he said, of a truth i understand that not is one who shows partiality - god,
44.10.35.1^but in every nation, the one fearing him and working righteousness, acceptable to him is,
44.10.36.1^the word that he sent to the sons of israel, proclaiming the gospel, peace by jesus christ   he is of all lord.
44.10.37.1^you yourselves know the having come declaration through all - judea, having begun from - galilee, after the baptism that proclaimed john:
44.10.38.1^jesus - from nazareth, how anointed him - god spirit with holy and with power, who went about doing good and healing all those being oppressed by the devil, because - god was with him.
44.10.39.1^and we are witnesses of all things that he did in both the region of the jews and in jerusalem, whom also they put to death, having hanged him on a tree.
44.10.40.1^this one - god raised up on the third day, and gave him manifest to become,
44.10.41.1^not to all the people, but to the witnesses - having been chosen beforehand by - god, to us who did eat with and drink with him after - rising his out from the dead.
44.10.42.1^and he instructed us to proclaim to the people and to testify fully that he is the one having been appointed by - god as judge of living and dead.
44.10.43.1^to him all the prophets bear witness that forgiveness of sins receives through the name of him everyone - believing in him.
44.10.44.1^still speaking - of peter the words these, fell the spirit - holy upon all those hearing the word.
44.10.45.1^and were amazed the from the circumcision believers, as many as had come with - peter, that even upon the gentiles the gift of the holy spirit has been poured out.
44.10.46.1^they were hearing for them speaking in tongues and magnifying - god.
44.10.46.2^then answered peter,
44.10.47.1^if not the water is able to withhold anyone - not to baptize these who the spirit - holy have received, just as also have we?
44.10.48.1^he commanded now them in the name of jesus christ to be baptized.
44.10.48.2^then they asked him to remain days some.
44.11.1.1^heard now the apostles and the brothers - being in - judea that also the gentiles had received the word - of god.
44.11.2.1^when also went up peter to jerusalem, began contending with him those of the circumcision,
44.11.3.1^saying -, you went to men uncircumcision having, and ate with them.
44.11.4.1^having begun now peter, he set it forth to them in order, saying,
44.11.5.1^i was in the city of joppa praying, and i saw in a trance a vision, descending a vessel certain like a sheet great, by four corners being let down out of - heaven, and it came down as far as me.
44.11.6.1^on it having looked intently, i was observing it, and i saw the quadrupeds of the earth, and the wild beasts, and the creeping things, and the birds of the air.
44.11.7.1^i heard then also a voice saying to me, having risen up, peter, kill and eat.
44.11.8.1^i said however, in no way, lord, for common or unclean nothing ever has entered into the mouth of me.
44.11.9.1^answered however the voice for a second time out of - heaven, what - god has cleansed, you not do call unholy.
44.11.10.1^this now happened on three times, and was drawn up again all into - heaven.
44.11.11.1^and behold, immediately three men stood at the house in which i was, having been sent from caesarea to me.
44.11.12.1^told now the spirit me to go with them, not having discriminated.
44.11.12.2^went now with me also - six brothers these, and we entered into the house of the man.
44.11.13.1^he related then to us how he had seen the angel in the house of him, having stood and having said, send forth to joppa, and send for simon, who is called peter,
44.11.14.1^who will speak words to you, in which will be saved you and all the household of you.
44.11.15.1^in then - beginning my to speak, fell the spirit - holy upon them, even as also upon us in the beginning.
44.11.16.1^i remembered then the word of the lord, how he had said, john indeed baptized with water;
44.11.16.2^you however will be baptized with the spirit holy.
44.11.17.1^if then the same gift has given to them - god as also to us having believed on the lord jesus christ, i how was able to forbid - god?
44.11.18.1^having heard then these things, they were silent and glorified - god, saying, then indeed also to the gentiles - god - repentance unto life has given.
44.11.19.1^those indeed therefore having been scattered by the tribulation - having taken place over stephen, passed through to phoenicia, and cyprus, and antioch, to no one speaking the word if not only to jews.
44.11.20.1^were however some of them, men of cyprus and of cyrene, who having come into antioch, were speaking also to the hellenists, proclaiming the gospel   the lord jesus.
44.11.21.1^and was the hand of the lord with them;
44.11.21.2^a great then number - having believed, turned to the lord.
44.11.22.1^was heard now the report in the ears of the church - being in jerusalem concerning them, and they sent forth barnabas to go as far as antioch,
44.11.23.1^who having come and having seen the grace of - god, rejoiced and was exhorting all with resolute purpose - of heart to abide in the lord.
44.11.24.1^for he was a man good, and full of the spirit holy, and of faith.
44.11.24.2^and was added a crowd large to the lord.
44.11.25.1^he went forth then to tarsus to seek saul,
44.11.26.1^and having found him, he brought him to antioch.
44.11.26.2^it came to pass that now they also a year whole gathered together in the church and taught a crowd large.
44.11.26.3^were called then first in antioch the disciples, christians.
44.11.27.1^in these now - days came down from jerusalem prophets to antioch.
44.11.28.1^having risen up now one of them named agabus, he signified by the spirit that a famine great is about to be over all the world   which came to pass under claudius.
44.11.29.1^- and the disciples, as was prospered anyone, determined each of them, for ministry, to send to the dwelling in - judea brothers,
44.11.30.1^which also they did, having sent it to the elders by the hand of barnabas and saul.
44.12.1.1^at that now - time, put forth herod the king the hands to mistreat some of those of the church.
44.12.2.1^he put to death then james, the brother of john, with the sword.
44.12.3.1^having seen now that pleasing it is to the jews, he proceeded to take also peter   these were now the days of the unleavened bread
44.12.4.1^whom also having seized, he put in prison, having delivered him to four sets of four soldiers to guard him, intending after the passover to bring out him to the people.
44.12.5.1^- indeed therefore peter was kept in the prison;
44.12.5.2^prayer however was fervent being made by the church to - god concerning him.
44.12.6.1^when then was about to bring forth him - herod, the night that, was - peter sleeping between two soldiers, having been bound with chains two, guards also before the door were watching the prison.
44.12.7.1^and behold, an angel of the lord stood by, and a light shone in the cell.
44.12.7.2^having struck then the side - of peter, he woke up him, saying, rise up in haste.
44.12.7.3^and fell of him the chains off the hands.
44.12.8.1^said then the angel to him, gird yourself about and put on the sandals of you.
44.12.8.2^he did and so.
44.12.8.3^and he says to him, wrap around you the cloak of you and follow me.
44.12.9.1^and having gone forth, he was following and not did know that real is what is happening by means of the angel;
44.12.9.2^he was thinking however a vision he saw.
44.12.10.1^having passed through then a first guard and a second, they came to the gate - iron - leading into the city, which by itself opened to them.
44.12.10.2^and having gone out they went on through street one, and immediately departed the angel from him.
44.12.11.1^and - peter to himself having come, said, now i know truly that has sent forth the lord the angel of him and delivered me out of the hand of herod and all the expectation of the people of the jews.
44.12.12.1^having considered it also, he came to the house of mary the mother of john, who is called mark, where were many having gathered together and praying.
44.12.13.1^having knocked then of him at the door of the gate, came a girl to answer, named rhoda.
44.12.14.1^and having recognized the voice - of peter, from - joy not she opened the gate, having run in;
44.12.14.2^but she reported to be standing - peter before the gate.
44.12.15.1^- and to her they said, you are out of your mind.
44.12.15.2^- but she kept insisting it so to be.
44.12.15.3^- and they kept saying, the angel it is of him.
44.12.16.1^- but peter continued knocking;
44.12.16.2^having opened it then, they saw him and were amazed.
44.12.17.1^having made a sign then to them with the hand to be silent, he related to them how the lord him had brought out of the prison.
44.12.17.2^he said then, report to james and to the brothers these things.
44.12.17.3^and having gone out, he went to another place.
44.12.18.1^having come now day, there was disturbance no small among the soldiers, what then of - peter has become.
44.12.19.1^herod then having sought after him, and not having found him, having examined the guards, he commanded them to be led away to death.
44.12.19.2^and having gone down from - judea to caesarea, he stayed there.
44.12.20.1^he had been now furiously angry with the tyrians and sidonians;
44.12.20.2^with one accord then they came to him.
44.12.20.3^and having gained blastus, who was over the bedchamber of the king, they were seeking peace, because of - being nourished their - region by the king s.
44.12.21.1^on the appointed now day, - herod, having put on apparel royal and having sat on the throne, was making an address to them.
44.12.22.1^- and the people were crying out, of a god this is the voice, and not of a man!
44.12.23.1^immediately then struck him an angel of the lord, in return for that not he gave the glory - to god;
44.12.23.2^and having been eaten by worms, he breathed his last.
44.12.24.1^- but the word - of god continued to grow and to multiply.
44.12.25.1^barnabas then and saul returned, to jerusalem having fulfilled the mission, having taken with them john, the one having been called mark.
44.13.1.1^there were now in antioch, in the being there church, prophets and teachers, - both barnabas and simeon who was called niger, and lucius the cyrenian, manaen also   herod the tetrarch brought up with   and saul.
44.13.2.1^as were ministering now they to the lord and fasting, said the spirit - holy, set apart then to me - barnabas and saul for the work to which i have called them.
44.13.3.1^then having fasted, and having prayed, and having laid the hands on them, they sent them off.
44.13.4.1^they indeed therefore having been sent forth by the holy spirit, went down to seleucia.
44.13.4.2^from there then they sailed to cyprus.
44.13.5.1^and having come into salamis, they began proclaiming the word - of god in the synagogues of the jews.
44.13.5.2^they had now also john as a helper.
44.13.6.1^having passed through now all the island, as far as paphos, they found a man   a certain magician, a false prophet jewish   whose name was bar-jesus,
44.13.7.1^who was with the proconsul sergius paulus, man an intelligent.
44.13.7.2^he having called to him barnabas and saul, desired to hear the word - of god.
44.13.8.1^was opposing however them elymas the magician   thus for means the name of him   seeking to turn away the proconsul from the faith.
44.13.9.1^saul then, - also called paul, having been filled the spirit holy, having looked intently upon him,
44.13.10.1^said, o full of all deceit and all craft, son of the devil, enemy of all righteousness, not will you cease perverting the ways the of lord - straight?
44.13.11.1^and now behold, the hand of the lord is upon you, and you will be blind, not seeing the sun during a season.
44.13.11.2^immediately then fell upon him mist and darkness, and going about he was seeking someone to lead him by the hand.
44.13.12.1^then having seen the proconsul that having happened, he believed, being astonished at the teaching of the lord.
44.13.13.1^having sailed then from - paphos with those around him, paul came to perga - of pamphylia.
44.13.13.2^john however having departed from them, returned to jerusalem.
44.13.14.1^they now, having passed through from - perga, came to antioch - of pisidia, and having gone into the synagogue on the day of the sabbaths, they sat down.
44.13.15.1^after then the reading of the law and of the prophets, sent the rulers of the synagogue to them, saying, men, brothers, if any there is among you a word of exhortation toward the people, speak.
44.13.16.1^having risen up then paul, and having made a sign with the hand, he said, men, israelites, and those fearing - god, listen.
44.13.17.1^the god of the people this of israel chose the fathers of us, and the people exalted in the sojourn in the land of egypt, and with arm uplifted, brought them out of it,
44.13.18.1^and of about forty years for a period he endured the ways their in the wilderness,
44.13.19.1^and having destroyed nations seven in the land of canaan, he gave as an inheritance the land of them
44.13.20.1^during years four hundred and fifty.
44.13.20.2^and after these things, he gave them judges until samuel the prophet.
44.13.21.1^then they asked for a king, and gave to them - god, - saul son of kish, a man of the tribe of benjamin, years forty.
44.13.22.1^and having removed him, he raised up - david to them as king, to whom also he said, having carried witness:
44.13.22.2^i have found david the son of jesse a man according to the heart of me, who will do all the will of me.
44.13.23.1^of this man - god, of the seed, according to promise, has brought - to israel the savior jesus
44.13.24.1^having proclaimed john before the face of the coming of him a baptism of repentance to all the people of israel.
44.13.25.1^while then was fulfilling john the course, he was saying, whom me do you suppose to be?
44.13.25.2^not am i he, but behold, he comes after me, of whom not i am worthy a sandal of the feet to untie.
44.13.26.1^men, brothers, sons of the family of abraham, and those among you fearing - god, to us the message of the salvation this has been sent.
44.13.27.1^those for dwelling in jerusalem and the rulers of them, him not having known, and the voices of the prophets that on every sabbath are being read, having condemned him they fulfilled them.
44.13.28.1^and no cause of death having found, they begged pilate to put to death him.
44.13.29.1^when then they had finished all the things about him having been written, having taken him down from the tree, they put him in a tomb.
44.13.30.1^- but god raised him out from the dead,
44.13.31.1^who appeared for days many to those having come up with him from - galilee to jerusalem, who now are witnesses of him to the people.
44.13.32.1^and we to you preach the gospel, the to the fathers promise having been made,
44.13.33.1^that this - god has fulfilled, to the children of them, to us, having raised up jesus, as also in the psalm it has been written, the second:
44.13.33.2^son of me are you, i today have begotten you.
44.13.34.1^that then he raised him out from the dead, no more being about to return to decay, thus he spoke -:
44.13.34.2^i will give to you the holy blessings of david, the sure blessings.
44.13.35.1^therefore also in another he says:
44.13.35.2^not you will allow the holy one of you to see decay.
44.13.36.1^david indeed for in his own generation having served the - of god purpose, fell asleep and was added to the fathers of him, and saw decay.
44.13.37.1^the one however - god raised up not did see decay.
44.13.38.1^known therefore be it to you, men, brothers, that through this one, to you forgiveness of sins is proclaimed.
44.13.38.2^and from all things from which not you were able in the law of moses to be justified,
44.13.39.1^in him everyone - believing is justified.
44.13.40.1^take heed therefore, lest might come about that having been said in the prophets:
44.13.41.1^behold, - scoffers, and wonder and perish;
44.13.41.2^for a work am working i in the days of you, a work that never not you would believe, even if one should declare it to you.
44.13.42.1^having departed then, they were begging on the next sabbath to be spoken to them the words these.
44.13.43.1^having broken up then the synagogue, followed many of the jews and of the worshipping converts - paul and - barnabas, who speaking to them kept persuading them to continue in the grace - of god.
44.13.44.1^on the now coming sabbath, almost all the city was gathered together to hear the word - of the lord.
44.13.45.1^having seen however the jews the crowds, they were filled with jealousy and began contradicting the things by paul spoken, blaspheming.
44.13.46.1^having spoken boldly also, - paul and - barnabas said, to you it was necessary first to be spoken the word - of god;
44.13.46.2^but since you thrust away it and not worthy you judge yourselves - of eternal life, behold, we are turning to the gentiles.
44.13.47.1^thus for has commanded us the lord:
44.13.47.2^i have set you for a light of the gentiles, - to be you for salvation to the uttermost part of the earth.
44.13.48.1^hearing it then, the gentiles were rejoicing and glorifying the word of the lord, and believed as many as were appointed to life eternal.
44.13.49.1^was carried then the word of the lord through all the region.
44.13.50.1^the but jews incited the worshipping women - of honorable position, and the principals of the city, and they stirred up a persecution against - paul and barnabas, and expelled them from the district of them.
44.13.51.1^- but having shaken off the dust of the feet against them, they went to iconium;
44.13.52.1^- and the disciples were filled with joy and the spirit holy.
44.14.1.1^it came to pass now in iconium, according to the same entered they into the synagogue of the jews and spoke so that believed of jewish both and greeks a great number.
44.14.2.1^the however unbelieving jews stirred up and poisoned the minds of the gentiles against the brothers.
44.14.3.1^a long indeed therefore time they stayed, speaking boldly for the lord, the one bearing witness to the word of the grace of him, granting signs and wonders to be done through the hands of them.
44.14.4.1^was divided now the multitude of the city, and some indeed were with the jews;
44.14.4.2^some however with the apostles.
44.14.5.1^when then there was a rush of the gentiles both and jews, with the rulers of them, to mistreat and to stone them,
44.14.6.1^having become aware, they fled to the cities - of lycaonia, lystra, and derbe, and the surrounding region,
44.14.7.1^and there preaching the gospel they continued.
44.14.8.1^and a certain man crippled, in lystra, in the feet, was sitting, lame from the womb of the mother of him, who never had walked.
44.14.9.1^this man heard - paul speaking, who, having looked intently at him and having seen that he has faith - to be healed,
44.14.10.1^said in a loud voice, stand on the feet of you upright!
44.14.10.2^and he sprang up and began to walk.
44.14.11.1^- and the crowds having seen what had done paul, lifted up the voice of them in lycaonian, saying, the gods, having become like men, have come down to us.
44.14.12.1^they began calling then - barnabas zeus, - and paul hermes, because he was the leading - speaker.
44.14.13.1^- and the priest - of zeus, - being just outside the city, oxen and wreaths to the gates having brought, with the crowds was desiring to sacrifice.
44.14.14.1^having heard however, the apostles barnabas and paul, having torn the garments of them, rushed out into the crowd, crying out
44.14.15.1^and saying, men, why these things do you?
44.14.15.2^also we of like nature are with you men, proclaiming the gospel to you, from these - vanities to turn to god the living, who made the heaven and the earth and the sea and all the things in them,
44.14.16.1^who in the past generations allowed all the nations to go the ways of them.
44.14.17.1^and yet not without witness himself he has left, doing good, from heaven to you rains giving and seasons fruitful, filling with food and gladness the hearts of you.
44.14.18.1^and these things saying, hardly they stopped the crowds - not sacrificing to them.
44.14.19.1^came however from antioch and iconium jews, and having persuaded the crowds, and having stoned - paul, they dragged him outside the city, supposing him to have died.
44.14.20.1^having surrounded however the disciples him, having risen up, he entered into the city.
44.14.20.2^and on the next day he went away with - barnabas to derbe.
44.14.21.1^having proclaimed the gospel to then the city that, and having discipled many, they returned to - lystra, and to iconium, and to antioch,
44.14.22.1^strengthening the souls of the disciples, exhorting them to continue in the faith, and that through many tribulations it behooves us to enter into the kingdom - of god.
44.14.23.1^having chosen now for them in every church elders, having prayed, with fasting they committed them to the lord, in whom they had believed.
44.14.24.1^and having passed through - pisidia, they came to - pamphylia,
44.14.25.1^and having spoken in perga the word, they went down to attalia.
44.14.26.1^and from there they sailed to antioch, from where they had been committed to the grace - of god for the work that they had fulfilled.
44.14.27.1^having arrived now and having gathered together the church, they began declaring all that had done - god with them, and that he had opened to the gentiles a door of faith.
44.14.28.1^they remained then time no little with the disciples.
44.15.1.1^and certain ones having come down from - judea were teaching the brothers -, if not you are circumcised according to the custom - of moses, not you are able to be saved.
44.15.2.1^having been brought about then commotion and discussion no small - by paul and - barnabas with them, they appointed to go up paul and barnabas and certain others out from them, to the apostles and elders, to jerusalem, about the question this.
44.15.3.1^they indeed therefore having been sent forward by the church were passing through - both phoenicia and samaria, relating in detail the conversion of the gentiles, and they were bringing joy great to all the brothers.
44.15.4.1^having come then to jerusalem, they were welcomed by the church and the apostles and the elders.
44.15.4.2^they declared then all that - god had done with them.
44.15.5.1^rose up now certain of those of the sect of the pharisees who believed, saying -, it is necessary to circumcise them, to command them then to keep the law of moses.
44.15.6.1^were gathered together then the apostles and the elders to see about the matter this.
44.15.7.1^of much now discussion having taken place, having risen up, peter said to them, men, brothers, you know that from days early, among you chose - god by the mouth of me to hear the gentiles the word of the gospel, and to believe.
44.15.8.1^and the heart-knowing god bore witness to them, having given them the spirit - holy, as also to us,
44.15.9.1^and not one he made distinction between us also and them, by the faith having purified the hearts of them.
44.15.10.1^now therefore, why are you testing - god, to put a yoke upon the neck of the disciples that neither the fathers of us, nor we, have been able to bear?
44.15.11.1^but by the grace of the lord jesus, we believe to be saved, in the same manner as they also.
44.15.12.1^kept silent now all the multitude, and were listening to barnabas and paul relating what had done - god, signs and wonders, among the gentiles by them.
44.15.13.1^after now - were silent they, answered james, saying, men, brothers, hear me.
44.15.14.1^simeon has related how first - god visited, to take out of the gentiles a people for the name of him.
44.15.15.1^and with this agree the words of the prophets, as it is written:
44.15.16.1^after these things i will return and will rebuild the tabernacle of david which has fallen, and the ruins of it i will rebuild, and i will set upright it,
44.15.17.1^so that - may seek out the remnant - of men the lord, and all the gentiles, upon whom has been called the name of me upon them, says the lord, doing these things,
44.15.18.1^known from eternity.
44.15.19.1^therefore i judge not to trouble those who, from the gentiles, are turning to - god,
44.15.20.1^but to write to them - to abstain from the pollutions of the idols, and - sexual immorality, and that which is strangled, and from blood.
44.15.21.1^moses for from generations of old, in every city ones proclaiming him has, in the synagogues on every sabbath being read.
44.15.22.1^then it seemed good to the apostles and to the elders, with all the church, having chosen men out from them, to send to antioch with - paul and barnabas:
44.15.22.2^judas - called barsabbas, and silas, men leading among the brothers,
44.15.23.1^having written by the hand of them:
44.15.23.2^the apostles and the elders, brothers, to those in - antioch and syria and cilicia, brothers - among the gentiles:
44.15.23.3^greetings.
44.15.24.1^inasmuch as we have heard that some from us went out troubled you by words, upsetting the minds of you, to whom not we had given instructions,
44.15.25.1^it seemed good to us having come with one accord, having chosen men, to send to you, with the beloved of us, barnabas and paul,
44.15.26.1^men having handed over the lives of them for the name of the lord of us, jesus christ.
44.15.27.1^we have sent therefore judas and silas, and they by word of mouth are telling you the same things.
44.15.28.1^it seemed good for to the spirit - holy and to us, no further to lay upon you burden, except these - necessary things:
44.15.29.1^to abstain from things sacrificed to idols, and from blood, and from what is strangled, and from sexual immorality.
44.15.29.2^from these keeping yourselves, well you will do.
44.15.29.3^farewell.
44.15.30.1^they indeed therefore, having been sent off, went to antioch, and having gathered the multitude, they delivered the letter.
44.15.31.1^having read it now, they rejoiced at the encouragement.
44.15.32.1^judas both and silas, also themselves prophets being, by talk much exhorted the brothers and strengthened them.
44.15.33.1^having continued then a time, they were sent away in peace from the brothers to those having sent them.
44.15.35.1^paul however and barnabas stayed in antioch, teaching and proclaiming the good news, with also others many, the word of the lord.
44.15.36.1^after now some days, said to barnabas, paul, having turned back indeed let us look after the brothers in city every in which we have announced the word of the lord, how they are.
44.15.37.1^barnabas now purposed to take along also - john - called mark;
44.15.38.1^paul however thought fit, the one having withdrawn from them from pamphylia and not having gone with them to the work, not to take along him.
44.15.39.1^arose therefore a sharp disagreement, so that separated they from one another;
44.15.39.2^- and barnabas, having taken - mark, sailed to cyprus.
44.15.40.1^paul however, having chosen silas, went forth, having been committed to the grace of the lord by the brothers.
44.15.41.1^he was passing through then - syria and - cilicia, strengthening the churches.
44.16.1.1^he came then also to derbe and to lystra.
44.16.1.2^and behold, a disciple certain was there, named timothy, the son of a woman jewish believing, father however a greek,
44.16.2.1^who was well spoken of by the in lystra and iconium brothers.
44.16.3.1^this one wanted - paul with him to go forth, and having taken, he circumcised him on account of the jews - being in the parts those;
44.16.3.2^they knew for all that a greek the father of him was.
44.16.4.1^while then they were passing through the cities, they were delivering to them to keep the decrees - decided on by the apostles and elders who were in jerusalem.
44.16.5.1^the indeed therefore churches were strengthened in the faith, and were increasing - in number every day.
44.16.6.1^having passed through then - phrygia and the galatian region, having been forbidden by the holy spirit to speak the word in - asia,
44.16.7.1^having come then down to - mysia, they were attempting into - bithynia to go;
44.16.7.2^and not did allow them the spirit of jesus;
44.16.8.1^having passed by then - mysia, they came down to troas.
44.16.9.1^and a vision during the night - to paul appeared:
44.16.9.2^a man of macedonia certain was standing and beseeching him and saying, having passed over into macedonia, help us.
44.16.10.1^when now the vision he had seen, immediately we sought to go forth to macedonia, concluding that had called us - god to preach the gospel to them.
44.16.11.1^having sailed then from troas, we made a straight course to samothrace, - and the following day, to nea polis,
44.16.12.1^and from there to philippi, which is the leading district of the of macedonia city, a colony.
44.16.12.2^we were now in this - city staying days some.
44.16.13.1^on the then day of the sabbaths, we went forth outside the city gate, by a river, where was customary a place of prayer to be.
44.16.13.2^and having sat down, we began speaking to the having gathered women.
44.16.14.1^and a certain woman named lydia, a seller of purple of the city of thyatira, worshiping - god, was listening, of whom the lord opened the heart to attend to the things being spoken by - paul.
44.16.15.1^when then she was baptized, and the house of her, she begged, saying, if you have judged me faithful to the lord to be, having entered into the house of me, abide.
44.16.15.2^and she persuaded us.
44.16.16.1^it happened now, going of us to the place of prayer, a girl certain, having a spirit of python, met us, who gain much was bringing the masters of her by fortune-telling.
44.16.17.1^she, having followed - paul and us, was crying out, saying, these - men servants of the god - most high are, who proclaim to you the way of salvation.
44.16.18.1^this then she continued for many days.
44.16.18.2^having been distressed then paul, and having turned to the spirit, he said, i command you in the name of jesus christ to come out from her.
44.16.18.3^and it came out the same - hour.
44.16.19.1^having seen now the masters of her that was gone the hope of the profit of them, having taken hold of - paul and - silas, they dragged them into the marketplace before the rulers;
44.16.20.1^and having brought up them to the magistrates, they said, these - men exceedingly trouble of us the city, jews being,
44.16.21.1^and preach customs, that not it is lawful for us to accept nor to practice, romans being.
44.16.22.1^and rose up together the crowd against them, and the magistrates having torn off of them the garments, were commanding that they be beaten with rods.
44.16.23.1^many then having laid on them blows, they cast them into prison, having charged the jailer securely to keep them,
44.16.24.1^who an order such having received, threw them into the inner prison, and the feet fastened of them in the stocks.
44.16.25.1^toward now - midnight, paul and silas, praying, were singing praises to - god.
44.16.25.2^were listening now to them the prisoners.
44.16.26.1^suddenly then earthquake there was a great, so that were shaken the foundations of the prison house;
44.16.26.2^were opened then immediately the doors all, and of all, the chains were loosed.
44.16.27.1^awoken then having been the jailer, and having seen open the doors of the prison, having drawn his sword, he was about himself to kill, supposing to have escaped the prisoners.
44.16.28.1^called out however loud in a voice, - paul saying, not do to yourself harm;
44.16.28.2^all for we are here.
44.16.29.1^having called for now lights, he rushed in, and terrified having become, he fell down before - paul and - silas.
44.16.30.1^and having brought them out he was saying, sirs, what of me is necessary to do, that i may be saved?
44.16.31.1^- and they said, believe on the lord jesus, and you will be saved, you and the household of you.
44.16.32.1^and they spoke to him the word of the lord, along with all those in the house of him.
44.16.33.1^and having taken them in that - hour of the night, he washed them from the wounds;
44.16.33.2^and he was baptized, he and the household of him all immediately.
44.16.34.1^having brought then them into the house, he laid a table for them, and rejoiced with all his household, having believed - in god.
44.16.35.1^day then having come, sent the magistrates the officers, saying, release the men those.
44.16.36.1^reported then the jailer the words these to - paul -:
44.16.36.2^have sent the captains, that you may be let go.
44.16.36.3^now therefore having gone out, depart in peace.
44.16.37.1^- but paul was saying to them, having beaten us publicly, uncondemned men, romans being, they cast us into prison, and now secretly us do they throw out?
44.16.37.2^no indeed!
44.16.37.3^instead, having come themselves, us let them bring out.
44.16.38.1^reported then to the captains the officers the words these.
44.16.38.2^they were afraid then, having heard that romans they are.
44.16.39.1^and having come, they appealed to them, and having brought them out, they were asking them to go out of the city.
44.16.40.1^having gone forth then out of the prison, they came to - lydia;
44.16.40.2^and having seen them, they exhorted the brothers and departed.
44.17.1.1^having passed through then - amphipolis and - apollonia, they came to thessalonica, where was a synagogue of the jews.
44.17.2.1^according to now the custom - with paul, he went in to them, and for sabbaths three he reasoned with them from the scriptures,
44.17.3.1^opening and setting forth that the christ it behooved to have suffered, and to have risen out from the dead, and that this is the christ - jesus, whom i preach to you.
44.17.4.1^and some of them were obedient and joined themselves - to paul and - to silas, - along with worshipping greeks a multitude great, women then of the leading not a few.
44.17.5.1^having become jealous now the jews, and having taken to them of the market-loungers men certain wicked, and having collected a crowd, they set in uproar the city;
44.17.5.2^and having assailed the house of jason, they were seeking them to bring out to the people.
44.17.6.1^not having found however them, they dragged jason and certain brothers before the city authorities, crying out -, the ones the world having upset, these also here are come,
44.17.7.1^whom has received jason.
44.17.7.2^and these all, contrary to the decrees of caesar do, king another proclaiming to be:
44.17.7.3^jesus.
44.17.8.1^they stirred up then the crowd, and the city authorities, hearing these things.
44.17.9.1^and having taken - security from - jason and the rest, they let go them.
44.17.10.1^- and the brothers immediately by night sent away - both paul and - silas to berea, who having arrived, into the synagogue of the jews went.
44.17.11.1^these now were more noble than those in thessalonica, who received the word with all readiness, every day examining the scriptures if were these things so.
44.17.12.1^many indeed therefore of them believed, and of the grecian women - prominent and men not a few.
44.17.13.1^when however knew those from - thessalonica jews that also in - berea was proclaimed by - paul the word - of god, they came there also, stirring up and agitating the crowds.
44.17.14.1^immediately also then, - paul sent away the brothers to go as to the sea;
44.17.14.2^remained but - both silas and - timothy there.
44.17.15.1^those now escorting - paul brought him unto athens;
44.17.15.2^and having received a command unto - silas and - timothy that as quickly as possible they should come to him, they departed.
44.17.16.1^in now - athens, waiting for them - of paul, was provoked the spirit of him in him, seeing utterly idolatrous to be the city.
44.17.17.1^he was reasoning indeed therefore in the synagogue with the jews and those worshiping, and in the marketplace on every day with those meeting him.
44.17.18.1^some then also of the epicureans and stoics, philosophers, encountered him.
44.17.18.2^and some were saying, what - may desire of the babbler this to say?
44.17.18.3^others however, of foreign gods he seems a proclaimer to be, because - jesus and the resurrection he was proclaiming the gospel of.
44.17.19.1^having taken hold also of him, to the ares hill they brought him, saying, are we able to know what is the new this, which by you is spoken, teaching?
44.17.20.1^strange things for some you are bringing to the ears of us.
44.17.20.2^we resolve therefore to know what wish these things to be.
44.17.21.1^the athenians now all, and the visiting strangers, in nothing else spent their time than to tell something and to hear something new.
44.17.22.1^having stood then - paul in the midst of the ares hill, he was saying, men, athenians, in all things as very religious you i behold.
44.17.23.1^passing through for and beholding the objects of worship of you, i found even an altar on which had been inscribed:
44.17.23.2^to an unknown god.
44.17.23.3^whom therefore not knowing you worship, him i proclaim to you.
44.17.24.1^the god - having made the world and all things that are in it, he of heaven and earth being lord, not in hand-made temples dwells,
44.17.25.1^nor by hands of men is he served, as needing anything, himself giving to all life and breath, and the all;
44.17.26.1^he made then of one, every nation of men, to dwell upon all the face of the earth, having determined the appointed times and the boundaries of the habitation of them,
44.17.27.1^to seek - god, if perhaps indeed they might palpate for him, and might find him.
44.17.27.2^and indeed, not far from one each of us he is.
44.17.28.1^in him for we live and move and are.
44.17.28.2^as also some of the among you poets have said, of him for also offspring we are.
44.17.29.1^offspring therefore being - of god, not we ought to consider to gold, or to silver, or to stone, a graven thing, of craft and imagination of man, the divine being to be like.
44.17.30.1^the indeed therefore times - of ignorance having overlooked - god, - now he commands - men all everywhere to repent,
44.17.31.1^because he set a day in which he is about to judge the world in righteousness, by a man whom he appointed, a guarantee having provided to all, having raised him out from the dead.
44.17.32.1^having heard of now a resurrection of the dead, some indeed began to mock him;
44.17.32.2^some however said, we will hear you concerning this also again.
44.17.33.1^thus - paul went out from the midst of them.
44.17.34.1^some however men, having joined themselves to him, believed, among whom also were dionysius the areopagite, and a woman named damaris, and others with them.
44.18.1.1^and after these things, having departed from - athens, he came to corinth.
44.18.2.1^and having found a certain jew named aquila, of pontus - a native, recently having come from - italy, and priscilla wife of him, because of - having commanded claudius to depart all the jews out of - rome, he came to them,
44.18.3.1^and due to of the same trade being, he stayed with them and worked;
44.18.3.2^they were for tentmakers by the trade.
44.18.4.1^he was reasoning now in the synagogue on every sabbath, persuading both jews and greeks.
44.18.5.1^when now came down from - macedonia - both silas and - timothy, was occupied with the word - paul, earnestly testifying to the jews to be the christ jesus.
44.18.6.1^opposing however of them and reviling him, having shaken out the garments, he said to them, the blood of you be upon the head of you;
44.18.6.2^clean i am.
44.18.6.3^from - now on, to the gentiles i will go.
44.18.7.1^and having departed from there he came to the house of a certain one named titius justus, worshiping - god, of whom the house was adjoining the synagogue.
44.18.8.1^crispus now, the ruler of the synagogue, believed in the lord, with all the household of him.
44.18.8.2^and many of the corinthians hearing, believed and were baptized.
44.18.9.1^said now the lord in the night through a vision - to paul, not fear, but continue speaking, and not be silent,
44.18.10.1^because i am with you, and no one will lay a hand on you - to harm you, because people there are to me many in the city this.
44.18.11.1^he remained now a year and months six, teaching among them the word - of god.
44.18.12.1^gallio however proconsul being of achaia, rose up against with one accord the jews - paul, and led him to the judgment seat,
44.18.13.1^saying -, contrary to the law, persuades this man - men to worship - god.
44.18.14.1^being about now - paul to open the mouth, said - gallio to the jews, if indeed it was unrighteousness some or crime wicked, o jews, according to reason - i would have endured with you;
44.18.15.1^if however a question it is about a word, and names, and law - in reference to your, you will see to it yourselves;
44.18.15.2^a judge i of these things not resolve to be.
44.18.16.1^and he drove them from the judgment seat.
44.18.17.1^having seized then all of them sosthenes, the ruler of the synagogue, they began to beat him before the judgment seat.
44.18.17.2^and nothing about these things - to gallio it mattered.
44.18.18.1^- now paul, more having remained days many, the brothers having taken leave of, sailed away to - syria   and with him priscilla and aquila   having shaved in cenchrea the head;
44.18.18.2^he had for a vow.
44.18.19.1^they came now to ephesus, and them left there.
44.18.19.2^he himself then having entered into the synagogue, he reasoned with the jews.
44.18.20.1^asking him now of them for a longer time to remain, not he did consent,
44.18.21.1^but having taken leave and having said, again i will return to you, - god willing, he sailed from - ephesus,
44.18.22.1^and having landed at caesarea, having gone up and having greeted the church, he went down to antioch.
44.18.23.1^and having stayed time some, he went forth, passing through successively the galatian region and phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.
44.18.24.1^a jew now certain, apollos named, of alexandria - a native, a man eloquent, came to ephesus, mighty being in the scriptures.
44.18.25.1^he was instructed in the way of the lord.
44.18.25.2^and being fervent - in spirit, he was speaking and was teaching earnestly the things concerning - jesus, knowing only the baptism of john.
44.18.26.1^he then began to speak boldly in the synagogue.
44.18.26.2^having heard however him priscilla and aquila, they took to them him and more accurately to him expounded the way of god.
44.18.27.1^resolving then he to pass through into - achaia, having encouraged him, the brothers wrote to the disciples to welcome him, who having arrived, helped greatly those having believed through - grace.
44.18.28.1^powerfully for the jews he was refuting publicly, showing by the scriptures to be the christ jesus.
44.19.1.1^it came to pass now, while - - apollos was in corinth, paul having passed through the upper parts to come down to ephesus, and having found certain disciples,
44.19.2.1^he said also to them, if the spirit holy did you receive, having believed?
44.19.2.2^- and they said to him, but not even that a spirit holy there is, did we hear.
44.19.3.1^he said then, into what then were you baptized?
44.19.3.2^- and they said, into - john s baptism.
44.19.4.1^said then paul, john baptized a baptism of repentance, the people telling in the one coming after him that they should believe, that is, in - jesus.
44.19.5.1^having heard then, they were baptized in the name of the lord jesus.
44.19.6.1^and having laid on them - paul the hands, came the spirit - holy upon them;
44.19.6.2^they were speaking then in tongues and prophesying.
44.19.7.1^there were then the in all men about twelve.
44.19.8.1^having entered then into the synagogue, he was speaking boldly for months three, reasoning and persuading - concerning the kingdom - of god.
44.19.9.1^when however some were hardened and were disbelieving, speaking evil of the way before the multitude, having departed from them, he took separately the disciples, every day reasoning in the lecture hall of tyrannus.
44.19.10.1^this then continued for years two, so that all those inhabiting - asia heard the word of the lord, jews both and greeks.
44.19.11.1^miracles then not - being ordinary, - god was performing by the hands of paul,
44.19.12.1^so that even to the ailing were brought from the skin of him handkerchiefs or aprons, and departed from them the diseases, the also spirits - evil left.
44.19.13.1^attempted now some of also of the itinerant jews, exorcists, to invoke over those having - spirits - evil the name of the lord jesus, saying, i adjure you by jesus whom paul proclaims.
44.19.14.1^they were now certain of sceva, a jew, a high priest, seven sons, this were doing.
44.19.15.1^answering however, the spirit - evil said to them -, - jesus i know, and - paul i am acquainted with;
44.19.15.2^you however, who are you?
44.19.16.1^and having leapt the man on them in whom was the spirit - evil, having overpowered them all, he prevailed against them so that naked and wounded they fled out of the house that.
44.19.17.1^this now became known to all jews both and greeks, those inhabiting - ephesus;
44.19.17.2^and fell fear upon all them, and was being magnified the name of the lord jesus.
44.19.18.1^many then of those having believed were coming, confessing and declaring the deeds of them.
44.19.19.1^many now of those the magic arts having practiced, having brought the books, burned them before all.
44.19.19.2^and they counted up the prices of them and found it of silverlings myriads five.
44.19.20.1^thus with might of the lord the word continued to increase and prevail.
44.19.21.1^after now were fulfilled these things, purposed - paul in the spirit, having passed through - macedonia and achaia, to go to jerusalem, having said -, after - having been my there, it behooves me also rome to see.
44.19.22.1^having sent then into - macedonia two of those ministering to him, timothy and erastus, he remained for a time in - asia.
44.19.23.1^arose now at the time same a disturbance not small concerning the way.
44.19.24.1^demetrius for a certain man named, a silversmith, making shrines silver of artemis, was bringing to the craftsmen no little business,
44.19.25.1^whom having brought together, also the in such things workmen, he said, men, you know that from this - business the wealth of us is.
44.19.26.1^and you see and hear that not only in ephesus, but almost all - of asia, - paul, this having persuaded them, has turned away a great many people, saying that not they are gods - by hands being made.
44.19.27.1^not only but this is endangered to us, the business into disrepute to come, but also the of the great goddess artemis temple for nothing to be reckoned, to be and also deposed the majesty of her, whom all - asia and the world worship.
44.19.28.1^having heard then and having become full of rage, they were crying out, saying, great is - artemis of the ephesians.
44.19.29.1^and was filled the city whole with confusion;
44.19.29.2^they rushed and with one accord to the theatre, having dragged off gaius and aristarchus, macedonians, fellow travelers of paul.
44.19.30.1^of paul however intending to go in to the people, not would allow him the disciples.
44.19.31.1^some then also of the asiarchs, being to him friends, having sent to him, were urging him not to venture himself into the theatre.
44.19.32.1^others indeed therefore some thing were crying out;
44.19.32.2^was for the assembly confused, and - most not did know for what cause they were assembled.
44.19.33.1^out of now the crowd to explain himself alexander, having thrust forward him the jews.
44.19.33.2^- and alexander, having motioned with the hand, was wanting to make a defense to the people.
44.19.34.1^having recognized however that a jew he is, a cry there was one from all, about ongoing hours two crying out, great is - artemis of the ephesians.
44.19.35.1^having calmed then the town clerk the crowd, he says, men, ephesians, what for is there man who not knows the of the ephesians city temple-keeper as being of the great artemis, and of that fallen from the sky?
44.19.36.1^undeniable therefore being these things, necessary it is for you calm to be, and nothing rash to do.
44.19.37.1^you brought for the men these, neither temple plunderers nor blaspheming the goddess of us.
44.19.38.1^if indeed therefore demetrius and the with him craftsmen have against anyone a matter, courts are conducted, and proconsuls there are;
44.19.38.2^let them accuse one another.
44.19.39.1^if however anything beyond this you inquire, in the lawful assembly it will be solved.
44.19.40.1^and for we are in danger of being accused of insurrection in regard to - this day, not one cause there existing concerning which not we will be able to give a reason for the commotion this.
44.19.40.2^and these things having said, he dismissed the assembly.
44.20.1.1^after now - had ceased the uproar, having called to him - paul the disciples and having encouraged, having said farewell, he departed to go to macedonia.
44.20.2.1^having passed through then the districts those, and having exhorted them with talk much, he came to - greece.
44.20.3.1^having continued then months three, having been made a plot against him by the jews, he being about to sail into - syria, arose a purpose - to return through macedonia.
44.20.4.1^was accompanied by then he sopater pyrrhus, a berean;
44.20.4.2^of the thessalonians now, aristarchus and secundus;
44.20.4.3^and gaius of derbe and timothy;
44.20.4.4^the asians now, tychicus and trophimus.
44.20.5.1^these also having gone ahead, waited for us in troas.
44.20.6.1^we then sailed away after the days of the unleavened bread, from philippi, and we came to them at - troas within days five, where we stayed days seven.
44.20.7.1^in then the first day of the week, having come together we to break bread, - paul talked to them, about to depart on the next day;
44.20.7.2^he continued then the talk until midnight.
44.20.8.1^there were now lamps many in the upper room where we were assembled.
44.20.9.1^was sitting then a certain young man named eutychus by the window, overpowered by sleep deep as talked - paul on longer;
44.20.9.2^having been overpowered by the sleep, he fell from the third story down, and was picked up dead.
44.20.10.1^having descended however, - paul fell upon him, and having embraced him, said, not be alarmed, the for life of him in him is.
44.20.11.1^having gone up then, and having broken the bread, and having eaten, for long and having talked until daybreak, so he departed.
44.20.12.1^they brought then the boy alive, and were comforted not a little.
44.20.13.1^we however, having gone ahead to the ship, sailed to - assos, there being about to take in - paul.
44.20.13.2^thus for having arranged, he was readying himself to go on foot.
44.20.14.1^when now he met with us at - assos, having taken in him, we came to mitylene.
44.20.15.1^and from there having sailed away, on the following day we arrived opposite chios;
44.20.15.2^- then the next day we arrived at samos;
44.20.15.3^the now following day we came to miletus.
44.20.16.1^had decided for - paul to sail by - ephesus, so that not it might come upon to him to spend time in - asia;
44.20.16.2^he was hastened for, if possible it was for him, on the day - of pentecost to be in jerusalem.
44.20.17.1^from then - miletus, having sent to ephesus, he called for the elders of the church.
44.20.18.1^when then they had come to him, he said to them, you know from the first day on which i arrived in - asia, how with you the whole time i was,
44.20.19.1^serving the lord with all humility, and tears, and trials - having befallen me in the plots of the jews;
44.20.20.1^how nothing i did shrink back of that being profitable, - not to declare to you, and to teach you publicly and from house to house,
44.20.21.1^earnestly testifying to the jewish both and to greeks, - in god repentance and faith in the lord of us, jesus.
44.20.22.1^and now, behold, bound i in the spirit go to jerusalem, what in it will happen to me not knowing,
44.20.23.1^except that the spirit - holy in every city fully testifies to me, saying that chains and tribulations me await.
44.20.24.1^but not any account i make my life dear to myself, so as to finish the course of me, and the ministry that i received from the lord jesus, to testify fully the gospel of the grace - of god.
44.20.25.1^and now, behold, i know that no more you will see the face of me, you all among whom i have gone about proclaiming the kingdom.
44.20.26.1^therefore i testify to you in - this day, that innocent i am of the blood of all;
44.20.27.1^not for i shrunk back - not from declaring all the counsel - of god to you.
44.20.28.1^take heed to yourselves and to all the flock among which you the spirit - holy has set overseers, to shepherd the church - of god, which he purchased with - blood the own.
44.20.29.1^i know that will come in after the departure of me wolves grievous among you, not sparing the flock,
44.20.30.1^and out from your own selves will rise up men speaking perverse things, - to draw away - disciples after them.
44.20.31.1^therefore stay awake, remembering that three years, night and day, not i ceased with tears admonishing one each.
44.20.32.1^and - now i commit you to god and to the word of the grace of him, - being able to build up and to give you an inheritance among those having been sanctified all.
44.20.33.1^silver or gold or clothing of no one i coveted.
44.20.34.1^you yourselves know that the needs of me and to those being with me, ministered to the hands these.
44.20.35.1^in everything i showed you that by thus straining it behooves us to aid those being weak, to remember and also the words of the lord jesus, how he himself said, blessed it is more to give than to receive.
44.20.36.1^and these things having said, having bowed the knee of him, with all them he prayed.
44.20.37.1^much then weeping there was among all;
44.20.37.2^and having fallen upon the neck - of paul, they were kissing him,
44.20.38.1^sorrowing especially over the word that he had spoken, that no more they are about the face of him to see.
44.20.38.2^they accompanied then him to the ship.
44.21.1.1^after then it happened sailing our, having drawn away from them, having run directly we came to - cos, - and the next day to - rhodes, and from there to patara.
44.21.2.1^and having found a boat passing over into phoenicia, having gone on board, we set sail.
44.21.3.1^having sighted then - cyprus and having left it on the left, we kept sailing to syria and landed at tyre.
44.21.3.2^there for the ship was unloading the cargo.
44.21.4.1^having sought out then the disciples, we remained there days seven, who - to paul kept telling through the spirit not to go up to jerusalem.
44.21.5.1^when then it happened that we had completed the days, having set out, we journeyed, accompanying us all with wives and children, as far as outside the city.
44.21.5.2^and having bowed the knees on the shore, having prayed,
44.21.6.1^having said farewell to one another, then we went up into the boat;
44.21.6.2^they then returned to the own.
44.21.7.1^we then, the voyage having completed from tyre, came down to ptolemais, and having greeted the brothers, we stayed day one with them.
44.21.8.1^on the now next day, having gone forth, we came to caesarea;
44.21.8.2^and having entered into the house of philip the evangelist, being of the seven, we stayed with him.
44.21.9.1^with this man now there were daughters four, virgins, prophesying.
44.21.10.1^remaining now days many, came down a certain one from - judea, a prophet named agabus;
44.21.11.1^and having come to us, and having taken the belt - of paul, having bound of himself the feet and the hands, he said, thus says the spirit - holy, the man of whom is the belt this, in this way will bind in jerusalem the jews and will deliver him into the hands of the gentiles.
44.21.12.1^when then we had heard these things, began begging we both and those of that place, - not to go up him to jerusalem.
44.21.13.1^then answered - paul, what are you doing, weeping and breaking my - heart?
44.21.13.2^i for not only to be bound, but also to die at jerusalem, readiness have, for the name of the lord jesus.
44.21.14.1^not being persuaded then of him, we were silent, having said, of the lord the will be done.
44.21.15.1^after now the days these, having packed the baggage, we started on our way up to jerusalem.
44.21.16.1^went then also some of the disciples from caesarea with us, bringing one with whom we would lodge, mnason, a certain cypriot, an early disciple.
44.21.17.1^having arrived now we at jerusalem, gladly received us the brothers.
44.21.18.1^on the now following day, went in - paul with us unto james, all and arrived the elders.
44.21.19.1^and having greeted them, he began to relate, by one each, the things had done - god among the gentiles through the ministry of him.
44.21.20.1^those then having heard began glorifying - god.
44.21.20.2^they said then to him, you see, brother, how many myriads there are among the jews - having believed, and all zealous ones for the law are.
44.21.21.1^they have been informed now about you, that apostasy you teach, from moses, those among the gentiles all jews, telling not to circumcise them the children, nor in the customs to walk.
44.21.22.1^what then is it?
44.21.22.2^certainly they will hear that you have come.
44.21.23.1^this therefore do you what to you we say.
44.21.23.2^there are with us men four, a vow having on themselves.
44.21.24.1^these men having taken, be purified with them and bear expense for them, so that they will shave the head, and will know all that of which they have been informed about you nothing is, but you walk orderly also yourself, keeping the law.
44.21.25.1^concerning now those having believed of the gentiles, we wrote, having adjudged to keep from them, the things both sacrificed to idols, and blood, and what is strangled, and sexual immorality.
44.21.26.1^then - paul, having taken the men, on the following day, with them having been purified, entered into the temple, declaring the fulfillment of the days of the purification until that was offered for one each of them the sacrifice.
44.21.27.1^when now were about the seven days to be completed, the from - asia jews, having seen him in the temple, began stirring up all the crowd and laid upon him the hands,
44.21.28.1^crying out, men, israelites, help!
44.21.28.2^this is the man who against the people and the law and the place this all those everywhere teaching;
44.21.28.3^besides and also greeks he has brought into the temple and defiled the holy place this.
44.21.29.1^it was they for having previously seen trophimus the ephesian in the city with him, whom they were supposing that into the temple had brought - paul.
44.21.30.1^was thrown into commotion also the city whole, and there was a rushing together of the people.
44.21.30.2^and having laid hold - of paul, they dragged him outside the temple, and immediately were shut the doors.
44.21.31.1^of them seeking then him to kill, there came a report to the commander of the cohort that all was in an uproar jerusalem,
44.21.32.1^who at once, having taken with him soldiers and centurions, ran down upon them.
44.21.32.2^- and having seen the commander and the soldiers, they stopped beating - paul.
44.21.33.1^then having drawn near, the commander laid hold of him and commanded him to be bound with chains two, and began inquiring who he might be and what it is he has been doing.
44.21.34.1^others however, another or one thing were crying out in the crowd.
44.21.34.2^not being able now he to know the facts on account of the uproar, he ordered to be brought him into the barracks.
44.21.35.1^when now he came to the stairs, it happened that was carried he by the soldiers, because of the violence of the crowd.
44.21.36.1^were following for the multitude of the people, crying out, away with him.
44.21.37.1^being about then to be brought into the barracks, - paul says to the commander, if is it permitted to me to say something to you?
44.21.37.2^- then he was saying, greek do you know?
44.21.38.1^not then you are the egyptian - before these the days having led a revolt and having led out into the wilderness the four thousand men of the assassins?
44.21.39.1^said however - paul, i a man indeed am a jew of tarsus, - of cilicia, not of an insignificant city a citizen.
44.21.39.2^i implore now you, allow me to speak to the people.
44.21.40.1^having allowed him then he, - paul, having stood on the stairs, made a sign with the hand to the people;
44.21.40.2^great then silence having taken place, he spoke to them in the hebrew language, saying:
44.22.1.1^men, brothers, and fathers, hear of me the to you now defense.
44.22.2.1^having heard then that in the hebrew language he was addressing them, even more they became quiet.
44.22.2.2^and he says,
44.22.3.1^i am a man, a jew, born in tarsus - of cilicia, brought up now in the city this at the feet of gamaliel, having been instructed according to the exactness of the of our fathers law, a zealous one being - for god, even as all you are this day;
44.22.4.1^who this - way persecuted as far as death, binding and betraying to prisons men both and women,
44.22.5.1^as also the high priest bears witness to me, and all the elderhood;
44.22.5.2^from whom also letters, having received to the brothers, to damascus i was on my way to bring also those there being, bound to jerusalem, in order that they might be punished.
44.22.6.1^it happened however to me journeying and drawing near - to damascus, about noon, suddenly out of - heaven shone a light great around me.
44.22.7.1^i fell then to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, saul, saul, why me persecute you?
44.22.8.1^i then answered, who are you, lord?
44.22.8.2^he said then to me, i am jesus of nazareth, whom you are persecuting.
44.22.9.1^those then with me being, the indeed light beheld;
44.22.9.2^the however voice not did they hear of the one speaking to me.
44.22.10.1^i said then, what shall i do, lord?
44.22.10.2^- and the lord said to me, having risen up go to damascus, and there you it will be told concerning all things that it has been appointed you to do.
44.22.11.1^while now, not i could see from the brightness of the light that, being led by the hand by those being with me, i came to damascus.
44.22.12.1^ananias then certain, a man devout according to the law, borne witness to by all the dwelling there jews,
44.22.13.1^having come to me and having stood by me, said to me, saul brother, receive your sight.
44.22.13.2^and i the same - hour looked up at him.
44.22.14.1^- and he said, the god of the fathers of us has appointed you to know the will of him, and to see the righteous one, and to hear the voice out of the mouth of him.
44.22.15.1^for you will be a witness for him to all men of what you have seen and heard.
44.22.16.1^and now why delay you?
44.22.16.2^having arisen, be baptized and wash away the sins of you, calling on the name of him.
44.22.17.1^it happened then to me, having returned to jerusalem, and praying of my in the temple, fell i into a trance
44.22.18.1^and saw him saying to me, make haste and go away with speed out of jerusalem, because not they will receive your testimony about me.
44.22.19.1^and i said, lord, they themselves know that i was imprisoning and beating in each of those synagogues those believing on you.
44.22.20.1^and when was poured out the blood of stephen, the witness of you, also i myself was standing by, and consenting, and watching over the garments of those killing him.
44.22.21.1^and he said to me, go, for i to the gentiles far away will send you.
44.22.22.1^they were listening now to him until this - word, and they lifted up the voice of them, saying, away with from the earth, the such.
44.22.22.2^not for it is fit he to live!
44.22.23.1^were crying out then they, and casting off the garments, and dust throwing into the air.
44.22.24.1^ordered the commander to be brought him into the barracks, having directed by flogging to be examined him, so that he might know for what cause like this they were crying out against him.
44.22.25.1^as however he stretched forward him with the straps, said to the standing by centurion - paul, if a man, a roman and uncondemned, it is lawful to you to flog?
44.22.26.1^having heard then the centurion, having gone to the commander, he reported it, saying, what are you going to do?
44.22.26.2^the for man this a roman is.
44.22.27.1^having come near then, the commander said to him, tell me, you a roman are?
44.22.27.2^- and he was saying, yes.
44.22.28.1^answered then the commander, i with a great sum the citizenship this bought.
44.22.28.2^- but paul was saying, i however even was born so.
44.22.29.1^immediately therefore departed from him those being about him to examine, and the commander also was afraid, having ascertained that a roman he is, and because him he had bound.
44.22.30.1^on the now next day, desiring to know - for certain - why he is accused by the jews, he unbound him and commanded to assemble the chief priests and all the council.
44.22.30.2^and having brought down - paul, he set him among them.
44.23.1.1^having looked intently then - paul at the council, he said, men, brothers, i in all conscience good have lived as a citizen - to god unto this - day.
44.23.2.1^- then the high priest ananias commanded those standing by him to strike of him the mouth.
44.23.3.1^then - paul to him said, to strike you is about - god, wall whitewashed!
44.23.3.2^and you, do you sit judging me according to the law, and violating law, command me to be struck?
44.23.4.1^those who now stood by said, the high priest - of god do you insult?
44.23.5.1^was saying then - paul, not i was aware, brothers, that he is high priest;
44.23.5.2^it has been written for -:
44.23.5.3^the ruler of the people of you, not you shall speak evil of.
44.23.6.1^having known then - paul that the one part consists of sadducees, - but the other of pharisees, he began crying out in the council, men, brothers, i a pharisee am, the son of a pharisee;
44.23.6.2^concerning the hope and resurrection of the dead i am judged.
44.23.7.1^this then of him saying, arose a dissension between the pharisees and sadducees, and was divided the crowd.
44.23.8.1^sadducees indeed for say not there to be resurrection, nor angel, nor spirit;
44.23.8.2^pharisees however confess - both.
44.23.9.1^arose then a clamor great, and having risen up some of the scribes of the party of the pharisees, they were contending, saying, nothing evil we find in the man this.
44.23.9.2^what if now a spirit has spoken to him, or an angel?
44.23.10.1^great then arising dissension, having feared the commander, lest should be torn to pieces - paul by them, he commanded the troop, having gone down, to take by force him from midst of them, to bring him then into the barracks.
44.23.11.1^- but the following night, having stood by him, the lord said, take courage, as for you have fully testified - about me at jerusalem, so you it behooves also in rome to testify.
44.23.12.1^when it was then day, having made a conspiracy, the jews put under an oath themselves, declaring neither to eat nor to drink until that they should kill - paul.
44.23.13.1^there were now more than forty, - this - plot having made,
44.23.14.1^who, having come to the chief priests and the elders, said, with an oath we have bound ourselves, nothing to eat until that we should kill - paul.
44.23.15.1^now therefore you, make a report to the commander along with the council, so that he might bring down him to you, as being about to examine more earnestly the things about him;
44.23.15.2^we then, before - drawing near his, ready are - to kill him.
