44.23.16.1^having heard however the son of the sister of paul of the ambush, having come near and having entered into the barracks, he reported it - to paul.
44.23.17.1^having called to him then - paul one of the centurions, he was saying, the young man this take to the commander;
44.23.17.2^he has for to report something to him.
44.23.18.1^the one indeed therefore having taken him brought him to the commander, and he says, the prisoner paul, having called to me, asked me this - young man to lead to you, having something to say to you.
44.23.19.1^having taken hold then the hand of him the commander, and having withdrawn in private, he began to inquire, what is it that you have to report to me?
44.23.20.1^he said then -, the jews have agreed - to ask you that tomorrow - paul you might bring down into the council, as being about something more earnestly to inquire about him.
44.23.21.1^you therefore not should be persuaded by them.
44.23.21.2^lie in wait indeed for him of them men more than forty, who have put under an oath themselves neither to eat nor to drink until that they have killed him;
44.23.21.3^and now they are ready, awaiting the from you promise.
44.23.22.1^- indeed therefore the commander dismissed the young man, having instructed him, no one tell that these things you have reported to me.
44.23.23.1^and having called to him two certain of the centurions, he said, prepare soldiers two hundred, so that they might go as far as caesarea, and horsemen seventy, and spearmen two hundred, for the third hour of the night.
44.23.24.1^mounts then provide, so that having set upon them - paul, they might bring him safely to felix the governor,
44.23.25.1^having written a letter, having the form this:
44.23.26.1^claudius lysias, to the most excellent governor, felix:
44.23.26.2^greetings.
44.23.27.1^the man this, having been seized by the jews, and being about to be killed by them, having come up with the troop, i rescued him, having learned that a roman he is.
44.23.28.1^resolving then to know the charge on account of which they were accusing him, i brought him down to the council of them,
44.23.29.1^whom i found being accused concerning questions of the law of them, no however worthy of death or of chains having accusation.
44.23.30.1^it having been disclosed then to me of a plot that against the man would be, at once i sent him to you, having instructed also the accusers to speak these things against him before you.
44.23.31.1^- indeed therefore the soldiers, according to that having been ordered them, having taken - paul, brought him by night to - antipatris.
44.23.32.1^on the now next day, having allowed the horsemen to go with him, they returned to the barracks,
44.23.33.1^who having entered into - caesarea and having delivered the letter to the governor, presented also - paul to him.
44.23.34.1^having read it then, and having asked from what province he is, and having learned that from cilicia he is,
44.23.35.1^i will hear fully you, he was saying, when also the accusers of you may have arrived, having commanded in the praetorium - of herod to be guarded him.
44.24.1.1^after then five days, came down the high priest ananias, with elders some and an orator tertullus certain, who made a representation to the governor against - paul.
44.24.2.1^having been called then of him, began to accuse - tertullus, saying, great peace we are attaining through you, and excellent measures are being done to the nation this through - your foresight,
44.24.3.1^in every way both and everywhere, we gladly accept it, most excellent felix, with all thankfulness.
44.24.4.1^in order that however not to any longer you i should be a hindrance, i implore to hear you us briefly, in your kindness.
44.24.5.1^having found for the man this a pest, and stirring insurrection among all the jews - in the world, a leader then of the of the nazarenes sect,
44.24.6.1^who even the temple attempted to profane, whom also we seized.
44.24.8.1^from him you will be able yourself, having examined him concerning all these things, to know of which we accuse him.
44.24.9.1^agreed then also the jews, declaring these things so to be.
44.24.10.1^answered then - paul, having made a sign to him the governor to speak:
44.24.10.2^for many years, as being you judge to nation, this knowing, cheerfully to the things concerning myself i make a defense.
44.24.11.1^being able you to know that not more than there are to me days twelve, from which i went up to worship in jerusalem.
44.24.12.1^and neither in the temple did they find me with anyone reasoning, or a tumultuous gathering making of a crowd, nor in the synagogues, nor in the city.
44.24.13.1^nor to prove are they able to you, concerning the things of which now they accuse me.
44.24.14.1^i confess however this to you, that according to the way which they call a sect, so i serve the of our fathers god, believing all things - throughout the law, and that in the prophets have been written,
44.24.15.1^a hope having in - god which also they themselves await, that a resurrection there is about to be of the just both and of the unjust.
44.24.16.1^in this also i myself strive, without offense a conscience to have toward - god and - men, through everything.
44.24.17.1^after years now many, alms to bring to the nation of me, i arrived, and offerings,
44.24.18.1^during which they found me purified in the temple, not with a crowd, nor in tumult.
44.24.19.1^some however are from - asia, jews who ought before you to appear and to make accusation, if anything they may have against me.
44.24.20.1^otherwise themselves it let them say any they found unrighteousness, having stood in me before the council,
44.24.21.1^other than concerning one this voice which i cried out among them standing -:
44.24.21.2^concerning the resurrection of the dead i am judged this day by you.
44.24.22.1^put off however them - felix, more precisely having knowledge of the things concerning the way, having said, when lysias the commander might have come down, i will examine the things as to you,
44.24.23.1^having commanded the centurion to keep him, to let him have then ease, and not to forbid the own of him to minister to him.
44.24.24.1^after then days some, having arrived - felix with drusilla, the own wife, being a jewess, he sent for - paul and heard him concerning the in christ jesus faith.
44.24.25.1^reasoning then he concerning righteousness and self-control and the judgment - coming, frightened having become, - felix answered, for the present being go away;
44.24.25.2^opportunity then having found, i will call for you.
44.24.26.1^at the same time also, he is hoping that riches will be given him by - paul.
44.24.26.2^therefore also often him sending for, he was talking with him.
44.24.27.1^two years however having been completed, received as successor - felix, porcius festus;
44.24.27.2^wishing then favor to acquire for himself with the jews, - felix left - paul imprisoned.
44.25.1.1^festus therefore having arrived in the province, after three days he went up to jerusalem from caesarea.
44.25.2.1^made a presentation before then him the chief priests and the chiefs of the jews, against - paul, and they were begging him,
44.25.3.1^asking a favor against him, that he would summon him to jerusalem, an ambush forming to kill him on the way.
44.25.4.1^- indeed therefore festus answered that is to be kept - paul in caesarea;
44.25.4.2^he himself now is about in quickness to set out.
44.25.5.1^those therefore among you, he says, those in power, having gone down too, if anything there is in the man wrong, let them accuse him.
44.25.6.1^having spent then with them days not more than eight or ten, having gone down to caesarea, on the next day having sat on the judgment seat, he commanded - paul to be brought.
44.25.7.1^having arrived then he, stood around him the from jerusalem having come down jews, many and weighty charges bringing, which not they were able to prove.
44.25.8.1^- paul made his defense -:
44.25.8.2^neither against the law of the jews, nor against the temple, nor against caesar, in anything have i sinned.
44.25.9.1^- festus however, wishing on the jews a favor to lay, answering - paul, said, are you willing to jerusalem having gone up, there concerning these things to be judged before me?
44.25.10.1^said then - paul, before the judgment seat of caesar standing i am, where me it behooves to be judged.
44.25.10.2^to the jews nothing i have done wrong, as also you very well know.
44.25.11.1^if indeed therefore i do wrong, and worthy of death have done anything, not i do refuse - to die.
44.25.11.2^if however nothing there is of which they can accuse me, no one me can to them give up.
44.25.11.3^to caesar i appeal!
44.25.12.1^then - festus, having conferred with the council, answered, to caesar you have appealed;
44.25.12.2^to caesar you will go!
44.25.13.1^days now having passed some, agrippa the king and bernice came down to caesarea, greeting - festus.
44.25.14.1^as now many days they stayed there, - festus, the king laid before, the things relating to - paul, saying, a man certain there is left by felix as a prisoner,
44.25.15.1^concerning whom, having been my in jerusalem, made a presentation the chief priests and the elders of the jews, asking against him judgment,
44.25.16.1^to whom i answered that not it is the custom with romans to give up any man before that the one being accused to face may have it the accusers the opportunity, and of defense he may have concerning the accusation.
44.25.17.1^having come together therefore of them here, delay no having made, the next day having sat on the judgment seat, i commanded to be brought the man,
44.25.18.1^concerning whom, having stood up, the accusers no charge were bringing of which i was expecting crimes.
44.25.19.1^questions however certain concerning the own religion they had against him, and concerning a certain jesus having been dead, whom was affirming - paul to be alive.
44.25.20.1^being perplexed now, i - concerning this inquiry was asking if he was willing to go to jerusalem and there to be judged concerning these things.
44.25.21.1^- but of paul having appealed for to be kept himself for the - emperor s decision, i commanded to be kept him until that i might send him to caesar.
44.25.22.1^agrippa then said to - festus, i have been wanting also myself the man to hear.
44.25.22.2^tomorrow, he says, you will hear him.
44.25.23.1^on the therefore next day, having come - agrippa and - bernice with great pomp, and having entered into the audience hall, with both the commanders and men - in prominence in the city, and having commanded - festus, was brought in - paul.
44.25.24.1^and says - festus, agrippa king, and all the being present with us men, you see this one, concerning whom all the multitude of the jews pleaded with me, in both jerusalem and here, crying out that not he ought of him to live no longer.
44.25.25.1^i however, having understood nothing worthy him of death to have done, himself and of this one having appealed to the emperor, i determined to send him,
44.25.26.1^concerning whom, definite anything to write to my lord, not i have.
44.25.26.2^therefore i have brought him before you all, and especially before you, king agrippa, so that the examination having taken place, i might have something to write.
44.25.27.1^absurd for to me it seems in sending a prisoner, not also the against him charges to specify.
44.26.1.1^agrippa then to - paul was saying, it is permitted you for yourself to speak.
44.26.1.2^then - paul, having stretched out the hand, began his defense:
44.26.2.1^concerning all of which i am accused by the jews, king agrippa, i esteem myself fortunate before you, being about today to defend myself.
44.26.3.1^especially acquainted being you with all the of the jews customs, and also controversies;
44.26.3.2^therefore i implore you patiently to hear me.
44.26.4.1^the indeed then manner of life of me, which is from youth, - from its beginning having been among the nation of me, in also jerusalem, know all the jews,
44.26.5.1^knowing me from the first, if they would be willing to testify, that according to the strictest sect - of our religion i lived as a pharisee.
44.26.6.1^and now for the hope of the to the fathers of us promise having been made by - god, i stand being judged,
44.26.7.1^to which the twelve tribes of us in earnestness, night and day, serving, hope to attain;
44.26.7.2^concerning which hope i am accused by the jews, o king.
44.26.8.1^why incredible is it judged by you if - god the dead raises?
44.26.9.1^i indeed therefore thought in myself to the name of jesus - of nazareth, i ought many things contrary to do,
44.26.10.1^which also i did in jerusalem;
44.26.10.2^and many also of the saints i in prisons locked up, the from the chief priests authority having received;
44.26.10.3^being put to death then they, i cast against them a vote.
44.26.11.1^and in all the synagogues, often punishing them, i was compelling them to blaspheme.
44.26.11.2^exceedingly then being furious against them, i kept persecuting them as far as even to - foreign cities,
44.26.12.1^during which, journeying to - damascus with the authority and commission of the chief priests,
44.26.13.1^day mid on the road i saw, o king, from heaven above, the brightness of the sun, having shone around me, a light;
44.26.13.2^and those with me journeying.
44.26.14.1^all and having fallen down of us to the ground, i heard a voice saying to me in the hebrew language, saul, saul, why me persecute you?
44.26.14.2^it is hard for you against the goads to kick.
44.26.15.1^i then said, who are you, lord?
44.26.15.2^- and the lord said, i am jesus, whom you are persecuting.
44.26.16.1^but rise up and stand on the feet of you;
44.26.16.2^for this purpose for i have appeared to you, to appoint you a servant and a witness of that which both you have seen of me, of the things in which then i will appear to you,
44.26.17.1^delivering you out from the people and from the gentiles, to whom i am sending you,
44.26.18.1^to open eyes of them, that they may turn from darkness to light, and from the power - of satan to - god, that may receive they forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those having been sanctified by faith that is in me.
44.26.19.1^so then, o king agrippa, not i was disobedient to the heavenly vision,
44.26.20.1^but to those in damascus first, both and jerusalem all, and the region - of judea, and to the gentiles, i kept declaring to repent and to turn to - god, worthy - of repentance works doing.
44.26.21.1^on account of these things, me the jews having seized being in the temple, they were attempting to kill.
44.26.22.1^help therefore having obtained - from - god unto the day this, i have stood, bearing witness to small both and to great, nothing other saying than what both the prophets said was about to happen, and moses,
44.26.23.1^that would suffer the christ;
44.26.23.2^as first through resurrection from the dead, light he is about to preach to both our people and to the gentiles.
44.26.24.1^these things now of him saying in his defense, - festus in a loud - voice said, you are insane, paul!
44.26.24.2^the great of you learning, to insanity turns you!
44.26.25.1^- but paul, not i am insane, says, most excellent festus, but of truth and sobriety words i utter.
44.26.26.1^understands for concerning these things the king, to whom also using boldness i speak.
44.26.26.2^are hidden from for him any of these things not.
44.26.26.3^i am persuaded none not for is in a corner done, of these things.
44.26.27.1^believe you, king agrippa, the prophets?
44.26.27.2^i know that you believe.
44.26.28.1^- then agrippa said to - paul, within so little me do you persuade a christian to become?
44.26.29.1^- and paul said, i would wish - - to god, both in a little and in much, not only you but also all those hearing me this day, to become such as also i am, except the chains these.
44.26.30.1^rose up then the king and the governor - and bernice and those sitting with them,
44.26.31.1^and having withdrawn, they began speaking to one another saying -, nothing of death or of chains worthy any is doing the man this.
44.26.32.1^agrippa then to festus was saying, have been released could the man this, if not he had appealed to caesar.
44.27.1.1^when now was determined - sailing our to - italy, they delivered - both paul and certain other prisoners to a centurion, named julius of the cohort of augustus.
44.27.2.1^having boarded then a ship of adramyttium being about to sail to the along - asia places, we set sail   being with us aristarchus, a macedonian of thessalonica.
44.27.3.1^the then next day, we landed at sidon.
44.27.3.2^considerately then - julius, - paul having treated, allowed him to his friends having gone, care to receive.
44.27.4.1^and from there having set sail, we sailed under - cyprus, because of - the winds being contrary.
44.27.5.1^- and then - along - cilicia and pamphylia, having sailed across the sea, we came to myra - of lycia.
44.27.6.1^and there, having found the centurion a ship of alexandria sailing to - italy, he placed us into it.
44.27.7.1^for many now days, sailing slowly and with difficulty, having arrived off - cnidus, not permitting us the wind, we sailed under - crete, off salmone.
44.27.8.1^with difficulty and coasting along it, we came to a place certain called fair havens, to which near the city was of lasea.
44.27.9.1^much now time having passed, and being already dangerous the voyage, because of - even the fast already being over, was admonishing them - paul,
44.27.10.1^saying to them, men, i understand that with disaster and much loss, not only of the cargo and of the ship, but also the lives of us, is about to be the voyage.
44.27.11.1^- but the centurion by the pilot and the ship owner rather was persuaded, than by the things by paul spoken.
44.27.12.1^unsuitable now the harbor being to winter in, the majority reached a decision to set sail from there, if somehow they might be able, having arrived at phoenix, to winter there   a harbor - of crete, looking toward the southwest and toward the northwest.
44.27.13.1^having blown gently now a south wind, having thought the purpose to have obtained, having weighed anchor, very near they began coasting along - crete.
44.27.14.1^after not long however, there came down from it a wind tempestuous, - called the northeaster.
44.27.15.1^having been caught then the ship, and not being able to face to the wind, having given way we were driven along.
44.27.16.1^an island then certain having run under, called cauda, we were able with difficulty control to gain of the lifeboat,
44.27.17.1^which having taken up, supports they began using, undergirding the ship.
44.27.17.2^fearing then lest into the sandbars of syrtis they should fall, having lowered the gear, thus they were driven along.
44.27.18.1^violently now being storm-tossed of us, on the next day a jettison of cargo they began to make,
44.27.19.1^and on the third day, with their own hands the tackle of the ship they cast away.
44.27.20.1^neither now sun nor stars appearing for many days, tempest and no small lying on us, from then on was abandoned hope all - being saved of us.
44.27.21.1^much also time without food there being, at that time having stood up - paul in midst of them, he said, it behooved you indeed, o men, having been obedient to me, not to have set sail from - crete, to have incurred then the disaster this and - loss.
44.27.22.1^and yet - now i exhort you to keep up your courage;
44.27.22.2^loss for of life none there will be from among you, only of the ship.
44.27.23.1^stood by for me this - night -, of god, whose am i whom and i serve, an angel,
44.27.24.1^saying, not fear, paul;
44.27.24.2^caesar you it behooves to stand before.
44.27.24.3^and behold, has granted to you - god all those sailing with you.
44.27.25.1^therefore take courage, men;
44.27.25.2^i believe for - god that thus it will be, according to the way it has been said to me.
44.27.26.1^upon an island however certain it behooves us to fall.
44.27.27.1^when then the fourteenth night had come, being driven about of us in the adriatic, toward the middle of the night, began sensing the sailors to be drawing near some to them land.
44.27.28.1^and having taken soundings, they found fathoms twenty.
44.27.28.2^a little then having gone farther and again having taken soundings, they found fathoms fifteen.
44.27.29.1^fearing then lest somewhere on rocky places we might fall, out of the stern having cast anchors four, they were praying for day to come.
44.27.30.1^of the then sailors seeking to flee out of the ship and having let down the lifeboat into the sea under pretense as from the bow anchors being about to cast out,
44.27.31.1^said - paul to the centurion and to the soldiers, if not these remain in the ship, you to be saved not are able.
44.27.32.1^then cut away the soldiers the ropes of the lifeboat, and allowed her to fall away.
44.27.33.1^until then that day was about to come, kept urging - paul all to partake of food, saying, the fourteenth today is day watching without eating you continue, nothing having taken.
44.27.34.1^therefore i exhort you to take food;
44.27.34.2^this indeed for - of you preservation is;
44.27.34.3^not one for of you a hair of the head will perish.
44.27.35.1^having said now these things and having taken bread, he gave thanks - to god before all, and having broken it, he began to eat.
44.27.36.1^encouraged then having been, all also themselves took food.
44.27.37.1^we were then the altogether souls in the ship, two hundred seventy six.
44.27.38.1^having been filled then with food, they began to lighten the ship, casting out the wheat into the sea.
44.27.39.1^when now day it was, the land not they did recognize;
44.27.39.2^a bay however certain they noticed, having a shore, on which they determined, if they should be able, to drive the ship.
44.27.40.1^and the anchors having cut away, they left them in the sea, at the same time having loosened the ropes of the rudders.
44.27.40.2^and having hoisted the foresail to the blowing wind, they began making for the shore.
44.27.41.1^having fallen however into a place between two seas, they ran aground the vessel;
44.27.41.2^and the indeed bow having stuck fast, it remained immovable, - and the stern was being broken up by the violence of the waves.
44.27.42.1^of the now soldiers, the plan was that the prisoners they should kill, lest anyone, having swum away, should escape.
44.27.43.1^- but the centurion, desiring to save - paul, hindered them of the purpose;
44.27.43.2^he commanded then those being able to swim, having cast themselves off first, on the land to go out,
44.27.44.1^and the rest, some indeed on boards, some then on things - from the ship.
44.27.44.2^and thus it came to pass that all were brought safely to the land.
44.28.1.1^and having been saved, then we found out that malta the island is called.
44.28.2.1^- and the natives were showing not just the ordinary kindness to us.
44.28.2.2^having kindled for a fire, they received all of us because of the rain - coming on and because of the cold.
44.28.3.1^having gathered now - paul of sticks a quantity, and having laid them on the fire, a viper out from the heat having come, fastened on the hand of him.
44.28.4.1^when then saw the natives hanging the beast from the hand of him, to one another they began to say, by all means a murderer is the man this, whom having been saved from the sea, - justice to live not has permitted.
44.28.5.1^the one indeed then, having shaken off the creature into the fire, he suffered no injury.
44.28.6.1^- but they were expecting him to be about to become inflamed, or to fall down suddenly dead.
44.28.6.2^a while great however of them waiting and seeing nothing amiss to him happening, having changed their opinion, they began declaring him to be a god.
44.28.7.1^in now the parts around the place that were lands belonging to the chief of the island, named publius, who having received us three, days hospitably entertained us.
44.28.8.1^it came to pass then, the father - of publius, fevers and dysentery oppressed with, was lying, toward whom - paul, having entered and having prayed, having laid the hands on him, healed him.
44.28.9.1^of this then having taken place, also the rest - in the island having infirmities were coming and were healed,
44.28.10.1^who also with many honors honored us, and on setting sail, they laid on us the things for the needs.
44.28.11.1^after then three months, we sailed in a ship having wintered in the island, alexandrian, with a figurehead of the dioscuri.
44.28.12.1^and having put in at syracuse, we stayed days three,
44.28.13.1^from where having gone around, we arrived at rhegium.
44.28.13.2^and after one day, having come on a south wind, on the second day we came to puteoli,
44.28.14.1^where having found some brothers, we were entreated with them to remain days seven.
44.28.14.2^and so to - rome we came.
44.28.15.1^and from there the brothers, having heard the things concerning us, came out to meet us as far as of appius the market and the three taverns, whom having seen - paul, having given thanks to god, took courage.
44.28.16.1^when now we came to rome, was allowed - paul to stay by himself, with the guarding him soldier.
44.28.17.1^it came to pass then, after days three called together he those being of the jews leaders.
44.28.17.2^having come together then of them, he was saying to them, i, men, brothers, nothing against having done the people or the customs - of our fathers, a prisoner from jerusalem was delivered into the hands of the romans,
44.28.18.1^who having examined me, were wanting to let me go, on account of - not one cause of death existing in me.
44.28.19.1^objecting however of the jews, i was compelled to appeal to caesar, not as the nation of me having anything to lay against.
44.28.20.1^for this therefore - cause i have called you, to see and to speak to you;
44.28.20.2^because of for the hope - of israel, the chain this i have around me.
44.28.21.1^- and to him they said, we neither letters concerning you received from - judea, nor having arrived any of the brothers reported or said anything concerning you evil.
44.28.22.1^we deem it worthy however from you to hear what you think, concerning truly for the sect this, known to us it is that everywhere it is spoken against.
44.28.23.1^having appointed then him a day, came to him to the lodging many, to whom he expounded, fully testifying to the kingdom - of god, persuading then them concerning - jesus from both the law of moses and the prophets, from morning to evening.
44.28.24.1^and some indeed were persuaded of the things he is speaking;
44.28.24.2^some however refused to believe.
44.28.25.1^discordant then being with one another, they began to leave, having spoken - paul word one -:
44.28.25.2^rightly the spirit - holy spoke by isaiah the prophet to the fathers of you,
44.28.26.1^saying:
44.28.26.2^go to the people this and say, in hearing you will hear and no not understand;
44.28.26.3^and in seeing you will see and no not perceive.
44.28.27.1^has grown dull for the heart of the people this, and with the ears barely they hear, and the eyes of them they have closed, lest ever they should see with the eyes, and with the ears they should hear, and with the heart they should understand, and should turn, and i will heal them.
44.28.28.1^known therefore be it to you that to the gentiles has been sent this - salvation - of god;
44.28.28.2^they then will listen!
44.28.30.1^he stayed then two years whole in his own rented house, and was welcoming all - coming unto him,
44.28.31.1^proclaiming the kingdom - of god and teaching the things concerning the lord jesus christ with all boldness unhinderedly.
45.1.1.1^paul, a servant of christ jesus, a called apostle having been set apart for the gospel of god,
45.1.2.1^which he promised beforehand through the prophets of him in the scriptures holy,
45.1.3.1^concerning the son of him, - having come of the seed of david according to flesh,
45.1.4.1^- having been declared son of god in power according to the spirit of holiness by resurrection from the dead, jesus christ, the lord of us;
45.1.5.1^through whom we have received grace and apostleship unto obedience of faith among all the gentiles on behalf of the name of him,
45.1.6.1^among whom are also you called of jesus christ.
45.1.7.1^to all those being in rome, beloved of god, called saints:
45.1.7.2^grace to you and peace from god the father of us and the lord jesus christ.
45.1.8.1^first indeed, i thank the god of me through jesus christ for all of you, because the faith of you is being proclaimed in all the world.
45.1.9.1^witness for my is - god, whom i serve in the spirit of me in the gospel of the son of him, how unceasingly mention of you i make,
45.1.10.1^always upon the prayers of me imploring, if perhaps now at last i will make a prosperous journey by the will - of god, to come to you.
45.1.11.1^i long for to see you, that some i may impart gift to you spiritual, to the strengthening of you,
45.1.12.1^that now is, to be encouraged together among you, through the among one another faith of you both and of me.
45.1.13.1^not i do want now you to be ignorant, brothers, that many times i purposed to come to you, and was hindered, until the present, that some fruit i might have also among you, as even among the other gentiles.
45.1.14.1^to greeks both and to barbarians, to the wise both and the foolish, a debtor i am.
45.1.15.1^thus - as to me there is readiness also to you who are in rome, to preach the gospel.
45.1.16.1^not for i am ashamed of the gospel, the power for of god it is, unto salvation to everyone - believing   to jewish both first and to greek.
45.1.17.1^the righteousness for of god in it is revealed, from faith to faith, as it has been written:
45.1.17.2^- and the righteous by faith will live.
45.1.18.1^is revealed for the wrath of god from heaven upon all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men, - the truth by unrighteousness suppressing,
45.1.19.1^because the known - of god manifest is among them, - god for to them has revealed it.
45.1.20.1^the for invisible qualities of him from the creation of the world, by the things made being understood, are clearly seen, the both eternal of him power and divinity, for - to be them without excuse.
45.1.21.1^for having known - god, not as god they glorified him, or were thankful, but they became futile in the thinking of them, and was darkened the foolish of them heart.
45.1.22.1^professing to be wise, they became fools,
45.1.23.1^and they changed the glory of the immortal god into a likeness of an image of mortal man and birds and quadrupeds and creeping things.
45.1.24.1^therefore gave up them - god in the desires of the hearts of them to impurity - to dishonor the bodies of them between themselves,
45.1.25.1^who changed the truth - of god into the falsehood, and reverenced and served the created thing beyond the one having created it, who is blessed to the ages!
45.1.25.2^amen.
45.1.26.1^because of this gave up them - god to passions of dishonor.
45.1.26.2^- even for females of them changed the natural use into that contrary to nature.
45.1.27.1^likewise then also the males, having left the natural use of the female, were inflamed in the desire of them toward one another, males with males, the shame working out, and the recompense which was fitting of the error of them, in themselves receiving.
45.1.28.1^and as not they did see fit - god to have in their knowledge, gave up them - god to a depraved mind, to do things not being proper;
45.1.29.1^being filled with all unrighteousness, wickedness, covetousness, malice;
45.1.29.2^full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness;
45.1.29.3^gossips,
45.1.30.1^slanderers, hateful to god, insolent, arrogant, boastful;
45.1.30.2^inventors of evil things, to parents disobedient;
45.1.31.1^foolish, untrustworthy, heartless, unmerciful;
45.1.32.1^who the righteous decree - of god having known, that those such things doing, worthy of death are, not only them are practicing, but also are approving of those practicing them.
45.2.1.1^therefore inexcusable you are, o man, each one who is judging.
45.2.1.2^in that which for you judge the other, yourself you are condemning;
45.2.1.3^- for the same things you do, the one judging.
45.2.2.1^we know however that the judgment - of god is according to truth, upon those - such things practicing.
45.2.3.1^suppose you now this, o man, the one judging those - such things practicing, and doing them yourself, that you will escape the judgment - of god?
45.2.4.1^or the riches of the kindness of him, and the forbearance, and the patience despise you, not knowing that the kindness - of god to repentance you leads?
45.2.5.1^because of however the hardness of you and unrepentant heart, you are treasuring up to yourself wrath in the day of wrath and revelation of righteous judgement - of god,
45.2.6.1^who will give to each, according to the works of him,
45.2.7.1^to those who indeed with endurance in work good, glory and honor and immortality are seeking, life eternal;
45.2.8.1^to those however of self-interest and disobeying the truth, being persuaded about however - unrighteousness, wrath and anger;
45.2.9.1^tribulation and distress upon every soul of man - working - evil, of jewish both first, and also of greek;
45.2.10.1^glory however, and honor, and peace to everyone - doing - good, to jewish both first, and to greek.
45.2.11.1^not for there is partiality with - god.
45.2.12.1^as many as for without the law have sinned, without the law also will perish;
45.2.12.2^and as many as in the law have sinned, by the law will be judged;
45.2.13.1^not for the hearers of the law are righteous with - god, but the doers of the law will be justified.
45.2.14.1^when for gentiles, - not the law having, by nature the things of the law do, these the law not having to themselves are a law,
45.2.15.1^who show the work of the law, written in the hearts of them, bearing witness their - conscience, and between one another, the thoughts accusing or also defending them
45.2.16.1^on the day when will judge - god the secrets - of men, according to the gospel of me, by christ jesus.
45.2.17.1^if however you a jew are called, and rely on the law, and boast in god;
45.2.18.1^and know the will, and approve the things being superior, being instructed out of the law;
45.2.19.1^are persuaded that then you yourself a guide are, of the blind, a light to those in darkness,
45.2.20.1^an instructor of the foolish, a teacher of infants, having the embodiment - of knowledge and of the truth in the law
45.2.21.1^you then teaching another, yourself not do you teach?
45.2.21.2^you preaching not to steal, do you steal?
45.2.22.1^you saying not to commit adultery, do you commit adultery?
45.2.22.2^you abhorring - idols, do you rob temples?
45.2.23.1^you who in law boast, through the transgression of the law, - god dishonor you?
45.2.24.1^- for, the name - of god through you is blasphemed among the gentiles,  as it has been written.
45.2.25.1^circumcision indeed - profits, if the law you do;
45.2.25.2^if however a transgressor of law you are, the circumcision of you uncircumcision has become.
45.2.26.1^if therefore the uncircumcision, the requirements of the law keeps, not the uncircumcision of him for circumcision will be reckoned?
45.2.27.1^and will judge the by nature uncircumcision, the law fulfilling, you who with the letter and circumcision are a transgressor of law.
45.2.28.1^not for the one on the outward a jew is;
45.2.28.2^neither the one outwardly, the outward in flesh, is circumcision;
45.2.29.1^but he who is on the inward a jew is one;
45.2.29.2^and circumcision is of heart, in spirit, not in letter;
45.2.29.3^of whom the praise is not of men, but of - god.
45.3.1.1^what then is the superiority of the jew?
45.3.1.2^or what is the benefit of the circumcision?
45.3.2.1^much in every way.
45.3.2.2^chiefly indeed for that they were entrusted with the oracles - of god.
45.3.3.1^what for if disbelieved some?
45.3.3.2^not the unbelief of them, the faithfulness - of god will nullify?
45.3.4.1^never may it be!
45.3.4.2^let be however - god true, every now man a liar, as it has been written:
45.3.4.3^that - you may be justified in the words of you, and will prevail in - being judged your.
45.3.5.1^if however the unrighteousness of us, god s righteousness shows, what shall we say?
45.3.5.2^is unrighteous - god, - inflicting the wrath?
45.3.5.3^according to man i speak.
45.3.6.1^never may it be!
45.3.6.2^otherwise, how will judge - god the world?
45.3.7.1^if however the truth - of god, in - my lie, abounded to the glory of him, why still also i as a sinner am judged?
45.3.8.1^and is it not, as we are slanderously charged, and as affirm some that us to say -, let us do things evil, that may come the good things?
45.3.8.2^their - condemnation just is.
45.3.9.1^what then?
45.3.9.2^are we better?
45.3.9.3^not at all.
45.3.9.4^we have already charged for jews both and greeks all under sin to be.
45.3.10.1^as it has been written -:
45.3.10.2^none there is righteous, not even one;
45.3.11.1^none there is - understanding;
45.3.11.2^none there is - seeking after - god.
45.3.12.1^all have turned away, together they have become worthless;
45.3.12.2^none there is who is practicing good, not there is so much as one.
45.3.13.1^a grave having been opened the throat of them is;
45.3.13.2^with the tongues of them they keep practicing deceit;
45.3.13.3^the venom of vipers is under the lips of them,
45.3.14.1^of whom the mouth of cursing and of bitterness is full;
45.3.15.1^swift are the feet of them to shed blood;
45.3.16.1^ruin and misery are in the paths of them;
45.3.17.1^and the way of peace not they have known.
45.3.18.1^not there is fear of god before the eyes of them.
45.3.19.1^we know now that whatever the law says, to those under the law it speaks, so that every mouth may be stopped, and under judgment may be all the world - to god.
45.3.20.1^therefore by works of the law not will be justified any flesh before him;
45.3.20.2^through for the law is knowledge of sin.
45.3.21.1^now however, apart from law, the righteousness of god has been revealed, being borne witness to by the law and the prophets,
45.3.22.1^the righteousness now of god through faith from jesus christ toward all those believing.
45.3.22.2^not for there is distinction.
45.3.23.1^all for have sinned and fall short of the glory - of god,
45.3.24.1^being justified freely by the of him grace through the redemption that is in christ jesus,
45.3.25.1^whom set forth as - god a propitiation, through - faith in - his blood, for a showing forth of the righteousness of him, because of the forbearance of the having taken place beforehand sins
45.3.26.1^in the forbearance - of god;
45.3.26.2^for of the showing forth the righteousness of him in the present time, for - to be him just and justifying the one of faith of jesus.
45.3.27.1^where then is the boasting?
45.3.27.2^it has been excluded.
45.3.27.3^through what principle?
45.3.27.4^that of works?
45.3.27.5^no, but through the principle of faith.
45.3.28.1^we reckon therefore to be justified by faith a man, apart from works of the law.
45.3.29.1^or of jews is he the god only, not also of gentiles?
45.3.29.2^yes, also of gentiles,
45.3.30.1^since indeed one - god is, who will justify the circumcision by faith and the uncircumcision through the same faith.
45.3.31.1^law then do we nullify through - faith?
45.3.31.2^never may it be!
45.3.31.3^instead, law we uphold.
45.4.1.1^what then shall we say discovered abraham, the father of us, according to the flesh?
45.4.2.1^if for abraham by works was justified, he has ground of boasting, but not toward god.
45.4.3.1^what for the scripture says?
45.4.3.2^believed then abraham - god, and it was reckoned to him for righteousness.
45.4.4.1^to the one now working, the reward not is reckoned according to grace, but according to debt.
45.4.5.1^to the one however not working, believing however on the one justifying the ungodly, is reckoned the faith of him for righteousness,
45.4.6.1^just as also david declares the blessedness of the man to whom - god credits righteousness apart from works:
45.4.7.1^blessed are they of whom are forgiven the lawless deeds, and of whom are covered the sins;
45.4.8.1^blessed the man against whom no not will reckon the lord sin.
45.4.9.1^is the blessing then this on the circumcision, or also on the uncircumcision?
45.4.9.2^we are saying for was credited - to abraham the faith as righteousness.
45.4.10.1^how then was it credited?
45.4.10.2^in circumcision being, or in uncircumcision?
45.4.10.3^not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.
45.4.11.1^and the sign he received of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith that he had while in the uncircumcision, for the to be him father of all those believing, in uncircumcision, for - to be credited also to them the righteousness,
45.4.12.1^and father of circumcision to those not of circumcision only, but also to those walking in the steps of the during uncircumcision faith of the father of us, abraham.
45.4.13.1^not for through the law the promise was - to abraham or the descendants of him that heir he should be of the world, but through the righteousness of faith.
45.4.14.1^if for those of the law are heirs, has been made void - faith, and made of no effect the promise.
45.4.15.1^- for law wrath brings;
45.4.15.2^where now no there is law, neither is transgression.
45.4.16.1^therefore it is of faith, that it may be according to grace, for - to be sure the promise to all the seed, not to that of the law only, but also to that of the faith of abraham, who is the father of all of us
45.4.17.1^as it has been written -:
45.4.17.2^a father of many nations i have made you.
45.4.17.3^before whom he believed god, the one giving life to the dead and calling the things not into being even existing,
45.4.18.1^who against hope, in hope believed, for - to become him the father of many nations, according to that having been spoken, so shall be the offspring of you.
45.4.19.1^and not having become weak in the faith, he considered - of himself the body already having become dead, a hundred years old about being, and the lifelessness of the womb of sarah.
45.4.20.1^at however the promise - of god, not he did waver - through unbelief, but was strengthened - in faith, having given glory - to god,
45.4.21.1^and having been fully assured that what he had promised, able he is also to do.
45.4.22.1^therefore also it was credited to him unto righteousness.
45.4.23.1^not it was written now on account of him alone that it was credited to him,
45.4.24.1^but also on account of us, to whom it is about to be credited, to those believing on the one having raised jesus the lord of us out from the dead,
45.4.25.1^who was delivered over for the trespasses of us, and was raised for the justification of us.
45.5.1.1^having been justified therefore by faith, peace we have with - god, through the lord of us jesus christ,
45.5.2.1^through whom also - access we have by the faith into the grace this in which we stand;
45.5.2.2^and we boast in hope of the glory - of god.
45.5.3.1^not only so now, but also we glory in - tribulations, knowing that - tribulation, perseverance produces;
45.5.4.1^- and perseverance, character;
45.5.4.2^- and character, hope.
45.5.5.1^- and hope not does make us ashamed, because the love - of god has been poured out into the hearts of us through the spirit holy, the one having been given to us.
45.5.6.1^yet indeed christ, being of us without strength still, according to the right time, for the ungodly died.
45.5.7.1^rarely indeed for a righteous man anyone will die;
45.5.7.2^on behalf of though the good man, perhaps someone even would dare to die.
45.5.8.1^demonstrates however the of himself love to us - god, that still sinners being of us, christ for us died.
45.5.9.1^much therefore more, having been justified now by the blood of him, we will be saved by him from the wrath!
45.5.10.1^if for, enemies being, we were reconciled - to god through the death of the son of him, much more, having been reconciled, shall we be saved in the life of him!
45.5.11.1^not only so now, but also we are rejoicing in - god through the lord of us jesus christ, through whom now the reconciliation we have received.
45.5.12.1^because of this, just as through one man - sin into the world entered, and through - sin, - death;
45.5.12.2^also thus to all men - death passed, for that all sinned.
45.5.13.1^until for the law, sin was in the world;
45.5.13.2^sin however not is imputed, not there being law.
45.5.14.1^nevertheless reigned - death from adam until moses, even over those not having sinned in the likeness of the transgression of adam, who is a type of the coming one.
45.5.15.1^but is not like the trespass so also the gift.
45.5.15.2^if for by the of the one trespass, the many died, how much more the grace - of god and the gift in grace which is of the one man, jesus christ, to the many did abound!
45.5.16.1^and is not as through one having sinned, the gift.
45.5.16.2^the truly for judgment was, of one was unto condemnation;
45.5.16.3^- but the gift is out of many trespasses, unto justification.
45.5.17.1^if for, by the of the one trespass, - death reigned through the one, how much more those the abundance - of grace, and of the gift - of righteousness receiving, in life will reign through the one, jesus christ!
45.5.18.1^so then, just as by one trespass, to all men it is unto condemnation, so also by one act of righteousness, to all men it is unto justification of life.
45.5.19.1^for as for through the disobedience of the one man, sinners were made the many, so also through the obedience of the one, righteous will be made the many.
45.5.20.1^the law now entered, so that might abound the trespass;
45.5.20.2^where however abounded - sin, overabounded - grace,
45.5.21.1^so that just as reigned the sin in - death, so also - grace might reign through righteousness, unto life eternal, through jesus christ the lord of us.
45.6.1.1^what then will we say?
45.6.1.2^shall we continue - in sin, that - grace may abound?
45.6.2.1^never may it be!
45.6.2.2^who we died - to sin, how still shall we live in it?
45.6.3.1^or are you unaware that as many as have been baptized into christ jesus, into the death of him have been baptized?
45.6.4.1^we were buried therefore with him through - baptism into - death, so that just as was raised up christ out from the dead by the glory of the father, so also we in newness of life should walk.
45.6.5.1^if for united we have become in the likeness of the death of him, certainly also of the resurrection we will be;
45.6.6.1^this knowing, that - old of us self was crucified with him, so that might be annulled the body - of sin, that no longer are enslaved we - to sin.
45.6.7.1^the one for having died has been freed from - sin.
45.6.8.1^if now we died with christ, we believe that also we will live with him,
45.6.9.1^knowing that christ, having been raised up out from the dead, no more dies.
45.6.9.2^death him no longer rules over.
45.6.10.1^that which for he died, - to sin he died once for all;
45.6.10.2^that which however he lives, he lives - to god.
45.6.11.1^so also you, consider yourselves to be dead indeed - to sin, living however - to god in christ jesus.
45.6.12.1^not therefore let reign - sin in the mortal of you body, in order - to obey the desires of it.
45.6.13.1^neither yield the members of you as instruments of unrighteousness - to sin, but yield yourselves - to god, as out from the dead living, and the members of you, as instruments of righteousness - to god.
45.6.14.1^sin for you not will rule over, not for you are under law, but under grace.
45.6.15.1^what then?
45.6.15.2^shall we sin because not we are under law, but under grace?
45.6.15.3^never may it be!
45.6.16.1^not know you that to whom you yield yourselves as slaves for obedience, slaves you are to him whom you obey, whether of sin to death, or of obedience to righteousness?
45.6.17.1^thanks be however - to god that you used to be slaves - of sin, you have become obedient now from the heart, to which you were handed over to the form of teaching.
45.6.18.1^having been set free now from - sin, you have become slaves - to righteousness.
45.6.19.1^in human terms i speak on account of the weakness of the flesh of you.
45.6.19.2^for as for you yielded the members of you in bondage - to impurity and to lawlessness unto - lawlessness, so now yield the members of you in bondage - to righteousness unto sanctification.
45.6.20.1^when for slaves you were - of sin, free you were - from righteousness.
45.6.21.1^what therefore fruit had you then in the things of which now you are ashamed?
45.6.21.2^the for end of those things is death.
45.6.22.1^now however, having been set free from - sin, having become slaves now - to god, you have the fruit of you unto sanctification;
45.6.22.2^- now the end is life eternal.
45.6.23.1^the for wages - of sin is death;
45.6.23.2^- but the gift - of god, life eternal in christ jesus the lord of us.
45.7.1.1^or are you ignorant, brothers   to those knowing for law i speak   that the law rules over the man for as long as the time he is alive?
45.7.2.1^the for married woman, to the living husband is bound by law;
45.7.2.2^if however should die the husband, she is cleared from the law of the husband.
45.7.3.1^then therefore, being alive the husband, an adulteress she will be called if she is to man another;
45.7.3.2^if however should die the husband, free she is from the law, so as for not to be her an adulteress, having been to man another.
45.7.4.1^likewise, brothers of me, also you have been put to death to the law through the body - of christ, for - to belong you to another, to the one out from the dead having been raised, so that we should bear fruit - to god.
45.7.5.1^while for we were in the flesh, the passions - of sins that were through the law were at work in the members of us, to the bringing forth of fruit - to death.
45.7.6.1^now however we have been released from the law, having died to that which we were bound, in order for to serve us in newness of the spirit, and not in oldness of the letter.
45.7.7.1^what then shall we say?
45.7.7.2^is the law sin?
45.7.7.3^never may it be!
45.7.7.4^but - sin not i have known, if not by law;
45.7.7.5^- then for covetousness, not i had been conscious of, if not the law had said, not you shall covet.
45.7.8.1^an occasion however having taken - sin by the commandment, it produced in me all covetousness;
45.7.8.2^apart from for the law, sin is dead.
45.7.9.1^i however was alive apart from law once;
45.7.9.2^having come however the commandment, the sin revived;
45.7.10.1^i then died.
45.7.10.2^and proved to be me the commandment that was to life, this to death.
45.7.11.1^the for sin, an occasion having taken by the commandment, deceived me, and by it put me to death.
45.7.12.1^so - indeed the law is holy, and the commandment is holy and righteous and good.
45.7.13.1^that which then is good, to me has become death?
45.7.13.2^never may it be!
45.7.13.3^but - sin, in order that it might be shown to be sin, through that which is good to me is working out death;
45.7.13.4^so that might become beyond excess sinful, - sin through the commandment.
45.7.14.1^we know for that - the law spiritual is;
45.7.14.2^i however fleshly am, having been sold under - sin.
45.7.15.1^what for i do, not i understand;
45.7.15.2^not for what i want, this i do;
45.7.15.3^but what i hate, this i do.
45.7.16.1^if now that which not i do want, this i do, i consent to the law, that it is good.
45.7.17.1^in that case now, no longer i am doing it, but the dwelling in me sin.
45.7.18.1^i know for that nothing there dwells in me, that is in the flesh of me, good;
45.7.18.2^- for to will is present with me, - but to do the good, not.
45.7.19.1^not for that i desire i do good, but that not i do want evil, this i practice.
45.7.20.1^if now what not i do want, i this do, it is no longer i who do it, but - dwelling in me sin.
45.7.21.1^i find so the principle, that desiring me to do - good, that me - evil is present with.
45.7.22.1^i delight for in the law - of god, according to the inward man;
45.7.23.1^i see however another law in the members of me, warring against the law of the mind of me, and making captive me to the law - of sin, - being in the members of me.
45.7.24.1^o wretched i am man!
45.7.24.2^who me will deliver out of the body - of death this?
45.7.25.1^thanks be then to god, through jesus christ the lord of us!
45.7.25.2^then so, myself i with the indeed mind serve law god s, - but with the flesh the law of sin.
45.8.1.1^there is no therefore now condemnation to those in christ jesus.
45.8.2.1^- for the law of the spirit of life in christ jesus has set free you from the law - of sin and - of death.
45.8.3.1^- for powerless being the law, in that it was weak through the flesh, - god, - of himself son having sent, in likeness of flesh of sin, and for sin, condemned - sin in the flesh,
45.8.4.1^so that the righteousness of the law should be fulfilled in us - not according to the flesh walking, but according to the spirit.
45.8.5.1^those for according to flesh being, the things of the flesh mind;
45.8.5.2^those however according to spirit, the things of the spirit.
45.8.6.1^the for mind of the flesh is death;
45.8.6.2^the but mind of the spirit, life and peace,
45.8.7.1^because the mind of the flesh is hostility toward god;
45.8.7.2^to for the law - of god not it is subject, nor even for can it be.
45.8.8.1^those now in flesh being, god to please not are able.
45.8.9.1^you now not are in flesh, but in spirit, if indeed the spirit of god dwells in you;
45.8.9.2^if however anyone the spirit of christ not has, he not is of him.
45.8.10.1^if however christ is in you, the indeed body is dead on account of sin, the however spirit is life on account of righteousness.
45.8.11.1^if now the spirit of the one having raised up - jesus out from the dead dwells in you, the one having raised up christ out from the dead will give life also to the mortal bodies of you, on account of - dwelling his spirit in you.
45.8.12.1^so then, brothers, debtors we are, not to the flesh, - according to flesh to live.
45.8.13.1^if for according to flesh you live, you are about to die;
45.8.13.2^if however by the spirit the deeds of the body you put to death, you will live.
45.8.14.1^as many as for by the spirit of god are led, these sons of god.
45.8.14.2^are
45.8.15.1^not for you have received a spirit of bondage again to fear, but you have received the spirit of divine adoption as sons, by whom we cry, abba!
45.8.15.2^- father!
45.8.16.1^himself the spirit bears witness with the spirit of us that we are children of god.
45.8.17.1^if now children, also heirs, heirs indeed of god, joint-heirs now of christ, if indeed we suffer with him, so that also we may be glorified together.
45.8.18.1^i reckon for that not comparable the sufferings of the present time are to the coming glory to be revealed to us.
45.8.19.1^the for earnest expectation of the creation, the revelation of the sons - of god awaits.
45.8.20.1^to the for futility, the creation was subjected, not willingly, but because of the one having subjected it, in hope
45.8.21.1^that also itself the creation will be set free from the bondage - of decay, into the freedom of the glory of the children - of god.
45.8.22.1^we know for that all the creation groans together and travails together until - now.
45.8.23.1^not only so now, but even ourselves, the firstfruit of the spirit having, we also ourselves in ourselves groan, divine adoption as sons awaiting, the redemption of the body of us.
45.8.24.1^in this for hope we were saved;
45.8.24.2^hope however being seen, not is hope;
45.8.24.3^what for sees any does he hope for?
45.8.25.1^if however, what not we see we hope for, in patience we await.
45.8.26.1^likewise now also, the spirit joins to help the weakness of us;
45.8.26.2^the for things which we should pray for as it behooves, not we know, but himself the spirit makes intercession, with groanings inexpressible.
45.8.27.1^the one now searching - hearts knows what is the mindset of the spirit, because according to god, he intercedes for the saints.
45.8.28.1^we know now that to those loving - god, all things work together for good, to those according to his purpose called being.
45.8.29.1^for those whom he foreknew, also he predestined to be conformed to the image of the son of him, for - to be him firstborn among many brothers.
45.8.30.1^those whom then he predestined, these also he called;
45.8.30.2^and whom he called, these also he justified;
45.8.30.3^whom then he justified, these also he glorified.
45.8.31.1^what then will we say to these things?
45.8.31.2^if - god is for us, who can be against us?
45.8.32.1^he who indeed the own son not spared, but for us all gave up him, how not also with him, things all us will he grant?
45.8.33.1^who will bring an accusation against the elect of god?
45.8.33.2^god is the one justifying.
45.8.34.1^who is the one condemning?
45.8.34.2^for it is christ jesus, the one having died, rather now having been raised up, who also is at the right hand - of god, who and is interceding for us.
45.8.35.1^who us will separate from the love - of christ?
45.8.35.2^tribulation, or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or danger, or sword?
45.8.36.1^as it has been written -:
45.8.36.2^for the sake of you, we face death all the day;
45.8.36.3^we were regarded as sheep of slaughter.
45.8.37.1^but in these things all, we more than conquer through the one having loved us.
45.8.38.1^i am persuaded for that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor principalities, nor things present, nor things to come, nor powers,
45.8.39.1^nor height, nor depth, nor any created thing other, will be able us to separate from the love - of god - in christ jesus the lord of us.
45.9.1.1^the truth i speak in christ.
45.9.1.2^not i am lying, bearing witness with me the conscience of me in the spirit holy,
45.9.2.1^that grief to me is great, and unceasing sorrow in the heart of me.
45.9.3.1^could wish for a curse to be myself i, separated from - christ for the brothers of me, - kinsmen of me, according to the flesh;
45.9.4.1^who are israelites, whose is the divine adoption as sons, and the glory, and the covenants, and the lawgiving, and the service, and the promises;
45.9.5.1^whose are the patriarchs;
45.9.5.2^and from whom is - christ - according to the flesh, - being over all god, blessed to the ages.
45.9.5.3^amen.
45.9.6.1^it is not as however, that has failed the word - of god.
45.9.6.2^not for all who are of israel, are these israel.
45.9.7.1^nor because they are seed of abraham are all children;
45.9.7.2^rather, in isaac will be named to you offspring
45.9.8.1^that is, not the children of the flesh, these are children - of god;
45.9.8.2^but the children of the promise are regarded as offspring.
45.9.9.1^of the promise for, the word is this:
45.9.9.2^at the time this, i will come, and there will be - to sarah a son.
45.9.10.1^not only then, but also rebecca, by one conception, having isaac the father of us,
45.9.11.1^not yet for having been born, nor having done anything good or evil, so that the according to election purpose - of god might stand,
45.9.12.1^not of works, but of the one calling, it was said to her -, the older will serve the younger.
45.9.13.1^as it has been written -:
45.9.13.2^jacob i loved, - but esau i hated.
45.9.14.1^what then shall we say?
45.9.14.2^not injustice with - god is there?
45.9.14.3^never may it be!
45.9.15.1^to moses for he says:
45.9.15.2^i will show mercy to whom - i may show mercy, and i will have compassion on whom - i may have compassion.
45.9.16.1^so then, it is not of the willing, nor of the running, but - showing mercy of god.
45.9.17.1^says for the scripture to pharaoh -:
45.9.17.2^for this very therefore i have raised up you, so that i might show in you the power of me, and that should be declared the name of me in all the earth.
45.9.18.1^so then, to whom he wants, he shows mercy;
45.9.18.2^whom now he wants, he hardens.
45.9.19.1^you will say to me then, why then still does he find fault?
45.9.19.2^the for purpose of him, who is resisting?
45.9.20.1^o man, but rather, you who are - answering against - god?
45.9.20.2^not will say the thing formed to the one having formed it, why me have you made like this?
45.9.21.1^or not has authority the potter over the clay, out of the same lump to make one indeed unto honor vessel, one however unto dishonor?
45.9.22.1^what if now desiring - god to show the wrath and to make known the power of him, bore with much patience, the vessels of wrath, having been fitted for destruction,
45.9.23.1^also that he might make known the riches of the glory of him upon the vessels of mercy, which he prepared beforehand for glory,
45.9.24.1^whom even he has called, us not only out from the jews, but also out from the gentiles?
45.9.25.1^as also in - hosea he says:
45.9.25.2^i will call that which is not people of me, people of me;
45.9.25.3^and her not having been loved, having been loved,
45.9.26.1^and, it will happen that in the place where it was said to them, not people my are you, there they will be called sons of god the living.
45.9.27.1^isaiah also cries out concerning - israel:
45.9.27.2^though shall be the number of the sons of israel as the sand of the sea, only the remnant will be saved.
45.9.28.1^the sentence for concluding and bringing swiftly, will perform the lord upon the earth.
45.9.29.1^and, as foretold isaiah:
45.9.29.2^if not the lord of hosts had left us descendants, like sodom - we would have become, and like gomorrah - we would have been made.
45.9.30.1^what then will we say?
45.9.30.2^that gentiles - not pursuing righteousness, have attained righteousness, righteousness now that is by faith;
45.9.31.1^israel however, pursuing a law of righteousness, to that law not did attain.
45.9.32.1^because of why?
45.9.32.2^because it was not by faith, but as by works.
45.9.32.3^they stumbled over the stone - of stumbling,
45.9.33.1^as it has been written:
45.9.33.2^behold i lay in zion a stone of stumbling, and a rock of offense;
45.9.33.3^and the one believing on him, never will be put to shame.
45.10.1.1^brothers, the indeed desire - of my heart and the supplication to - god on behalf of them is for salvation.
45.10.2.1^i bear witness for about them, that zeal for god they have, but not according to knowledge.
45.10.3.1^being ignorant of for the - of god righteousness, and the own righteousness seeking to establish, to the righteousness - of god, not they submitted.
45.10.4.1^the end for of law is christ, unto righteousness to everyone - believing.
45.10.5.1^moses for writes of the righteousness that is of the law, that the having done these things man, will live by them.
45.10.6.1^the however of faith righteousness, thus speaks:
45.10.6.2^not you should say in the heart of you, who will ascend into - heaven?
45.10.6.3^that is, christ to bring down,
45.10.7.1^or, who will descend into the abyss?
45.10.7.2^that is, christ out from the dead to bring up.
45.10.8.1^but what says it?
45.10.8.2^near you the word is, in the mouth of you and in the heart of you.
45.10.8.3^that is, the word - of faith which we proclaim,
45.10.9.1^that if you confess with the mouth of you, the lord is jesus, and believe in the heart of you, that - god him raised out from the dead, you will be saved.
45.10.10.1^in the heart for is belief unto righteousness;
45.10.10.2^in the mouth now is confession unto salvation.
45.10.11.1^says for the scripture, everyone - believing on him not will be put to shame.
45.10.12.1^not for there is difference jew between and greek;
45.10.12.2^- for the same lord of all is rich toward all those calling him.
45.10.13.1^whoever for that - shall call upon the name of the lord will be saved.
45.10.14.1^how then shall they call on him whom not they believed?
45.10.14.2^how now shall they believe on him of whom not they have heard?
45.10.14.3^how now shall they hear apart from preaching?
45.10.15.1^how now shall they preach if not they are sent?
45.10.15.2^as it has been written:
45.10.15.3^how beautiful the feet of those proclaiming good news of good things!
45.10.16.1^but not all heeded the good news.
45.10.16.2^isaiah for says, lord, who has believed the report of us?
45.10.17.1^so - faith is from hearing, - and hearing through the word of christ.
45.10.18.1^but i ask, no not did they hear?
45.10.18.2^indeed:
45.10.18.3^into all the earth has gone out the voice of them;
45.10.18.4^and to the ends of the world, the words of them.
45.10.19.1^but i ask, not israel not did know?
45.10.19.2^first, moses says:
45.10.19.3^i will provoke to jealousy you by those not a nation;
45.10.19.4^by a nation without understanding, i will anger you.
45.10.20.1^isaiah then is very bold and says:
45.10.20.2^i was found by those me not seeking;
45.10.20.3^manifest i became to those me not inquiring after.
45.10.21.1^as for however, - israel, he says:
45.10.21.2^all the day, i have stretched out the hands of me, to a people disobeying and contradicting.
45.11.1.1^i ask then, not did reject - god the people of him?
45.11.1.2^never may it be!
45.11.1.3^also for i an israelite am, of the seed of abraham, of the tribe of benjamin.
45.11.2.1^not did reject - god the people of him, whom he foreknew.
45.11.2.2^or not know you in elijah what says the scripture, how he pleads - with god against - israel:
45.11.3.1^lord, the prophets of you they have killed;
45.11.3.2^the altars of you they have torn down;
45.11.3.3^and i have been left alone, and they are seeking the life of me.
45.11.4.1^but what was spoken to him the divine answer?
45.11.4.2^i have left to myself seven thousand men who not have bowed the knee - to baal.
45.11.5.1^thus then also, in the present time, a remnant according to the election of grace there has been.
45.11.6.1^if now by grace, no longer from works;
45.11.6.2^otherwise - grace no longer would be grace.
45.11.7.1^what then?
45.11.7.2^what is seeking israel, this not it has obtained;
45.11.7.3^- but the elect obtained it.
45.11.7.4^the now rest were hardened,
45.11.8.1^as it has been written:
45.11.8.2^gave them - god a spirit of stupor, eyes - not to see, and ears - not to hear, unto the today day.
45.11.9.1^and david says:
45.11.9.2^let be the table of them for a snare and for a trap, and for a stumbling block and for a retribution to them;
45.11.10.1^let be darkened the eyes of them, - not to see, and the backs of them, for ever bent over.
45.11.11.1^i ask then, not did they stumble that they might fall?
45.11.11.2^never may it be!
45.11.11.3^but in the of them trespass - is salvation to the gentiles, so as - to provoke to jealousy them.
45.11.12.1^if however, the trespass of them is riches of the world, and the failure of them is the riches of the gentiles, how much more the fullness of them!
45.11.13.1^to you now i am speaking, the gentiles.
45.11.13.2^upon as much as indeed therefore am i of the gentiles apostle, the ministry of me i magnify,
45.11.14.1^if at all i shall provoke to jealousy of me the flesh, and shall save some of them.
45.11.15.1^if for the rejection of them is the reconciliation of the world, what will be the acceptance, if not life out from the dead?
45.11.16.1^if now the firstfruit is holy, also the lump;
45.11.16.2^and if the root is holy, also the branches.
45.11.17.1^if however some of the branches were broken off, you now, a wild olive tree being, were grafted in among them, and a fellow-partaker of the root of the fatness of the olive tree have become,
45.11.18.1^not boast over the branches.
45.11.18.2^if now you boast against them, not you the root support, but the root you.
45.11.19.1^you will say then, were broken off branches, that i might be grafted in.
45.11.20.1^rightly so;
45.11.20.2^by the unbelief they were broken off;
45.11.20.3^you however - by faith stand.
45.11.20.4^not high be minded, but be afraid.
45.11.21.1^if for - god the according to nature branches not spared, not at all neither you will he spare.
45.11.22.1^behold therefore the kindness and severity of god;
45.11.22.2^upon indeed those having fallen, severity;
45.11.22.3^toward however you, kindness of god, if you continue in the kindness;
45.11.22.4^otherwise also you will be cut off.
45.11.23.1^even they now if not they continue - in unbelief, will be grafted in;
45.11.23.2^able for is - god again to graft in them.
45.11.24.1^if for you, out of the according to nature were cut off a wild olive tree, and, contrary to nature, were grafted into a cultivated olive tree, how much more these, who according to nature are, will be grafted into the own olive tree!
45.11.25.1^not for i want you to be ignorant, brothers, of the mystery this, that not you may be in yourselves wise, that a hardening in part - to israel has happened, until that the fullness of the gentiles may come in;
45.11.26.1^and so all israel will be saved, as it has been written:
45.11.26.2^will come out of zion the one delivering, he will remove ungodliness from jacob.
45.11.27.1^and this is to them the from me covenant, when i shall take away the sins of them.
45.11.28.1^as regards indeed the gospel, they are enemies on account of you;
45.11.28.2^as regards however the election, beloved on account of the patriarchs.
45.11.29.1^irrevocable for are the gifts and the calling - of god.
45.11.30.1^just as for you once were disobedient - to god, now however have been shown mercy the of these disobedience,
45.11.31.1^so also these now have been disobedient, the for your mercy, so that also they now may have mercy shown them.
45.11.32.1^has bound up for - god - all in disobedience, that - all he may show mercy to.
45.11.33.1^o, the depth of riches, both of wisdom and knowledge of god!
45.11.33.2^how unsearchable the judgments of him, and untraceable the ways of him!
45.11.34.1^who for has known the mind of the lord, or who counselor of him has been?
45.11.35.1^or who has first given to him, and it will be recompensed to him?
45.11.36.1^for from him, and through him, and unto him - are all things.
45.11.36.2^to him be the glory to the ages!
45.11.36.3^amen.
45.12.1.1^i exhort therefore you, brothers, through the compassions - of god, to present the bodies of you a sacrifice living, holy, well-pleasing, - to god which is the reasonable service of you.
45.12.2.1^and not be conformed to the age this, but be transformed by the renewing of the mind, for - to prove by you, what is the will - of god, - good and well-pleasing and perfect.
45.12.3.1^i say for through the grace - having been given to me to everyone - being among you, not to be high-minded above what it behooves you to think, but to think so as - to be sober-minded, to each as - god has allotted a measure of faith.
45.12.4.1^just as for, in one body many members we have, - now the members all not the same have function;
45.12.5.1^so the many, one body we are in christ;
45.12.5.2^- and individually one of another members.
45.12.6.1^we are having however gifts according to the grace - having been given to us different:
45.12.6.2^if prophecy, according to the proportion of the faith;
45.12.7.1^or service, in the service;
45.12.7.2^or - teaching, in the teaching;
45.12.8.1^or - exhorting, in the exhortation;
45.12.8.2^- giving, in generosity;
45.12.8.3^- leading, with diligence;
45.12.8.4^- showing mercy, with cheerfulness.
45.12.9.1^let love be unfeigned:
45.12.9.2^abhorring - evil, cleaving to - good,
45.12.10.1^- in brotherly love to one another devoted - in honor, one another esteeming,
45.12.11.1^- in diligence not lagging, - in spirit being fervent, the lord serving,
45.12.12.1^- in hope rejoicing, - in tribulation being patient, - in prayer being constant,
45.12.13.1^to the needs of the saints contributing, - hospitality pursuing.
45.12.14.1^bless those persecuting you.
45.12.14.2^bless and not curse;
45.12.15.1^to rejoice with the rejoicing, to weep with the weeping;
45.12.16.1^the same thing toward one another minding, not the things haughty minding, but with the lowly going along.
45.12.16.2^not be wise in yourselves.
45.12.17.1^to no one evil for evil repaying, providing right before all men;
45.12.18.1^if possible - of you, with all men living at peace;
45.12.19.1^never yourselves avenging, beloved;
45.12.19.2^instead give place - to wrath;
45.12.19.3^it has been written for:
45.12.19.4^mine is vengeance, i will repay, says the lord.
45.12.20.1^on the contrary, if should hunger the enemy of you, feed him;
45.12.20.2^if he should thirst, give drink him;
45.12.20.3^this for doing, coals of fire you will heap upon the head of him.
45.12.21.1^not be overcome by - evil, but overcome with - good - evil.
45.13.1.1^every soul to the authorities being above him let be subject.
45.13.1.2^not for there is authority, if not by god;
45.13.1.3^those however existing, by god having been instituted are.
45.13.2.1^therefore the one resisting the authority, the - of god ordinance has resisted;
45.13.2.2^those now having resisted upon themselves judgment will bring.
45.13.3.1^the for rulers not are a terror - to good works, but - to evil.
45.13.3.2^do you desire now not to fear the authority?
45.13.3.3^the good do, and you will have praise from him.
45.13.4.1^of god for servant he is to you for - good.
45.13.4.2^if however - evil you do, be afraid, not for in vain the sword he bears;
45.13.4.3^of god for a servant he is, an avenger for wrath to the one - evil doing.
45.13.5.1^therefore necessary it is to be subject, not only on account of the wrath, but also on account of the conscience.
45.13.6.1^because of this for, also taxes pay you;
45.13.6.2^servants for of god they are, upon this very thing attending continually.
45.13.7.1^render to all their dues, to whom the tax, the tax;
45.13.7.2^to whom the revenue, the revenue;
45.13.7.3^to whom the respect, the respect;
45.13.7.4^to whom the honor, the honor.
45.13.8.1^to no one nothing owe, if not - one another to love;
45.13.8.2^the one for loving the other, the law has fulfilled.
45.13.9.1^- for, not you shall commit adultery, not you shall murder, not you shall steal, not you shall covet,  and if any other commandment, in the word this it is summed up, in the saying:
45.13.9.2^you shall love the neighbor of you as yourself.
45.13.10.1^- love to the neighbor evil not does do;
45.13.10.2^the fulfillment therefore of the law - love is.
45.13.11.1^and this, knowing the time, that it is the hour already for you out of sleep to awaken;
45.13.11.2^now for nearer is of us the salvation than when first we believed.
45.13.12.1^the night is nearly over, - and the day has drawn near.
45.13.12.2^we should cast off therefore the works - of darkness;
45.13.12.3^we should put on now the armor - of light.
45.13.13.1^as in daytime, properly we should walk, not in reveling and drinking, not in sexual immorality and sensuality, not in dissension and jealousy.
45.13.14.1^but put on the lord jesus christ, and of the flesh provision not make for desires.
45.14.1.1^the one now being weak in the faith, receive, not for passing judgment on reasonings.
45.14.2.1^one indeed believes to eat all things;
45.14.2.2^the one however being weak, vegetables eats.
45.14.3.1^the one eating, the one not eating not let him despise;
45.14.3.2^the one now not eating, him eating not let him judge, - god for him has received.
45.14.4.1^you who are, - judging another s servant?
45.14.4.2^to the own master he stands or falls.
45.14.4.3^he will be upheld however;
45.14.4.4^able is for the lord to uphold him.
45.14.5.1^one truly for judges a day to be above another day;
45.14.5.2^one however judges every day alike.
45.14.5.3^each in the own mind, let be fully assured.
45.14.6.1^the one regarding the day, to the lord regards it;
45.14.6.2^and the one eating, to the lord eats, he gives thanks for - to god;
45.14.6.3^and the one not eating, to the lord not he eats, and he gives thanks - to god.
45.14.7.1^no one for of us to himself lives, and no one to himself dies.
45.14.8.1^if both for we should live, to the lord we live;
45.14.8.2^if also we should die, to the lord we die.
45.14.8.3^if both therefore we should live, if also we should die, the lord s we are.
45.14.9.1^unto this for, christ died and lived again, that both the dead and living he might rule over.
45.14.10.1^you however, why judge you the brother or you, or also you why do despise the brother of you?
45.14.10.2^all for we will stand before the judgment seat of god.
45.14.11.1^it has been written for:
45.14.11.2^live i, says the lord, that to me will bow every knee, and every tongue will confess - to god.
45.14.12.1^so then, each of us concerning himself, account will give - to god.
45.14.13.1^no longer therefore one another should we judge;
45.14.13.2^but this determine rather, - not to put any stumbling block before your brother, or snare.
45.14.14.1^i know and i am persuaded in the lord jesus that nothing is unclean of itself;
45.14.14.2^if not to him reckoning anything unclean to be, to that one unclean it is.
45.14.15.1^if for on account of food, the brother of you is grieved, no longer according to love are you walking.
45.14.15.2^not with the food of you that one destroy, for whom christ died.
45.14.16.1^not let be spoken of as evil, therefore, your - good.
45.14.17.1^not for is the kingdom - of god eating and drinking, but righteousness and peace and joy in the spirit holy.
45.14.18.1^the one for in these things serving - christ is well-pleasing - to god and approved - by men.
45.14.19.1^so then, the things - of peace we should pursue, and the things - for edification - among each other.
45.14.20.1^not for the sake of food, destroy the work - of god.
45.14.20.2^all things indeed are clean, but it is wrong to the man - through a stumbling block eating.
45.14.21.1^it is good - neither to eat meat, nor to drink wine, nor anything in which the brother of you stumbles.
45.14.22.1^you the faith that have, to yourself keep before - god.
45.14.22.2^blessed is the one not judging himself in what he approves.
45.14.23.1^the one however doubting, if he eats, has been condemned, because it is not of faith;
45.14.23.2^everything now that is not of faith, sin is.
45.15.1.1^we ought now, we who are strong, the weaknesses of the weak to bear, and not ourselves to please.
45.15.2.1^each of us the neighbor let please, unto the good, for edification.
45.15.3.1^even for - christ not himself pleased, but as it has been written:
45.15.3.2^the reproaches of those reproaching you have fallen on me.
