45.15.4.1^whatever for was written in the past, for - our instruction was written, so that through - endurance and through the encouragement of the scriptures, - hope we might have.
45.15.5.1^the now god - of endurance and - encouragement, may he give you the same to be of mind with one another, according to christ jesus,
45.15.6.1^so that with one accord, with one mouth, you may glorify the god and father of the lord of us jesus christ.
45.15.7.1^therefore receive one another as also - christ received you, to the glory - of god.
45.15.8.1^i say for, christ a servant to have become of the circumcision for the truth of god, in order - to confirm the promises given to the fathers,
45.15.9.1^- and for the gentiles, for mercy, to glorify - god, as it has been written:
45.15.9.2^because of this i will praise you among the gentiles, and to the name of you will i sing.
45.15.10.1^and again it says:
45.15.10.2^rejoice you gentiles, with the people of him.
45.15.11.1^and again:
45.15.11.2^praise all the gentiles, the lord;
45.15.11.3^and praise him, all the peoples.
45.15.12.1^and again, isaiah says:
45.15.12.2^there will be the root - of jesse, and the one arising to rule over gentiles;
45.15.12.3^in him the gentiles will hope.
45.15.13.1^- and the god - of hope may fill you with all joy and peace, in - believing;
45.15.13.2^for - to abound you in - hope in the power of the spirit holy.
45.15.14.1^i am persuaded now, brothers of me, also myself i concerning you, that also you yourselves full are of goodness, being filled with all - knowledge, being able also one another to admonish.
45.15.15.1^more boldly however i have written to you, in part, as reminding you, because of the grace - having been given to me by - god
45.15.16.1^for - to be me a minister christ of jesus to the gentiles, administering the sacred service of the gospel - of god, so that might become the offering of the gentiles acceptable, having been sanctified in the spirit holy.
45.15.17.1^i have therefore the boasting in christ jesus, in the things pertaining to - god.
45.15.18.1^not for will i dare anything to speak of, what except has accomplished christ through me, unto the obedience of the gentiles, by word and deed,
45.15.19.1^in the power of signs and wonders, in the power of the spirit of god;
45.15.19.2^so as for me from jerusalem, and around unto - illyricum, to have fully proclaimed the gospel - of christ,
45.15.20.1^thus now being ambitious to preach the gospel not where had been named christ, so that not upon another s foundation i might build.
45.15.21.1^rather, as it has been written:
45.15.21.2^to whom not it was proclaimed concerning him;
45.15.21.3^they will see, and those that not have heard will understand.
45.15.22.1^therefore also i have been hindered - many times - to come to you.
45.15.23.1^now however, no longer a place having in the regions these, a great desire now having had - to come to you for many years,
45.15.24.1^whenever - i may go to - spain i hope for going through to see you, and by you to be equipped there, if of you first in part i should be filled.
45.15.25.1^now however i am going to jerusalem, ministering to the saints.
45.15.26.1^were pleased for macedonia and achaia a contribution certain to make for the poor among the saints - in jerusalem.
45.15.27.1^they were pleased for, and debtors they are of them.
45.15.27.2^if for the things spiritual of them have shared in the gentiles, they ought also in the material things to minister to them.
45.15.28.1^this therefore having finished and having sealed to them the fruit this, i will set off through you into spain.
45.15.29.1^i know now that coming to you, in the fullness of the blessing of christ i will come.
45.15.30.1^i exhort now you, brothers, by the lord of us jesus christ and by the love of the spirit, to strive together with me in the prayers for me to - god,
45.15.31.1^so that i may be delivered from those refusing to be persuaded in - judea, and the service of me, which is in jerusalem, acceptable to the saints may be,
45.15.32.1^so that in joy, having come to you by the will of god, i may be refreshed with you.
45.15.33.1^- and the god - of peace be with all of you.
45.15.33.2^amen.
45.16.1.1^i commend now to you phoebe, the sister of us, being also a servant of the church - in cenchrea,
45.16.2.1^that her you might receive in the lord worthily - of the saints, and you might assist her in whatever - of you she may need matter.
45.16.2.2^also for she a patroness of many has been, and of me myself.
45.16.3.1^greet prisca and aquila, the fellow workers of me in christ jesus
45.16.4.1^who for the life of me, the of them neck have lain down, whom not i only thank, but also all the churches of the gentiles
45.16.5.1^and the at house their church.
45.16.5.2^greet epenetus, the beloved of me, who is a firstfruit - of asia for christ.
45.16.6.1^greet mary, who much toiled for you.
45.16.7.1^greet andronicus and junias, - kinsmen of me and fellow prisoners with me, who are of note among the apostles, who also before me were in christ.
45.16.8.1^greet ampliatus, - beloved of me in the lord.
45.16.9.1^greet urbanus, the fellow worker of us in christ, and stachys the beloved of me.
45.16.10.1^greet apelles, the approved in christ.
45.16.10.2^greet those of the household of aristobulus.
45.16.11.1^greet herodion, the kinsman of me.
45.16.11.2^greet those of the household of narcissus, - being in the lord.
45.16.12.1^greet tryphena and tryphosa, those toiling in the lord.
45.16.12.2^greet persis, the beloved, who much toiled in the lord.
45.16.13.1^greet rufus, the chosen in the lord, and the mother of him and of me.
45.16.14.1^greet asyncritus, phlegon, hermes, patrobas, hermas, and the with them brothers.
45.16.15.1^greet philologus and julia, nereus and the sister of him, and olympas and the with them all saints.
45.16.16.1^greet one another with a kiss holy.
45.16.16.2^greet you, the churches all - of christ.
45.16.17.1^i exhort now you, brothers, to watch out for those - divisions and - obstacles contrary to the teaching that you have learned causing, and turn away from them.
45.16.18.1^- for such the lord of us christ not serve, but the of themselves belly;
45.16.18.2^and by - smooth talk and flattery they deceive the hearts of the naive.
45.16.19.1^the for of you obedience, to all has reached.
45.16.19.2^over you, therefore i rejoice;
45.16.19.3^i wish however you wise to be to - good, innocent however to - evil.
45.16.20.1^the now god - of peace will crush - satan under the feet of you in a short time.
45.16.20.2^the grace of the lord of us jesus be with you.
45.16.21.1^greets you timothy, the fellow worker of me, also lucius, and jason, and sosipater, the kinsmen of me.
45.16.22.1^greet you i, tertius, the one having written down this letter, in the lord.
45.16.23.1^greets you gaius, the host of me, and of all the church.
45.16.23.2^greets you erastus, the steward of the city, and quartus, the brother.
45.16.25.1^to him now being able you to strengthen, according to - gospel my and the preaching of jesus christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, in times of the ages having been kept secret,
45.16.26.1^having been made manifest however now, through also scriptures prophetic, according to the commandment of the eternal god, unto the obedience of faith   to all the gentiles having been made known
45.16.27.1^to the only wise god, through jesus christ which is, be the glory to the ages amen.
46.1.1.1^paul, a called apostle of christ jesus by the will of god, and sosthenes, the brother,
46.1.2.1^to the church - of god - being in corinth, having been sanctified in christ jesus, called holy, together with all those calling on the name of the lord of us jesus christ in every place, both theirs and ours:
46.1.3.1^grace to you and peace from god father of us and the lord jesus christ.
46.1.4.1^i thank the god of me always concerning you for the grace - of god - having been given you in christ jesus,
46.1.5.1^that in everything you have been enriched in him, in all speech and all knowledge,
46.1.6.1^as the testimony about christ was confirmed in you,
46.1.7.1^so as for you not to be lacking in not one gift, eagerly awaiting the revelation of the lord of us jesus christ,
46.1.8.1^who also will sustain you to the end, blameless in the day of the lord of us jesus christ.
46.1.9.1^faithful is - god, by whom you were called into fellowship with the son of him, jesus christ, the lord of us.
46.1.10.1^i exhort now you, brothers, by the name of the lord of us jesus christ, that the same thing you speak all, and not there be among you divisions;
46.1.10.2^you may be however having been knit together in the same mind and in the same judgment.
46.1.11.1^it was shown for to me concerning you, brothers of me, by those of chloe, that quarrels among you there are.
46.1.12.1^i mean now this, that each of you says, i indeed am of paul, i and of apollos, i and of cephas,  i and of christ.
46.1.13.1^has been divided - christ?
46.1.13.2^not paul was crucified for you?
46.1.13.3^or into the name of paul were you baptized?
46.1.14.1^i thank - god that no one of you i baptized, if not crispus and gaius,
46.1.15.1^so that not anyone should say that into - my name you were baptized.
46.1.16.1^i baptized now also the of stephanas household;
46.1.16.2^as to the rest, not i know whether any other i baptized.
46.1.17.1^not for sent me christ to baptize, but to preach the gospel, not in wisdom of discourse, that not be emptied of power the cross of the christ.
46.1.18.1^the message for - of the cross, to those indeed perishing foolishness is;
46.1.18.2^those however being saved, to us, power of god it is.
46.1.19.1^it has been written for:
46.1.19.2^i will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and the intelligence of the intelligent i will frustrate.
46.1.20.1^where is the wise?
46.1.20.2^where the scribe?
46.1.20.3^where the debater the age of this?
46.1.20.4^not has made foolish - god the wisdom of the world?
46.1.21.1^since for in the wisdom - of god, not knew the world through the wisdom - god, was pleased - god, through the foolishness of the proclamation, to save those believing.
46.1.22.1^seeing that both jews signs ask for, and greeks wisdom seek,
46.1.23.1^we however preach christ having been crucified, to the jewish indeed a stumbling block, to gentiles now foolishness;
46.1.24.1^to them however the called, jews both and greeks, christ of god the power and of god the wisdom.
46.1.25.1^for the foolishness - of god wiser - than men is, and the weakness - of god stronger - than men.
46.1.26.1^consider for the calling of you, brothers, that not many wise according to flesh were, not many powerful, not many of noble birth.
46.1.27.1^but the foolish things of the world has chosen - god that he might shame the wise;
46.1.27.2^and the weak things of the world chose - god that he might shame the strong;
46.1.28.1^and the low-born of the world, and the things being despised, chose - god, also the things not being, that the things being he might annul,
46.1.29.1^so that not might boast all flesh before - god.
46.1.30.1^out of him however, you are in christ jesus, who has been made wisdom unto us from god, righteousness and also sanctification and redemption,
46.1.31.1^in order that, as it has been written:
46.1.31.2^the one boasting, in the lord let him boast.
46.2.1.1^and i, having come to you, brothers, came not according to excellency of speech, or wisdom, proclaiming to you the mystery - of god.
46.2.2.1^nothing for i decided anything to know among you, if not jesus christ, and him having been crucified.
46.2.3.1^and i, in weakness, and in fear, and in trembling much, was with you.
46.2.4.1^and the message of me and the preaching of me were not in persuasive of wisdom words, but in demonstration of the spirit and of power,
46.2.5.1^so that the faith of you not might be in wisdom of men, but in power of god.
46.2.6.1^wisdom however we speak among the mature;
46.2.6.2^wisdom however, not the age of this, nor of the rulers the age of this, who are coming to naught.
46.2.7.1^but we speak of god wisdom in a mystery, - having been hidden, which foreordained - god before the ages for glory of us,
46.2.8.1^which none of the rulers the age of this has understood;
46.2.8.2^if for they had understood it, not - the lord - of glory they would have crucified,
46.2.9.1^but as it has been written:
46.2.9.2^what eye not has seen, and ear not has heard, and into heart of man not has entered, what has prepared - god for those loving him.
46.2.10.1^to us for has revealed it - god through the spirit.
46.2.10.2^the for spirit all things searches, even the depths - of god.
46.2.11.1^who for knows among men the things of the man, if not the spirit of the man that is within him?
46.2.11.2^so also the things - of god no one knows, if not the spirit - of god.
46.2.12.1^we now, not the spirit of the world have received, but the spirit who is from - god, that we may know the things by - god having been granted to us,
46.2.13.1^which also we speak, not in taught of human wisdom words, but in those taught of the spirit, by spiritual means spiritual things communicating.
46.2.14.1^the natural however man not accepts the things of the spirit - of god;
46.2.14.2^foolishness for to him they are, and not he is able to understand them, because spiritually they are discerned.
46.2.15.1^he who is however spiritual judges - all things he himself, however by no one is judged.
46.2.16.1^who for has known the mind of the lord?
46.2.16.2^who will instruct him?
46.2.16.3^we however the mind of christ have.
46.3.1.1^and i brothers not was able to speak to you as to spiritual, but as to fleshly, as to infants in christ.
46.3.2.1^milk you i gave to drink, not solid food, not yet for were you able.
46.3.2.2^in fact, not still now are you able;
46.3.3.1^still for fleshly you are.
46.3.3.2^where for are among you jealousy and strife, not fleshly are you, and according to man are walking?
46.3.4.1^when for might say one, i indeed am of paul, another however, i of apollos, not fleshly are you?
46.3.5.1^who then is apollos?
46.3.5.2^who now is paul?
46.3.5.3^servants through whom you believed, also to each as the lord has given?
46.3.6.1^i planted, apollos watered, but - god kept it growing.
46.3.7.1^so neither the one planting is anything, nor the one watering, but only the one giving growth   god.
46.3.8.1^the one planting now and the one watering, one are;
46.3.8.2^each now the own reward will receive, according to the own labor.
46.3.9.1^of god for we are fellow workers;
46.3.9.2^god s field, god s building you are.
46.3.10.1^according to the grace - of god - having been given to me, as a wise master builder the foundation i have laid;
46.3.10.2^another however is building upon it.
46.3.10.3^each one however let take heed how he builds upon it.
46.3.11.1^foundation for another, no one is able to lay, besides the one being already laid, which is jesus christ.
46.3.12.1^if now anyone builds upon the foundation gold, silver, stones precious, wood, hay, straw,
46.3.13.1^of each the work manifest will become;
46.3.13.2^the for day will disclose it, because in fire it is revealed;
46.3.13.3^and of each the work, what sort it is, the fire itself will prove.
46.3.14.1^if of anyone the work will remain which he built up, a reward he will receive.
46.3.15.1^if of anyone the work will be burned up, he will suffer loss;
46.3.15.2^he himself however will be saved, so however as through fire.
46.3.16.1^not know you that temple of god you yourselves are, and the spirit - of god dwells?
46.3.16.2^in you
46.3.17.1^if anyone the temple - of god destroys, will destroy him - god;
46.3.17.2^- for the temple - of god holy is, which are you.
46.3.18.1^no one himself let deceive;
46.3.18.2^if anyone thinks himself wise to be among you in the age this, foolish let him become, so that he may become wise.
46.3.19.1^the for wisdom of the world this, foolishness with - god is.
46.3.19.2^it has been written for:
46.3.19.3^he is the one catching the wise in the craftiness of them.
46.3.20.1^and again, the lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are futile.
46.3.21.1^therefore no one let boast in men.
46.3.21.2^all things for of you are,
46.3.22.1^whether paul, or apollos, or cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come  all yours,
46.3.23.1^you now of christ, christ now of god.
46.4.1.1^so us, let regard a man as servants of christ and stewards of the mysteries of god.
46.4.2.1^in this case moreover, it is required in the stewards, that faithful one shall be found.
46.4.3.1^me however to the smallest matter it is, that by you i be examined, or by a human court.
46.4.3.2^in fact neither myself do i examine.
46.4.4.1^nothing for against myself i am conscious of, yet not by this have i been justified;
46.4.4.2^the one however judging me the lord is.
46.4.5.1^so then, not before the time anything judge, until - shall have come the lord, who both will bring to light the hidden things - of darkness, and will make manifest the motives of the hearts;
46.4.5.2^and then the praise will come to each from - god.
46.4.6.1^these things now, brothers, i have applied to myself and apollos on account of you, so that in us you may learn -, not beyond what has been written, that not one for - one you be puffed up over the other.
46.4.7.1^who for you makes different?
46.4.7.2^what now have you which not you did receive?
46.4.7.3^if now also you did receive it, why boast you as not having received it?
46.4.8.1^already satiated you are;
46.4.8.2^already you have been enriched;
46.4.8.3^apart from us you reigned, and i wish that really you did reign, so that also we you might reign with.
46.4.9.1^i think for, - god us - apostles last has exhibited, as appointed to death, because a spectacle we have become to the world, both to angels and to men.
46.4.10.1^we are fools on account of christ, you however wise in christ;
46.4.10.2^we weak, you however strong;
46.4.10.3^you honored, we however without honor.
46.4.11.1^as far as the present hour, both we hunger and thirst, and are poorly clad, and are buffeted, and wander homeless,
46.4.12.1^and we toil, working with our own hands.
46.4.12.2^being reviled, we bless;
46.4.12.3^being persecuted, we endure;
46.4.13.1^being slandered, we entreat.
46.4.13.2^as the scum of the earth we have become, of all the refuse, until now.
46.4.14.1^not shaming you do i write these things, but as children my beloved, admonishing you.
46.4.15.1^if for ten thousand guardians you should have in christ, yet not many fathers;
46.4.15.2^in for christ jesus, through the gospel, i you have begotten.
46.4.16.1^i exhort therefore you, imitators of me become.
46.4.17.1^on account of this i sent to you timothy, who is my child, beloved and faithful in the lord, who you will remind of the ways of me that are in christ jesus, as everywhere in every church i teach.
46.4.18.1^as to not coming now of me to you, have become puffed up some.
46.4.19.1^i will come however shortly to you, if the lord wills, and i will find out not the talk of those being puffed up, but the power.
46.4.20.1^not for in word the kingdom - of god is, but in power.
46.4.21.1^what desire you?
46.4.21.2^with a rod i should come to you, or in love, a spirit then of gentleness?
46.5.1.1^actually is reported among you sexual immorality, and such sexual immorality as not even among the pagans, so as for the wife one of the father to have.
46.5.2.1^and you puffed up are, and not rather have mourned, so that might be taken out of midst of you the one the deed this having done!
46.5.3.1^i indeed, though being absent - in body, being present now - in spirit, already have judged as being present the one so this having produced,
46.5.4.1^in the name of the lord our jesus having been gathered together you, and - of me in spirit, with the power of the lord of us jesus,
46.5.5.1^to deliver - such a one - to satan for destruction of the flesh, so that the spirit may be saved in the day of the lord.
46.5.6.1^not good is the boasting of you.
46.5.6.2^not know you that a little leaven all the lump leavens?
46.5.7.1^cleanse out the old leaven, that you may be a new lump, as you are, unleavened.
46.5.7.2^also for the passover lamb of us has been sacrificed, christ,
46.5.8.1^so that we might celebrate the feast, not with leaven old, not with leaven of malice and wickedness, but with unleavened bread of sincerity and of truth.
46.5.9.1^i wrote to you in the letter not to associate with the sexually immoral,
46.5.10.1^not altogether with the sexually immoral the world of this, or with the covetous and swindlers, or idolaters   since you would need then from the world to depart.
46.5.11.1^now however, i wrote to you not to associate with him if anyone a brother being designated, he is sexually immoral or a coveter, or an idolater or verbal abuser, or a drunkard, or swindler   with such a one not even to eat.
46.5.12.1^what for is it to me those outside to judge?
46.5.12.2^not those within you do judge?
46.5.13.1^those however outside - god will judge.
46.5.13.2^expel the evil out from yourselves that.
46.6.1.1^dare anyone of you, a matter having against the other, go to law before the unrighteous, and not before the saints?
46.6.2.1^or not know you that the saints the world will judge?
46.6.2.2^and if by you is to be judged the world, unworthy are you of cases of the smallest?
46.6.3.1^not know you that angels we will judge?
46.6.3.2^- how much more the things of this life?
46.6.4.1^the things of this life indeed so, judgment as to if you have, the ones being despised in the church, those set you up!
46.6.5.1^for shame to you i say this.
46.6.5.2^thus not is there among you no one, a wise man, who will be able to decide in between the brother of him?
46.6.6.1^instead, brother against brother goes to law, and this before unbelievers!
46.6.7.1^already indeed therefore altogether a defeat for you it is, that lawsuits you have among one another.
46.6.7.2^because of why not rather suffer wrong?
46.6.7.3^because of why not rather be defrauded?
46.6.8.1^but you do wrong and defraud, and these things to brothers!
46.6.9.1^or not know you that the unrighteous ones of god the kingdom not will inherit?
46.6.9.2^not be deceived:
46.6.9.3^neither the sexually immoral, nor idolaters, nor adulterers, nor effeminate, nor homosexuals,
46.6.10.1^nor thieves, nor coveters, not drunkards, nor verbal abusers, nor swindlers, the kingdom of god will inherit.
46.6.11.1^and such some of you were;
46.6.11.2^but you were washed, but you were sanctified, but you were justified, in the name of the lord jesus christ and by the spirit of the god of us.
46.6.12.1^all things to me are lawful, but not all things do profit.
46.6.12.2^all things to me are lawful, but not i will be mastered by anything.
46.6.13.1^the foods for the belly and the belly the for foods, - but god both this and these will destroy;
46.6.13.2^- and the body is not - for sexual immorality, but for the lord, and the lord for the body.
46.6.14.1^- and god both the lord has raised up, and us will raise out, by the power of him.
46.6.15.1^not know you that the bodies of you members of christ are?
46.6.15.2^having taken then the members of the christ, shall i make them of a prostitute members?
46.6.15.3^never may it be!
46.6.16.1^or not know you that the one being joined to the prostitute, one body is?
46.6.16.2^will become,  for it says, the two into flesh one.
46.6.17.1^the one however being joined to the lord, one spirit is.
46.6.18.1^flee - sexual immorality.
46.6.18.2^every sin, whatever if might do a man, outside the body is;
46.6.18.3^the one however sinning sexually, against the own body sins.
46.6.19.1^or not know you that the body of you a temple of the in you holy spirit is, whom you have from god?
46.6.19.2^and not you are your own,
46.6.20.1^you were bought for with a price;
46.6.20.2^glorify therefore - god in the body of you.
46.7.1.1^concerning now the things about which you wrote:
46.7.1.2^it is good for a man a woman not to touch.
46.7.2.1^because of however - sexual immorality, each man the own of him wife let have, and each woman the own husband let have.
46.7.3.1^to the wife, the husband the duty let fulfill;
46.7.3.2^likewise now also, the wife to the husband.
46.7.4.1^the wife, the own body not has authority over, but the husband;
46.7.4.2^likewise now, also the husband of the own body not has authority over, but the wife.
46.7.5.1^not deprive one another, if not - by mutual agreement, for a time, that you might be at leisure - for prayer;
46.7.5.2^and again, together the same be, so that not may tempt you - satan, through the lack of self-control of you.
46.7.6.1^this now i say by way of concession, not by way of command.
46.7.7.1^i wish now all men to be like even myself.
46.7.7.2^but each his own has gift from god;
46.7.7.3^one has indeed this, one however that.
46.7.8.1^i say now to the unmarried and to the widows, it is good for them if they should remain as even i.
46.7.9.1^if however not they have self-control, let them marry;
46.7.9.2^better for it is to marry than to burn with passion.
46.7.10.1^to those now having married i give this charge   not i, but the lord   a wife from a husband not is to be separated;
46.7.11.1^if however indeed she is separated, let her remain unmarried, or to the husband be reconciled;
46.7.11.2^and a husband a wife not is to send away.
46.7.12.1^to the now rest i say   i not the lord:
46.7.12.2^if any brother a wife has unbelieving, and she consents to dwell with him, not let him divorce her.
46.7.13.1^and a woman if any has a husband unbelieving, and he consents to dwell with her, not let her divorce the husband.
46.7.14.1^is sanctified for the husband - unbelieving, in the wife;
46.7.14.2^and is sanctified the wife - unbelieving, in the husband;
46.7.14.3^else then the children of you unclean are;
46.7.14.4^now however holy they are.
46.7.15.1^if however the unbeliever separates himself, let him separate himself;
46.7.15.2^not is under bondage the brother or the sister in - such cases.
46.7.15.3^into however peace has called you - god.
46.7.16.1^how for know you, wife, if the husband you will save?
46.7.16.2^or how know you, husband, if the wife you will save?
46.7.17.1^if not to each, as has assigned the lord, to each as has called - god, so let him walk.
46.7.17.2^and thus in the churches all i prescribe.
46.7.18.1^having been circumcised anyone was called?
46.7.18.2^not let him be uncircumcised.
46.7.18.3^in uncircumcision was called anyone?
46.7.18.4^not let him be circumcised.
46.7.19.1^- circumcision nothing is, and - uncircumcision nothing is, but keeping the commandments of god.
46.7.20.1^each in the calling in which he has been called, in this let him abide.
46.7.21.1^slave being were you called, not to you let it be a care;
46.7.21.2^but if also you are able free to become, rather take advantage.
46.7.22.1^the one for in the lord having been called being a slave, a freedman of the lord is;
46.7.22.2^likewise the one free having been called, a slave is of christ.
46.7.23.1^with a price you were bought;
46.7.23.2^not become slaves of men.
46.7.24.1^each wherein that he was called, brothers, in that let him abide with god.
46.7.25.1^concerning now the virgins, a commandment of the lord not i have;
46.7.25.2^judgment however i give, as having received mercy from the lord, trustworthy to be.
46.7.26.1^i think therefore this good is, because of the present necessity, that it is good for a man - in the same manner to remain.
46.7.27.1^have you been bound to a wife?
46.7.27.2^not seek to be loosed.
46.7.27.3^have you been loosed from a wife?
46.7.27.4^not seek a wife.
46.7.28.1^if however also you shall have married, not you did sin;
46.7.28.2^and if shall have married the virgin, not she did sin;
46.7.28.3^tribulation however in the flesh will have - such;
46.7.28.4^i now you am sparing.
46.7.29.1^this now i say, brothers:
46.7.29.2^the season shortened is.
46.7.29.3^- from now on that both those having wives, as none having should be;
46.7.30.1^and those weeping, as not weeping;
46.7.30.2^and those rejoicing, as not rejoicing;
46.7.30.3^and those buying, as not possessing;
46.7.31.1^and those using the world, as not using it as their own.
46.7.31.2^is passing away for the present form of the world this.
46.7.32.1^i desire now you without concern to be.
46.7.32.2^the unmarried man cares for the things of the lord, how he should please the lord;
46.7.33.1^the one however having been married, cares for the things of the world, how he should please the wife,
46.7.34.1^and is divided.
46.7.34.2^and the woman - unmarried and - virgin, cares for the things of the lord, that she should be holy both in body and in spirit;
46.7.34.3^the one however having been married, cares for the things of the world, how she should please the husband.
46.7.35.1^this now for the of you yourselves benefit i say, not that a restraint you i might place upon, but for what is seemly and devoted to the lord, without distraction.
46.7.36.1^if however anyone to be behaving improperly to the virgin of him supposes, if she is beyond youth, and so it ought to be, what he wills let him do;
46.7.36.2^not he does sin;
46.7.36.3^let them marry.
46.7.37.1^he who however stands in the heart of him firm, not having necessity, authority however having over the own will, and this has judged, in the own heart, to keep - the virgin, well he will do.
46.7.38.1^so then also, the one marrying the own virgin, well does;
46.7.38.2^and the one not marrying, better will do.
46.7.39.1^a wife is bound for as long as time may live the husband of her;
46.7.39.2^if however shall have died the husband, free she is to whom she wills to be married, only in the lord.
46.7.40.1^more blessed however she is, if in the same manner she should remain, according to - my judgment;
46.7.40.2^i think now myself also the spirit of god to have.
46.8.1.1^concerning now the things sacrificed to idols, we know indeed all knowledge we have.
46.8.1.2^- knowledge puffs up, - but love builds up.
46.8.2.1^if anyone thinks to have known anything, not yet does he know as it is necessary to know.
46.8.3.1^if however anyone loves - god, he is known by him.
46.8.4.1^concerning the eating therefore of the things sacrificed to idols, we know that nothing an idol is in the world, and that there is no god, if not one.
46.8.5.1^even truly if indeed there are those called gods, whether in heaven or on earth, as there are gods many, and lords many,
46.8.6.1^yet to us there is one god, the father, of whom are the things all, and we for him;
46.8.6.2^and one lord, jesus christ, by whom are the things all, and we through him.
46.8.7.1^but not in all is this knowledge.
46.8.7.2^some now, - by habit until now, of the idol as of a thing sacrificed to an idol eat;
46.8.7.3^and the conscience of them weak being, it is defiled.
46.8.8.1^food however us not will commend to god;
46.8.8.2^neither if not we should eat do we come short, nor if we should eat have we an advantage.
46.8.9.1^be careful however, lest somehow the right of you this an occasion of stumbling becomes to those being weak.
46.8.10.1^if for anyone sees you, - having knowledge, in an idol s temple eating, not the conscience of him weak being, will be built up, so as the things sacrificed to idols to eat?
46.8.11.1^is destroyed for the one being weak through - your knowledge, the brother for whom christ died.
46.8.12.1^thus then sinning against the brothers and wounding their - conscience being weak, against christ you sin.
46.8.13.1^therefore if food snares the brother of me, never not shall i eat meat to the age, so that not the brother of me i might snare.
46.9.1.1^not am i free?
46.9.1.2^not am i an apostle?

46.9.1.4^not the work of me, you are, in the lord.

46.9.2.2^the for seal of my the apostleship, you are in the lord.
46.9.3.1^- my defense to those me examining is this.
46.9.4.1^no not have we the right to eat and to drink?
46.9.5.1^no not have we authority a sister, a wife, to take about, as also the other apostles, and the brothers of the lord, and cephas?

46.9.7.2^who plants a vineyard, and the fruit of it not does eat?
46.9.7.3^or who shepherds a flock, and from the milk of the flock not does drink?

46.9.12.1^if others of the over you authority partake, should not more we?
46.9.12.2^but not we did use the right this.
46.9.12.3^instead, all things we bear, so that not any hindrance we should place to the gospel of christ.
46.9.13.1^not know you that those in the temple working, the things of the temple eat;
46.9.13.2^those at the altar attending, in the altar partake?
46.9.14.1^so also, the lord has prescribed to those the gospel proclaiming from the gospel to live.
46.9.15.1^i however not have used none of these.
46.9.15.2^neither have i written now, these things that thus it should be with me;
46.9.15.3^it were good for me rather to die, than the boasting of me, anyone will make void.
46.9.16.1^if for i preach the gospel, nothing there is to me boasting;
46.9.16.2^necessity for me is laid upon.
46.9.16.3^woe however to me be, if not i should preach the gospel.
46.9.17.1^if for willingly this i do, a reward i have;
46.9.17.2^if however unwillingly, a stewardship i am entrusted with.
46.9.18.1^what then of me is the reward?
46.9.18.2^that in preaching the gospel free of charge, i should offer the gospel, so as - not to use up the right of me in the gospel.
46.9.19.1^free for being from all, to all myself i became servant, so that the more i might gain.
46.9.20.1^and i became to the jews, like a jew, so that jews i might win.
46.9.20.2^to those under the law, as under the law not being myself under the law so that those under the law i might win.
46.9.21.1^to those outside the law, like outside the law   not being outside the law of god, but under the law to christ   so that i might win those outside the law.
46.9.22.1^i became to the weak, weak, that the weak i might win.
46.9.22.2^these things to all i have become all, so that by all means, some i might save.
46.9.23.1^all things now i do on account of the gospel, that a fellow partaker with it i might become.
46.9.24.1^not know you that those in a race course running, all indeed run;
46.9.24.2^one however receives the prize?
46.9.24.3^thus run, that you might obtain it.
46.9.25.1^everyone now - striving, in all things controls himself;
46.9.25.2^they indeed then, that a perishable crown they might receive, we however an imperishable.
46.9.26.1^i therefore thus run, as not uncertainly;
46.9.26.2^so i fight, as not the air beating.
46.9.27.1^but i batter of me the body and bring it into servitude, not hardly to others having preached, myself disqualified i might be.

46.10.7.1^neither idolaters are you to be, as some of them;
46.10.7.2^as it has been written:
46.10.7.3^sat down the people to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

46.10.22.2^not stronger than he are we?

46.11.15.2^for the long hair instead of a covering is given to her.
46.11.16.1^if now anyone is inclined contentious to be, we such custom no other have, nor the churches - of god.

46.11.20.1^coming therefore of you together in one place, not it is the lord s supper to eat.

46.11.23.1^i for received from the lord that which also i delivered to you, that the lord jesus in the night in which he was betrayed, took bread,
46.11.24.1^and having given thanks, he broke it and said, this of me is the body, which is for you;
46.11.24.2^this do in - of me remembrance.

46.11.25.2^this do, as often as if you might drink it, in - of me remembrance.
46.11.26.1^as often as for if you may eat the bread this, and the cup may drink, the death of the lord you proclaim until that he should come.
46.11.27.1^therefore whoever - should eat the bread or should drink the cup of the lord unworthily, guilty will be of the body and of the blood of the lord.
46.11.28.1^let examine however a man himself, and in this manner of the bread let him eat, and of the cup let him drink.
46.11.29.1^the one for eating and drinking judgment on himself, eats and drinks not discerning the body.
46.11.30.1^because of this, among you many are weak and sick, and are fallen asleep many.
46.11.31.1^if for ourselves we were judging, not - we would come under judgment.
46.11.32.1^being judged however by the lord, we are disciplined, so that not with the world we should be condemned.
46.11.33.1^so then, brothers of me, coming together in order - to eat, one another wait for.
46.11.34.1^if anyone is hungry, at home let him eat, so that not for judgment you might come together.
46.11.34.2^- and the other things, as soon as - i might come, i will set in order.
46.12.1.1^concerning now - spiritual gifts, brothers, not i do want you to be ignorant.
46.12.2.1^you know that when pagans you were, to - idols - mute, even as - you were led, being carried away.
46.12.3.1^therefore i make known to you that no one in the spirit of god speaking, says accursed is jesus, and no one is able to say, lord is jesus, if not in the spirit holy.
46.12.4.1^varieties now of gifts there are, - but the same spirit;
46.12.5.1^and varieties of services there are, but the same lord;
46.12.6.1^and varieties of workings there are, the but same god - is working the all things in everyone.
46.12.7.1^to each now is given the manifestation of the spirit for the common profiting.
46.12.8.1^to one truly for through the spirit is given a word of wisdom, to another now a word of knowledge, according to the same spirit,
46.12.9.1^and to a different one, faith by the same spirit, to another now gifts of healing in that one spirit,
46.12.10.1^to another now working of miracles, to another now prophecy, to another now distinguishing of spirits, and to a different one various kinds of tongues, to another now interpretation of tongues.
46.12.11.1^all now these things works the one and the same spirit, apportioning individually to each as he wills.
46.12.12.1^just as for the body one is, and members many has, all now the members of the body, many being, one are body;
46.12.12.2^so also is - christ.
46.12.13.1^also for in one spirit, we all into one body were baptized, whether jews or greeks, whether slaves or free;
46.12.13.2^and all one spirit we were made to drink.
46.12.14.1^also for the body not is one member, but many.
46.12.15.1^if should say the foot, because not i am a hand, not i am of the body, not on account of this, not is it of the body.
46.12.16.1^and if should say the ear, because not i am an eye, not i am of the body, not on account of this, not is it of the body.
46.12.17.1^if all the body were an eye, where would be the hearing?
46.12.17.2^if all were hearing, where would be the sense of smell?
46.12.18.1^now however, - god has arranged the members, one each of them in the body, as he desired.
46.12.19.1^if now were - all one member, where would be the body?
46.12.20.1^now however, many even are the members, one however body.
46.12.21.1^not is able now the eye to say to the hand, need of you not i have.
46.12.21.2^or again the head to the feet, need of you not i have.
46.12.22.1^but much rather, those seeming members of the body weaker to be, indispensable are;
46.12.23.1^and those which we think less honorable to be of the body, these honor more abundant we bestow;
46.12.23.2^and the unpresentable parts of us, decorum more abundant have;
46.12.24.1^- and the presentable parts of us, no need have.
46.12.24.2^but - god has composed the body, to the parts being deficient more abundant having given honor,
46.12.25.1^that not there should be division in the body, but the same for one another should have concern, the members.
46.12.26.1^and if suffers one member, suffer with it all the members;
46.12.26.2^if is honored one member, rejoice with it all the members.
46.12.27.1^you now are the body of christ, and members in particular.
46.12.28.1^and some indeed has appointed - god in the church, first apostles, secondly prophets, third teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healing, helping, administrating, various kinds of tongues.
46.12.29.1^not are all apostles?
46.12.29.2^not all prophets?
46.12.29.3^not all teachers?
46.12.29.4^not have all miracles?
46.12.30.1^not all gifts have of healings?
46.12.30.2^not all in tongues do speak?
46.12.30.3^not all do interpret?
46.12.31.1^be desirous of however the gifts - greater.
46.12.31.2^and now, according to a more surpassing way, to you i show.
46.13.1.1^if in the tongues - of men i speak, and - of angels, love however not have, i have become a brass sounding, or a cymbal clanging.
46.13.2.1^and if i should have prophecy and understand the mysteries all, and all the knowledge, and if i should have all the faith, so as mountains to remove, love however not have, nothing i am.
46.13.3.1^even if i may give away all the possessions of me, and if i may deliver up the body of me that i may boast, love however not have, nothing i am profited.
46.13.4.1^- love is patient, is kind;
46.13.4.2^- love not is envious;
46.13.4.3^- love not is boastful, not is puffed up,
46.13.5.1^not acts unbecomingly;
46.13.5.2^not seeks the things of its own, not is easily provoked, not it keeps account - of wrongs;
46.13.6.1^not delights at - unrighteousness, rejoices however in the truth.
46.13.7.1^all things it bears, all things believes, all things hopes, all things endures.
46.13.8.1^- love never fails;
46.13.8.2^if however there are prophesies, they will be done away;
46.13.8.3^if tongues, they will be ceased;
46.13.8.4^if knowledge it will pass away.
46.13.9.1^in part for we know, and in part we prophesy;
46.13.10.1^when however should come the perfect, the in part will be done away.
46.13.11.1^when i was a child, i was speaking like a child, i was thinking like a child, i was reasoning like a child;
46.13.11.2^when i became a man, i did away with the things of the child.
46.13.12.1^we see for presently, through a glass in obscurity;
46.13.12.2^then however, face to face;
46.13.12.3^presently, i know in part;
46.13.12.4^then however i will know fully, as also i have been fully known.
46.13.13.1^now however abide faith, hope, love, the things three these;
46.13.13.2^the greatest however of these is - love.
46.14.1.1^earnestly pursue - love;
46.14.1.2^earnestly desire now - spiritual gifts, especially now that you might prophesy.
46.14.2.1^the one for speaking in a tongue, not to men speaks, but to god;
46.14.2.2^no one for hears;
46.14.2.3^in the spirit however, he utters mysteries.
46.14.3.1^the one however prophesying, to men speaks for edification, and encouragement, and consolation.
46.14.4.1^the one speaking in a tongue, himself edifies;
46.14.4.2^the one however prophesying, the church edifies.
46.14.5.1^i desire now all you to speak in tongues, rather however that you should prophesy;
46.14.5.2^greater is now the one prophesying than the one speaking in tongues, except if not he should interpret, so that the church edification might receive.
46.14.6.1^now however brothers, if i should come to you in tongues speaking, what you will i profit, if not to you i should speak either in revelation, or in knowledge, or in prophecy, or in teaching?
46.14.7.1^even - lifeless things a sound giving, whether flute or harp, if distinction to the sounds not they give, how will it be known what is being piped or - being harped?
46.14.8.1^also for if indistinct the trumpet sound gives, who will prepare himself for battle?
46.14.9.1^so also you, with the tongue if not intelligible speech you give, how will it be known what is being spoken?
46.14.9.2^you will be for into the air speaking.
46.14.10.1^so many if it may be kinds of languages there are in the world, and none without meaning.
46.14.11.1^if therefore not i know the power of the sound, i will be to the one speaking a foreigner, and the one speaking to me a foreigner.
46.14.12.1^so also you, since zealous you are of spiritual gifts, for the edification of the church, search that you should cause it to abound.
46.14.13.1^therefore the one speaking in a tongue, let him pray that he might interpret.
46.14.14.1^if for i pray in a tongue, the spirit of me prays, - but the mind of me unfruitful is.
46.14.15.1^what then is it?
46.14.15.2^i will pray with the spirit, i will pray however also with the mind.
46.14.15.3^i will sing praise with the spirit, i will sing praise however also with the mind.
46.14.16.1^otherwise if you bless with the spirit, the one filling the place of the uninstructed, how will he say the amen at - your thanksgiving, since what you say not he knows?
46.14.17.1^you truly for well are giving thanks, but the other not is edified.
46.14.18.1^i thank - god than all of you more, in tongues speaking;
46.14.19.1^but in the church, i desire five words with the mind of me to speak that also others i might instruct, rather than ten thousand words in a tongue.
46.14.20.1^brothers, not children be in the minds.
46.14.20.2^yet in the evil, be little children;
46.14.20.3^in the however thinking, full grown be.
46.14.21.1^in the law it has been written -:
46.14.21.2^by other tongues, and by lips other, i will speak to the people this, and not even thus will they hear me, says the lord.
46.14.22.1^so then - tongues for a sign are, not to those believing, but to the unbelieving;
46.14.22.2^- but prophecy is not to the unbelieving, but to the believing.
46.14.23.1^if therefore gathers the church whole together the place, and all should speak in tongues, come in however uninstructed ones or unbelievers, not will they say that you are mad?
46.14.24.1^if however all prophesy, should come in then some unbeliever or uninstructed, he is convicted by all, he is examined by all,
46.14.25.1^the secrets of the heart of him manifest become.
46.14.25.2^and thus having fallen upon his face, he will worship - god, declaring that certainly - god among you is.
46.14.26.1^what then is it, brothers?
46.14.26.2^when you may come together, each a psalm has, a teaching has, a revelation has, a tongue has, an interpretation has.
46.14.26.3^all things for edification let be done.
46.14.27.1^if with a tongue anyone speaks, let it be by two or the most three, and in turn;
46.14.27.2^and one let interpret.
46.14.28.1^if however not there is an interpreter, let him be silent in the church;
46.14.28.2^to himself then let him speak, and - to god.
46.14.29.1^prophets then, two or three let speak, and the others let discern.
46.14.30.1^if however to another a revelation should be made sitting by, the first let be silent.
46.14.31.1^you are able for one by one all to prophesy, so that all may learn and all may be exhorted.
46.14.32.1^and spirits of prophets, to prophets are subject.
46.14.33.1^not for he is of disorder the god, but of peace.
46.14.33.2^as in all the churches of the saints,
46.14.34.1^the women in the churches let them be silent.
46.14.34.2^not for it is allowed to them to speak, but to be in submission, as also the law says.
46.14.35.1^if however anything to learn they desire, at home the own husbands let them ask;
46.14.35.2^shameful for it is for a woman to speak in the church.
46.14.36.1^or from you the word - of god has gone out?
46.14.36.2^or to you only has it come?
46.14.37.1^if anyone considers a prophet himself to be, or spiritual, let him recognize the things i write to you that of the lord are the commands.
46.14.38.1^if however anyone is ignorant, let him be ignored.
46.14.39.1^so, brothers of me, earnestly desire - to prophesy, and - to speak not do forbid in tongues.
46.14.40.1^all things however properly and with order let be done.
46.15.1.1^i make known now to you, brothers, the gospel that i proclaimed to you, which also you received, in which also you stand,
46.15.2.1^by which also you are being saved, to the word i proclaimed to you, if you hold fast;
46.15.2.2^unless if not, in vain you have believed.
46.15.3.1^i delivered for to you in the foremost what also i received, that christ died for the sins of us according to the scriptures,
46.15.4.1^and that he was buried, and that he was raised the day the third according to the scriptures,
46.15.5.1^and that he appeared to cephas, then to the twelve.
46.15.6.1^thereafter he appeared to more than five hundred brothers at once, of whom the greater part remain until now;
46.15.6.2^some however have fallen asleep.
46.15.7.1^then he appeared to james, then to the apostles all.
46.15.8.1^last then of all, as the untimely birth, he appeared also to me.
46.15.9.1^i for am the least of the apostles, who not am fit to be called an apostle, because i persecuted the church - of god.
46.15.10.1^by the grace however of god, i am what i am, and the grace of him - toward me not void has been.
46.15.10.2^rather, more abundantly than them all i toiled, not i however, but the grace - of god that was with me.
46.15.11.1^whether therefore i or they, thus we preach, and thus you believed.
46.15.12.1^if now christ is preached that out from the dead he has been raised, how say among you some that a resurrection of the dead not there is?
46.15.13.1^if however a resurrection of the dead not there is, neither christ has been raised;
46.15.14.1^if then christ not has been raised, is void then also the preaching of us, void also the faith of you.
46.15.15.1^we are found then also false witnesses - of god, because we have witnessed concerning - god, that he raised up - christ, whom not he has raised if then the dead not are raised.
46.15.16.1^if for the dead not are raised, neither christ has been raised;
46.15.17.1^if then christ not has been raised, is futile the faith of you still you are in the sins of you.
46.15.18.1^then also those having fallen asleep in christ have perished.
46.15.19.1^if in the life this, in christ having hope we are, only, more to be pitied than all men we are.
46.15.20.1^now however christ has been raised out from the dead, firstfruit of those having fallen asleep.
46.15.21.1^since for by a man came death, also by a man resurrection of the dead.
46.15.22.1^for as indeed in - adam all die, so also in - christ, all will be made alive.
46.15.23.1^each however in the own order:
46.15.23.2^the firstfruit christ, then those of christ at the coming of him;
46.15.24.1^then the end, when he shall hand over the kingdom to the god and father, when he shall have annulled all dominion and all authority and power.
46.15.25.1^it behooves for him to reign until that he shall have put all the enemies under the feet of him.
46.15.26.1^the last enemy to be abolished is - death.
46.15.27.1^all things,  for he has put in subjection, under the feet of him.
46.15.27.2^when however it may be said that all things have been put in subjection, it is evident that is excepted the one having put in subjection to him - all things.
46.15.28.1^when now shall have been put in subjection to him - all things, then also himself the son will be put in subjection to the one having put in subjection to him - all things, so that may be - god - all in all.
46.15.29.1^otherwise what will they do who are baptized for the dead?
46.15.29.2^if at all the dead not are raised, why also are they baptized for them?
46.15.30.1^why also, we are in danger every hour?
46.15.31.1^every day i die, as surely as the in you boasting, brothers which i have in christ jesus the lord of us.
46.15.32.1^if according to man, i fought wild beasts in ephesus, what to me the profit?
46.15.32.2^if the dead not are raised, let us eat and let us drink, tomorrow for we die.
46.15.33.1^not be misled:
46.15.33.2^do corrupt morals good, companionships bad.
46.15.34.1^sober up righteously and not sin;
46.15.34.2^ignorance for of god some have;
46.15.34.3^to the shame of you i speak.
46.15.35.1^but will say someone, how are raised the dead?
46.15.35.2^with what then body do they come?
46.15.36.1^fool you!
46.15.36.2^what you sow not does come to life, if not it dies.
46.15.37.1^and what you sow, not the body that will be you sow, but a bare grain, if it may be of wheat, or of some of the rest.
46.15.38.1^- but god gives it a body, as he has willed, and to each of the seeds, its own body.
46.15.39.1^not all flesh is the same flesh, but one indeed of men, another now flesh of beasts, another now flesh of birds, another now of fish.
46.15.40.1^and bodies there are heavenly, and bodies earthly.
46.15.40.2^but one truly is the of the heavenly glory, another now that of the earthly.
46.15.41.1^one is the glory of the sun, and another the glory of the moon, and another the glory of the stars;
46.15.41.2^star for from star differs in glory.
46.15.42.1^so also is the resurrection of the dead.
46.15.42.2^it is sown in decay, it is raised in immortality.
46.15.43.1^it is sown in dishonor, it is raised in glory.
46.15.43.2^it is sown in weakness, it is raised in power.
46.15.44.1^it is sown a body natural, it is raised a body spiritual.
46.15.44.2^if there is a body natural, there is also spiritual.
46.15.45.1^so also it has been written:
46.15.45.2^became the first man adam into a soul living;
46.15.45.3^the last adam into a spirit life-giving.
46.15.46.1^however not first was the spiritual, but the natural, then the spiritual.
46.15.47.1^the first man was from the earth, made of dust;
46.15.47.2^the second man from heaven.
46.15.48.1^as the one made of dust, so also are those of the earth;
46.15.48.2^and as the heavenly one, so also those of heaven.
46.15.49.1^and as we have born the image of the earthly, we shall bear also the image of the heavenly.
46.15.50.1^this now i say, brothers, that flesh and blood, the kingdom of god to inherit not is able, nor the decay, the immortality does inherit.
46.15.51.1^behold, a mystery to you i tell.
46.15.51.2^all not we will sleep;
46.15.51.3^all however we will be changed
46.15.52.1^in an instant, in the twinkling of an eye, at the last trumpet.
46.15.52.2^the trumpet will sound for, and the dead will be raised imperishable, and we will be changed.
46.15.53.1^it behooves for the perishable this, to put on imperishable;
46.15.53.2^and the mortal this, to put on immortality.
46.15.54.1^when now the perishable this shall have put on the imperishable, and the mortal this shall have put on immortality, then will come to pass the word - having been written:
46.15.54.2^has been swallowed up - death in victory.
46.15.55.1^where of you, o death, the victory?
46.15.55.2^where of you, o death, the sting?
46.15.56.1^- and the sting - of death is - sin;
46.15.56.2^- and the power - of sin, the law;
46.15.57.1^to however god be thanks, the one giving us the victory through the lord of us jesus christ.
46.15.58.1^therefore, brothers of me beloved, steadfast be, immovable, abounding in the work of the lord always, knowing that the toil of you not is in vain in the lord.
46.16.1.1^concerning now the collection which is for the saints, as i have directed the churches - of galatia, so also you are to do.
46.16.2.1^every first of the week, each of you aside him let put, treasuring up - what if he may be prospered in, so that not when i might come then collections there should be.
46.16.3.1^when then i shall have arrived, whomever if you might approve, with letters these i will send to carry the bounty of you to jerusalem.
46.16.4.1^if then suitable it is for me also to go, with me they will go.
46.16.5.1^i will come however to you, when macedonia i shall have gone through;
46.16.5.2^macedonia for i am going through.
46.16.6.1^with you then possibly i will stay, or even i will winter, so that you me may equip, wherever if i may go.
46.16.7.1^not i want for you now in passing to see;
46.16.7.2^i hope indeed a time certain to remain with you, if the lord permits.
46.16.8.1^i will remain however in ephesus until - pentecost.
46.16.9.1^a door for to me has opened great and productive, and are opposing many.
46.16.10.1^if now comes timothy, see that without fear he might be with you;
46.16.10.2^the for work of the lord he is doing, as also i.
46.16.11.1^not anyone therefore him should despise.
46.16.11.2^equip however him in peace, so that he might come to me;
46.16.11.3^i am expecting for him, with the brothers.
46.16.12.1^concerning now apollos the brother, greatly i exhorted him that he should go to you with the brothers, and at all not was his will that now he should come;
46.16.12.2^he will come however when he shall have opportunity.
46.16.13.1^watch you;
46.16.13.2^stand firm in the faith;
46.16.13.3^act like men;
46.16.13.4^be strong.
46.16.14.1^all things of you, in love let be done.
46.16.15.1^i exhort now you, brothers, you know the house of stephanas, that it is firstfruit - of achaia, and to service to the saints, they have devoted themselves,
46.16.16.1^that also you be subject - to such as these, and to everyone - joining in the work and laboring.
46.16.17.1^i rejoice however at the coming of stephanas, and fortunatus, and achaicus;
46.16.17.2^because - your deficiency, these have filled up.
46.16.18.1^they refreshed for - my spirit and - yours.
46.16.18.2^recognize therefore - such as these.
46.16.19.1^greet you, the churches - of asia.
46.16.19.2^greet you in the lord heartily, aquila and prisca, with the at house of them church.
46.16.20.1^greet you, the brothers all.
46.16.20.2^greet one another with a kiss holy.
46.16.21.1^the greeting, the own hand of paul.
46.16.22.1^if anyone not loves the lord, let him be accursed.
46.16.22.2^marana tha!
46.16.23.1^the grace of the lord jesus be with you.
46.16.24.1^the love of me be with all you in christ jesus.
47.1.1.1^paul, apostle of christ jesus by the will of god, and timothy, the brother, to the church - of god - being in corinth, with the saints all - being in all - achaia.
47.1.2.1^grace to you and peace from god the father of us and the lord jesus christ.
47.1.3.1^blessed be the god and father of the lord of us jesus christ, the father - of compassions, and god of all comfort,
47.1.4.1^the one comforting us in all the tribulation of us, for - to be able us to comfort those in every tribulation through the comfort with which we are comforted ourselves by - god,
47.1.5.1^because as abound the sufferings of the christ toward us, thus so through - christ abounds also the comfort of us.
47.1.6.1^if however we are constricted, it is for - your comfort and salvation;
47.1.6.2^if we are encouraged, it is for - your comfort, - operating in the endurance of the same sufferings that also we suffer.
47.1.7.1^and the hope of us is steadfast for you, knowing that as partners you are of the sufferings, so also of the comfort.
47.1.8.1^not for do we want you to be ignorant brothers, as to the affliction of us - having happened in - asia, that against excessively beyond our power, we were weighed, so as to despair for us even - to live.
47.1.9.1^but we in ourselves, the sentence - of death had, in order that not trusting we should be in ourselves, but in - god, the one raising the dead,
47.1.10.1^who from such a great a death has delivered us, and will deliver us, in whom we have hope that also still he will deliver us,
47.1.11.1^joining together also of you for us by supplication, so that by many persons, for the toward us grace bestowed, through many, thanks may be given for us.
47.1.12.1^- for the boasting of us this is, the testimony of the conscience of us, that in the holiness and sincerity - of god, and not in wisdom fleshly, but in the grace of god, we have conducted ourselves in the world, more abundantly now toward you.
47.1.13.1^no for other things we write to you, other than what you read or even understand;
47.1.13.2^i hope now that to the end you will understand,
47.1.14.1^as also you have understood us in part, so that boasting of you we are, even as also you are ours, in the day of the lord of us jesus.
47.1.15.1^and with this - confidence i was planning previously to you to come, so that a second blessing of grace you might have,
47.1.16.1^and through you to pass through into macedonia, and again from macedonia to come to you, and by you to be set forward to - judea.
47.1.17.1^thus therefore purposing, not then - lightness did i use?
47.1.17.2^or what i purpose, according to flesh do i purpose, so that there should be with me - yes, yes, and - no, no?
47.1.18.1^faithful however - god is, that the word of us - to you not was yes  and no.
47.1.19.1^the - of god for son, jesus, christ the one among you by us having been proclaimed by me and silvanus and timothy, not was yes and no, but yes in him it has always been.
47.1.20.1^as many as for promises of god there are, in him is the yes.
47.1.20.2^therefore also in him the amen - to god is for glory by us.
47.1.21.1^the one now establishing us with you unto christ, and having anointed us, is god,
47.1.22.1^the one also having sealed us, and having given the pledge of the spirit in the hearts of us.
47.1.23.1^i however, as witness - god call upon - my soul, that sparing you, not yet have i come to corinth.
47.1.24.1^not that we lord it over your - faith, but fellow workers are of the joy with you;
47.1.24.2^in the for faith you stand firm.
47.2.1.1^i judged for within myself this, - not again in grief to you to come.
47.2.2.1^if for i grieve you again, who - is gladdening me, if not the one being grieved by me?
47.2.3.1^and i wrote this same thing, so that not, having come, grief i might have from those of whom it behooves me to rejoice, trusting in all you, that - my joy of all of you is.
47.2.4.1^out of for much affliction and anguish of heart i wrote to you through many tears, not that you might be grieved, but the love that you might know that i have more abundantly toward you.
47.2.5.1^if however anyone has caused grief, not me has he grieved, but in part   that not i might put it too severely   all you.
47.2.6.1^sufficient to such a one is the punishment this, which is by the majority,
47.2.7.1^so that on the contrary rather for you to forgive and to comfort him, lest perhaps - by more abundant sorrow should be overwhelmed - such a one.
47.2.8.1^therefore i exhort you to confirm toward him love.
47.2.9.1^for this indeed also did i write, so that i might know the proof of you, whether to everything obedient you are.
47.2.10.1^to whomever now anything you forgive, i also;
47.2.10.2^and for i, to whom i have forgiven, if anything i have forgiven, it is for the sake of you in the person of christ,
47.2.11.1^so that not we should be outwitted by - satan;
47.2.11.2^not for of his - schemes we are ignorant.
47.2.12.1^having come now to - troas for the gospel - of christ, also a door to me having been opened in the lord,
47.2.13.1^not i had rest in the spirit of me, in the not finding my titus the brother of me;
47.2.13.2^instead, having taken leave of them, i went out to macedonia.
47.2.14.1^to however god be thanks, the one always leading in triumph us in - christ, and the fragrance of the knowledge of him making manifest through us in every place.
47.2.15.1^for of christ a sweet perfume we are - to god in those being saved and in those perishing;
47.2.16.1^to one indeed an odor from death to death, to one now, a fragrance from life to life.
47.2.16.2^and for these things who is sufficient?
47.2.17.1^not for we are, like the many, peddling the word - of god;
47.2.17.2^but as of sincerity, but as of god, before god in christ we speak.
47.3.1.1^are we beginning again ourselves to commend?
47.3.1.2^or not we need, like some, commendatory letters to you or from you?
47.3.2.1^the letter of us you are, having been inscribed in the hearts of us, being known and being read by all men,
47.3.3.1^being revealed that you are a letter of christ, having been ministered to by us, having been inscribed not in ink but with the spirit of god the living, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of hearts human.
47.3.4.1^confidence now such we have through - christ toward - god.
47.3.5.1^not that from ourselves sufficient we are to reckon anything as of ourselves, but the sufficiency of us is of - god,
47.3.6.1^who also has made competent us as ministers of a new covenant, not of the letter but of the spirit;
47.3.6.2^the for letter kills, - but the spirit gives life.
47.3.7.1^if now the ministry - of death, in letters having been engraved on stones, was produced in glory, so as for not to be able to look intently the sons of israel into the face of moses, on account of the glory of the face of him, which is fading,
47.3.8.1^how not more, the ministry of the spirit will be in glory?
47.3.9.1^if for in the ministry - of condemnation was glory, much more abounds the ministry - of righteousness in glory!
47.3.10.1^even for, not has been glorified that having been made glorious in this - respect, on account of the surpassing it glory.
47.3.11.1^if for that which is fading away was through glory, much more is that remaining in glory!
47.3.12.1^having therefore such hope, great boldness we use,
47.3.13.1^and not as moses would put a veil over the face of himself, for - not to look intently the sons of israel into the end of that fading away.
47.3.14.1^but were hardened the minds of them.
47.3.14.2^until for the present day, the same veil at the reading of the old covenant remains, not being lifted, which in christ is being removed.
47.3.15.1^but unto this day, when - shall be read moses, a veil over the heart of them lies.
47.3.16.1^whenever however if one shall have turned to the lord, is taken away the veil.
47.3.17.1^the now lord the spirit is;
47.3.17.2^where now the spirit of the lord is, there is freedom.
47.3.18.1^we now all, having been unveiled in face, the glory of the lord beholding as in a mirror, the same image are being transformed into, from glory to glory, even as from the lord, the spirit.
47.4.1.1^because of this, having the ministry this, as we received mercy, not we lose heart.
47.4.2.1^but we have renounced the hidden things - of shame, not walking in craftiness nor falsifying the word - of god, but - by manifestation of the truth commending ourselves to every conscience of men before - god.
47.4.3.1^if however indeed is concealed the gospel of us, to those who are perishing it is concealed,
47.4.4.1^in whom the god of the age this has blinded the minds of the unbelieving, so as for - not to beam forth the illumination of the gospel of the glory - of christ, who is the image - of god.
47.4.5.1^not for ourselves do we proclaim, but jesus christ lord;
47.4.5.2^ourselves now, servants of you, for the sake of jesus.
47.4.6.1^for it is - god, - having said, out of darkness light shall shine,  who shone in the hearts of us for the radiance of the knowledge of the glory - of god in the face of jesus christ.
47.4.7.1^we have now the treasure this in earthen vessels, that the surpassingness of the power may be - from god, and not from us,
47.4.8.1^in every way being hard pressed, but not being crushed;
47.4.8.2^being perplexed, but not despairing;
47.4.9.1^being persecuted, but not being forsaken;
47.4.9.2^being struck down, but not being destroyed;
47.4.10.1^always the death - of jesus in our body carrying around, so that also the life - of jesus in the body of us should be manifested;
47.4.11.1^always for we the living to death are being delivered on account of jesus, so that also the life - of jesus may be manifested in the mortal flesh of us.
47.4.12.1^so then, - death in us works, - but life in you.
47.4.13.1^having however the same spirit - of faith, according to that having been written:
47.4.13.2^i believed, therefore i have spoken,  also we believe, therefore also speak,
47.4.14.1^knowing that the one having raised up the lord jesus, also us through jesus will raise up and will present us with you.
47.4.15.1^- for all things are for the sake of you, so that the grace having abounded through - more and more the thanksgiving may increase to the glory - of god.
47.4.16.1^therefore not we lose heart;
47.4.16.2^but if indeed the outward of us man is being brought to decay, yet the inner of us is being renewed day and day.
47.4.17.1^the for momentary lightness - affliction of us, far surpassing to excessiveness an eternal weight of glory is producing for us,
47.4.18.1^not are looking at we the things being seen, but the things not being seen.
47.4.18.2^the things for being seen are temporary;
47.4.18.3^the things however not being seen are eternal.
47.5.1.1^we know for that if - earthly of us house, the tent, should be destroyed, a building from god we have, a house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.
47.5.2.1^and indeed, in this we groan, the dwelling of us which is from heaven to be clothed with longing.
47.5.3.1^if indeed also having been clothed, not naked we will be found.
47.5.4.1^and for, - being in the tent, we groan, being burdened, because that not we do wish to be unclothed but to be clothed, that may be swallowed up the mortal by - life.
47.5.5.1^the one now having prepared us for very this is god, - having given to us the pledge of the spirit,
47.5.6.1^being confident therefore always and knowing that, being at home in the body, we are absent from the lord;
47.5.7.1^by faith for we walk, not by sight.
47.5.8.1^we are confident now, and are pleased, rather to be absent out of the body, and to be at home with the lord.
47.5.9.1^therefore also we are ambitious, whether being at home or being away, well-pleasing to him to be.
47.5.10.1^- for all of us to be revealed it behooves before the judgment seat - of christ, that may receive back each the things done in the body, according to what he did, whether good or evil.
47.5.11.1^knowing therefore the fear of the lord, men we persuade to god and we have been made manifest;
47.5.11.2^i hope now also in the consciences of you to have been made manifest.
47.5.12.1^not again ourselves are we commending to you, but occasion are giving to you of boasting on behalf of us, so that you may have an answer toward those in appearance boasting, and not in the heart.
47.5.13.1^if for we are beside ourselves, it is to god;
47.5.13.2^or if we are sober-minded it is for you.
47.5.14.1^the for love - of christ compels us, having concluded this, that one for all has died, therefore - all have died.
47.5.15.1^and for all he died, that those living, no longer to themselves should live, but to the one for them having died and having been raised again.
47.5.16.1^therefore we from - now no one regard according to the flesh.
47.5.16.2^though even we have regarded according to flesh christ, yet now no longer we regard him thus.
47.5.17.1^therefore if anyone is in christ, he is a new creation.
47.5.17.2^the old things have passed away;
47.5.17.3^behold, has come into being the new.
47.5.18.1^- and all things are of - god, the one having reconciled us to himself through christ, and having given to us the ministry - of reconciliation,
47.5.19.1^how that god was in christ the world reconciling to himself, not reckoning to them the trespasses of them, and having put into us the word - of reconciliation.
47.5.20.1^for christ therefore we are ambassadors, as though - god is beseeching through us.
47.5.20.2^we implore on behalf of christ:
47.5.20.3^be reconciled - to god.
47.5.21.1^the one not having known sin, for us sin he made, so that we might become the righteousness of god in him.
47.6.1.1^working together now also we exhort not in vain the grace - of god to receive you.
47.6.2.1^he says for:
47.6.2.2^in a time acceptable i listened to you, and in a day of salvation i helped you.
47.6.2.3^behold, now is the time of favor;
47.6.2.4^behold, now is the day of salvation.
47.6.3.1^nothing before no one placing an obstacle, so that not should be blemished the ministry,
47.6.4.1^rather, in everything, we are commending ourselves as god s servants, in endurance great, in tribulations, in hardships, in distresses,
47.6.5.1^in beatings, in imprisonments, in riots, in labors, in watchings, in fastings;
47.6.6.1^in purity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in the spirit holy, in love genuine;
47.6.7.1^in the word of truth, in the power of god;
47.6.7.2^with the weapons - of righteousness for the right hand and for the left;
47.6.8.1^through glory and dishonor, through bad report and good report;
47.6.8.2^as imposters, and yet true;
47.6.9.1^as being unknown, and yet being well-known;
47.6.9.2^as dying, and yet behold, we live;
47.6.9.3^as being disciplined, and yet not being killed;
47.6.10.1^as being sorrowful, always yet rejoicing;
47.6.10.2^as poor, many yet enriching;
47.6.10.3^as nothing having, and yet all things possessing.
47.6.11.1^the mouth of us has been opened to you, corinthians;
47.6.11.2^the heart of us has been expanded.
47.6.12.1^not you are restrained by us;
47.6.12.2^you are restrained however in the affections of you.
47.6.13.1^- now as the same recompense, as to children i speak, be expanded also you.
47.6.14.1^not become unequally yoked together with unbelievers;
47.6.14.2^what for partnership have righteousness and lawlessness?
47.6.14.3^or what fellowship light with darkness?
47.6.15.1^what now harmony christ with belial?
47.6.15.2^or what part to a believer with an unbeliever?
47.6.16.1^what now agreement the temple of god with idols?
47.6.16.2^we for the temple of god are, the living, as has said - god -:
47.6.16.3^i will dwell in them, and will walk among them;
47.6.16.4^and i will be their god, and they will be to me a people.
47.6.17.1^therefore come out from the midst of them and be separate, says the lord, and unclean nothing touch, and i will receive you.
47.6.18.1^and i will be to you for a father, and you will be to me for sons and daughters, says the lord almighty.
47.7.1.1^these therefore having - promises, beloved, we should cleanse ourselves from every defilement of flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in the fear of god.
47.7.2.1^make room for us;
47.7.2.2^no one we have wronged, no one we have corrupted, no one we have exploited.
47.7.3.1^for condemnation not i speak;
47.7.3.2^i have before said for that in the hearts of us you are, for us - to die together, and to live together.
47.7.4.1^great is my boldness toward you;
47.7.4.2^great my boasting on behalf of you;
47.7.4.3^i have been filled - with encouragement;
47.7.4.4^i overabound - with joy upon all the affliction of us.
47.7.5.1^and for having come of us into macedonia, no had rest the flesh of us;
47.7.5.2^but in every way we are being pressed:
47.7.5.3^on the outside conflicts, within fears.
47.7.6.1^but the one comforting the downcast comforted us, - god, by the coming of titus,
47.7.7.1^not only now by the coming of him, but also by the comfort with which he was comforted as to you;
47.7.7.2^relating to us - your earnest desire, - your mourning, - your zeal for me, so as for me the more to rejoice.
47.7.8.1^for if also i have grieved you in the letter, not i do regret it.
47.7.8.2^though even i did regret it;
47.7.8.3^i see indeed that the letter that, if even for an hour, grieved you.
47.7.9.1^now i rejoice, not that you were grieved, but that you were grieved unto repentance;
47.7.9.2^you were grieved for according to god, so that in nothing you might suffer loss through us.
47.7.10.1^the for, according to god grief, repentance to salvation without regret produces;
47.7.10.2^- and the of the world grief, death produces.
47.7.11.1^behold for, this very same thing, according to god to have been grieved, how much has produced in you earnestness, but instead reasoned defense, but indignation, but fear, but longing, but zeal, but vindication!
47.7.11.2^in everything, you have proved yourselves innocent to be in this matter.
47.7.12.1^so if even i wrote to you, it was not for the sake of the one having done wrong, nor for the sake of the one having suffered wrong, but rather for the sake of - being revealed the earnestness of you, which is for us to you before - god.
47.7.13.1^on account of this, we have been comforted.
47.7.13.2^besides now the comfort of us, the more abundantly rather we have rejoiced at the joy of titus, because has been refreshed the spirit of him by all of you.
47.7.14.1^for if anything to him about you i have boasted, not i was put to shame;
47.7.14.2^but as all things in truth we have spoken to you, so also the boasting of us - to titus, truth became.
47.7.15.1^and the affections of him more abundantly toward you are, remembering the of all of you obedience, how with fear and trembling you received him.
47.7.16.1^i rejoice that in everything i am confident in you.
47.8.1.1^we make known now to you, brothers, the grace - of god - having been bestowed among the churches - of macedonia,
47.8.2.1^that in much proof of tribulation, the abundance of the joy of them and - of deep poverty of them abounded into the riches the generosity of them.
47.8.3.1^for according to their ability, i testify that, and beyond their ability, they were willing of themselves,
47.8.4.1^with much entreaty imploring of us, for the grace and the fellowship of the service - among the saints.
47.8.5.1^and not only as we had hoped, but themselves they gave, first to the lord, and then to us, by the will of god.
47.8.6.1^accordingly - exhorted we titus, that as he had begun, so also he might complete with you as well, the grace this.
47.8.7.1^but even as in every way you abound, in faith, and speech, and knowledge, and all earnestness, and in the from us to you love, that also in this - grace you should abound.
47.8.8.1^not as a command do i speak, but through the of others earnestness, also the - of your love genuineness proving.
47.8.9.1^you know for the grace of the lord of us jesus christ, that for the sake of you he became poor, rich being, so that you - through that poverty might be enriched.
47.8.10.1^and a judgment in this matter i give, this indeed for you is profitable, who not only - to act, but also - to will, have begun from a year ago.
47.8.11.1^now then also the doing complete;
47.8.11.2^so that just as there was the readiness of the to will, so also the to complete, out of that which you have.
47.8.12.1^if for the readiness is present, as if he might have acceptable, not as not he does have.
47.8.13.1^not for that to others there may be ease but for you affliction, but of equality.
47.8.14.1^at the present time, - your abundance will be for the of those need, so that also - their abundance may be for the of you need, so that there may be equality.
47.8.15.1^as it has been written:
47.8.15.2^he the much not did abound, and he the little not had lack.
47.8.16.1^thanks however - to god, the one putting the same earnestness for you into the heart of titus.
47.8.17.1^for our indeed appeal he accepted, very earnest however being, of his own accord he has gone out to you.
47.8.18.1^we have sent now with him the brother whose - praise is in the gospel through all of the churches;
