47.8.19.1^not only now, but also having been chosen by the churches fellow traveler of us, with - grace this that is being administered by us toward the himself of the lord glory, and readiness of us,
47.8.20.1^avoiding this, lest anyone us should blame in the abundance this - being administered by us.
47.8.21.1^we are taking great care to do for what is right, not only before the lord, but also before men.
47.8.22.1^we sent with now them the brother of us, whom we have proven in many things often earnest to be, now however much earnest by his confidence more which is in you.
47.8.23.1^whether as regards titus, he is partner my and for you a fellow worker;
47.8.23.2^or brothers our, they are apostles of the churches, the glory of christ.
47.8.24.1^- therefore the proof of the love of you and of our boasting about you, to them show in face of the churches.
47.9.1.1^concerning now for the service - for the saints, superfluous for me it is - to write to you.
47.9.2.1^i know for the readiness of you, which concerning you i boast of to macedonians, that achaia has been prepared from a year ago, and - your zeal has been provoking the greater number.
47.9.3.1^i have sent however the brothers, that not the boasting of us which is about you should be made void in the matter this, that as i have been saying, prepared you may be.
47.9.4.1^not perhaps if should come with me macedonians and find you unprepared, would be put to shame we   that not we might say you   in the confidence this.
47.9.5.1^necessary therefore i esteemed it to exhort the brothers that they should go before unto you and should complete beforehand the foreannounced blessing of you this, ready to be thus as a blessing, and not as covetousness.
47.9.6.1^this now:
47.9.6.2^the one sowing sparingly, sparingly also will reap;
47.9.6.3^and the one sowing upon blessings, upon blessings also will reap,
47.9.7.1^each as he purposes in the heart, not out of regret or of necessity;
47.9.7.2^a cheerful for giver loves - god.
47.9.8.1^able is now - god all grace to make abound to you, so that in every way, always, all sufficiency having, you may abound in every work good.
47.9.9.1^as it has been written:
47.9.9.2^he has scattered abroad, he has given to the poor, the righteousness of him abides to the age.
47.9.10.1^the one now supplying seed to him sowing and bread for food will supply and will multiply the seed for sowing of you and will increase the fruits of the righteousness of you,
47.9.11.1^in every way enriching you to all generosity, which produces, through us, thanksgiving - to god.
47.9.12.1^for the ministry of the service this not only is completely filling up the needs of the saints, but also is overflowing through many thanksgivings - to god,
47.9.13.1^through the proof of the service this, they glorifying - god at the submission of the of confession of you to the gospel - of christ and the generosity of the participation toward them and toward all;
47.9.14.1^and their supplication is for you, a longing for you on account of the surpassing grace - of god upon you.
47.9.15.1^thanks be - to god for the indescribable of him gift!
47.10.1.1^myself now i, paul, exhort you by the meekness and gentleness - of christ, who as to appearance indeed am humble among you, being absent however am bold toward you.
47.10.2.1^i implore you now that, not being present, to be bold with the confidence with which i reckon to be daring toward some - reckoning us as according to flesh walking.
47.10.3.1^in flesh for walking, not according to flesh do we wage war.
47.10.4.1^the for weapons of the warfare of us are not fleshly, but powerful - divinely to the demolition of strongholds, arguments overthrowing,
47.10.5.1^and every high thing lifting itself up against the knowledge - of god, and taking captive every thought into the obedience - of christ,
47.10.6.1^and in readiness having, to avenge all disobedience, when might have been fulfilled your - obedience.
47.10.7.1^the things according to appearance are you looking.
47.10.7.2^if anyone is persuaded in himself of christ to be, this let him reckon again within himself, that as he is of christ, so also are we.
47.10.8.1^if even for more abundantly somewhat i should boast concerning the authority of us, which has given us the lord for building you up and not for tearing down you, not i will be ashamed,
47.10.9.1^that not i might seem as if - to frighten you by means of the letters.
47.10.10.1^for the letters, indeed they say, are weighty and strong, - but the presence of the body weak, and the speech having been ignored.
47.10.11.1^this let reckon - such a one, that such as we are - in word by letters being absent, such we are also being present - in action.
47.10.12.1^not for dare we to classify or to compare ourselves with some - themselves commending;
47.10.12.2^but these by themselves, themselves measuring, and comparing themselves with themselves, not understand.
47.10.13.1^we however not into the things beyond measure will boast, but according to the measure of the area that has assigned to us - god, a measure to reach as far as also you.
47.10.14.1^not for as not reaching to you, we are overextending ourselves;
47.10.14.2^as far as for also you, we came in the gospel - of christ,
47.10.15.1^not to the things beyond measure boasting in others  labors, hope however having, increasing the faith of you, among you to be enlarged according to the area of us, to abundance,
47.10.16.1^so as that beyond you to preach the gospel, not in another s area, in things ready to boast.
47.10.17.1^the one however boasting, in the lord let him boast.
47.10.18.1^not for the one himself commending, this one is approved, but the one whom the lord commends.
47.11.1.1^i wish you were bearing with me little a in foolishness, but indeed you do bear with me.
47.11.2.1^i am jealous as to for you of god with the jealousy;
47.11.2.2^i have betrothed for you to one husband, a virgin pure to present - to christ.
47.11.3.1^i am afraid however, lest by any means as the serpent deceived eve in the craftiness of him, might be corrupted the minds of you from the simplicity and the purity - in - christ.
47.11.4.1^if indeed for the one coming, another jesus proclaims, whom not we did proclaim, or a spirit different you receive which not you did receive, or glad tidings different which not you did accept, well are you bearing with it.
47.11.5.1^i reckon for in nothing to have been inferior to those most eminent apostles.
47.11.6.1^if however, even unpolished - in speech i am, yet not - in knowledge;
47.11.6.2^but in every way, we have been made manifest in all things to you.
47.11.7.1^or a sin did i commit, myself humbling so that you might be exalted, because freely the - of god gospel i preached to you?
47.11.8.1^other churches i robbed, having received support for the toward you service.
47.11.9.1^and being present with you and having been in need, not i did burden no one;
47.11.9.2^- for the need of me completely filled up the brothers having come from macedonia, and in everything unburdensome myself to you i kept, and will keep.
47.11.10.1^is the truth of christ in me, that the boasting this not will be sealed up of mine in the regions - of achaia.
47.11.11.1^because of why?
47.11.11.2^because not i do love you?
47.11.11.3^- god knows i do!
47.11.12.1^what however i do, also i will do, so that i might cut off the opportunity of those desiring an opportunity that in what they are boasting, they might be found as also we.
47.11.13.1^- for such are false apostles, workers deceitful, disguising themselves as apostles of christ.
47.11.14.1^and no wonder;
47.11.14.2^himself for - satan masquerades as an angel of light.
47.11.15.1^it is not surprising therefore, if also the servants of him masquerade as servants of righteousness, whose - end will be according to the deeds of them.
47.11.16.1^again i say, no one me should think a fool to be;
47.11.16.2^if however - otherwise even as a fool receive me, that i also little a may boast.
47.11.17.1^what i am saying, not according to the lord am i saying, but as in foolishness, in this the confidence - of boasting.
47.11.18.1^since many boast according to the flesh, i also will boast.
47.11.19.1^gladly for you bear with - fools, wise being!
47.11.20.1^you bear it for if anyone you enslaves, if anyone devours you, if anyone takes from you, if anyone exalts himself, if anyone in the face of you strikes you.
47.11.21.1^as to dishonor i speak, as that we have been weak!
47.11.21.2^in whatever however - anyone might be daring   in foolishness i speak   am daring i also.
47.11.22.1^hebrews are they?
47.11.22.2^i also.
47.11.22.3^israelites are they?
47.11.22.4^i also.
47.11.22.5^descendants of abraham are they?
47.11.22.6^i also.
47.11.23.1^servants of christ are they?
47.11.23.2^as being beside myself i speak above measure:
47.11.23.3^i too, in labors more abundantly, in imprisonments more abundantly, in beatings above measure, in deaths often.
47.11.24.1^from the jews five times forty lashes minus one i received.
47.11.25.1^three times i was beaten with rods, once i was stoned, three times i was shipwrecked, a night and a day in the deep sea i have passed;
47.11.26.1^in journeyings often, in perils of rivers, in perils of robbers;
47.11.26.2^in perils from my own race, in perils from the gentiles;
47.11.26.3^in perils in the city, in perils in the wilderness;
47.11.26.4^in perils on the sea, in perils among false brothers;
47.11.27.1^in labor and toil, in watchings often;
47.11.27.2^in hunger and thirst, in fastings often;
47.11.27.3^in cold and nakedness.
47.11.28.1^besides the things external, the pressure on me - on every day is my care for all the churches.
47.11.29.1^who is weak, and not i am weak?
47.11.29.2^who is led into sin, and not i do burn inwardly?
47.11.30.1^if to boast it behooves me, in the things of the weakness of me i will boast.
47.11.31.1^the god and father of the lord jesus knows, the one being blessed to the ages, that not i am lying.
47.11.32.1^in damascus the governor under aretas the king was guarding the city of the damascenes to seize me.
47.11.33.1^but through a window in a basket i was let down through the wall, and i escaped the hands of him.
47.12.1.1^to boast it behooves me;
47.12.1.2^not is it profitable indeed.
47.12.1.3^i will go on however to visions and revelations of the lord.
47.12.2.1^i know a man in christ, ago years fourteen   whether in the body, not i know, or out of the body, not i know, - god knows   having been caught up - such a man to the third heaven.
47.12.3.1^and i know - such a man   whether in the body or out of the body, not i know, - god knows
47.12.4.1^that he was caught up into - paradise, and he heard inexpressible words, - not being permitted to man to speak.
47.12.5.1^concerning - such a man i will boast;
47.12.5.2^concerning however myself, not i will boast, if not in the weaknesses.
47.12.6.1^if for i should desire to boast, not i will be a fool;
47.12.6.2^the truth for i will be speaking.
47.12.6.3^i refrain however, lest anyone to me should credit more than what he sees in me, or hears anyone of me,
47.12.7.1^and the surpassingness of the revelations.
47.12.7.2^therefore that not i should become conceited, was given to me a thorn in my flesh, a messenger of satan, that me he might buffet, so that not i should become conceited.
47.12.8.1^for this, three times the lord i begged, that it might depart from me.
47.12.9.1^and he said to me, suffices you the grace of me;
47.12.9.2^the for power in weakness is perfected.
47.12.9.3^most gladly therefore rather will i boast in the weaknesses of me, so that may rest upon me the power - of christ.
47.12.10.1^therefore i take pleasure in weaknesses, in insults, in hardships, in persecutions, and difficulties for christ;
47.12.10.2^when for i might be weak, then strong i am.
47.12.11.1^i have become a fool;
47.12.11.2^you me compelled.
47.12.11.3^i for ought by you to have been commended.
47.12.11.4^in no way for was i inferior to those most eminent apostles, though even nothing i am.
47.12.12.1^the indeed signs of the apostle were performed among you in all perseverance, in signs both, and wonders, and miracles.
47.12.13.1^in what for is it that you were inferior beyond the rest of the churches, if not that myself i not did burden you?
47.12.13.2^forgive me the wrong this!
47.12.14.1^behold, third time this, ready i am to come to you, and not i will burden you;
47.12.14.2^not for i seek what is yours, but you.
47.12.14.3^not for ought the children for the parents to treasure up, but the parents for the children.
47.12.15.1^i now most gladly will spend, and will be utterly spent, for the souls of you.
47.12.15.2^if more abundantly you loving, less i am loved?
47.12.16.1^be it so however, i not did burden you;
47.12.16.2^but being crafty, by trickery you i caught.
47.12.17.1^not any of whom i have sent to you, by him did i exploit you?
47.12.18.1^i urged titus to go, and sent with him the brother.
47.12.18.2^not did exploit you titus?
47.12.18.3^not in the same spirit did we walk?
47.12.18.4^not in the same steps?
47.12.19.1^all along have you been thinking that to you we have been making a defense?
47.12.19.2^before god in christ we speak, - but all things, beloved, for - your edification.
47.12.20.1^i fear for lest perhaps, having come, not such as i wish i may find you, and i might be found by you such as not you do wish;
47.12.20.2^lest perhaps quarreling, jealousy, anger, contentions, slander, gossip, conceit, disorder;
47.12.21.1^lest again having come of me, should humble me the god of me as to you, and i should mourn over many of those having before sinned and not having repented of the impurity and sexual immorality and sensuality that they have practiced.
47.13.1.1^third this time i am coming to you.
47.13.1.2^in the mouth of two witnesses or three, will be established every matter.
47.13.2.1^i have warned and i warn, as being present the second time, and being absent now those having sinned before, and the rest all, that if i come to the same again, not i will spare anyone,
47.13.3.1^since a proof you seek, - in me speaking of christ, who toward you not is weak, but is powerful among you.
47.13.4.1^and for he was crucified in weakness, yet he lives by power god s.
47.13.4.2^also for we are weak in him, but we will live with him by power god s toward you.
47.13.5.1^yourselves examine whether you are in the faith;
47.13.5.2^yourselves test.
47.13.5.3^or not do you recognize yourselves that jesus christ is in you, if not unapproved you are?
47.13.6.1^i hope now that you will know that we not are unapproved.
47.13.7.1^we pray now to - god, not to do you wrong nothing, not that we approved might appear, but that you what is right may do;
47.13.7.2^we though as unapproved might appear.
47.13.8.1^nothing for have we power any against the truth, but for the truth.
47.13.9.1^we rejoice for when we might be weak, you however strong might be.
47.13.9.2^but this also:
47.13.9.3^we pray for the of you perfection.
47.13.10.1^because of therefore these things, being absent i write, so that being present, not with severity i should treat you, according to the authority that the lord has given me, for building up and not for tearing down.
47.13.11.1^finally, brothers, rejoice!
47.13.11.2^be perfected, be exhorted, be of the same mind, be at peace.
47.13.11.3^and the god - of love and peace will be with you.
47.13.12.1^greet one another with a holy kiss.
47.13.12.2^greet you, the saints all.
47.13.13.1^the grace of the lord jesus christ, and the love of god, and the fellowship of the holy spirit, be with all of you.
48.1.1.1^paul, an apostle, not from men, nor through man, but through jesus christ, and god the father, the one having raised him out from the dead
48.1.2.1^and the with me all brothers, to the churches - of galatia:
48.1.3.1^grace to you and peace from god father of us and the lord jesus christ,
48.1.4.1^the one having given himself for the sins of us, so that he might deliver us out of the age of having come presently evil, according to the will of the god and father of us,
48.1.5.1^to whom be the glory to the ages of the ages.
48.1.5.2^amen.
48.1.6.1^i am astonished that so quickly you are deserting from the one having called you in the grace of christ, to a different gospel,
48.1.7.1^which not is another;
48.1.7.2^if not some there are who are troubling you, and are desiring to pervert the gospel - of christ.
48.1.8.1^but even if we or an angel out of heaven should preach a gospel to you contrary to what we proclaimed to you, accursed let him be!
48.1.9.1^as we have said before, even now again i say, if anyone to you is preaching a gospel contrary to what you received, accursed let him be!
48.1.10.1^presently for of men do i seek approval, or - god?
48.1.10.2^or do i seek men to please?
48.1.10.3^for if yet men i were pleasing, of christ a servant not - i would be.
48.1.11.1^i make known for to you, brothers, the gospel - having been preached by me, that not it is according to man.
48.1.12.1^neither for i from man received it, nor was i taught it, but by a revelation of jesus christ.
48.1.13.1^you have heard of for - my way of life former in - judaism, that beyond exceeding measure, i was persecuting the church - of god and was destroying it.
48.1.14.1^and i was advancing in - judaism beyond many contemporaries in the countrymen of me, more abundantly zealous being of the fathers of me traditions.
48.1.15.1^when however was pleased - god the one having selected me from the womb of mother of me, and having called me by the grace of him,
48.1.16.1^to reveal the son of him in me, that i might preach him among the gentiles, immediately not i consulted with flesh and blood,
48.1.17.1^nor did i go up to jerusalem to the before me apostles, but i went away into arabia, and again returned to damascus.
48.1.18.1^then after years, three i went up to jerusalem to make acquaintance with cephas, and i remained with him days fifteen.
48.1.19.1^other however of the apostles none i saw, if not james, the brother of the lord.
48.1.20.1^in what now i write to you, behold, before - god -, not i lie.
48.1.21.1^then i went into the regions - of syria and - cilicia.
48.1.22.1^i was then unknown - by face to the churches - of judea that are in christ.
48.1.23.1^only however hearing they were that the one persecuting us formerly, now is preaching the faith which once he was destroying.
48.1.24.1^and they were glorifying in me - god.
48.2.1.1^then after fourteen years again i went up to jerusalem with barnabas, having taken with me also titus.
48.2.2.1^i went up now according to a revelation and set before them the gospel that i proclaim among the gentiles   apart individually however to those esteemed   lest hardly in vain i should be running or have run.
48.2.3.1^but not even titus who was with me, a greek being, was compelled to be circumcised,
48.2.4.1^because of even the brought in secretly false brothers, who came in by stealth to spy out the freedom of us which we have in christ jesus, that us they will enslave,
48.2.5.1^to whom not even for an hour did we yield - in subjection, so that the truth of the gospel might continue with you.
48.2.6.1^of now those esteemed to be something   whatsoever formerly they were, not to me makes a difference;
48.2.6.2^the person - god of a man not does accept   to me for the esteemed nothing added.
48.2.7.1^but on the contrary, having seen that i have been entrusted with the gospel of the uncircumcision, just as peter with that of the circumcision
48.2.8.1^the one for having worked in peter for apostleship of the circumcision did also in me toward the gentiles
48.2.9.1^and having known the grace - having been given to me, james and cephas and john, those esteemed pillars to be, the right hands gave to me and barnabas, of fellowship, that we should go to the gentiles;
48.2.9.2^they however to the circumcision.
48.2.10.1^only they asked the poor that we should remember, that also i was eager the same thing to do.
48.2.11.1^when however came peter to antioch, to face his i opposed him, because condemned he stood.
48.2.12.1^before - for, came certain ones from james, with the gentiles he was eating;
48.2.12.2^when however they came, he was drawing back and was separating himself, being afraid of those of the circumcision.
48.2.13.1^and acted hypocritically with him also the rest of the jews, so that even barnabas was carried away of them by the hypocrisy.
48.2.14.1^but when i saw that not they are walking uprightly according to the truth of the gospel, i said - to peter before all, if you, a jew being, like a gentile and not like a jew live, why the gentiles do you compel to judaize?
48.2.15.1^we, by birth jews, and not of the gentiles sinners,
48.2.16.1^knowing nevertheless that not is justified a man by works of law, if not through faith from jesus;
48.2.16.2^christ even we in christ jesus have believed, that we may be justified by faith from christ, and not by works of the law;
48.2.16.3^because by works of the law not will be justified any flesh.
48.2.17.1^if however seeking to be justified in christ, have been found also we ourselves sinners, is then christ of sin a minister?
48.2.17.2^never may it be!
48.2.18.1^if for that i had torn down, these things again i build, a transgressor myself i prove.
48.2.19.1^i for, through the law to the law died, that to god i might live.
48.2.19.2^christ i have been crucified with;
48.2.20.1^i live now, no longer i;
48.2.20.2^lives however in me christ;
48.2.20.3^that which then now i live in the flesh, through faith i live, that from the son - of god, the one having loved me and having given up himself for me.
48.2.21.1^not i do set aside the grace - of god;
48.2.21.2^if for through the law righteousness is, then christ for naught died.
48.3.1.1^o foolish galatians!
48.3.1.2^who you has bewitched, whose before eyes jesus christ was publicly portrayed as having been crucified?
48.3.2.1^this only i wish to learn from you, by works of the law the spirit did you receive, or by hearing of faith?
48.3.3.1^so foolish are you?
48.3.3.2^having begun in the spirit, now in the flesh are you being perfected?
48.3.4.1^so many things did you suffer in vain, if indeed also in vain?
48.3.5.1^the one therefore supplying to you the spirit and working miracles among you, is it out of works of the law or out of hearing of faith?
48.3.6.1^so also, abraham believed - god, and it was reckoned to him as righteousness.
48.3.7.1^know then that those of faith, these sons are of abraham.
48.3.8.1^having foreseen then the scripture that by faith justifies the gentiles - god, foretold the gospel - to abraham -:
48.3.8.2^will be blessed in you all the nations.
48.3.9.1^so then, those of faith are blessed along with the believing abraham.
48.3.10.1^as many as for of works of the law are, under a curse are;
48.3.10.2^it has been written for -:
48.3.10.3^cursed is everyone who not does continue all things - having been written in the book of the law, - to do them.
48.3.11.1^that now by the law no one is justified before - god is evident, because the righteous by faith will live.
48.3.12.1^- and the law not is of faith;
48.3.12.2^rather, the one having done these things will live by them.
48.3.13.1^christ us redeemed from the curse of the law, having become for us a curse, for it has been written:
48.3.13.2^cursed is everyone - hanging on a tree
48.3.14.1^so that to the gentiles the blessing - of abraham might come, in christ, jesus so that the promise of the spirit we might receive, through - faith.
48.3.15.1^brothers, according to man i am speaking.
48.3.15.2^even of man having been ratified a covenant, no one sets aside or adds thereto.
48.3.16.1^- and to abraham were spoken the promises, and to the seed of him.
48.3.16.2^not it does say, and - to seeds, as of many;
48.3.16.3^but as of one, and to the seed of you,  who is christ.
48.3.17.1^this now i say:
48.3.17.2^the covenant, having been confirmed beforehand by - god, - afterward four hundred and thirty years having come, the law not does annul, so as - to nullify the promise.
48.3.18.1^if for by the law is the inheritance, it is no longer by a promise;
48.3.18.2^- but to abraham through a promise has granted it - god.
48.3.19.1^why then the law?
48.3.19.2^- transgressions on account of, it was added, until that should have come the seed to whom promise has been made, having been ordained through angels in the hand of a mediator.
48.3.20.1^- however, a mediator of one person not is;
48.3.20.2^- but god one is.
48.3.21.1^the therefore law is contrary to the promises - of god?
48.3.21.2^never may it be!
48.3.21.3^if for had been given a law - being able to impart life, indeed from out of the law - would have emerged - righteousness;
48.3.22.1^but imprisoned the scripture things all under sin, so that the promise, by faith from jesus christ, might be given to those believing.
48.3.23.1^before - now came - faith, under the law we were held in custody, having been locked up until the being about faith to be revealed,
48.3.24.1^so that the law trainer of us has become, unto christ, so that by faith we might be justified.
48.3.25.1^having come now - faith, no longer under a trainer we are.
48.3.26.1^all for sons of god you are through - faith in christ jesus.
48.3.27.1^as many as for into christ you were baptized, christ you have put on.
48.3.28.1^neither there is jew nor greek;
48.3.28.2^neither there is slave nor free;
48.3.28.3^neither there is male and female;
48.3.28.4^all for you one are in christ jesus.
48.3.29.1^if now you are christ s, then - abraham s seed you are, according to the promise heirs.
48.4.1.1^i say now, for as long as time the heir a child is, not he differs from a slave, though owner of everything being.
48.4.2.1^instead, under guardians he is, and trustees, until the time appointed by his father.
48.4.3.1^so also we, when we were children, under the basic principles of the world were held in bondage.
48.4.4.1^when however had come the fullness of the time, sent forth - god the son of him, having been born of a woman, having been born under the law,
48.4.5.1^that those under the law he might redeem, so that the divine adoption as sons we might receive.
48.4.6.1^because now you are sons, sent forth - god the spirit of the son of him into the hearts of us, crying out, abba, - father!
48.4.7.1^so no longer you are a slave, but a son;
48.4.7.2^if now a son, also an heir through god.
48.4.8.1^but at that time indeed not knowing god, you were enslaved to those by nature not being gods;
48.4.9.1^now however, having known god, rather however having been known by god, how do you turn again to the weak and destitute principles, to which again anew to be enslaved you desire?
48.4.10.1^days you observe, and months and seasons and years.
48.4.11.1^i fear for you, lest perhaps in vain i have toiled for you.
48.4.12.1^become as i am, because i also have become as you, brothers, i implore you.
48.4.12.2^in nothing me have you wronged.
48.4.13.1^you know now that in weakness of the flesh i proclaimed the gospel to you at the first;
48.4.14.1^and the test of you in the flesh of me, not you did despise me, nor reject me with contempt;
48.4.14.2^but as an angel of god, you received me even as christ jesus.
48.4.15.1^what then the blessedness of you?
48.4.15.2^i bear witness for to you that, if possible, the eyes of you having gouged out, you would have given them to me.
48.4.16.1^so enemy of you have i become, speaking truth to you?
48.4.17.1^they are zealous after you not rightly, but to exclude you from us.
48.4.17.2^they desire so that them you might be zealous after.
48.4.18.1^good it is now to be zealous in a right thing at all times, and not only in - being present my with you.
48.4.19.1^children of me, of whom again i travail until that shall have been formed christ in you,
48.4.20.1^i was wishing indeed to be present with you presently and to change the tone of me, because i am perplexed as to you.
48.4.21.1^tell me, those under the law wishing to be, the law not you do listen to?
48.4.22.1^it has been written for that abraham two sons had, one of the slave woman and one of the free.
48.4.23.1^but the one indeed of the slave woman, according to flesh has been born;
48.4.23.2^the one but of the free, through the promise,
48.4.24.1^which things are allegorized;
48.4.24.2^these for are two covenants:
48.4.24.3^one indeed from mount sinai, unto slavery begetting, which is hagar.
48.4.25.1^- and hagar sinai mount is, in - arabia;
48.4.25.2^she corresponds now to the present jerusalem, she is in slavery for with the children of her.
48.4.26.1^- but the above jerusalem free is, who is mother of us.
48.4.27.1^it has been written for:
48.4.27.2^rejoice, o barren woman, the one not bearing;
48.4.27.3^break forth and call aloud, the one not travailing;
48.4.27.4^because many are the children of the desolate woman more, than of her having the husband.
48.4.28.1^you now, brothers, like isaac, of promise children are.
48.4.29.1^but just as at that time the one according to flesh having been born was persecuting the one born according to spirit, so also it is now.
48.4.30.1^but what says the scripture?
48.4.30.2^cast out the slave woman and the son of her;
48.4.30.3^no for not will inherit the son of the slave woman along with the son of the free.
48.4.31.1^so then, brothers, not we are of the slave woman children, but of the free.
48.5.1.1^in freedom, us christ has set free;
48.5.1.2^stand firm, therefore, and not again in a yoke of slavery entangle yourselves.
48.5.2.1^behold, i paul say to you that if you shall become circumcised, christ you nothing will profit.
48.5.3.1^i testify now again to every man being circumcised that a debtor he is all the law to keep.
48.5.4.1^you are severed from christ, whoever in the law are being justified;
48.5.4.2^from grace you have fallen away.
48.5.5.1^we for, through the spirit by faith, the hope of righteousness eagerly await.
48.5.6.1^in for christ jesus, neither circumcision any has power, nor uncircumcision;
48.5.6.2^but only faith through love working.
48.5.7.1^you were running well.
48.5.7.2^who you cut into, the truth not to obey?
48.5.8.1^this persuasion is not of the one calling you.
48.5.9.1^a little leaven whole the lump leavens.
48.5.10.1^i am confident as to you in the lord, that no other mind will you have.
48.5.10.2^the one however troubling you will bear the judgment, whoever if he might be.
48.5.11.1^i now, brothers, if circumcision still proclaim, why still am i persecuted?
48.5.11.2^in that case has been abolished the offense of the cross.
48.5.12.1^i wish also will emasculate themselves those upsetting you.
48.5.13.1^you for to freedom were called, brothers;
48.5.13.2^but not the freedom for an opportunity to the flesh.
48.5.13.3^rather through - love, serve one another.
48.5.14.1^- for the entire law in one word is fulfilled in this:
48.5.14.2^you shall love the neighbor of you as yourself.
48.5.15.1^if however one another you bite and devour, take heed, lest by one another you might be consumed.
48.5.16.1^i say now, by the spirit walk, and the desire of the flesh no not you should gratify.
48.5.17.1^the for flesh desires, against the spirit, - and the spirit against the flesh;
48.5.17.2^these for to one another are opposed, in order not that if you might wish those things you should do.
48.5.18.1^if however the spirit you are led by, not you are under the law.
48.5.19.1^evident now are the works of the flesh, which are sexual immorality, impurity, sensuality,
48.5.20.1^idolatry, sorcery, enmities, strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, contentions, dissensions, factions,
48.5.21.1^envyings, drunkennesses, carousing, and things like these, as to which i forewarn you, even as i warned before, that those such things doing, kingdom god s not will inherit.
48.5.22.1^- but the fruit of the spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,
48.5.23.1^gentleness, self-control;
48.5.23.2^against things such, no there is law.
48.5.24.1^those now - of christ jesus, the flesh have crucified with its passions and - desires.
48.5.25.1^if we live by the spirit, by the spirit also we should walk.
48.5.26.1^not we should become boastful, one another provoking, one another envying.
48.6.1.1^brothers, if even should be overcome a man in some trespass, you, the spiritual ones, restore - such a one in a spirit of gentleness, considering yourself, lest also you be tempted.
48.6.2.1^one another s - burdens bear you, and thus you shall fulfill the law - of christ.
48.6.3.1^if for thinks himself anyone to be something, nothing being, he deceives himself.
48.6.4.1^- but the work of himself test each, and then as to himself alone, the ground of boasting he will have, and not as to - another.
48.6.5.1^each for - his own load shall bear.
48.6.6.1^let share now the one being taught in the word, with the one teaching, in all good things.
48.6.7.1^not be misled;
48.6.7.2^god not is mocked.
48.6.7.3^whatever for if might sow a man, that also he will reap.
48.6.8.1^for the one sowing to the flesh of himself, from the flesh will reap decay.
48.6.8.2^the one however sowing to the spirit, from the spirit will reap life eternal.
48.6.9.1^- and in well doing, not we should grow weary;
48.6.9.2^in time for due, we will reap a harvest not giving up.
48.6.10.1^so then, as occasion we have, we should work - good toward all, especially now toward those of the household of the of faith.
48.6.11.1^see in how large to you letters i have written with my own hand.
48.6.12.1^as many as wish to have a fair appearance in the flesh, these compel you to be circumcised, only that for the cross - of christ not they might be persecuted.
48.6.13.1^not even for those being circumcised themselves the law keep, but they desire you to be circumcised, so that in - your flesh they may boast.
48.6.14.1^for me however, never may it be to boast, if never in the cross of the lord of us jesus christ, through which to me the world has been crucified, and i to the world.
48.6.15.1^neither for circumcision anything is, nor uncircumcision;
48.6.15.2^instead a new creation.
48.6.16.1^and as many as those who rule by this will walk, peace be upon them, and mercy;
48.6.16.2^and upon the israel - of god.
48.6.17.1^the henceforth, troubles to me no one let give;
48.6.17.2^i for the marks - of jesus on of the body of me bear.
48.6.18.1^the grace of the lord of us jesus christ be with the spirit of you, brothers.
48.6.18.2^amen.
49.1.1.1^paul, an apostle of christ jesus by the will of god, to the saints - being in ephesus, and faithful in christ jesus.
49.1.2.1^grace to you and peace from god the father of us and the lord jesus christ.
49.1.3.1^blessed be the god and father of the lord of us jesus christ, the one having blessed us with every blessing spiritual in the heavenly realms in christ,
49.1.4.1^just as he chose us in him before the foundation of the world, to be for us holy and blameless before him, in love
49.1.5.1^having predestined us for divine adoption as sons through jesus christ, to himself, according to the good pleasure of the will of him,
49.1.6.1^to the praise of the glory of the of grace of him, which he has freely given us in the beloved one,
49.1.7.1^in whom we have - redemption through the blood of him, the forgiveness - of trespasses, according to the riches of the grace of him,
49.1.8.1^which he lavished upon us in all wisdom and understanding,
49.1.9.1^having made known to us the mystery of the will of him according to the pleasure of him, which he purposed in him
49.1.10.1^for the administration of the fullness of the times, to bring together the all things in - christ, the things in the heavens and the things upon the earth, in him,
49.1.11.1^in whom also we have obtained an inheritance, having been predestined according to the purpose of the one - all things working according to the counsel of the will of him,
49.1.12.1^for - to be us to the praise of the glory of him, the ones having first trusted in - christ,
49.1.13.1^in whom also you, having heard the word - of truth, the gospel of the salvation of you, in whom also having believed, you were sealed with the spirit - of promise - holy,
49.1.14.1^who is the guarantee of the inheritance of us, to the redemption of the acquired possession, to the praise of the glory of him.
49.1.15.1^because of this i also, having heard of the among you faith in the lord jesus and the love - toward all the saints,
49.1.16.1^not do cease giving thanks for you, mention making in the prayers of me,
49.1.17.1^that the god of the lord of us jesus christ, the father - of glory, may give to you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the knowledge of him,
49.1.18.1^being enlightened the eyes of the heart of you, in order for - to know you what is the hope of the calling of him, what are the riches of the glory of the inheritance of him in the saints,
49.1.19.1^and what is the surpassing greatness of the power of him toward us, those believing according to the working of the might of the strength of him,
49.1.20.1^which he worked in - christ, having raised him out from the dead and having set him at the right hand of him in the heavenly realms,
49.1.21.1^above every principality and authority and power and dominion, and every name being named, not only in the age this, but also in the one coming.
49.1.22.1^and all things he put under the feet of him, and him gave to be head over all things to the church,
49.1.23.1^which is the body of him, the fullness of the one - all in all filling.
49.2.1.1^and you, being dead in the trespasses and the sins of you,
49.2.2.1^in which once you walked, according to the age, the world of this, according to the ruler of the authority of the air, the spirit - now working in the sons - of disobedience,
49.2.3.1^among whom also we all lived once in the desires of the flesh of us, doing the things willed of the flesh, and of its thoughts;
49.2.3.2^and we were children, by nature, of wrath, as even the rest.
49.2.4.1^- but god, rich being in mercy, because of the great love of him with which he loved us,
49.2.5.1^even being we dead - in trespasses, made us alive with - christ   by grace you are saved
49.2.6.1^and he raised us up together and seated us together in the heavenly realms in christ jesus,
49.2.7.1^in order that he might show in the ages that are coming the surpassing riches of the grace of him in kindness toward us in christ jesus.
49.2.8.1^- for by grace you are saved through faith, and this not of yourselves;
49.2.8.2^it is of god the gift,
49.2.9.1^not as a result of works, so that not anyone may boast.
49.2.10.1^of him for we are workmanship, having been created in christ jesus for works good, which prepared beforehand - god, that in them we should walk.
49.2.11.1^therefore remember that formerly you the gentiles in the flesh, the ones being called the uncircumcision by that being called the circumcision, in the flesh made by hands
49.2.12.1^that you were at the time that separate from christ, alienated from the commonwealth - of israel, and strangers to the covenants of the promise, hope not having and without god in the world.
49.2.13.1^now however in christ jesus, you the ones once being far off have become near by the blood - of christ.
49.2.14.1^he himself for is the peace of us, - having made - both one, and the barrier of the fence having broken down, the hostility, in the flesh of him,
49.2.15.1^the law - of commandments in ordinances having annulled, so that the two he might create in himself into one new man, making peace;
49.2.16.1^and he might reconcile - both in one body - to god through the cross, having slain the hostility by it.
49.2.17.1^and having come, he proclaimed the gospel:
49.2.17.2^peace to you, the ones far off, and peace to those near.
49.2.18.1^for through him we have the access - both by one spirit to the father.
49.2.19.1^so then no longer are you strangers and aliens, but are fellow citizens of the saints and of the household - of god,
49.2.20.1^having been built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, being the cornerstone himself christ jesus,
49.2.21.1^in whom the whole building, being fitted together, is increasing into a temple, holy in the lord,
49.2.22.1^in whom also you are being built together for a habitation - of god in the spirit.
49.3.1.1^of this for reason, i paul, the prisoner - of christ jesus, for you - gentiles.
49.3.1.2^.
49.3.1.3^.
49.3.2.1^if indeed you have heard of the administration of the grace - of god, - having been given to me toward you,
49.3.3.1^that by revelation he made known to me the mystery, just as i have written before in brief,
49.3.4.1^by which you are able, reading it, to understand the insight of me into the mystery - of christ,
49.3.5.1^which in other generations not was made known to the sons - of men, as now it has been revealed to holy apostles his and prophets in the spirit,
49.3.6.1^are the gentiles joint-heirs, and a joint-body, and joint-partakers of the promise in christ jesus, through the gospel,
49.3.7.1^of which i became servant according to the gift of the grace - of god -, having been given to me according to the working of the power of him.
49.3.8.1^to me, the very least of all saints, was given the grace this:
49.3.8.2^to the gentiles to preach the unsearchable riches - of christ,
49.3.9.1^and to enlighten all what is the administration of the mystery - having been hidden from the ages in - god, the one - all things having created,
49.3.10.1^so that should be made known now to the rulers and the authorities in the heavenly realms, through the church, the manifold wisdom - of god,
49.3.11.1^according to the purpose of the ages, which he accomplished in - christ jesus the lord of us,
49.3.12.1^in whom we have - boldness and access in confidence, by the faith from him.
49.3.13.1^therefore i implore you not to lose heart at the tribulations of me for you, which is glory of you.
49.3.14.1^.
49.3.14.2^.
49.3.14.3^.
49.3.14.4^of this for reason i bow the knees of me to the father,
49.3.15.1^from whom every family in the heavens and on earth is named,
49.3.16.1^that he might give you according to the riches of the glory of him, with power, to be strengthened by the spirit of him in the inner man,
49.3.17.1^for to dwell - christ through - faith in the hearts of you, in love being rooted and being founded,
49.3.18.1^so that you may be fully able to comprehend with all the saints what is the breadth and length and height and depth,
49.3.19.1^to know then the surpassing - knowledge love - of christ, so that you may be filled unto all the fullness - of god.
49.3.20.1^to the one now being able above all things to do exceedingly that we ask or think, according to the power - working in us,
49.3.21.1^to him be the glory in the church and in christ jesus to all the generations of the age of the ages.
49.3.21.2^amen.
49.4.1.1^exhort therefore you i, the prisoner in the lord, worthily to walk of the calling to which you were called,
49.4.2.1^with all humility and gentleness, with patience, bearing with one another in love,
49.4.3.1^being diligent to keep the unity of the spirit in the bond - of peace;
49.4.4.1^one body and one spirit, just as also you were called into one hope of the calling of you;
49.4.5.1^one lord, one faith, one baptism;
49.4.6.1^one god and father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.
49.4.7.1^one now to each of us has been given - grace according to the measure of the gift - of christ.
49.4.8.1^therefore it says:
49.4.8.2^having ascended on high, he led captive captivity, and gave gifts - to men.
49.4.9.1^- and, he ascended,  what is if not that also he descended into the lower regions of the earth?
49.4.10.1^the one having descended, the same is also one having ascended above all the heavens, so that he might fill - all things.
49.4.11.1^and he gave some indeed to be apostles, some now prophets, some now evangelists, some now shepherds and teachers,
49.4.12.1^toward the perfecting of the saints, for the work of ministry, for the building up of the body - of christ,
49.4.13.1^until we may attain - all to the unity of the faith and of the knowledge of the son - of god, unto a man a complete, to the measure of the stature of the fullness - of christ,
49.4.14.1^so that no longer we might be infants, being tossed by waves and being carried about by every wind - of teaching, in the cunning - of men in craftiness, with a view to the scheming - of deceit.
49.4.15.1^speaking the truth however in love, we should grow up into him in all things who is the head, christ,
49.4.16.1^from whom all the body, being joined together and being held together by every ligament of its supply, according to the working in the measure individual of each part, the increase of the body makes for itself to the building up of itself in love.
49.4.17.1^this therefore i say and testify in the lord:
49.4.17.2^no longer are you to walk as also the gentiles are walking, in the futility of the mind of them,
49.4.18.1^being darkened in the understanding, being alienated from the life - of god, because of the ignorance - being in them, on account of the hardness of the heart of them,
49.4.19.1^who having cast off all feeling, themselves have given up to sensuality, for the working of impurity, all with greediness.
49.4.20.1^you however not this way learned - christ,
49.4.21.1^if indeed him you have heard and in him have been taught, just as is the truth in - jesus.
49.4.22.1^are to have put off you, concerning the former way of life, the old man, which is being corrupted, according to its desires - of deceit,
49.4.23.1^to be renewed then in the spirit of the mind of you,
49.4.24.1^and to have put on the new man, - according to god having been created in righteousness and holiness - of truth.
49.4.25.1^therefore having put off - falsehood, let speak truth each one with the neighbor of him, because we are of one another members.
49.4.26.1^be angry, and yet not sin.
49.4.26.2^the sun not let set upon - anger of you;
49.4.27.1^neither give opportunity to the devil.
49.4.28.1^the one stealing, no longer let him steal;
49.4.28.2^rather however let him toil, working with the own hands what is good, so that he may have something to impart to the one need having.
49.4.29.1^any word unwholesome out of the mouth of you not let go forth, but if any good for edification of the need, so that it may give grace to those hearing.
49.4.30.1^and not grieve the spirit - holy - of god, in whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
49.4.31.1^all bitterness, and rage, and anger, and clamor, and slander, let be removed from you, along with all malice.
49.4.32.1^be now to one another kind, tender-hearted, forgiving each other, as also - god in christ forgave you.
49.5.1.1^be therefore imitators - of god, as children beloved,
49.5.2.1^and walk in love, just as also - christ loved us and gave up himself for us as an offering and a sacrifice - to god, into an aroma of a sweet smell.
49.5.3.1^sexual immorality however, and impurity all, or covetousness, not even let be named among you, as also is proper to saints,
49.5.4.1^and filthiness, and foolish talking, or crude joking, which not are fitting;
49.5.4.2^but rather thanksgiving.
49.5.5.1^this for you know, realizing that any fornicator, or unclean person, or covetous man, who is an idolater, not has inheritance in the kingdom - of christ, and of god.
49.5.6.1^no one you let deceive with empty words, because of these things for comes the wrath - of god upon the sons - of disobedience.
49.5.7.1^not therefore be partakers with them.
49.5.8.1^you were for once darkness;
49.5.8.2^now however, light in the lord;
49.5.8.3^as children of light walk
49.5.9.1^- for the fruit of the light is in all goodness and righteousness and truth
49.5.10.1^discerning what is well-pleasing to the lord.
49.5.11.1^and not have fellowship with the works - unfruitful - of darkness;
49.5.11.2^rather however even expose them;
49.5.12.1^the things for in secret being done by them, shameful it is even to mention.
49.5.13.1^- but everything being exposed by the light is made visible,
49.5.14.1^everything for - becoming visible light is.
49.5.14.2^therefore it says:
49.5.14.3^awake you, the one sleeping, and rise up out from the dead, and will shine upon you - christ.
49.5.15.1^take heed therefore carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise,
49.5.16.1^redeeming the time, because the days evil are.
49.5.17.1^because of this, not be foolish, but understand what the will of the lord is.
49.5.18.1^and not to be drunk with wine, in which is debauchery.
49.5.18.2^instead be filled with the spirit,
49.5.19.1^speaking to each other in psalms and hymns and songs spiritual, singing and making melody in the heart of you to the lord,
49.5.20.1^giving thanks at all times for all things in the name the lord of us jesus christ to the god and father.
49.5.21.1^be submitting yourselves to one another in reverence of christ:
49.5.22.1^- wives, to the own husbands, as to the lord;
49.5.23.1^for the husband is head of the wife, as also - christ is the head of the church, he himself savior of the body.
49.5.24.1^but even as the church is subjected - to christ, so also - wives to the own husbands in everything.
49.5.25.1^- husbands, love the wives, just as also - christ loved the church and himself gave up for her,
49.5.26.1^so that her he might sanctify, having cleansed her by the washing - of water by the word,
49.5.27.1^so that might present he to himself in glory the church, not having spot or wrinkle or any of the such things, but that it would be holy and blameless.
49.5.28.1^so ought also - husbands to love the of themselves wives, as the of themselves bodies.
49.5.28.2^the one loving the of himself wife, himself loves.
49.5.29.1^no one for at any time the of himself flesh hated, but he nourishes and cherishes it, just as also does - christ the church;
49.5.30.1^for members we are of the body of him.
49.5.31.1^because of this, will leave a man his father and - mother and be joined to the wife of him, and will be the two into flesh one.
49.5.32.1^the mystery this great is;
49.5.32.2^i however speak as to christ, and as to the church.
49.5.33.1^however also you - according to individual, each the of himself wife, so let love as himself;
49.5.33.2^- and the wife that she may respect the husband.
49.6.1.1^- children, obey the parents of you in the lord;
49.6.1.2^this for is right.
49.6.2.1^honor the father of you and - mother, which is the commandment first with a promise,
49.6.3.1^that well with you it may be, and you will be long-lived upon the earth.
49.6.4.1^and - fathers, not provoke the children of you, but bring up them in the discipline and admonition of the lord.
49.6.5.1^- slaves, obey the according to flesh masters with fear and trembling, in sincerity of the heart of you, as to christ,
49.6.6.1^not with eye-service as men-pleasers, but as servants of christ, doing the will - of god from the heart,
49.6.7.1^with good will rendering service, as to the lord and not to men,
49.6.8.1^knowing that each one, if whatever he might have done good, this he will receive back from the lord, whether slave or free.
49.6.9.1^and - masters, the same things them do toward them, giving up the threatening, knowing that also of them and of you the master is in the heavens, and partiality not there is with him.
49.6.10.1^- henceforth be empowered in the lord, and in the strength of the might of him.
49.6.11.1^put on the complete armor - of god, for - to be able you to stand against the schemes of the devil,
49.6.12.1^because not is to us the wrestling against blood and flesh, but against the rulers, against the authorities, against the cosmic powers of the darkness this, against the spiritual forces - of evil in the heavenly realms.
49.6.13.1^because of this, take up the complete armor - of god, so that you may be able to withstand in the day - evil, and all things having done, to stand.
49.6.14.1^stand therefore, having girded the loins of you with truth, and having put on the breastplate - of righteousness,
49.6.15.1^and having shod the feet with the readiness of the gospel - of peace;
49.6.16.1^besides all, having taken up the shield - of faith, with which you will be able all the arrows of the evil one - flaming to quench.
49.6.17.1^and the helmet - of salvation take, and the sword of the spirit, which is the word of god,
49.6.18.1^through all prayer and supplication, praying in every season in the spirit, and unto this very thing, watching with all perseverance and supplication for all - saints,
49.6.19.1^and also for me, that to me may be given divine utterance in the opening of the mouth of me, with boldness to make known the mystery of the gospel,
49.6.20.1^for which i am an ambassador in a chain, that in it i may be bold, as it behooves me to speak.
49.6.21.1^that now may know also you the things concerning me, what i am doing, all things will make known to you tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant in the lord,
49.6.22.1^whom i have sent to you for this very purpose, that you may know the things concerning us, and he may encourage the hearts of you.
49.6.23.1^peace to the brothers and love with faith from god the father and the lord jesus christ.
49.6.24.1^- grace be with all those loving the lord of us jesus christ in incorruptibility.
50.1.1.1^paul and timothy, servants of christ jesus, to all the saints in christ jesus - being in philippi, with the overseers and deacons:
50.1.2.1^grace to you and peace from god father of us and the lord jesus christ.
50.1.3.1^i thank the god of me upon every - remembrance of you,
50.1.4.1^always in every supplication of me for all of you, with joy the supplication making
50.1.5.1^for the partnership of you in the gospel from the first day until - now,
50.1.6.1^being persuaded of the very thing this, that the one having begun in you a work good will complete it until the day of christ jesus.
50.1.7.1^accordingly, it is right for me this to feel about all of you, since - have i in the heart you;
50.1.7.2^in both the chains of me, and in the defense and confirmation of the gospel, fellow partakers with me of grace all you are.
50.1.8.1^witness for my - god is, how i long after all you in the affection of christ jesus.
50.1.9.1^and this i pray, that the love of you, yet more and more may abound in knowledge and all discernment,
50.1.10.1^for - to approve you the things being excellent, so that you may be pure and blameless unto the day of christ,
50.1.11.1^being filled with the fruit of righteousness that is through jesus christ, to the glory and praise of god.
50.1.12.1^to know now you, i want, brothers, that the things concerning me, really to the advancement of the gospel have turned out,
50.1.13.1^so as for the chains of me clearly known in christ to have become in all the palace guard, and to the rest all;
50.1.14.1^and - most of the brothers, in the lord trusting by the chains of me, more abundantly to dare fearlessly the word to speak.
50.1.15.1^some indeed even from envy and strife, some however also from goodwill - christ are proclaiming
50.1.16.1^the ones indeed out of love, knowing that for defense of the gospel i am appointed;
50.1.17.1^the ones however out of selfish ambition - christ are proclaiming, not purely, supposing tribulation to add to the chains of me.
50.1.18.1^what then?
50.1.18.2^only that in every way, whether in pretext or in truth, christ is proclaimed.
50.1.18.3^and in this i rejoice.
50.1.18.4^yes, and i will rejoice.
50.1.19.1^i know for that this for me will turn out to deliverance through - your prayer and the provision of the spirit of jesus christ,
50.1.20.1^according to the earnest expectation and hope of me that in nothing i will be ashamed, but in all boldness, as always also now, will be magnified christ in the body of me, whether by life or by death.
50.1.21.1^to me for - to live is christ, and - to die is gain.
50.1.22.1^if i am however - to live in flesh, this for me is the fruit of labor.
50.1.22.2^and what shall i choose?
50.1.22.3^not i know!
50.1.23.1^i am pressed however between the two, the desire having for myself - to depart and with christ to be, very much for more better;
50.1.24.1^- but to remain in the flesh is more necessary for the sake of you.
50.1.25.1^and this having been persuaded of, i know that i will remain and will continue with all of you for - your progress and joy of the faith,
50.1.26.1^so that the boasting of you may abound to christ jesus in me through - my coming again to you.
50.1.27.1^only worthily of the gospel - of christ conduct yourselves, so that whether having come and having seen you, or being absent, i might hear the things concerning you, that you are standing firm in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel,
50.1.28.1^and not being frightened in nothing by those opposing you, which is to them a demonstration of destruction;
50.1.28.2^to you however of salvation, and this from god.
50.1.29.1^for to you it has been granted - concerning christ, not only - in him to believe, but also - concerning him to suffer,
50.1.30.1^the same conflict having, such as you saw in me and now hear of in me.
50.2.1.1^if there is any therefore encouragement in christ, if any comfort of love, if any fellowship of the spirit, if any affections and compassions,
50.2.2.1^fulfill my - joy so that the same you may be minded, the same love having, united in soul, the same thing minding,
50.2.3.1^nothing according to self-interest or according to vain conceit, but - in humility one another be esteeming surpassing themselves,
50.2.4.1^not the things of themselves each considering, but also the things of others each.
50.2.5.1^this let mind be in you which also in christ jesus was:
50.2.6.1^who in the form of god existing, not something to be grasped considered - to be equal with god,
50.2.7.1^but himself emptied, the form of a servant having taken, in the likeness of men having been made.
50.2.7.2^and in appearance having been found as a man,
50.2.8.1^he humbled himself, having become obedient unto death, the death even of the cross.
50.2.9.1^therefore also - god him highly exalted, and granted to him the name - above every name,
50.2.10.1^that at the name of jesus every knee should bow, in the heavens and on earth and under the earth,
50.2.11.1^and every tongue should confess that is lord jesus christ, to the glory of god the father.
50.2.12.1^therefore, beloved of me, just as always you have obeyed, not as in the presence of me only, but now much more in the absence of me, with fear and trembling - your own salvation work out.
50.2.13.1^god for is the one working in you both - to will and - to work according to his good pleasure.
50.2.14.1^all things do without murmurings and disputings,
50.2.15.1^so that you may be blameless and innocent, children of god, unblemished in the midst of a generation crooked and perverted, among whom you shine as lights in the world,
50.2.16.1^the word of life holding forth, unto a boast to me in the day of christ that not in vain i did run nor in vain toil.
50.2.17.1^but if even i am being poured out as a drink offering on the sacrifice and service of the faith of you, i am glad and rejoice with all you.
50.2.18.1^- and likewise also you be glad and rejoice with me.
50.2.19.1^i hope however in the lord jesus, timothy soon to send to you, that i also may be encouraged, having known the things concerning you.
50.2.20.1^no one for i have like-minded, who genuinely the things relative to you will care for.
50.2.21.1^those all for the things of themselves are seeking, not the things jesus.
50.2.21.2^of christ
50.2.22.1^- but the proven worth of him you know, that as a father with a child, with me he has served in the gospel.
50.2.23.1^him indeed therefore i hope to send, when - i shall have seen the things concerning me, immediately.
50.2.24.1^i am persuaded now in the lord that also i myself soon i will come.
50.2.25.1^necessary now i esteemed it, epaphroditus, the brother and fellow worker and fellow soldier of me, of you now messenger and minister of the need of me, to send to you,
50.2.26.1^since longing after he was all you and being deeply distressed because you heard that he was ill.
50.2.27.1^and indeed he was sick nearly unto death, but - god had mercy on him;
50.2.27.2^not on him now alone, but also on me, that not sorrow upon sorrow i should have.
50.2.28.1^all the more speedily therefore i have sent him, that having seen him again, you may rejoice, and i less anxious might be.
50.2.29.1^receive therefore him in the lord with all joy, and - such in honor hold,
50.2.30.1^because for the sake of the work of christ, unto death he came near, having disregarded his life so that he might fill up the of you deficit of toward me service.
50.3.1.1^- finally, brothers of me, rejoice in the lord.
50.3.1.2^the same things to write to you, to me indeed is not troublesome;
50.3.1.3^for you now is safe.
50.3.2.1^beware of the dogs;
50.3.2.2^beware of the evil workers;
50.3.2.3^beware of the false circumcision.
50.3.3.1^we for are the circumcision, those in the spirit of god worshiping and glorying in christ jesus, and not in the flesh having put confidence,
50.3.4.1^though i have confidence even in the flesh.
50.3.4.2^if any thinks other to have confidence in the flesh, i more:
50.3.5.1^circumcision on the eighth day;
50.3.5.2^of the nation of israel, of the tribe of benjamin;
50.3.5.3^a hebrew of hebrews;
50.3.5.4^according to the law, a pharisee;
50.3.6.1^according to zeal, persecuting the church;
50.3.6.2^according to righteousness which is in the law, having become faultless.
50.3.7.1^but whatever things were to me gain, these i have esteemed, because of - christ, loss.
50.3.8.1^but -, therefore indeed, also i count all things loss to be because of the excelling - knowledge of christ jesus the lord of me, because of whom - all things i have lost, and esteem them rubbish, that christ i may gain
50.3.9.1^and be found in him, not having my own righteousness, which is of the law, but that through faith from christ, the of god righteousness on the basis of - faith,
50.3.10.1^- to know him and the power of the resurrection of him, and the fellowship of sufferings of him, being conformed to the death of him,
50.3.11.1^if, by any means, i may attain to the resurrection - out from dead.
50.3.12.1^not that already i have obtained it, or already have been perfected;
50.3.12.2^i am pursuing however, if also i may lay hold of that for which also i was laid hold of by christ jesus.
50.3.13.1^brothers, i myself not do consider to have taken hold of it.
50.3.13.2^one thing however:
50.3.13.3^the things indeed behind forgetting, to the things now ahead reaching forward,
50.3.14.1^toward the goal i press on for the prize of the upward calling - of god in christ jesus.
50.3.15.1^as many as therefore are mature, this should be of mind;
50.3.15.2^and if in anything differently you are minded, even this - god to you will reveal.
50.3.16.1^nevertheless to that which we have attained, by the same to walk.
50.3.17.1^imitators together of me be, brothers, and observe those thus walking, as you have for a pattern us.
50.3.18.1^many for are walking   of whom often i told you, now indeed even weeping i say   - as enemies of the cross - of christ,
50.3.19.1^whose - end is destruction, whose - god is the belly, and - glory is in the shame of them, those things earthly minding.
50.3.20.1^of us for the citizenship in the heavens exists, from whence also a savior we are awaiting, the lord jesus christ,
50.3.21.1^who will transform the body - of humiliation of us, conformed to the body of the glory of himself, according to the working - enabling him even to subdue to himself - all things.
50.4.1.1^therefore, brothers of me, beloved and longed for, the joy and crown of me, in this way stand firm in the lord, beloved.
50.4.2.1^euodia i exhort and syntyche i exhort, the same to be of mind in the lord.
50.4.3.1^yes, i ask also you, true yokefellow, help these women, who in the gospel labored together with me, with also clement and the rest of the fellow workers of me, whose - names are in the book of life.
50.4.4.1^rejoice in the lord always;
50.4.4.2^again i will say, rejoice!
50.4.5.1^the gentleness of you let be known to all men.
50.4.5.2^the lord is near.
50.4.6.1^nothing be anxious about, but in everything, by prayer and - supplication, with thanksgiving, the requests of you let be made known to - god.
50.4.7.1^and the peace - of god - surpassing all understanding will guard the hearts of you and the minds of you in christ jesus.
50.4.8.1^- finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever venerable, whatever right, whatever pure, whatever lovely, whatever admirable   if any excellence and if any praise   these things think on.
50.4.9.1^what also you have learned and have received and have heard and have seen in me, these things practice;
50.4.9.2^and the god - of peace will be with you.
50.4.10.1^i rejoiced however in the lord greatly that now at last you revived the for me caring;
50.4.10.2^wherein which also you were concerned, you were lacking opportunity however.
50.4.11.1^not that as to destitution i speak;
50.4.11.2^i for have learned in that which i am, content to be.
50.4.12.1^i know also how to be brought low, i know also how to abound.
50.4.12.2^in everything and in all things, i have learned the secret also to be full and to hunger, also to abound and to be deficient.
50.4.13.1^for all things i have strength in the one strengthening me.
50.4.14.1^but well you did, having fellowship in my - affliction.
50.4.15.1^know now also you, philippians, that in the beginning of the gospel, when i went out from macedonia, not one with me church had partnership with regard to the matter of giving and receiving, if not you alone.
50.4.16.1^for even in thessalonica, both once and twice, for the needs of me you sent.
50.4.17.1^not that i seek after the gift, but i seek after the fruit - abounding to the account of you.
50.4.18.1^i have however all things and abound;
50.4.18.2^i am full, having received from epaphroditus the things from you, an odor of a sweet smell, a sacrifice acceptable, well-pleasing - to god.
50.4.19.1^- and the god of me will fill up all the needs of you, according to the riches of him in glory in christ jesus.
50.4.20.1^to now the god and father of us is be the glory to the ages of the ages.
50.4.20.2^amen.
50.4.21.1^greet every saint in christ jesus.
50.4.21.2^greet you, the with me brothers.
50.4.22.1^greet you, all the saints, especially now those from - caesar s household.
50.4.23.1^the grace of the lord jesus christ be with the spirit of you.
51.1.1.1^paul an apostle of christ jesus by the will of god, and timothy the brother,
51.1.2.1^to the in colossae saints and faithful brothers in christ:
51.1.2.2^grace to you and peace from god the father of us.
51.1.3.1^we give thanks to the god and father of the lord of us jesus christ, continually for you praying,
51.1.4.1^having heard of the faith of you in christ jesus and the love that you have toward all the saints,
51.1.5.1^because of the hope - being laid up for you in the heavens, which you heard of before in the word of truth, the gospel,
51.1.6.1^the one being present unto you, just as also in all the world it is bearing fruit and increasing, just as also among you, from the day you heard and knew the grace - of god in truth,
51.1.7.1^just as you learned from epaphras, the beloved fellow bond-servant of us, who is faithful on behalf of us, a servant - of christ,
51.1.8.1^the one also having made known to us - your love in the spirit.
51.1.9.1^because of this also we from the day we heard, not cease for you praying and asking that you may be filled with the knowledge of the will of him in all wisdom and understanding spiritual,
51.1.10.1^to walk worthily of the lord:
51.1.10.2^in all pleasing, in every work good, bringing forth fruit and growing in the knowledge - of god,
51.1.11.1^with all power being strengthened according to the might - glorious of him unto all endurance and patience with joy,
51.1.12.1^giving thanks to the father, the one having qualified you for the share of the inheritance of the saints in the light,
51.1.13.1^who has delivered us from the dominion - of darkness and transferred us into the kingdom of the son - beloved of him,
51.1.14.1^in whom we have - redemption, the forgiveness - of sins.
51.1.15.1^he is the image of the god - invisible, the firstborn over all creation,
51.1.16.1^because in him were created - all things in the heavens and upon the earth, the visible and the invisible, whether thrones or dominions or rulers or authorities;
51.1.16.2^- all things through him and unto him have been created.
51.1.17.1^and he is before all things, and - all things in him hold together.
51.1.18.1^and he is the head of the body, the church, who is the beginning, firstborn out from the dead, so that might be in all things he holding preeminence,
51.1.19.1^because in him was pleased all the fullness to dwell,
51.1.20.1^and by him to reconcile - all things to himself, having made peace by the blood of the cross of him, through him, whether the things on the earth, or the things in the heavens.
51.1.21.1^and you, once being alienated and hostile - in mind in the deeds - evil,
51.1.22.1^now however he has reconciled you in the body of the flesh of him through - death, to present you holy and unblemished and blameless before him,
51.1.23.1^if indeed you continue - in the faith, established and firm, and not being moved away from the hope of the gospel that you have heard, - having been proclaimed in all creation - under - heaven, of which have become i paul a minister.
51.1.24.1^now i rejoice in the sufferings for you, and i am filling up that which is lacking of the tribulations - of christ in the flesh of me for the body of him which is the church,
51.1.25.1^of which became i a minister, according to the administration - of god - having been given me toward you, to complete the word - of god,
51.1.26.1^the mystery - having been hidden from the ages and from the generations, now however having been manifested to the saints of him,
51.1.27.1^to whom has willed - god to make known what is the riches of the glory of the mystery this among the gentiles, which is christ in you, the hope - of glory,
51.1.28.1^whom we preach, admonishing every man and teaching every man in all wisdom, so that we may present every man perfect in christ.
51.1.29.1^unto this also i toil, striving according to the energy of him - working in me in power.
51.2.1.1^i want for you to know how great a struggle i am having for you, and those in laodicea, and as many as not have seen the face of me in the flesh,
51.2.2.1^that may be encouraged the hearts of them, having been knit together in love, and to all the riches of the full assurance - of understanding, to the knowledge of the mystery - of god, which is christ,
51.2.3.1^in whom are all the treasures - of wisdom and of knowledge hidden.
51.2.4.1^this i say so that no one you might delude by persuasive speech.
51.2.5.1^if truly indeed in the flesh i am absent, yet - in spirit with you i am, rejoicing and seeing your - good order and the firmness of the in christ faith of you.
51.2.6.1^just as therefore you have received - christ jesus the lord, in him walk,
51.2.7.1^having been rooted and being built up in him, and being strengthened in the faith just as you were taught, abounding with thanksgiving.
51.2.8.1^take heed lest anyone you there will be - taking captive through - philosophy and empty deceit, according to the tradition - of men, according to the principles of the world and not according to christ.
51.2.9.1^for in him dwells all the fullness of the deity bodily;
51.2.10.1^and you are in him complete, who is the head of all rule and authority,
51.2.11.1^in whom also you were circumcised with the circumcision made without hands, in the removal of the body of the flesh, in the circumcision - of christ,
51.2.12.1^having been buried with him in - baptism, in which also you were raised with him through the faith of the working - of god, the one having raised him out from the dead.
51.2.13.1^and you dead being in the trespasses and in the uncircumcision of the flesh of you, he made alive together you with him, having forgiven us all the transgressions,
51.2.14.1^having blotted out the against us handwriting in the decrees, which was adverse to us;
51.2.14.2^and it he has taken out of the way, having nailed it to the cross.
51.2.15.1^having disarmed the rulers and the authorities, he made a show of them in public, having triumphed over them in it.
51.2.16.1^not therefore anyone you let judge in regard to food, or in regard to drink, or in regard to a feast, or a new moon, or sabbaths,
51.2.17.1^which are a shadow the things coming;
51.2.17.2^the however body is - of christ.
51.2.18.1^no one you let disqualify, delighting in humility and the worship of the angels, which he has seen detailing, vainly being puffed up by the mind of the flesh of him,
51.2.19.1^and not holding fast to the head, from whom all the body, by the joints and ligaments being supplied and being knit together, increases with the increase - of god.
51.2.20.1^if you have died with christ away from the principles of the world, why as if living in the world, do you submit to decrees:
51.2.21.1^not you should handle!
51.2.21.2^not you should taste!
51.2.21.3^not you should touch!
51.2.22.1^which are all unto decay with the use, according to the commandments and teachings - of men,
51.2.23.1^which are an appearance indeed having of wisdom, in self-imposed worship and humility and harsh treatment of the body, not of honor a certain, against the indulgence of the flesh.
51.3.1.1^if then you have been raised with - christ, the things above seek, where - christ is at the right hand - of god sitting.
51.3.2.1^the things above set your minds on, not the things on the earth.
51.3.3.1^you have died for, and the life of you has been hidden with - christ in - god.
51.3.4.1^when - christ may be revealed, the life of you, then also you with him will appear in glory.
51.3.5.1^put to death therefore the members which are upon the earth:
51.3.5.2^sexual immorality, impurity, passion, desire evil, and - covetousness, which is idolatry,
51.3.6.1^because of which things is coming the wrath - of god on the sons of disobedience,
51.3.7.1^in which also you walked once when you were living in them.
51.3.8.1^now however, put off also you - all these things:
51.3.8.2^anger, rage, malice, slander, foul language out of the mouth of you.
51.3.9.1^not do lie to one another, having put off the old man with the practices of him,
51.3.10.1^and having put on the new, the one being renewed in knowledge according to the image of the one having created him,
51.3.11.1^where not there is greek and jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, scythian, slave, free;
51.3.11.2^but - all and in all christ is.
51.3.12.1^put on therefore, as the elect - of god, holy and beloved, hearts of compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience;
51.3.13.1^bearing with each other and forgiving each other.
51.3.13.2^if anyone against another should have a complaint, even as also the lord has forgiven you, so also you.
51.3.14.1^beyond all now these, put on the love, which is the bond - of perfect unity.
51.3.15.1^and the peace - from christ let rule in the hearts of you, to which also you were called in one body.
51.3.15.2^and thankful be.
51.3.16.1^the word - of christ let dwell in you richly, in all wisdom teaching and admonishing each other in psalms, hymns, and songs spiritual, with - grace singing, in the hearts of you, to god.
51.3.17.1^and everything, which what if you might do in word or in deed, all in the name of the lord jesus, giving thanks - to god the father through him.
51.3.18.1^- wives, submit yourselves to the husbands, as is fitting in the lord.
51.3.19.1^- husbands, love the wives, and not be harsh toward them.
51.3.20.1^- children, obey the parents in all things;
51.3.20.2^this for pleasing is in the lord.
51.3.21.1^- fathers, not do provoke the children of you, that not they might become discouraged.
51.3.22.1^- slaves, obey in all things the according to flesh masters, not with eye-services as men-pleasers, but in sincerity of heart, fearing the lord.
51.3.23.1^whatever if you might do, from the soul work, as to the lord and not to men,
51.3.24.1^knowing that from the lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance.
51.3.24.2^the lord christ you serve.
51.3.25.1^the one for doing wrong will be repaid for what he has done wrong, and not there is partiality.
51.4.1.1^- masters, that which is righteous and that which is equal, to the slaves give, knowing that also you have a master in heaven.
51.4.2.1^- in prayer continue steadfastly, watching in it with thanksgiving,
51.4.3.1^praying at the same time also for us, that - god may open to us a door for the word, to declare the mystery - of christ, on account of which also i have been bound,
51.4.4.1^so that i should make clear it, as it behooves me to speak.
51.4.5.1^in wisdom walk toward those outside, the time redeeming.
51.4.6.1^- let the speech of you be always in grace, with salt having been seasoned, to know how it behooves you one each to answer.
51.4.7.1^the things concerning me all will make known to you tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant and fellow bond-servant in the lord,
51.4.8.1^whom i sent to you for this very purpose, that you might know the things concerning us, and he may encourage the hearts of you,
51.4.9.1^with onesimus, the faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you.
51.4.9.2^all things to you they will make known - here.
51.4.10.1^greets you, aristarchus the fellow prisoner of me, and mark, the cousin of barnabas, concerning whom you have received instructions   if he comes to you, welcome him
51.4.11.1^and also jesus - called justus, - being among the circumcision these only fellow workers for the kingdom - of god, who have been to me a comfort.
51.4.12.1^greets you, epaphras who is one of you, a servant of christ jesus, always struggling for you in the prayers, so that you may stand mature and fully assured in all the will - of god.
51.4.13.1^i bear witness for to him that he has great concern for you and those in laodicea and them in hiera polis.
51.4.14.1^greets you, luke the physician - beloved, and also demas.
51.4.15.1^greet the in laodicea brothers, and also nympha, and the in house of her church.
51.4.16.1^and when shall be read among you the letter, cause that also in the of the laodiceans church it may be read, and the one from laodicea that also you may read.
