51.4.17.1^and say to archippus, take heed to the ministry that you have received in the lord, that it you may fulfill.
51.4.18.1^the greeting is in the own hand   paul.
51.4.18.2^remember my - chains.
51.4.18.3^- grace be with you.
52.1.1.1^paul and silvanus and timothy, to the church of the thessalonians in god the father and the lord jesus christ:
52.1.1.2^grace to you and peace.
52.1.2.1^we give thanks to god always concerning all of you, mention making in the prayers of us, unceasingly
52.1.3.1^remembering your - work - of faith and - labor - of love, and the endurance of the hope of the lord of us jesus christ, before the god and father of us,
52.1.4.1^knowing, brothers beloved by - god, the election of you,
52.1.5.1^because the gospel of us not came to you in word only, but also in power and in the spirit holy, and with full assurance much, just as you know what we were among you on account of you.
52.1.6.1^and you imitators of us became, and of the lord, having received the word in tribulation much, with the joy of the spirit holy,
52.1.7.1^so as for to became you an example to all the believing ones in - macedonia and in - achaia.
52.1.8.1^from you for has sounded forth the word of the lord, not only in - macedonia and in - achaia, but in every place the faith of you - toward - god has gone abroad, so as for no need to have us to say anything.
52.1.9.1^they themselves for concerning us report what reception we had from you, and how you turned to - god from - idols, to serve the god living and true,
52.1.10.1^and to await the son of him from the heavens, whom he raised out from the dead, jesus, the one delivering us from the wrath - coming.
52.2.1.1^you yourselves for know, brothers, the coming of us - to you that not in vain has been;
52.2.2.1^but having previously suffered and having been mistreated just as you know, in philippi, we had boldness in the god of us, to speak to you the gospel - of god amid much conflict.
52.2.3.1^- for the exhortation of us is not of error, nor of impurity, nor in trickery;
52.2.4.1^but just as we have been approved by - god to be entrusted with the gospel, so we speak, not as men pleasing, but god, the one examining the hearts of us.
52.2.5.1^never for at any time with word of flattery were we, just as you know, nor with a pretext for greed   god is witness
52.2.6.1^nor seeking from men glory, nor from you, nor from others,
52.2.7.1^though having authority with weight to be, as christ s apostles.
52.2.7.2^but we were infants in the midst of you, as if a nursing mother would cherish - her own children.
52.2.8.1^so yearning over you, we were pleased to have imparted to you not only the gospel - of god, but also our own lives, because beloved to us you have become.
52.2.9.1^you remember for, brothers, the labor of us and - hardship:
52.2.9.2^night and day working, in order - not to burden anyone of you, we proclaimed to you the gospel - of god.
52.2.10.1^you are witnesses, and - god, how holily, and righteously, and blamelessly, toward you, those believing, we were;
52.2.11.1^just as you know how one each of you, as a father children his own,
52.2.12.1^exhorting you and comforting and charging unto - to walk you worthily - of god, who calls you into the of himself kingdom and glory.
52.2.13.1^and because of this also, we give thanks - to god unceasingly that, having received the word by your hearing from us - of god, you accepted not the word of men, but even as it is, truly the word of god, which also works in you who believe.
52.2.14.1^you for imitators became, brothers, of the churches - of god - being in - judea in christ jesus.
52.2.14.2^for the same as them, suffered also you from the own countrymen, as also did they from the jews,
52.2.15.1^who both the lord having killed, jesus, and their own prophets, and us having driven out, and god not pleasing, and all men who are set against,
52.2.16.1^hindering us to the gentiles to speak, that they might be saved, so as - to fill up their - sins always.
52.2.16.2^has come now upon them the wrath to the utmost.
52.2.17.1^we however, brothers, having been bereaved of you for the time of an hour, in face, not in heart, more abundantly were eager the face of you to see with great desire.
52.2.18.1^therefore we wanted to come to you   i indeed paul, both once and twice   and hindered us - satan.
52.2.19.1^who is for our hope, or joy, or crown of boasting?
52.2.19.2^or are not even you, before the lord of us jesus, at - his coming?
52.2.20.1^you for are the glory of us, and - joy.
52.3.1.1^therefore no longer enduring, we thought it best to be left behind in athens alone,
52.3.2.1^and we sent timothy, the brother of us and fellow worker - of god in the gospel - of christ, in order - to strengthen you and to encourage concerning the faith of you,
52.3.3.1^that no one be moved in the tribulations these.
52.3.3.2^yourselves for you know that for this we are destined.
52.3.4.1^and indeed, when with you we were, we were telling beforehand you that we are about to suffer affliction, just as also it came to pass, and you know.
52.3.5.1^because of this i also, no longer enduring, sent in order - to know the faith of you, lest somehow had tempted you the one tempting, and in vain would be the labor of us.
52.3.6.1^presently however, having come timothy to us from you, and having brought good news to us of the faith and the love of you, and that you have a remembrance of us good always, longing us to see, just as also we you,
52.3.7.1^because of this we were encouraged, brothers, as to you, in all the distress and tribulation of us, through - your faith.
52.3.8.1^for now we live, if you are standing firm in the lord.
52.3.9.1^what for thanksgiving are we able - to god to give concerning you in return for all the joy that we rejoice because of you, before the god of us,
52.3.10.1^night and day, exceedingly imploring for us - to see your - face and to supply the things lacking in the faith of you?
52.3.11.1^himself now the god and father of us, and the lord of us jesus, may direct the way of us to you.
52.3.12.1^you now, the lord may make to increase, and to abound - in love toward one another, and toward all, just as also we toward you,
52.3.13.1^in order - to strengthen your - hearts, blameless in holiness before the god and father of us at the coming of the lord of us jesus, with all the saints of him.
52.3.13.2^amen.
52.4.1.1^finally then, brothers, we implore you and exhort in the lord jesus that, just as you have received from us - in what manner it behooves you to walk and to please god, just as even you walk now, so you should abound more.
52.4.2.1^you know for what instructions we gave you, through the lord jesus.
52.4.3.1^this for is the will - of god, the sanctification of you:
52.4.3.2^to abstain you are from - sexual immorality;
52.4.4.1^to know each of you how the of himself vessel to control in holiness and honor,
52.4.5.1^not in the passion of lust, as also the gentiles, - not knowing - god;
52.4.6.1^- not to go beyond and to overreach in the matter, the brother of him, because avenging is the lord concerning all these things, just as also we told before you, and thoroughly warned.
52.4.7.1^not for has called us - god to impurity, but into holiness.
52.4.8.1^so then, the one rejecting this, not man disregards, but - god, the one also giving the spirit of him - holy to you.
52.4.9.1^concerning now - brotherly love, no need you have for me to write to you, yourselves for you taught by god are, in order - to love one another.
52.4.10.1^and for you are doing this toward all the brothers, the ones in all - macedonia.
52.4.10.2^we exhort however you, brothers, to abound more and more,
52.4.11.1^and to strive earnestly to live quietly and to attend to the own, and to work with the own hands of you, just as you we commanded,
52.4.12.1^so that you may walk properly toward those outside, and of no one need may have.
52.4.13.1^not we do want but you to be ignorant, brothers, concerning those having fallen asleep, so that not you should be grieved, just as also the rest, those not having hope.
52.4.14.1^if for we believe that jesus died and rose again, so also - god, those having fallen asleep through - jesus, will bring with him.
52.4.15.1^this for to you we declare in the word of the lord, that we the living - remaining, unto the coming of the lord no not shall precede those having fallen asleep,
52.4.16.1^because himself the lord with a loud command, with the voice of an archangel, and with the trumpet of god, will descend from heaven, and the dead in christ will rise first.
52.4.17.1^then we the living - remaining, together with them, will be caught away in the clouds for the meeting of the lord in the air;
52.4.17.2^and so always with the lord we will be.
52.4.18.1^therefore encourage one another with the words these.
52.5.1.1^concerning now the times and the seasons, brothers, no need you have to you to be written.
52.5.2.1^yourselves for fully you know that the day of the lord, as a thief by night, in this manner comes.
52.5.3.1^for when they might say, peace and security, then suddenly upon them comes destruction, as the labor pains to her in womb having;
52.5.3.2^and no not shall they escape.
52.5.4.1^you however, brothers, not are in darkness, that the day you like a thief should overtake.
52.5.5.1^all for you, sons of light are, and sons of day.
52.5.5.2^not we are of night nor of darkness.
52.5.6.1^so then not we should sleep as the others, but we should watch and we should be sober.
52.5.7.1^those for sleeping, by night sleep;
52.5.7.2^and those becoming drunk, by night get drunk.
52.5.8.1^we however, of the day being, should be sober, having put on the breastplate of faith and love, and the helmet the hope of salvation,
52.5.9.1^because not has destined us - god for wrath, but for obtaining salvation through the lord of us jesus christ,
52.5.10.1^the one having died for us, so that whether we might watch or we might sleep, together with him we may live.
52.5.11.1^therefore encourage one another and build up one - another, just as also you are doing.
52.5.12.1^we implore however you, brothers, to appreciate those toiling among you and taking the lead over you in the lord, and admonishing you,
52.5.13.1^and to esteem them exceedingly in love, because of the work of them.
52.5.13.2^be at peace among yourselves.
52.5.14.1^we exhort now you, brothers, to admonish the unruly, encourage the fainthearted, help the weak, be patient toward all.
52.5.15.1^see that no one evil for evil to anyone has repaid, but always the good pursue also toward one another and toward all.
52.5.16.1^always rejoice.
52.5.17.1^unceasingly pray.
52.5.18.1^in everything give thanks;
52.5.18.2^this for is the will of god in christ jesus toward you.
52.5.19.1^the spirit not do quench.
52.5.20.1^prophecies not do despise.
52.5.21.1^all things however test.
52.5.21.2^to the good hold fast.
52.5.22.1^from every form of evil abstain.
52.5.23.1^himself now, the god - of peace may sanctify you completely;
52.5.23.2^and entirely your - spirit and - soul and - body, blameless at the coming of the lord of us jesus christ, may be preserved.
52.5.24.1^is faithful the one calling you, who also will do it.
52.5.25.1^brothers, pray also for us.
52.5.26.1^greet the brothers all with a kiss holy.
52.5.27.1^i adjure you by the lord to be read this letter to all the brothers.
52.5.28.1^the grace of the lord of us jesus christ be with you.
53.1.1.1^paul and silvanus and timothy, to the church of the thessalonians in god the father of us and the lord jesus christ:
53.1.2.1^grace to you and peace from god the father of us and the lord jesus christ.
53.1.3.1^to thank we ought - god always concerning you, brothers, just as fitting it is, because is increasing exceedingly the faith of you, and is abounding the love of one each of all you to one another;
53.1.4.1^so as for ourselves, us in you to boast, in the churches - of god, about the perseverance of you, and faith in all the persecutions of you, and in the tribulations that you are bearing.
53.1.5.1^this is a plain token of the righteous judgment - of god, unto - to be accounted worthy you of the kingdom - of god, for which also you suffer.
53.1.6.1^for indeed righteous it is with god to repay those oppressing you with affliction,
53.1.7.1^and to you - being oppressed, repose with us at the revelation of the lord jesus from heaven, with the angels mighty of him
53.1.8.1^in a fire of flame, inflicting vengeance on those not knowing god and on those not obeying the gospel of the lord of us jesus,
53.1.9.1^who the penalty will suffer of destruction eternal, away from the presence of the lord and from the glory of the power of him,
53.1.10.1^when he shall come to be glorified in the saints of him, and to be marveled at among all those having believed, because was believed the testimony of us to you in the day that,
53.1.11.1^for which also we pray always for you, that you he may count worthy of the calling of the god of us, and he may fulfill every good pleasure of goodness and work of faith with power,
53.1.12.1^so that may be glorified the name of the lord of us jesus in you, and you in him, according to the grace of the god of us and the lord jesus christ.
53.2.1.1^we implore now you, brothers, by the coming of the lord of us jesus christ and our gathering together unto him,
53.2.2.1^for - not quickly to be shaken you in - mind nor to be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word, nor by letter, as if by us, as that is present the day of the lord.
53.2.3.1^no one you should deceive in not one way, because it is if not until shall have come the apostasy first, and shall have been revealed the man - of lawlessness, the son - of destruction,
53.2.4.1^the one opposing and exalting himself above every so-called god or object of worship, so as for him in the temple - of god to sit down, setting forth he himself that is god.
53.2.5.1^not do you remember that, yet being with you, these things i was saying to you?
53.2.6.1^and now that which is restraining, you know, for - to be revealed him in - his time.
53.2.7.1^the for mystery already is working - of lawlessness;
53.2.7.2^only there is the one restraining it at present until out of the midst he might be gone.
53.2.8.1^and then will be revealed the lawless one, whom the lord jesus will slay with the breath of the mouth of him and will annul by the appearing of the coming of him,
53.2.9.1^whose is - coming, according to the working - of satan, in every power, and in signs, and in wonders of falsehood,
53.2.10.1^and in every deceit of wickedness unto those perishing, in return for which the love of the truth not they received, in order for - to be saved them.
53.2.11.1^and because of this, will send to them - god a working of delusion, for - to believe them what is false,
53.2.12.1^in order that should be judged all those not having believed the truth, but having delighted - in unrighteousness.
53.2.13.1^we however ought to give thanks - to god always concerning you, brothers beloved by the lord, that has chosen you - god from the beginning, unto salvation in the sanctification of the spirit, and by faith of the truth;
53.2.14.1^to this also he called you, through the gospel of us, to the obtaining of the glory of the lord of us jesus christ.
53.2.15.1^so then, brothers, stand firm and hold fast to the traditions that you were taught, whether by word, or by letter from us.
53.2.16.1^himself now the lord of us jesus christ, and - god, the father of us, the one having loved us and having given us comfort eternal and hope good by grace,
53.2.17.1^may he encourage your - hearts and may he strengthen them in every work and word good.
53.3.1.1^- finally, pray, brothers, for us, that the word of the lord may spread quickly and may be glorified, just as also with you,
53.3.2.1^and that we may be delivered from - perverse and evil men;
53.3.2.2^not for all are of the faith.
53.3.3.1^faithful however is the lord, who will strengthen you and will keep you from - evil.
53.3.4.1^we are persuaded now in the lord as to you, that the things that we command, both you are doing and you will do.
53.3.5.1^- and the lord may direct your - hearts into the love - of god and into the steadfastness - of christ.
53.3.6.1^we command now you, brothers, in the name of the lord of us jesus christ, are to withdraw you from every brother idly walking and not according to the tradition that you received from us.
53.3.7.1^yourselves for you know how it behooves you to imitate us, because not we were idle among you,
53.3.8.1^nor without payment bread did we eat from anyone, but in labor and hardship, night and day working, in order - not to be burdensome to any of you,
53.3.9.1^not that not we have the right, but that ourselves as an example we may offer to you, for - you to imitate us.
53.3.10.1^even for when we were with you, this we were commanding you, that if anyone not is willing to work, neither let him eat.
53.3.11.1^we hear for some are walking among you idly, not at all working, but being busybodies.
53.3.12.1^to now such, we warn and exhort by our lord jesus christ, so that, with quietness working, - their own bread they may eat.
53.3.13.1^you now, brothers, not shall grow weary in well-doing.
53.3.14.1^if then anyone not obey this instruction of us through the letter, of this man take note not to mix with him, so that he may be ashamed.
53.3.15.1^and yet not as an enemy esteem him, but admonish him as a brother.
53.3.16.1^himself now the lord - of peace may give you - peace through all, in every way.
53.3.16.2^the lord be with all of you.
53.3.17.1^the greeting - in my own hand   paul, which is my sign in every letter.
53.3.17.2^in this manner i write.
53.3.18.1^the grace of the lord of us jesus christ be with all of you.
54.1.1.1^paul, an apostle of christ jesus according to the command of god the savior of us, and of christ jesus, the hope of us,
54.1.2.1^to timothy, my true child in the faith:
54.1.2.2^grace, mercy, and peace from god the father, and christ jesus, the lord of us.
54.1.3.1^just as i urged you to remain in ephesus, when i was going to macedonia, so that you might warn certain men not to teach other doctrines,
54.1.4.1^nor to give heed to myths and genealogies endless, which speculations bring, rather than stewardship of god, which is in faith.
54.1.5.1^- and the goal of our instruction is love out of a pure heart and a conscience good and a faith sincere,
54.1.6.1^from which some, having missed the mark, have turned aside to meaningless discourse,
54.1.7.1^desiring to be teachers of the law, not understanding neither what they are saying, nor that about which they confidently assert.
54.1.8.1^we know now that good is the law, if one it lawfully uses,
54.1.9.1^knowing this, that for a righteous one law not is enacted, for the lawless however, and insubordinate, for the ungodly and sinful, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for slayers of man,
54.1.10.1^for the sexually immoral, homosexuals, enslavers, liars, perjurers, and if anything other, in the being sound teaching, is opposed to,
54.1.11.1^according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed god, with which have been entrusted i.
54.1.12.1^thankfulness i have for the one having strengthened me, christ jesus the lord of us, that faithful me he esteemed, having appointed me to service,
54.1.13.1^- formerly being a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and insolent;
54.1.13.2^but i was shown mercy, because being ignorant, i did it in unbelief.
54.1.14.1^surpassingly increased then the grace of the lord of us, with the faith and love, that are in christ jesus.
54.1.15.1^trustworthy is the saying and of full acceptance worthy, that christ jesus came into the world sinners to save, of whom the foremost am i.
54.1.16.1^but because of this, i was shown mercy, that in me, the foremost, might display christ jesus - perfect patience, as a pattern for those being about to believe on him, to life eternal.
54.1.17.1^to now the king of the ages, the immortal, invisible, only god, be honor and glory, to the ages of the ages.
54.1.17.2^amen.
54.1.18.1^this - charge i commit to you, my child timothy, according to the going before as to you prophecies, that you might war by them the good warfare,
54.1.19.1^holding faith and a good conscience, which some, having cast away, concerning the faith have caused a shipwreck,
54.1.20.1^among whom are hymenaeus and alexander, whom i have handed over - to satan that they may be disciplined not to blaspheme.
54.2.1.1^i exhort therefore, first of all, to be made entreaties, prayers, intercessions, and thanksgivings, on behalf of all men,
54.2.2.1^for kings and all those in authority being, so that a tranquil and quiet life we may lead, in all godliness and dignity.
54.2.3.1^this is good and acceptable before the savior of us, god,
54.2.4.1^who all men desires to be saved, and to the knowledge of the truth to come.
54.2.5.1^one for god there is, one then mediator between god and men, the man christ jesus,
54.2.6.1^the one having given himself as a ransom for all, the testimony in proper times their own,
54.2.7.1^in regard to which was appointed i a herald and an apostle   the truth i am speaking;
54.2.7.2^not i do lie   a teacher of the gentiles, in faith and truth.
54.2.8.1^i desire therefore to pray the men in every place, lifting up holy hands, apart from anger and dissension.
54.2.9.1^likewise also women, in apparel respectable, with modesty and self-control, should adorn themselves, not with braided hair, or gold, or pearls, or clothing costly,
54.2.10.1^but with what is becoming to women professing the fear of god, through works good.
54.2.11.1^a woman in quietness let learn in all submissiveness.
54.2.12.1^to teach however, a woman not i do permit, nor to use authority over a man, but to be in quietness.
54.2.13.1^adam for first was formed, then eve.
54.2.14.1^and adam not was deceived;
54.2.14.2^- but the woman, having been deceived, into transgression has come.
54.2.15.1^she will be saved however through - childbearing, if they abide in faith and love and holiness, with self-restraint.
54.3.1.1^trustworthy is the saying:
54.3.1.2^if anyone overseership aspires to, of good a work he is desirous.
54.3.2.1^it behooves therefore the overseer above reproach to be, of one wife the husband, sober, self-controlled, respectable, hospitable, able to teach,
54.3.3.1^not given to wine, not a striker, but gentle, peaceable, not loving money,
54.3.4.1^the own house well managing, children having in submission, with all dignity
54.3.5.1^if but one the own household to manage not knows, how the church of god how will he care for?
54.3.6.1^not a novice, that not having been puffed up, into the judgment he might fall of the devil.
54.3.7.1^it behooves him now also a testimony good to have from those outside, so that not into reproach he might fall, and the snare of the devil.
54.3.8.1^deacons likewise must be dignified, not double-tongued, not to wine much being given, not greedy of dishonest gain,
54.3.9.1^holding to the mystery of the faith with clear a conscience.
54.3.10.1^also these now, let them be tested first;
54.3.10.2^then let them serve, blameless being.
54.3.11.1^women likewise must be dignified, not slanderers, clear-minded, faithful in all things.
54.3.12.1^deacons let be of one wife husbands, their children well managing and the own households.
54.3.13.1^those for well having served, a standing for themselves good acquire, and great confidence in the faith that is in christ jesus.
54.3.14.1^these things to you i am writing, hoping to come to you in a short time,
54.3.15.1^if however i should delay, so that you may know how it behooves one in the household of god to conduct oneself, which is the church of god the living, the pillar and base of the truth.
54.3.16.1^and confessedly, great is the - of godliness mystery:
54.3.16.2^who was revealed in the flesh, was justified in the spirit, was seen by angels, was proclaimed among the nations, was believed on in the world, was taken up in glory.
54.4.1.1^- but the spirit expressly states that in later times, will depart from some the faith, giving heed to spirits deceitful and teachings of demons,
54.4.2.1^in hypocrisy of speakers of lies, having been seared in the own conscience,
54.4.3.1^forbidding to marry, commanding to abstain from foods that - god created for reception with thanksgiving by the faithful and those knowing the truth.
54.4.4.1^for every creature of god is good, and nothing is to be rejected, with thanksgiving being received;
54.4.5.1^it is sanctified for by the word of god and prayer.
54.4.6.1^these things laying before the brothers, good you will be a servant of christ jesus, being nourished in the words of the faith and of the good teaching that you have closely followed.
54.4.7.1^- but profane and silly fables refuse.
54.4.7.2^train rather yourself to godliness.
54.4.8.1^- for bodily exercise of a little is profit, - but godliness for everything profitable is, the promise holding of life of the present, and of the one coming.
54.4.9.1^trustworthy is the saying, and of full acceptance worthy.
54.4.10.1^for this for we toil and strive, because we have hope on god the living, who is the savior of all men, especially of believers.
54.4.11.1^command these things and teach.
54.4.12.1^no one your - youth let despise, but a pattern be for the believers in speech, in conduct, in love, in faith, in purity.
54.4.13.1^until i come, give heed to the public reading of scripture, to exhortation, to teaching.
54.4.14.1^not be negligent of the in you gift, which was given to you through prophecy, with the laying on of the hands of the elderhood.
54.4.15.1^these things ponder;
54.4.15.2^in them be absorbed, so that your - progress evident may be to all.
54.4.16.1^give heed to yourself and to the teaching.
54.4.16.2^continue in them, this for doing, both yourself you will save and those hearing you.
54.5.1.1^an elder not do rebuke, but exhort him as a father;
54.5.1.2^younger men as brothers;
54.5.2.1^elder women as mothers;
54.5.2.2^and younger women as sisters, in all purity.
54.5.3.1^widows honor, who are truly widows.
54.5.4.1^if however any widow, children or grandchildren has, let them learn first to the own household to be devout and recompense to give to parents;
54.5.4.2^this for is pleasing before - god.
54.5.5.1^she who is now indeed a widow, and being left alone, has hope in god, and continues - in supplications and - prayers night and day.
54.5.6.1^she however living in self-indulgence, while living is dead.
54.5.7.1^also these things command, so that above reproach they should be.
54.5.8.1^if now anyone the own, and especially his household, not does provide for, the faith he has denied, and he is than an unbeliever worse.
54.5.9.1^a widow let be enrolled not less than years old sixty, being of one man the wife,
54.5.10.1^in works good being borne witness to, if she has brought up children, if she entertained strangers, if saints  feet she has washed, if to those being oppressed she has imparted relief, if every work good she has followed after.
54.5.11.1^younger however widows refuse;
54.5.11.2^when for they might grow wanton against - christ, to marry they desire,
54.5.12.1^incurring judgment because the first faith they have cast off.
54.5.13.1^at the same time then also to be idle they learn, going about - house to house;
54.5.13.2^not only then idle, but also gossips and busybodies, speaking things not being proper.
54.5.14.1^i want therefore the younger ones to marry, to bear children, to manage their households, no occasion to give the one opposing of reproach on account.
54.5.15.1^already for some have turned aside after - satan.
54.5.16.1^if any believing woman has dependent widows, let her impart relief to them, and not let be burdened the church, so that to those who are truly widows it may impart relief.
54.5.17.1^the well ruling elders, of double honor let be counted worthy, especially those straining in the word and the teaching.
54.5.18.1^says for the scripture, an ox treading out grain not you shall muzzle,  and, worthy is the workman of the wages of him.
54.5.19.1^against an elder an accusation not do receive, except if not upon two or three witnesses.
54.5.20.1^those sinning before, all rebuke, so that also the rest, fear might have.
54.5.21.1^i earnestly testify before - god and christ jesus and the elect angels that these things you should keep, apart from prejudice, nothing doing out of partiality.
54.5.22.1^hands hastily on no one lay, nor share in the sins of others;
54.5.22.2^yourself pure keep.
54.5.23.1^no longer drink only water, but wine a little use, because of the stomach and the frequent of you ailments.
54.5.24.1^of some men the sins manifest are, going before them to judgment;
54.5.24.2^of some however also they appear later.
54.5.25.1^likewise also, the works - good are evident, and even those otherwise being, to be concealed not able.
54.6.1.1^as many as are under a yoke as slaves, the own masters of all honor worthy let them esteem, so that not the name - of god and the teaching should be blasphemed.
54.6.2.1^those now believing having masters, not let them despise them because brothers they are;
54.6.2.2^but rather let them serve them, because believing ones they are, and beloved, - by the good service being helped.
54.6.2.3^these things teach and exhort.
54.6.3.1^if anyone teaches another doctrine and not draws near the being sound words - of the lord of us jesus christ and the according to godliness teaching,
54.6.4.1^he is puffed up, nothing knowing but unhealthy about controversies and disputes about words, out of which come envy, strife, slander, suspicions evil,
54.6.5.1^and constant frictions corrupted among men - in mind, and destitute of the truth, holding a means of gain to be - godliness.
54.6.6.1^is however gain great - godliness with contentment.
54.6.7.1^nothing for we brought into the world, because neither to carry out anything are we able.
54.6.8.1^having however sustenance and coverings, with these we will be content.
54.6.9.1^those however desiring to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and desires many foolish and harmful, which plunge - men into ruin and destruction.
54.6.10.1^a root for of all kinds - of evils is the love of money, which some stretching after have been seduced away from the faith, and themselves have pierced with sorrows many.
54.6.11.1^you however, o man of god, these things flee;
54.6.11.2^pursue now righteousness, godliness, faith, love, endurance, and gentleness.
54.6.12.1^fight the good fight of the faith.
54.6.12.2^lay hold of the eternal life, to which you were called, and also did confess the good confession before many witnesses.
54.6.13.1^i charge you before - god, the one giving life to all things, and christ jesus, the one having testified before pontius pilate the good confession,
54.6.14.1^to keep you the commandment without stain, above reproach, until the appearing of the lord of us jesus christ,
54.6.15.1^which seasons in the own he will display, the blessed and alone sovereign, the king of those being kings, and the lord of those being lords,
54.6.16.1^- alone having immortality, in light dwelling unapproachable, whom has seen no one of men nor to see is able, to whom be honor and dominion eternal.
54.6.16.2^amen.
54.6.17.1^to the rich in the present age, instruct them not to be high-minded, nor to have hope in of riches the uncertainty, but on god the one providing us all things richly for enjoyment,
54.6.18.1^to do good, to be rich in works good, generous in distributing to be, ready to share,
54.6.19.1^treasuring up for themselves a foundation good for the future, so that they may take hold of that which is indeed life.
54.6.20.1^o timothy, the deposit committed to you guard, avoiding - profane, empty babblings and opposing arguments - falsely called knowledge,
54.6.21.1^which some professing, from the faith have gone astray.
54.6.21.2^- grace be with you all.
55.1.1.1^paul, an apostle of christ jesus by the will of god, according to the promise of life - in christ jesus,
55.1.2.1^to timothy my beloved child:
55.1.2.2^grace, mercy, and peace from god the father and christ jesus the lord of us.
55.1.3.1^thankful i am - to god, whom i serve from my forefathers with a pure conscience, as unceasingly i have the of you remembrance in the prayers of me night and day,
55.1.4.1^longing you to see, recalling your - tears, so that with joy i may be filled,
55.1.5.1^remembrance having taken of the within you sincere faith, which dwelt first in the grandmother of you, lois, and in the mother of you, eunice;
55.1.5.2^i am persuaded now that also it is in you.
55.1.6.1^for this reason i remind you to kindle anew the gift - of god, which is in you by the laying on of the hands of me.
55.1.7.1^not for has given us - god a spirit of cowardice, but of power, and of love, and of self-control.
55.1.8.1^not therefore you should be ashamed of the testimony of the lord of us, nor of me the prisoner of him;
55.1.8.2^but suffer together for the gospel, according to the power of god,
55.1.9.1^the one having saved us, and having called us with a calling holy, not according to the works of us, but according to his own purpose and grace, - having been given us in christ jesus before time eternal,
55.1.10.1^having been made manifest also now by the appearing of the savior of us, christ jesus, having abolished indeed - death, having brought to light now life and immortality, through the gospel,
55.1.11.1^to which was appointed i a herald, and an apostle, and a teacher.
55.1.12.1^for this reason also these things i suffer.
55.1.12.2^but not i am ashamed;
55.1.12.3^i know for whom i have believed, and i am persuaded that able he is the deposit entrusted of me to guard for that - day.
55.1.13.1^the pattern retain of sound words, which from me you did hear, in the faith and love that are in christ jesus.
55.1.14.1^the good deposit entrusted to you keep, by the spirit holy, the one dwelling in us.
55.1.15.1^you know this, that turned away from me all those in - asia, among whom are phygelus and hermogenes.
55.1.16.1^may grant mercy the lord to the of onesiphorus household, because often me he refreshed, and the chain of me not he was ashamed of.
55.1.17.1^but having arrived in rome, earnestly he sought out me and found me.
55.1.18.1^may grant unto him the lord to find mercy from the lord in that - day!
55.1.18.2^and how much in ephesus he served very well, you know.
55.2.1.1^you therefore, child of me, be strong in the grace that is in christ jesus.
55.2.2.1^and the things which you have heard from me among many witnesses, these entrust to faithful men, such as sufficient will be also others to teach.
55.2.3.1^share in suffering as a good soldier of christ jesus.
55.2.4.1^no one serving as a soldier entangles himself in the of this life affairs, that the one having enlisted him, he might please.
55.2.5.1^if now also competes anyone, not he is crowned, if not lawfully he shall have competed.
55.2.6.1^for the hardworking farmer it is necessary first of the fruits to partake.
55.2.7.1^consider the things i am saying;
55.2.7.2^will give for you the lord understanding in all things.
55.2.8.1^remember jesus christ, having been raised out from the dead, of the seed of david, according to - gospel my,
55.2.9.1^in which i suffer hardship, even to chains as an evildoer.
55.2.9.2^but the word - of god not is bound!
55.2.10.1^because of this, all things i endure for the sake of the elect, so that also they the salvation may obtain that is in christ jesus, with glory eternal.
55.2.11.1^trustworthy is the saying:
55.2.11.2^if for we have died together with him, also we will live together with him;
55.2.12.1^if we endure, also we will reign together with him;
55.2.12.2^if we will deny him, he also will deny us;
55.2.13.1^if we are faithless, he faithful remains;
55.2.13.2^to deny for himself, not he is able.
55.2.14.1^these things remind them, solemnly charging them before - god not to quarrel about words, for nothing profitable but to the subversion of those hearing.
55.2.15.1^hasten yourself, approved to present - to god a workman not ashamed, accurately handling the word - of truth.
55.2.16.1^- but worldly, empty babblings avoid, on to more for they will lead ungodliness,
55.2.17.1^and the talk of them like gangrene pasture to grow will have, among whom are hymenaeus and philetus,
55.2.18.1^who concerning the truth have gone astray, asserting the resurrection already to have taken place;
55.2.18.2^and they are overthrowing the of some faith.
55.2.19.1^- nevertheless, the firm foundation of god stands, having the seal this:
55.2.19.2^knows the lord those being his, and, let depart from iniquity everyone - naming the name of the lord.
55.2.20.1^in a great now house, not there are only vessels golden and silver, but also wooden and earthen;
55.2.20.2^and some indeed unto honor, some however unto dishonor.
55.2.21.1^if therefore anyone shall have cleansed himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, having been sanctified, useful to the master, for every work good having been prepared.
55.2.22.1^- and youthful lusts flee;
55.2.22.2^pursue now righteousness, faith, love, and peace, along with those calling on the lord out of pure a heart.
55.2.23.1^- and foolish and ignorant speculations refuse, knowing that they breed quarrels.
55.2.24.1^the bond-servant now of the lord, not it behooves to quarrel, but gentle to be toward all, able to teach, forbearing,
55.2.25.1^in gentleness disciplining those opposing, lest ever may give them - god repentance, unto a knowledge of the truth,
55.2.26.1^and they might come to their senses out of the of the devil snare, having been captured by him for - his will.
55.3.1.1^this however realize, that in the last days will be present times difficult.
55.3.2.1^will be for - men lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, proud, abusive, to parents disobedient, ungrateful, unholy,
55.3.3.1^unloving, implacable, slanderous, without self-control, savage, without love of good,
55.3.4.1^treacherous, reckless, puffed up, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of god,
55.3.5.1^having a form of godliness - but the power of it denying.
55.3.5.2^and these turn away from.
55.3.6.1^out of this sort for are those entering into - households and taking captive weak women, burdened with sins, being led away by passions various,
55.3.7.1^always learning and never to a knowledge of the truth to come being able.
55.3.8.1^by which way now jannes and jambres opposed moses, so also these oppose the truth, men being depraved - in mind, disqualified regarding the faith.
55.3.9.1^but not they will advance further much, - for the folly of them plain will be to all, as also that of those two became.
55.3.10.1^you however have closely followed my - teaching, - conduct, - purpose, - faith, - patience, - love, - endurance,
55.3.11.1^- persecutions, - sufferings such as to me happened in antioch, in iconium, in lystra;
55.3.11.2^what manner of persecutions i endured!
55.3.11.3^and yet out of all, me delivered the lord.
55.3.12.1^also all now - desiring piously to live in christ jesus will be persecuted.
55.3.13.1^evil however men and imposters will advance to - worse, deceiving and being deceived.
55.3.14.1^you however, abide in the things you have learned and have been assured of, having known from whom you learned them,
55.3.15.1^and that from childhood the sacred writings you have known, - being able you to make wise unto salvation, through faith, - in christ jesus.
55.3.16.1^every scripture is god-breathed and profitable for instruction, for conviction, for correction, and for training - in righteousness,
55.3.17.1^so that complete may be the - of god man, toward every work good having been fully equipped.
55.4.1.1^i earnestly declare before - god and christ jesus, the one being about to judge the living and the dead, and by the appearing of him and the kingdom of him:
55.4.2.1^preach the word;
55.4.2.2^be ready in season and out of season;
55.4.2.3^convict, rebuke, and exhort, with complete patience and instruction.
55.4.3.1^there will be for a time when - sound teaching not they will endure, but according to the own desires, to themselves they will gather around them teachers, having an itching - ear,
55.4.4.1^and from indeed the truth - hearing, they will turn away;
55.4.4.2^unto then - myths they will be turned aside.
55.4.5.1^you however, be sober in all things, endure afflictions, the work do of an evangelist, the ministry of you fully carry out.
55.4.6.1^i for already am being poured out, and the time of the departure of me is come.
55.4.7.1^the good fight i have fought, the race i have finished, the faith i have kept.
55.4.8.1^from now on is laid up for me the - of righteousness crown, which will award to me the lord in that - day, the righteous judge;
55.4.8.2^not only however to me, but also to all those loving the appearing of him.
55.4.9.1^be diligent to come to me quickly;
55.4.10.1^demas for me has deserted, having loved the present age, and he has gone to thessalonica, crescens to galatia, and titus to dalmatia.
55.4.11.1^luke is alone with me.
55.4.11.2^mark having taken, bring him with you;
55.4.11.3^he is for to me useful for the ministry.
55.4.12.1^tychicus however i have sent to ephesus.
55.4.13.1^the cloak that i left in troas with carpus, upon coming bring, and the books, especially the parchments.
55.4.14.1^alexander the coppersmith great to me harm did.
55.4.14.2^will render to him the lord according to the deeds of him,
55.4.15.1^whom also you beware of, exceedingly for he has opposed - our message.
55.4.16.1^in - first of me defense, no one me has stood with, but all me deserted.
55.4.16.2^not to them may it be charged!
55.4.17.1^- and the lord me stood by and strengthened me, so that through me the proclamation would be fully accomplished, and should hear all the gentiles.
55.4.17.2^and i was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
55.4.18.1^will deliver me the lord from every deed evil and will bring me safely into the kingdom of him - heavenly, to whom is the glory unto the ages of the ages.
55.4.18.2^amen.
55.4.19.1^greet prisca and aquila, and the of onesiphorus house.
55.4.20.1^erastus remained in corinth;
55.4.20.2^trophimus however i left in miletus ailing.
55.4.21.1^be earnest before winter to come.
55.4.21.2^greets you eubulus, and pudens, and linus, and claudia, and the brothers all.
55.4.22.1^the lord be with the spirit of you.
55.4.22.2^- grace be with you all.
56.1.1.1^paul, a servant of god, an apostle now of jesus christ, according to the faith of the elect of god, and knowledge of the truth, which is according to godliness,
56.1.2.1^in the hope of life eternal, which promised - who cannot lie, god, before time eternal;
56.1.3.1^he revealed now, in seasons his own, in the word of him, in the proclamation with which have been entrusted i, according to the commandment of the savior of us, god.
56.1.4.1^to titus, my true child according to our common faith:
56.1.4.2^grace and peace from god the father and christ jesus the savior of us.
56.1.5.1^of this on account, i left you in crete, so that the things lacking you might set in order, and might appoint in every town elders, as i you directed,
56.1.6.1^if anyone is blameless, of one wife the husband, children having believing, not under accusation of debauchery, or insubordinate.
56.1.7.1^it behooves for the overseer blameless to be, as god s steward;
56.1.7.2^not self-willed, not quick tempered, not given to wine, not a striker, not greedy of base gain,
56.1.8.1^but hospitable, a lover of good, self-controlled, upright, holy, and disciplined;
56.1.9.1^holding to the according to the teaching faithful word, that able he may be both to encourage with - teaching - sound, and those contradicting it to convict.
56.1.10.1^there are for many also insubordinate, empty talkers, and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
56.1.11.1^whom it is necessary to silence, who whole households overthrow, teaching things that they not ought, base gain for the sake of.
56.1.12.1^said one of them, own of them, a prophet, cretans are always liars, evil beasts, gluttons lazy.
56.1.13.1^the testimony this is true, for which cause rebuke them severely, so that they may be sound in the faith,
56.1.14.1^not giving heed to jewish myths and the commandments of men, turning away from the truth.
56.1.15.1^all things are pure to the pure;
56.1.15.2^to those however being defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure;
56.1.15.3^instead, are defiled their both - mind and - conscience.
56.1.16.1^god they profess to know;
56.1.16.2^in however works, they deny him, detestable being and disobedient, and for any work good, unfit.
56.2.1.1^you however speak the things that are consistent with - sound doctrine.
56.2.2.1^the aged men sober-minded are to be, dignified, self-controlled, sound - in faith, - in love, - in endurance;
56.2.3.1^the aged women likewise, in behavior reverent, not slanderers, not to wine much being enslaved, teachers of what is good,
56.2.4.1^so that they may train the young women lovers of their husbands to be, loving their children,
56.2.5.1^self-controlled, pure, keepers at home, kind, being subject to the own husbands, so that not the word - of god should be maligned.
56.2.6.1^the younger men, likewise, exhort to be self-controlled.
56.2.7.1^in all things yourself be holding forth as a pattern of good works;
56.2.7.2^in the teaching integrity, dignity,
56.2.8.1^speech sound, beyond reproach, so that he who is of the contrary may be ashamed, nothing having to say concerning us evil.
56.2.9.1^servants to their own masters are to be subject, in everything well-pleasing to be, not gainsaying,
56.2.10.1^not pilfering, but all fidelity showing good, so that the doctrine of the savior of us, god, they may adorn in all things.
56.2.11.1^has appeared for the grace - of god, bringing salvation to all men,
56.2.12.1^instructing us that, having denied - ungodliness and - worldly passions, discreetly and righteously and piously we should live in the present age,
56.2.13.1^awaiting the blessed hope and the appearing of the glory of the great god and savior of us, jesus, christ
56.2.14.1^who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all lawlessness, and might purify to himself a people specially chosen, zealous of good works.
56.2.15.1^these things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority.
56.2.15.2^no one you let despise.
56.3.1.1^remind them to rulers, to authorities, to be subject, to be obedient;
56.3.1.2^for every work good, ready to be;
56.3.2.1^no one to speak evil of, peaceable to be, gentle, all showing humility toward all men.
56.3.3.1^were for once also we ourselves foolish, disobedient, being deceived, serving lusts and pleasures various, in malice and envy living, hateful, hating one another.
56.3.4.1^when however the kindness and the love of mankind appeared, of the savior of us, god,
56.3.5.1^not by works - in righteousness that did we, but according to - his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the spirit holy,
56.3.6.1^whom he poured out on us richly through jesus christ, the savior of us,
56.3.7.1^so that, having been justified - by that grace, heirs we should become according to the hope of life eternal.
56.3.8.1^trustworthy is the saying, and concerning these things i want you to affirm strongly, so that may take care good works to be devoted to, those believing god.
56.3.8.2^these things are excellent and profitable - to men.
56.3.9.1^foolish however controversies and genealogies and arguments and quarrels about the law, avoid;
56.3.9.2^they are for unprofitable and worthless.
56.3.10.1^a factious man, after one and a second admonition, reject,
56.3.11.1^knowing that is corrupt - such a man, and is sinning, being self-condemned.
56.3.12.1^when i shall send artemas to you, or tychicus, be diligent to come to me into nicopolis;
56.3.12.2^there for i have decided to winter.
56.3.13.1^zenas the lawyer and apollos earnestly equip, so that nothing to them should be lacking.
56.3.14.1^let learn now also - our people good works to devote themselves to, for - necessary needs, so that not they should be unfruitful.
56.3.15.1^greet you, those with me all.
56.3.15.2^greet those loving us in the faith.
56.3.15.3^- grace be with all of you.
57.1.1.1^paul, a prisoner of christ jesus, and timothy, our brother, to philemon, the beloved and fellow worker of us,
57.1.2.1^and to apphia our sister, and to archippus the fellow soldier of us, and to the at the house of you church:
57.1.3.1^grace to you and peace from god father of us and the lord jesus christ.
57.1.4.1^i thank the god of me always, mention of you making upon the prayers of me,
57.1.5.1^hearing of your - love and the faith that you have toward the lord jesus and toward all the saints,
57.1.6.1^so that the fellowship of the faith of you, effective might become in the acknowledgment of every good thing that is in us, in christ.
57.1.7.1^joy for great i have, and encouragement by occasion of the love of you, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, brother.
57.1.8.1^therefore much in christ boldness having, to order you what is befitting,
57.1.9.1^for the sake of - love, rather i exhort you, such a one being, as paul aged, now then also a prisoner of christ jesus.
57.1.10.1^i exhort you for - my child, whom i have begotten in - chains, onesimus,
57.1.11.1^- once to you useless, now however both to you and to me useful,
57.1.12.1^whom i have sent back to you in person   he who is - my very heart
57.1.13.1^whom i was wishing with myself to keep, so that on behalf of you, me he might serve in the chains of the gospel.
57.1.14.1^apart from however - your consent, nothing i wished to do, so that not as according to necessity, the good of you may be, but according to willingness.
57.1.15.1^perhaps for because of this, he was separated from you for a time, so that eternally him you might possess,
57.1.16.1^no longer as a slave, but above a slave, a brother beloved, especially to me, how much however more to you, both in the flesh and in the lord.
57.1.17.1^if therefore me you consider a partner, receive him as me.
57.1.18.1^if however in any way he has wronged you, or he owes you, this to me charge.
57.1.19.1^i paul did write with my own hand.
57.1.19.2^i will repay it;
57.1.19.3^that not i may say to you, that even yourself to me you owe also.
57.1.20.1^yes, brother, i from you may have profit in the lord.
57.1.20.2^refresh my - heart in christ.
57.1.21.1^being persuaded of the obedience of you, i write to you, knowing that even above what i say, you will do.
57.1.22.1^at the same time now, also prepare for me a lodging;
57.1.22.2^i hope for that through the prayers of you, i will be granted to you.
57.1.23.1^greets you epaphras, - fellow prisoner my in christ jesus,
57.1.24.1^as do mark, aristarchus, demas, and luke, the fellow workers of me.
57.1.25.1^the grace of the lord jesus christ be with the spirit of you.
58.1.1.1^in many portions and in many ways, long ago - god having spoken to the fathers in the prophets,
58.1.2.1^in last - days these has spoken to us in his son, whom he appointed heir of all things, through whom also he made the ages,
58.1.3.1^who being the radiance of his glory and the exact expression of the substance of him, upholding then - all things by the word of the power of himself, the purification - of sins having made, sat down at the right hand of the majesty on high.
58.1.4.1^by so much superior having become to the angels, as much as more excellent beyond theirs, he has inherited a name.
58.1.5.1^to which for did he say ever of the angels:
58.1.5.2^son of me are you;
58.1.5.3^i today have begotten you?
58.1.5.4^and again:
58.1.5.5^i will be to him for a father, and he will be to me for a son?
58.1.6.1^when then again he brings the firstborn into the world, he says:
58.1.6.2^and let worship him all the angels of god.
58.1.7.1^and as to indeed the angels he says:
58.1.7.2^the one making the angels of him winds, and the ministers of him, of fire a flame.
58.1.8.1^unto however the son:
58.1.8.2^the throne of you, o god, is to the age of the age, and the scepter of righteousness is the scepter of the kingdom of you.
58.1.9.1^you have loved righteousness and have hated wickedness;
58.1.9.2^because of this, has anointed you - god, the god of you, with the oil of exultation, above the companions of you.
58.1.10.1^and:
58.1.10.2^you in the beginning, lord, of the earth laid the foundation, and works of the hands of you are the heavens.
58.1.11.1^they will perish;
58.1.11.2^you however remain;
58.1.11.3^and all like a garment will grow old;
58.1.12.1^and like a robe you will roll up them, like a garment also they will be changed;
58.1.12.2^you however the same are, and the years of you not will never end.
58.1.13.1^to which now of the angels did he say ever:
58.1.13.2^sit at the right hand of me, until - i may place the enemies of you as a footstool for the feet of you
58.1.14.1^not all are they ministering spirits, for service being sent forth, for the sake of those being about to inherit salvation?
58.2.1.1^because of this, it behooves more abundantly to give heed us to the things we have heard, lest ever we should drift away.
58.2.2.1^if for the by angels having been spoken word was unalterable, and every transgression and disobedience received a just recompense,
58.2.3.1^how we will escape such a great having neglected a salvation, which a commencement having received, declared by the lord, by those having heard, to us it was confirmed,
58.2.4.1^bearing witness - god by signs together with them and wonders, and by various miracles, and of the spirit holy distributions, according to the of him will.
58.2.5.1^not for to angels did he subject the world that is coming, of which we are speaking.
58.2.6.1^has testified however somewhere someone, saying, what is man, that you are mindful of him, or the son of man, that you care for him?
58.2.7.1^you made lower him a little some than the angels;
58.2.7.2^with glory and honor you crowned him,
58.2.8.1^all things you have put in subjection under the feet of him.
58.2.8.2^in - for subjecting to him - all things, nothing he left to him unsubject.
58.2.8.3^at present however, not yet do we see to him - all things having been subjected.
58.2.9.1^who however a little one than the angels, having been made lower, we see, jesus, because of the suffering - of death, with glory and with honor having been crowned, so that by the grace of god for everyone he might taste death.
58.2.10.1^it was fitting for to him, for whom are - all things and by whom are - all things, many sons to glory having brought, the archetype of the salvation of them, through sufferings to make perfect.
58.2.11.1^the one both for sanctifying, and those being sanctified, of one are all;
58.2.11.2^for which reason, not he is ashamed brothers them to call,
58.2.12.1^saying:
58.2.12.2^i will declare the name of you to the brothers of me;
58.2.12.3^in the midst of the congregation i will sing praises of you.
58.2.13.1^and again:
58.2.13.2^i will be trusting in him.
58.2.13.3^and again:
58.2.13.4^behold, i and the children whom to me has given - god.
58.2.14.1^since therefore the children have partaken of blood and of flesh also, he likewise took part in the same things, so that through his death, he might destroy the one the power holding - of death, that is, the devil,
58.2.15.1^and might set free those who fear of death through all their time to live, subject were to slavery.
58.2.16.1^not for surely in that place the angels he helps, but the seed of abraham he helps.
58.2.17.1^therefore it behooved him in all things his brothers to be made like, so that a merciful he might become, and faithful, high priest in things relating to - god, in order - to make propitiation for the sins of the people.
58.2.18.1^in that for has suffered he himself, having been tempted, he is able those being tempted to help.
58.3.1.1^therefore, brothers holy, of the calling heavenly partakers, carefully consider the apostle and high priest of the confession of us, jesus,
58.3.2.1^faithful being to the one having appointed him, as also moses in all the house of him.
58.3.3.1^of greater for he glory than moses has been counted worthy, by so much as greater honor has than the house itself, the one having built it.
58.3.4.1^every for house is built by someone;
58.3.4.2^the one however everything having built is god.
58.3.5.1^and moses indeed was faithful in all the house of him as a servant, unto a testimony of the things going to be spoken;
58.3.6.1^christ however as the son over the house of him, whose house are we, if indeed our confidence, and the boast of our hope, we should hold.
58.3.7.1^therefore, just as says the spirit - holy:
58.3.7.2^today if the voice of him you should hear,
58.3.8.1^not harden the hearts of you, as in the rebellion, in the day - of testing in the wilderness,
58.3.9.1^where tried me the fathers of you by testing, and saw the works of me
58.3.10.1^forty years.
58.3.10.2^therefore i was angry with the generation that, and i said, always they go astray - in the heart of them;
58.3.10.3^and not have they known the ways of me;
58.3.11.1^so i swore in the wrath of me, not shall they enter into the rest of me.
58.3.12.1^take heed, brothers, lest ever there will be in any of you a heart evil of unbelief, into - falling away from god the living.
58.3.13.1^but encourage other each every day, while - - today it is called, so that not may be hardened one of you by the deceitfulness - of sin.
58.3.14.1^partakers for - of christ we have become, if indeed from the beginning the assurance unto the end firm we should hold.
58.3.15.1^as - it is said:
58.3.15.2^today if the voice of him you should hear, not harden the hearts of you, as in the rebellion.
58.3.16.1^who for were those having heard, rebelled, but not all those having come out of egypt by the leading of moses?
58.3.17.1^with whom now was he indignant forty years, if not with those having sinned, whose - bodies fell in the wilderness?
58.3.18.1^to whom then did he swear that not shall they enter into the rest of him, if not to those having disobeyed?
58.3.19.1^and we see that not they were able to enter in because of unbelief.
58.4.1.1^we should fear therefore, lest ever left remaining, of the promise to enter into the rest of him, should seem any of you to have fallen short.
58.4.2.1^and for we are those having had the gospel preached just as they did;
58.4.2.2^but not did profit the message of their hearing them, not having been united with the faith of those having heard.
58.4.3.1^we enter for into the rest, those having believed;
58.4.3.2^as he has said:
58.4.3.3^so i swore in the wrath of me, not shall they enter into the rest of me.
58.4.3.4^and yet the works from the foundation of the world have been finished.
58.4.4.1^he has spoken for somewhere concerning the seventh day in this way, and rested - god on the day - seventh from all the works of him.
58.4.5.1^and in this passage again, not shall they enter into the rest of me.
58.4.6.1^since therefore it remains for some to enter into it, and those formerly having received the good news, not did enter in because of disobedience,
58.4.7.1^again a certain he appoints day today, through david saying after so long a time, just as it has been said, today, if the voice of him you shall hear, not harden the hearts of you.
58.4.8.1^if for to them joshua had given rest, not - about another he would have spoken after this day.
58.4.9.1^so then there remains a sabbath rest for the people - of god.
58.4.10.1^the one for having entered into the rest of him, also he rested from the works of him, as from the own - god did.
58.4.11.1^we should be diligent therefore to enter into that - rest, so that not by the same anyone example should fall - of disobedience.
58.4.12.1^living is for the word - of god, and active, and sharper than any sword two-edged, even penetrating as far as the division of soul and spirit, of joints and also marrows, and able to judge the thoughts and intentions of the heart.
58.4.13.1^and not there is creature hidden before him;
58.4.13.2^all things however are uncovered and laid bare to the eyes of him to whom is our - reckoning.
58.4.14.1^having therefore a high priest great, having passed through the heavens, jesus, the son - of god, we should hold firmly to our confession.
58.4.15.1^not for have we a high priest not being able to sympathize with the weaknesses of us;
58.4.15.2^one having been tempted however in all things by the same way, without sin.
58.4.16.1^we should come therefore with boldness to the throne - of grace, so that we may receive mercy and grace may find for in time of need help.
58.5.1.1^every for high priest, from among men being taken, on behalf of men is appointed, in things relating to - god that he should offer gifts both and sacrifices for sins,
58.5.2.1^to exercise forbearance being able, with those being ignorant and going astray, since also he himself is encompassed by weakness;
58.5.3.1^and because of this he is obligated, just as for the people, so also for himself, to offer sacrifices for sins.
58.5.4.1^and not upon himself anyone takes the honor, but rather being called by - god, just as also aaron.
58.5.5.1^so also - christ not himself did glorify to become a high priest, but the one having said to him:
58.5.5.2^son of me are you, i today have begotten you.
58.5.6.1^just as also in another place he says:
58.5.6.2^you are a priest to the age, according to the order of melchizedek.
58.5.7.1^he in the days of the flesh of him, prayers both and supplications, to the one being able to save him from death, with crying loud and tears having offered up, and having been heard, because of - reverence,
58.5.8.1^though being a son, he learned from the things he suffered, - obedience,
58.5.9.1^and having been perfected, he became to all those obeying him, the author of salvation eternal,
58.5.10.1^having been designated by - god a high priest according to the order of melchizedek.
58.5.11.1^concerning this there is much from us - speech, and difficult in interpretation to speak, since sluggish you have become in the hearings.
58.5.12.1^even for you ought to be teachers by the time, again need of you have one to teach you what is the principles of the beginning of the oracles - of god;
58.5.12.2^and you have become need those having of milk, and not of solid food.
58.5.13.1^everyone for - partaking only of milk is inexperienced in the word of righteousness;
58.5.13.2^an infant for he is;
58.5.14.1^for the mature however is - solid food, the ones by - constant use the senses training having for distinguishing good both and evil.
58.6.1.1^therefore, having left the - beginning of the christ teaching, to - maturity we should go on, not again a foundation laying of repentance from dead works, and faith in god,
58.6.2.1^about baptisms instruction, of laying on then of hands, of the resurrection both of the dead and of judgment eternal.
58.6.3.1^and this we will do, if permits - god.
58.6.4.1^it is impossible for to those once having been enlightened, having tasted then of the gift - heavenly, and partakers having become of the spirit holy,
58.6.5.1^and the goodness having tasted of god s word, the power also of the coming age
58.6.6.1^and then having fallen away   again to restore them to repentance, crucifying in themselves the son - of god and subjecting him to open shame.
58.6.7.1^land for - having drunk in the upon it coming often rain, and producing vegetation useful for those for the sake of whom also it is tilled, partakes of blessing from - god.
58.6.8.1^that bringing forth however thorns and thistles is worthless and a curse near to, of which the end is unto burning.
58.6.9.1^we are persuaded however concerning you, beloved, of better things, and things accompanying salvation, if even like this we speak.
58.6.10.1^not for unjust is - god, to forget the work of you and the love that you have shown toward the name of him, having ministered to the saints and still ministering.
58.6.11.1^we desire now, each of you the same to show, earnestness, toward the full assurance of the hope unto the end,
58.6.12.1^so that not sluggish you may be, imitators however of those through faith and patience inheriting the promises.
58.6.13.1^- for to abraham having made his promise, - god, since by no one he had greater to swear, he swore by himself,
58.6.14.1^saying, if surely blessing i will bless you, and multiplying i will multiply you.
58.6.15.1^and thus having waited patiently, he obtained the promise.
58.6.16.1^men for by one greater swear, and of all their disputes an end, for confirmation, is the oath,
58.6.17.1^in which more abundantly desiring - god to show to the heirs of the promise the unchangeableness of the purpose of him, guaranteed it by an oath,
58.6.18.1^so that by two things unchangeable, in which it is impossible to lie - for god, strong encouragement we may have, - having fled for refuge, to take hold of the being set before us hope,
58.6.19.1^which as an anchor we have of the soul, sure both and unshakable and entering into that within the veil,
58.6.20.1^where the forerunner for us has entered, jesus, according to the order of melchizedek, a high priest having become to the age.
58.7.1.1^this for - melchizedek, king of salem, priest - of god - most high, - having met abraham returning from the slaughter of the kings and having blessed him,
58.7.2.1^is he to whom also a tenth of all apportioned abraham, first indeed being translated, king of righteousness;
58.7.2.2^then and also, king of salem, which is, king of peace.
58.7.3.1^without father, without mother, without genealogy, neither beginning of days nor of life end having, having been made like however the son - of god, he remains a priest unto - all time.
58.7.4.1^consider now how great this one was, to whom even a tenth abraham gave out of the best spoils, the patriarch.
58.7.5.1^and those indeed, out from the sons of levi, the priestly office receiving, a commandment have to take a tenth from the people according to the law, that is, from the brothers of them, though having come out of the loin of abraham.
58.7.6.1^the one however not tracing his ancestry from them has collected a tenth from abraham, and the one having the promises has blessed.
58.7.7.1^apart from now all dispute, the inferior by the superior is blessed.
58.7.8.1^and here indeed tithes, dying men receive;
58.7.8.2^in that place however, it is testified that he lives on.
58.7.9.1^and so, a word to speak, through abraham also, levi, the one tithes receiving, paid the tithe.
58.7.10.1^still for in the loin of his father he was, when met him melchizedek.
58.7.11.1^if indeed then perfection by the levitical priesthood were   the people for upon it had received the law   what still need was there, according to the order of melchizedek, for another to arise priest and not according to the order of aaron to be named?
58.7.12.1^being changed for of the priesthood, from necessity also, of law a change takes place.
58.7.13.1^he concerning whom for are said these things a tribe another belonged to, from which no one has served at the altar.
58.7.14.1^it is evident for that out of judah has sprung the lord of us, as to which a tribe, concerning priests, nothing moses spoke.
58.7.15.1^and more abundantly yet evident it is, if according to the likeness of melchizedek arises a priest another,
58.7.16.1^who not according to a law of a commandment fleshly has been constituted, but according to the power of a life indestructible.
58.7.17.1^it is testified for -:
58.7.17.2^you are a priest to the age, according to the order of melchizedek.
58.7.18.1^a putting away indeed for there is of the preceding commandment, because of - its weakness and uselessness
58.7.19.1^nothing for perfected the law   the introduction then of a better hope, by which we draw near - to god.
58.7.20.1^and to as much as not apart from an oath, those ones truly for without an oath are priests becoming,
58.7.21.1^he however with an oath, through the one saying to him:
58.7.21.2^has sworn the lord, and not will change his mind, you are a priest to the age.
58.7.22.1^by so much also of a better covenant has become the guarantee jesus.
58.7.23.1^and those indeed many are having become priests, because of - by death being prevented from continuing.
58.7.24.1^- but because of the abiding of him to the age, a permanent he holds - priesthood,
58.7.25.1^wherefore also, to save to the uttermost he is able, those drawing near through him - to god, always living for - to intercede for them.
58.7.26.1^such indeed for us also was fitting a high priest, holy, innocent, undefiled, having been separated from - sinners, and higher than the heavens having become,
58.7.27.1^who not has every day need, as the high priests, first for the own sins, sacrifices to offer up, then for those of the people;
58.7.27.2^this for he did once for all, himself having offered up.
58.7.28.1^the law for men appoints as high priests, having weakness;
58.7.28.2^the word however of the oath, which is after the law, a son to the age, having been perfected.
58.8.1.1^the sum now of the things being spoken of is that such we have, a high priest who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the majesty in the heavens,
58.8.2.1^in the holy places a minister, and in the tabernacle - true, which has pitched the lord, not man.
58.8.3.1^every for high priest, in order - to offer gifts both, and sacrifices, is appointed;
58.8.3.2^wherefore it was necessary to have something also for this one that he might offer.
58.8.4.1^if certainly then he were on earth, not even - would he be a priest, there being those offering according to law the gifts,
58.8.5.1^who a copy and shadow serve of the heavenly, as was divinely instructed moses, being about to complete the tabernacle.
58.8.5.2^see that,  for he says, you shall make all things according to the pattern - having been shown you in the mountain.
58.8.6.1^now, however, more excellent he has obtained a ministry, as much as also of a better he is covenant the mediator, which upon better promises has been enacted.
58.8.7.1^if for the first that had been faultless, not - for a second would have been sought a place.
58.8.8.1^finding fault for with them, he says:
58.8.8.2^behold, the days are coming, says the lord, and i will ratify with the house of israel and with the house of judah, a covenant new,
58.8.9.1^not according to the covenant that i made with fathers of them, in the day of having taken hold of by me the hand of them, to lead them out of the land of egypt, because they not did continue in the covenant of me, and i disregarded them, says the lord.
58.8.10.1^for this is the covenant that i will make with the house of israel, after the days those, says the lord, putting laws of me into the mind of them, and upon hearts of them i will inscribe them;
58.8.10.2^and i will be to them for god, and they will be to me for a people.
58.8.11.1^and no not shall they teach each the neighbor of him, and each the brother of him saying, know the lord,  because all will know me, from the least to the greatest of them,
58.8.12.1^because merciful i will be toward the iniquities of them, and the sins of them no not i shall remember more.
58.8.13.1^in - saying, new, he has made obsolete the first;
58.8.13.2^that then growing old and aging is near vanishing.
58.9.1.1^had indeed therefore also the first, regulations of worship - and a sanctuary earthly.
58.9.2.1^a tabernacle for was prepared, the first room   in which were - both the lampstand, and the table, and of the presentation the bread   which is called the holy place.
58.9.3.1^behind now the second veil was a tabernacle, - being called the holy of holies,
58.9.4.1^the golden having altar of incense, and the ark of the covenant, having been covered around in every part with gold, in which was the jar golden having the manna, and the staff of aaron - having budded, and the tablets of the covenant.
58.9.5.1^above then it were the cherubim of glory, overshadowing the mercy seat;
58.9.5.2^concerning which not it is now the time to speak in detail.
58.9.6.1^these things now thus having been prepared, into indeed the first tabernacle at all times everything enter the priests, the sacred services accomplishing.
58.9.7.1^enters into however the second, once in the year only, the high priest, not without blood, which he offers for himself and the of the people sins of ignorance.
58.9.8.1^by this was signifying the spirit - holy that not yet has been made manifest the into the holy places way, still the first tabernacle having a standing,
58.9.9.1^which is a symbol for the time - present, in which gifts both and sacrifices are offered, not being able in regard to conscience to make perfect the one worshiping,
58.9.10.1^consisting only in foods and drinks and various washings, ordinances of the flesh, until the time of reformation being imposed.
58.9.11.1^christ however, having appeared as high priest of the having come good things, by the greater and more perfect tabernacle not made by hands, that is, not of this - creation,
58.9.12.1^nor by blood of goats and calves, through however the own blood, he entered once for all into the holy places, eternal redemption having obtained.
58.9.13.1^if for the blood of goats, and of bulls, and the ashes of a heifer, sprinkling the having been defiled, sanctify them for the of the flesh purification,
58.9.14.1^how much more the blood - of christ, who through the spirit eternal, himself offered unblemished - to god, will purify the conscience of us from dead works, in order - to serve god the living!
58.9.15.1^and because of this, of a covenant new the mediator he is, so that, death having taken place, for redemption of the under the first covenant transgressions, the promise might receive those having been called, of the eternal inheritance.
58.9.16.1^where for there is a will, the death it is necessary to establish of the one having made it.
58.9.17.1^a will for after death is affirmed, since not at the time it is in force, when is living the one having made it,
58.9.18.1^wherefore neither the first, apart from blood has been inaugurated.
58.9.19.1^having been spoken for of every commandment according to the law by moses to all the people, having taken the blood - of calves and - of goats, with water, and wool scarlet, and hyssop, itself both the book and all the people he sprinkled,
58.9.20.1^saying, this is the blood of the covenant, which commanded unto you - god.
58.9.21.1^and the tabernacle then, and all the vessels of the ministry with blood likewise he sprinkled.
58.9.22.1^and almost with blood all things are purified, according to the law, and apart from blood-shedding, not there is forgiveness.
58.9.23.1^it was necessary then for the indeed representations of the things in the heavens, with these to be purified, themselves however the heavenly things with better sacrifices than these.
58.9.24.1^not for into made by hands has entered holy places christ, copies of the true ones, but into itself - heaven, now to appear in the presence - of god for us,
58.9.25.1^nor that repeatedly he should offer himself, just as the high priest enters into the holy places every year with the blood of another.
58.9.26.1^otherwise it was necessary for him repeatedly to have suffered from the foundation of the world.
58.9.26.2^now however once in the consummation of the ages, for the putting away of sin, by the sacrifice of himself he has been revealed.
58.9.27.1^and in as much as it is apportioned - to men once to die, after then this to face judgment,
58.9.28.1^so also - christ, once having been offered in order - of many to bear the sins, for a second time, apart from sin, will appear to those him awaiting for salvation.
58.10.1.1^a shadow for having the law of the coming good things, not themselves the form of the things, each year with the same sacrifices, which they offer to the continuous, never is able those drawing near to perfect.
58.10.2.1^otherwise not - would they have ceased being offered, because of - none having any longer conscience of sins, those serving once having been cleansed?
58.10.3.1^but in these, there is a reminder of sins every year.
58.10.4.1^impossible it is indeed for the blood of bulls and of goats to take away sins.
58.10.5.1^therefore coming into the world, he says:
58.10.5.2^sacrifice and offering not you have desired, a body however you have prepared me.
58.10.6.1^burnt offerings and offerings for sin not you have delighted in.
58.10.7.1^then i said, behold, i have come   in the scroll of the book it is written of me   - to do, - o god, the will of you.
58.10.8.1^above saying -, sacrifice, and offering, and burnt offerings, and offerings for sin, not you have desired, nor have you delighted in,  which according to the law are offered;
58.10.9.1^then he said, behold, i have come - to do the will of you.
58.10.9.2^he takes away the first, that the second he might establish.
58.10.10.1^by that will, having been sanctified we are, through the offering of the body of jesus christ once for all.
58.10.11.1^and every indeed priest stands every day ministering, and the same repeatedly offering sacrifices, which never are able to take away sins.
58.10.12.1^this one however, one for sins having offered sacrifice in - perpetuity, sat down at the right hand - of god,
58.10.13.1^the henceforth awaiting until should be placed the enemies of him as a footstool for the feet of him.
58.10.14.1^by one for offering, he has perfected for - all time those being sanctified.
58.10.15.1^bears witness now to us also the spirit - holy;
58.10.15.2^after for - having said:
58.10.16.1^this is the covenant that i will make with them, after the days those, says the lord, putting the laws of me into the hearts of them, and into the mind of them, i will inscribe them,
58.10.17.1^and, the sins of them, and the lawless acts of them, no not will i remember any more.
58.10.18.1^where now forgiveness of these is, no longer is there an offering for sin.
58.10.19.1^having therefore, brothers, confidence for the entering the holy places by the blood of jesus,
58.10.20.1^which he dedicated for us a way new, and living, through the veil, that is, the flesh of him,
58.10.21.1^and having a priest great over the house - of god,
58.10.22.1^we should draw near with a sincere heart in full assurance of faith, having been sprinkled clean our hearts from a conscience evil, and having been washed our body with water pure.
58.10.23.1^we should hold fast to the confession of our hope, firmly;
58.10.23.2^faithful for is the one having promised.
