58.10.24.1^and we should think one another, toward stirring up to love and to good works,
58.10.25.1^not forsaking the assembling together of ourselves as is the custom with some, but encouraging one another, and so much more as you see drawing near the day.
58.10.26.1^if willingly for, sin we, after we are - to receive the knowledge of the truth, no longer for sins remains a sacrifice,
58.10.27.1^terrifying however a certain expectation of judgment and of fire fury to devour being about the adversaries.
58.10.28.1^having set aside anyone the law of moses, without mercies on the basis of two or three witnesses, he dies.
58.10.29.1^how much think you worse will he deserve punishment, the one the son - of god having trampled upon, and the blood of the covenant ordinary having esteemed, by which he was sanctified, and the spirit - of grace having insulted?
58.10.30.1^we know for the one having said, mine is vengeance;
58.10.30.2^i will repay,  and again, will judge the lord the people of him.
58.10.31.1^it is a fearful thing - to fall into the hands of god the living.
58.10.32.1^remember however the former days in which, having been enlightened, a great conflict you endured of sufferings,
58.10.33.1^this indeed, by revilings both and tribulations being made a spectacle;
58.10.33.2^this now, partners of those thus passing through them having become.
58.10.34.1^both for with the prisoners you sympathized, and the plundering of the possessions of you with joy you accepted, knowing to have yourselves a better possession, and abiding.
58.10.35.1^not throw away therefore the boldness of you, which has a great reward.
58.10.36.1^of endurance for you have need, so that, the will - of god having done, you may receive the promise.
58.10.37.1^yet for, a little very while, the one coming will come, and not will delay.
58.10.38.1^the one however righteous of mine by faith will live;
58.10.38.2^and if he might shrink back, not takes pleasure the soul of me in him.
58.10.39.1^we however not are of those drawing back to destruction, but of faith to the preserving of the soul.
58.11.1.1^is now faith of things hoped for the assurance, of things the conviction not being seen.
58.11.2.1^in this for were commended the ancients.
58.11.3.1^by faith we understand to have been formed the universe by the word of god, so that which not from things being visible, the things being seen have been made.
58.11.4.1^by faith a more excellent sacrifice abel than cain offered - to god, through which he was testified to be righteous, bearing witness to the gifts of him - god;
58.11.4.2^and through it, having died, still he speaks.
58.11.5.1^by faith enoch was translated, - not to see death;
58.11.5.2^and not was he found, because had taken up him - god.
58.11.5.3^before for the translation, he was commended to have pleased - god.
58.11.6.1^without now faith, it is impossible to please him.
58.11.6.2^to believe for it behooves the one drawing near - to god, that he exists, and that to those earnestly seeking out him, a rewarder he becomes.
58.11.7.1^by faith having been divinely instructed noah concerning the things not yet seen, having been moved with fear, prepared an ark for the salvation of the household of him, by which he condemned the world, and of the according to faith righteousness that is, he became heir.
58.11.8.1^by faith being called, abraham obeyed to go out into a place that he was going to receive for an inheritance, and went out, not knowing where he is going.
58.11.9.1^by faith he sojourned in the land of the promise, as in a foreign country, in tents having dwelt with isaac and jacob, the joint-heirs of the promise - same.
58.11.10.1^he was awaiting for the - foundations having city, of which the architect and builder is - god.
58.11.11.1^by faith also, herself sarah barren, power for the conception of seed received, even beyond the opportune age, since faithful she considered the one having promised.
58.11.12.1^therefore also from one man were born, and he having been as good as dead, as the stars of heaven - in multitude, and as the sand - by the shore of the sea - countless.
58.11.13.1^in faith died these all, not having received the promises, but from afar them having seen, and having embraced them, and having confessed that strangers and sojourners they are on the earth.
58.11.14.1^those for such things saying make manifest that their own country they are seeking.
58.11.15.1^and if indeed that they had been remembering from where they came out, they would have had - opportunity to return.
58.11.16.1^now however a better one they stretch forward to, that is, a heavenly one.
58.11.16.2^therefore not is ashamed of them - god, god to be called of them;
58.11.16.3^he has prepared indeed for them a city.
58.11.17.1^by faith has offered up abraham - isaac.
58.11.17.2^being tested, even his only begotten son was offering up the one the promises having received,
58.11.18.1^as to whom it was said -, in isaac will be reckoned your offspring,
58.11.19.1^having reasoned that even out from the dead to raise , able was - god, from where him also in a simile, he received.
58.11.20.1^by faith also concerning the things coming, blessed isaac - jacob and - esau.
58.11.21.1^by faith jacob, dying, each of the sons of joseph blessed, and worshiped on the top of the staff of him.
58.11.22.1^by faith joseph, dying, concerning the exodus of the sons of israel made mention, and concerning the bones of him gave instructions.
58.11.23.1^by faith moses, having been born, was hidden three months by the parents of him, because they saw was beautiful the little child, and not they did fear the edict of the king.
58.11.24.1^by faith moses, grown having become, refused to be called the son of the daughter of pharaoh,
58.11.25.1^rather having chosen to suffer affliction with the people - of god than the temporary to have of sin enjoyment,
58.11.26.1^greater wealth having esteemed than the of egypt treasures the reproach - of christ;
58.11.26.2^he was looking for toward the reward.
58.11.27.1^by faith he left egypt, not having feared the anger of the king;
58.11.27.2^the for invisible one as seeing, he persevered.
58.11.28.1^by faith he has kept the passover and the sprinkling of the blood, so that not the one destroying the firstborn would touch them.
58.11.29.1^by faith they passed through the red sea, as through dry land, which an attempt having made, the egyptians were swallowed up.
58.11.30.1^by faith the walls of jericho fell, having been encircled for seven days.
58.11.31.1^by faith rahab the prostitute not did perish with those having disobeyed, having received the spies with peace.
58.11.32.1^and what more shall i say?
58.11.32.2^will fail me for telling the time, of gideon, barak, samson, jephthah, david also, and samuel, and the prophets,
58.11.33.1^who by faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, obtained promises;
58.11.33.2^shut the mouths of lions,
58.11.34.1^quenched the power of fire, escaped the mouths of the sword;
58.11.34.2^acquired strength out of weakness, became mighty in war, the armies put to flight of foreigners.
58.11.35.1^received back women by resurrection the dead of them;
58.11.35.2^others then were tortured, not having accepted - release, so that a better resurrection they might obtain.
58.11.36.1^others then of mockings and of scourgings, trial received;
58.11.36.2^in addition, also of chains and imprisonment.
58.11.37.1^they were stoned, they were sawed in two, by slaughter of the sword they were killed;
58.11.37.2^they wandered in sheepskins, in goats  skins, being destitute, being oppressed, being mistreated;
58.11.38.1^of whom not was worthy the world;
58.11.38.2^in deserts wandering, and mountains, and caves, and - holes of the earth.
58.11.39.1^and these all, having been commended through the faith, not did receive the promise,
58.11.40.1^- god for us better something having planned, so that not apart from us they should be made perfect.
58.12.1.1^therefore also we, such a great having encompassing us a cloud of witnesses, weight having laid aside every, and the easily entangling sin, with endurance should run the lying before us race,
58.12.2.1^looking to the of our faith founder and perfecter, jesus, who in view of the lying before him joy, endured the cross, its shame having despised, at right hand and of the throne - of god sat down.
58.12.3.1^consider fully for, the one such great having endured from - sinners against himself hostility, so that not you shall grow weary, in the souls of you fainting.
58.12.4.1^not yet unto blood have you resisted, against - sin struggling,
58.12.5.1^and you have forgotten the exhortation that you as to sons addresses:
58.12.5.2^son of me, not regard lightly the discipline of the lord, nor faint, by him being reproved.
58.12.6.1^whom for he loves, the lord disciplines;
58.12.6.2^he scourges now every son whom he receives.
58.12.7.1^as discipline endure, as sons you is treating - god;
58.12.7.2^what for son is there whom not disciplines his father?
58.12.8.1^if however without you are of discipline, of which partakers they have become all, then illegitimate children and not sons you are.
58.12.9.1^furthermore - indeed of the flesh of us fathers we have had correctors, and we respected them;
58.12.9.2^not much and more shall we be in subjection to the father - of spirits, and shall live?
58.12.10.1^- truly indeed for a few days, according to that seeming good to them, they were disciplining us;
58.12.10.2^- but he for our benefitting, in order - to share of the holiness of him.
58.12.11.1^all now discipline, for indeed those being present, not seems of joy to be, but of grief;
58.12.11.2^afterward however, the fruit peaceable, to those by it having been trained, it yields of righteousness.
58.12.12.1^therefore the drooping hands and the enfeebled knees lift up,
58.12.13.1^and paths straight make for the feet of you, so that not the lame should be put out of joint, should be healed however rather.
58.12.14.1^peace pursue with all, and - holiness, which without no one will see the lord,
58.12.15.1^observing lest any be failing of the grace - of god, lest any root of bitterness up springing should trouble you, and by this, might be defiled many,
58.12.16.1^lest there be any fornicator or profane person, as esau, who for meal one sold the birthright of himself.
58.12.17.1^you know for that even afterward, wishing to inherit the blessing, he was rejected;
58.12.17.2^of repentance for place not he found, although with tears having earnestly sought it.
58.12.18.1^not for you have come to that being touched and having been kindled with fire, and to darkness, and to gloom, and to storm,
58.12.19.1^and of a trumpet to the sound, and to a voice of words, which those having heard excused themselves, asking not to be addressed to them the word,
58.12.20.1^not they could bear for that being commanded:
58.12.20.2^if even a beast should touch the mountain, it shall be stoned.
58.12.21.1^and so fearful was the thing appearing that moses said, greatly afraid i am, and trembling.
58.12.22.1^but you have come to zion mount, and the city of god the living, the jerusalem heavenly, and to myriads of angels, to the assembly,
58.12.23.1^and to the church of the firstborn having been enrolled in the heavens, and to the judge god of all, and to the spirits of the righteous having been perfected,
58.12.24.1^and of a covenant new the mediator, to jesus, and to the blood of sprinkling better things speaking than that of abel.
58.12.25.1^take heed lest you refuse the one speaking.
58.12.25.2^if for they not escaped, on earth having refused the one divinely instructing them, much less we - the one from the heavens turning away from,
58.12.26.1^whose - voice the earth shook at that time;
58.12.26.2^now however he has promised, saying, yet once more i will shake not only the earth, but also - heaven.
58.12.27.1^this now, yet once more, signifies the of the things being shaken removing, as having been created, so that should remain the things not being shaken.
58.12.28.1^therefore a kingdom not to be shaken receiving, we may have grace, by which we may serve well pleasingly - god, with reverence and awe.
58.12.29.1^also for the god of us is a fire consuming.
58.13.1.1^- brotherly love let abide.
58.13.2.1^- of hospitality not be forgetful;
58.13.2.2^through this for, unawares some have entertained angels.
58.13.3.1^remember - prisoners as being bound with them, those being mistreated as also yourselves being in the body.
58.13.4.1^honorable let - marriage be in all, and the marriage bed undefiled;
58.13.4.2^the sexually immoral for and adulterers will judge - god.
58.13.5.1^let be without covetousness your manner of life, being satisfied with the present;
58.13.5.2^he himself for has said:
58.13.5.3^never not you will i leave, nor never not you will i forsake.
58.13.6.1^so are confident we to say:
58.13.6.2^the lord is my helper, and not i will be afraid;
58.13.6.3^what shall do to me man?
58.13.7.1^remember those leading you, who spoke to you the word - of god, of whom, considering the outcome of their way of life, imitate the faith.
58.13.8.1^jesus christ yesterday and today is the same, and to the ages.
58.13.9.1^by teachings various and strange, not be carried away;
58.13.9.2^it is good for by grace to be strengthened for the heart, not foods, in which not were profited those being devoted.
58.13.10.1^we have an altar from which to eat, not have authority, those in the tabernacle serving.
58.13.11.1^whose for is brought of animals the blood as sacrifices for sin, into the holy places by the high priest;
58.13.11.2^of those the bodies are burned outside the camp.
58.13.12.1^therefore also jesus, so that he might sanctify by the own blood the people, outside the gate suffered.
58.13.13.1^therefore we should go forth to him outside the camp, the reproach of him bearing.
58.13.14.1^not for we have here an abiding city, but the coming one we are seeking for.
58.13.15.1^through him then we should offer the sacrifice of praise through everything to god, that is, the fruit of the lips confessing the name of him.
58.13.16.1^- and the good and of sharing, not be forgetful;
58.13.16.2^with such for sacrifices is well pleased - god.
58.13.17.1^obey those leading you, and be submissive;
58.13.17.2^they for watch over the souls of you, as account about to give;
58.13.17.3^that with joy this they might do, and not groaning, unprofitable indeed for you is this.
58.13.18.1^pray for us;
58.13.18.2^we are persuaded for that a good conscience we have, in all things well desiring to conduct ourselves.
58.13.19.1^more abundantly now i exhort you this to do, so that more quickly i may be restored to you.
58.13.20.1^may the now god - of peace, - having brought out from the dead the shepherd of the sheep - great, by the blood of the covenant eternal, the lord of us jesus,
58.13.21.1^equip you in everything good, in order - to do the will of him, working in us that which is well pleasing before him, through jesus christ, to whom be the glory to the ages of the ages.
58.13.21.2^amen.
58.13.22.1^i exhort now you, brothers, bear with the word - of exhortation;
58.13.22.2^only for in few words i have written to you.
58.13.23.1^you know the brother of us timothy has been released, with whom if sooner he should come, i will see you.
58.13.24.1^greet all those leading you, and all the saints.
58.13.24.2^greet you, those from - italy.
58.13.25.1^- grace be with all of you.
59.1.1.1^james, of god and of the lord jesus christ a servant, to the twelve tribes - in the dispersion:
59.1.1.2^greetings.
59.1.2.1^all joy esteem it, brothers of me, when trials you might fall into various,
59.1.3.1^knowing that the testing of your - faith produces endurance.
59.1.4.1^- and endurance, work its perfect let have, so that you may be perfect and complete, in nothing lacking.
59.1.5.1^if now any of you lacks wisdom, let him ask from the one giving, god, to all generously, and not finding fault, and it will be given to him.
59.1.6.1^let him ask however in faith, nothing doubting.
59.1.6.2^the one for doubting is like a wave of the sea, being blown by the wind and being tossed by the wind.
59.1.7.1^not for let suppose the man that, that he will receive anything from the lord.
59.1.8.1^he is a man double-minded, unstable in all the ways of him.
59.1.9.1^let boast however the brother - of low degree in the exaltation of him;
59.1.10.1^he who is then rich, in the humiliation of him, because like a flower of grass he will pass away.
59.1.11.1^has risen for the sun with its burning heat and withered the grass, and the flower of it has fallen, and the beauty of the appearance of it has perished.
59.1.11.2^thus also the rich man in the midst of the pursuits of him will fade away.
59.1.12.1^blessed is the man who endures trial, because approved having been, he will receive the crown - of life that he has promised to those loving him.
59.1.13.1^no one being tempted let say -, by god i am being tempted.
59.1.13.2^- for god unable to be tempted is by evils;
59.1.13.3^tempts now he himself no one.
59.1.14.1^a man however is tempted, by the own desire being drawn away and being enticed.
59.1.15.1^then - desire, having conceived, gives birth to sin;
59.1.15.2^- and sin having become fully grown, brings forth death.
59.1.16.1^not be misled, brothers my beloved.
59.1.17.1^every act of giving good, and every gift perfect, from above is, coming down from the father - of lights, with whom not there is variation or of shifting shadow.
59.1.18.1^having willed it, he brought forth us by the word of truth, for - to be us firstfruits a certain - of his creatures.
59.1.19.1^know this, brothers my beloved.
59.1.19.2^let be however every man swift unto - to hear, slow unto - to speak, slow unto anger;
59.1.20.1^the anger for of man, the righteousness of god not produces.
59.1.21.1^therefore, having put aside all filthiness and abounding of wickedness, in humility receive the implanted word, - being able to save the souls of you.
59.1.22.1^be however doers of the word, and not only, hearers deceiving yourselves,
59.1.23.1^because if anyone a hearer of the word is and not a doer, this one is like a man looking at the face - natural of him in a mirror;
59.1.24.1^he has viewed for himself and has gone away and immediately he has forgotten what like he was.
59.1.25.1^the one however having looked intently into the law perfect, that - of freedom, and having continued in it, not a hearer forgetful having been, but a doer of the work   this one blessed in the work of him will be.
59.1.26.1^if anyone seems religious to be, not bridling the tongue of himself, but deceiving the heart of himself, of this one worthless is the religion.
59.1.27.1^religion pure and undefiled before the god and father this is, to visit orphans and widows in the tribulation of them;
59.1.27.2^unstained oneself to keep from the world.
59.2.1.1^brothers of me, not with partiality hold the faith of the lord of us jesus christ - of glory.
59.2.2.1^if for might come into assembly of you a man with a gold ring in apparel splendid, might come in then also a poor man in shabby apparel,
59.2.3.1^you should look also upon the one wearing the apparel - splendid and should say, you sit you here honorably, and to the poor should say, you stand or, sit there, under the footstool of me,
59.2.4.1^then not have you made a distinction among yourselves and have become judges with thoughts evil?
59.2.5.1^listen, brothers my beloved.
59.2.5.2^not - god has chosen the poor - in this world to be rich in faith and heirs of the kingdom that he promised to those loving him?
59.2.6.1^you however have dishonored the poor.
59.2.6.2^not the rich are oppressing you and they dragging you into court?
59.2.7.1^not they are blaspheming the good name - having been called upon you?
59.2.8.1^if indeed the law you keep royal, according to the scripture, you shall love the neighbor of you as yourself,  well you are doing.
59.2.9.1^if however you show partiality, sin you are committing, being convicted by the law as transgressors.
59.2.10.1^whoever for all the law shall keep, shall stumble but in one point, he has become of all guilty.
59.2.11.1^the one for having said, not you shall commit adultery,  said also, not you shall murder.
59.2.11.2^if however not you do commit adultery, do commit murder however, you have become a transgressor of the law.
59.2.12.1^so speak and so act as by the law of freedom being about to be judged.
59.2.13.1^- for judgment without mercy will be to the one not having shown mercy.
59.2.13.2^triumphs over mercy judgment.
59.2.14.1^what is the profit, brothers of me, if faith says anyone to have, works however not he has?
59.2.14.2^not is able the faith to save him?
59.2.15.1^now if a brother or a sister without clothes is, and lacking is - of daily food,
59.2.16.1^says then anyone to them out from you, go in peace;
59.2.16.2^be warmed and be filled, not gives however to them the needful things for the body, what is the profit?
59.2.17.1^so also - faith, if not it has works, dead is, by itself.
59.2.18.1^but will say someone, you faith have, and i works have.
59.2.18.2^show me the faith of you without - works, and i you will show by the works of me, - faith.
59.2.19.1^you believe that one is - god.
59.2.19.2^well you are doing!
59.2.19.3^even the demons believe that, and shudder!
59.2.20.1^do you want however to come to know, o man foolish, that - faith apart from - works worthless is?
59.2.21.1^abraham the father of us, not by works was justified, having offered isaac the son of him upon the altar?
59.2.22.1^you see that his faith was working with the works of him, and by his works, his faith was perfected.
59.2.23.1^and was fulfilled the scripture - saying, believed then abraham - god, and it was counted to him for righteousness,  and a friend of god he was called.
59.2.24.1^you see that by works is justified a man, and not by faith alone.
59.2.25.1^likewise then also rahab the prostitute not by works was justified, having received the messengers and by another way having sent them forth?
59.2.26.1^just as for the body apart from spirit dead is, so also - faith apart from works dead is.
59.3.1.1^not many of you teachers let be, brothers of mine, knowing that greater judgment we will receive.
59.3.2.1^in many ways for we stumble all.
59.3.2.2^if anyone in what he says not does stumble, this one is a perfect man, able to bridle indeed all the body.
59.3.3.1^if now, of the horses - bits into the mouths we put for - to obey them us, even all the body of them we turn about.
59.3.4.1^behold, also the ships, so great being and by winds strong being driven, are turned about by a very small rudder wherever the impulse of the one steering resolves.
59.3.5.1^thus also the tongue a small member is, and exceeding things it boasts.
59.3.5.2^behold a small fire, how great a forest it kindles.
59.3.6.1^also the tongue is a fire, the world - of iniquity.
59.3.6.2^the tongue is set among the members of us, - defiling all the body, and setting on fire the course - of nature, and itself being set on fire by - hell.
59.3.7.1^all for kinds of beasts both and of birds, of creeping things both and things of the sea, is subdued and has been subdued by the race of the human,
59.3.8.1^- but the tongue no one to subdue is able of men;
59.3.8.2^it is an unruly evil, full of poison deadly.
59.3.9.1^with it we bless our lord and father, and with it we curse - men, those according to the likeness of god being made.
59.3.10.1^out of the same mouth proceed forth blessing and cursing.
59.3.10.2^not ought, brothers of me, these things so to be.
59.3.11.1^not the spring out of the same opening pours forth - both fresh and - bitter?
59.3.12.1^not is able, brothers of me, a fig tree olives to produce?
59.3.12.2^or a vine, figs?
59.3.12.3^nor a salt spring, fresh to produce water.
59.3.13.1^who is wise and understanding among you;
59.3.13.2^let him show out of the good conduct the works of him, in the humility of wisdom.
59.3.14.1^if however jealousy bitter you have, and self-interest in the heart of you, not boast of it and lie against the truth.
59.3.15.1^not is this the wisdom from above coming down, but is earthly, unspiritual, demonic.
59.3.16.1^where for jealousy and self-interest exist, there will be disorder and every evil thing.
59.3.17.1^- but the from above wisdom first indeed pure is, then peaceable, gentle, reasonable, full of mercy and of fruits good, impartial, sincere.
59.3.18.1^the fruit now of righteousness in peace is sown by those making peace.
59.4.1.1^from where come disputes and from where quarrels among you?
59.4.1.2^is it not from there, out of the passions of you - warring in the members of you?
59.4.2.1^you desire, and not have;
59.4.2.2^you kill and covet, and not are able to obtain;
59.4.2.3^you quarrel and wrangle.
59.4.2.4^not you have, because - not ask you.
59.4.3.1^you ask and not receive, because wrongly you ask, that in the pleasures of you, you may spend it.
59.4.4.1^adulteresses!
59.4.4.2^not know you that the friendship with the world, hostility with god is?
59.4.4.3^whoever if therefore has chosen a friend to be of the world, an enemy - of god is appointed.
59.4.5.1^or think you that in vain the scripture says, with envy yearns the spirit that he has made to dwell in us?
59.4.6.1^greater however he gives grace.
59.4.6.2^therefore it says:
59.4.6.3^- god the proud opposes, to the humble however gives grace.
59.4.7.1^subject yourselves therefore - to god.
59.4.7.2^resist however the devil, and he will flee from you.
59.4.8.1^draw near - to god, and he will draw near to you.
59.4.8.2^cleanse your hands, you sinners, and have purified hearts, you double-minded.
59.4.9.1^be grieved, and mourn, and weep.
59.4.9.2^the laughter of you, to mourning let be turned, and the joy to gloom.
59.4.10.1^humble yourselves in the presence of the lord, and he will exalt you.
59.4.11.1^not speak against one another, brothers.
59.4.11.2^the one speaking against his brother or judging the brother of him, speaks against the law and judges the law.
59.4.11.3^if however the law you judge, not you are a doer of the law, but a judge.
59.4.12.1^one there is - lawgiver and judge, the one being able to save and to destroy.
59.4.12.2^you however, who are - judging the neighbor?
59.4.13.1^come now, those saying, today or tomorrow we will go into such - city, and will spend there a year, and will trade, and will make a profit,
59.4.14.1^who not know what is on the next day is.
59.4.14.2^what is the life of you?
59.4.14.3^a vapor just it is, - for a little while appearing, then also vanishing.
59.4.15.1^instead ought - to say you, if the lord should will, both we will live and we will do this or that.
59.4.16.1^now however you boast in the arrogance of you.
59.4.16.2^all boasting such evil is.
59.4.17.1^to him knowing therefore good to do, and not doing, sin to him it is.
59.5.1.1^come now, you rich, weep, wailing over the miseries upon you that are coming.
59.5.2.1^the riches of you have rotted, and the garments of you moth-eaten have become.
59.5.3.1^the gold of you and the silver have corroded, and the rust of them for a testimony against you will be, and will eat the flesh of you like fire.
59.5.3.2^you have treasured up in the last days.
59.5.4.1^behold, the wage of the workmen - having harvested the fields of you, - having been kept back by you, cries out, and the cries of those having harvested, into the ears of the lord of hosts have entered.
59.5.5.1^you lived in luxury upon the earth, and lived in self-indulgence.
59.5.5.2^you have fattened the hearts of you in the day of slaughter.
59.5.6.1^you have condemned and have put to death the righteous;
59.5.6.2^not does he resist you.
59.5.7.1^be patient therefore, brothers, until the coming of the lord.
59.5.7.2^behold, the farmer awaits the precious fruit of the earth, being patient for it until it receives the early and latter rains.
59.5.8.1^be patient also you;
59.5.8.2^strengthen the hearts of you, because the coming of the lord has drawn near.
59.5.9.1^not grumble brothers against one another, so that not you may be condemned.
59.5.9.2^behold, the judge before the doors is standing.
59.5.10.1^as an example take, brothers, - of suffering evils and - of patience, the prophets who spoke in the name of the lord.
59.5.11.1^behold, we count blessed those having persevered.
59.5.11.2^the perseverance of job you have heard of, and the outcome from the lord you have seen, that full of compassion is the lord, and is merciful.
59.5.12.1^before all things however, brothers of me, not swear, neither by - heaven, nor the earth, nor other any oath.
59.5.12.2^be however of you the yes, yes, and the no, no, so that not under judgment you might fall.
59.5.13.1^is suffering hardships anyone among you?
59.5.13.2^let him pray.
59.5.13.3^is cheerful anyone?
59.5.13.4^let him sing praises.
59.5.14.1^is sick anyone among you?
59.5.14.2^let him call near the elders of the church, and let them pray over him, having anointed him with oil in the name of the lord.
59.5.15.1^and the prayer - of faith will save the one ailing, and will raise up him the lord, and if sins he might be one having committed, it will be forgiven him.
59.5.16.1^confess therefore to one another the sins, and pray for one another, so that you may be healed.
59.5.16.2^much prevails the prayer of a righteous man being made effective.
59.5.17.1^elijah a man was of like nature to us, and with fervent prayer he prayed for it - not to rain, and not it did rain upon the earth years three and months six.
59.5.18.1^and again he prayed, and the heaven rain gave, and the earth produced the fruit of it.
59.5.19.1^brothers of me, if anyone among you might wander from the truth, and should bring back someone him,
59.5.20.1^let him know that the one having brought back a sinner from the error of the way of him will save the soul of him from death and will cover over a multitude of sins.
60.1.1.1^peter, an apostle of jesus christ, to the elect sojourners of the dispersion of pontus, galatia, cappadocia, asia, and bithynia,
60.1.2.1^according to the foreknowledge of god the father, by the sanctification of the spirit, unto the obedience and sprinkling of the blood of jesus christ:
60.1.2.2^grace to you and peace may be multiplied.
60.1.3.1^blessed be the god and father of the lord of us jesus christ, the one according to the great of him mercy having begotten again us to a hope living, through the resurrection of jesus christ out from the dead,
60.1.4.1^to an inheritance imperishable and undefiled and unfading, being reserved in the heavens for you,
60.1.5.1^who by the power of god are being guarded through faith, for the salvation ready to be revealed in the time last,
60.1.6.1^in which you greatly rejoice, for a little while at present, if being necessary it is, having been put to grief by various trials,
60.1.7.1^so that the proven genuineness of your - faith, more precious than gold, - perishing, by fire though being refined, may be discovered to result in praise and glory and honor in the revelation of jesus christ,
60.1.8.1^whom not having seen you love, on whom now though not seeing believing now you exult with joy inexpressible and filled with glory,
60.1.9.1^receiving the outcome of the faith of you, the salvation of your souls.
60.1.10.1^concerning this salvation, sought out and searched out diligently the prophets, - of the toward you grace having prophesied,
60.1.11.1^inquiring into what or what manner of time was signifying the in them spirit of christ, testifying beforehand - unto christ s sufferings and the after these glories,
60.1.12.1^to whom it was revealed that not themselves, you however, they were serving in those things which now have been proclaimed to you by those having proclaimed the gospel to you by the spirit holy having been sent from heaven, into which desire angels to look.
60.1.13.1^therefore having girded up the loins of the mind of you, being sober-minded, fully set your hope upon the being brought to you grace in the revelation of jesus christ,
60.1.14.1^as children of obedience, not fashioning yourselves to the former in the ignorance of you desires.
60.1.15.1^but as the one having called you is holy, also yourselves holy in all your conduct be,
60.1.16.1^because it has been written holy you shall be, because i am holy
60.1.17.1^and if as father you call on the one impartially judging according to the of each work, in fear during the of the sojourn of you time conduct yourselves,
60.1.18.1^knowing that not by perishable things   by silver or by gold   you were redeemed from the futile of you manner of life handed down from your fathers,
60.1.19.1^but by the precious blood, as of a lamb without blemish and without spot, of christ,
60.1.20.1^having been foreknown indeed before the foundation of the world, having been revealed however in the last - times for the sake of you,
60.1.21.1^who by him believe in god, the one having raised up him out from the dead and glory him having given, so as for the faith of you, and hope, to be in god.
60.1.22.1^the souls of you having purified by - obedience to the truth unto brotherly love sincere, out of purity of heart, one another love fervently.
60.1.23.1^having been born again, not of seed perishable, but of imperishable, by the word living of god, and abiding,
60.1.24.1^because, all flesh is like grass, and all the glory of it like the flower of grass.
60.1.24.2^withers the grass, and the flower falls away,
60.1.25.1^- but the word of the lord abides to the age.
60.1.25.2^this now is the word - having been proclaimed to you.
60.2.1.1^having put aside therefore all malice, and all deceit, and hypocrisy, and envies, and all evil speakings,
60.2.2.1^like newborn babies, - reasonable pure milk crave, so that by it you may grow up in respect to salvation,
60.2.3.1^if indeed you have tasted that is good the lord.
60.2.4.1^to whom coming, a stone living, by men indeed rejected, in the sight of however god chosen and precious,
60.2.5.1^also you yourselves as stones living, are being built up as a house spiritual into a priesthood holy, to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to god through jesus christ.
60.2.6.1^therefore it is contained in scripture:
60.2.6.2^behold, i lay in zion a stone, cornerstone, a chosen precious;
60.2.6.3^and the one believing on him, no not shall be put to shame.
60.2.7.1^to you therefore is the preciousness, - believing;
60.2.7.2^to those disobeying, however, the stone which have rejected those building, this has become into the head of the corner,
60.2.8.1^and, a stone of stumbling and a rock of offense.
60.2.8.2^they stumble at, to the word being disobedient, to which also they were appointed.
60.2.9.1^you however are a race chosen, a royal priesthood, a nation holy, a people for his possession, so that the excellencies you may proclaim of the one out of darkness you having called, to the marvelous of him light,
60.2.10.1^who once were not a people, now however the people of god;
60.2.10.2^those not having received mercy, now however having received mercy.
60.2.11.1^beloved, i exhort you as aliens and sojourners, to abstain from fleshly desires, which war against the soul,
60.2.12.1^the conduct of you among the gentiles keeping honorable, so that wherein which they speak against you as evildoers, through the good deeds having witnessed, they may glorify - god in the day of visitation.
60.2.13.1^be in subjection to every human institution for the sake of the lord, whether to the king as being supreme,
60.2.14.1^or to governors, as by him being sent for vengeance to evildoers, praise then to well-doers,
60.2.15.1^because this is the will - of god, doing good, to put to silence the - of foolish men ignorance,
60.2.16.1^as free, and not as a cover-up having for evil the freedom, but as of god servants.
60.2.17.1^everyone honor:
60.2.17.2^the brotherhood love, - god fear, the king honor.
60.2.18.1^- servants, be subject with all fear to masters, not only to the good and gentle, but also to the unreasonable.
60.2.19.1^this for is acceptable, if for sake of conscience toward god, endures anyone griefs, suffering unjustly.
60.2.20.1^what kind of for credit is it, if sinning and being struck you shall endure?
60.2.20.2^but if doing good and suffering you shall endure, this is commendable before god.
60.2.21.1^to this hereunto for you have been called, because also christ suffered for you, you leaving an example that you should follow after the steps of him:
60.2.22.1^who sin not committed, neither was found trickery in the mouth of him.
60.2.23.1^who being reviled, not reviled in return;
60.2.23.2^suffering not threatened;
60.2.23.3^he gave himself over however to him judging justly.
60.2.24.1^who the sins of us himself bore in the body of him on the tree, so that, - to sins having been dead, - to righteousness we might live.
60.2.24.2^by whose - wounds you have been healed.
60.2.25.1^you were for like sheep going astray, but you have returned now to the shepherd and overseer of the souls of you.
60.3.1.1^likewise - wives, be subject to the own husbands, so that, even if any are disobedient to the word, by the of the wives conduct, without word, they will be won over,
60.3.2.1^having witnessed the in respect pure conduct of you,
60.3.3.1^whose let it be not the external of braiding of hair and putting around of gold, or putting on of garments adorning,
60.3.4.1^but the hidden of the heart man, in the imperishable of the gentle and quiet spirit, which is before - god of great worth.
60.3.5.1^in this way for formerly also the holy women - hoping in god used to adorn themselves, being subject to the own husbands,
60.3.6.1^as sarah obeyed - abraham, lord him calling, of whom you have become children, doing good and not fearing not one consternation.
60.3.7.1^- husbands likewise, dwelling with them according to knowledge, as with a weaker vessel with the female, rendering honor, as also joint-heirs of the grace of life, so as for - not to be hindered the prayers of you.
60.3.8.1^- now the end:
60.3.8.2^all be single-minded, sympathetic, loving as brothers, tender-hearted, humble,
60.3.9.1^not repaying evil for evil or insult for insult;
60.3.9.2^on the contrary however, blessing, because to this you were called, so that blessing you should inherit.
60.3.10.1^the one for desiring life to love, and to see days good, let him keep the tongue from evil, and lips - not to speak deceit.
60.3.11.1^let him turn away also from evil, and let him do good.
60.3.11.2^let him seek peace and let him pursue it.
60.3.12.1^because the eyes of the lord are on the righteous, and the ears of him toward prayer of them.
60.3.12.2^the face however of the lord is against those doing evil.
60.3.13.1^and who is he who will harm you, if for that which is good, zealous you should be?
60.3.14.1^but if even you should suffer because of righteousness, you are blessed.
60.3.14.2^- and the threats of them not you should be afraid of, neither should you be troubled.
60.3.15.1^as lord however, - christ sanctify in the hearts of you, ready always for a defense to everyone - asking you an account concerning the in you hope;
60.3.16.1^yet with gentleness and fear, a conscience having good, so that in this they might speak against you, they shall be ashamed those reviling your - good in christ manner of life.
60.3.17.1^it is better for doing good if wills it the will - of god, to suffer, than doing evil,
60.3.18.1^because also christ once for sins suffered, the righteous for the unrighteous, so that you he might bring - to god, having been put to death indeed in the flesh, having been made alive however in the spirit,
60.3.19.1^in which also to the in prison spirits, having gone he preached,
60.3.20.1^having disobeyed at one time, when was waiting the - of god longsuffering in the days of noah, being prepared of the ark, in which a few   that is, eight souls   were saved through water,
60.3.21.1^which also you prefigures now saving baptism, not of flesh a putting away of the filth, but of a conscience good, the demand toward god, through the resurrection of jesus christ,
60.3.22.1^who is at the right hand - of god, having gone into heaven, having been subjected to him angels and authorities and powers.
60.4.1.1^christ therefore having suffered in the flesh, also you the same mind arm yourselves with, because the one having suffered in the flesh is done with sin,
60.4.2.1^so as - no longer to men s desires but to the will of god, the remaining in the flesh to live time.
60.4.3.1^is sufficient for the past time the desire of the gentiles to have carried out, having walked in sensuality, lusts, drunkenness, orgies, carousing, and abominable idolatries.
60.4.4.1^with respect to this they think it strange, not running with them of you into the same - of debauchery overflow, speaking evil of you,
60.4.5.1^who will give account to him who ready is to judge the living and the dead.
60.4.6.1^to this end indeed, even to the dead the gospel was proclaimed, so that they might be judged indeed according to men in the flesh;
60.4.6.2^they might live however according to god in the spirit.
60.4.7.1^of all now the end has drawn near.
60.4.7.2^be clear-minded therefore, and sober for the purpose of prayers,
60.4.8.1^above all things, - among yourselves love fervent having, because love covers over a multitude of sins,
60.4.9.1^hospitable to one another, without complaint,
60.4.10.1^each as has received a gift, to each other them serving, as good stewards of the manifold grace of god:
60.4.11.1^if anyone speaks, as oracles of god;
60.4.11.2^if anyone serves, as of strength which supplies - god, so that in all things may be glorified - god through jesus christ, to whom be the glory and the power to the ages of the ages.
60.4.11.3^amen.
60.4.12.1^beloved, not be surprised at the among you fire for a trial to you taking place, as if a strange thing to you were happening.
60.4.13.1^but as you have shared in the - of christ sufferings, rejoice, so that also in the revelation of the glory of him, you may rejoice exulting.
60.4.14.1^if you are insulted in the name of christ, you are blessed, because the - of glory and - - of god spirit upon you rests.
60.4.15.1^not for any of you let suffer as a murderer, or a thief, or an evildoer, or as a troublesome meddler;
60.4.16.1^if however as a christian, not let him be ashamed;
60.4.16.2^let him glorify however - god in the name this.
60.4.17.1^for it is the time for - to have begun the judgment from the house - of god;
60.4.17.2^if now first from us, what will be the outcome of those disobeying the - of god gospel?
60.4.18.1^and, if the righteous one with difficulty is saved, the ungodly and sinner where will appear?
60.4.19.1^therefore also, those suffering according to the will - of god, to the faithful creator let them commit the souls of them in well doing.
60.5.1.1^elders - among you, i exhort, - a fellow elder and witness of the - of christ sufferings, who am also of the being about to be revealed glory partaker:
60.5.2.1^shepherd the among you flock - of god, exercising oversight not under compulsion, but willingly, according to god;
60.5.2.2^and not for base gain, but eagerly;
60.5.3.1^not as exercising lordship over - those in your charge, but examples being to the flock.
60.5.4.1^and having been revealed the chief shepherd, you will receive the unfading - of glory crown.
60.5.5.1^likewise, younger ones, be subject to your elders.
60.5.5.2^all now one to another - humility gird on, because, - god the proud opposes, to the humble however he gives grace.
60.5.6.1^be humbled therefore under the mighty hand - of god, so that you he may exalt in due time,
60.5.7.1^all the anxiety of you having cast upon him, because with him there is care about you.
60.5.8.1^be sober-minded;
60.5.8.2^watch.
60.5.8.3^the adversary of you, the devil, as a lion roaring prowls about, seeking whom to devour,
60.5.9.1^whom you should resist, firm in the faith, knowing the same - sufferings - throughout the world in your brotherhood to be accomplished.
60.5.10.1^the now god of all grace, the one having called you to the eternal of him glory in christ, a little while of you having suffered, he himself will perfect, will confirm, will strengthen, and will establish you.
60.5.11.1^to him be the power to the ages.
60.5.11.2^amen.
60.5.12.1^through silvanus, to you the faithful brother as i regard him, through few words i have written, exhorting and testifying this to be the true grace - of god, in which you stand.
60.5.13.1^greets you she in babylon, elected with you, and mark, the son of me.
60.5.14.1^greet one another with a kiss of love.
60.5.14.2^peace be to you all who are in christ.
61.1.1.1^simon peter, a servant and apostle of jesus christ, to those equally precious with ours having obtained a faith, through the righteousness of the god of us and savior, jesus christ:
61.1.2.1^grace to you and peace be multiplied in the knowledge - of god and of jesus the lord of us.
61.1.3.1^accordingly, all things to us the divine power of him - toward life and godliness has given, through the knowledge of the one having called us by his own glory and excellence,
61.1.4.1^through which the precious and magnificent to us promises he has given, so that through these you might become of the divine partakers nature, having escaped the in the world in desire, decay.
61.1.5.1^and very reason for this now, earnestness all having brought in, supplement into the faith of you - virtue, into and - virtue - knowledge,
61.1.6.1^into then - knowledge - self-control, into then - self-control - endurance, into then - endurance - godliness,
61.1.7.1^in then - godliness - brotherly affection, in then - brotherly affection - love.
61.1.8.1^these things for in you being and abounding, neither idle nor unfruitful make you, as to the of the lord of us jesus christ, knowledge.
61.1.9.1^in whomever for not are present these things, blind he is, being short sighted, forgetfulness having received of the purification the former of him sins.
61.1.10.1^therefore rather, brothers, be diligent, sure your - calling and election to make, these things for practicing never not shall you stumble at any time.
61.1.11.1^in this way for richly will be supplied to you the entrance into the eternal kingdom of the lord of us and savior, jesus christ.
61.1.12.1^therefore i will be ready always you to remind concerning these things, though knowing them and having been strengthened in the being present in you truth.
61.1.13.1^right now i esteem it, as long as i am in this - tabernacle, to stir up you by putting you in remembrance,
61.1.14.1^knowing that impending is the putting off of the tabernacle of me, as also the lord of us jesus christ has made clear to me.
61.1.15.1^i will be diligent now also at every time, to have for you after - my departure, - these things a lasting remembrance to make.
61.1.16.1^not for cleverly devised fables having followed out, we have made known to you the of the lord of us jesus christ power and coming, but eyewitnesses having been - of his majesty.
61.1.17.1^having received for from god the father honor and glory, a voice was brought to him, such as follows by the majestic glory:
61.1.17.2^the son of me, - beloved of me, this is, in whom i have found delight.
61.1.18.1^and this - voice we heard from heaven, having been brought with him, being in the holy mountain.
61.1.19.1^and we have more certain the prophetic word, to which well you do taking heed, as to a lamp shining in a dark place, until this day shall have dawned and the morning star shall have arisen in the hearts of you,
61.1.20.1^this first knowing, that any prophecy of scripture of its own interpretation not is.
61.1.21.1^not for by the will of man was brought prophecy at any time, but by the spirit holy being carried, spoke from god men.
61.2.1.1^there were however also false prophets among the people, as also among you there will be false teachers, who will stealthily introduce heresies destructive, even the having bought them master denying, bringing upon themselves swift destruction.
61.2.2.1^and many will follow after their - sensuality, through whom the way of the truth will be maligned.
61.2.3.1^and through covetousness with fabricated words you they will exploit, for whom the judgment of long ago not is idle, and the destruction of them not slumbers.
61.2.4.1^if for - god the angels having sinned, not spared, but in chains of gloomy darkness having cast them down to tartarus, delivered them, for judgment being kept;
61.2.5.1^and the ancient world not he spared, but one of eight, noah of righteousness a herald preserved, the flood upon the world of the ungodly having brought in;
61.2.6.1^and the cities of sodom and gomorrah having reduced to ashes, to destruction he condemned them, an example of what is coming on the ungodly having set;
61.2.7.1^and righteous lot, being distressed by the of the lawless in sensuality conduct, he rescued
61.2.8.1^through seeing for and hearing that righteous man, dwelling among them day after day, in his soul righteous with their lawless deeds was tormented
61.2.9.1^then knows the lord the devout out of temptation to deliver;
61.2.9.2^the unrighteous then unto the day of judgment being punished to keep;
61.2.10.1^especially then those after the flesh in the passion of defilement walking and authority despising.
61.2.10.2^bold, self-willed, glorious ones not they tremble blaspheming,
61.2.11.1^whereas angels, in strength and power greater being, not do bring against them before the lord a reviling judgment.
61.2.12.1^these however, like irrational animals, having been born as creatures of instinct for capture and destruction, in what they are ignorant of, blaspheming, in the destruction of them also will be destroyed,
61.2.13.1^suffering wrong as the wage of unrighteousness;
61.2.13.2^as pleasure esteeming - in daytime carousal;
61.2.13.3^blots and blemishes, reveling in the deceptions of them, feasting with you;
61.2.14.1^eyes having full of adultery, and unceasing from sin, enticing souls unestablished;
61.2.14.2^a heart having been exercised in craving having   of a curse children!
61.2.15.1^having left the straight way, they have gone astray, having followed in the way - of balaam - son of bosor, who the wage of unrighteousness loved;
61.2.16.1^reproof however he had for his own transgression by a donkey mute;
61.2.16.2^in a man s voice having spoken, it restrained the of the prophet madness.
61.2.17.1^these are springs without water and mists by storm being driven, for whom - gloom - of darkness has been reserved.
61.2.18.1^arrogant for of vanity speaking words, they entice with the passions of the flesh to sensuality those barely escaping from those in error living,
61.2.19.1^freedom them promising, themselves slaves being - of corruption.
61.2.19.2^by what for anyone has been subdued, by that he is enslaved.
61.2.20.1^if for having escaped the pollutions of the world through the knowledge of the lord and savior jesus christ, in these now again having been entangled they are subdued, has become to them the last state worse than the first.
61.2.21.1^better for it would have been for them not to have known the way - of righteousness, than having known it, to have turned from the having been delivered to them holy commandment.
61.2.22.1^has happened to them the thing of the true proverb:
61.2.22.2^a dog having returned to its own vomit,  and, a sow having washed, to her rolling place in the mire.
61.3.1.1^this now, beloved, is the second to you i am writing letter, in which i am stirring up of you in putting you in remembrance - pure mind,
61.3.2.1^to remember the having been spoken beforehand words   by the holy prophets and of the - apostles through your   commandment of the lord and savior,
61.3.3.1^this first knowing, that will come in the last of the days with scoffing scoffers, according to - own evil desires of them following
61.3.4.1^and saying, where is the promise of the coming of him?
61.3.4.2^from the time that for the fathers fell asleep, all things as they were continue from the beginning of creation.
61.3.5.1^it is concealed from indeed them this willingly, that heavens existed long ago, and the earth out of water and through water having been composed by the - of god word,
61.3.6.1^through which the at that time world, with water having been deluged, perished.
61.3.7.1^- but now the heavens and the earth, by the same word having been stored up exist, for fire being kept unto the day of judgment and destruction - of ungodly men.
61.3.8.1^this one however thing not let be hidden from you, beloved, that one day with the lord is like a thousand years, and a thousand years like day one.
61.3.9.1^not does delay the lord the promise, as some slowness esteem, but is patient toward you, not willing for any to perish, but all to repentance to come.
61.3.10.1^will come however the day of the lord like a thief, in which the heavens with a roar will pass away, elements then burning with heat will be dissolved, and the earth and the in it works not will be found.
61.3.11.1^these things in this way all being dissolved, what kind ought to be you?
61.3.11.2^in holy conduct and godliness,
61.3.12.1^expecting and hastening the coming of the - of god day, by reason of which the heavens being set on fire will be dissolved, and the elements burning with heat are melting.
61.3.13.1^new however heavens, and earth a new, according to the promise of him, we are awaiting, in which righteousness dwells.
61.3.14.1^therefore, beloved, these things expecting, be diligent without spot and without blemish by him to be found, in peace.
61.3.15.1^and the of the lord of us patience as salvation esteem, just as also - beloved of us brother paul, according to the having been given to him wisdom, wrote to you,
61.3.16.1^as also in all the letters, speaking in them concerning these things, among which are difficult to be understood some things, which the ignorant and unestablished distort, as also the other scriptures, to the own of them destruction.
61.3.17.1^you therefore, beloved, knowing this beforehand, beware, that not by the of the lawless error having been led away, you should fall from the own steadfastness.
61.3.18.1^grow however in grace, and in knowledge of the lord of us and savior jesus christ.
61.3.18.2^to him be the glory both now and to the day of eternity.
62.1.1.1^that which was from the beginning, that which we have heard, that which we have seen with the eyes of us, that which we have gazed upon and the hands of us have handled, concerning the word - of life
62.1.2.1^and the life was made manifest, and we have seen and bear witness, and we proclaim to you the life - eternal which was with the father and was revealed to us
62.1.3.1^that which we have seen and have heard, we proclaim also to you, so that also you fellowship may have with us.
62.1.3.2^indeed the fellowship now - of us is with the father, and with the son of him, jesus christ.
62.1.4.1^and these things write we so that the joy of us might be complete.
62.1.5.1^and is this the message that we have heard from him, and we preach to you, that - god light is, and darkness in him, not is none.
62.1.6.1^if we should say that fellowship we have with him, and yet in the darkness should walk, we lie and not do practice the truth.
62.1.7.1^if in the light we should walk as he is in the light, fellowship we have with one another, and the blood of jesus, the son of him, cleanses us from all sin.
62.1.8.1^if we should say that sin not we have, ourselves we deceive, and the truth not is in us.
62.1.9.1^if we should confess the sins of us, faithful he is and just, that he may forgive us our sins, and might cleanse us from all unrighteousness.
62.1.10.1^if we should say that not we have sinned, a liar we make him, and the word of him not is in us.
62.2.1.1^little children of me, these things i am writing to you so that not you might sin.
62.2.1.2^and if anyone should sin, an advocate we have with the father, jesus christ the righteous one.
62.2.2.1^and he the propitiation is for the sins of us;
62.2.2.2^not for the of ours and only, but also for all the world.
62.2.3.1^and by this we know that we have come to know him, if the commandments of him we should keep.
62.2.4.1^the one saying -, i have known him, and the commandments of him not keeping, a liar he is, and in him the truth not is.
62.2.5.1^whoever however - may keep his - word, truly in him the love - of god has been perfected.
62.2.5.2^by this we know that in him we are:
62.2.6.1^the one claiming in him to abide, ought just as that walk also he in the same way walked.
62.2.7.1^beloved, not a commandment new i am writing to you, but a commandment old, which you have had from the beginning.
62.2.7.2^the commandment - old is the word that you have heard.
62.2.8.1^again, a commandment new i am writing to you, which is true in him and in you, because the darkness is passing away, and the light - true already shines.
62.2.9.1^the one claiming in the light to be and the brother of him hating, in the darkness is even until now.
62.2.10.1^the one loving the brother of him, in the light abides, and cause for stumbling in him not there is.
62.2.11.1^the one however hating the brother of him, in the darkness is, and in the darkness walks;
62.2.11.2^and not does he know where he is going, because the darkness has blinded the eyes of him.
62.2.12.1^i am writing to you, little children, because have been forgiven your - sins for the sake of the name of him.
62.2.13.1^i am writing to you, fathers, because you have known him who is from the beginning.
62.2.13.2^i am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the evil one.
62.2.14.1^i have written to you, little children, because you know the father.
62.2.14.2^i have written to you, fathers, because you know him who is from the beginning.
62.2.14.3^i have written to you, young men, because strong you are, and the word - of god in you abides, and you have overcome the evil one.
62.2.15.1^not love the world nor the things in the world.
62.2.15.2^if anyone should love the world, not is the love of the father in him,
62.2.16.1^because all that is in the world, the desire of the flesh, and the desire of the eyes, and the vaunting of life, not is from the father, but from the world is.
62.2.17.1^and the world is passing away, and the desire of it;
62.2.17.2^the one however doing the will - of god abides to the age.
62.2.18.1^little children, the last hour it is, and as you have heard that antichrist is coming, even now antichrists many have arisen, whereby we know that the last hour it is.
62.2.19.1^from among us they went out, but not they were of us;
62.2.19.2^if for of us they had been, they would have remained - with us.
62.2.19.3^but it is so that it might be made manifest that not they are all of us.
62.2.20.1^and you the anointing have from the holy one, and know you all.
62.2.21.1^not i have written to you because not you know the truth, but because you know it, and because any lie, of the truth not is.
62.2.22.1^who is the liar, if not the one denying that jesus not is the christ?
62.2.22.2^this is the antichrist, the one denying the father and the son.
62.2.23.1^everyone - denying the son, neither the father has he.
62.2.23.2^the one confessing the son, also the father has.
62.2.24.1^you, what you have heard from the beginning, in you let it abide.
62.2.24.2^if in you should abide what from the beginning you have heard, also you in the son and in the father will abide.
62.2.25.1^and this is the promise that he promised us:
62.2.25.2^- life - eternal.
62.2.26.1^these things i have written to you concerning those leading astray you.
62.2.27.1^and you, the anointing that you received from him, abides in you, and not need you have that anyone should teach you.
62.2.27.2^but just as the same anointing teaches you concerning all things, and true is, and not is a lie;
62.2.27.3^and just as it has taught you, you shall abide in him.
62.2.28.1^and now, little children, abide in him, so that when he appears we might have boldness and not be ashamed before him at the coming of him.
62.2.29.1^if you know that righteous he is, you know that also everyone - practicing - righteousness, of him has been begotten.
62.3.1.1^behold what love has given to us the father, that children of god we should be called   and we are!
62.3.1.2^because of this, the world not knows us, because not it knew him.
62.3.2.1^beloved, now children of god are we, and not yet has been revealed what we will be.
62.3.2.2^we know that when he appears, like him we will be, for we will see him as he is.
62.3.3.1^and everyone - having the hope this in him, purifies himself, just as he pure is.
62.3.4.1^everyone - committing - sin, also - lawlessness commits;
62.3.4.2^and - sin is - lawlessness.
62.3.5.1^and you know that he appeared so that - sins he might take away;
62.3.5.2^and sin in him not there is.
62.3.6.1^anyone - in him abiding, not sins;
62.3.6.2^anyone - sinning, not has seen him, nor has he known him.
62.3.7.1^little children, no one let lead astray you;
62.3.7.2^the one practicing - righteousness, righteous is, just as he righteous is.
62.3.8.1^the one practicing - sin, of the devil is, because from the beginning the devil has been sinning.
62.3.8.2^for this reason was revealed the son - of god, so that he might destroy the works of the devil.
62.3.9.1^anyone - having been born of - god, sin not practices, because seed of him in him abides, and not he is able to continue sinning, because of - god he has been born.
62.3.10.1^through this manifest are the children - of god and the children of the devil:
62.3.10.2^anyone - not practicing righteousness not is of - god, and also the one not loving the brother of him.
62.3.11.1^for this is the message that you have heard from the beginning, that we should love one another,
62.3.12.1^not as cain , who of the evil one was and slew the brother of him.
62.3.12.2^and because of what he slayed him?
62.3.12.3^because the works of him evil were, those however of the brother of him, righteous.
62.3.13.1^and not be surprised, brothers, if hates you the world.
62.3.14.1^we know that we have passed from - death to - life, because we love our brothers.
62.3.14.2^the one not loving abides in - death.
62.3.15.1^everyone - hating the brother of him a murderer is;
62.3.15.2^and you know that any murderer, not has life eternal in him abiding.
62.3.16.1^by this we have known - love, because he for us the life of him laid down;
62.3.16.2^and we ought for our brothers, our lives to lay down.
62.3.17.1^whoever now - might have the goods of the world, and might see the brother of him need having, and might close up the heart of him from him, how the love - of god abides in him?
62.3.18.1^little children, not we should love in word, nor in tongue, but in action and in truth.
62.3.19.1^and by this we will know that of the truth we are, and before him we will assure the heart of us,
62.3.20.1^that if should condemn us our - heart, that greater than is - god the heart of us, and he knows all things.
62.3.21.1^beloved, if the heart of us not should condemn us, confidence we have toward - god,
62.3.22.1^and whatever if we might ask, we receive from him, because the commandments of him we keep, and the things pleasing before him we do.
62.3.23.1^and this is the commandment of him, that we should believe in the name the son of him, jesus christ, and we should love one another, just as he gave the commandment to us.
62.3.24.1^and the one keeping the commandments of him, in him abides, and he in him.
62.3.24.2^and by this we know that he abides in us, by the spirit whom to us he has given.
62.4.1.1^beloved, not every spirit believe, but test the spirits, whether of - god they are, because many false prophets have gone out into the world.
62.4.2.1^by this you know the spirit - of god:
62.4.2.2^every spirit that confesses jesus christ in the flesh having come, of - god is;
62.4.3.1^and any spirit that not confesses - jesus, from - god not is.
62.4.3.2^and this is that of the antichrist, which you heard that is coming, and now in the world is already.
62.4.4.1^you from - god are, little children, and have overcome them, because greater is the one in you than the one in the world.
62.4.5.1^they of the world are;
62.4.5.2^because of this from out of the world they speak, and the world them listens to.
62.4.6.1^we of - god are.
62.4.6.2^the one knowing - god listens to us.
62.4.6.3^he who not is from - god, not listens to us.
62.4.6.4^by this we know the spirit - of truth and the spirit - of falsehood.
62.4.7.1^beloved, we should love one another, because - love from - god is;
62.4.7.2^and everyone - loving, from - god has been born, and knows - god.
62.4.8.1^the one not loving, not has known - god, because - god love is.
62.4.9.1^in this has been revealed the love - of god among us, that the son of him, the one and only, has sent - god into the world, so that we might live through him.
62.4.10.1^in this is - love, not that we loved - god, but that he loved us and sent the son of him as a propitiation for the sins of us.
62.4.11.1^beloved, if so - god loved us, also we ought one another to love.
62.4.12.1^god no one at any time has seen;
62.4.12.2^if we should love one another, - god in us abides and the love of him in us having been perfected is.
62.4.13.1^by this we know that in him we abide, and he in us, because from out the spirit of him he has given to us.
62.4.14.1^and we have seen and testify that the father has sent the son as savior of the world.
62.4.15.1^whoever if shall confess that jesus is the son - of god, - god in him abides, and he in - god.
62.4.16.1^and we have come to know and have come to believe the love that has - god as to us.
62.4.16.2^- god love is, and the one abiding in - love, in - god abides, and - god in him abides.
62.4.17.1^in this has been perfected - love with us, so that confidence we may have in the day - of judgment, that just as he is, also we are in the world this.
62.4.18.1^fear no there is in - love, but - perfect love out casts - fear, because the fear punishment has;
62.4.18.2^the one now fearing, not has been perfected in - love.
62.4.19.1^we love because he first loved us.
62.4.20.1^if anyone should say -, i love - god, and the brother of him should hate, a liar he is.
62.4.20.2^the one for not loving the brother of him, whom he has seen, - god, whom not he has seen, not is he able to love.
62.4.21.1^and this the commandment we have from him, that the one loving - god should love also the brother of him.
62.5.1.1^everyone - believing that jesus is the christ, of - god has been born, and everyone - loving the one having begotten him, loves also the one having been begotten from him.
62.5.2.1^by this we know that we love the children - of god, when - god we love and the commandments of him keep.
62.5.3.1^this for is the love - of god, that the commandments of him we should keep;
62.5.3.2^and the commandments of him burdensome not are.
62.5.4.1^for everyone - having been born of - god overcomes the world;
62.5.4.2^and this is the victory - having overcome the world:
62.5.4.3^the faith of us.
62.5.5.1^who now is the one overcoming the world, if not the one believing that jesus is the son - of god?
62.5.6.1^this is the one having come by water and blood, jesus christ;
62.5.6.2^not by - water only, but by - water and by - blood.
62.5.6.3^and the spirit is the one testifying, because the spirit is the truth.
62.5.7.1^for three there are - bearing testimony:
62.5.8.1^the spirit and the water and the blood   and these three in - one are.
62.5.9.1^if the testimony - of men we receive, the testimony - of god greater is.
62.5.9.2^for this is the testimony - of god that he has testified concerning the son of him.
62.5.10.1^the one believing in the son - of god has the testimony in himself.
62.5.10.2^the one not believing - god, a liar has made him, because not he has believed in the testimony that has testified - god concerning the son him.
62.5.11.1^and this is the testimony, that life eternal has given to us, - god and this the life in the son his is.
62.5.12.1^the one having the son has - life;
62.5.12.2^the one not having the son - of god, - life not has.
62.5.13.1^these things have i written to you so that you may know that life you have eternal, to those believing in the name of the son - of god.
62.5.14.1^and this is the confidence that we have toward him, that if anything we might ask according to the will of him, he hears us.
62.5.15.1^and if we know that he hears us, whatever if we might ask, we know that we have the requests that we have asked from him.
62.5.16.1^if anyone should see the brother of him sinning a sin not unto death, he shall ask, and he will give him life, to those sinning not unto death.
62.5.16.2^there is a sin unto death;
62.5.16.3^not concerning that do i say that he should implore.
62.5.17.1^all unrighteousness sin is, and there is sin not unto death.
62.5.18.1^we know that everyone - having been born of - god not continues to sin, but the one having been begotten of - god protects him, and the evil one not does touch him.
62.5.19.1^we know that of - god we are, and the world whole, in the evil one lies.
62.5.20.1^we know now that the son - of god is come, and has given us understanding, so that we may know him who is true;
62.5.20.2^and we are in him who is true, in the son of him, jesus christ.
62.5.20.3^he is the true god and life eternal.
62.5.21.1^little children, keep yourselves from - idols.
63.1.1.1^the elder, to the elect lady and the children of her, whom i love in truth, and not i only, but also all those having known the truth
63.1.2.1^because of the truth - abiding in us and with us that will be to the age:
63.1.3.1^will be with us grace, mercy, and peace from god the father and from jesus christ, the son of the father, in truth and love.
63.1.4.1^i rejoiced exceedingly that i have found some of the children of you walking in truth, just as commandment we received from the father.
63.1.5.1^and now i implore you, lady, not as a commandment i am writing to you new, but that which we have had from the beginning, that we should love one another.
63.1.6.1^and this is - love, that we should walk according to the commandments of him.
63.1.6.2^this the commandment is just as you have heard from the beginning, so that in it you should walk.
63.1.7.1^for many deceivers have entered into the world, those not confessing jesus christ coming in flesh.
63.1.7.2^this is the deceiver and the antichrist.
63.1.8.1^watch yourselves, so that not you should lose what things we have worked for, but a reward full you may receive.

63.1.9.2^the one abiding in the teaching, this one both the father and the son has.

63.1.11.1^the one telling for him to rejoice partakes in the works of him - evil.

65.1.3.1^beloved, all diligence using to write to you concerning - common of us salvation, necessity i had to write to you, exhorting you to contend earnestly for the once for all having been delivered to the saints faith.
65.1.4.1^came in stealthily for certain men, those long ago having been designated unto this - condemnation, ungodly ones, the of the god of us grace changing into sensuality, and the only master and lord of us jesus christ denying.
65.1.5.1^to remind now you i want, having known you at one time all this, that jesus a people out of the land of egypt having saved, - afterward those not having believed, he destroyed.
65.1.6.1^the angels both - not having kept own their domain, but having left the own dwelling, unto the judgment of the great day, in chains eternal under darkness he keeps,
65.1.7.1^just as sodom and gomorrah and the around them cities, - in like manner with them having indulged in sexual immorality and having gone after flesh strange, are set forth as an example of fire eternal the penalty undergoing.
65.1.8.1^likewise yet also these dreaming ones, the flesh indeed defile, authority then set aside, glorious ones and blaspheme.
65.1.9.1^- but michael the archangel, when with the devil disputing, he was reasoning about - moses  body, not did dare a judgment to bring against him blasphemous, but said, rebuke you, the lord.
65.1.10.1^these however, whatever things indeed not they have seen they speak evil of;
65.1.10.2^whatever things then naturally, as the irrational animals, they understand, in these things they corrupt themselves.
65.1.11.1^woe to them, because in the way - of cain they went, and to the error - of balaam for reward they rushed, and in the rebellion - of korah they perished.
65.1.12.1^these are the ones in the love feasts of you, hidden reefs, feasting together with you fearlessly, themselves shepherding;
65.1.12.2^clouds without water, by winds being carried about;
65.1.12.3^trees autumnal without fruit, twice having died, having been uprooted;
65.1.13.1^waves wild of the sea, foaming out - of their shame;
65.1.13.2^stars wandering, to whom the gloom - of darkness to the age has been reserved.
65.1.14.1^prophesied then also as to these the seventh from adam, enoch, saying:
65.1.14.2^behold, has come the lord amidst holy ones myriads of his,
65.1.15.1^to execute judgment against all, and to convict every soul concerning all the works of ungodliness of them which they have done in an ungodly way, and concerning all the harsh things that have spoken against him sinners ungodly.
65.1.16.1^these are grumblers, discontented, after the lusts own following;
65.1.16.2^and the mouth of them speaks great swelling words, flattering faces profit for the sake of.
65.1.17.1^you however, beloved, remember the words - having been spoken beforehand by the apostles of the lord of us jesus christ,
65.1.18.1^that they were saying to you, in the last time there will be scoffers, after - their own passions following, - of ungodlinesses.
65.1.19.1^these are those causing divisions, worldly-minded, the spirit not having.
65.1.20.1^you however, beloved, building up yourselves, in the most holy of you faith in the spirit holy praying,
65.1.21.1^yourselves in the love of god keep, awaiting the mercy of the lord of us jesus christ, unto life eternal.
65.1.22.1^and those who indeed have mercy on, are doubting;
65.1.23.1^others also save, out of the fire snatching;
65.1.23.2^to others then show mercy with fear, hating even the by the flesh having been stained clothing.

65.1.25.1^to the only god savior of us, through jesus christ the lord of us, be glory, majesty, dominion, and authority, before all - time and now, and to all the ages.
65.1.25.2^amen.

66.1.9.1^i john, the brother of you, and fellow-partaker in the tribulation and kingdom and endurance in jesus, was in the island - called patmos, on account of the word - of god and the testimony of jesus.
66.1.10.1^i was in the spirit on the lord s day, and i heard behind me a voice loud, like that of a trumpet,
66.1.11.1^saying, what you see, write in a book, and send to the seven churches, to ephesus, and to smyrna, and to pergamum, and to thyatira, and to sardis, and to philadelphia, and to laodicea.
66.1.12.1^and i turned to see the voice that was speaking with me.
66.1.12.2^and having turned, i saw seven lampstands golden,
66.1.13.1^and in the midst of the lampstands, one like the son of man, having been clothed to the feet, and having been girded about at the breasts with a sash golden.
66.1.14.1^- and the head of him and the hairs are white, as if wool, white as snow;
66.1.14.2^and the eyes of him are like a flame of fire;
66.1.15.1^and the feet of him are like fine bronze, as in a furnace having been refined;
66.1.15.2^and the voice of him is like the voice of waters many;
66.1.16.1^and he is holding in the right hand of him stars seven, and out of the mouth of him a sword two-edged sharp is going forth;
66.1.16.2^and the face of him is like the sun shining in the full strength of it.
66.1.17.1^and when i saw him, i fell at the feet of him as though dead.
66.1.17.2^and he placed the right hand of him upon me, saying, not fear.
66.1.17.3^i am the first and the last,
66.1.18.1^and the living one;
66.1.18.2^and i was dead, and behold living i am to the ages of the ages, and i have the keys of death and of hades.
66.1.19.1^write therefore the things that you have seen, and the things that are, and the things that are about to take place after these,
66.1.20.1^the mystery of the seven stars, which you saw on the right hand of me, and the seven lampstands - golden:

66.2.2.2^and you have tested those claiming to be apostles and not are, and you have found them false.

66.3.1.2^these things says the one having the seven spirits - of god, and the seven stars.
