66.3.5.1^the one overcoming, thus will be clothed in garments white.
66.3.5.2^and no not will i blot out the name of him from the book - of life, and i will confess the name of him before the father of me, and before the angels of him.
66.3.6.1^the one having an ear, let him hear what the spirit says to the churches.
66.3.7.1^and to the messenger of the in philadelphia church write:
66.3.7.2^these things says the holy one, the true one, - having the key of david, the one opening and no one will shut, and shutting and no one opens.
66.3.8.1^i know your - deeds.
66.3.8.2^behold, i have set before you a door having been opened, which no one is able to shut it, because little you have power, and yet you have kept my - word and not have denied the name of me.
66.3.9.1^behold, i give those from the synagogue - of satan   those declaring themselves jews to be, and not are, but they lie   behold, i will cause them that they will come and will worship before the feet of you, and they shall know that i have loved you.
66.3.10.1^because you have kept the word of the patient endurance of me, i also you will keep out of the hour of the trial - being about to come upon the inhabited world whole, to try those dwelling upon the earth.
66.3.11.1^i am coming quickly.
66.3.11.2^hold fast to what you have, so that no one may take the crown of you.
66.3.12.1^the one overcoming, i will make him a pillar in the temple of the god of me, and out no not shall he go anymore.
66.3.12.2^and i will write upon him the name of the god of me, and the name of the city of the god of me, the new jerusalem, - coming down out of - heaven from the god of me, and the name of me - new.
66.3.13.1^the one having an ear, let him hear what the spirit says to the churches.
66.3.14.1^and to the messenger of the in laodicea church write:
66.3.14.2^these things says the amen, the witness - faithful and true, the beginning of the creation - of god.
66.3.15.1^i know your - works, that neither cold you are nor hot.
66.3.15.2^i wish cold you would be or hot.
66.3.16.1^so because lukewarm you are, and neither hot nor cold, i am about you to spit out of the mouth of me.
66.3.17.1^for you say -, rich i am, and i have grown rich, and of nothing need i have.
66.3.17.2^and not do you realize that you are - wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked.
66.3.18.1^i counsel you to buy from me gold having been refined by fire so that you may be rich, and garments white so that you may be clothed and not might be made manifest the shame of the nakedness of you, and eye-salve to anoint the eyes of you so that you may see.
66.3.19.1^i as many as if might love, i rebuke and discipline;
66.3.19.2^be zealous therefore and repent.
66.3.20.1^behold, i stand at the door and knock.
66.3.20.2^if anyone should hear the voice of me and open the door, then i will come in to him, and will dine with him, and he with me.
66.3.21.1^the one overcoming, i will give to him to sit with me on the throne of me, as i also overcame and sat down with the father of me on the throne of him.
66.3.22.1^the one having an ear, let him hear what the spirit says to the churches.
66.4.1.1^after these things i looked, and behold, a door was standing open in - heaven, and the voice - first that i heard like a trumpet was speaking with me, saying, come up here, and i will show to you what it behooves to take place after these things.
66.4.2.1^immediately i was in the spirit, and behold, a throne was set in - heaven, and upon the throne one sitting,
66.4.3.1^and the one sitting was like in appearance stone, jasper and sardius.
66.4.3.2^and a rainbow was around the throne, like in appearance an emerald.
66.4.4.1^and around the throne, thrones were twenty four;
66.4.4.2^and on the thrones twenty four elders sitting, having been clothed in garments white;
66.4.4.3^and on the heads of them, crowns golden.
66.4.5.1^and out of the throne come flashes of lightning, and voices, and thunderings.
66.4.5.2^and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven spirits - of god.
66.4.6.1^and before the throne was something like a sea of glass, like crystal.
66.4.6.2^and in the midst of the throne and around the throne were four living creatures, being full of eyes in front and behind.
66.4.7.1^and the living creature - first was like a lion, and the second living creature like a calf, and the third living creature having the face as of a man, and the fourth living creature like an eagle flying.
66.4.8.1^and the four living creatures, one for one of them had respectively wings six, all around and within full of eyes;
66.4.8.2^and rest not they have day and night, saying:
66.4.8.3^holy, holy, holy, lord - god - almighty, the one having been, and the one being, and the one coming.
66.4.9.1^and whenever will give the living creatures glory and honor and thanksgiving to the one sitting upon the throne, the one living to the ages of the ages,
66.4.10.1^will fall the twenty four elders before the one sitting upon the throne, and they will worship the one living to the ages of the ages, and they will cast the crowns of them before the throne, saying:
66.4.11.1^worthy are you, the lord and - god of us, to receive - glory and - honor and - power;
66.4.11.2^for you created - all things, and because of the will of you they existed, and were created.
66.5.1.1^and i saw on the right hand of the one sitting upon the throne a scroll, having been written inside and on the back, having been sealed with seals seven.
66.5.2.1^and i saw an angel strong, proclaiming in a voice loud, who is worthy to open the scroll, and to break the seals of it?
66.5.3.1^and no one was able in - heaven, nor upon the earth, nor under the earth, to open the scroll, nor to see it.
66.5.4.1^and i was weeping loudly, because no one worthy was found to open the scroll, nor to see it.
66.5.5.1^and one of the elders says to me, not do weep.
66.5.5.2^behold, has overcome the lion - of the tribe of judah, the root of david, to open the scroll and the seven seals of it.
66.5.6.1^and i saw in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, a lamb standing as having been slain, having horns seven and eyes seven, which are the seven spirits - of god, having been sent out into all the earth.
66.5.7.1^and he came and took it out of the right hand of the one sitting on the throne.
66.5.8.1^and when he had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty four elders fell down before the lamb, having each a harp and bowls golden being full of incenses, which are the prayers of the saints.
66.5.9.1^and they are singing a song new, saying, worthy are you to take the scroll, and to open the seals of it, because you were slain, and you purchased - to god by the blood of you, out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation,
66.5.10.1^and you have made them to the god of us, a kingdom and priests;
66.5.10.2^and they will reign upon the earth.
66.5.11.1^and i looked, and i heard the voice of angels many around the throne, and of the living creatures, and of the elders;
66.5.11.2^and was the number of them myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands,
66.5.12.1^saying in a voice loud:
66.5.12.2^worthy is the lamb - having been slain, to receive the power and riches and wisdom and strength and honor and glory and blessing!
66.5.13.1^and every creature which is in - heaven, and upon the earth, and under the earth, and on the sea and - in them everything, i heard saying:
66.5.13.2^to the one sitting on the throne, and to the lamb, - blessing and - honor and - glory and - might to the ages of the ages.
66.5.14.1^and the four living creatures kept saying, amen.
66.5.14.2^and the elders fell down and worshiped.
66.6.1.1^and i watched when opened the lamb one of the seven seals, and i heard one of the four living creatures saying, like a voice of thunder, come!
66.6.2.1^and i looked, and behold, a horse white, and the one sitting on it having a bow;
66.6.2.2^and was given to him a crown, and he went forth overcoming, and that he might conquer.
66.6.3.1^and when he opened the seal - second, i heard the second living creature saying, come!
66.6.4.1^and went forth another horse bright red;
66.6.4.2^and to the one sitting on it was granted to him to take the peace from the earth, and that one another they will slay;
66.6.4.3^and was given to him a sword great.
66.6.5.1^and when he opened the seal - third, i heard the third living creature saying, come!
66.6.5.2^and i looked, and behold, a horse black, and the one sitting on it having a pair of scales in the hand of him.
66.6.6.1^and i heard something like a voice in the midst of the four living creatures, saying, a choenix of wheat for a denarius, and three choenixes of barley for a denarius;
66.6.6.2^and the oil and the wine not you should injure.
66.6.7.1^and when he opened the seal - fourth, i heard the voice of the fourth living creature saying, come!
66.6.8.1^and i looked, and behold, a horse pale, and the one sitting on it, the name of him was - death, and - hades was following with him;
66.6.8.2^and was given to them authority over the fourth of the earth, to kill with sword, and with famine, and with plague, and by the beasts of the earth.
66.6.9.1^and when he opened the fifth seal, i saw under the altar the souls of those having been slain because of the word - of god, and because of the testimony which they had upheld.
66.6.10.1^and they were crying in a voice loud, saying, until when, o lord, - holy and true, not do you judge, and avenge the blood of us from those dwelling upon the earth?
66.6.11.1^and were given to them each robes white, and it was said to them that they shall rest yet a time little, until would be fulfilled also the fellow servants of them, and the brothers of them, those being about to be killed as also had been they.
66.6.12.1^and i saw when he opened the seal - sixth, and an earthquake great there was, and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon whole became like blood,
66.6.13.1^and the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree casts the unripe figs of it, by a wind great being shaken.
66.6.14.1^and - heaven departed like a scroll being rolled up, and every mountain and island out of the places of them were moved.
66.6.15.1^and the kings of the earth, and the great ones, and the commanders, and the rich, and the powerful, and every slave and free, hid themselves in the caves, and among the rocks of the mountains.
66.6.16.1^and they say to the mountains and to the rocks, fall on us and hide us from the face of the one sitting on the throne, and from the wrath of the lamb,
66.6.17.1^because has come the day - great of the wrath of them, and who is able to stand?
66.7.1.1^after these things i saw four angels standing upon the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, so that no would blow wind on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.
66.7.2.1^and i saw another angel, having ascended from the rising of the sun, having the seal of god the living.
66.7.2.2^and he cried in a voice loud to the four angels to whom it had been given to them to harm the earth and the sea,
66.7.3.1^saying, not harm the earth, nor the sea, nor the trees, until we shall have sealed the servants of the god of us, on the foreheads of them.
66.7.4.1^and i heard the number of those having been sealed, one hundred forty four thousand, having been sealed out of every tribe of the sons of israel:
66.7.5.1^out of the tribe of judah twelve thousand having been sealed, out of the tribe of reuben twelve thousand, out of the tribe of gad twelve thousand,
66.7.6.1^out of the tribe of asher twelve thousand, out of the tribe of naphtali twelve thousand, out of the tribe of manasseh twelve thousand,
66.7.7.1^out of the tribe of simeon twelve thousand, out of the tribe of levi twelve thousand, out of the tribe of isaachar twelve thousand,
66.7.8.1^out of the tribe of zebulun twelve thousand, out of the tribe of joseph twelve thousand, out of the tribe of benjamin twelve thousand having been sealed.
66.7.9.1^after these things i looked, and behold, a multitude great, which to number it no one was able, out of every nation, and tribes, and peoples, and tongues, standing before the throne and before the lamb, having been clothed with robes white, and palm branches in the hands of them.
66.7.10.1^and they were crying out in a voice loud, saying:
66.7.10.2^- salvation to the god of us, the one sitting on the throne, and to the lamb!
66.7.11.1^and all the angels stood around the throne, and the elders, and the four living creatures, and they fell before the throne upon the faces of them, and worshiped - god,
66.7.12.1^saying, amen!
66.7.12.2^- blessing, and - glory, and - wisdom, and - thanksgiving, and - honor, and - power, and - strength, to the god of us, to the ages of the ages!
66.7.12.3^amen.
66.7.13.1^and answered one of the elders, saying to me, these - having been clothed with the robes - white, who are they, and from where have they come?
66.7.14.1^and i said to him, lord of me, you know.
66.7.14.2^and he said to me, these are the ones coming out of the tribulation - great, and they have washed the robes of them and made white them in the blood of the lamb.
66.7.15.1^because of this, they are before the throne - of god, and serve him day and night in the temple of him;
66.7.15.2^and the one sitting on the throne will tabernacle over them.
66.7.16.1^not they will hunger any more, neither will they thirst anymore, nor at all shall fall upon them the sun, nor any scorching heat;
66.7.17.1^because the lamb - in the center of the throne will shepherd them, and he will lead them to living fountains of waters, and will wipe away - god every tear from the eyes of them.
66.8.1.1^and when he opened the seal - seventh, there was silence in - heaven for about half an hour.
66.8.2.1^and i saw the seven angels who before - god stand, and were given to them seven trumpets.
66.8.3.1^and another angel came and stood at the altar, having a censer golden;
66.8.3.2^and was given to him incense much, that he will offer it with the prayers of the saints all upon the altar - golden - before the throne.
66.8.4.1^and went up the smoke of the incense with the prayers of the saints out of the hand of the angel, before - god.
66.8.5.1^and took the angel the censer, and filled it from the fire of the altar, and cast it to the earth;
66.8.5.2^and there were thunders, and rumblings, and flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.
66.8.6.1^and the seven angels - having the seven trumpets prepared themselves that they might sound the trumpets.
66.8.7.1^and the first sounded his trumpet, and there was hail, and fire having been mixed with blood, and it was cast upon the earth.
66.8.7.2^and a third of the earth was burned up, and a third of the trees were burned up, and all the grass green was burned up.
66.8.8.1^and the second angel sounded his trumpet, and something like a mountain great, with fire burning, was cast into the sea.
66.8.8.2^and became a third of the sea blood,
66.8.9.1^and died a third of the creatures - in the sea - having life, and a third of the ships were destroyed.
66.8.10.1^and the third angel sounded his trumpet, and fell out of - heaven a star great, burning like a torch.
66.8.10.2^and it fell upon a third of the rivers, and upon the springs of waters.
66.8.11.1^and the name of the star is called - wormwood.
66.8.11.2^and became a third of the waters into wormwood, and many of the men died from the waters, because they were made bitter.
66.8.12.1^and the fourth angel sounded his trumpet, and was struck a third of the sun, and a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that should be darkened a third of them, and the day not should appear for a third of it, and the night likewise.
66.8.13.1^and i looked, and i heard one eagle flying in mid-heaven, saying in a voice loud, woe!
66.8.13.2^woe!
66.8.13.3^woe to those dwelling on the earth, because of the remaining voices of the trumpet of the three angels - being about to sound their trumpets!
66.9.1.1^and the fifth angel sounded his trumpet, and i saw a star out of - heaven having fallen to the earth, and was given to it the key of the pit of the abyss.
66.9.2.1^and he opened the pit of the abyss, and went up smoke out of the pit, like the smoke of a furnace great, and were darkened the sun and the air by the smoke of the pit.
66.9.3.1^and out of the smoke came forth locusts unto the earth, and was given to them power, like have power the scorpions of the earth.
66.9.4.1^and it was said to them, that not they shall harm the grass of the earth, nor any green thing, nor any tree, if not the men - not having the seal - of god on the foreheads.
66.9.5.1^and it was granted to them that not they should kill them, but that they shall torment them months five.
66.9.5.2^and the torment of them was like torment of a scorpion, when it might strike a man.
66.9.6.1^and in the days those, will seek - men - death, and not no more will find it;
66.9.6.2^and they will long to die, and shall flee - death from them.
66.9.7.1^and the appearance of the locusts was like horses having been prepared for battle, and upon the heads of them were something like crowns, like gold;
66.9.7.2^and the faces of them like the faces of men.
66.9.8.1^and they had hair like hair of women, and the teeth of them like those of lions were.
66.9.9.1^and they had breastplates like breastplates of iron, and the sound of the wings of them was as the sound of chariots of horses many rushing into battle.
66.9.10.1^and they have tails like scorpions and stingers, and in the tails of them is the power of them to injure - men for months five.
66.9.11.1^they have over them a king, the angel of the abyss.
66.9.11.2^the name of him in hebrew is abaddon, and in the greek, the name he has apollyon.
66.9.12.1^- woe the first has passed.
66.9.12.2^behold, are coming still two woes after these things.

66.9.14.1^saying to the sixth angel, the one having the trumpet, release the four angels, those having been bound at the river - great euphrates.
66.9.15.1^and were released the four angels - having been prepared for the hour and day and month and year, so that they might kill a third - of mankind.
66.9.16.1^and the number of the armies of the cavalry was twice ten thousand ten thousands;
66.9.16.2^i heard the number of them.
66.9.17.1^and thus i saw the horses in the vision, and those sitting on them, having breastplates fiery and hyacinthine and brimstone.
66.9.17.2^and the heads of the horses were like heads of lions, and out of the mouths of them proceed fire, and smoke, and brimstone.
66.9.18.1^by - three plagues these was killed a third of mankind, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, - proceeding out of the mouths of them.
66.9.19.1^the for powers of the horses in the mouths of them are, and in the tails of them;
66.9.19.2^the for tails of them are like serpents, having heads, and with them they injure.
66.9.20.1^and the rest of the men who not were killed by the plagues these not even repented of the works of the hands of them, so that not they will worship the demons, and the idols - golden and - silver and - bronze and - stone and - wooden, which neither to see are able, nor to hear, nor to walk.
66.9.21.1^and not they repented of the murders of them, nor of the sorceries of them, nor of the sexual immorality of them, nor of the thefts of them.

66.10.9.2^and he says to me, take and eat it;
66.10.9.3^and it will make bitter your - stomach, but in the mouth of you it will be sweet as honey.

66.10.10.2^and it was in the mouth of me as honey sweet;
66.10.10.3^and when i had eaten it, was made bitter the stomach of me.
66.10.11.1^and they say to me, it is necessary for you again to prophesy concerning peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings many.
66.11.1.1^and was given to me a measuring rod like a staff, saying, rise and measure the temple - of god, and the altar, and those worshiping in it.

66.11.4.1^these are the two olive trees and the two lampstands - before the lord of the earth standing.
66.11.5.1^and if anyone them should desire to harm, fire goes out of the mouth of them and devours the enemies of them.
66.11.5.2^and if anyone should desire them to harm, thus it is necessary for him to be killed.
66.11.6.1^these have the power to shut the sky, so that no rain shall fall in the days of the prophecy of them;
66.11.6.2^and power they have over the waters, to turn them into blood, and to strike the earth with every plague, as often as if they might desire.
66.11.7.1^and when they shall have completed the testimony of them, the beast - coming up out of the abyss will make with them war, and will overcome them, and will kill them.
66.11.8.1^and the body of them will be upon the street of city the great, which is called figuratively sodom and egypt, where also the lord of them was crucified.
66.11.9.1^and gaze those of the peoples and tribes and tongues and nations upon the bodies of them, days three and a half, and the bodies of them not they will allow to be put into a tomb.
66.11.10.1^and those dwelling on the earth rejoice over them and make merry, and gifts will send to one another, because these - two prophets have tormented those dwelling upon the earth.
66.11.11.1^and after the three days and a half, the spirit of life from - god entered into them, and they stood upon the feet of them;
66.11.11.2^and fear great fell upon those beholding them.
66.11.12.1^and they heard a voice great out of - heaven, saying to them, come up here.
66.11.12.2^and they went up to - heaven in the cloud;
66.11.12.3^and beheld them the enemies of them.
66.11.13.1^and in that - hour there was an earthquake great, and a tenth of the city fell, and were killed in the earthquake, names of men thousand seven.
66.11.13.2^and the rest terrified became and gave glory to the god of heaven.
66.11.14.1^the woe - second has passed.
66.11.14.2^behold, the woe - third is coming quickly.

66.12.1.2^a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under the feet of her, and on the head of her a crown of stars twelve,
66.12.2.1^and in womb having.
66.12.2.2^and she cries out, being in travail, and being in pain to bring forth.
66.12.3.1^and was seen another sign in - heaven, and behold, a dragon great, red having heads seven, and horns ten, and upon the heads of him, seven royal crowns.
66.12.4.1^and the tail of him drags a third of the stars of heaven, and he cast them to the earth.
66.12.4.2^and the dragon stands before the woman - being about to bring forth, so that when she should bring forth, the child of her he might devour.
66.12.5.1^and she brought forth a son male, who is about to rule all the nations with a rod of iron;
66.12.5.2^and was caught up the child of her to - god, and to the throne of him.
66.12.6.1^and the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has there a place having been prepared by - god, so that there they should nourish her days one thousand two hundred sixty.
66.12.7.1^and there was war in - heaven:
66.12.7.2^- michael and the angels of him - warred against the dragon, and the dragon warred back, and the angels of him.
66.12.8.1^and not had he strength, nor a place was found for them any longer in - heaven.
66.12.9.1^and was thrown out the dragon - great, the serpent - ancient, who is called the devil and - satan, - deceiving the inhabited world whole.
66.12.9.2^he was thrown down to the earth, and the angels of him with him were thrown down.
66.12.10.1^and i heard a voice great in - heaven, saying:
66.12.10.2^now have come the salvation, and the power, and the kingdom of the god of us, and the authority the christ of him, because has been thrown down the accuser of the brothers of us, the one accusing them before the god of us day and night.
66.12.11.1^and they have overcome him by reason of the blood of the lamb, and by reason of the word of the testimony of them;
66.12.11.2^and not they have loved the life of them unto death.
66.12.12.1^because of this, rejoice o heavens, and those in them dwelling!
66.12.12.2^woe to the earth and the sea, because has come down the devil to you, having fury great, knowing that a short time he has.
66.12.13.1^and when saw the dragon that he had been thrown down to the earth, he pursued the woman who had brought forth the male child.
66.12.14.1^and were given to the woman the two wings of the eagle - great, so that she could fly into the wilderness, into the place of her, where she is nourished there a time, and times, and half a time from the face of the serpent.
66.12.15.1^and cast the serpent out of the mouth of him after the woman water as a river, so that her carried away by a flood he might cause to be.
66.12.16.1^and helped the earth the woman, and opened the earth the mouth of it and swallowed up the river, which had cast the dragon out of the mouth of him.
66.12.17.1^and was angry the dragon with the woman, and went to make war with the rest of the children of her - keeping the commandments - of god and holding the testimony of jesus.
66.12.18.1^and he stood upon the sand of the sea.
66.13.1.1^and i saw out of the sea a beast rising, having horns ten, and heads seven, and on the horns of it, ten royal crowns, and upon the heads of it, names of blasphemy.
66.13.2.1^and the beast that i saw was like a leopard, and the feet of it like a bear s, and the mouth of it like the mouth of a lion.
66.13.2.2^and gave to it the dragon the power of him, and the throne of him, and authority great.
66.13.3.1^and one of the heads of it was as having been slain to death.
66.13.3.2^and the wound of death of it was healed, and marveled all the earth after the beast.
66.13.4.1^and they worshiped the dragon, who had given - authority to the beast;
66.13.4.2^and they worshiped the beast, saying, who is like the beast?
66.13.4.3^and who is able to make war against it?
66.13.5.1^and was given to it a mouth speaking great things and blasphemy;
66.13.5.2^and was given to it authority to act months forty and two.
66.13.6.1^and it opened the mouth of it unto blasphemies against - god, to blaspheme the name of him, and the tabernacle of him, those in - heaven dwelling.
66.13.7.1^and there was given to it to make war with the saints, and to overcome them.
66.13.7.2^and was given to it authority over every tribe and people and tongue and nation.
66.13.8.1^and will worship it all - dwelling on the earth, of whom not have been written the names of them in the book - of life of the lamb - having been slain, from the founding of the world.
66.13.9.1^if anyone has an ear, let him hear.
66.13.10.1^if anyone is to go into captivity, into captivity he goes;
66.13.10.2^if anyone with the sword is to be killed, he by the sword is to be killed.
66.13.10.3^here is the endurance and the faith of the saints.
66.13.11.1^and i saw another beast rising out of the earth, and it had horns two like a lamb, and it was speaking like a dragon.
66.13.12.1^and the authority of the first beast all it exercises on behalf of it, and causes the earth and those in it dwelling, that they will worship the beast - first, of whom had been healed the wound - fatal of it.
66.13.13.1^and it works signs great, so that even fire it should cause out of - heaven to come down to the earth in the presence - of men.
66.13.14.1^and it deceives those dwelling on the earth, by reason of the signs that were given to it to perform before the beast, telling those dwelling on the earth to make an image to the beast that has the wound of the sword and has lived.
66.13.15.1^and there was given to it to give breath to the image of the beast, so that also should speak the image of the beast, and should cause that as many as if not would worship the image of the beast would be killed.
66.13.16.1^and it causes all the small and the great, and the rich and the poor, and the free and the servants, that it should give them a mark on the hand of them - right, or on the forehead of them,
66.13.17.1^and that no one should be able to buy or to sell, if not the one having the mark   the name of the beast, or the number of the name of it.
66.13.18.1^here the wisdom is.
66.13.18.2^the one having understanding, let him count the number of the beast;
66.13.18.3^number for a man s it is, and the number is of it, six hundred sixty six.
66.14.1.1^and i looked, and behold, the lamb was standing upon - mount zion, and with him one hundred forty four thousand, having the name of him and the name of the father of him having been written on the foreheads of them.
66.14.2.1^and i heard a voice out of - heaven, as the sound of waters many, and as the sound of thunder loud.
66.14.2.2^and the voice that i heard, was like that of harpists harping with the harps of them.
66.14.3.1^and they are singing as a song new before the throne, and before the four living creatures, and the elders.
66.14.3.2^and no one was able to learn the song, if not the one hundred forty four thousand - having been redeemed from the earth.
66.14.4.1^these are they who with women not have not been defiled;
66.14.4.2^pure for they are, these - following the lamb wherever - he shall go.
66.14.4.3^these have been redeemed out from - men as firstfruits - to god and to the lamb.
66.14.5.1^and in the mouth of them not was found a lie;
66.14.5.2^blameless they are.
66.14.6.1^and i saw another angel flying in mid-heaven, having the glad tidings everlasting to preach upon those dwelling on the earth, and upon every nation and tribe and tongue and people,
66.14.7.1^saying in a voice loud, fear - god, and give him glory, because has come the hour of the judgment of him.
66.14.7.2^and worship the one having made - heaven, and the earth, and sea, and springs of waters.
66.14.8.1^and another angel, a second followed, saying, fallen, fallen is babylon the great, who of the wine - of wrath for the immorality of her, she has given to drink all the gentiles.
66.14.9.1^and another angel, a third, followed them, saying in a voice loud, if anyone worships the beast and the image of it, and receives a mark on the forehead of him, or upon the hand of him,
66.14.10.1^also he will drink of the wine of the anger - of god, - having been mixed undiluted in the cup of the wrath of him;
66.14.10.2^and he will be tormented in fire and brimstone, before the angels holy, and before the lamb.
66.14.11.1^and the smoke of the torment of them to ages of ages goes up;
66.14.11.2^and not have rest day and night those worshiping the beast and the image of it, and if anyone receives the mark of the name of it.
66.14.12.1^here the endurance of the saints is, those keeping the commandments - of god, and the faith of jesus.
66.14.13.1^and i heard a voice out of - heaven, saying write, blessed are the dead - in the lord dying from now on.
66.14.13.2^yes, says the spirit, so that they will rest from the labors of them;
66.14.13.3^- for the works of them follow with them.
66.14.14.1^and i looked, and behold, a cloud white, and upon the cloud is sitting one like the son of man, having on the head of him a crown golden, and in the hand of him a sickle sharp.
66.14.15.1^and another angel came out of the temple, crying in a voice loud to the one sitting on the cloud, put forth the sickle of you and reap, because has come the hour to reap, because has ripened the harvest of the earth.
66.14.16.1^and swung the one sitting upon the cloud the sickle of him upon the earth, and was harvested the earth.
66.14.17.1^and another angel came out of the temple - in - heaven, having also he a sickle sharp.
66.14.18.1^and another angel came out of the altar, - having authority over the fire, and he called in a voice loud to the one having the sickle - sharp, saying, put forth your - sickle - sharp, and gather the clusters from the vine of the earth, because have fully ripened the grapes of it.
66.14.19.1^and put forth the angel the sickle of him to the earth, and gathered the vine of the earth, and cast them into the winepress of the wrath - of god - great.
66.14.20.1^and was trodden the winepress outside the city, and flowed blood out of the winepress, as high as the bridles of the horses, to the distance of stadia one thousand six hundred.

66.15.3.2^great and wonderful are the works of you, lord - god the almighty!

66.16.2.1^and departed the first, and poured out the bowl of him into the earth;
66.16.2.2^and came a sore, evil and grievous, upon the men - having the mark of the beast and those worshiping the image of it.
66.16.3.1^and the second poured out the bowl of him into the sea, and it became blood, as of one dead;
66.16.3.2^and every soul living died that was in the sea.

66.16.5.1^and i heard the angel of the waters saying:
66.16.5.2^righteous are you, the one being, and - having been, o holy one, because these things you have judged,

66.16.6.2^worthy they are.

66.16.7.2^yes, lord - god - almighty, true and righteous are the judgments of you.

66.16.9.1^and were scorched the men with heat great, and they cursed the name - of god, the one having - authority over the plagues these;
66.16.9.2^and not did they repent to give him glory.

66.16.11.1^and they cursed the god of heaven on account of the distresses of them, and on account of the sores of them;
66.16.11.2^and not they did repent of the works of them.

66.16.16.1^and he gathered together them unto the place - called in hebrew armageddon.

66.16.18.1^and there were flashes of lightning, and voices, and thunders;
66.16.18.2^and an earthquake there was great, such as not had there been since - men were upon the earth, so great was the earthquake, so mighty.

66.17.5.2^babylon the great, the mother of the prostitutes, and of the abominations of the earth.

66.18.2.2^fallen, fallen is babylon the great!

66.18.3.2^and the kings of the earth with her have committed sexual immorality;
66.18.3.3^and the merchants of the earth through the power of the sensuality of her have been enriched.
66.18.4.1^and i heard another voice from - heaven, saying:
66.18.4.2^come the people of me, out of her, so that not you may have fellowship in the sins of her, and of the plagues of her so that not you may receive.

66.18.6.1^give back to her as also she has rendered;
66.18.6.2^and pay back double to her, twofold according to the works of her.
66.18.6.3^in the cup which she has mixed, mix to her double.
66.18.7.1^so much as she has glorified herself and lived in luxury, as much give to her torment and misery, because in the heart of herself she says -, i sit as a queen, and a widow never i am, and mourning never not shall i see.
66.18.8.1^because of this, in one day will come the plagues of her, death and misery and famine;
66.18.8.2^and with fire she will be burned up, because mighty is the lord - god, the one having judged her.
66.18.9.1^and will weep and will wail for her the kings of the earth, the ones with her having committed sexual immorality and having lived luxuriously, when they see the smoke of the burning of her,

66.18.10.2^woe, woe, the city - great, babylon, the city - strong!

66.18.17.2^and every shipmaster, and all those to a place sailing, and sailors, and as many as the sea trade by, at a distance stood,

66.20.2.1^and he seized the dragon, the serpent - ancient, who is the devil and - satan, and bound him for a thousand years.
66.20.3.1^and he cast him into the abyss, and shut and sealed it over him, so that not he should deceive any longer the nations, until were completed the thousand years.
66.20.3.2^after these things, it is necessary for to be released him for a little time.
66.20.4.1^and i saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment was given to them, and the souls of those having been beheaded because of the testimony of jesus and because of the word - of god, and those who not did worship the beast, nor the image of him, and not did take the mark upon the forehead, and upon the hand of them.
66.20.4.2^and they lived and reigned with - christ a thousand years.
66.20.5.1^the rest of the dead not lived again until shall have been completed the thousand years.
66.20.5.2^this is the resurrection - first.
66.20.6.1^blessed and holy is the one having a part in the resurrection - first!
66.20.6.2^over these the second death not has power, but they will be priests - of god and - of christ, and will reign with him a thousand years.
66.20.7.1^and when shall have been completed the thousand years, will be released - satan out of the prison of him,
66.20.8.1^and will go out to deceive the nations - in the four corners of the earth, - gog and magog, to gather together them unto the war, of whom the number is of them like the sand of the sea.
66.20.9.1^and they marched up over the breadth of the earth and encircled the camp of the saints and the city - having been beloved.
66.20.9.2^but came down fire out of - heaven and devoured them.
66.20.10.1^and the devil, the one deceiving them, was cast into the lake - of fire and of sulfur, where are also the beast and the false prophet;
66.20.10.2^and they will be tormented day and night to the ages of the ages.
66.20.11.1^and i saw a throne great white, and the one sitting on it, whose from - face fled the earth and - heaven, and place not was found for them.
66.20.12.1^and i saw the dead, - great and - small, standing before the throne, and books were opened.
66.20.12.2^and another book was opened, which is the one of life.
66.20.12.3^and were judged the dead out of the things having been written in the books, according to the deeds of them.
66.20.13.1^and gave up the sea the dead who were in it;
66.20.13.2^and - death and - hades gave up the dead who were in them;
66.20.13.3^and they were judged each of them according to the works of them.
66.20.14.1^and - death and - hades were cast into the lake - of fire.
66.20.14.2^this the death - second is the lake of fire.
66.20.15.1^and if anyone not was found in the book - of life having been written, he was cast into the lake - of fire.
66.21.1.1^and i saw a heaven new, and an earth new, - for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea not is any longer.
66.21.2.1^and the city - holy, the jerusalem new, i saw coming down out of - heaven from - god, having been prepared as a bride having been adorned for the husband of her.
66.21.3.1^and i heard a voice great from the throne, saying:
66.21.3.2^behold, the tabernacle - of god is with - men, and he will tabernacle with them, and they peoples of him will be, and himself - god with them will be as their god.
66.21.4.1^and he will wipe away every tear from the eyes of them, and - death not will be any longer nor mourning nor crying nor pain;
66.21.4.2^not they will be any longer, because the former things have passed away.
66.21.5.1^and said the one sitting on the throne, behold, new i make all things.
66.21.5.2^and he says, write this, because these the words faithful and true are.
66.21.6.1^and he said to me, it is done!
66.21.6.2^i am the alpha and the omega, the beginning and the end.
66.21.6.3^i to the one thirsting will give of the spring of the water - of life freely.
66.21.7.1^the one overcoming will inherit all things, and i will be his god, and he will be my son.
66.21.8.1^- but to the cowardly and unbelieving and having become abominable and murderers and the sexually immoral and sorcerers and idolaters and all - liars, the portion of them is in the lake - burning with fire and brimstone, which is the death - second.
66.21.9.1^and came one of the seven angels, - having the seven bowls - being full of the seven plagues - last, and spoke with me, saying, come here, i will show you the bride, the wife of the lamb.
66.21.10.1^and he carried away me in the spirit to a mountain great and high, and he showed me the city - holy jerusalem, descending out of - heaven from - god,
66.21.11.1^having the glory - of god.
66.21.11.2^the radiance of it was like a stone most precious, like a stone jasper being clear as crystal,
66.21.12.1^having a wall great and high, having gates twelve, and at the gates angels twelve, and names having been inscribed, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the sons of israel.
66.21.13.1^on the east were gates three, and on the north gates three, and on the south gates three, and on the west gates three.
66.21.14.1^and the wall of the city had foundations twelve, and in them the twelve names of the twelve apostles of the lamb.
66.21.15.1^and the one speaking with me had a measuring reed golden, so that he could measure the city, and the gates of it, and the wall of it.
66.21.16.1^and the city foursquare lies, and the length of it is the same as also the width.
66.21.16.2^and he measured the city with the reed, at stadia twelve thousand.
66.21.16.3^the length and the breadth and the height of it equal are.
66.21.17.1^and he measured the wall of it, one hundred forty four cubits, the measure of man, that is of the angel.
66.21.18.1^and the structure of the wall of it was jasper, and the city gold pure, like glass clear,
66.21.19.1^the foundations of the wall of the city, with every stone precious having been adorned:
66.21.19.2^the foundation - first jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald,
66.21.20.1^the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, the twelfth amethyst.
66.21.21.1^and the twelve gates were twelve pearls;
66.21.21.2^respectively one each of the gates was of one pearl.
66.21.21.3^and the street of the city gold, pure as glass transparent.
66.21.22.1^and temple not i saw in it;
66.21.22.2^- for the lord - god - almighty, temple of it is, and the lamb.
66.21.23.1^and the city no need has of the sun, nor of the moon, that they should shine in it;
66.21.23.2^the for glory - of god enlightened it, and the lamp of it is the lamb.
66.21.24.1^and will walk the nations by the light of it, and the kings of the earth bring the glory of them into it.
66.21.25.1^and the gates of it no not shall be shut by day, night for not will be there.
66.21.26.1^and they will bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it.
66.21.27.1^and no not shall enter into it anything defiling, and those practicing abomination and a lie, if not those having been written in the book - of life of the lamb.
66.22.1.1^and he showed me a river of water of life, clear as crystal, flowing out of the throne - of god and of the lamb.
66.22.2.1^in the middle of the street of it and of the river, on this side and on that side, was a tree of life, producing fruits twelve, according to month, each yielding the fruit of it;
66.22.2.2^and the leaves of the tree are for the healing of the nations.
66.22.3.1^and any curse not there will be any longer.
66.22.3.2^and the throne - of god and of the lamb in it will be, and the servants of him will serve him.
66.22.4.1^and they will see the face of him, and the name of him will be on the foreheads of them.
66.22.5.1^and night not there will be there, and not they have need of the light of a lamp and of the light of the sun, because the lord - god will enlighten upon them, and they will reign to the ages of the ages.
66.22.6.1^and he said to me, these - words are faithful and true.
66.22.6.2^and the lord, the god of the spirits of the prophets, sent the angel of him, to show the servants of him the things that must come to pass in quickness.
66.22.7.1^and behold, i am coming quickly.
66.22.7.2^blessed is the one keeping the words of the prophecy of the book this.
66.22.8.1^and i, john, am the one hearing and seeing these things.
66.22.8.2^and when i heard and saw, i fell down to worship before the feet of the angel - showing me these things.
66.22.9.1^and he says to me, see that you not.
66.22.9.2^fellow servant of you i am, and with the brothers of you the prophets, and with those keeping the words of the book this.
66.22.9.3^- god worship!
66.22.10.1^and he says to me, not seal the words of the prophecy of the book this;
66.22.10.2^the time for near is.
66.22.11.1^the one being unrighteous, let him be unrighteous still;
66.22.11.2^and he who is filthy, let him be filthy still;
66.22.11.3^and he who is righteous, righteousness let him practice still;
66.22.11.4^and he who is holy, let him be holy still.
66.22.12.1^behold, i am coming quickly, and the reward of me is with me, to give to each as the work is his.
66.22.13.1^i am the alpha and the omega, the first and the last, the beginning and the end.
66.22.14.1^blessed are those washing the robes of them, that will be the right of them to the tree - of life, and by the gates they shall enter into the city.
66.22.15.1^outside are the dogs, and the sorcerers, and the sexually immoral, and the murderers, and the idolaters, and everyone loving and practicing falsehood.
66.22.16.1^i, jesus, have sent the angel of me to testify to you these things in the churches.
66.22.16.2^i am the root and the offspring of david, the star - bright - morning.
66.22.17.1^and the spirit and the bride say, come!
66.22.17.2^and the one hearing, let him say, come!
66.22.17.3^and the one thirsting let him come;
66.22.17.4^the one desiring, let him take the water of life freely.
66.22.18.1^testify i to everyone - hearing the words of the prophecy of the book this:
66.22.18.2^if anyone should add to these things, will add - god unto him the plagues - having been written in the book this.
66.22.19.1^and if anyone should take away from the words of the book of the prophecy this, will take away - god the part of him from the tree - of life, and out of the city - holy, of those having been written in the book this.
66.22.20.1^says the one testifying these things, yes, i am coming quickly.
66.22.20.2^amen.
66.22.20.3^come, lord jesus!
66.22.21.1^the grace of the lord jesus be with all.
